October 18 — Richard Sweed is driving west on the outskirts of Bakersfield, California, when he sees a bluish-gray metallic disc with portholes take off from the ground at a 45° angle. It is about 60 feet in diameter and makes a whining sound. He examines the spot where the object had rested and finds the sand “fused like glass crystals.” (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, p. 18)

1928

January 3 — Kansas journalist [Charles Benedict Driscoll](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Benedict_Driscoll&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727643489&usg=AOvVaw1SD-TY4j0XMqRjp7dcyQSH) begins writing about ball lighting in his syndicated column, “The World and All,” keeping the subject alive for many years. (Charles B. Driscoll, “[The World and All,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92248083/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727643747&usg=AOvVaw3iaJg08-ViUqaqzXwJncnP)” Lexington (Ky.) Herald, January 3, 1928, p. 4)

May — Mystic and white supremacist [William Dudley Pelley](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Dudley_Pelley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727644215&usg=AOvVaw3GdxQ7cgzzENyYgsWleL71) claims he has an out-of-body experience in which he travels to other planes of existence devoid of corporeal souls. He describes his experience in an American Magazine article titled “My Seven Minutes in Eternity,” expanded to a book 1933 as Seven Minutes in Eternity. In later writings, he describes the experience as “hypo-dimensional.” During this event, he meets with God and Jesus, who instruct him to undertake the spiritual transformation of America. He later claims that the experience gives him the ability to levitate, see through walls, and have out-of-body experiences at will. (William Dudley Pelley, [“Seven Minutes in Eternity” with Their Aftermath](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Duiug.30112052129936%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D5%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727644772&usg=AOvVaw1RkWdGvqFrEG_3TM4a68hV)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Duiug.30112052129936%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D5%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727645026&usg=AOvVaw2Nxm1q5mnjJAhcc7p6t0-_) Robert Collier, 1929; Clark III 1285)

Summer — A 6-year-old girl sees a black, faceless, 5-foot-high figure with a large head and dangling arms in a field off Anstey Lane, Leicester, England. She thinks it is a scarecrow but notices a “large globe on legs” near the figure. She wakes up her father (who is resting in the open air) but when she turns around, the scarecrow and the globe are gone. (Pauline Berger, “[The Disappearing Scarecrow,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201969%2520V%252015%2520N%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727645461&usg=AOvVaw1_o-Ezh796gI59xyT4WBrb)” Flying Saucer Review 15, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1969): 29; Clark III 264)

June 13 — 9:00–10:00 p.m. Something like a “great blurred electric light” appears over Miami, Florida, for more than 30 minutes. One witness, amateur astronomer R. C. Fahrion, describes it as a comet without a tail, but it does not move, is of an “enormous size,” and disappears very suddenly. (“[Miami Astronomers Unable to Identify Light in](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92249976/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727645821&usg=AOvVaw1HnM-NxvDNoLzqmLvS3b7m) [Sky,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92249976/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727646064&usg=AOvVaw0ENhhTyBa6Y7HCE4u_mRDb)” Miami Herald, June 14, 1928, p. 1; “[Miamians Watch Sky Mystery, Mistaken for Tailless Comet,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92250138/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727646328&usg=AOvVaw3Esohu8-_NIZctoJu_m32q)” Miami News, June 14, 1928, p. 12; Clark III 1172)

* * *

Early November — 10:30 p.m. [Norman H. Sabie](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/114843467/norman-sabie&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727646726&usg=AOvVaw3U-pgJRlc6-Blc624KIZy4) and [Thorsten Sabie](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/114842471/thorsten-sabie&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727646968&usg=AOvVaw2G9sre59rL3XZIHWK8AlL_) are driving cattle near Milton, North Dakota, watch a round, metallic object, like a “soup bowl turned upside down,” speed by at a low altitude (15–20 feet), emitting 4–5 rays of light that illuminate the ground and startle cattle. It makes a sound like air pouring through a tube. (UFOEv, [p. 129](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D141%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727647247&usg=AOvVaw1v9oTr6nZ9spJdDKUfuQAe); Clark III 1170)

November 28 — French diplomatic scholar [Henri Pensa](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henri_Pensa&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727647609&usg=AOvVaw0db51KzRMx-igcaUkppaIy) writes that a silvery object trailing fire is seen in Rodez, Aveyron, France, coming from the “direction of Mars.” He says that in the winter of 1927–1928, he has seen a bright light, usually between 8:00 and 11:00 p.m., that brightens the landscape. (Giuseppe Stilo, “[Francia, 1928:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://cieloinsolito.com/?p%3D724&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727648033&usg=AOvVaw1QB2_IEPgr0SJQaqte27s-) [Marte Attacca?](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://cieloinsolito.com/?p%3D724&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727648357&usg=AOvVaw0Y3U8-WpB623ltWDoSxcOH)” Cielo Insolito, October 2, 2019)

1929

1929 — In Hertford, England, a 5-year-old girl and her 8-year-old brother have such an unsettling experience that they do not talk about it themselves until about 1960, and the woman herself does not reveal it to outsiders until 1970.

They are playing in a garden when they hear engine sounds and see a tiny (12 or 15 inches wide) biplane coming over the fence from the direction of an orchard. It swoops down, nearly hitting a trash can, and lands for a few seconds before resuming its flight. While it is stationary, the girl can see a “perfectly proportioned tiny pilot wearing a leather flying helmet, who waved to us as he took off.” (Gordon Creighton, “[A Weird Case from the](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201970%2520V%252016%2520N%25204.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727649324&usg=AOvVaw2p-S9SVoKkYcGLhKc7nuW1) [Past,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201970%2520V%252016%2520N%25204.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727649625&usg=AOvVaw02dKw4KqYkdbjIEz55yFfD)” Flying Saucer Review 16, no. 4 (July/Aug. 1970): 30; Clark III 1173)

June 12 — 11:00 p.m. As he is driving home at Ferme-Neuve, Quebec, Levis Brosseau, 20, sees something like a black cloud with a yellow light resting on a hillside. He gets out to investigate and discerns a structured object 50 feet in diameter. Outside of it, 4–5 small men of yellowish color are moving quickly about. Soon the object flies overhead, “purring like a milk separator,” and he hears two voices arguing. (Center for UFO Studies, [HUMCAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/HUMCAT/HUMCAT_Index_1910-1939.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727650308&usg=AOvVaw0GaCY_RT1Y7xA6s15bxfr1) [Index 1910–1939](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/HUMCAT/HUMCAT_Index_1910-1939.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727650552&usg=AOvVaw1v2B1yC42QZjLOUS4-PVtQ)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/HUMCAT/HUMCAT_Index_1910-1939.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727650730&usg=AOvVaw2hyRrTIlddZQS3vDqZ65Ka) p. 31; Clark III 264)

September — Medical student William Walton is crossing a street in Oak Park, Illinois, when he sees a very bright yellowish-white light like two saucers pressed together. It approaches his position, and he hears a humming sound like the throbbing of a turbine and feels heat and pressure. The object passes over him at about 100 feet altitude, but the force knocks him to his knees. After it passes, he detects an odor of sulfur. (Linda Zimmerman, More Hudson Valley UFOs, Eagle Press, 2017)

1930

1930 — 10:00 a.m. A woman is driving the family car in an isolated hilly area of Texas when she rounds a curve and sees a huge object about 100 feet across by the side of the road. A small door is open with steps leading down to the ground. One side of the object is braced up by two slender legs with round plates for feet. A man of normal size comes walking toward her and forces her to stop. He seems to speak to her telepathically, telling her to leave the road and make a shortcut through a gully. Some 8–10 other figures walk forward, much smaller and with slanted eyes. They are wearing tan coveralls and tight caps. Despite potential damage to her car, she drives through the gully as the larger man walks alongside. The next thing she remembers is walking up to her porch at her home 15 miles away. It is around 12:00 midnight. In March 1968, having read Interrupted Journey about the Betty and Barney Hill case, she writes to the Colorado project and offers herself for hypnosis and research. [Edward Condon](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Condon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727651615&usg=AOvVaw3oWa1cizxPUl2EtyDZBYtp) files the letter under “psychological” and does not respond. (Michael D. Swords, “Too Close for Condon: Close Encounters of the 4th Kind,” IUR 28, no. 3 (Fall 2003): 4–5; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1930-00-00-usa-texas.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727652157&usg=AOvVaw3OKPVB2ljHSql3Lw_yEdLe)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1930-00-00-usa-texas.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727652459&usg=AOvVaw3oemu__6A7EiJL9oNLP6yO) August 29, 2019)

1930 — Day. Schoolboys and teachers at the Barton Hill Academy in Bristol, England, watch a cigar-shaped metallic object speed across the sky faster than a dirigible. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, pp. 16–19)

1930 — 9:30 p.m. Two men walking along a lane at Tomintoul, Scotland, see a white light “like a meteor.” When it gets brighter, they can see figures moving inside it. The witnesses think it is a ghost light. (Clark III 264; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1930-00-00-uk-tomintoul.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727653135&usg=AOvVaw09ZEbpzj19jghjOOzw3gyq)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1930-00-00-uk-tomintoul.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727653444&usg=AOvVaw0cyRlIQ0tp6LzgCR-41Wx9) September 20, 2018)

Spring (or spring 1931) — 7:00 p.m. As he walks down a country road near Newberry, Michigan, high school student Ralph Newman sees a “distinctly green fireball” in the low eastern sky that moves from south to north. About the size of the full moon, its light brightens the countryside, then it vanishes. (Clark III 1175)

* * *

May — Day. A top-shaped object 40 feet wide lands in a garden in Greensboro, North Carolina. Mr. and Mrs. J. T. Rankin and their two daughters can see the head and shoulders of a figure inside wearing a tight-fitting outfit and helmet. Some 5–10 minutes later the object ascends quietly and is gone. (Center for UFO Studies, [HUMCAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/HUMCAT/HUMCAT_Index_1910-1939.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727654103&usg=AOvVaw20e4J8yb5FOvg-yoEbyQh1) [Index 1910–1939](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/HUMCAT/HUMCAT_Index_1910-1939.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727654424&usg=AOvVaw1KGXHGEZlDJ2GfsdVkhQLy)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/HUMCAT/HUMCAT_Index_1910-1939.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727654699&usg=AOvVaw0N-mY8FknPklxx5wgJvZet) p. 33; Clark III 264; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1930-05-00-usa-greensboro.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727655068&usg=AOvVaw2VLwWhse9djGRACq_IinQd)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1930-05-00-usa-greensboro.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727655375&usg=AOvVaw1qgwrNnRjFtgMqstHDrw0h) September 15, 2018)

1931

January 1 — 1:00 a.m. J. Stewart Childerhose and his brother, two farmers of Cobden, Ontario, see an object with a brilliant white light on its front illuminating treetops on the shore of Muskrat Lake. Green and white lights twinkle on its tail end. It moves in a rectangular path, then speeds up suddenly and climbs out of sight. (Lore and Deneault, [p. 108](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/mysteriesofskies0000lore/page/108/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727656024&usg=AOvVaw1ERdaIdJg80jgg5q624rSW))

January 26 — Author [Tiffany Thayer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tiffany_Thayer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727656421&usg=AOvVaw2HjR1ugIOczeRFlK6xBDqT) founds the Fortean Society during a dinner with [Charles Fort](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Fort&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727656804&usg=AOvVaw2b7PZAz9OZf1DXTVnIaP33) in the Savoy-Plaza Hotel in New York City in order to promote his books and ideas. (Wikipedia, “[Fortean Society](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fortean_Society&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727657161&usg=AOvVaw2FbagZtuF1TwX_uAmxyf--)”; Jim Steinmeyer, Charles Fort: The Man Who Invented the Supernatural, Tarcher, 2008, pp. 239–241)

February — [Charles Fort](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Fort&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727657577&usg=AOvVaw2sy-GvOYQt8PVqpdmIUBez) writes in Lo!, published this month, that “Unknown, luminous things, or beings, have often been seen, sometimes close to this earth, and sometimes high in the sky. It may be that some of them were living things that occasionally come from somewhere else.” (Wikipedia, “[Lo!](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lo!&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727657963&usg=AOvVaw2cafzteEiOlEAC7TCRSVut)”; Jim Steinmeyer, Charles Fort: The Man Who Invented the Supernatural, Tarcher, 2008, pp. 235–243; Clark III 507–508, 1098)

May — 4:30 p.m. Pasquale Masala is out riding his horse with a friend a few miles southeast of Paulilatino, Sardinia, Italy. When they reach a megalithic tomb known as Nuraghe Trudumeddu, they dismount to enjoy the view. Suddenly, a strange object the size and shape of a football emerges from the partially blocked entrance of the tomb. It travels at a height of about 3 feet above the ground at a constant speed of about 10–15 mph and enters a thick patch of undergrowth. Marsala runs after it for about a half mile and notices that the bushes part in front of the object and close up after it passes. His companion is frightened and insists on returning to the village. (Mary Boyd, “[An Early Italian Cross-Country Case,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201974%2520V%252020%2520N%25203.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727658600&usg=AOvVaw1G331TgqfzP47ZpR1Sdz0t)” Flying Saucer Review 20, no. 3 (December 1974): 21; 1Pinotti 13– 14)

June 6 — Aviator [Francis Chichester](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Francis_Chichester&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727659197&usg=AOvVaw22U8Fx_Ei6qoMGRYy1LQL2) sees a dull gray-white “airship” as he is making the first solo flight in a Gypsy Moth seaplane from New Zealand to Australia over the Tasman Sea. (Francis Chichester, The Lonely Sea and the Sky, Hodder and Stoughton, 1964, [p. 165](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/lonelyseasky0000chic/page/164/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727659644&usg=AOvVaw0MWO31UydzWMqsPjq5ZtJ4); Keith Basterfield, “[Aviator Francis Chichester’s Classic Sighting: Is the](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufos-scientificresearch.blogspot.com/2018/05/aviator-francis-chichesters-classic.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727659972&usg=AOvVaw0MD6wswglty8YGwrXq6zvD) [Date Wrong?](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufos-scientificresearch.blogspot.com/2018/05/aviator-francis-chichesters-classic.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727660236&usg=AOvVaw2DRzUdO5vSJP5fnFqqbp9T)” Unidentified Aerial Phenomena–Scientific Research, May 29, 2018; Patrick Gross, “[Francis](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/chichester1931.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727660592&usg=AOvVaw21APe_GHZOMnMLLR6yP3I5) [Chichester Sighting, 1931](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/chichester1931.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727660862&usg=AOvVaw3qJnL6nfIgexSxQQp7o8PH)”)

Summer — Alice May Williams of Auckland, New Zealand, begins writing letters over a two-year period to [Edison Pettit](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edison_Pettit&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727661327&usg=AOvVaw2jrqvgPQS9h6qmgB3C7PDp) and [Seth Barnes Nicholson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seth_Barnes_Nicholson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727661637&usg=AOvVaw20QzzHGb_6pYPVtIkdztg6)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seth_Barnes_Nicholson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727661822&usg=AOvVaw0sYf9fSDFHV5vV1TNcLrz9) astronomers at the Mount Wilson Observatory in Pasadena, California, describing her encounters with telepathic aliens who fly in a circular machine “like a great big lamp.” She writes that “The Planet mars is inhabited by human spirits like us can talk eat & drink wear clothes, but have great power. They are something people of this earth have never seen.” Their ships “are round like the moon with airtight shutter at the front, glass. The machine must be built with some light material, airproof fireproof, waterproof. The inside must be like a room, 2 beds tables & chairs.” Much of her information seems to be derived from articles in the Auckland Star about conditions elsewhere in the solar system. (David Herkt, “[Who No: Letters from Alice May](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://publicaddress.net/speaker/who-no-letters-from-alice-may-williams/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727662195&usg=AOvVaw2T-sZQ5Wi0r2pg94cDoLsf) [Williams,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://publicaddress.net/speaker/who-no-letters-from-alice-may-williams/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727662451&usg=AOvVaw3iYeS36GYCKN5-o_ZwrKVV)” Speaker: Public Address, September 3, 2012)

1932

1932 — Danish pilots Lt. Col. Peter Grunnet and Lt. Tage Andersen are flying an H.M.II (Heinkel HE 8) seaplane over eastern Greenland as part of a photogrammetric survey. Suddenly, Andersen notices they are being followed by a hexagonal metallic object about a mile behind them. (Rufus Drake, “UFO Crisis over Greenland,” Saga, October 1976, pp. 36–38, 54, 60; Patrick Gross, “[Pilots UFO Sightings,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/acufo-greenland1932.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727663316&usg=AOvVaw0mXvR4IAhWgYh8SnxPGXfX)” August 8, 2021)

April or May — Terry F. Lapeza sees an aluminum-like disc with yellowish lights or “portholes” on the underside, about 100 feet in diameter over Durham, New York. It is moving north at about 300 mph. (UFOEv, [p. 129](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D141%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727663835&usg=AOvVaw0ignoBhjSD84DvMr2CXJV5))

* * *

Early summer (or early summer 1933)— 7:30 p.m. Teenager Fred W. Van Sant and his brother Milton see 7–8 “meteors flying in a bunch” over hills east of Oakland, California. They maintain the same altitude from east to west in a great arc. The objects are silent and are so bright they seem to be emitting their own light. (NICAP case file; Clark III 1175)

June —Evening. [Reuben D. Knight](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/56347611/reuben-d-knight&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727664566&usg=AOvVaw0b8iZhk3Zc6vmB-6WO09mi) is standing on the porch of his farmhouse near Wattsburg, Pennsylvania, when he notices a bright speck of light approaching from some woods to the south. Growing in size, it comes to within 4 feet of him and appears as a silvery-blue ball about 14 inches in diameter. It travels in a loop and circles back to the woods in a steady path of 35–40 mph. After it circles past him again, he calls his wife and she sees the ball make a final loop before it disappears in the woods. (NICAP case file; Clark III 1175; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1932-06-00-usa-wattsburg.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727665067&usg=AOvVaw1Fc7HdhW38o2RAVxO70EDn), August 19, 2018)

1933

1933 — Earl J. Duncan and a Native American boy are in a truck near Fort Washakie, Wyoming, on the Wind River Indian Reservation. As they reach the crest of a hill, they see three perfectly round, pulsating, orange-red balls about 900 feet away. They are moving “in absolute alignment” about 20 feet from the ground toward the nearest mountain range. After 5 minutes of silent movement they disappear over a nearby mountain. (NICAp case file; Clark III 1175)

Summer — For weeks, strange lights in the sky are reported around Tobin Lake, Saskatchewan. Curious about the reports, two young men and a woman drive to the lake from Napawin. On their way they see a glow near the horizon, so they park and trek a quarter mile into the woods where they can see a large, oval-shaped craft sitting on legs.

From an open central doorway shines a bright orange glow; a ladderlike stairway extends downward with a dozen figures dressed in silver suits moving up and down the steps. They appear to be repairing the craft. The witnesses watch for 30 minutes when they decide to return to their truck and get closer. Two nights later they return and find imprints and burn marks, which they photograph. Two of them write an article that they submit to magazines, which refuse to publish what they consider outlandish fiction. (John Brent Musgrave, “[Saskatchewan, 1933: UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201976%2520V%252022%2520N%25206.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727665934&usg=AOvVaw2G1Wssh-2TMFx9hlEvu8Gl) [Stops for ‘Repairs,’](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201976%2520V%252022%2520N%25206.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727666289&usg=AOvVaw2ZXiWth9FKyTbSVaRJ6Hvr)” Flying Saucer Review 22, no. 6 (April 1977): 16–17; Clark III 264; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1933-canada-nipawin.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727666689&usg=AOvVaw1TGj59BN0TkjSaGwYyYw-L)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1933-canada-nipawin.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727666991&usg=AOvVaw2_Y-_gzpNgRy-IdipcouBB) July 15, 2009)

Summer — 2:30 a.m. A man who still insists on anonymity in 1964 is driving near Cherryville, Pennsylvania, when his car gets a flat tire. As he is jacking it up, he sees a faint violet light in the field on his right. Curious, he walks about 200 feet toward the light and sees a bell-shaped object about 10 feet in diameter and 6 feet high on the grass. Light is issuing from a circular door about 1 foot in diameter. He pushes it and it swings open. Putting his head inside, he cannot see much because of the peculiar light coming from the ceiling. The chamber inside is about 6 feet in diameter, 4 feet high, and full of tubing and dials on a console. An ammonia scent pervades the room, which is notably chilly. The man then walks around the object, touching the surface, which is slick, metallic, and cold. After 10 minutes, he goes back to the car, replaces the tire, and drives home. (“[Flying Saucer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92254566/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727667486&usg=AOvVaw3exufpvIi611XHXjomeYXY) [Spotted in 1933,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92254610/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727667738&usg=AOvVaw0NP0IEhyN8kAQ2lkBHlwbO)” Allentown (Pa.) Sunday Call-Chronicle, February 16, 1964, pp. B1–B2; Clark III 1175–1176; “[1933 Sighting Reported,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201964%252007%252000%2520-%2520July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727668236&usg=AOvVaw0rX-hyYuNPfWJYO-e5HfyC)” APRO Bulletin, July 1964, pp. 7–8; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1933-usa-chrysville.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727668743&usg=AOvVaw2Qje2R9EFFwIiz0XAHqdC7)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1933-usa-chrysville.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727669047&usg=AOvVaw3PtzbcDs-3BoFDtoyZ0FnH) July 16, 2009)

Summer — Night. Frank Van Keuren is fishing with others along the waterway off Beach Haven, New Jersey. Suddenly they are illuminated by a searchlight coming from an object moving slowly and silently about 1,000 feet in the air. It goes on to circle some radio towers about 8 miles away, flooding them with light. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, pp. 19–20)

June 1 — English mountaineer [Frank Smythe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Smythe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727669641&usg=AOvVaw2XTf3r5Kylf-rGpCYduuky)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Smythe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727669835&usg=AOvVaw2ySx0mBgj208984UsYGL3D) during the British Mount Everest Expedition in the Himalaya Mountains of Nepal, is heading for camp at 27,500 feet when he sees two dark objects floating in the blue sky. In shape they resemble kite balloons, except that one appears to possess short squat wings. As they hover motionless, they seem to pulsate in and out as though they are breathing. A minute or two later they disappear behind mountain mist. (Frank S. Smythe, Camp Six: An Account of the 1933 Mount Everest Expedition, Hodder and Stoughton, 1937,

[pp. 264–265](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/dli.csl.6684/page/n301/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727670351&usg=AOvVaw2DtA3_IvBRV7j9RnT9VZ5M); Barry Greenwood, “[UFOs on Mt. Everest in 1933,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.greenwoodufoarchive.com/uhr/uhr05.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727670720&usg=AOvVaw2Qgh4b8UOoELyUKukYvc89)” UFO Historical Revue, no. 5 (July 1999): 2–3)

June 13 — An unknown aircraft allegedly crashes at Magenta, just west of Milan, Italy. The Italian government establishes a top-secret group, Gabinetto Ricerche Speziale/33, to examine the craft. It is headed by Prime Minister [Benito Mussolini](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benito_Mussolini&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727671277&usg=AOvVaw3L2s7q3MkZ-aj0P4qBhmjn), Foreign Minister [Galeazzo Ciano](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Galeazzo_Ciano&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727671598&usg=AOvVaw29IzqNSwnUPHSFa3H0fpWs), and Air Marshal [Italo Balbo](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italo_Balbo&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727671812&usg=AOvVaw3DhlErYCDJPyDPt6OAXpWZ), with scientific support from [Guglielmo Marconi](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guglielmo_Marconi&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727672024&usg=AOvVaw12GHyE0annuVmrZWCLlLYM) and astronomer [Gino Cecchini](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.treccani.it/enciclopedia/gino-cecchini_%2528Dizionario-Biografico%2529/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727672275&usg=AOvVaw19LMLb6K0woF0g-2IAGzMk)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.treccani.it/enciclopedia/gino-cecchini_%2528Dizionario-Biografico%2529/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727672468&usg=AOvVaw0mFT1R79mvsZjAT_xbBYuH) Debris is reportedly stored in the hangars of the SIAI- Marchetti aircraft company in Vergiate, Varese. Journalists are ordered to keep silent about the incident due to

* * *

national security. (Good Need, [pp. 12–15](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/12/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727672857&usg=AOvVaw1-7VLVe25iRHFCvFvjm2y_); Roberto Pinotti and Alfredo Lissoni, Gli “X-Files” del Nazifascismo,

2001; 2Pinotti 179–197)

July 5 — Evening. Four RAF Hawker Fury I biplanes flying over Sussex, England, encounter a gigantic light that shines directly into the center of their formation from a higher altitude. Two Hawkers experience mechanical trouble and separate. Capt. Nigel Tompkins and Lt. Bruce H. Thomas make emergency landings when both their planes’ engines quit. On his way down, Thomas passes so close to the light that it causes burns on his face and hands.

Probable hoax. (History of the III Fighter Squadron, RAF, London Press, 1947; Jan Aldrich, “[Aircraft/UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/47cats/jan42.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727673403&usg=AOvVaw1PmZgqsaxbh2d-wLDY905F) [Encounters Prior to 1942,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/47cats/jan42.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727673622&usg=AOvVaw1ql_HErD5NbH54LvFuKSFN)” Project 1947; Patrick Gross, “[Pilots UFO Sightings,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/acufo-sussex5july1933.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727673873&usg=AOvVaw0wjNw85-VoiAeK2qr9V5eD)” August 3, 2021)

July 31 (or August 1) — 9:15 p.m. Somewhere between Butt Valley Reservoir and Humbug Valley, California, high- school science teacher Paul M. Barry Jr. is skywatching when he sees two objects shoot across the sky. They are solid, prolate spheroids with a green luminescence. Their brightness changes considerably as they approach the zenith and diminish as they approach the horizon. He thinks they are 8–10 miles distant. The two objects disappear and are followed by a third. (Clark III 1175)

Fall — 11:45 p.m. A chemist in Contra Costa County, California, hears a humming sound outside coming from the northeast. Looking out the window, he sees the yard bathed in a steady blue-purple light. Suddenly the light goes out and the humming ends with a “pow” sound. (Lorenzen, UFOs; The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, p. 19)

Late November — After sunset. A lone observer sees what appears to be an aircraft land on ice-covered lake Fjosoken, Sorsele, Sweden. It takes off and circles the lake for one hour, during which time it projects a powerful searchlight on the lake’s surface. However, local police interview the witness and suspect that he was looking at Venus. (Swords 361)

December 24 — 6:00 p.m. Witnesses in Kalix, Norrbotten, Sweden, see beams of light coming from a machine that seems to be searching the ground below. The beams are “blinding.” The sighting is part of a wave of “ghost flier” reports of gray monoplanes without identifying markings that are reported over rural areas of Scandinavia from November 15, 1933, through February 11, 1934. The Swedish Military Record Office accumulates 96 reports from Sweden, 234 from Norway, and 137 from Finland, and the Swedish Air Force undertakes at least two reconnaissance missions in search of the mystery planes. More than 50% of the reports take place between 5:00

p.m. and 7:00 p.m., when Venus is low over the horizon. (Strange Company 7; Hilary Evans and Robert E. Bartholomew, Outbreak! Anomalist, 2009, pp. 497–499; Swords 361–363; Anders Liljegren, “[Ghost Flier](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Sweden/AFU_Newsletter/AFU_2001_41.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727674757&usg=AOvVaw2jLZuRDRr58-c9g-Q9V0aK) [Mystery Still Unresolved,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Sweden/AFU_Newsletter/AFU_2001_41.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727674993&usg=AOvVaw2cFgptxv5t79LkKyjt3oU0)” AFU Newsletter 41 (September 2001): 1–3)

December 28 — The 4th Swedish Flying Corps begins an investigation of the ghost flyers. (John A. Keel, “[Mystery](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201970%2520V%252016%2520N%25204.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727675375&usg=AOvVaw2IxkGnF6c1ZPYyTuquefXL) [Aeroplanes of the 1930s, Part 2,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201970%2520V%252016%2520N%25204.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727675624&usg=AOvVaw2QNa7NsLcs7qNPC_CcEVpF)” Flying Saucer Review 16, no. 4 (July/Aug. 1970): 12)

December 30 — Swedish customs sends a request for air support to Gen. [Eric Virgin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eric_Virgin_(officer)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727675950&usg=AOvVaw3f4Lpb7GldkXJyvBrL7XgM)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eric_Virgin_(officer)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727676133&usg=AOvVaw1tHH6ULbpnE6L9TE887j_n) head of the Swedish Air Force, to help apprehend the ghost fliers who could be smuggling liquor into Sweden. However, he is cautious and wants more information to evaluate. (Swords 361–362; Good Above, [p. 13](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/12/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727676353&usg=AOvVaw0axdvMpwvQ0ZYeTmuTWibk))

1934

January — [George Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727676809&usg=AOvVaw0hu09KbXIAni0QWAt6zCBt)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727676980&usg=AOvVaw2d9sik-JzcI58gqGWx82gZ) who has been a lecturer and counselor on spiritual topics since about 1928, opens the Monastery of the Royal Order of Tibet at 758 Manzanita Drive, Laguna Beach, California. The monastery serves as his home and headquarters until 1940. (George M. Eberhart, “George Adamski—New Age Meets the Space Age,” IUR 21, no. 2 (Summer 1996): 20; “[Laguna Beach, 1932–1940: From Temple to Ranch,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.the-adamski-case.nl/his-life/laguna-beach/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727677291&usg=AOvVaw34uvko5CE6BO5GM7EkuEAr)” The Adamski Case, September 27, 2019)

January 2 — 3:45 a.m. Olof Hedlund is taking a walk in Sorsele, Västerbotten, Sweden, when he hears an engine above him. There is a full moon and visibility is good. He sees an airplane fly over the city from the west, passing directly above the train station. It turns three times in wide circles, then it takes off to the north, following the railroad tracks. It is at about 1,300 feet altitude and visible for 15 minutes. (John A. Keel, “[Mystery Aeroplanes of](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201970%2520V%252016%2520N%25204.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727677612&usg=AOvVaw0m7tGDCZAeleOlt_hh3XJy) [the 1930s, Part 2,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201970%2520V%252016%2520N%25204.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727677839&usg=AOvVaw1RS5BjOZDkTOvZbi9hrtNT)” Flying Saucer Review 16, no. 4 (July/Aug. 1970): 12)

January 9 — A mystery airplane is seen again over Västerbotten province, Sweden. The Swedish Air Force loses two aircraft trying to discover where the plane is based. (“[Mystery Plane Reported,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1934/01/10/94483337.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727678194&usg=AOvVaw1ML0jwFYOo8-arZxlJcjIu)” New York Times, January 10, 1934, p. 11; Strange Company 7–8)

* * *

January 10 — Gen. [Pontus Reuterswärd](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sv.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pontus_Reutersw%25C3%25A4rd&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727678635&usg=AOvVaw2uHNyKjJ2ruHAUn8CvJWVw)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sv.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pontus_Reutersw%25C3%25A4rd&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727678833&usg=AOvVaw1mVo8DAUqTx56Z1sTeYS-y) chief of armed forces in Upper Norrland, Sweden, recommends to officials of Norrbotten County that they request assistance from the Air Force to deal with the ghost fliers. Norrbotten administrator Bernard Gärde is skeptical of the “vague and unreliable” reports at first. (Swords 361–362)

January 22 — A mystery aircraft flies over the military fortress at Boden, Norrbotten, Sweden, seen by 30 soldiers, and [Reuterswärd](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sv.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pontus_Reutersw%25C3%25A4rd&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727679145&usg=AOvVaw1bq9AymC0b-5w084IShEK6) alerts the press that planes had flown over restricted military areas. (John A. Keel, “[Mystery](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201971%2520V%252017%2520N%25204.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727679397&usg=AOvVaw04lYjgJUpEVAEMQMkYGyna) [Aeroplanes of the 1930s, Part III—The Landings,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201971%2520V%252017%2520N%25204.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727679636&usg=AOvVaw3-OShNttH8fZS2d1LIl9SZ)” Flying Saucer Review 17, no. 4 (July/Aug. 1971): 17; Swords 362)

January 27 — Swedish MP [Arvid Lindman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arvid_Lindman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727680000&usg=AOvVaw06gNAWiJjj2F3t5iolfE5v) puts a question to Prime Minister [Per Albin Hansson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Per_Albin_Hansson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727680244&usg=AOvVaw06Rk3zvBUnacqgzROUgItZ)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Per_Albin_Hansson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727680414&usg=AOvVaw0AmZD-KK12_FzfLticuygq) asking what action the government plans to take about the ghost fliers. (Swords 362)

February 1 — Night. A mystery aircraft flies in circles for two hours over central London, England. Its engine is noisy, and its course can be clearly seen by its lights. On February 6, Under-Secretary of State for Air [Philip Sassoon](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philip_Sassoon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727680751&usg=AOvVaw3JKzQKT1pa987W0QU1_6nO) claims that it was an RAF plane carrying out a training exercise in coordination with ground forces. (John A. Keel, “[Mystery Aeroplanes of the 1930s, Part 2,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201970%2520V%252016%2520N%25204.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727681016&usg=AOvVaw10i63IGt39K-gKByd_L0x6)” Flying Saucer Review 16, no. 4 (July/Aug. 1970): 13)

February 2 — Prime Minister [Hansson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Per_Albin_Hansson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727681354&usg=AOvVaw3myw9pvwEvxLoX0bGwQ2mS) tells the Swedish Parliament that most ghost flier sightings are misidentifications or fantasy, while others are unsolved. (Swords 362)

February 2 — Night. A large unidentified airplane is seen over eastern Finland close to the Russian frontier, apparently scouting the district. Flights of ghost planes and mysterious lights have been seen for the past month over Helsinki and Vyborg, Finland, as well as Sweden and Norway. The Scandinavian mystery fliers continue to be seen into 1935. (“[Finnish Alarm Grows over ‘Ghost’ Planes,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1934/02/04/94488205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727681712&usg=AOvVaw0BGvxfxFkYoCPLpCGEMcoT)” New York Times, February 4, 1934, p. 9; Strange Company 8–9)

February 12 — Norrbotten, Sweden, administrator Bernard Gärde officially requests assistance of the Air Force with the ghost fliers. But air surveillance has actually been taking place since early January. (Swords 362)

March 4 — Sweden calls off its hunt for the ghost fliers, although sightings are still being reported. Even though 24 airplanes participated in the search, no Swedish pilot has seen a ghost flier. Soldiers on the ground occasionally report sound from a motor or lights in the sky. (Swords 362–363)

April 30 — Gen. [Reuterswärd](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sv.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pontus_Reutersw%25C3%25A4rd&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727682319&usg=AOvVaw3acAjKEdRWSC0ZvfucsNON) tells the press that several ghost flier reports in January had been of real, unidentified aircraft involved in a violation of Sweden’s airspace. MP [Elof Lindberg](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sv.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elof_Lindberg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727682713&usg=AOvVaw2cktdirLZXPZDmzUKIeiTT) accuses him of not being competent enough to draw such a conclusion. (Good Above, [p. 13](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/12/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727683078&usg=AOvVaw3SWxMVTwLlTGxVMkt9yYUU); Swords 363)

June 11 — Night. Two mystery airplanes circle around London, England: “The machines were low enough for their outlines, as well as their navigation lights, to be clearly visible against the sky.” Regulations prohibit RAF planes from flying over London at less than 5,000 feet. (John A. Keel, “[Mystery Aeroplanes of the 1930s, Part 2,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201970%2520V%252016%2520N%25204.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727683550&usg=AOvVaw1eZnyDWonz0t1vnXdBgi1i)” Flying Saucer Review 16, no. 4 (July/Aug. 1970): 13)

Summer — Day. 9-year-old [Coral E. Lightner](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Jim_and_Coral_Lorenzen.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727684205&usg=AOvVaw0pe1Z7oiTNqW14SMJ_Ul5T) and two friends watch a white object “like an open umbrella without the ribs or spurs” glide silently through the sky from the west-southwest to the northwest over Barron, Wisconsin. It moves silently with a slight undulation before it disappears after 20 seconds. (Lorenzen, FS Hoax, [pp. 15–16](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/1966CoralLorenzenFlyingSaucersTheStartlingEvidenceOfTheInvasionFromOuterSpacenotOCR/page/n11/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727684807&usg=AOvVaw1Bl52YvpeMaezugRGZqow2); “[The Wisconsin Flying Saucer That Changed UFO Research Forever,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.wisconsinfrights.com/coral-lorenzen-ufo-research/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727685192&usg=AOvVaw39z41tewHsyy7_-2G6c386)” Wisconsin Frights, September 20, 2018)

August 9 — Around 5:00 a.m. Musician [Leon M. Thompson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/64262206/leon-miller-thompson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727685774&usg=AOvVaw0v--oGjpCUGSdtqhmgEMyT) is boating on Keuka Lake in western New York when he notices an odd cloud on the west side of the lake. It is in the form of an elongated cone some 60–75 feet in length and 10–15 feet in diameter at its largest point. Suddenly the sky lights up in a flash and the cloud emits a fireball that arcs across the lake to the east and leaves a fiery train. It falls on a cottage and throws up a cloud of mist or steam that slowly dissipates. (“[Ball of Fire Brings Thrill to Fisherman,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92277834/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727686246&usg=AOvVaw1xO0ZADT4e_aYl0PRk9mgg)” Elmira (N.Y.) Star-Gazette, August 4, 1934, p. 5; Chris Aubeck and Martin Shough, Return to Magonia: Investigating UFOs in History, Anomalist, 2015, pp. 315–328)

1935

1935 — 10:00 p.m. Edward Winters of the US 4th Coast Artillery Regiment watches a dull-red, Zeppelin-shaped object flying over the Panama Canal Zone at high speed from the Pacific to the Atlantic for about 30 minutes. Later it returns, moving in the opposite direction farther away. (NICAP case file)

* * *

1935 — Astronomer [Arthur M. Harding](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://chancellor.uark.edu/about/presidents-chancellors/arthur-m-harding.php&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727687605&usg=AOvVaw1Z1ptkm4c_nvkYmoqaaqzP) writes that “Surely there must be some forms of life on Venus that are not so very different from what we find on earth.” (Arthur M. Harding, Astronomy: The Splendor of the Heavens Brought Down to Earth, Garden City Publishing, 1935, [p. 408](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/in.ernet.dli.2015.168383/page/n423/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727688180&usg=AOvVaw1OAjy0zmumtkOmImtYh8VJ))

January 10 — Charles Spayde, the operator of a telegraph station west of Lima, Ohio, claims that he has been receiving a “series of strange, unintelligible signals” that are broad in wavelength and “come in all over the dial.” He is convinced they are not static or mechanical disturbances and they do not originate on this planet. (Jerome Clark, “Conversations with Martians,” IUR 29, no. 3 (Fall 2004): 20)

January 22 or 23 — 8:00 p.m. A woman in Vienna, Virginia, sees a lightning-like flash in the southwest that flares up several times then dies down. It seems to come from a “great blazing light, almost a ball of fire,” that is moving around the horizon. It is lost to view in the southeast. (“A correspondent from Vienna, Va., writes,” Science 81 (1935): 294)

Spring — Night. A Mr. Aerts sees a brilliant circular object “like aluminum” in the sky above the roofs of nearby houses in Mechelen, Belgium. It lands and he sees two small occupants come out of the rear; they wear square helmets with short antennas and are apparently examining the exterior surface. (Center for UFO Studies, [HUMCAT Index](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/HUMCAT/HUMCAT_Index_1910-1939.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727689037&usg=AOvVaw1fu0q_WtcyGFsD9Leupd0T) [1910–1939](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/HUMCAT/HUMCAT_Index_1910-1939.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727689262&usg=AOvVaw3eIUsiTqnMHl7KVCKk8Kww)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/HUMCAT/HUMCAT_Index_1910-1939.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727689435&usg=AOvVaw2EzaLL7hpAxWQnWmsjknBB) p. 42; Clark III 265)

April 5 — Dusk. A farmer named Mora sees a large, round, brilliant object descend and hover just above the ground near his property in Aznalcázar, Seville, Spain. Several small beings appear and stroll around it. (Clark III 264–265; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1935-04-05-spain-aznalcazar.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727689770&usg=AOvVaw1M8z_BVFtH-lwA8bDgj_S9)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1935-04-05-spain-aznalcazar.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727689963&usg=AOvVaw2OY5t0XI9ecDCi_dJapwsS) April 9, 2007)

May — Radu Popescu and his cousin are walking by the Olt River near Drăgășani, Romania, when they come upon what seems to be a Romany wagon. They see five figures—one next to the object, two farther away, and another two next to a boat on the shore. Suddenly the figures run toward the object, something black covers it, an antenna appears, and it rises up above the river. It turns to a white color as it moves away. (Romania 121–122)

July 1 — The US Division of Investigation officially becomes the Federal Bureau of Investigation. (Federal Bureau of Investigation, [Timeline](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.fbi.gov/history/timeline&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727690392&usg=AOvVaw03aEyu8bURcF-zMBBY4m0E)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.fbi.gov/history/timeline&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727690574&usg=AOvVaw2jXRvYxQ-UTd_yPegig2M9) March 31, 2002)

July 8 — The Swedish Chief of Staff releases its final report on ghost fliers. After concluding that 42 of the 487 reports investigated by Sweden, Norway, and Finland are of actual aircraft violating borders, the military admits the phenomenon is at least partially real. (Swords 363)

1936

1936 — Atmospheric physicist [William Jackson Humphreys,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Jackson_Humphreys&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727691130&usg=AOvVaw1TOEkIzZDSpCAJbVsUy9yz) after examing 280 cases, argues that ball lightning is caused by persistence of vision, meteorites, will-o’-the-wisp, brush discharge, and other natural phenomena. (W. J. Humphreys, “[Ball Lightning,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.jstor.org/stable/984750?refreqid%3Dexcelsior%253A6a5b4e7a4b1a89bfc652ddb14931cc97&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727691406&usg=AOvVaw1vh2BD30p8r1QhL6h_oCRT)” Proceedings of the American Philosophical Society 76 (1936): 613–626)

1936 — Late evening. Mrs. E. P. Higgins and another member of the Canal Zone Astronomical Society observe a moving orange-red star passing from north to south near Miraflores Lake, Panama. Suddenly it halts and travels in three small circles from right to left. (Lore and Deneault, [pp. 112–113](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/mysteriesofskies0000lore/page/112/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727691785&usg=AOvVaw26__YfuGkLWxv7do8eswSN); Clark III 1176)

January — [George Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727692089&usg=AOvVaw3Z4uw5fgAQyU8SI3ii94BI)’s Royal Order of Tibet publishes Universal Jewels of Life as a free monthly newsletter for those attending his meetings in Laguna Beach, California. Besides Adamski, talks are also given by Marguerite Weir, Alice Wells, and others. Beginning in May, the Royal Order has a weekly 15-minute slot on local radio stations KFOX in Long Beach and KMPC in Los Angeles. He also publishes Wisdom of the Masters of the Far East, a summary of his “ageless wisdom” teachings. (“[Laguna Beach, 1932–1940: From Temple to Ranch,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.the-adamski-case.nl/his-life/laguna-beach/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727692440&usg=AOvVaw3z6Ua9u5u7KKVaSbu0OSOD)” The Adamski Case, September 27, 2019)

August 17 — A metallic disc with a diameter of 33–40 feet is seen flying soundlessly near Venice, Italy. It has windows and alternating white and red lights. Two fighters from a nearby air base attempt to intercept it but cannot reach it. After maneuvering for an hour and passing above Mestre, Veneto, it appears more like a torpedo-shaped object.

Two other smaller, domed discs are also seen following it. A report on the incident is sent to Foreign Minister [Galeazzo Ciano](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Galeazzo_Ciano&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727692835&usg=AOvVaw08Xch5fPBPT05Q72smvCIZ)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Galeazzo_Ciano&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727693014&usg=AOvVaw0-wO4y9aUQp7iIIWf0hmdl) (Good Need, [p. 12](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/12/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727693241&usg=AOvVaw2RipCLeGPJG1oHetbFvTMe); Roberto Pinotti and Alfredo Lissoni, Gli “X-Files” del Nazifascismo, 2001)

* * *

Fall — Before 12:00 midnight. [Louie R. Lindblad](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/5664788/louie-roland-lindblad&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727693635&usg=AOvVaw0UWTI4oPd5F3jukrOyYLXF) and five companions from Texarkana, Arkansas, are fox hunting in Bowie County, Texas \[around the current site of the Red River Army Depot\] when they observe numerous star- like objects in a circular formation. Occasionally a light would fly across the circle and take up another position until they all seem to relocate. They watch the display for about 30–40 minutes. (MUFON UFO Journal, no. 150, August 1980, p. 12)

October — Night. Holger Berg and another worker at the Civilian Conservation Corps in Eklutna, Alaska, are walking south toward Anchorage when the see a light approaching them from the south. It is attached to a cigar-shaped object embedded in a blue-green haze and making a strange buzzing noise. As the object passes directly overhead, they notice it actually has a triangular shape and multicolored lights on its tail end. Frightened, they dive into a nearby snowbank then run back to Eklutna. (Marler 64–66)

October 10 — 4:15 a.m. Capt. Mario Rossi, flight instructor at the airfield at Orbetello, Grosseto, Italy, is flying a Savoia- Marchetti SM.62 at 12,465 feet over Talamone, Italy, when he sees an unusual light ahead of his plane. He follows the light, which is at a slightly higher altitude and moving at nearly 440 mph. Rossi loses it after flying into a cloud for 12 minutes and finding himself over Elba. (Ernesto Thayaht, “[Three Sightings in Italy,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1955%252CJul-Aug%252CV%25201%252CN%25203.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727694193&usg=AOvVaw29ap-JNQePTMXBXxYKSuTi)” Flying Saucer Review 1, no. 3 (July/Aug. 1955): 6; 1Pinotti 15–16; “[Pilots UFO Sightings,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/acufo-formichedigrosseto10oct1936.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727694493&usg=AOvVaw1JXvEMorBzD7ThOf9sV-1_)” August 7, 2021)

Winter — Robert Damion, an astronomer of Nice, Alpes-Maritimes, France, who has a private observatory in the Alps, claims that for several nights a “certain portion of the sky in the vicinity of Mars” has been lit up with a deep bluish tint for 40 seconds each time. He is convinced that Mars is trying to signal Earth. (“[Strange Light from](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92280807/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727694837&usg=AOvVaw0MfWf9YGDzp84PGdZQTy5w) [Mars Called Signal to Earth,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92280807/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727695043&usg=AOvVaw3YOHK3CwfssJMjDNrti9cB)” Ogden (Utah) Standard-Examiner, March 11, 1936, p. 12)

1937

January — A man who later becomes an administrator in a Missouri state agency chases a disc-shaped object in his private aircraft over Van Buren, Missouri. (Harley D. Rutledge, Project Identification: The First Scientific Field Study of UFO Phenomena, Prentice-Hall, 1981, [p. 213](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/rutledge-project-identification/page/213/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727696053&usg=AOvVaw2F1pGCUxHjzGdyns0hMbGU))

January 1 — Noon. Pilot Howard S. Behr is flying a Curtiss-Wright CW-15 Sedan at 3,000 feet over Virginia on his way to Raleigh, North Carolina. Suddenly he sees an object beginning to cross his flight path about 1,000 feet below him. It looks like a gondola, gun-metal gray in color, with both of its ends turned up. He estimates it is about 35– 40 feet long and traveling at 150 mph. It moves off to his left and disappears. (Jerome Clark, Strange Skies: Pilot Encounters with UFOs, Citadel, 2003, p. 6; Patrick Gross, “[Pilots UFO Sightings,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/acufo-virginia1jan1937.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727696600&usg=AOvVaw2htZOUq85Bj3F7ZlfVAk4m)” August 7, 2021)

January 4 — New ghost flier sightings around the fortress at Boden, Norrbotten, Sweden, have prompted Gen. [Pontus](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sv.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pontus_Reutersw%25C3%25A4rd&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727696882&usg=AOvVaw0pEa3DUuT3UtnvgCmhImBP) [Reuterswärd](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sv.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pontus_Reutersw%25C3%25A4rd&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727697102&usg=AOvVaw0LntCi96_pK0BJvVoEiCxp) to alert Minister of Defence [Janne Nilsson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sv.wikipedia.org/wiki/Janne_Nilsson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727697342&usg=AOvVaw2YQ5udYh4xrnjEc1vz7A7b) about the possibility of foreign spies. Late January — Ghost fliers return to Västerbotten, Sweden. A light is seen wandering near the horizon east of Umeå. A light brighter than a headlight is reported from a community near Dorotea. A light similar to position lights on an aircraft flies over a village outside Stensele. (Swords 363)

February 11 — 9:00 p.m. The crew of the fishing vessel Fram is departing Kvalsvik, Norway, when they notice a “large aeroplane” with red and green glowing lights resting on top of the water. The captain turns the boat around to offer assistance, but the object’s lights go out and it is cloaked in a “cloud of smoke” and vanishes. (Strange Company 11)

February 15 — MP [Elof Lindberg](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sv.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elof_Lindberg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727698588&usg=AOvVaw3ayKFu6u0OIE-zjmchK190) demands in the Swedish Parliament that a commission with civil experts, not military, should investigate the ghost flier intrusions. He suspects the military has embellished the reports to direct more resources to the northern region and to the Air Force in general. (Swords 363)

May 19 — [Lindberg](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sv.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elof_Lindberg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727699216&usg=AOvVaw0H216JqXnIswfcugTkRW9i)’s request for a civilian ghost flier investigation is rejected by Swedish Minister of Defence [Janne](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sv.wikipedia.org/wiki/Janne_Nilsson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727699610&usg=AOvVaw03Gq3SMP-CqM-b5GX7r8Om) [Nilsson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sv.wikipedia.org/wiki/Janne_Nilsson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727699836&usg=AOvVaw2Ns2QXVpzqdwFdYIqdkm43)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sv.wikipedia.org/wiki/Janne_Nilsson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727700007&usg=AOvVaw3au39wwUvmPYjIweiWAQ1o) who explains that no new facts have surfaced and few new observations have been reported. May 30 — Amateur astronomer [Latimer J. Wilson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/128149374/latimer-james-wilson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727700300&usg=AOvVaw2RaDHzuRWIONAgitP1rR1y) of Nashville, Tennessee, is observing Mars through a 12-inch reflector when he sees a series of intermittent bright flashes across the south polar cap. A line of tiny white spots seems to extend across the cap, some coalescing to swell in a brilliant white spot that quickly becomes yellow, then red- yellow, the “phenomenon passing from left to right across the polar cap.” (Latimer J. Wilson, “[Apparent Flashes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://adsabs.harvard.edu/full/1937PA.....45..430W&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727700584&usg=AOvVaw3tfAS9ETX8Z9TzbEA1FTO_) [Seen on Mars,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://adsabs.harvard.edu/full/1937PA.....45..430W&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727700788&usg=AOvVaw2a8VbQadKCyLmMVXojSwgZ)” Popular Astronomy 45 (1937): 430; Walter H. Haas, “[Flashes on Mars Observed in 1937 and](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://adsabs.harvard.edu/full/2003JALPO..45a..43H&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727701068&usg=AOvVaw1_qvWM-ajpVPMzCx0P0GeX) [Some Random Remarks,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://adsabs.harvard.edu/full/2003JALPO..45a..43H&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727701274&usg=AOvVaw26Q3TEeQvUXR4_m3Z7mhqw)” The Strolling Astronomer 45, no. 1 (Winter 2003): 43–45)

Summer — An object allegedly falls from the sky in Langenau \[now Czernica, Poland\] into a field belonging to [Eva](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eva_Braun&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727701669&usg=AOvVaw1G8ZILX1_rHdg3m3IPuli0) [Braun](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eva_Braun&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727701865&usg=AOvVaw1ugAks2JjYhceiQbMH4UVj)’s family and is retrieved by German soldiers. It supposedly winds up in [Wernher von Braun](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wernher_von_Braun&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727702073&usg=AOvVaw2hImsyDkQOcG2-kYyzrM2k)’s laboratory, but the story is probably mythical.
