September — [Tiffany Thayer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tiffany_Thayer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727702391&usg=AOvVaw1xZVaMaS6QKonmv8HPW9d6) publishes the first issue of the Fortean Society Magazine (retitled Doubt in 1944) in New York City. (Fortean Society Magazine [1, no. 1](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/Fortean%2520Society%2520Magazine%2520(Fortean%2520Society)/Fortean%2520Society%2520Magazine%2520-%2520No%252001.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727702827&usg=AOvVaw21NxmKDIhL6I8eZWo4Z0zA) (September 1937); Clark III 516)

September 10–12 — [George Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727703143&usg=AOvVaw178sgqrvzlf2kZFzZoJ6bH)’s Royal Order of Tibet organizes a festival in Laguna Beach, California, dramatizing the “teachings of the universal masters” and a round-table discussion focusing on the “present day needs in unifying all mankind.” (“[Laguna Beach, 1932–1940: From Temple to Ranch,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.the-adamski-case.nl/his-life/laguna-beach/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727703385&usg=AOvVaw0otmhZzKna8VUGB_MrRjI7)” The Adamski Case, September 27, 2019)

1938

1938 — The Ford Foundation and Rockefeller Foundation begin contributing large amounts of money to the Council on Foreign Relations. They create various Committees on Foreign Relations throughout the country, which later become governed by the American Committees on Foreign Relations in Washington, D.C., funded by a grant from the Carnegie Corporation. Influential men are chosen in several cities and are brought together for discussions in their own communities as well as participating in an annual conference in New York. These local committees serve to influence local leaders and shape public opinion to build support for the council’s policies, while also acting as “useful listening posts” through which the Council and US government can “sense the mood of the country.” (Wikipedia, “[Council on Foreign Relations](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Council_on_Foreign_Relations&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727704155&usg=AOvVaw2BaZsJXodaT6C3WN2IIHd4)”)

1938 — Harvey L. Sperry, 13, sees a white, vapor-like object moving at 5–10 mph at less than 100 feet altitude from north to south in Minneapolis, Minnesota. Its rim seems to be “composed of two interwoven parts revolving and moving in opposite directions.” (Lore and Deneault, [p. 136](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/mysteriesofskies0000lore/page/136/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727704455&usg=AOvVaw2xfHmF5uxaktg4XT6JQf6g); Clark III 1176)

February — [Raymond A. Palmer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raymond_A._Palmer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727704771&usg=AOvVaw3VBhb0AY53P-5_khTOilEx) is hired as editor of Amazing Stories magazine, owned by Ziff-Davis in Chicago, Illinois. He immediately sets out to enliven the periodical, which is close to folding. Concentrating on “space opera” stories, he expands its size to more than 200 pages and encourages readers to contribute content. (Wikipedia, “[Raymond A. Palmer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raymond_A._Palmer%23Career&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727705148&usg=AOvVaw3tY1yjIOlIiiKDkWZmwtZU)”)

Summer — Midnight. Artist Malcolm B. Perry sees what looks like a Navy blimp moving east to west over Somerville, Massachusetts. It has apparent portholes in the sides, and he can see the silhouette of someone looking at him. Other figures are taking turns looking through portholes. It disappears below some low clouds. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, pp. 20–21; “1938: Perry’s Alien,” UFO Roundup 5, no. 37 (September 4, 2000);

Clark III 265)

July 25 — 11:30 p.m. A lieutenant and his aide see a strong light coming from a hovering lens-shaped object near Guadalajara, Spain. It is over 35 feet in diameter and 15 feet high. A platform with two moving figures is lowered from underneath. A blue beam from the object shines on the witnesses, who feel a sudden chill. The platform rises back up, and the object glows with an intense white light and flies away. (Vicente-Juan Ballester Olmos, [A](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/books/Catalogue_of_200_Type_I_UFO_Events_in_Spain_and_Portugal.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727705800&usg=AOvVaw0gm-4XszFXknsGZ4V3GyOl) [Catalogue of 200 Type I UFO Events in Spain and Portugal](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/books/Catalogue_of_200_Type_I_UFO_Events_in_Spain_and_Portugal.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727706039&usg=AOvVaw39yEl3WKNmbTBLi3WGgvGF), CUFOS, 1976, p. 2; Clark III 265)

October — Dusk. A man is in a cornfield with his father near Alger, Ohio, when an object moves up and hovers about 500 feet above the field. The tractor motor stops running. The object is about 100 feet in diameter and has a ring of pulsating, multicolored lights around it. Soon it makes a right-angle turn and vanishes in the sky, after which they get the tractor working again. (Michael D. Swords, “The Timmerman Files,” IUR 26, no. 4 (Winter 2001–2002): 14)

October 22 — Italian Lt. Col. [Mario Pezzi](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mario_Pezzi_(aviator)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727706516&usg=AOvVaw2B6rwM5o976LsBcaeyj063) reaches a record altitude of 56,850 feet in a Caproni Ca.161. It is still the highest a manned, propeller-driven biplane has gone. (Wikipedia, “[Mario Pezzi (aviator)](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mario_Pezzi_(aviator)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727706780&usg=AOvVaw223325ehuChj5GzYCviIRT)”)

October 30 — 8:00 p.m. “The War of the Worlds” episode of the American radio drama anthology series The Mercury Theatre on the Air, directed and narrated by actor and future filmmaker [Orson Welles](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orson_Welles&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727707208&usg=AOvVaw1d-P39YynfJlGFW5A5cStz), is an adaptation of [H. G.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/H._G._Wells&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727707447&usg=AOvVaw0D3GhxVgMoctXDS9UZ3oDf) [Wells](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/H._G._Wells&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727707651&usg=AOvVaw2qtJbYDE795ccZY4q4E3hZ)’s novel The War of the Worlds (1898). It is performed and broadcast live in New York City as a Halloween episode over the Columbia Broadcasting System radio network. The episode becomes famous for allegedly causing panic among its listening audience, though the scale of that panic is disputed as the program has relatively few listeners. In the days after the adaptation, widespread outrage is expressed in the media. The program’s news-

* * *

bulletin format is described as deceptive by some newspapers and public figures, leading to an outcry against the broadcasters and calls for regulation by the FCC, which declines. Some government agencies in the US, Germany, and Russia take note of how segments of the population are easily manipulated into thinking fiction is fact. According to [Annie Jacobsen,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Annie_Jacobsen&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727708214&usg=AOvVaw07JU5tquwYzR4w_3vfrqLU) the confusion allegedly inspires [Joseph Stalin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Stalin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727708446&usg=AOvVaw18rYXJLUnoTcT1NvcrzvLD) to create a similar scenario with a fake alien crash in the US. (Wikipedia, “[The War of the Worlds](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_War_of_the_Worlds_(1938_radio_drama)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727708736&usg=AOvVaw0fpj1IpKaPJLqZHVRpT0cl) [(1938 radio drama)](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_War_of_the_Worlds_(1938_radio_drama)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727708923&usg=AOvVaw0CTg3vZEoYBkCCn1s3fq-_)”; John Gosling, Waging the War of the Worlds: A History of the 1938 Radio Broadcast and Resulting Panic, Including the Original Script, McFarland, 2009; Jacobsen, Area 51, [pp. 22](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/22/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727709308&usg=AOvVaw0WHTurE32mGmvZS-goTY04), [211](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/210/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727709542&usg=AOvVaw1fyOYGvQBJP6MCzc4z_hYx))

December 17 — The process of nuclear fission is discovered by chemist [Otto Hahn](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Otto_Hahn&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727709872&usg=AOvVaw052-J_U6ajeN9fiNRpxGY0) and his assistant [Fritz Strassmann](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fritz_Strassmann&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727710111&usg=AOvVaw14VOEqx6GzvuQ8hBp6bP0l) at the Kaiser Wilhelm Institut für Chemie in Berlin, Germany, producing barium by bombarding uranium with neutrons. (Atomic Heritage Foundation, “[Atomic Timeline](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.atomicheritage.org/history/timeline&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727710376&usg=AOvVaw08upYYgIfjV9eVEjZ_QT8N)”)

1939

1939? — Sisters [Lucile](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/42196628/anna-lucile-andrew&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727710836&usg=AOvVaw1SXm3GsRe0jZBLIvrLaRhh) and [Allene Holt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/137657953/margaret-allene-gramly&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727711088&usg=AOvVaw3Os-IOzJCJH6f0LDeOzwyE)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/137657953/margaret-allene-gramly&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727711274&usg=AOvVaw2HN_TrO-55s__WeG_9ipVX) daughters of Rev. [Turner Hamilton Holt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/30140414/turner-hamilton-holt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727711488&usg=AOvVaw3k1q7hYVa5lxziBA1tbM4p), claim they are separately told by their father, a cousin of Secretary of State [Cordell Hull](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cordell_Hull&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727711699&usg=AOvVaw3WGoQp8jvW7G5frj3zX6sq)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cordell_Hull&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727711909&usg=AOvVaw0Hus-3wZRdTa3FFDDlyZFB) that Hull personally showed Holt a wrecked circular craft of some kind and glass jars holding unknown creatures. These are stored in a sub-basement of the US Capitol building in Washington, D.C. Both sisters are told the story when Holt is a minister at the Shenandoah Christian Church in Greenwich, Ohio, before 1947, but researchers can find no confirmation in any of Hull’s papers or memoirs. (William E. Jones and Eloise G. Watson, “Pre–World War II ‘Creature’ Retrieval?” IUR 26, no. 4 (Winter 2001–2002): 6–9, 12)

January 13 — The process of nuclear fission is explained theoretically in Stockholm, Sweden, by [Lise Meitner](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lise_Meitner&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727712325&usg=AOvVaw0Uj6XSUs3CQGXvUHUvyRCU) and her nephew [Otto Robert Frisch,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Otto_Robert_Frisch&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727712559&usg=AOvVaw1c80z3emhdw5l-r26QZsnn) who compares it to the biological fission of living cells. (Atomic Heritage Foundation, “[Atomic Timeline](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.atomicheritage.org/history/timeline&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727712793&usg=AOvVaw3HrWovbyRWYI8gBVRD1y9N)”)

January 25 — A Columbia University team conducts the first nuclear fission experiment in the US in the basement

of Pupin Hall on the south side of 120th Street in New York City. The experiment involves placing uranium oxide inside an ionization chamber and irradiating it with neutrons, then measuring the energy released. The results confirm that fission is occurring and hints strongly that it is the isotope uranium-235 that is undergoing fission. (Richard Rhodes, The Making of the Atomic Bomb, Simon & Schuster, 1986, [pp. 267–270](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/makingofatomicbo00rhod/page/266/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727713409&usg=AOvVaw1-b09QFpqUJSCRZclO3yq_))

January 26 —The Carnegie Institution of Washington holds a press conference at the Fifth Washington Conference on Theoretical Physics in D.C. to announce the discovery of nuclear fission. (Atomic Heritage Foundation, “[Atomic](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.atomicheritage.org/history/timeline&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727713714&usg=AOvVaw0HaxZJoYrwcahMhhPEoCHI) [Timeline](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.atomicheritage.org/history/timeline&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727713917&usg=AOvVaw2-dEaD8rpQZrRn1l-kFBi7)”)

Late summer — A girl sleeping in the back yard of her home in Fort Worth, Texas, is awakened by a whirring noise. She sees a small object approaching from the east at an altitude of 20–30 feet. When it gets close, it descends to the level of her bed and hovers briefly at the foot, so close that she can touch it. It has the shape of an “old-time Mississippi steamboat with a deck around the bottom.” Strata or veins run through it, and a soft, blue-green glow surrounds it. It is 3 feet around and 1 foot high. It rises suddenly and disappears. (“[Woman Says Strange Object](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92336504/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727714293&usg=AOvVaw1kPc2aN6vTfPEHP0yNmjfc) [Flew by Her Bed in Yard,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92336504/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727714492&usg=AOvVaw2spxep0yAWRnMF4bPdyxY-)” Fort Worth (Tex.) Star-Telegram, March 24, 1950, p. 23; Clark III 1176)

Early August — George Pârvu and four other schoolchildren are playing in an open field in Armășești, Romania, when they see a bright light in the sky moving in a zigzag fashion. It circles a few times then descends in their direction, getting bigger and brighter. The egg-shaped object hovers silently at an altitude of 230–260 feet. Suddenly it becomes a dull coppery color and lands about 140 feet away. Two of the children flee but Pârvu and two others remain. The bottom of the object has a ring of small turbine blades that look like paddles in a water mill. It seems to be 16 feet high. A hatch opens and two little men about 4 feet tall come out, dressed in gray diving suits. They walk toward the children, one of them holding a rectangular box pointing at the ground. The children approach them, holding hands, but when they are about 23 feet away the other man points a thick stick-like device at them and they are no longer able to move forward. The little men bow in their direction, waist deep, then turn around and reenter the object, which takes off. The children find a circular area of yellowed grass where the object had been. Pârvu feels energized, but one of the other boys is temporarily sick. Pârvu encounters what he perceives to be the same object in August 1944, August 1949, and the summer of 1954 (in the center of Bucharest). (George Pârvu, La voia destinului, CNI Coresi, 2011; Romania 124–128)

* * *

August 2 — Hungarian-American physicist [Leo Szilárd](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leo_Szilard&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727715126&usg=AOvVaw3KqadNkIXpUngjAv4OKikb) writes a confidential letter to [President Roosevelt,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franklin_D._Roosevelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727715410&usg=AOvVaw3pr0LwUQq20iXfM6ZvgzOt) in consultation with fellow Hungarian physicists [Edward Teller](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Teller&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727715715&usg=AOvVaw3iK1h1Na_I8sLhOWr8Pwg3) and [Eugene Wigner.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eugene_Wigner&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727715966&usg=AOvVaw2CNWFV3GmTrnGgqCFHWzXM) He has persuaded [Albert Einstein](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albert_Einstein&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727716227&usg=AOvVaw300TPnOy6J4Z6jMNSByqul) to sign it as well. The letter warns that Germany might develop atomic bombs and suggests that the United States should start its own nuclear program. It results in the establishment of research into nuclear fission by the US government, and ultimately to the creation of the Manhattan Project. Delayed by the outbreak of war in Europe, the letter is eventually hand-delivered to Roosevelt by economist [Alexander Sachs](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexander_Sachs&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727716890&usg=AOvVaw0SL7fCV_bc8W0MvFkf97xX) on October 11. Roosevelt gives the letter to his aide, Brig. Gen. [Edwin “Pa” Watson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edwin_%2522Pa%2522_Watson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727717258&usg=AOvVaw0Owpc2ig9ZtvX9ubkdxaM_) with the instruction: “Pa, this requires action!” (Wikipedia, “[Einstein–Szilard letter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Einstein%25E2%2580%2593Szil%25C3%25A1rd_letter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727717526&usg=AOvVaw1yFDSNk4uz3SstPBSGvuY8)”; Atomic Heritage Foundation, “[Atomic Timeline](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.atomicheritage.org/history/timeline&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727717907&usg=AOvVaw3ORaWv9URa_sQkQbonu3Pl)”)

October — An egg-shaped object with 8 spots like portholes is observed through an astronomical reflector telescope at Wisconsin Rapids, Wisconsin. (Richard H. Hall, From Airships to Arnold, UFO Research Coalition, 2007, p. 17)

October 21 — After reading [Szilárd](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leo_Szilard&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727718399&usg=AOvVaw1Ty1eR31oA-Gux7v58DGNg)’s letter, [Roosevelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franklin_D._Roosevelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727718632&usg=AOvVaw3yqEbUgpw4RYplrpLmuFBq) creates an Advisory Committee on Uranium, which meets for the first time at the National Bureau of Standards in Washington, D.C. The committee consists of NBS Director [Lyman James Briggs,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lyman_James_Briggs&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727718909&usg=AOvVaw30_zJOWJ23HxxkMtAwc1oX) Army Lt. Col. [Keith F. Adamson,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8789273/keith-frazee-adamson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727719169&usg=AOvVaw3uD_YbTM4aYNiwDy_r7Bam) and Navy Cmdr. [Gilbert C. Hoover.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gilbert_C._Hoover&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727719396&usg=AOvVaw3zUJLlOa8EPL3HZ8T9s1i-) It is attended by physicists [Fred L. Mohler](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/149090915/fred-l-mohler&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727719641&usg=AOvVaw35nfl0diSQPyn4cSk0cOG4) from the National Bureau of Standards and [Richard Brooke Roberts](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nasonline.org/publications/biographical-memoirs/memoir-pdfs/roberts-richard-b.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727719915&usg=AOvVaw3oPdVLaEz0HtOSflugBoxW) from the Carnegie Institution of Washington, and Szilárd, [Wigner](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eugene_Wigner&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727720209&usg=AOvVaw1cdQaWMdBLFHZuqsYsq51U), and [Teller](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Teller&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727720405&usg=AOvVaw3Rl2CTjBBF3NiOuGXgOjwB). [Einstein](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albert_Einstein&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727720661&usg=AOvVaw2RgFw86e2nKql0VF_o1OC_) is invited but declines to attend. Adamson is skeptical about the prospect of building an atomic bomb, but is willing to authorize $6,000 (equivalent to

$107,000 in 2018 dollars) for the purchase of uranium and graphite for Szilárd and [Enrico Fermi](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enrico_Fermi&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727721082&usg=AOvVaw1CrHuUZtijmWt1pa_EBYQT)’s experiments into producing a nuclear chain reaction at Columbia University. (Wikipedia, “[S-1 Executive Committee](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S-1_Executive_Committee&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727721336&usg=AOvVaw0-xLwaJbBTWhvmPqyOWzYb)”)

November 13 — 7:00 a.m. A building foreman is driving past a deserted farm near Brockworth, Gloucester, England, when he hears a high-pitched humming sound. He watches a gray, bell-shaped object hovering about 20 feet above a field 100 feet away. He estimates it is about 25 feet across. Dark window-like patches are visible on the side. A “curtain” of blue-green light emanates from the underside. After about two minutes, the green light retracts into the base of the object. The object then tilts to an angle of about 80° and moves away without a sound. (Jenny Randles and Peter Warrington, Science and the UFOs, Basil Blackwell, 1985, [p. 3](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scienceufos0000rand/page/2/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727721753&usg=AOvVaw0IrWqh-OqCWOgUi-adQr43); Jenny Randles, “Beam Me Up,” Fortean Times 381 (July 2019): 29–30)

1940

1940 — Astronomer Royal [Harold Spencer Jones](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harold_Spencer_Jones&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727722303&usg=AOvVaw1S4TC_9gGj2XHBgDd1ElI5) publishes Life on Other Worlds, an essay on the cosmos, the possibility of life arising, science’s tools, the development of the Earth, solar system bodies without atmospheres, the giant gas planets, Venus, Mars, the origin of solar systems, and possibilities for life beyond the solar system. (H. Spencer Jones, [Life on Other Worlds](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/lifeonotherworld031516mbp&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727722643&usg=AOvVaw3qH3LmtLpKtjgoQmfVwxGM)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/lifeonotherworld031516mbp&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727722904&usg=AOvVaw3GH0qLiCkRV0-ECY-I45yw) Macmillan, 1940; Michael D. Swords, “SETI/ETI and UFOs,” JUFOS 5 (1994): 141–142)

March — [George Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727723316&usg=AOvVaw2A7BCithSzxmxD6Pi9UlRa) moves from Laguna Beach to a property along the Star Route in Valley Center, California, about 9 miles from where Palomar Observatory is under construction to set up a spiritual retreat. He acquires a 15-inch telescope to create an interest in astronomy. (“[Palomar Mountain, 1940–1960: From Obscurity to World](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.the-adamski-case.nl/his-life/mount-palomar/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727723584&usg=AOvVaw1dR0rdQrKASi9FCHYyO3rv) [Fame,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.the-adamski-case.nl/his-life/mount-palomar/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727723795&usg=AOvVaw3PW1VkLUDVxwpZig1FUdoM)” The Adamski Case, September 22, 2019)

March — US physicist [John R. Dunning](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_R._Dunning&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727724077&usg=AOvVaw1rUwi3yST0B9I2LsvmWuLO) and colleagues at Columbia University verify the hypothesis of Danish physicist [Niels Bohr](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Niels_Bohr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727724323&usg=AOvVaw0xEK_gsdjcOWYzcnqtZUEE) that fission is more readily produced in the rare uranium-235 isotope than the abundant uranium-238 isotope. Dunning begins investigating gaseous diffusion as a process for enriching uranium. (Atomic Heritage Foundation, “[Atomic Timeline](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.atomicheritage.org/history/timeline&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727724575&usg=AOvVaw0JzwOE1_zqaFw2bjHpfZJp)”)

March — [Otto Robert Frisch](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Otto_Robert_Frisch&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727724838&usg=AOvVaw2qg1MAyjZZ3rpV2Ja7z6t-) and [Rudolf Peierls,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rudolf_Peierls&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727725091&usg=AOvVaw1R3KdIx_hReVnq0cFyQU2K) two researchers at the University of Birmingham in England—who ironically have been assigned to investigate nuclear weapons by Australian physicist [Mark Oliphant](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mark_Oliphant&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727725380&usg=AOvVaw3CjvN4KAz77uhOCESdI7VQ) because, as enemy aliens in Britain, they are ineligible to participate in secret war work—issue the Frisch-Peierls memorandum. It contradicts the common thinking of the time that many tons of uranium would be needed to make a bomb, requiring delivery by ship. The calculation in the memorandum shows that a bomb might be possible using as little as 1–10 kilograms of pure uranium-235, which would be quite practical for aircraft to carry. (Wikipedia, “[Frisch–Peierls memorandum](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frisch%25E2%2580%2593Peierls_memorandum&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727725754&usg=AOvVaw0oDcLbYMMa-upelSak_1lg)”; Atomic Heritage Foundation, “[Atomic Timeline](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.atomicheritage.org/history/timeline&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727726006&usg=AOvVaw2K5qDiMFGTBleJqM3AGNHk))

March 22 — [Franklin D. Roosevelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franklin_D._Roosevelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727726280&usg=AOvVaw3kcNaSNhlKyLzzQWGaYA52) signs Executive Order 8381, creating the three security levels for the most important documents: Restricted, Confidential, and Secret. (US President, Executive Order No. 8381, “[Defining Certain](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://irp.fas.org/offdocs/eo/eo-8381.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727726571&usg=AOvVaw0dVf1d0J0KzUDoH3MGBJtd) [Vital Military and Naval Installations and Equipment,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://irp.fas.org/offdocs/eo/eo-8381.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727726835&usg=AOvVaw2tWrq9woERlG4Lq44vttCv)” March 22, 1940)

* * *

Spring — Afternoon. Walking down a street in Hinsdale, Illinois, William T. Powers sees five disc-shaped objects in the northern sky. They are traveling together at 100–200 mph and disappear into a cloud. (Clark III 1177)

April 10 — The first meeting of the MAUD Committee in England, established in response to the Frisch-Peierls memorandum to determine if an atomic bomb is feasible, meets in the Royal Society committee room in Burlington House, London. The original members are physicists [George Paget Thomson,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Paget_Thomson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727727297&usg=AOvVaw1BV7xMxsrBx0IcZdVnsef0) [James Chadwick,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Chadwick&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727727497&usg=AOvVaw0lKKesvbovibcoz0cOkBfE) [John](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Cockcroft&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727727712&usg=AOvVaw1-xzxamZoyn21K9tk571C3) [Cockcroft,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Cockcroft&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727727912&usg=AOvVaw0w7x2a8uNioYZT5nvy15_P) [Mark Oliphant,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mark_Oliphant&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727728163&usg=AOvVaw2iGR8nvYTFGZ-oIv0lpJDI) and [Philip Burton Moon](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philip_Burton_Moon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727728555&usg=AOvVaw1guiY0jihrrLXPKxxmn0Zq); physicists [Patrick Blackett,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patrick_Blackett&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727728899&usg=AOvVaw0OR4vp-ubQxDfghzp_V0G9) [Charles Drummond](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Drummond_Ellis&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727729256&usg=AOvVaw2sNYPrJq0n4I5QBA-YKiBa)

[Ellis,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Drummond_Ellis&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727729679&usg=AOvVaw2IHXOpqFMIbdddNw34HEIz) and chemist [Norman Haworth](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Norman_Haworth&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727730027&usg=AOvVaw3F5adf6q3s0t8yxvh3w2q4) are subsequently added, along with a representative of the Director of Scientific Research at the Ministry of Aircraft Production (MAP). (Wikipedia, “[MAUD Committee](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MAUD_Committee&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727730457&usg=AOvVaw1v1JXFHefc-qdyTbKeFBRW)”)

Mid-May — 9:00 a.m. [Lavern P. Zewiske](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/146523030/lavern-paul-zewiske&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727730901&usg=AOvVaw2gFSVh8JkSGu18E3PflT5Y) and his father [Paul](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/146523087/paul-edward-zewiske&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727731163&usg=AOvVaw1KXDQ9FM0SJsq5Z8F7auUd) are checking some recently planted corn on their farm near Fairbank, Iowa. A gray object with multiple hooked “hairs or tentacles” moving around on the bottom passes overhead at 500–1,000 feet. (“[Out of the Past,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter/1984-85_CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter_V5.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727731431&usg=AOvVaw1VRnDMKc22Mf8uoPotOUTk)” CUFOS Associate Newsletter 5, no. 5 (Oct./Nov. 1984): 6)

May 21— President [Franklin D. Roosevelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franklin_D._Roosevelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727731768&usg=AOvVaw3-RgC75K1F3uGAuoDiN67J) authorizes the FBI to conduct electronic surveillance and wiretapping on US spies, saboteurs, or suspicious individuals. (“[Warrantless FBI Electronic Surveillance,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sites.google.com/site/cointelprodocs/warrantless-fbi-electronic-surveillance%23sec2b1&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727732044&usg=AOvVaw3HJzAfYiPNu8s22ODegFmS)” US Senate, Select Committee to Study Governmental Operations with Respect to Intelligence Activities, Final Report, April 23, 1976, pp. 271–351)

Summer (or summer 1941) — Near St. Clair, Pennsylvania, as he is walking along a country road, young Frank Sever hears a loud noise in the nearby woods. He sees something like an “aluminum building” partly concealed in the trees. A short distance from it he sees “six small men milling about or looking for something on the ground.” Thinking they are ghosts, he runs. Later he comes back and confirms there is no building on the spot. (Clark III 265)

August 11 — The RAF Bomber Command issues a report on “Phenomena Connected with Enemy Night Tactics” concerning unidentifiable aircraft observed by bombing crews over the coast of Holland and the Ruhr Valley of Germany. The report suggests the sightings are either due to observer strain or German “experimental apparatus.” (Strange Company 16–17)

1941

1941 — A physicist and his wife are traveling notrh on US Highway 99 north of Bakersfield, California, and pull off to the side to watch a long, slender object of a blazing red, green, and yellow color moving about 8 miles east of them. It is traveling at about 50 mph at an altitude of 200–300 feet and is clearly outlined against the foothills. It seems to be several times longer than a bomber. (“[Recent Sightings,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201957%252001%252000%2520-%2520January.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727732861&usg=AOvVaw2MgJkBIneesatysn0WGJfn)” APRO Bulletin, January 1957, p. 5)

Early spring — 9:00–9:30 p.m. Rev. [William Guy Huffman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/13590056/william-guy-huffman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727733461&usg=AOvVaw3gyAsd8gZviVLrpMRiBwYM) of the Red Star Baptist Church in Cape Girardeau, Missouri, is summoned to an apparent airplane crash one Saturday. When he arrives at the scene, about 15 miles from town, he finds a weird-looking craft “broken and scattered all around,” but smooth and rounded without edges or seams. A cockpit with a chair facing an instrument panel remains intact. Police officers, military men, and plain-clothes individuals are sifting through the wreckage. He also sees three non-human bodies about 4 feet tall with long arms, oversized heads, and large eyes. He says a prayer for them, and afterward sees someone take a photo of an alien propped up by the arms between two plainclothesmen. The following evening, he is given a copy of the photo by a member of his congregation (thought to be [Garland D. Fronabarger](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/15533576/garland-d-fronabarger&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727734023&usg=AOvVaw3plqgGqkNncfAzlNDtQJcq)), but he loans it later to someone who never returns it. Huffman’s wife [Floy](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/27616322/floy-m_-huffman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727734392&usg=AOvVaw3NI6254Pj9qcvZaKDk0fCk) reveals the story to her granddaughter, Charlette Mann, on her deathbed in 1984, who relates the story to ufologist [Leonard Stringfield](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leonard_H._Stringfield&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727734817&usg=AOvVaw0GeJxy8w4yOD4cgr0575ji). (Clark III 343–344; Paul Blake Smith, MO41: The Bombshell before Roswell, W&B Publishers, 2015; Billy Booth, “1941 Cape Girardeau, Missouri Crash,” liveabout.com, February 5, 2019; Kevin Randle, “[Cape Girardeau UFO Crash, 1941,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2019/12/cape-girardeau-ufo-crash-1941.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727735550&usg=AOvVaw020aN5JXrZph-MqoGV12bc)” A Different Perspective, December 5, 2019)

March — The Chain Home radars placed around the English coastline detect a formation of blips moving across the English Channel. RAF fighters are sent to intercept, but their crews see nothing and the blips fade. The radar returns are characterized as radar “angels,” invisible targets in the clear atmosphere. (David Clarke, “The Radar Angels,” Fortean Times 195 (May 2005): 36–37)

March 17 — The Western Defense Command is established as the command formation of the US Army responsible for coordinating the defense of the Pacific Coast and training soldiers prior to their deployment overseas. (Wikipedia, “[Western Defense Command](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Western_Defense_Command&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727736276&usg=AOvVaw1JKM6eqR0TWQqNopfhLSWt)”)

* * *

May — With the help of the American Legion, volunteers are recruited into the Aircraft Warning Service, the civilian arm of the Army’s Ground Observer Corps. On the east coast, the AWS is under the auspices of the Army Air Force’s 1st Interceptor Command based at Mitchel Field near Uniondale, New York. On the west coast, the AWS is under the auspices of the 4th Interceptor Command based in Riverside, California. On both coasts, observation posts, information centers, and filter centers are established. (Wikipedia, “[Aircraft Warning Service](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aircraft_Warning_Service&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727736992&usg=AOvVaw1pxtMEhrZUKgtazpF94ka9)”; Project 1947, “[Aircraft Warning Service (AWS): Freeman Observation Post #52](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/freeman52.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727737365&usg=AOvVaw1AJywu671piDNn65fuP9uI)”)

June 20 — The Army Air Corps becomes the US Army Air Forces to provide the air arm greater autonomy. (Wikipedia, “[United States Army Air Forces](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Army_Air_Forces&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727737903&usg=AOvVaw3WylFAXoBW_zeJOGFz0sGr)”)

June 26 — The first draft of the final report of the MAUD Committee is written by [George Paget Thomson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Paget_Thomson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727738227&usg=AOvVaw1f9hhCG_pywU9cyWjRrFgp) and circulates among committee members. It concludes that an atomic bomb is feasible. [Vannevar Bush](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vannevar_Bush&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727738488&usg=AOvVaw285NWa1InUZy4V_aXKKM07) receives a copy.

Without the help of the MAUD Committee the Manhattan Project would have started months behind. Instead, they are able to begin thinking about how to create a bomb, not whether it is possible. (Wikipedia, “[MAUD](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MAUD_Committee&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727738879&usg=AOvVaw0Uh3dIj24YnAvdOzxDoTr3) [Committee](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MAUD_Committee&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727739084&usg=AOvVaw0Euf1mVsSx7w_IbckpBc3N)”)

June 28 — [Roosevelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franklin_D._Roosevelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727739401&usg=AOvVaw2Kz9ruYolawCtgtmxyah2l) establishes the Office of Scientific Research and Development; [Vannevar Bush](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vannevar_Bush&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727739652&usg=AOvVaw1aWLLCaLSYnPN6bEUrA7rf) is appointed director. It subsumes the National Defense Research Committee, whose Uranium Committee becomes the Uranium Section of the OSRD, soon renamed the S-1 for security reasons. To the S-1 Section, Vannevar Bush adds American physicist [Samuel King Allison](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Samuel_King_Allison&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727739956&usg=AOvVaw06OLCxYKPFPOtxVIL1pMaG)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Samuel_King_Allison&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727740154&usg=AOvVaw2-kYR9SuR5gTd7-9ZjQxbs) Russian-American physicist [Gregory Breit](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gregory_Breit&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727740367&usg=AOvVaw3t-egyJRZbKyOITb3uDk53), American physicist [Edward Condon](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Condon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727740605&usg=AOvVaw3o9qZpu0Nae_dpsn1Re6y4)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Condon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727740782&usg=AOvVaw0oypdCXwDKMHk49iZ1d-DC) physicist [Lloyd P. Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://physicstoday.scitation.org/doi/pdf/10.1063/1.2811130&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727740990&usg=AOvVaw2lHsV_yAg827S0uqIJYuHQ), and [Henry DeWolf Smyth](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henry_DeWolf_Smyth&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727741224&usg=AOvVaw3JI8KN2bj_vIQKZb-DI1id). American physicist [Ross Gunn](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ross_Gunn&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727741417&usg=AOvVaw3FankpNkQ7cExVBnJq71wn) is dropped in line with an NDRC policy not to have Army or Navy personnel in the sections. [Lyman James Briggs](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lyman_James_Briggs&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727741654&usg=AOvVaw1Hi7NNnPxSY1H7NMilqxtx) remains the chairman, with American physicist [George B. Pegram](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_B._Pegram&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727741878&usg=AOvVaw3unpz6T-2lo7kauqBM-jgE) as the vice chairman. (Wikipedia, “[Office of Scientific](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Office_of_Scientific_Research_and_Development&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727742127&usg=AOvVaw3xRr2Q0Q_JTQUwlhPvPGeK) [Research and Development](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Office_of_Scientific_Research_and_Development&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727742347&usg=AOvVaw2Tcwff4KlAsmQEjBcdTAvk)”)

Late June — About 5:30 p.m. Helen Michailoff and her mother are in Odessa, Ukraine, when they see a raspberry-red object slowly moving east and emitting smoke. Thinking it is a bomb, they rush to the basement, but there is no explosion. (“[Out of the Past,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter/1983-84_CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter_V4.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727742674&usg=AOvVaw2IUs1MC3KpPR_eJ_FVOpeu)” CUFOS Associate Newsletter 4, no. 5 (Oct./Nov. 1983): 4)

July 3 — The Northrop N-1M, an experimental “flying wing” aircraft with a 38-foot wingspan, is first flown at Baker Dry Lake in the Mojave Desert, California, by test pilot [Vance Breese](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vance_Breese&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727743064&usg=AOvVaw0_-aKPqnRjZiTFJipRvLEJ) for several hundred yards. He reports that the aircraft can fly no higher than 5 feet. After this is corrected, the N-1M takes another 28 flights through November. (Wikipedia, “[Northrop N-1M](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northrop_N-1M&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727743372&usg=AOvVaw2XYL-ujNfK-GUN8BAYN9Ua)”)

July 11 — [Roosevelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franklin_D._Roosevelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727743675&usg=AOvVaw3NeUS6vAmFsccg_AADn7AJ) establishes the Office of the Coordinator of Information, a forerunner of the Office for Strategic Services, headed by lawyer [William J. Donovan.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_J._Donovan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727743951&usg=AOvVaw2lFFYTbIODTuyMZYxkVdJx) It is tasked with collecting and analyzing national security information. (Wikipedia, “[Office of the Coordinator of Information](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Office_of_the_Coordinator_of_Information&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727744213&usg=AOvVaw2FM9Hz2LWlM5V4wdW1BS9C)”)

September — Night. Seaman Mar Doroba, Anthony Kornilak, and others on the British troopship [SS Pulaski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SS_Czar&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727744529&usg=AOvVaw18iXOf8fXH-29_lSrvkH1U) in the Mozambique Channel see a “strange globe glowing with greenish light, about half the size of the full moon.” They watch it for more than an hour before it disappears. (Strange Company 17; Lore and Deneault, [pp. 130–131](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/mysteriesofskies0000lore/page/130/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727744836&usg=AOvVaw0JniQthXbStwvlISFz64yg))

October 2 — German test pilot [Heini Dittmar](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heini_Dittmar&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727745145&usg=AOvVaw1QKh9kF9DQF8V7TcWJDlJZ) attains an unofficial airspeed record of 623 mph in a rocket-powered Messerschmidt Me 163A at Peenemünde, Germany. (Wikipedia, “[Heini Dittmar](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heini_Dittmar&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727745378&usg=AOvVaw0969z0Rx3g5Uq3cKUXQpNS)”)

Early October — A possible UFO crash/retrieval takes place during preparations for the US Army’s Carolina maneuvers in south central North Carolina (possibly in or around the Uwharrie National Forest). The sketchy story is based on the participation of Pvt. [Guy B. Simeone](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://library.uta.edu/digitalgallery-beta/img/20035245&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727745673&usg=AOvVaw3tds3v1qlpTlp2LvDDZpQa), who relates a few details about a crash and dead “little people” to his family in a letter and phone call. [Walter N. Webb](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/NICAP-Bios/Webb.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727745923&usg=AOvVaw0Jca-o56a1pQ3Krj7axl4B) reports on his investigation of the incident in 1996. (Walter N. Webb, “An Anecdotal Report of a UFO Crash/Retrieval in 1941: Part 1,” IUR 21, no. 4 (Winter 1996): 20–28; Walter N. Webb, “An Anecdotal Report of a UFO Crash/Retrieval in 1941: Part 2,” IUR 22, no. 1 (Spring 1997): 28–32)

October 9 — [Roosevelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franklin_D._Roosevelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727746355&usg=AOvVaw1njMAujd9wkEZu0ZmkfAUF) approves an atomic weapons program after meeting with Office of Scientific Research and Development Director [Vannevar Bush](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vannevar_Bush&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727746594&usg=AOvVaw24nVXI97rwjprq1W7jaTDq) and Vice President [Henry A. Wallace.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henry_A._Wallace&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727746850&usg=AOvVaw2Feje7Z7vPUTbcLmikajNZ) On Bush’s advice, Roosevelt chooses the US Army to run the project rather than the Navy, although the Navy has shown far more interest in the field, and is already conducting research into atomic energy for powering ships. Bush’s negative experiences with the Navy has convinced him that it would not listen to his advice and cannot handle large-scale construction projects. (Cameron Reed, “Manhattan Project Mystery,” Forum on the History of Physics, Spring 2012)

* * *

Early December — Army Lt. Walter Hanson and his wife are stranded in the Georgia countryside when they run out of gas. They see a star-like object that swiftly moves in circles counterclockwise. Suddenly it stops and takes off obliquely. (Strange Company 17–18; Lore and Deneault, [p. 140](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/mysteriesofskies0000lore/page/140/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727747466&usg=AOvVaw1YoWL6amyGiaLSHOFQs-29))

December 8 — Around noon. Red Cross volunteer [Yoshio Taketa](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/116296634/yoshio-taketa&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727747766&usg=AOvVaw0LLJBn7E44K1uTGDDP5CIq) is resting on the lawn of the Kuhio School in Honolulu, Hawaii, with 9 others. The smoke is still rising from the Pearl Harbor attack to the west. One of them notices a round white object at about 20,000 feet overhead. It floats away slowly. (Clark III 501)

December 18 — With the US at war, funding for an atomic bomb is now available in amounts undreamed of the year before. At the S-1 Section meeting, American physicist [Ernest Lawrence](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ernest_Lawrence&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727748113&usg=AOvVaw1kJ9PgEWUG31blbk1LJ_gm) asks for $400,000 for electromagnetic separation, and the section immediately recommends granting it. MIT physicist [Karl Taylor Compton](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karl_Taylor_Compton&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727748356&usg=AOvVaw3z0SgaqG0R3dm6i__h3N8N) is allocated

$340,000 for nuclear reactor research at Columbia and Princeton, and $278,000 at the University of Chicago. Another $500,000 is earmarked for raw materials. His proposed schedule is no less breathtaking: to produce a nuclear chain reaction by July 1942, and an atomic bomb by January 1945. In January 1942, he creates

the Metallurgical Laboratory, centralizing the work at the University of Chicago. (Wikipedia, “[S-1 Executive](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S-1_Executive_Committee&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727748898&usg=AOvVaw3bawH9Yi975H5UksR-5snX) [Committee](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S-1_Executive_Committee&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727749106&usg=AOvVaw1fku16xBgo64EVB6use4YZ)”)

December 22 —Electrical engineer George Bogner stops his car at the corner of St. Agnes Avenue and Pleasant Street in Utica, New York, to watch a round, metallic object speed silently across the sky. He estimates it at 100 feet in diameter and moving at 300 mph. (Strange Company 18; Lore and Deneault, [pp. 140–141](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/mysteriesofskies0000lore/page/140/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727749441&usg=AOvVaw0h_JxXTv4uamCNaux04B3E))

1942

1942 — Naval Intelligence Officer Bernard M. Baruch Jr. develops a submarine reporting network, Communication Instruction for Reporting Enemy Sightings on which CIRVIS is modeled in 1948. (US Naval War College, [Master Script for “Communication Instruction for Reporting Enemy Sightings,”](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.usnwcarchives.org/repositories/2/archival_objects/4101&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727750049&usg=AOvVaw1O4maf-XGrJWxM6JQCTy2r) undated; NICAP, “[Capt. Bernard](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/NICAP-Bios/Baruch.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727750286&usg=AOvVaw3OWiH9CradaMtDrhTxHbwC) [Baruch Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/NICAP-Bios/Baruch.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727750485&usg=AOvVaw3kf0LCpOGlhQ4LnhFFGbuo)”)

1942 — 1:00 a.m. A woman returning home in Prouvy, Nord, France, finds herself face-to-face with three small entities with large round heads and short beards. They have large, luminous yellow eyes and wear tight, one-piece suits with a metallic sheen that leave only their faces exposed. The beings stare at her without moving, so she goes inside to get her husband, but by the time they return the entities have gone. (Center for UFO Studies, [HUMCAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/HUMCAT/HUMCAT_Index_1940-1949.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727750794&usg=AOvVaw3TmRZX9rDcfXG7ubEb7nPw) [Index 1940–1949](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/HUMCAT/HUMCAT_Index_1940-1949.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727751098&usg=AOvVaw3YiSbnoGOW9iKvsW6d06_v)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/HUMCAT/HUMCAT_Index_1940-1949.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727751353&usg=AOvVaw02RexX8aydm07iWdFJnUmN) p. 3; Clark III 265; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1942-france-prouvy.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727751701&usg=AOvVaw2gkZdX_LvaWeSULmrgIt6k)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1942-france-prouvy.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727751896&usg=AOvVaw3tEFm8kyQAaCoBYmw20zVx) September 26, 2007)

February 24–25 — The Battle of Los Angeles takes place, a rumored enemy attack and subsequent anti-aircraft barrage over Los Angeles, California. Air raid sirens sound throughout Los Angeles County on the night of February 24. A total blackout is ordered, and thousands of air raid wardens are summoned to their positions. At 3:16 a.m., the 37th Coast Artillery Brigade begins firing .50 caliber machine guns and 12.8-pound anti-aircraft shells into the air at reported aircraft; more than 1,400 shells are eventually fired. Pilots of the 4th Interceptor Command are alerted, but their aircraft remain grounded. The artillery fire continues sporadically until 4:14 a.m. The “all clear” is sounded and the blackout order lifted at 7:21 a.m. Several buildings and vehicles are damaged by shell fragments, and five civilians die as an indirect result of the anti-aircraft fire. Three are killed in car accidents in the ensuing chaos and two die of heart attacks attributed to the stress of the hour-long action. The incident is front-page news along the Pacific coast and earns some mass media coverage. Within hours of the end of the air raid, Secretary of the Navy [Frank Knox](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Knox&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727752375&usg=AOvVaw2XObi-2LXafKp2wh9p682o) holds a press conference, saying the entire incident was a false alarm due to anxiety and “war nerves.” Knox’s comments are followed by statements from the Army on February 26 that reflect General [George C. Marshall](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Marshall&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727752639&usg=AOvVaw3TRg4CXzyctWFKL2P0-Q98)’s belief that the incident was caused by commercial airplanes used as a psychological warfare campaign to generate panic. Some contemporary press outlets suspect a cover-up. Rep. [Leland M. Ford](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leland_M._Ford&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727752916&usg=AOvVaw3IWAYXAHCU8UC_Fv3vuXLK) (R-Calif.) calls for a congressional investigation, saying, “none of the explanations so far offered removed the episode from the category of ‘complete mystification’ ... this was either a practice raid, or a raid to throw a scare into 2,000,000 people, or a mistaken identity raid, or a raid to lay a political foundation to take away Southern California’s war industries.” The Japanese government, after the war ended, declares that they had flown no airplanes over Los Angeles during the war. In 1983, the US Office of Air Force History attributes the event to a case of “war nerves” triggered by a lost weather balloon and exacerbated by stray flares and shell bursts from adjoining batteries. A number of fake documents about this incident have been circulated by [Timothy S. Cooper](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://majesticdocuments.waskosky.com/about/investigation-team/timothy-s-cooper/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727753246&usg=AOvVaw34KgkgzrWrHTdMgyVRpaB7). (Wikipedia, “[Battle of](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Los_Angeles&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727753454&usg=AOvVaw293izpSS4APawTvWbiE70S) [Los Angeles](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Los_Angeles&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727753662&usg=AOvVaw24vnhFxUXGMTc4whRoKble)”; February 26 — Army Chief of Staff [George C. Marshall](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Marshall&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727758654&usg=AOvVaw3_N521Zm-oIqIGNnBbUVeg) writes [Roosevelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franklin_D._Roosevelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727758966&usg=AOvVaw0sjtxp6-vA-wvpCkMSZDC_) that as many as 15 unknown commercial aircraft, flying at various speeds up to 200 mph and at elevations from 9,000 to 18,000 feet, were responsible for the Battle of Los Angeles. (presidentialufo.com, “General George Marshall Secret Memo to President Roosevelt about the Unidentified Objects over Los Angeles on February 25, 1942”; Good Above, [pp. 17](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/16/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727759633&usg=AOvVaw2Yh6UuXLoK3FZNNQ9MFpQb), [446](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/446/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727759965&usg=AOvVaw2Vd2hqH4PTufX7oHlyVzHZ))

February 26 — Royal Netherlands Navy cruiser [HNLMS Tromp,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HNLMS_Tromp_(1937)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727760429&usg=AOvVaw0jYnGNBKVpUmCYcKaNEyYh) returning to Australia after the Battle of Badung Strait (off Bali in Indonesia), reports a large, aluminum disc speeding above it in the Timor Sea and maneuvering for nearly 4 hours. It departs at an estimated 3,500 mph. (“[Australasia,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1957%252CNov-Dic%252CV%25203%252CN%25206.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727760902&usg=AOvVaw1Mi-afZpOfWwj4B7Aug9vX)” Flying Saucer Review 3, no. 6 (Nov./Dec. 1957): 6)

March 5 — Benjamin Smith, formerly of the Army Air Corps, sees several blinking lights moving slowly over the Middle River adjacent to Essex, Maryland. They circle the river two or three times then disappear. Smith reports the incident to local police, who then inform Naval Intelligence. (Towson (Md.) Union News, March 6, 1942; Jan Aldrich)

March 9 — The Air Service Command becomes a major Army Air Forces unit to support logistical functions. (Wikipedia, “[Air Materiel Command](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Air_Materiel_Command%23Air_Service_Command&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727761842&usg=AOvVaw0vrVrH1qHIENzKc300jjOR)”)

Spring — Rev. Robert H. Moore and six other persons attending the Seabury-Western Theological Seminary in Evanston, Illinois, watch a small, light-gray, rectangular object over the northern part of town for 10 minutes. (Lore and Deneault, [p. 142](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/mysteriesofskies0000lore/page/142/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727762450&usg=AOvVaw2T6SRWppSoJiF0t--II_Q6))

April 1 — The Materiel Division of the Air Service Command assumes responsibility for R&D and procurement and is redesignated as the Air Corps Materiel Command. (Wikipedia, “[Air Materiel Command](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Air_Materiel_Command%23Air_Service_Command&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727762949&usg=AOvVaw0BDUYUXLqZk-lukVoUPGbF)”)

May — 3:00 p.m. Abdon Gonzales Tello, 13, and other boys see a silvery, cigar-shaped object in the sky to the west of Miraflores, Peru. Its ends are cut off at sharp angles, and it takes 20 seconds to proceed to the south and out of sight. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, p. 22)

June — Col. [James C. Marshall](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_C._Marshall&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727763801&usg=AOvVaw3ff1FpjG9AE0cnAsl4oZuY) is selected to head the Manhattan Project. (Wikipedia, “[Manhattan Project](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manhattan_Project&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727764219&usg=AOvVaw060D6tnBcXFaibFTvXAV7J)”)

June 13 — [Roosevelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franklin_D._Roosevelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727764671&usg=AOvVaw34JcNQEcmq6EVU2eUoJUnY) establishes the Office of Strategic Services, a wartime intelligence agency, with Gen. [William J.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_J._Donovan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727765107&usg=AOvVaw2F3BILnk3HiCQH4V8ezXNf) [Donovan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_J._Donovan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727765348&usg=AOvVaw2w33xBcJcHbgUr51hPj3Cq) at its head. (Wikipedia, “[Office of Strategic Services](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Office_of_Strategic_Services&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727765616&usg=AOvVaw0CvHpe38pmYIEK5IH4ph8x)”)

June 19 — [Roosevelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franklin_D._Roosevelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727765891&usg=AOvVaw2eePZ7E9-2NmB7bmWJreK6) abolishes the S-1 Section and replaces it with the S-1 Executive Committee, tasked with the technical and contractual aspects of producing an atomic bomb, while the Army handles engineering, construction, and site selection. American chemist [James B. Conant](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_B._Conant&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727766189&usg=AOvVaw2MjDf0xDtoW8drO8uRYD3r) is appointed as its chairman, and [Lyman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lyman_James_Briggs&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727766504&usg=AOvVaw0KsJgB_I1jr-8Nx25HM5su) [James Briggs](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lyman_James_Briggs&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727766751&usg=AOvVaw3bm-Lxs5mJnDa133Hx_fjv)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lyman_James_Briggs&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727766924&usg=AOvVaw3DSNzRviOrQiwxnRrRrp9Q) [Karl Taylor Compton](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karl_Taylor_Compton&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727767144&usg=AOvVaw18tZmQftemRTAHsMbp4V-R)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karl_Taylor_Compton&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727767311&usg=AOvVaw1_YYi_Z8RsiBhVUQNcvToL) [Ernest Lawrence](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ernest_Lawrence&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727767505&usg=AOvVaw0UdVmC2vN-2A6KBim4zRZR)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ernest_Lawrence&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727767686&usg=AOvVaw1Ss4v_LHgrKhWEX7bIqy9S) and American chemists [Eger V. Murphree](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eger_V._Murphree&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727767883&usg=AOvVaw1GTKjBUsn2z0xOe7U8be82) and [Harold C.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harold_Urey&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727768115&usg=AOvVaw1iLeteVjcFAvmMDpGA4LJU) [Urey](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harold_Urey&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727768324&usg=AOvVaw0rDmFluGNnVpNCg8gEzU9D) as its other members. Roosevelt approves the committee’s recommendation to move to the pilot plant stage and build piles to produce plutonium and electromagnetic, centrifuge, and gaseous diffusion plants to produce uranium-235. (Wikipedia, “[S-1 Executive Committee](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S-1_Executive_Committee&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727768605&usg=AOvVaw0YyYI7IoOv6avyM6MwYagp)”)

June 25 (or March 25) — Midnight. Flight Lt. Roman (Ray) Sabiński of the 301 Polish Bomber Squadron is flying an RAF Wellington bomber after returning from a run on the Ruhr Valley, Germany; he sees a bright copper-colored light the “size of the moon” following the aircraft over the Zuiderzee in Holland. When it gets within 200 yards, the rear gunner shoots at it with all four machine guns. After two minutes, it moves at terrific speed to the port side, and the front gunner starts firing at it. Sabiński takes evasive action, but the object keeps pacing him.

Finally, it moves in front of the bomber, stays there a while, then takes off at fantastic speed. (Strange Company 23–25; Gordon W. Creighton. “[Foo Fighters,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1962%252CMar-Apr%252CV%25208%252CN%25202.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727769112&usg=AOvVaw3gN9lU6de1xe4sXC87JuUV)” Flying Saucer Review 8, no. 2 (March/April 1962): 15; Patrick Gross, “[Pilot Reports](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/zuidersee25mar1942.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727769406&usg=AOvVaw3FhmOqaaytpw0BvhbDdUZs)”)

Late 1942? — According to records released in August 2010, Prime Minister [Winston Churchill](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winston_Churchill&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727769761&usg=AOvVaw3pXvjqs0YS394NxNzsYMIT) supposedly classifies for 50 years an alleged UFO incident because of fears it could create mass panic. The incident allegedly involves an

* * *

RAF reconnaissance plane returning from a mission in Europe. The aircraft is over or near the English coastline when it is allegedly intercepted by a strange metallic object that matches the aircraft’s course and speed for a time before shooting away. The plane’s crew photograph the object, which “hovered noiselessly” near the aircraft before moving off. According to the documents, details of the cover-up emerge when a man writes to the government in 1999 seeking to find out more about the incident. He describes how his grandfather, who served with the RAF, was present when Churchill and Gen. [Dwight Eisenhower](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dwight_D._Eisenhower&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727770262&usg=AOvVaw1JFJKVhJX2ECRAsWMszf8B) discussed how to deal with the encounter. However, the evidence is hearsay and somewhat questionable. (UFOFiles2, [pp. 20–21](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/the-ufo-files-the-inside-story-of-real-life-sightings-david-clarke/page/n39/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727770582&usg=AOvVaw2djii7M6r4CwaBlhZRfATY))

Summer — 5:50 p.m. An RAAF pilot is on flying patrol off the Tasman Peninsula, Tasmania, following reports by fishermen of strange lights on the waters of Bass Strait. A “singular airfoil of glistening bronze color” appears out of a cloudbank. It’s about 150 feet long, 50 feet in diameter, and has a dome on top. It accompanies his plane for a few minutes before departing at “a hell of a pace.” It turns again and dives into the ocean, throwing up a “whirlpool of waves.” (Bill Chalker, “[Australian A.F. UFO Report Files,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201982%252010%252000%2520-%2520Vol%252030%2520No%252010.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727770966&usg=AOvVaw0yqKfSiTN9jNcpPaCiUBJP)” APRO Bulletin 30, no. 10 (October 1982): 6–7)

Late summer — Pvt. Albert Lancashire, 27, is standing guard at Cresswell radar station near Newbiggin-by-the-Sea, Northumberland, England, when he sees a cloud-enshrouded light approaching from the North Sea. As it descends, he is drawn up into it by a beam. Small men grab him and carry him into the craft, where he sees other human figures of normal height, including an apparent captain with dark hair and goggles. He is made to lie down on a couch or table. He has only vague memories of what happens next, but he thinks a medical exam is performed. He wakes up back at his sentry post. (Center for UFO Studies, [HUMCAT Index 1940–1949](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/HUMCAT/HUMCAT_Index_1940-1949.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727771355&usg=AOvVaw3nBKFWAox3ftDL0i3bLdyW)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/HUMCAT/HUMCAT_Index_1940-1949.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727771533&usg=AOvVaw2n5rVUryJoQVYAnMtOZbx9) p. 4; “New Time Lapse Case from England Uncovered,” MUFON UFO Journal 107 (October 1976): 1–18; Clark III 265)

August — Evelyn M. Howell and two other adults see a huge cigar-shaped object hovering near them between Lafayette Township and Newton, New Jersey. It has “two rows of windows” that give off blue, green, white, and red fluorescent lights. They watch it for 10 minutes, after which it silently and slowly takes off. Howell and her husband see a similar object on the drive home to Ogdensburg, New Jersey. (Clark III 1178)

August 5 — Early morning. The Navy destroyer [USS Helm](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Helm_(DD-388)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727771947&usg=AOvVaw0kMQwnWHxVuRNI5JHBTxDZ) is on its way to the Solomon Islands in preparation for the Guadalcanal landings. A radio blackout is in effect. An aircraft approaches, a full alert is sounded, and three cruisers ([Vincennes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Vincennes_(CA-44)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727772196&usg=AOvVaw2GMRqdyQ8YS5wAAmqWYjxU)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Vincennes_(CA-44)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727772369&usg=AOvVaw2x9_eJhcPN_cCF-ilKiLeu) [Quincy](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Quincy_(CA-39)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727772572&usg=AOvVaw3EU-Mfcz2RE3M0z5u2CwrS)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Quincy_(CA-39)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727772740&usg=AOvVaw2CvxQR2tAoiOG9-pFuU4ER) [Astoria](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Astoria_(CA-34)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727772952&usg=AOvVaw1pvFi3EB5pId5G5FXUPyyR)) and seven other ships open fire on it. The object is not hit and proceeds to circle around the fleet. An anonymous sailor on security detail on the Helm watches it through binoculars and sees it as 90 feet in diameter, oval, with a round dome on top. The ships continue to fire on the UFO, which attains extremely high speeds. Commanding Officer [Chester Edward Carroll](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://abbot.us/captains/carroll.shtml&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727773228&usg=AOvVaw0jGoCqXkNhTE-ECf2n1831) later hears that the aircraft is neither German nor Japanese. (Strange Company 27–28)

August 12 — Day. Sgt. Stephen J. Brickner of the 1st Marine Division on Tulagi in the Solomon Islands is cleaning his rifle when an air-raid warning is sounded. He dives into his foxhole looking to the sky. He hears a roaring sound unlike that of an aircraft. Soon he sees a formation of more than 150 silvery objects, in straight lines of 10 or 12. The objects seem to wobble slightly. They are flying faster than Japanese planes and are soon out of sight. (Good Above, [p. 18](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/18/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727773653&usg=AOvVaw1Nszp_kqcl1DjCyVqDmwF3); Strange Company 28–29)

August 13 — The Manhattan Engineering District, with Brig. Gen. [James C. Marshall](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_C._Marshall&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727774030&usg=AOvVaw3pPxpfBmNpE1Jh5HS63XCt) as district engineer, is established by Chief of the US Army Corps of Engineers Maj. Gen. [Eugene Reybold](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eugene_Reybold&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727774281&usg=AOvVaw0tTiN5IPaUUDxE6sBMOxUU)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eugene_Reybold&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727774475&usg=AOvVaw1owRUCCnM4nIePXPAbLPXO) (Wikipedia, “[Manhattan Project](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manhattan_Project&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727774704&usg=AOvVaw30UOKKv2EWx9jJk4egAivH)”)

August 29 — Army Air Corps control tower operator Pvt. Michael Solomon sees two small reddish objects descend near the AAC Advanced Flying School at Columbus, Mississippi, then speed away. He later contacts government officials and officers from the school in attempting to confirm his sighting. (Clark III 1177; Jan Aldrich)

September 23 — Col. [Leslie Groves](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leslie_Groves&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727775102&usg=AOvVaw3mCQ__8n4sglUZAVNfMnER) is promoted to brigadier general and becomes director of the Manhattan Project. The Military Policy Committee, consisting of [Vannevar Bush](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vannevar_Bush&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727775373&usg=AOvVaw0WTAKcRPogVc7sfIUOUgCA) (with [James B. Conant](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_B._Conant&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727775609&usg=AOvVaw3fb4oJKDJgCzhSYxSer4hI) as his alternative), Maj. Gen.

[Wilhelm D. Styer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wilhelm_D._Styer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727775881&usg=AOvVaw0-034zgBiMUxIBp9oqrzxv)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wilhelm_D._Styer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727776055&usg=AOvVaw3kNNSLeBsN_ryipBllavgb) and Rear Adm. [William R. Purnell,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_R._Purnell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727776291&usg=AOvVaw0rghLSeQYl1QyyCRhpLznr) is created to oversee the project. (Wikipedia, “[Manhattan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manhattan_Project&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727776559&usg=AOvVaw2-U1-UyNM1-viRATciiHQV) [Project](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manhattan_Project&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727776767&usg=AOvVaw1R0mSh7qcyvHcnE3Vpl9gP)”)

September 25 — RAF Bomber Command’s Operational Research Section releases a report titled “A Note on Pyrotechnic Activity over Germany.” An unnamed Flak Liaison Officer has coordinated the reports from No. 3 and No. 5 Groups and determines there are two types of phenomena: a ball of fire that is shot from the ground and drips multicolored fragments, and multi-part flares. Another type involves “small coloured balls” that climb to 7,000 feet. (Strange Company 32)

September 29 — US Under Secretary of War [Robert P. Patterson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_P._Patterson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727777252&usg=AOvVaw22E1X123hiMkKy4gDGYpoX) authorizes the Corps of Engineers to acquire 56,000 acres in Tennessee for Site X, which will become the Oak Ridge, Tennessee, laboratory and production site. (Wikipedia, “[Oak Ridge, Tennessee](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oak_Ridge%252C_Tennessee%23Manhattan_Project&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727777715&usg=AOvVaw2IIst2t7OEpm_zwXkEnP80)”)

* * *

October 7 — Land at Oak Ridge, Tennessee, is acquired by eminent domain for Clinton Engineer Works. (Wikipedia, “[Clinton Engineer Works](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinton_Engineer_Works&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727778068&usg=AOvVaw2oJHDec1OArpoU-RfpCBpC)”)

October 19 — [Leslie Groves](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leslie_Groves&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727778327&usg=AOvVaw1Ax907xIRZ_RBD-ksnY6cZ) approves [J. Robert Oppenheimer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Robert_Oppenheimer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727778565&usg=AOvVaw0cXnsffKCNcLMaUSOwAuAe) to coordinate the scientific research of the Manhattan Project at the Site Y laboratory in Los Alamos, New Mexico. (Wikipedia, “[Manhattan Project](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manhattan_Project&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727778802&usg=AOvVaw0iTnKRQPqMfZ5JHg0OxY_-)”)

November 15 — Teams under physicists [Herbert L. Anderson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Herbert_L._Anderson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727779121&usg=AOvVaw0PN416JYxIlxjK1tMK-4PA) and [Walter Zinn](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walter_Zinn&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727779354&usg=AOvVaw3FnW2pnlnESxAa3HJD2Of7) have constructed 16 experimental nuclear reactors under the Stagg Field stands at the University of Chicago. (Wikipedia, “[Metallurgical Laboratory](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metallurgical_Laboratory%23Chicago_Pile-1&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727779624&usg=AOvVaw2uyUK0e8n9uthJoUQXVmPD)”)

November 25 — The Los Alamos site in New Mexico is acquired for Project Y. (Wikipedia, “[Project Y](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Project_Y&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727779887&usg=AOvVaw26ZyUbP2DWPG8nsZdDHnRj)”)

November 28 — 10:40–10:45 p.m. Capt. Lever and the No. 61 Squadron crew of an RAF Lancaster are returning from a bombing raid on Turin, Italy, when about 10–15 miles southwest of the city they see an object 200–300 feet long traveling southeast at a speed of 500 mph. It has four pairs of red lights spaced along its body and is flying on a level course. Five minutes later, as the Lancaster approaches the Alps at 14,000 feet, the crew sees the object again traveling southwest up a valley. It disappears when the red lights go out. (UFOFiles2, [pp. 25–26](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/the-ufo-files-the-inside-story-of-real-life-sightings-david-clarke/page/n47/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727780240&usg=AOvVaw22Qm2Sp0P33RBT8vTfuAyT); Strange Company 34–35; Good Need, [pp. 18–19](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/18/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727780506&usg=AOvVaw14coLggAk_hRWf78cqeFbE)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/18/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727780697&usg=AOvVaw15SkmgVKfPci4wLWhijTPH) [32](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/32/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727780911&usg=AOvVaw2HOUtByHviZUxwQEJjY3Qv))

December — A Technical Data Laboratory is established at Wright Field near Dayton, Ohio, as part of the Army Materiel Command. Its operations include the evaluation of foreign aircraft and related equipment. (US Air Force, “National Air and Space Intelligence Center Heritage,” July 31, 2015)

December — 8:00 p.m. RAAF Lt. [Bruce Clyde Lumsden](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://stalag45.rssing.com/chan-58806349/article11-live.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727781431&usg=AOvVaw2S-OINZENYTBqU4Je3dOCn) is flying a Hawker Hurricane heading for the French coast. About 7,000 feet over the mouth of the River Somme, France, he observes two orange lights climbing, one slightly above the other. He completes a full turn, putting the lights behind him on the port side. They now appear brighter and larger. When they reach his altitude, they stop climbing and stay at his altitude. He makes another full turn, but the objects stay with him. Lumsden dives to 4,000 feet, but the lights match his maneuvers. He increases his speed to 260 mph and gradually leaves them behind. His squadron mates do not believe him, but the next night another squadron member has a similar encounter with a green light. (Strange Company 36)

December 2 — Chicago Pile-1, the first nuclear reactor, goes critical at the University of Chicago under the leadership and design of [Enrico Fermi](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enrico_Fermi&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727781962&usg=AOvVaw2aPdkKX2LUuyqdD_xIJNZX)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enrico_Fermi&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727782173&usg=AOvVaw1r5xxXYJTRJNE1ScIMC9WN) achieving a self-sustaining reaction just one month after construction was started. (Wikipedia, “[Chicago Pile-1](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chicago_Pile-1&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727782536&usg=AOvVaw3xDDNHv-BRlQ9otAK0BMEZ)”)

December 27 — The Northrop N-9M, a prototype flying wing bomber with a wingspan of 60 feet, makes its first test flight at Jack Northrop Field \[now Hawthorne (Calif.) Municipal Airport\] with pilot [John Wescott Myers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Wescott_Myers&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727783012&usg=AOvVaw2fwGsBxX9o6dO-ce-0IF7L).

Through May, 44 more flights are made, nearly all terminated by mechanical failures. (Wikipedia, “[Northrop N-](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northrop_N-9M&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727783508&usg=AOvVaw0vT1KRMM9QOKpDmq0sQOej) [9M](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northrop_N-9M&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727783847&usg=AOvVaw3YJE-DDMB82bgxi4XHHYBK)”)

1943

January 15 — During a US bombing raid over Cherbourg, Manche, France, several crews see “large numbers of projectiles resembling ‘schools of flying fish,’ about a foot long and similar to incendiary bombs, coming up from a direction of the town.” (Strange Company 38)

January 16 — [Leslie Groves](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leslie_Groves&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727784803&usg=AOvVaw33vrq4YzAuq5ONf8fmGeoT) approves development of the Hanford site in Washington State for plutonium production. (Wikipedia, “[Hanford Site](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hanford_Site&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727785201&usg=AOvVaw0c4KCfzI0Tas60mny-jnlq)”)

February 9 — Land for a plutonium production complex is acquired at Hanford, Washington. (Wikipedia, “[Hanford Site](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hanford_Site&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727785721&usg=AOvVaw1x7jppoc43-xFptVjvJKwf)”) February 18 — Construction begins for Y-12, a massive electromagnetic separation plant for enriching uranium at Oak
