Ridge, Tennessee. (Wikipedia, “[Y-12 National Security Complex](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Y-12_National_Security_Complex&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727786378&usg=AOvVaw3SUn7ZIqdR31MPGKRPol6O)”)

April 1 — Los Alamos Laboratory is established in New Mexico and begins operations. (Wikipedia, “[Project Y](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Project_Y%23Construction&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727786929&usg=AOvVaw0RBZZlN8BtXnqYUw4YSVZC)”)

April 5 — 9:50 a.m. Flight instructor Gerry A. Casey and a student pilot in a Boeing-Stearman Model 75 watch a radiant- orange, elliptical disc dive at their aircraft near Long Beach, California. There is no propellor and it has a rounded hump above and below. It hovers alongside with a slight wobble, then accelerates, turns from orange to white, and climbs out of sight in 2 seconds. (Project 1947, “[UFO Reports, 1943](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1943a.htm%23casey&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727787422&usg=AOvVaw25l0wSSNO544Svt0RnKwN9)”; Gerry A. Casey, “UFO: The Time for the Telling Has Come,” Tacoma (Wash.) Western Flyer, July 7, 1989, via [UFO Newsclipping Service](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/UFO%2520Newsclipping%2520Service/UFO%2520Newsclipping%2520Service%2520-%25201989%252008%2520-%2520no%2520241.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727787896&usg=AOvVaw1En24oj6UJkDBt8HyyPUcY) 241 (August 1989), p. 3; Patrick Gross, “[Observation at Long Beach, 1943](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/longbeach1943.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727788170&usg=AOvVaw0xMIPV5pQvoyE0evR6f_BV)”)

April 9 — 5:00 p.m. Kazimierz Bzowski and other resistance fighters are monitoring a fire in the Warsaw Ghetto in Poland. They notice a flying object approaching them at about 60 mph. Through binoculars it appears to be a sphere colored with tangled strips of both raspberry and blue-green colors. Bzowski estimates it is at an elevation

* * *

of 200 feet and is about 25 feet in diameter. They observe German and Lithuanian snipers on Bonifraterska street shooting at it, although the bullets seem to pass through it. The object alters course and heads toward Old Town, then stops dead and shoots away at great speed. (Poland 13)

May — Capt. Gordon W. Cammell is flying an RAF Lancaster bomber back over the English Channel when he and his entire crew see a “huge orange ball on or near the sea” 7,000–8,000 feet below them. Over the next 10 minutes, they watch it project a bright and constant light. (Strange Company 41)

May 19 — The Northrop N-9M flying wing bomber prototype crashes 12 miles west of Muroc Army Air Base \[now Edwards AFB\], California, killing its pilot [Max Constant](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/175865483/max-constant&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727789016&usg=AOvVaw220Onziz53ZGBkgrFS04CL)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/175865483/max-constant&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727789311&usg=AOvVaw18_CWJXhn5cUCdAbfhQNTA) (Wikipedia, “[Northrop N-9M](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northrop_N-9M&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727789672&usg=AOvVaw3XaDfVNJNnOYdynza3lzj-)”)

May 26 — Late night. Capt. Ray Smith and copilot Sgt. Gordon N. Cockcroft are flying at 18,000 feet in a Halifax bomber on a run near Essen, Germany, when they see a silvery-gold cylindrical object, larger than their aircraft, on the port side. It has several evenly spaced portholes. It is hovering at a 45° angle. After 20–30 seconds it climbs away at high speed. (“[Correspondence,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter/1982-83_CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter_V3.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727790248&usg=AOvVaw3gMzXqijml7W7IrD5rFtbC)” CUFOS Associate Newsletter 3, no. 5 (Oct./Nov. 1982): 4–6; Strange Company 40; Project 1947, “[UFO Reports, 1943](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1943a.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727790768&usg=AOvVaw2AulUcSsxC-YpEWH4sE4qL)”; John Hanson and Dawn Holloway, Haunted Skies: The Encyclopaedia of British UFOs: Volume 1, 1940–1959, Fortean Words, 2010)

June — The Army Air Force’s Air Tactical Service Command meets with Lockheed Aircraft Corporation in Burbank, California, to ask them to develop a jet fighter. (Wikipedia, “[Skunk Works](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skunk_Works&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727791171&usg=AOvVaw2TzkpzsHk-WaQV_EAH1ond)”)

June 2 — Construction begins on K-25, the gaseous diffusion plant at Oak Ridge, Tennessee. (Wikipedia, “[K-25](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K-25&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727791431&usg=AOvVaw3BmB_QDbZMh6OVFiv_KoqR)”)

July — Lockheed Engineer [Kelly Johnson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kelly_Johnson_(engineer)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727791960&usg=AOvVaw0wNdKwbXJKMg21aBHa7nz7) and other associate engineers hand-deliver a proposal for the XP-80 jet fighter to the Air Tactical Service Command. Two days later, the go-ahead is given to Lockheed to start development, and the Skunk Works is born in Burbank, California, with Johnson at the helm. The name supposedly comes from the L’il Abner comic strip, which has a place called “Skonk Works” where a strong beverage is brewed from skunks, old shoes, and other ingredients. (Wikipedia, “[Skunk Works](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skunk_Works&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727792595&usg=AOvVaw2A3EopOvAXyOJ64hgn3-ro)”)

July 18 — A French prisoner in a German labor camp near Gdynia, Poland, is walking to work along the Baltic Sea when he sees a flat, metallic object embedded in the sand. A human figure is standing next to it, apparently trying to dig it up. When he passes by, the figure, apparently an Asian woman with long blonde hair and dressed in a tight- fitting overall, turns in his direction. The witness assumes she is the famous German aviator [Hanna Reitsch](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hanna_Reitsch&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727793157&usg=AOvVaw3SJGyMpH-NsDJKLSymsgPk) and helps her dig the experimental aircraft out of the sand. The object is 20 feet in diameter and looks like two metallic saucers put together. The woman touches the witness’s chest with her hand and points to the sky. She touches her belt and a door in the object opens. She crawls inside, the door closes, and the object ascends and departs at a tremendous speed. (Jean Sider, Ultra Top-Secret: Ces OVNIs qui font peur, Axis Mundi, 1990)

September — During an air battle between the Germans and Russians, a member of the Spanish Blue Division fighting with the Germans near Pushkin outside Leningrad \[now Saint Petersburg\], Russia, notices a disc-shaped object above the planes. It appears to be observing the battle, then disappears at a fantastic speed. ([Antonio Ribera](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antonio_Ribera&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727793968&usg=AOvVaw10eA3FadfUz-nxnyYTAV6O), Platillos Volantes en Iberoamerica y España, Santiago Pomaire, 1968, pp. 411–412)

September — [Ray Palmer,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raymond_A._Palmer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727794542&usg=AOvVaw0xUPVA3oHuqretAw4DxyMD) editor of Amazing Stories magazine, receives a letter from a reader named [Richard S. Shaver,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Sharpe_Shaver&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727794900&usg=AOvVaw1v600SCrK33YHceNlmlBZZ) who claims to have discovered “Mantong,” a proto-language that is the source of all earthly languages. In Mantong, each sound has a hidden meaning, and by applying this formula to any word in any language, one can decode the secret meaning. Palmer applies the formula to several words and realizes Shaver might be onto something. (Wikipedia, “[Richard Sharpe Shaver](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Sharpe_Shaver&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727795264&usg=AOvVaw1BIT6gVE-LVMk9sM1M82sb)”; Clark III 609; Walter Kafton-Minkel, Subterranean Worlds, Loompanics, 1989, [p. 136](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/subterraneanworldswalterkaftonminkel100000yearsofdragonsdwarfsthedeadlostracesufosfrominsidetheearth/page/n139/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727795606&usg=AOvVaw3ujFoAtlX80qkhJKNY4zkW))

September 6 — 9:50 a.m. During an aerial fight over Stuttgart, Germany, the crews of two aircraft of the 384th Bomb Group, commanded by Capt. Raymond P. Ketelson, observe two round objects “resembling silvery discs” floating downward through the aircraft formation. One hits the wing of a B-17 bomber, setting it on fire. The bomber does not return from the mission. (Strange Company 43)

Autumn — A Polish bomber unit based in England claims that silver-blue balls of fire appeared near their wing on six missions when they raided the Nazi V-1 weapons plant in Peenemünde, Germany. RAF intelligence officer [Michael Bentine](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Bentine&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727796112&usg=AOvVaw0QrBylmBNEdpwGghIee48R) debriefs them later and asks, “But what did it do to you?” They reply, “Nothing.” Bentine points out, “Well it was not a very effective weapon, was it?” (UFOFiles2, [p. 20](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/the-ufo-files-the-inside-story-of-real-life-sightings-david-clarke/page/n39/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727796408&usg=AOvVaw3SLbVISzFm50JwpVfkXkXv); David Clarke and Andy Roberts, “[The](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.uk-ufo.org/condign/histfoo2.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727796626&usg=AOvVaw1w6tq5Ch-Y6ZGFvnxH9W0y) [Foo Fighters: The RAF Experience,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.uk-ufo.org/condign/histfoo2.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727796824&usg=AOvVaw2Pm1_K6QoKp0T25Zs96sNe)” The Real UFO Project, January 2003)

October — 9:00 p.m. [Wilberta Finley](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/87087670/wilberta-murrie-finley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727797106&usg=AOvVaw2IxTEcf4y7_kuA0cQOaK-e), an air spotter for the Civil Air Patrol, notices a “huge dark aerial object approaching” her home in Santa Barbara, California, facing the Goleta Valley. Moving low and soundlessly, it

* * *

barely skims over a nearby hill. From its front a beam of light shoots down, and at intervals it swings from side to side as if scanning the hills and homes below. (“Report from the Readers,” Fate 11, no. 11 (November 1958): 116–118; Clark III 1178)

October 10 — Construction begins for the first reactor at the Hanford site in Washington. (US Department of Energy, Office of History and Heritage Resources, “[Hanford Becomes Operational,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.osti.gov/opennet/manhattan-project-history/Events/1942-1944_pu/hanford_operational.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727797672&usg=AOvVaw2Orw4xBGB1kFUXxzVbUuDb)” August 7, 2013)

October 14 — Night. A group of B-17s from the 384th Bombardment Group are returning from a mission over Germany when they see a cluster of silver-colored discs in the path of their formation and closing with the bombers. The crews talk back and forth, discussing and confirming the sight before them. They describe the objects as “about one inch thick and three inches in diameter…gliding down slowly in a very uniform cluster.” One of the bombers goes directly through the cluster “with absolutely no effect on engines or plane surface,” even though one is heard to strike the tail assembly. A mass of black debris about 3-4 feet long is also observed. (Clark III 502; Martin Caidin, Black Thursday, Dell, 1962, pp. 188–190; Frank Edwards, Flying Saucers—Here and Now! Lyle Stuart, 1967, [pp. 77–78](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/flyingsaucersher00edwa/page/76/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727798167&usg=AOvVaw0sILQDWpi5eClnuz_zBMYr))

October or November — 11:00 p.m. 2Lt [Thomas J. Duzynski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/608840/thomas-j-duzynski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727798439&usg=AOvVaw1JwjNdpvB_iBRoT-xw_H6k) is stationed at Camp Ibis on the west side of the Dead Mountains Wilderness northwest of Needles, California. Taking a stroll outside his tent, he notices an elliptical- shaped object traveling to the south at high speed parallel to the ground between himself and the mountains. It banks sharply, almost on edge, and gains altitude, disappearing in seconds. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, pp. 22–23)

November — [Ray Palmer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raymond_A._Palmer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727798855&usg=AOvVaw3Lpk3RJ6uNElxEcJqhm2Oj) publishes an article, “An Ancient Language?” on the language of Mantong in the January 1944 issue of Amazing Stories and enters into correspondence with [Richard S. Shaver](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Sharpe_Shaver&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727799180&usg=AOvVaw1t-w4WUk0SYpCEEA2ZrJ2i), who responds with a 10,000- word document titled “A Warning to Future Man.” Shaver writes of advanced prehistoric races who built underground cities before abandoning Earth for another planet because of damaging radiation from the Sun.

Those ancients also abandoned some of their own offspring here, a minority of whom remained noble and human “Teros,” while most degenerate over time into a population of mentally impaired sadists known as “Deros”— short for “detrimental robots.” Shaver’s robots are not mechanical constructs, but robot-like due to their savage behavior. These Deros still live in the cave cities, according to Shaver, kidnapping surface-dwelling people by the thousands for meat or torture. Deros can be blamed for nearly all misfortunes, from minor “accidental” injuries or illnesses to airplane crashes and catastrophic natural disasters. Though generally confined to their caves, the Deros sometimes travel in spaceships or rockets, and have dealings with equally evil extraterrestrials. Shaver claims to possess first-hand knowledge of the Deros and their caves, insisting he had been their prisoner for several years. The article stirs considerable reader interest, and the pages of Amazing Stories are soon filled with stories and articles about the “Shaver mystery.” (Wikipedia, “[Richard Sharpe Shaver](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Sharpe_Shaver&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727800492&usg=AOvVaw321wrVyWcUh1CVna0XA9uO)”; \[Richard\] S. Shaver, \[Letter\], “[An Ancient Language?](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ia801602.us.archive.org/31/items/Amazing_Stories_v18n01_1944-01_cape1736/Amazing_Stories_v18n01_1944-01_cape1736.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727800987&usg=AOvVaw130lSm4tJ6-DbFANvjPXhK)” Amazing Stories 18, no. 1 (January 1944): 206–207; \[Ray Palmer,\] “[Mantong:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ia802506.us.archive.org/0/items/Amazing_Stories_v19n01_1945-03_Ziff-Daviscape1736/Amazing%2520Stories%2520v19n01%25201945-03%2520%2528Ziff-Davis%2529%2528cape1736%2529.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727801765&usg=AOvVaw3zchxFPpwPMc8Wr8vyq5Of) [The Language of Lemuria,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ia802506.us.archive.org/0/items/Amazing_Stories_v19n01_1945-03_Ziff-Daviscape1736/Amazing%2520Stories%2520v19n01%25201945-03%2520%2528Ziff-Davis%2529%2528cape1736%2529.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727802301&usg=AOvVaw00BhDCF9mRU37G0Srnb2B-)” Amazing Stories 19, no. 1 (March 1945): 71, 206; Walter Kafton-Minkel, Subterranean Worlds, Loompanics, 1989, [pp. 136–137](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/subterraneanworldswalterkaftonminkel100000yearsofdragonsdwarfsthedeadlostracesufosfrominsidetheearth/page/n139/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727802784&usg=AOvVaw2iZmugoKqFXOLj-sFACx0F); Clark III 872; Richard Toronto, War over Lemuria: Richard Shaver, Ray Palmer, and the Strangest Chapter of 1940s Science Fiction, McFarland, 2013)

November 4 — The X-10 Graphite Reactor at Oak Ridge, Tennessee, goes critical. The Y-12 plant is separating uranium- 235 from natural uranium, which is 99.3% uranium-238, by using calutrons to perform electromagnetic isotope separation. (Wikipedia, “[X-10 Graphite Reactor](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/X-10_Graphite_Reactor&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727803194&usg=AOvVaw1FN3jAHbr_CsB5LHWoSwOM)”)

December? — Matt P. Dillingham is on evening duty adjacent to Mullinix Field \[now Bonriki International Airport\] on Tarawa Atoll in the Pacific Ocean. He begins receiving radar plots showing a north-south track to the west moving at 750 mph. It disappears, but two other targets on the same trajectory appear, moving at the same speed. The same targets are repeated for several nights following. (“[Out of the Past,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter/1983-84_CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter_V4.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727803631&usg=AOvVaw2pr8jTRNYwzuPw-UdFiAz-)” CUFOS Associate Newsletter 4, no. 6 (Dec. 1983/Jan. 1984): 6)

December 2 — Night. Some 105 German Junkers Ju 888 bombers attack the port of Bari, Italy, a key supply center for Allied forces. 28 Allied ships are sunk, including the US Liberty ship [SS John Harvey](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SS_John_Harvey&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727804000&usg=AOvVaw26no6MfHTr8dMgEkEszrbB)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SS_John_Harvey&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727804174&usg=AOvVaw3q9dUTRSVT1jFUFjOJ12Ss) which is carrying mustard gas intended for retaliation in case German forces use chemical warfare. Liquid sulfur mustard from the bombs spills into waters already contaminated by oil from the other damaged vessels. The many sailors who abandoned their ships into the water become covered with the oily mixture. The wounded are pulled from the water and sent to medical facilities whose personnel are unaware of the mustard gas. Medical staff focus on personnel with blast or fire injuries. Within a day, the first symptoms of mustard poisoning appear in 628 patients and medical staff, including blindness and chemical burns. That puzzling development is further complicated by the arrival of hundreds of Italian civilians also seeking treatment, who have been poisoned by a cloud of sulfur mustard vapor that blows over the city when some of John Harvey’s cargo exploded. As the medical crisis worsens, little

* * *

information is available about what is causing the symptoms, because US military command want to keep the presence of chemical munitions secret from the Germans. By the end of the month, 83 of the 628 hospitalized military victims have died. The number of civilian casualties, thought to have been even greater, cannot be accurately gauged since most have left the city to seek shelter with relatives. (Wikipedia, “[Air raid on Bari](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Air_raid_on_Bari&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727804694&usg=AOvVaw3Cy1umHX8uFgECAc9uxaGI)”)

December 11 — US bombers conduct a daylight raid on Emden, Germany, and observe an unknown object about the size of a Thunderbolt aircraft over the target area. It passes below the bombers in a straight line and at terrific speed, leaving a vapor trail that persists. (Strange Company 51–52)

December 14 — Night. British 255 Night Fighter Squadron leader [Patrick Hardy Vesey Wells](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://samilitaryhistory.org/vol095as.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727805102&usg=AOvVaw3nyundfXTzoNQEkjaHK_gd) is flying his Bristol Beaufighter on a patrol mission around Naples, Italy, when he and his navigator notice a small bright light behind them. It stays on their tail, moving from side to side. After 1–2 minutes it goes off in another direction. (Strange Company 52)

Winter — Day. While on a bombing mission over central Germany, Sgt. [Louis Kiss](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/17898179/louis-kiss&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727805466&usg=AOvVaw29fwqnLfxhWmI_hn5vya2n), a tail gunner on the Phyllis Marie, a B-17 of the 390th Bombardment Group, sees an odd-looking sphere approach the plane from behind and below. It seems to be the size of a basketball and shimmery gold. The object hovers just above one wing, then passes over the top to the other wing where it hovers again. Soon it moves to the rear and gets caught in the B-17’s backwash and disappears. (“[First Official Foo-Fighter Records Discovered,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/Just%2520Cause%2520(CAUS)/Just%2520Cause%2520-%2520New%2520Series/Just%2520Cause%2520-%25201992%252006%2520%2520-%2520No%252032%2520-%2520New%2520Series.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727805860&usg=AOvVaw2rgmASfjWZfCCnI_OcxLJW)” Just Cause, no. 32 (June 1992): 4–5)

Winter — 3:00 p.m. Harry G. Barnes, a member of the Washington, D.C., Metropolitan Police Department stationed at No. 1 Precinct, sees three oval-shaped objects in V-formation speeding eastward across the northeast sky. The objects have pulsating, greenish-red exhausts that occasionally flare and curl around them. (UFOEv, [p. 64](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D76%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727806246&usg=AOvVaw2p3KqKa5ryuerbYWvNPMYY); Clark III 1177)

1944

1944 — During a mission to bomb oil fields in Romania, a Russian Tupolev Tu-2 piloted by Maj. Bajenov and Boris Surikov are flying over southwest Ukraine at an altitude of 3 miles when a large, elliptical object approaches them. The bomber starts shaking, the oil pressure rises, and Surikov feels a strong electrostatic charge. Even after the object passes, the bomber’s wings are covered with glowing discharges. (Good Need, [pp. 21–22](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/20/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727806809&usg=AOvVaw3qb-yUtGCvwtPQ5ZgEM50w))

1944 — [George Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727807187&usg=AOvVaw12dZwHVznuIQyM4GzWgTD0) and his followers move closer to Palomar Mountain, California, along the Road to the Stars where his long-time associate Alice K. Wells sets up a roadside café, Palomar Gardens. According to coworker Charlotte Blodget, “Each member of the group shared in the manual labor that went into this effort, and since heavy restrictions were still in effect regarding materials \[in the war’s aftermath\], anything available had to serve.” Adamski builds a “small observatory” to house his 15-inch telescope to study the skies. (“[Palomar](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.the-adamski-case.nl/his-life/mount-palomar/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727807695&usg=AOvVaw2hyB-DBHAID4drUd2OpLmm) [Mountain, 1940–1960: From Obscurity to World Fame,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.the-adamski-case.nl/his-life/mount-palomar/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727808075&usg=AOvVaw2clH8GiZAbo3MZfiWuc7hg)” The Adamski Case, September 22, 2019; George M. Eberhart, “Palomar Gardens Café,” IUR 30, no. 3 (May 2006): 9)

January 15 — The Materiel Command becomes the AAF Materiel Command. (Wikipedia, “[Air Materiel Command](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Air_Materiel_Command%23Air_Service_Command&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727808822&usg=AOvVaw3tFCYvyoa48jQp7SLH0Z1L)”)

February — 2:30 a.m. An Australian Beaufort bomber is flying at 4,500 feet over Bass Strait, Australia, when it is joined by an object like a “dark shadow” with a flickering flame coming out of its rear. It appears only 100–150 feet away and stays with the bomber for 18–20 minutes, during which time its radio and direction-finding instruments fail. It shoots away at 700 mph. (Bill Chalker, “[Australian A.F. UFO Report Files,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201982%252010%252000%2520-%2520Vol%252030%2520No%252010.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727809270&usg=AOvVaw2dzKmxzjOYUG1tSFgWPkG7)” APRO Bulletin 30, no. 10 (October 1982): 7)

February 9 — RAF No. 5 Group issues a report of its investigation on “Rocket Phenomena,” concluding that the air crews are seeing either rockets fired from aircraft, parachute rockets, or high-explosive projectiles at maximum altitudes of 18,000 feet. Reports of objects changing their course are either defects causing erratic flight or light flak tracers reaching their highest point and descending. (Strange Company 57–58)

February 20 — 2:30 a.m. Two guards of the 3rd Marine Division on Guadalcanal in the Solomon Islands see what they first assume are the headlight beams of a truck coming from a swamp about three-quarters of a mile from their position. It moves laterally about 50 feet and they see it is a circular light about 50–60 feet long and 20 feet high. It then rises into the air about 25 feet and heads in the direction of the guards at about 45 mph. It makes a 45° turn and passes about 100 feet above the trees of a coconut grove. Several days later, a 200-foot cut in the reeds is discovered in the approximate spot where the light originated. (Alvin G. McNish, “[Letter,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter/1984-85_CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter_V5.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727809822&usg=AOvVaw0c7uZo6eg670AxnyN27PJ2)” CUFOS Associate Newsletter 5, no. 5 (Oct./Nov. 1984): 2)

February 23 — Brig. Gen. [George C. McDonald](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/106278/major-general-george-c-mcdonald/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727810210&usg=AOvVaw3WByKHxP10plVVQxQmvDi4) is appointed assistant chief of staff for intelligence for the newly created US Strategic Air Forces in Europe. “Many months preceding the collapse of Germany, McDonald recognized the

* * *

imperative need for the creation of a new type of intelligence activity to investigate and exploit air intelligence objectives in Germany and liberated countries. This unique system was established and consisted of a great number of highly qualified technical and scientific personnel to exploit all the worldwide aeronautical research developments of Germany. This resulted in the collection of priority intelligence information of value in the prosecution of the war against Japan; technical and non-technical information of immediate operational significance and value; as well as a substantial portion of important documents and personnel of the German Air Ministry that enabled the US Army Air Forces to undertake long-range research with respect to many valuable- phases of air doctrine, research, employment, organization, procedure, and plans of the German air force.” Among the personalities involved in the operation are some who will become involved in UFO investigations in the future: Col. [John A. O’Mara,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8773069/john-a-o_mara&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727810725&usg=AOvVaw1QZnsQXKnEqqFvTasAPjEg) Col. [Howard H. McCoy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/colonel-howard-mccoy-and-mj-12.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727811040&usg=AOvVaw0CiYj70s6FxvpPqixQP0k-)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/colonel-howard-mccoy-and-mj-12.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727811248&usg=AOvVaw0fzwXs6bKDFKUXaMZQCrsh) Col. [Harold E. Watson,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/105276/brigadier-general-harold-e-watson/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727811486&usg=AOvVaw1ybwNbTPBa4oDUAkzukiq7) and Col. [Malcolm D. Seashore](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49311334/malcolm-d-seashore&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727811734&usg=AOvVaw0pR6XIl4owAo5pCp_k4pQ4). (Wikipedia, “[United States Strategic Air Forces in Europe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Strategic_Air_Forces_in_Europe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727811957&usg=AOvVaw2vYR8whUupZYLMT938IbEI)”)

February 24 —Night. Southwest of Saint-Quentin, Aisne, France, three silver objects are seen by an RAF bomber returning from a mission over Schweinfurt, Germany. They resemble Zeppelins but move independently of the wind. (Strange Company 60)

March — An Army Air Force pilot flying a B-17 sees a fast-moving, glowing green object light up the cockpit and speed out of sight over the horizon at Carlsbad, New Mexico. (UFOEv, [p. 19](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D31%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727812453&usg=AOvVaw1HqY9cYYGMG9OlyHxChhc2))

March 1 — The first prototype H.IX V1, an unpowered glider with fixed tricycle landing gear, is tested in Germany, but there is an accident when the pilot attempts to land without first retracting an instrument-carrying pole extending from the aircraft. The design is taken from the [Horten brothers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Horten_brothers&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727812953&usg=AOvVaw3C2ZVhllJphtipIPg15kqI) and given to Gothaer Waggonfabrik. (Wikipedia, “[Horten Ho 229](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Horten_Ho_229&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727813199&usg=AOvVaw0JVpV-ipBQgvPqrT5a2gqQ)”)

Spring (or 1945) — Two grammar school teachers are driving in the mountains near Auberry, California, when their car stalls and they see a cigar-shaped object with lighted portholes along the side hovering in a nearby ravine. They watch it for several minutes until it begins moving slowly out of the ravine, ascends, and shoots away to the west at a tremendous speed. The car engine remains stalled for a while, then starts by itself. (“[Past Sightings Come to](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201968%252001%252000%2520-%2520January-February.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727813625&usg=AOvVaw2vzahoFpWNUeRftNo2JX06) [Light,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201968%252001%252000%2520-%2520January-February.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727813915&usg=AOvVaw0g9uk6e385YB4SOSTIDWGI)” APRO Bulletin, Jan./Feb. 1968, p. 5)

April — Late afternoon. Near the Eastern front in western Slovakia, a man is standing on a hill near his home when he sees a dark round object moving at high speed to his right for less than one minute. It moves at a steady speed and is followed by another object about 20 seconds later. As many as 6 others appear, and five are visible at one time, each beginning as a pinpoint of light, growing bigger, then decreasing back to a pinpoint. The display lasts for about 5 minutes. (“[Correspondence,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter/1982-83_CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter_V3.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727814321&usg=AOvVaw2a5RI9WIejDfdUjjZwbm7f)” CUFOS Associate Newsletter 3, no. 5 (Oct./Nov. 1982): 2)

April 5 — The Y-12 plant at Oak Ridge has sent 200 grams of enriched uranium to Los Alamos. Italian-American physicist [Emilio Segrè](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emilio_Segr%25C3%25A8&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727814681&usg=AOvVaw1qjfPqb299UuSU7Y1hR1Oe) receives the first sample and within 10 days discovers that the spontaneous fission rate is too high for use in a gun-type fission weapon (because of pu-240 isotope present as an impurity in the pu-239). (Atomic Heritage Foundation, “[Atomic Timeline](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.atomicheritage.org/history/timeline&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727815015&usg=AOvVaw3_FHQeQ1bmA-EtU6-1tnZZ)”)

April 26 — Night. RAF pilot Arthur Horton of the 622 Squadron is returning from a bombing mission to Essen, Germany, when he is followed by four orange balls of light with “short stubby wings” and emitting sparks, two on each side of the aircraft. He takes evasive action with his Lancaster, but the objects follow all his maneuvers for 10 minutes. When they reach the coast of Holland, they seem to “burn themselves out.” (Strange Company 64–65; UFOFiles2, [pp. 16, 18](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/the-ufo-files-the-inside-story-of-real-life-sightings-david-clarke/page/n31/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727815399&usg=AOvVaw2gFzlEPaQ_ssBvcL_cwIVS))

May 29 — The Aircraft Warning Service is deactivated. (Wikipedia, “[Aircraft Warning Service](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aircraft_Warning_Service&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727815755&usg=AOvVaw0HQupJbbZAyN9ZkEOX06b8)”)

June — 12:30 p.m. [David A. K. Morris,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/180896335/david-aubrey_kaye-morris&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727816166&usg=AOvVaw1gXHYzS7GvAwraDjE2FBr_) a fitter with Service Unit 10 of the Royal New Zealand Air Force, takes a swim with a friend at Torokina Beach, Bougainville Island, Papua New Guinea. They see “a huge, dark-gray, seemingly metallic, bulbous mass hanging out of a large cumulus cloud.” It moves silently, its outline fading into the cloud and out of sight. It resembles a Zeppelin or the [R101](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/R101&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727816436&usg=AOvVaw0kuxq5teGJl66-9cpaFf9K) airship, only bigger. (D. Morris, “[RNZAF Camp UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufocusnz.org.nz/2020/07/22/rnzaf-camp-ufo-sighting-of-1944/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727816691&usg=AOvVaw2CHLFx9HJiCZlkBGGLdDHc) [Sighting of 1944,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufocusnz.org.nz/2020/07/22/rnzaf-camp-ufo-sighting-of-1944/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727816911&usg=AOvVaw00DiLcivfaY-Rwg9ZjFYw_)” Ufocus NZ, July 22, 2020)

June — Edward W. Ludwig is commanding a small, Coast Guard–manned cargo vessel near Palmyra Atoll. While looking for a lost Navy patrol plane, he observes a bright aerial sphere that alternately moves and stops for 30 minutes. (“True Mystic Experiences,” Fate 3, no. 8 (December 1950): 82–87)

June 10? — The Liberty ship [SS George E. Badger](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SS_George_E._Badger&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727817302&usg=AOvVaw3Siq8oGpu-gNA9d30UaInQ) is off Omaha Beach in Normandy, France, when gunner [Edward](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/23391167/edward-breckel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727817547&usg=AOvVaw2JJ1Z3c3_8tnNTGTKtwgt3) [Breckel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/23391167/edward-breckel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727817757&usg=AOvVaw1M8iyBR80lERr9AfWGqUQ9) sees a “dark ellipsoidal object” on the horizon about 5 miles away. “Blunted on each end like a sausage,” the silent craft remains in view for 3 minutes, moving slowly at about 15 feet above the surface of the water. (Strange Company 67; “[The Case for the ‘Sea-Saucer,’](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/Orbit/ORBIT%2520Volume%2520I%25201954-1955R.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727818058&usg=AOvVaw0xZGruOVMccP0OYCghqfmK)” CRIFO Orbit 1, no. 10 (January 7, 1955): 5)

* * *

Early July — 10:30 a.m. During Allied operations in the area around Loreto, Castelfidardo, and Osimo, in Ancona province, Italy, Antoni Szachnowsky, of the 2nd Polish Artillery Regiment, notices an egg-shaped, glistening, metallic, motionless object. The Polish Army anti-aircraft gun fires on it, then the German batteries join in.

Eventually both sides stop, and the object remains motionless for a minute. Then it tilts at a 45° angle, moves rapidly upward, and disappears. (“1944: An Italian Foo-Fighter?” UFO Sightings Italia, no. 2, March 2002)

July 4 — [Oppenheimer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Robert_Oppenheimer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727818696&usg=AOvVaw0zAjbcRbQP6tkRyLog8JNF) reveals [Segrè](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emilio_Segr%25C3%25A8&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727818925&usg=AOvVaw0jYPqbxYrZrXvGo9G3ijk7)’s final measurements to the Los Alamos staff, and the development of the gun-type plutonium weapon “Thin Man” is abandoned. Designing a workable implosion design (Fat Man) becomes the top priority of the laboratory, and design of the uranium gun-type weapon (Little Boy) continues. (Atomic Heritage Foundation, “[Atomic Timeline](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.atomicheritage.org/history/timeline&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727819398&usg=AOvVaw1I-jyTWSZTADvUsVMAo3qP)”)

July 6 — German test pilot [Heini Dittmar](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heini_Dittmar&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727819682&usg=AOvVaw0aINqMFe9GbqX7UxlGMYS0) attains an unofficial airspeed record of 702 mph in a rocket-powered Messerschmidt Me 163B at Lagerlechfeld, Bavaria, Germany. (Wikipedia, “[Heini Dittmar](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heini_Dittmar&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727819927&usg=AOvVaw36LV1bnIOICrncCgwQlQ5U)”)

July 9 — Afternoon. After a successful air strike by the US 449th Bombardment Group against the Concordia-Vega refinery at Ploești, Romania, witness Grigore Zmeuranu sees a round, yellowish object flying from the north at a speed about 3-4 times that of an aircraft. It leaves a short vapor trail, moves over the bombed area, and returns silently in the same direction. (Hobana and Weverbergh 226–227; Strange Company 71)

July 17 — The Air Service Command and the AAF Materiel Command are placed under AAF Materiel and Services. (Wikipedia, “[Air Materiel Command](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Air_Materiel_Command%23Air_Service_Command&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727820396&usg=AOvVaw21v_4XAjKw0XiinXJAfX-X)”)

Late July — Evening. Jaakku Kivistö is serving in the Finnish Army as a noncommissioned medical officer stationed on a farm near Impilahti, Karelia \[now Russia\], by Lake Ladoga. He notices a large object next to the corn-drying building on a steep hillside that he at first takes for a military truck. As he walks closer, he sees it is reddish in color, moving slowly about 150–230 feet in the air, 100 feet long, and has a row of black windows. It moves off quickly in the direction of the lake and vanishes. (“[A Close Encounter from the Year 1944,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Norway/Nordic%2520UFO%2520Newsletter%2520(English%2520language)/Nordic%2520UFO%2520Newsletter%2520-%25201985%2520No%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727820814&usg=AOvVaw0XoZgJ51fZnlcjPs6PAZ6T)” Nordic UFO Newsletter, 1985, no. 1, pp. 3–5)

Summer — 5:00 p.m. François Panes watches a cigar-shaped object at an altitude of about 5,000 feet above the Kamensko Forest north of Blovice, Czechoslovakia \[now Czech Republic\], glittering brightly with no wings, no rudder, and no propeller. It is about 150 feet in diameter and 300–400 feet long. The object is lit up from underneath. It slowly descends, after which it rises up again and vanishes into the blue sky after 10–15 minutes. (Hobana and Weverbergh 215–216)

Summer — Fred Wieland and some friends are riding their bicycles on a footpath adjacent to the Grand Central Parkway in Queens, New York City. As they climb a hill, they look up and see a cigar-shaped object “broadside” to them. It is of smooth metallic construction with no windows or openings. They race to the top of the hill for a better look, but by then the object has completely disappeared. (Clark III 1178)

Summer — Mid-day. Franceen Andron is at Camp McCain, southeast of Grenada, Mississippi, when she sees a large, fat, cigar-shaped object that changes from dull black to gray to “fog blue.” It is joined by three smaller discs that appear below it after emerging from a cloud. The large object disappears first, followed by the discs, which race away in different directions. (NICAP case file)

Summer — Day. [Asa Howard Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/3288411/asa-howard&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727821485&usg=AOvVaw3O4ThTbACWgO7fJpfTHdt2) is outside the barracks at RAF Molesworth in Cambridgeshire, England, when he and other airmen see a pencil-shaped, metallic object moving faster than a jet about a mile away. While watching it for about 2 minutes, they see it pass behind a small cloud before it disappears. (NICAP case file)

August — Night. Officer George Todt of the 38th Regiment, Second Infantry Division, is between Saint-Lô and Vire, Normandy, France, when he sees a cherry-red light one-fifth the size of the moon moving silently west at 120 mph towards Omaha Beach. It stops over the American lines and hovers for 14 minutes. It expands and contracts regularly every few seconds. Col. [Francis Henry Boos](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://valor.militarytimes.com/hero/117371&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727821841&usg=AOvVaw0VjYOUACKOxArKL21-c2NE) and another officer also observe it. (Strange Company 78– 79)

August 11 — Shortly after midnight. Capt. [Alvah M. Reida](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/195591754/alvah-michael-reida&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727822200&usg=AOvVaw3VhVhYZd9pF4h7vMc4JMwa) is piloting a B-29 bomber based at Kharagpur, India, on a bombing mission over Palembang, Sumatra, Indonesia, when his right gunner and copilot notice a sphere “probably five or six feet in diameter, of a very bright and intense red or orange in color” that constantly throbs, at about 12,500 feet, pacing them about 1,500 feet off the starboard wing. It keeps up with the B-29, then flying at 210 mph. Reida tries to shake it off his plane, but it stays in the same relative position until, after 8 minutes, it makes an abrupt 90° turn and accelerates rapidly, disappearing in the overcast. (UFOEv, [p. 23](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D35%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727822572&usg=AOvVaw0q_nWKXTxtaiFfIK2cG4-3); Strange Company 71–75; Good Above, [p. 19](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/18/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727822859&usg=AOvVaw2nVS15qwlYA__0KKnStiTK))

August 11 — Night. RAF Warrant Officer Ronald R. Claridge is over France aboard a No. 7 Squadron Lancaster bomber returning from a bombing run on La Pallice, La Rochelle, Charente-Maritime, France, when his radar screen goes blank. Another crewman shouts to look at a vast disc-shaped object with a long row of lights on their starboard

* * *

side. They watch it for 3 minutes, then it shoots away in a flash of light. Later he draws a watercolor painting to show how the UFO dwarfed the bomber. (UFOFiles2, [pp. 26–27](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/the-ufo-files-the-inside-story-of-real-life-sightings-david-clarke/page/n47/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727823346&usg=AOvVaw1IjbMqQW6vweFrAcBbSYv9))

Mid-August — 11:00 a.m. During the Warsaw Uprising in Poland, Zenon Sergisz notices a German bomber passing by, as well as three bright points of light that descend as the bomber moves away. The lights are flattened spheres that move low behind some buildings then rise up at an angle and disappear. (Poland 14–15)

August 17 — The Allied command creates the Combined Intelligence Objectives Subcommittee (CIOS), charged in part with investigating the strange balls of fire. (Strange Company 79)

Late August — Sgt. Ness and another man of the mine-laying platoon of the 175th Infantry Regiment, 29th Infantry Division, see a large rectangular object “like a railroad boxcar” with no apparent source of propulsion move steadily at about 90 mph over the front lines near Brest, Brittany, France, and out to sea. At one point the object passes in front of the moon, briefly obscuring it from view. (Lore and Deneault, [pp. 120–121](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/mysteriesofskies0000lore/page/120/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727823916&usg=AOvVaw0nCTWCBOEq5pDXnYM0_vS7))

Late August — 4:20 p.m. A nurse, Mrs. E. M. Church, on her way to a tram station in Christchurch, New Zealand, sees an object like an “upturned saucer” resting on the ground near the road. It seems to be 20 feet across and 9 feet high. Two beings, not quite 4 feet tall, are inside, visible through a rectangular window. A third stands motionless, just outside an open door. All three seem to be looking toward the lights of a nearby fairground. The nurse cannot decide if their skin color is green or they are dressed in green, but all are encased in a transparent oblong box. The head takes up half of their bodies and there are no apparent legs or arms. She inadvertently makes a noise, and the outside figure notices her. Its helmet flips over automatically, and it drifts inside the object, which rises up and disappears in the clouds. (Center for UFO Studies, [HUMCAT Index 1940–1949](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/HUMCAT/HUMCAT_Index_1940-1949.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727824250&usg=AOvVaw3lu7TJTiu-6SDLGMbg1Io1), p. 12; Clark III 265)

August 31 — The Army Air Forces Air Technical Service Command is formed as the result of the merging of the Materiel and Air Service Commands. (Wikipedia, “[Air Materiel Command](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Air_Materiel_Command%23Air_Service_Command&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727824543&usg=AOvVaw3Hf7szJts9vVQxZdzrZUVf)”)

September — Dusk. Three Oak Ridge workers (a man named Nelson, A. C. Butler, and Albert Profitt) are driving 2 miles southeast of Oliver Springs, Tennessee, when a strange object appears about 50 feet ahead of them at the level of their windshield. It is glossy white in color and about 30 feet long and 4 feet wide. Nelson eases the car up to the object, but it withdraws; when he stops, it also stops. Soon the light rises high in the air and disappears over Black Oak Ridge. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, pp, 23–24)

September — 9:00 p.m. Canadian Army Lance Cpl. Carson Yorke is just outside Antwerp, Belgium, during a German bombardment. He steps out of his vehicle and sees a glowing globe traveling at about 30 mph and 40 feet altitude from the front lines toward the city (in the same course that the German V-2s are following). It seems to be 3–4 feet in diameter and looks “as though it was cloudy glass with a light inside.” It disappears from view, then is followed by another, then five others in succession. (Jerome Clark and Lucius Farish, “[The Mysterious ‘Foo](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/sagafoo.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727825076&usg=AOvVaw0CcCagKFXCaFFU6GPABXSq) [Fighters’ of WW II,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/sagafoo.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727825287&usg=AOvVaw07O7oHYVSGPvHXSCmqnFmS)” Saga UFO Report, Spring 1975)

September 2 — Two chemists are killed, and [Arnold Kramish](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arnold_Kramish&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727825648&usg=AOvVaw3hFxOPGQm9mJlot__1OdtC) almost killed, after being sprayed with highly corrosive hydrofluoric acid while attempting to unclog a uranium enrichment device that is part of the pilot thermal diffusion plant at the Philadelphia Navy Yard. (Wikipedia, “[Arnold Kramish](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arnold_Kramish%23Manhattan_Project&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727826013&usg=AOvVaw16SGNfS062Dr_sMYQeoKab)”)

September 6 — The Combined Intelligence Objectives Subcommittee holds its first meeting in London, England. Present are Air Commodore K. C. Buss (Air Ministry), Gen. [George C. McDonald](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/106278/major-general-george-c-mcdonald/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727826326&usg=AOvVaw2lzAQoTtqd6WjX7uqMX3pr) (AAF Director of Intelligence), Lt.

Col. [Lewis F. Powell Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lewis_F._Powell_Jr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727826684&usg=AOvVaw0OO6mDmQBonpQy8QMMBGuP), Col. [Howard McCoy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/colonel-howard-mccoy-and-mj-12.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727826916&usg=AOvVaw2sX6MMBzbgils8oZE_GruU) (chief of the Air Technical Section), [Howard P. Robertson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Howard_P._Robertson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727827152&usg=AOvVaw1jWKg3skBf5CmsyXSJNurW) (CalTech physicist), and Cmdr. [Ian Fleming](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ian_Fleming&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727827376&usg=AOvVaw28le_e76cMjpk_XPW_ToZQ) (Admiralty). (Strange Company 80)

October — Late night. Members of a family who live in an isolated area on the outskirts of Rochester, Pennsylvania, are awakened by a loud noise and flash of light. The father goes to the door, where he sees a 4.5-foot-tall figure dressed in a brown robe. Fifteen feet to its left are five other figures dressed in luminous brown metallic suits.

Their heads seem large, with only a slit for a mouth. The arms are long, with long thin fingers. Three of them enter the house and the father accompanies them to a landed craft nearby. He remembers nothing else when he wakes up in the morning. A round, burned circle 20 feet from the house and 25 feet in diameter is found the next day. (Clark III 265–266)

October — Nellie Carlin and another woman are about to drive to work in St. Paul, Minnesota, when they see what seems to be an airplane about to crash. It abruptly stops 20 feet above their heads, revealing itself to be a brown, bullet- shaped object with a flat end “like frosted glass with a bright light behind it.” It makes a crackling noise, turns right, and ascends at great speed. (Clark III 1178)

Late October — 9:30 p.m. 1Lt. J. B. Douglas Jr. and other soldiers of the 489th Armored Field Artillery near Weert, Netherlands, watch a bright silvery object through field glasses moving silently from northwest to southwest through an arc of 90° in about 30–45 minutes. (UFOEv, [pp. 30](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D43%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727828023&usg=AOvVaw0Bi0k_QFSWYRiI-3Hh9MOs), [129](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D141%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727828257&usg=AOvVaw2wXaJiztVZTDQR5PWVgLIz))

* * *

October 28 — Physicist [David T. Griggs](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_T._Griggs&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727828591&usg=AOvVaw3gUJODkJeLvxP8CtluUG4e)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_T._Griggs&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727828837&usg=AOvVaw0Aay5I1RDn82d85cEL-CDn) a civilian adviser on radar to the War Department, is asked by Gen. [Henry H.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henry_H._Arnold&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727829055&usg=AOvVaw0UrzsHZ5L6NOLetGw7drCY) [“Hap” Arnold](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henry_H._Arnold&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727829253&usg=AOvVaw2YIpml7qpsnNXOX5Q-HbKY) to look into incidents of unusual aerial phenomena in Europe and interview pilots. He later moves his investigation to the Pacific Theater. His report to Arnold at the end of the war has never been located. He was interviewed by [James E. McDonald](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_E._McDonald&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727829554&usg=AOvVaw0dfyN-P502HKxg13-HeBWK) on April 10, 1969. (Michael D. Swords, “David Griggs and the Foo Fighters,” IUR 31, no. 1 (January 2007): 17–19)

October 30 — Late night. RAF Flight Engineer Maurice Juberley of the 640 Squadron is returning from a bombing mission over Köln, Germany. His Halifax III is flying at 19,000 feet above the clouds when the rear gunner reports a ball of orange fire closing in on them. He orders an evasive maneuver and loses the light. (Strange Company 86)

Early November — Night. Lieut. Col. [Oris B. Johnson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/106584/major-general-oris-b-johnson/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727830333&usg=AOvVaw2Cewn_XkH04pvXdy2X7P2F)’s 422d Night Fighter Squadron, equipped with P-61 Black Widow fighters, reports seeing 15–20 mystery objects every night over Germany, either alone or in formations of four.

Johnson says he could accept that the reports are rocket planes or night fighter jets. (Strange Company 87)

November 3 — The Japanese Army launches the first of some 9,300 Fu-Go bomb-bearing fire balloons intended to land in North America to instill fear and terror. About 300 are found or seen in America. It is likely that more of them land in unpopulated areas. On November 4, a US Navy patrol craft discovers one of the first Fu-Go balloons floating off San Pedro, Los Angeles, California. National and state agencies are placed on heightened alert status when balloons are found in Wyoming and Montana before the end of the month. (Wikipedia, “[Fu-Go balloon](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fu-Go_balloon_bomb&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727831110&usg=AOvVaw27lqWITSDQJ21xJHn9Yn90) [bomb](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fu-Go_balloon_bomb&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727831468&usg=AOvVaw1HtLff4C4hsvyyzES4Bi89)”; Franklin Matthias, “[Japanese Balloon Bombs Fu-Go,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.atomicheritage.org/history/japanese-balloon-bombs-fu-go&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727831846&usg=AOvVaw3ZjFIvnaDCzxQe-RpaDVlD)” Atomic Heritage Foundation, August 10, 2016)

November 4 — Night. RAF Lancaster bombers over Solingen, Germany, report what they call “scarecrow” dummy airplanes that explode with a sheet of flame and dense black smoke. (“[German Dummy Planes Explode Amid Our](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1944/11/06/84004866.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727832339&usg=AOvVaw0WDvpY4X5X0a9RoTK08hna) [Own,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1944/11/06/84004866.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727832722&usg=AOvVaw2Kiei-aqpUxI5xHpfHuccJ)” New York Times, November 6, 1944, p. 3)

November 12 — 9:30 p.m. A radio station in Santiago, Chile, broadcasts a version of The War of the Worlds in Spanish in which Martians land in Puente Alto, causing a panic and the death by heart attack of at least one person in Valparaíso. (John Gosling, Waging the War of the Worlds: A History of the 1938 Radio Broadcast and Resulting Panic, Including the Original Script, McFarland, 2009, pp. 99–102)

November 16 — 11:55 p.m. Lt. J. L. Besmond, officer of the day on the [USS Gilliam,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Gilliam_(APA-57)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727833655&usg=AOvVaw0hlg1FbByrYkxwiyqeswFd) enroute from Oro Bay, Papua New Guinea, to Leyte Gulf, Philippines, observes an unusual object at a distance of 21 miles. Fire Control Officer P. Kendall Bruce describes it as a bright green globe that rises from behind the ship and moves in a “perfect parabola at great speed, finally disappearing behind the horizon to the north.” (NICAP, “[UFO Observed from USS](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/441116phillipines_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727834137&usg=AOvVaw0-K7RJUQ8RTkoKIhTCspSE) [Gilliam](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/441116phillipines_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727834490&usg=AOvVaw2zdZft7PK1RboUYLQnuAJ8)”)

November 24 — Capt. [William D. Leet](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/139829263/william-dean-leet&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727834987&usg=AOvVaw1jXOoEUaq_YdFSHKINh3ja)’s B-17 crew (part of the 2nd Bombardment Group, 5th Wing of the Fifteenth Air Force) is returning from bombing a target at Klagenfurt, Austria. While flying over northeastern Italy near Trieste, Leet notices a blinding light and feels an intense heat. It goes away quickly, but seconds later he sees a “round amber light” sitting off the left wingtip of the B-17. It is bright and perfectly circular. Leet orders the gunners not to shoot at it. Sgt. Harris, the upper gunner, thinks it is 10 feet in diameter and 150–300 feet away. The object stays with them over the Adriatic Sea for 50 minutes, until it “just turned off” like a light bulb. (Strange Company 90–93)

November 29 — 3:00 p.m. [Reginald Herbert Mortimer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/104455565/reginald-herbert-mortimer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727835409&usg=AOvVaw3WIbb5O5h3ohCs_1WSfttp) and his daughter Frances are on the Bruce Peninsula between Lake Huron and Georgian Bay, Ontario, when they hear a hissing sound behind them and see 9 disc-shaped objects pass overhead at approximately 2,000 feet. Moving three abreast in a square configuration, they are lost to sight over the lake. (Clark III 1179)

November 29 — Night. A Bristol Beaufighter crew (pilot Lieut. Edward A. Schlueter and radar observer Lieut. Donald J. Meiers of the 415th Night Fighter Squadron, and intelligence officer Capt. [Fred B. Ringwald](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/135104859/fred-bertrand-ringwald&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727835856&usg=AOvVaw2A_JbEoPVFj8uzSfsWy0ce) as observer) is on a bombing mission and flying above the Rhine River north of Strasbourg, Bas-Rhin, France. They see “eight to 10 bright orange lights off the left wing…flying through the air at high speed.” Neither the airborne radar nor ground control registers anything nearby. Schlueter and Meiers also see red lights on November 26 above Mannheim, Germany. (Zoe Crasney, “[What Were the Mysterious ‘Foo Fighters’ Sighted by WWII Night Flyers?](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.smithsonianmag.com/air-space-magazine/what-were-mysterious-foo-fighters-sighted-ww2-night-flyers-180959847/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727836191&usg=AOvVaw3VNcTD7HnOHmVUDufQc2Ir)” Smithsonian Air and Space Magazine, August 2016; Strange Company 93–95)

November 30? — As the [USS Gilliam](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Gilliam_(APA-57)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727836581&usg=AOvVaw2SplHtPG_PRMLbIvtil6y7) is transporting troops from Leyte Gulf to Lingayen Gulf, Luzon, Philippines, Lieut.

JG Kendall Bruce, fire control officer on the ship, observes a bright green, globe-shaped object rising out of the nearby headlands and disappears to the north, It is too slow for a missile. \[Same event as November 16?\] (NICAP, “[UFO Observed from USS Gilliam](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/441116phillipines_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727836889&usg=AOvVaw2YSxgI0NrlNcb5bPne8GzZ)”; Strange Company 95–96)

December 13 — SHAEF in Paris, France, issues a press release identifying the fireballs as a “new German weapon” and that the Ninth Air Force has reported seeing “many silver balls floating in the air above enemy territory.” An

* * *

Army Air Force spokesman says on December 20 that the silver balls have “no detectable effects” on Allied planes. He does not know whether or not they are metallic. (Strange Company 96, 101)

December 14–28 — Numerous balls of light are reported by the Night Fighter Squadrons during bombing raids over Germany. Pilot and operations officer [Charlie Horne](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/53881946/charles-lucius-horne&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727837572&usg=AOvVaw07VfD-winkPlcRyW_9uAhD) of the 415th Night Fighter Squadron suggests calling the objects “foo fighters,” a name gleaned from the men’s favorite comic strip, “Smokey Stover” by cartoonist [Bill](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bill_Holman_(cartoonist)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727837873&usg=AOvVaw1xKDCU3f24NH9MyonNcMTL) [Holman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bill_Holman_(cartoonist)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727838107&usg=AOvVaw1jh7LvVwgVGvosrH41Ask8)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bill_Holman_(cartoonist)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727838288&usg=AOvVaw1N_-SMmmx3j7yUKlpJcweI) The comic follows the escapades of a madcap fire fighter who calls his fire truck the “Foomobile.” Smokey Stover often states, “where there’s foo, there’s fire.” (“[More Foo-Fighter Records Released,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/Just%2520Cause%2520(CAUS)/Just%2520Cause%2520-%2520New%2520Series/Just%2520Cause%2520-%25201992%252009%2520%2520-%2520No%252033%2520-%2520New%2520Series.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727838579&usg=AOvVaw2mD-W5_PRXDMjtcQGZxiKE)” Just Cause, new ser., no. 33 (September 1992): 2–6; Strange Company 96–111; Swords 3–5; “[The Foo Fighters of World War](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.saturdaynightuforia.com/html/articles/articlehtml/foofightersofworldwariipartone.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727838978&usg=AOvVaw0yYwg96cbug7bNwrsBDm6Q) [II, Part One,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.saturdaynightuforia.com/html/articles/articlehtml/foofightersofworldwariipartone.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727839220&usg=AOvVaw1mEpnRNehY-hOMcxG5pRzS)” Saturday Night UFOria; Clas Svahn, “The Origin of the Expression ‘Foo Fighter,’” IUR 25, no. 3 (Fall 2000): 18; Don Berliner, with Marie Galbreath and Antonio Hunneeus, UFO Briefing Document: The Best Available Evidence, Dell, 2000, [pp. 47–49](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufobriefingdocum0000berl/page/46/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727839563&usg=AOvVaw0VWeQVBGef1BiLAjscNWmk); Barry Greenwood, “[Foo Fighter Archive Donated to UHR,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.greenwoodufoarchive.com/uhr/uhr17.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727839776&usg=AOvVaw1cHmq5XpXYJT37Kco4pqWm)” UFO Historical Revue, no. 17 (December 2015): 2–8)

December 23 — Night. Navy Lt. [George Arents III](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/184270993/george-arents&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727840126&usg=AOvVaw2itSyxUXBCoIobnFPVe86i) and copilot Lt. Elon Forster are flying a military DC-3 at 9,000 feet between Blackstone and Richmond, Virginia, when they notice a cigar-shaped object hovering below them at about 4,000 feet. It appears to be 200 feet long and has two horizontal rows of blue-lighted windows and a flaming exhaust coming out of its tail. (Jan Aldrich)

Late December through February 1945 — Radar operators at Naval Air Station Pasco, Washington, report unusual blips that appear out of nowhere and proceed from northwest to southeast. A Grumman F6F Hellcat fighter is scrambled on at least two occasions with orders to shoot down anything that appears to be hostile, but nothing is seen. In another incident, Lt. JG Clarence R. Clem accompanies Lt. Commander Richard Brown and Ensign C. T. Neal to a waiting aircraft and Brown takes off in pursuit of a ball of fire that quickly leaves him behind as it speeds off to the northwest and is lost to radar. On another occasion, naval officer R. W. Hendershot, flying an SNJ aircraft, is asked by ground radar to make contact with two high-altitude blips flying at the speed of a single- engine Piper Cub. Though he can see nothing, he is convinced the blips are real. (Strange Company 142; Nukes 43–44; Project 1947, “[UFOs over Hanford: Cdr. R. W. Hendershot,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/reports/1945_hanford_report.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727840647&usg=AOvVaw3MhP_JOtnmpK59WqygPnro)” June 22, 2014; Robert L. Hastings, “[Reports](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ufohastings.com/index.php/articles/reports-confirm-ufo-activity-at-the-hanford-nuclear-weapons-plant-during-world-war-ii&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727840938&usg=AOvVaw2zbhZhXtgbJ33hZSbSscz4) [Confirm UFO Activity at the Hanford Nuclear Weapons Plant during World War II,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ufohastings.com/index.php/articles/reports-confirm-ufo-activity-at-the-hanford-nuclear-weapons-plant-during-world-war-ii&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727841216&usg=AOvVaw2xAqAbeSa6icv1s1xaLTTL)” UFOs & Nukes, August 9, 2015; Headquarters Fourth Air Force, “[Air Defense Measures at Hanford Engineering Company,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ufohastings.com/storage/files/image/2015-08-08/hanford_1945_1.png&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727841459&usg=AOvVaw0mmbLdsWFURF1PzSLdrE84)” January 23, 1945; Robert L. Hastings, “[Former US Navy Pilot Says Huge Fireball Maneuvered above the Hanford Atomic](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ufohastings.com/index.php/articles/former-us-navy-pilot-says-huge-fireball-maneuvered-above-the-hanford-atomic-plant&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727841732&usg=AOvVaw1-70WzE2V6DkMwWpw5Y4hQ) [Plant during World War II,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ufohastings.com/index.php/articles/former-us-navy-pilot-says-huge-fireball-maneuvered-above-the-hanford-atomic-plant&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727842017&usg=AOvVaw0x-bwoX8iuWTauHBSLHv-n)” UFOs & Nukes, October 5, 2015)

1945

January — [Ray Palmer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raymond_A._Palmer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727842507&usg=AOvVaw3H3Nw5xNR9zFd4HwQOmi_K) edits, rewrites, and publishes Richard S. Shaver’s description of the cave-dwelling Dero for the March 1945 issue of Amazing Stories under the title “I Remember Lemuria.” The issue sells out and generates quite a response. Between 1945 and 1949, many letters arrive attesting to the truth of Shaver’s claims (tens of thousands of letters, according to Palmer). The correspondents claim that they, too, have heard strange voices or encountered denizens of the Hollow Earth. (Wikipedia, “[Richard Sharpe Shaver](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Sharpe_Shaver&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727842998&usg=AOvVaw0Yau-snfVfi5dE-0L29cVx)”; Richard S. Shaver, “[‘I](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ia802506.us.archive.org/0/items/Amazing_Stories_v19n01_1945-03_Ziff-Daviscape1736/Amazing%2520Stories%2520v19n01%25201945-03%2520%2528Ziff-Davis%2529%2528cape1736%2529.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727843373&usg=AOvVaw0lKevFpFFZpDYSw37OG7Z7) [Remember Lemuria,’](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ia802506.us.archive.org/0/items/Amazing_Stories_v19n01_1945-03_Ziff-Daviscape1736/Amazing%2520Stories%2520v19n01%25201945-03%2520%2528Ziff-Davis%2529%2528cape1736%2529.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727843681&usg=AOvVaw3h4RRK6fxw46O0QEBXYWid)” Amazing Stories 19, no. 1 (March 1945): 12–70; Walter Kafton-Minkel, Subterranean Worlds, Loompanics, 1989, [pp. 137–144](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/subterraneanworldswalterkaftonminkel100000yearsofdragonsdwarfsthedeadlostracesufosfrominsidetheearth/page/n141/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727844259&usg=AOvVaw1GdoDFikXDs_rKkO-n5-8q); Clark III 872, 1069; Richard Toronto, War over Lemuria: Richard Shaver, Ray Palmer, and the Strangest Chapter of 1940s Science Fiction, McFarland, 2013; David Halperin, “[The](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.davidhalperin.net/the-shaver-mystery-richard-shaver-ray-palmer-and-the-quest-for-lemuria-part-1/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727844839&usg=AOvVaw0X8yPKa8SyZZOJ-1FVWnwG) [Shaver Mystery—Richard Shaver, Ray Palmer, and the Quest for Lemuria (Part 1),](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.davidhalperin.net/the-shaver-mystery-richard-shaver-ray-palmer-and-the-quest-for-lemuria-part-1/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727845289&usg=AOvVaw1ifv_Gs7lsrSEA5jS2zdXg)” July 4, 2014)

January 2 — 2:30 a.m. USAAF Lieut. Jack Green and navigator Lieut. Warren Barber, 653rd Bombardment Squadron, are conducting a reconnaissance flight in a Mosquito over the Netherlands and northern Germany when they encounter two balls of fire on three occasions pacing their plane. Barber describes them as a “pair of fog lights, shooting up to 60 or 70,000 feet.” (Strange Company 114–116, 208–209)

January 2 — The New York Times publishes an article stating that the foo fighters are German weapons. Lieut. Donald J. Meiers of the 415th Night Fighter Squadron says he has been followed by foo-fighters twice. “A foo-fighter picked me up at 700 feet and chased me 20 miles down the Rhine Valley \[Germany\]. I turned to starboard and two balls of fire turned with me. I turned to the port side and they turned with me. We were going 260 miles an hour and the balls were keeping right up with us.” (“[Balls of Fire Stalk U.S. Fighters in Night Assaults over](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1945/01/02/84625631.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727846221&usg=AOvVaw1lVRGnx5X_RxVPyAEzyJM4) [Germany,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1945/01/02/84625631.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727846602&usg=AOvVaw31eyPXeAe3D7hDB0FfZJ2V)” New York Times, January 2, 1945, pp. 1, 4; Strange Company 117–118)

January 2 — Col. [Clayton Lawrence Bissell,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clayton_Lawrence_Bissell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727847288&usg=AOvVaw2AzgDPqr1M9aUMm7XOIWDG) in the Pentagon’s Office of the Assistant Chief of Staff for Intelligence, sends SHAEF in Paris a classified message seeking an explanation for the red balls of fire pacing planes. No response has been located to date. (\[Clayton Lawrence\] Bissell, \[[message](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/2_January_1945_wdgbi.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727847745&usg=AOvVaw031xUclVBwxTEA_V4cDe58)\], January 2, 1945; Project 1947, “[UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1945a.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727848078&usg=AOvVaw0-eTXwnRhI7wzwcYosbbcF) [Reports, 1945](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1945a.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727848437&usg=AOvVaw0s5RaMnzgHqOJ7Bfu2YF7M)”)

* * *

January 16 —Lt. Col. [Leavitt Corning Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/6360350/leavitt-corning&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727849043&usg=AOvVaw0TS-SMybVQTydAuyp3fvJZ) of the XII Tactical Air Command sends a secret memo to the assistant chief of air intelligence requesting further information on the “Night Phenomenon.” (Strange Company 126–127)

January 20 — First Tactical Air Force Executive Officer Maj. [Samuel V. Boykin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/38941869/samuel-woodson_venable-boykin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727849670&usg=AOvVaw23e5NO9gJUr6MZo9bvEw7C) responds to [Corning](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/6360350/leavitt-corning&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727850059&usg=AOvVaw3YVeZ51IIBbITs9tvYqFxD) asking for more particulars about the reports. (Strange Company 127)

January 22 — British prisoners being force-marched out of the German Heydebreck labor camp (near modern Kędzierzyn-Koźle, Poland) see a four-engine bomber overhead. Behind it is a “brilliant light” that is following it closely. (Clark III 503)

January 30 — 12:10 a.m. A 415th Night Fighter Squadron crew observes two amber-colored “lights in the air at 2,000 feet” between Wissembourg, Bas-Rhin, France, and Landau, Germany. They seem to be about a foot in diameter and 20–50 feet apart. The lights follow their Bristol Beaufighter, closing in to about 1,000 feet before disappearing. (Strange Company 129)

January 30 — Capt. [Fred B. Ringwald](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/135104859/fred-bertrand-ringwald&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727851160&usg=AOvVaw1_nBs6AxFQjot1DNuHZudH)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/135104859/fred-bertrand-ringwald&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727851465&usg=AOvVaw0WvKzIdS51ydkaXJCIfY5m) intelligence officer for the 415 Night Fighter Squadron, responds to [Corning](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/6360350/leavitt-corning&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727851843&usg=AOvVaw0dOks5-GJyI_JrPSsj6NY9)’s January 16 request by offering a summary of 14 foo fighter reports from December 14, 1944, to January 29, 1945. (Strange Company 129–132)

February — [Meade Layne](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Meade_Layne&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727852415&usg=AOvVaw3H8FzOUaiDMF3HO5oRfGqO) founds the Borderland Sciences Research Associates in San Diego, California, and publishes the first issue of its newsletter, The Round Robin. Working with local medium [Mark A. Probert,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://hatch.kookscience.com/wiki/Mark_Probert&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727852864&usg=AOvVaw29tmEumk0mccE60SF1c7yW) who channels “etheric” entities from discarnates with advanced knowledge of spirit and cosmos, Layne and BSRA seek to explore the mysteries of the invisible world. (Borderland Sciences Research Associates, \[[History](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://borderlandsciences.org/history/BSRA.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727853264&usg=AOvVaw1lL4J8-TiPLzFSzBmnaeCj)\]; Clark III 876; Håkan Blomqvist, “[Round Robin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufoarchives.blogspot.com/2014/03/round-robin-and-contactee-history.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727853647&usg=AOvVaw0_FQJXMaTXd8n4iYl38lDo) [and Contactee History,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufoarchives.blogspot.com/2014/03/round-robin-and-contactee-history.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727853959&usg=AOvVaw1Y-QnxR52nRZqQvNnKsOhd)” Håkan Blomqvist’s Blog, March 30, 2014)

February 2 — The first Hanford plutonium arrives at Los Alamos. (Atomic Heritage Foundation, “[Atomic Timeline](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.atomicheritage.org/history/timeline&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727854420&usg=AOvVaw1nz1zIbv7jo5V0RcWmhyiu)”)

February 2 — The first flight of the H.IX V2 is made in Oranienburg, Germany. All subsequent test flights and development are done by Gothaer Waggonfabrik in Gotha. By this time, the [Horten brothers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Horten_brothers&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727855232&usg=AOvVaw0lxpOq2F9RGw6TlkbErZa-) are working on a turbojet-powered design for the Amerika Bomber contract competition and do not attend the first test flight. The test pilot is Leutnant [Erwin Ziller.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.pilotenbunker.de/Unbek_Helden/Ziller_Erwin/ziller_erwin.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727855801&usg=AOvVaw3XuRZENdSUpa_pyUtiktdC) Two further test flights are made in February. There are reports that during one of these test flights, the H.IX V2 undertook a simulated dogfight with a Messerschmitt Me 262, the first operational jet fighter, and that the H.IX V2 outperformed the Me 262. However, the Me 262 is considered by many as unsuitable for fighter missions, being slow in turning. (Wikipedia, “[Horton Ho 229](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Horten_Ho_229&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727856328&usg=AOvVaw3HNr_oYvullbYoSR-B-pyn)”)

February 7 — Afternoon. Several F6F fighters on patrol (one piloted by Ensign [Norman P. Stark](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/50418180/norman-paul_norm_-stark&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727856833&usg=AOvVaw2d792peLbKQ3haFMYugiXl)) from the [USS Wasp](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Wasp_(CV-18)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727857173&usg=AOvVaw1pmgq_XS2hcI1YfcBgc29V) aircraft carrier anchored at Ulithi Atoll in the Caroline Islands are told to investigate a radar target at 30,000 feet some 10 miles west of the fleet. Before they can reach altitude, the object moves back to the west at high speed. They catch a brief visual glimpse of it. (LCDR Norman P. Stark, “[A WWII F6F Navy Fighter Pilot’s Experiences](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.battleofsaipan.com/Nstark000101.htm%23Liberty_at_Mog&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727857708&usg=AOvVaw32b1SKvef67b_5YqtVHTEI) [in the Pacific,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.battleofsaipan.com/Nstark000101.htm%23Liberty_at_Mog&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727858067&usg=AOvVaw16fHWejXv4toikpbPZwbmW)” Battle of Saipan, January 1, 2000)

February 10 — The Chicago Tribune and Washington Times-Herald reveal [Bill Donovan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_J._Donovan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727858722&usg=AOvVaw1qpSkFePHSk1bQhLF8Yf4U)’s plans for a postwar intelligence agency and publishes a secret memo he has sent to [Roosevelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franklin_D._Roosevelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727859080&usg=AOvVaw01NjusMcl63gBNlCgPu1VZ) proposing its creation. The article compares the proposed agency to the Gestapo. Knowing that Americans want a smaller federal government after the war, Roosevelt is not entirely sold on Donovan’s proposal, although Donovan feels reasonably confident that he can talk the president into the idea. [J. Edgar Hoover](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Edgar_Hoover&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727859505&usg=AOvVaw0Vh4A9XKS75rWXdKETyweb) disapproves of Donovan’s plan, which he sees as a direct threat to FBI authority, even though Donovan has stressed that his agency will operate only abroad, not domestically. (Walter Trohan, “[Super-Spy Idea Denounced As New Deal OGPU,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92406563/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727859881&usg=AOvVaw0iYebRCtGzIKAuAxU757vu)” Chicago Tribune, February 10, 1945, p. 1; Central Intelligence Agency, “[Origins of CIA,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP75B00380R000700080025-4.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727860278&usg=AOvVaw1HQ25uRhLEpSiZ9MZ_f4qs)” August 3, 2005; Mark Riebling, Wedge: From Pearl Harbor to 9/11, Simon & Schuster, 2002, [pp. 59–61](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/wedgefrompearlha0000rieb/page/58/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727860615&usg=AOvVaw26i42yPZQfTIIKqDb0bkEj))

February 11 — Air Commodore [Colin McKay Grierson,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colin_McKay_Grierson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727860909&usg=AOvVaw0vSBgcY_Z8FXusVqwmZlxz) RAF assistant chief of staff A2, refers [Ringwald](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/135104859/fred-bertrand-ringwald&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727861215&usg=AOvVaw0ZlUYx25Gu0gkeSpJjkTSn)’s report to the Air Ministry. (Strange Company 133–134)
