Mid-February — As their C-47 prepares to land at Biggs Field, Fort Bliss, El Paso, Texas, S/Sgt Ralph Bayer is alarmed to see an aircraft approaching from the left and only 900 feet below them. The object is about 30 feet long and a dull, flat gray in color, and it travels in a straight course 500 feet above the ground until it disappears. (Clark III 1178)

February 18 — Disaster strikes during the third test flight of the H.IX V2 in Gotha, Germany. [Erwin Ziller](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.pilotenbunker.de/Unbek_Helden/Ziller_Erwin/ziller_erwin.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727861680&usg=AOvVaw3okdy6LPI0HGoyEL_ME0GJ) takes off without any problems to perform a series of flight tests. After about 45 minutes, at an altitude of around 800 meters, one of the Jumo 004 turbojet engines develops a problem, catches fire and stops. Ziller is seen putting the aircraft into a dive and pulling up several times in an attempt to restart the engine and save the precious prototype. He undertakes a series of four complete turns at a 20° angle. Ziller does not use his radio or eject from the aircraft. He already is unconscious as a result of the fumes from the burning engine. The aircraft crashes just outside the boundary of the airfield. Ziller is thrown from the aircraft on impact and dies from his injuries two weeks later.

The prototype aircraft is completely destroyed. (Wikipedia, “[Horton Ho 229](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Horten_Ho_229&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727862027&usg=AOvVaw1xtmGcdkWDwQ3NHZogfMos)”)

* * *

February 22 — Night. A B-24 bomber flying near Chichijima in the Ogasawara (Bonin) Archipelago, Japan, sees an object trailing exhaust. It is also picked up on radar and follows the plane for about 20 miles before disappearing off the screen. (Project 1947, “[UFO Reports, 1945](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1945a.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727862433&usg=AOvVaw37AAtmiZXt-aTmgr58aINI)”)

March — The K-25 gaseous diffusion plant at Oak Ridge, Tennessee, begins production. (Wikipedia, “[K-25](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K-25&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727862745&usg=AOvVaw1nCVmJwdxxusJ_cSwZHWfZ)”)

March — A man is squirrel hunting in a wooded area near Belfast, Maine, when he sees a huge, elongated object just above the trees. He runs after it, thinking it is a dirigible about to crash. The object crashes into the trees at the far edge of a clearing, splitting a huge pine tree down the middle. He smells burned rubber. The object seems to be as big as several B-36 bombers. As he stands there stunned, the lowest end of the craft begins to rise and he hears a humming sound of increasing intensity. After it rises to a horizontal position, it begins to spin faster and faster and the hum becomes very intense. Suddenly one end spews a shower of fine, silvery threads that glint in the sunlight. The object begins to change to a white metallic color and it takes off straight up at fantastic speed. (“I Saw a Flying Saucer,” Flying Saucers, May 1959, pp. 6–18, 78; Clark III 1178–1179)

March — [Ray Palmer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raymond_A._Palmer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727863173&usg=AOvVaw0H_MNiMtDFHu7kmxR7ZVpr) travels to Barto, Pennsylvania, and spends a weekend with [Richard Shaver](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Sharpe_Shaver&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727863424&usg=AOvVaw0ijkTV012NihzKUl7F09Il) and his wife. He witnesses Shaver’s channeling trances and the different voices describing the cavern world that he generates during his sleep. (Wikipedia, “[Richard Sharpe Shaver](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Sharpe_Shaver&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727863687&usg=AOvVaw0HkjQrbDAue2y98WyDM55c)”; Walter Kafton-Minkel, Subterranean Worlds, Loompanics, 1989, [pp. 137–144](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/subterraneanworldswalterkaftonminkel100000yearsofdragonsdwarfsthedeadlostracesufosfrominsidetheearth/page/n141/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727864056&usg=AOvVaw3kXfObRPrxJgu7NB3s6BKg); Clark III 872, 1069; Richard Toronto, War over Lemuria: Richard Shaver, Ray Palmer, and the Strangest Chapter of 1940s Science Fiction, McFarland, 2013; David Halperin, “[The Shaver](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.davidhalperin.net/the-shaver-mystery-richard-shaver-ray-palmer-and-the-quest-for-lemuria-part-1/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727864375&usg=AOvVaw2dB4j8AWrYA_GeQTddiCIl) [Mystery—Richard Shaver, Ray Palmer, and the Quest for Lemuria (Part 1),](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.davidhalperin.net/the-shaver-mystery-richard-shaver-ray-palmer-and-the-quest-for-lemuria-part-1/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727864634&usg=AOvVaw3WdOG2_db6trxzmljU9ITP)” July 4, 2014)

March 10 — A Japanese Fu-Go balloon strikes a high-tension wire on the Bonneville Power Administration in Washington State. The balloon causes sparks and a fireball that results in the power being cut. Coincidentally, the largest consumer of energy on this power grid is the Hanford site of the Manhattan Project, which suddenly loses power. The officer in charge at Hanford, Col. [Franklin Matthias](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.atomicheritage.org/profile/franklin-matthias&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727865050&usg=AOvVaw2tzAGNWhjXlEbYQJK44LH0), says “it shut down the plant cold, and it took us about three days to get it back up to full power again.” (Franklin Matthias, “[Japanese Balloon Bombs Fu-Go,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.atomicheritage.org/history/japanese-balloon-bombs-fu-go&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727865306&usg=AOvVaw0HFl0z3IkxqijmXlMi21eg)” Atomic Heritage Foundation, August 10, 2016)

March 12 — Nearly a week after the US Army launches Operation Lumberjack to cross the Rhine River, the Ho 229 is included in the Jäger-Notprogramm (Emergency Fighter Program) for accelerated production of inexpensive “wonder weapons.” The prototype workshop is moved to the Gothaer Waggonfabrik (Gotha) in Friedrichroda, Germany. In the same month, work commences on the third prototype, the Ho 229 V3. (Wikipedia, “[Horton Ho](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Horten_Ho_229&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727866054&usg=AOvVaw1K6wqUsYOGIk7b1j-Tq3kj) [229](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Horten_Ho_229&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727866258&usg=AOvVaw3QbqvOfQmzu2OE_ZkpLlYW)”)

March 18 — [Grierson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colin_McKay_Grierson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727866532&usg=AOvVaw3OPO0Yv6Cn7RgZJQ6zkixO) writes to [Samuel V. Boykin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/38941869/samuel-woodson_venable-boykin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727866781&usg=AOvVaw2PyKrUUJ-Qwz_NQkJp52eZ) that the Air Ministry thinks the fireballs are either Me-262’s or flak rockets. (Strange Company 147)

March 18 — Night. A 416th NFS crew is flying a Mosquito 25 miles northwest of Florence, Italy. Suddenly a light is flying alongside them at 13,000 feet. It doesn’t appear on the radar screen. The pilot turns the plane toward the light, keeping on its tail, pursuing at 260 mph and climbing to 16,000 feet. Suddenly the light disappears. (Strange Company 148)

Late March — At least two residents of Dresden, Germany, see a round, flat, silver-colored object without propellors or wings hovering silently in the air. It suddenly disappears like a “burst soap bubble.” (“[Weltrundschau,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Switzerland/Weltraumbote/Weltraumbote%2520-%2520No%252032-33%2520-%25201958.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727867308&usg=AOvVaw0-aOvJVd8uYrpU8qstc7OQ)” Weltraumbote, no. 32/22 (July/Aug. 1958): 14–15; Clark III 503)

March 22 — 1:00 p.m. The [USS New York](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_New_York_(BB-34)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727867646&usg=AOvVaw1k8m1eANjqF2K43pdEpol_) is off New Guinea preparing to rejoin the Seventh Fleet. Gunner Cpl. Donald Pratt is preparing for a Japanese attack when he sees a shiny silver object hovering directly over the battleship. It remains stationary over the ship for 30 minutes and is tracked on ship radar. Two antiaircraft guns fire on the object, but it does not move or seem affected. Capt. [Kemp C. Christian Sr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/3392277/kemp-c-christian&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727867917&usg=AOvVaw21RhUmGkGkjHyC5IVru0LT) orders the guns to stop. Immediately the object shoots up and away at a fantastic rate of speed. (Strange Company 151–152)

March 25 — Around 10:30 p.m. Company A of the US 44th Armored Infantry Battalion is bivouacked on a hill along the Autobahn between Mannheim and Darmstadt, Germany, when 6–7 circular, glowing, yellow-orange objects approach at 150 feet, roughly following the road. They are not in strict formation and seem individually controlled. John G. Norris recalled that after 5–6 minutes they are hidden by the trees. (Strange Company 153– 154)

March 26 — During an air operation, Lieut. [Calvin P. Lamb](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/6414390/calvin-powell-lamb&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727868405&usg=AOvVaw3zUblu8wn2aWl4Hf5yKOlK) (pilot), Lieut. James G. Holmes (radar observer), and Sgt. John W. McIsaac (gunner) notice lights on an airborne object. The lights follow them through a few turns but move away as the crew orbits north of Iwo Jima, Japan. They give chase, obtaining a slight target on the aircraft radar, then the object pulls out of sight. A similar lighted object is again seen March 28 by Lieut. [William F. Sill](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/202159893/william-floyd-sill&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727868682&usg=AOvVaw16fbGNrs7aO8ILjOwgiUOO) (pilot), Flight Officer George W. Hayden (radar observer), and PFC William Brasvell (gunner). (Project 1947, “[UFO Reports, 1945](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1945a.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727868917&usg=AOvVaw20a7VJpD1NeEgdz43-b5O_)”)

* * *

April — During operations around Okinawa, Japan, the radar crew on the aircraft carrier [USS Independence](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Independence_(CVL-22)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727869285&usg=AOvVaw3nCnXwr9kNmiSdrNUQoQn5) frequently notices strange radar returns that move at slow speeds (30–70 mph). Aircraft and destroyers sent to search for them never find anything. These radar ghosts are usually detected 25–30 miles away at an altitude of 1,500 feet, but occasionally 3,500 feet. The primary diagnostic for these false returns is their speed. The Navy nicknames them the “ghost of Nansei-shoto” after the Japanese name for the Ryukyu Islands, of which Okinawa is one. (Strange Company 183–186)

April — [Ray Palmer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raymond_A._Palmer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727869741&usg=AOvVaw2tVfpdp_OB5iIuipmoR936) publishes a second story by [Richard Shaver](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Sharpe_Shaver&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727869980&usg=AOvVaw2n0vZcGRm3pO3tJfJi1BV9)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Sharpe_Shaver&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727870153&usg=AOvVaw28WoJmrRn5y8gPA83Sf8GT) “Thought Records of Lemuria,” in the June issue of Amazing Stories. Here it is revealed that Shaver’s knowledge of the cave world and Lemuria isn’t really a “racial memory,” as the first story had asserted. Shaver, working in a factory, heard voices speaking to him, apparently through his welding gun. (Richard S. Shaver, “[Thought Records of Lemuria,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/Amazing_Stories_v19n02_1945-06.Ziff-Daviscape1736/page/n15/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727870461&usg=AOvVaw1jz3D4vTGhAV0fQc-epHBs)” Amazing Stories 19, no 2 (June 1945): 16–52)

April 3–4 — US B-29 bombers over Honshu, Japan, encounter numerous balls of light tagging along with them. (Strange Company 157–159)

April 7 — [Walter and Reimar Horten,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Horten_brothers&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727870894&usg=AOvVaw2HneXkfaiDiVOgJo4K0z2r) German designers associated with wingless aircraft, are arrested by US troops near Göttingen, Germany. (Lance Cole, Secret Wings of World War II: Nazi Technology and the Allied Arms Race, Pen & Sword, 2015)

April 10 — 11:00 p.m. James L. Hendry sees from his porch in Jeffersontown, Kentucky, a bright light that seems to be directly above Fisherville, 3 miles to the east. Its brightness fluctuates and it seems to be moving directly toward his location, casting a light beam downward. After 10 minutes, it goes out “like a snuffed candle.” (“A Meteor?” Louisville Times, April 14, 1945; Project 1947, “[UFO Reports, 1945](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1945a.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727871320&usg=AOvVaw1l2rAhRBk0lnj0YyamUr5I)”)

April 10 — As part of the Manhattan Project, 18 people in the US are injected with plutonium in doses ranging from 95 to 5,900 nanocuries without their knowledge or consent. The intent is to study how plutonium is absorbed into the digestive tract. The last experiment is conducted on July 18, 1947. (Wikipedia, “[Unethical human](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unethical_human_experimentation_in_the_United_States%23Plutonium_experiments&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727871641&usg=AOvVaw0mrmUaRxDFwdtPuXh9rMbS) [experimentation in the United States](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unethical_human_experimentation_in_the_United_States%23Plutonium_experiments&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727871917&usg=AOvVaw06Ln0kKsvE6twuMLhPmKF1)”)

April 12 — Roosevelt dies at Warm Springs, Georgia. [Harry S. Truman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_S._Truman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727872190&usg=AOvVaw3GyOE1fAgB-uf_0u8ok6BW) is sworn in as president. ()

April 17 — Maj. Gen. [James P. Hodges](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/106754/major-general-james-p-hodges/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727872501&usg=AOvVaw2tcWjaLVTv6WwHfdvWd3Nb) writes a memorandum to Gen. [Henry H. “Hap” Arnold,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henry_H._Arnold&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727872769&usg=AOvVaw0y6FANMBarEf_smEw0VtrE) saying that infrared devices are now available to take photographs of “balls of fire” in the Pacific. (Project 1947, “[UFO Reports,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1945a.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727873002&usg=AOvVaw0Tdt7rhJYbfpmUFQwtSXh9) [1945](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1945a.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727873225&usg=AOvVaw0dr4IdZ7HTRucH_-kkYpfV)”)

April 22 — The [USS Lewis Hancock](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Lewis_Hancock&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727873485&usg=AOvVaw2lWBYt1iNrGjkWQjFvMKmJ) is northeast of Okinawa, Japan, when the SG radar picks up an unidentified target at 6 miles heading their way at 70–115 mph. Its movements are erratic. Two miles out, the ship identifies a “tight formation of more than fifty birds.” (Strange Company 184)

April 24 — The [USS Audubon](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Audubon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727873850&usg=AOvVaw3p2nO17N6xzl-xlSsSIOK_) is headed for Okinawa, Japan, with US Army passengers and equipment. Radar operators pick up “unidentified aeroplanes” heading their way. The screens show a blip, alternately fuzzy and strong, some 8 miles away headed down the starboard side at 25 mph. Still, nothing can be seen visually, and the radar operator suggests that it is a flock of birds. (Strange Company 184–186)

April 25 — 9:45 a.m. Acting Squadron Leader Kit Francis Williams of the RAF 617 Bomber Squadron is flying a Lancaster with 25 other aircraft to bomb Hitler’s headquarters at Berchtesgaden, Germany, in the Bavarian Alps. Just after a turn near Kaiserslautern, Germany, at 16,500 feet, Williams witnesses an object like a large woolly blanket that takes up his entire windshield. He thinks it could be as much as 4–5 miles wide. It moves vertically and is gone in an instant. Suddenly his aircraft loses its electrical power and loses one of its bombs. He and his bomber and engineer get severe headaches. They return to base in England after regaining power. (Keith Basterfield, “[Observation by Pilot over Germany, 1945,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufos-scientificresearch.blogspot.com/2016/11/observation-by-australian-pilot-over.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727874630&usg=AOvVaw3tUQ9O99LoEL7oO9jD1uSU)” Unidentified Aerial Phenomena—Scientific Research, November 14, 2016)

April 26 — Gen. [Curtis LeMay](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Curtis_LeMay&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727875117&usg=AOvVaw3SbuGvejLpVTqww11KjrgI)’s XXI Bomber Command’s Air Intelligence staff produces a 5-page report representing the most up-to-date information and theories on the balls of fire but cannot find a good explanation for them. (Strange Company 162–163)

May — German scientist [Viktor Schauberger](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Viktor_Schauberger&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727875839&usg=AOvVaw3k6Irqg7JJ88rTLPqg-vIq)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Viktor_Schauberger&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727876124&usg=AOvVaw1bqkHLLJ2DNB7Gz3VBn3GW) who has been using inmates from the Mauthausen concentration camp to help him develop new aircraft and submarine engines, is captured by Allied forces in Leonstein, Austria.

Supposedly his devices and documents, which allegedly include a prototype flying saucer, are kept under lock and key. He is released in March 1946 and moves to Linz, Austria, but the Americans do not confiscate his workshop and laboratory materials, although they prohibit him from further military experimentation. (Wikipedia, “[Nazi](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nazi_UFOs&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727876669&usg=AOvVaw2EOCV2QxwAh2uFP7Ubfs6G) [UFOs](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nazi_UFOs&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727877025&usg=AOvVaw1HCJrCK5ZoaA99Vlrv7WzY)”)

May 3 — Early morning. Nine B-24’s with the 11th Bombardment Group’s 431st Squadron are heading out on a bombing mission against Japanese air installations on Truk \[now Chuuk\] Atoll in Micronesia. One plane over Fala Island sees two objects at their altitude of 11,000 feet, changing from cherry red to orange then white, then

* * *

dying out and turning cherry red again. Both follow the B-24 through all sorts of evasive actions. (“[B-24 Sights](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.greenwoodufoarchive.com/uhr/uhr02.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727877750&usg=AOvVaw3OiNVMyrDOXve2M39MPs8V) [Circles of Light,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.greenwoodufoarchive.com/uhr/uhr02.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727878118&usg=AOvVaw01hj4vtB2B3raXwZaJ05sV)” UFO Historical Revue, no. 2 (September 1998): 8; Strange Company 163–165; NICAP, “[May](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/450502trukdir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727878713&usg=AOvVaw2YhhR7ZXkgHKA91JkItMlS) [2, Truk Atoll Sighting](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/450502trukdir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727879040&usg=AOvVaw2lk0p_XfdGZDDOHRsapn_1)”)

May 5 — A pregnant woman, Elsie Mitchell, and five children are killed when they discover a Japanese Fu-Go balloon bomb that has landed in the forest of Gearhart Mountain near Bly in southern Oregon. (Wikipedia, “[Fu-Go](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fu-Go_balloon_bomb%23Single_lethal_attack&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727879765&usg=AOvVaw357pxTWExJ30oWSOv0WaMa) [balloon bomb](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fu-Go_balloon_bomb%23Single_lethal_attack&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727880011&usg=AOvVaw22oK8BaVOvylJ4-doPIYh1)”)

May 23 and 25 — Night. In the wake of two B-29 raids on Tokyo, Japan, both nights, businessman Iomoyo Okado looks up from his air raid shelter and sees slow-moving “roundish objects, like hot cakes, about 20 square yards” in diameter, and silent. They are blue or gray in color. (“[‘Flying Hot Cakes’ over Tokyo in 1945,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92430325/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727880336&usg=AOvVaw3slxw75HgnD81qutZWqXrM)” St. Joseph (Mo.) News-Press, July 12, 1947, p. 6; Clark III 503)

Summer — After 5:00 p.m. Future ufologist [Ann Druffel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://copycateffect.blogspot.com/2020/06/ufologist-ann-druffel-dies.html?fbclid%3DIwAR3N-uW1ZAkq5p21hxc11siol67dwjxfSq2vLaTl8v0pExaBh0OeTDuLTyc&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727880808&usg=AOvVaw09j3-uAFQhtJE6atBpHOKC) is on a bus returning from her summer job in Long Beach, California, when she sees out of the left-hand window a bright, stationary, yellowish-white light in the northeastern sky. It looks like Venus but has a yellow color. She gets off the bus and still watches it, walking home. Soon she sees it is moving slowly to the northwest. She gets her mother to view it as well. Druffel thinks it is too high to be a coastal defense balloon. Druffel watches it for 90 minutes, after which it takes on some “activity.” Some 10–15 pieces of light begin separating from it, fading from view after moving several diameters away from the large object. (Ann Druffel, “UFO Sightings by UFO Researchers: The ‘Inaccessible Cases,’” MUFON UFO Journal, no. 139 (September 1979), pp. 14–15; Herbert S. Taylor, “Satellite Objects: A Further Look,” IUR 29, no. 2 (Summer 2004): 3–4)

Summer — Future ufologist [Illobrand von Ludwiger](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Illobrand_von_Ludwiger&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727881304&usg=AOvVaw05Rt8SJz5SceU42MbT2UxS) sees an object like a black plate, whose diameter is one-eighth that of the Moon, flying against the wind below the clouds, in Stendal, Saxony-Anhalt, Germany. (Margaret Sachs, The UFO Encyclopedia, Putnam, 1980, [p. 357](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoencyclopedia00marg/page/357/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727881628&usg=AOvVaw3IjW9Cv7UDLjxw1gcgtoUb))

Summer — Radioman Robert S. Crawford and 13 other sailors aboard the US Army Transport [Delarof](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.navsource.org/archives/30/22/22027.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727881911&usg=AOvVaw3HLZNDnhD8EnHTwDfU8hXr) see a large, dark sphere rise out of the ocean east of Adak in the Aleutian Islands, Alaska. The UFO, showing darkly against the setting sun, climbs almost straight up for a few moments, then it arcs into level flight, and circles the ship two or three times. All the observers are convinced it is a large object. Crawford estimates the UFO is 150–250 feet in diameter. The gun crews hold their fire. After several minutes, it disappears to the south. (NICAP, “[Large Object](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/45SUMRaleutianisles_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727882227&usg=AOvVaw2ecig8xabUFEopN_YaN1tJ) [Emerges from Sea near the](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/45SUMRaleutianisles_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727882446&usg=AOvVaw0uPVqolcNdxjivnyzNSywC) [Delarof](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/45SUMRaleutianisles_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727882624&usg=AOvVaw0EWECg6vhc_CNrSl3EHGAr)”; “[The Question of Submerging UFO’s,”](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/041%2520MAR%25201968.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727882836&usg=AOvVaw2zGlP4dy_Ana0V6POAo5Q1) UFO Investigator 4, o. 5 (March 1968): 4)

June 1 — The Army Air Force approves a Northrop-recommended change for installing eight jet engines in each of two modified YB-35 piston-driven flying wings, which are redesignated YB-49s. (Wikipedia, “[Northrop YB-49](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northrop_YB-49&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727883169&usg=AOvVaw1P2cfjFlYkSrHR6L7PtZIS)”)

June 1 — 7:30 p.m. A shiny, tubular object, 5–6 feet long, is observed over Morganton, North Carolina. It streaks toward the northwest, blue flame shooting from the rear. After it vanishes in the mountains near Lake James, witnesses hear an explosion. (Loren E. Gross, [The Mystery of Unidentified Flying Objects—A Prelude, 1896–1949](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-Mystery-of-UFOs-A-Prelude.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727883519&usg=AOvVaw1g0_cqGVLRGWJOiDN3cHWU)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-Mystery-of-UFOs-A-Prelude.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727883756&usg=AOvVaw0uVQSNiKaUiS-WI4WEws21) The author, 1971, p. 156)

June 9 — XXI Bomber Command Air Intelligence issues an Air Intelligence Report on the balls of fire in the Pacific Theatre. The Truk sighting is attributed to an unknown Japanese experimental aircraft, though not a jet. (Strange Company 177–180)

July — The 9th Bombardment Group on Tinian in the Northern Marianas: “During our night missions in June and July a UFO phenomenon was reported. Our air crews started sighting balls of fire, i.e., glowing objects about the size of a full moon which flew around in the vicinity of our flying patterns over Japan. One of our crews reported that one of the objects followed their airplane halfway to Iwo Jima. I saw them on two missions. I don’t remember any reports of any hostile action by these objects and the reports of sightings stopped after a couple of months. The object of these reports was dismissed by some experts as the planet Venus. And, after these reports started coming in, some crews did mistake the rising full moon as one of these balls of fire. Some reports speculated that these balls of fire were exhausts from a Japanese development called a Baka Bomb, but exhaust flames can only be seen from the rear; and these objects appeared to have the same size and intensity in whatever direction they were traveling. I have never heard of any official assessment as to what these objects were. I had an occasion to ask General [LeMay](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Curtis_LeMay&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727884288&usg=AOvVaw3lFUFMfLjDwLwp90Kp93N3) about them several years after the war and he had no explanation. I am sure that what I saw was neither Venus nor the moon nor a Baka Bomb.” (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, p. 24; Henry

C. Huglin, “[Group Commander’s Reminiscences,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northrop_YB-49&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727884647&usg=AOvVaw3SRrZSlQrNiEz8uKLxUS4i)” in Lawrence S. Smith, et al., History of the 9th Bombardment Group (VH), 9th Bomb Group Association, 1995, pp. 27–28)

July — In northern Okinawa, Japan, on a bluff looking toward the South China Sea, Artillery Capt. [William A. Mandel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/58851118/william-a_-mandel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727884996&usg=AOvVaw3z9EXkOQMtflMi9-Z9phqY) sees a cigar-shaped object with a lighted tail moving at eye level at about 200 –300 mph at an elevation of no

* * *

more than 400 feet. He estimates its length at 30–40 feet and its diameter at 6–8 feet. (Project 1947, “[UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1945a.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727885468&usg=AOvVaw1qKS1495nziUyuQKrktTPZ) [Reports, 1945](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1945a.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727885692&usg=AOvVaw3uW-gKd5BOWrflOJIOqkVR)”)

July — When several balloon-shaped objects appear above Selfridge Field \[now Selfridge Air National Guard Base\] near Mount Clemens, Michigan, the base commander asks for a volunteer to attack them as possible Japanese balloon bombs. Jean Kisling, serving with a Free French Air Force detachment as an instructor on P-47 Thunderbolts, accepts the challenge. He chases one “well beyond the service ceiling of the P-47D” and opens fire with 8 machine guns. The object shoots away sideways on edge, leaving a contrail. (Good Need, [p. 24](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/24/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727886000&usg=AOvVaw2gL_lAWznwXJvzfqLhnquj))

July 1 — The Air Technical Service Command is moved into T-2 Intelligence. (Wikipedia, “[Air Materiel Command](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Air_Materiel_Command%23Air_Technical_Services_Command&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727886289&usg=AOvVaw3oRj_AK87SJjKGTTHQOi6K)”)

July 16 — The first detonation of a nuclear weapon (an implosion-style plutonium-based bomb) takes place at the Trinity site on what is now the White Sands Missile Range near Alamogordo, New Mexico. At this time, the bomb’s price tag, adjusted for inflation, is $28 billion. (Wikipedia, “[Trinity (nuclear test)](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trinity_(nuclear_test)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727886579&usg=AOvVaw0BWDPj8eMPdMVeEpxN_fRu)”)

Mid-July — Noon. Pilot Rolan D. Powell and five other F6F Hellcat pilots at Naval Air Station Pasco, Washington, are scrambled after radar reports a fast-moving object over the nearby Hanford facility. They see a bright object with a saucer-like appearance at. It is the size of three aircraft carriers, side-by side, oval shaped, very streamlined like a stretched-out egg and, and pinkish in color. It hovers in a fixed position at 65,000 feet and then goes straight up and disappears. (NICAP, “[Huge Saucer over Nuclear Reactor—Radar/Visual](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/45XXXXhanforddir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727886876&usg=AOvVaw06tNq_FUuHkT2R9EkYnMgM)”; Strange Company 188; Patrick Gross, “[Alleged UFO Intercept Attempt at Hanford Nuclear Plant, July 1945](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/hanford1945.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727887195&usg=AOvVaw3krRp9P_ugJRI75uHZgk6R)”)

July 20 — The Joint Chiefs of Staff establish Operation Overcast, a forerunner to Project Paperclip, a secret recruitment program to aid in postwar military research. The Joint Intelligence Objectives Agency is established to conduct the operation. (Wikipedia, “[Operation Paperclip](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Paperclip&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727887475&usg=AOvVaw05Cnew8yGg_4ef7d5JLk79)”)

July 24 — President [Truman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_S._Truman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727887776&usg=AOvVaw0Rg55cCwLL6G7Q-VaST14F) discloses to Soviet leader [Joseph Stalin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Stalin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727888090&usg=AOvVaw1zRLcSXHGgceDZIGm_AkTz) that the United States has atomic weapons. Stalin feigns little surprise, since he already knows this through espionage. (Gene Dannen, “[Truman Tells Stalin, July](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.dannen.com/decision/potsdam.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727888474&usg=AOvVaw3dTVVV-rhvN7oyJofDOKof) [24, 1945](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.dannen.com/decision/potsdam.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727888805&usg=AOvVaw137VMCM_oVS5oiNdm-CKtJ)”)

August — The Army Signal Security Agency persuades ITT, RCA, and Western Union to continue the wartime cable intercept program, both foreign and domestic, now called Project SHAMROCK. No courts, no warrants. It remains secret from Congress and the President. (Wikipedia, “[Project SHAMROCK](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Project_SHAMROCK&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727889239&usg=AOvVaw38eWBJoZERWMuYQk0G7ueA)”)

August — 5:00 a.m. Ilona Johansson-Paasonen, staying in a sauna along lake Längelmävesi, Finland, wakes up and sees a 35-foot dazzling ball of fire streaking in her direction along the opposite shore. She throws herself to the floor, but when nothing happens she looks outside and sees a big dog, frozen in terror, its gaze fixed on the lake and a dark log-like object, 6 feet long, gliding through the water with a tall, slender man at the prow. He is dressed in a green coverall. On the other side another man sits steering an engine enclosed within a big glass bulb. (Ilona Johansson- Paasonen, “[Humanoideja Längelmävedellä?](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Finland/Vimana%2520(1967-1972)/AFU_19700000_Vimana%2520no%25203-4.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727889881&usg=AOvVaw1YTjhCLaDXyCpsQmRB1RZg)” Vimana 1970, no. 3/4, pp. 22–24; Ilona Johansson-Paasonen, “[Humanoids at Längelmävesi,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR-CH%25201973%2520N%252013.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727890405&usg=AOvVaw0MYEtOyLJKGYxjILJElbOP)” FSR Case Histories 13 (February 1973): 3–4; Clark III 266)

August 6 — 8:15 a.m. An atomic bomb (a fission weapon containing 64 kilograms of Uranium-235, Little Boy) is detonated 1,900 feet above Hiroshima, Japan, by the [Enola Gay](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enola_Gay&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727891052&usg=AOvVaw1MMKuxe3KcOyRILrnal-O_). The weapon is considered very inefficient, with only 1.7% of its material fissioning, but it is enough to obliterate the city. Some 78,000 people die instantly or immediately afterward in the firestorm. By the end of the year, another 25,000 will also sicken and die from radiation exposure. (Wikipedia, “[Atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atomic_bombings_of_Hiroshima_and_Nagasaki%23Bombing_of_Hiroshima&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727891583&usg=AOvVaw19XQ006oc1nDjFkxKf99rS)”)

August 7 — During a press conference with the Seattle Times, Col. [Franklin Matthias,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franklin_Matthias&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727892168&usg=AOvVaw3gXCx7sf1NfBvGgyPcQ9EK) officer in charge at the Hanford Engineer Works in Washington, admits the plant has had problems with aerial intrusions, but that radar has been installed and an arrangement made with the Navy to intercept any unidentified aircraft. (Project 1947, “[UFOs over](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/hendershot.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727892618&usg=AOvVaw3BqvwvTmqjgeYw97PgjaNX) [Hanford: Commander R. W. Hendershot](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/hendershot.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727892957&usg=AOvVaw2QkSC86S12bcvZbDarRltG)”)

August 9 — 11:01 a.m. Another atomic bomb (an implosion-type plutonium weapon, Fat Man) is dropped on Nagasaki, Japan, by [Bockscar](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bockscar&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727916106&usg=AOvVaw3u3PxwS9-k-3dhy23FjcuZ)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bockscar&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727916412&usg=AOvVaw0Ygf-Cep0LnG8lT2k2uBZl) Although the bomb is more powerful than the one used on Hiroshima, its effects are confined by hillsides to the narrow Urakami Valley. At least 35,000–40,000 people are killed, and 60,000 others are injured. (Wikipedia, “[Atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atomic_bombings_of_Hiroshima_and_Nagasaki%23Bombing_of_Nagasaki&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727916871&usg=AOvVaw3VFLthae5ojlLHbOvUWi34)”)

August 10 — 3:00 a.m. Pianist Doris La Fountain is driving home along Market Street after finishing a concert at a night club in East Paterson \[now Elmwood Park\], New Jersey. She is accompanied by music store proprietor [Thomas](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/170049207/thomas-brino&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727917261&usg=AOvVaw2VYTwY4PQoSG7pKC6dzZ_Z) [Brino](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/170049207/thomas-brino&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727917480&usg=AOvVaw1kbT098tNwMZ4vVTcMWknT) and James Shaw of Clifton, New Jersey. For about 5 minutes they watch a brilliant red and green rectangular object maneuver at ground level about 70 feet away. It shoots off into the sky and disappears. (“[Seeing Saucer Sweet Music to a Pianist,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92439039/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727917735&usg=AOvVaw2IQSw565ls09PMKGQmrReQ)” New York Daily News, September 8, 1957, Passaic-Bergen Sec., p. 22; Lore and Deneault, [p. 145](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/mysteriesofskies0000lore/page/144/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727918025&usg=AOvVaw1oK4BqCJgYQfGnCWX2MLZ1))

August 16 — A UFO allegedly crashes near San Antonio, New Mexico, and is discovered by Jose Padilla, 9, and Remigio Baca, 7, when they are looking for a cow. The crashed saucer has created a gouge, and they can see entities moving around inside. They collect two shiny metal parts from the periphery of the crash site. A recent analysis

* * *

shows that the metal is of terrestrial origin. (Paola Leopizzi Harris, “[The Reme Baca and Jose Padilla Witness](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.theufochronicles.com/2010/11/1945-san-antonio-ufo-crash-witness.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727918474&usg=AOvVaw1_-DQJSGmHJoOw3uRE3N7i) [Case,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.theufochronicles.com/2010/11/1945-san-antonio-ufo-crash-witness.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727918734&usg=AOvVaw15sRvWN8QtyZfntItYcXCS)” The UFO Chronicles, November 30, 2010; John Greenewald, “[Analysis of Two Metallic Parts Purportedly](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.theblackvault.com/casefiles/analysis-two-metallic-parts-purportedly-crashed-unidentified-aerial-object-san-antonio-new-mexico-august-16-1945/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727919015&usg=AOvVaw35ts_JHhvxhWKPpJm_iR_p) [from a Crashed Unidentified Aerial Object (San Antonio, New Mexico, August 16, 1945),](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.theblackvault.com/casefiles/analysis-two-metallic-parts-purportedly-crashed-unidentified-aerial-object-san-antonio-new-mexico-august-16-1945/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727919297&usg=AOvVaw29A3AVQgUdFani3NNS4Sa4)” The Black Vault, February 1, 2017; Jacques Vallee and Paola Leopizzi Harris, Trinity: The Best-Kept Secret, StarWorksUSA, 2021; Kevin D. Randle, “[Trinity: The Best Kept Secret](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2021/06/trinity-best-kept-secret-critique.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727919600&usg=AOvVaw0QwCkYr7YXZo_ljMcXv558)[—A Critique,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2021/06/trinity-best-kept-secret-critique.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727919800&usg=AOvVaw0hpocltwqPcgUiB-Oh-xc-)” A Different Perspective, June 2, 2021; Jacques Vallée, “[The Other Lessons of Trinity,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://trinitysecret.com/the-other-lessons-of-trinity/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727920013&usg=AOvVaw3S4rK-DetUCxAPWNJEq_FJ)” Trinity blog, December 6, 2021; Kevin D. Randle, “[Jacques](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2021/12/jacques-vallee-and-ten-unexplained-ufo.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727920245&usg=AOvVaw1A6c5Ql6XFoCxF2EfvHaS2) [Vallée and Ten Unexplained UFO Cases and Metallic Debris,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2021/12/jacques-vallee-and-ten-unexplained-ufo.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727920487&usg=AOvVaw2Jlz-rwiCVvK3taMN_pkYV)” A Different Perspective, December 16, 2021)

August 21 — Manhattan Project physicist [Harry Daghlian](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_Daghlian&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727920761&usg=AOvVaw0is8RV3ENtvrZS6KabU7Mj) is conducting an after-hours experiment at the remote Omega Site of the Los Alamos Laboratory in New Mexico when his hand slips. The test assembly he has built—a ball of plutonium surrounded by tungsten carbide bricks—goes critical. He sees a momentary blue flash and is struck by a wave of gamma and neutron radiation amounting to more than 500 rem. He disassembles the experiment, walks away, and admits himself to medical care. He falls into a coma and dies on September 15, the first person to die accidentally from close exposure to nuclear fission. (Adam Higginbotham, Midnight at Chernobyl, Simon & Schuster, 2019, pp. 30–31)

August 28 — Twelve 5th Air Force intelligence specialists flying on a C-46 approaching Iwo Jima (in the Ogasawara Islands, Japan) see three white, teardrop-shaped objects paralleling the plane. Navigational needles go wild, the engine sputters, and the plane falters until the objects speed away. One of the passengers is future UFO investigator [Leonard Stringfield.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leonard_H._Stringfield&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727921214&usg=AOvVaw0PRaGLhfYJlkiLgsdsy4r3) (Stringfield, Situation Red, Fawcett Crest, 1977, pp. 9–10; Strange Company 191–193, 209–211; NICAP, “[C-46 Encounters Objects / Magnetic Compasses ‘West Wild’](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/450828iwojima_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727921566&usg=AOvVaw33Y29P2Se3ovjY5N4-GS69)”)

September — The first group of seven German rocket scientists arrive at Fort Strong in Boston harbor, Massachusetts, through Operation Overcast: [Wernher von Braun](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wernher_von_Braun&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727921912&usg=AOvVaw3zFqpuya-2-EINvJVHsXMC)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wernher_von_Braun&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727922091&usg=AOvVaw3ycqII7g1RdBPd27ejJ81c) Erich W. Neubert, Theodor A. Poppel, August Schultze, [Eberhard Rees](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eberhard_Rees&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727922295&usg=AOvVaw0fnIxZcYJ5zS_po5DLSrQX)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eberhard_Rees&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727922463&usg=AOvVaw1GFk3V_Bkrxck6KWe-9XUu) Wilhelm Jungert, and Walter Schwidetzky. By the end of the year, they and two other groups are moved to Fort Bliss, Texas, and White Sands, New Mexico, as “War Department Special Employees.” (Wikipedia, “[Operation Paperclip](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Paperclip%23Arrivals&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727922702&usg=AOvVaw2eNFcfRaxELxobD2NP19pL)”)

September — The US Army atomic bomb production unit, Z Division, named for its director, [Jerrold R. Zacharias](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jerrold_R._Zacharias&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727923002&usg=AOvVaw0b7aIjJQGLEIB7VOaEw_bR) from Los Alamos, New Mexico, moves to Oxnard Field, New Mexico, from Wendover Field \[now Airport\], Utah, to be closer to Los Alamos. This marks the beginning of Sandia Base \[now part of Kirtland AFB\]. Nearby Kirtland Field is used as a B-29 base for aircraft compatibility and drop tests. By October, all the staff and facilities at Wendover are transferred to Sandia. As reservist officers are demobilized, they are replaced by about 50 hand- picked regular officers. (Wikipedia, “[Manhattan Project](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manhattan_Project%23After_the_war&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727923374&usg=AOvVaw3Mwq9Tz7IvTTLXM3JeAQTC)”)

September — Policy adviser [Ferdinand Eberstadt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ferdinand_Eberstadt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727923655&usg=AOvVaw2TUav9EGCjWnl1gEVCfAew) writes for Secretary of the Navy [James Forrestal](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Forrestal&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727923887&usg=AOvVaw2F8jYLOQahD_3AmuiX_NeF) a report recommending a complete realignment of national security organizations. (Wikipedia, “[Eberstadt Report](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manhattan_Project%23After_the_war&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727924141&usg=AOvVaw1Y4l6PhGN2INN3Zqm32ANC)”)

September 20 — The OSS is dissolved by Executive Order, effective October 1, scattering personnel through the Departments of State and War. The Research and Analysis Branch is transferred to the State Department. The War Department takes over Secret Intelligence (SI) and Counter Espionage (X2), which are rolled up into the Strategic Services Unit (SSU) headed by Brig. Gen. [John Magruder](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Magruder_(Brigadier_General)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727924450&usg=AOvVaw2KGnB65F60GY-DWC9wph3U), the former OSS Deputy Director of Intelligence who oversees the OSS liquidation. Most of the other personnel are cashiered. September 26? — Night. Machinist Mate First Class George M. Kryling](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/134038168/gerald-m-kryling&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727925564&usg=AOvVaw3VvRBFvpjxm1noncL8A0y2) and his wife Thelma approach a bright light about 50 feet in the air and 20 feet from the road near some high-tension wires. McDonald](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/106278/major-general-george-c-mcdonald/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727925934&usg=AOvVaw3WgOpMM0_mPFMrrkyiBMMp), AAF director of intelligence, writes to Maj. Gen. December — Lt. Col. Jo Chamberlin’s article on foo fighters appears in American Legion Magazine. December 5 — A training flight (Flight 19) of five TBM Avenger torpedo bombers disappears while over the Atlantic Ocean. The squadron’s flight plan is scheduled to take them due east from Fort Lauderdale, Florida, for

141 miles, north for 73 miles, and then back over a final 140-mile leg to complete the exercise. The flight never returns to base. A report by Navy investigators concludes that flight leader Lt. [Charles C. Taylor](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/7071436/charles-carroll-taylor&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727928896&usg=AOvVaw1xN4-zDqP7Ke9ghEFKzdKI) mistook small islands offshore for the Florida Keys after his compasses stopped working, resulting in the flight heading over open sea and away from land. The report is later amended by the Navy to read “cause unknown” to avoid blaming Taylor for the loss of five aircraft and 14 men. One of the search-and-rescue aircraft deployed to look for them,

a PBM Mariner with a 13-man crew, also disappears. The report attributes the loss of the PBM aircraft to an explosion in midair while searching for the flight. According to contemporaneous sources, the Mariner has a history of explosions due to vapor leaks when heavily loaded with fuel, as it might have been for a potentially long search-and-rescue operation. A tanker off the coast of Florida sees an explosion and a widespread oil slick when fruitlessly searching for survivors. The weather is becoming stormy by the end of the incident. None of the Avenger bombers have been found. (Wikipedia, “[Flight 19](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flight_19&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727929303&usg=AOvVaw0_Y_Qrlop9RDEN_lVncueE)”; Larry Kusche, The Bermuda Triangle Mystery— Solved, Harper & Row, 1975, [pp. 97–122](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/bermudatriangle100kusc/page/96/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727929593&usg=AOvVaw14xo2w_ssL2XZFiCBiddjT); Larry Kusche, [The Disappearance of Flight 19](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/disappearanceoff00kusc&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727929796&usg=AOvVaw3tMmAM-raCYRTTx9wCLBqt)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/disappearanceoff00kusc&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727929962&usg=AOvVaw08QhhRwJCHCWDBfffZb1fW) Harper & Row, 1980)

1946

1946 — The US nuclear stockpile consists of 9 atomic bombs. (Ryan Crierie, “[U.S. Nuclear Stockpile, 1945–2009](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.alternatewars.com/BBOW/ABC_Weapons/US_Nuclear_Stockpile.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727930472&usg=AOvVaw1xS9vmf9JxBcyofTOwPAas)”) 

1946 — Dancers on the roof of a nightclub in Istanbul, Turkey, watch the rapid passage of four square-shaped lights,

reddish in color and aligned side by side, moving from the east and disappearing in the west in less than 60 seconds. One witness, meteorologist and RAF pilot George Raymond Leatherbarrow, estimates their altitude at 50,000 feet based on reflections on cirrus clouds. (G. R. Leatherbarrow, “[Two Early UFO Cases from the Middle](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520Kingdom/Awareness%2520(Contact%2520UK)/Awareness%2520-%25201976%2520-%2520Vol%252005%2520No%25203%2520-%2520Autumn.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727930833&usg=AOvVaw3PkkUZBSIDo4Q-4RP22zN_) [East,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520Kingdom/Awareness%2520(Contact%2520UK)/Awareness%2520-%25201976%2520-%2520Vol%252005%2520No%25203%2520-%2520Autumn.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727931101&usg=AOvVaw0lhHZl9b2w-wJuhlFQa-h-)” Awareness 5, no. 3 (Autumn 1976): 4–5; Clark III 1177)

1946 — American astrophysicist [Charles Greeley Abbot](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Greeley_Abbot&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727931443&usg=AOvVaw0BTFvMXcUrD6jBSN10-X93) writes that he thinks Earth might make contact with Venusians, coming into “fluent communication by wireless with a race brought up completely separate, having their own systems of government, social usages, religions, and surrounded by vegetation and animals entirely unrelated to any here on earth.” (Charles Greeley Abbot, The Earth and the Stars, Van Nostrand, 1946, [p. 110](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015074975395%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D150%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727931804&usg=AOvVaw2v1346DYA9Xn6Gd6ec9Tsc); Roger D. Launius, “[Venus-Earth-Mars: Comparative Climatology and the Search for Life in the Solar System,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.mdpi.com/2075-1729/2/3/255/htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727932018&usg=AOvVaw08Sv-QsNhyMxGAj1UXszDd)” Life 2, no. 3 (2012): 255–273)

1946 — A farmer named Gunyon in Westerham, Kent, England, calls the British Technical Intelligence staff asking that the Air Ministry come and remove one of these “darned contraptions” which has fallen on his farm. The intelligence officers ask for directions and are told to drive from Croydon to Westerham, turning onto a lane when they reach a pub called The White Dog. Amid great security, two staff cars are dispatched, but fail to find the farm. They locate a pub called The White Hart and a farmer named Bunyan, who strenuously denies having made the call. Although the incident appears to be a hoax, few people can reach the Technical Intelligence staff and convince them to make a field visit. Indeed, the intelligence officers believe that former Air Intelligence scientist [Reginald Victor Jones](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reginald_Victor_Jones&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727932418&usg=AOvVaw0_sf1Lv6cOyr8L3ReRAgwd), who has been skeptical of foo fighters and ghost rockets, is behind the affair. Jones writes that a signal is received from Gen. [Douglas MacArthur](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Douglas_MacArthur&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727932745&usg=AOvVaw2dGQ17551rEeDZ-83W8_wo)’s staff in Tokyo, asking for confirmation of a report that a Russian flying bomb had recently crashed in England. The other Director of Intelligence on the Air Staff, Air Commodore Roland Eugene Vintras, suggests to Jones that this might tie in with the “Westerham Incident.” (R.

V. Jones, Most Secret War, Hamish Hamilton, 1978, [pp. 507–513](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/mostsecretwar0000jone/page/506/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727933240&usg=AOvVaw3sJ7rBlRQ-m6fR5Xc_2dxQ); “[UFO Britannia: Part 2—World War Foo and](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.abovetopsecret.com/forum/thread909885/pg1&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727933464&usg=AOvVaw31ZByurhun8WBqfn3kMlHw) [Post War Cover Ups,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.abovetopsecret.com/forum/thread909885/pg1&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727933696&usg=AOvVaw1XjYzpGL3iw7AdIj1DOqF6)” Above Top Secret forum, December 19, 2012)

Schmitt, “Roswell and the Flying Wing,” IUR 18, no. 4 (July/Aug. 1993): 3; John Powell, “[The Horten](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.warbirdforum.com/horten.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727934576&usg=AOvVaw1iABfOPyyvxE10t9kQpvHJ) [Flying Wings,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.warbirdforum.com/horten.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727934787&usg=AOvVaw2p97VLhdxXGnOe5rcrcC-y)” War Bird Forum, July 2019)

January 18 — 11:00 p.m. A US C-54 transport plane is at 7,000 feet over the French countryside on its way to Paris, France. Suddenly the pilot sees a brilliant “shooting star” about 35° above the horizon. It streaks down below the eastern horizon, then reappears and moves in a hyperbola before falling again. (Loren E. January 22 — President [Truman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_S._Truman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727935702&usg=AOvVaw33RBQtoANW742_4s4K_8RW) creates a National Intelligence Authority (State, War, Navy, Chief of Staff, and a presidential representative with the DCI as a non-voting member) for policy and coordination and a Central Intelligence Group for operations under it. February 21 — 8:30 p.m. One or more meteors are seen in west Finland and the counties of Västerbotten, Västernorrland, Kopparberg \[now Dalarna\], Gävleborg, Uppsala, Östergötland, and Skaraborg \[now Västra Götaland\] in Sweden. It supposedly sets a farmhouse on fire in Vaasa province, Finland. It leaves a long trail of smoke in the sky. March 5 — 6:00 p.m. João Prestes is returning on foot from a fishery on the banks of the Tietê River to his sister’s home in Araçariguama, São Paulo, Brazil. As he is entering the house, a light from outside strikes and envelopes him. He becomes dizzy and confused but manages to get up and go inside. He summons Araci Gomide, a nurse who has served in the military with him. Gomide describes his friend as being literally cooked, with his flesh detaching from his bones, injuries on his feet and ankles, and his feet clenched like the claws of a bird. His arms are burned and the flesh on his fingers is falling off. His chest, neck, and face also seem to be burned but not charred or red. Prestes dies on the way to a hospital in Santana di Parnaíba at 3:00 a.m. (Clark III 166–167; Brazil 17–21; Pablo Villarubia Mauso, “[The Incredible Saga of João Prestes,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ufocasebook.com/prestes.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727937866&usg=AOvVaw2DqF2AxT7wkhumPXfDqZhU)” UFO Casebook)

March 6 — The Western Defense Command is deactivated. (Wikipedia, “[Western Defense Command](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ufocasebook.com/prestes.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727938186&usg=AOvVaw14lVnLwCJIJJN4OZKME0Un)”)

March 14 — Dusk. Paul Cummings Jr. is driving east on US Highway 136 about 10 miles east of Havana, Illinois, with Douglas Gowdy. A bright orange ball appears in the road about 1 mile ahead, gliding down the highway only one foot above the pavement and possibly touching both shoulders of the road. When it is within 2,000 feet, Cummings pulls the car over and stops, and they rush out to lie down in a ditch, fearing an explosion. When they look up again, the object is nowhere in sight. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, pp. 26–27)

April 2 — The Strategic Services Unit is transferred to the new Central Intelligence Group and becomes the Office of Special Operations. (Wikipedia, “[Strategic Services Unit](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strategic_Services_Unit&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727938661&usg=AOvVaw2tuPUPGMrTRyhZAUVfgVmL)”)

April 25 — While ice fishing at Anima Nipissing Lake, Ontario, Don Cameron and his family watch 12–14 small disc- shaped objects descend at a 45° angle about 75 feet away. They come spinning down on the ice, rise 2 feet into the air, then come down again. Cameron walks toward them, and they ascend and shoot away at the same angle and direction. They find black marks on the snow and ice. (Clark III 1179)

April or May — Around 12:00 noon. Richard R. Hill and Stanley Ogdrzyiak are driving in an open convertible on the Country Club Road near Lafayette, New York. Suddenly they see a gleaming, metallic, cigar-shaped object in the sky. It remains motionless at 5,000–10,000 feet altitude, which at that height would make it 300–400 feet long.

After 2 minutes, it disappears instantaneously. (“[Case 84,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/Orbit/ORBIT_Volume_II_1955-56_S.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727939096&usg=AOvVaw3nJSJABG-6dstZKKExQBH8)” CRIFO Newsletter 2, no. 3 (June 3, 1955): 4; Clark III

1179)

May — Day. Navy Lieutenant Andrew A. Titcomb is on leave and picking oranges at his wife’s family home at La Grange, north of Titusville, Florida, when he hears a whistling noise and sees a dark “flying football” directly overhead at about 1,000 feet elevation moving at 125 mph. It appears 15–20 feet in diameter and flies in an arc to the southeast. It disappears in a cloudbank. (UFOEv, [p. 6](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D18%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727939556&usg=AOvVaw0hVKMNLVaMdBoI_-5XArd3); Clark III 1179)

May 13 — The Soviets establish a rocket center called NII-88 \[now TsNIIMash\] at Kaliningrad \[now Korolyov\], Russia, northeast of Moscow. Missile designer [Sergei Korolev](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sergei_Korolev&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727939852&usg=AOvVaw2iQpQ-dd-LkmZcZ1_tLDfn) is appointed chief designer of Section 3 on long-range missiles. Stalin declares Korolev’s name a secret, which it remains until his death in 1966. Russia keeps dozens of its captured German scientists here, working on special projects until 1955. (Wikipedia, “[TsNIIMash](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TsNIIMash&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727940126&usg=AOvVaw3zp2iTbR9gVOazBgrO7B3k)”)

May 13 — A rocket is seen traveling over Helsinki, Finland, in a southwesterly direction at 1,000 feet. It supposedly moves at supersonic speed, emitting a magnesium-like light and a trail of smoke. (Jan L. Aldrich, comp., [The](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Books/Digitized_by_AFU/Aldrich%252C%2520Jan%2520-%2520The%2520Ghost%2520Rockets%2520File.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727940443&usg=AOvVaw1i_1UjeirjxJqJ8vD2L6wa) [Ghost Rocket File](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Books/Digitized_by_AFU/Aldrich%252C%2520Jan%2520-%2520The%2520Ghost%2520Rockets%2520File.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727940726&usg=AOvVaw0wi4Elh6drhm_u-Esc_Sl7)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Books/Digitized_by_AFU/Aldrich%252C%2520Jan%2520-%2520The%2520Ghost%2520Rockets%2520File.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727940945&usg=AOvVaw0xJAQZxPpcPXvfnj53f3Jo) Fund for UFO Research, 2000, p. 10)

May 18 — 10:45 p.m. [Gösta Carlsson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sv.wikipedia.org/wiki/G%25C3%25B6sta_Carlsson_(f%25C3%25B6retagare)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727941272&usg=AOvVaw3oDsWlNAAWY8ObJg_-iRIT)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sv.wikipedia.org/wiki/G%25C3%25B6sta_Carlsson_(f%25C3%25B6retagare)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727941459&usg=AOvVaw1qf-ICrllQBp8RvdpE9I7e) later to become founder and owner of Cernelle AB, is walking in the forested area of Kronoskagen near Ängelholm, Sweden, when he sees a disc-shaped machine more than 50 feet in diameter. On

* * *

the top is a cupola with oval windows, and beneath it are an oblong “fan,” two legs, a small ladder, and openings. A man dressed in a white, one-piece outfit gestures to Carlsson to stop. Two other occupants, three of them women, all wearing suits and transparent helmets, are nearby. One of the males points a boxlike device at the witness, who leaves the scene but returns by a different route 30 minutes later, just in time to see the UFO depart. A concrete model of the UFO is dedicated in 1963 as a memorial. (Wikipedia, “[UFO-Memorial Ängelholm](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UFO-Memorial_%25C3%2584ngelholm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727941861&usg=AOvVaw3cHYEtipyHw_43OU_TpSsB)”; Sven-Olof Fredrickson, “[The Ängelholm Landing Report,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201972%2520V%252018%2520N%25202.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727942100&usg=AOvVaw2sJlkvwaJz8BX_GXNr4YQ4)” Flying Saucer Review 18, no. 2 (Mar./Apr. 1972): 15– 17; Anders Liljegren, “[High-Quality Investigation of 1946 CEIII Case,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Sweden/AFU%2520Newsletter%2520(AFU)/AFU%2520Newsletter%2520-%2520No%252038%2520-%25201995.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727942423&usg=AOvVaw0De5GAdyfObFwPYVZRlJwF)” AFU Newsletter, no. 38 (March 1995): 2–3; Clark III 528–529; Clas Svahn, “[Gösta Carlssons möte,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ufo.se/index.php/gosta-carlsson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727942709&usg=AOvVaw3R4_y_BWIugsKxoOKMlAJf)” Riksorganisationen UFO-Sverige, July 10, 2018; Håkan Blomqvist, “[UFO-Sweden Memories: Ängelholm 1996,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://blomqvist62.rssing.com/chan-38075447/latest-article16-live.php&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727942938&usg=AOvVaw0kFSrXCr2lbrBLBkjDM-Bx)” Håkan Blomqvist’s Blog, July 1, 2020; Clas Svahn and Gösta Carlsson, Mötet i gläntan: Sveriges mest kända närkontakt med UFO, 3rd ed., Parthenon, 2021)

May 21 — Two motorists report an elongated craft resembling a rocket or Zeppelin over Stora Mellösa, Sweden. One of the witnesses sees two short wings, although the other cannot see any despite watching the object for 5 minutes. (Swords 12)

May 24 — 2:20 a.m. Witnesses in Landskrona, Sweden, see a wingless, cigar-shaped object, spurting sparks from its tail. About 300 feet above the ground, it is moving at airplane speed toward the southwest. (Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727943406&usg=AOvVaw2Bw_qOyxbyoTAbZSrY4LKQ) [History: 1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727943646&usg=AOvVaw09Wj8Ljx7BvRBVeYUmjAsp), The Author, 1988 ed., p. 1; Göran Jansson, “[Spökraketerna 1947,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.zenza.se/spokraketerna1946.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727943896&usg=AOvVaw1HOCIQC-v9AWaD_pTWZHYI)” January 2005, p. 6)

May 28 — The Aftonbladet newspaper in Stockholm, Sweden, is the first to use the term “Spökraket” (ghost rocket) in a headline. (Swords 12)

May 31 — 11:43 a.m. A huge, metallic, wingless cigar moves rapidly at 1,000 feet altitude over Katrineholm, Sweden. (Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History: 1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727944376&usg=AOvVaw0n2LXyVrw82LWH-xgjErnK), The Author, 1988 ed., pp. 2–3)

Summer — Late evening. Two women on a walk in Johannesburg, South Africa, see an aerial object hovering 5 feet above the roof of a nearby hotel. It is shaped like a saucer with a round, golden ball in the center, evenly split between the top and bottom sections. They hear a clicking noise, and the ball drops through the saucer until it is level with the roof. More clicks are heard, and the ball rises through and above the saucer 8–9 feet. In the space between the ball and the disc the witnesses see two figures larger than normal height (7 feet), fair-complexioned and broad-shouldered, with short wavy hair. They are wearing white uniforms with stiff collars and stand motionless until the object floats away and is lost to view. (John Judge, “[Near-Landing in 1946 in Johannesburg,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201979%2520V%252024%2520N%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727944807&usg=AOvVaw0GTzZuREtcpY5JRlqI7XM4)” Flying Saucer Review 24, no. 5 (March 1979): 14–16; Clark III 266)

Summer — Day. Eleanor Hancock is in Colorado Springs, Colorado, looking southwest toward Cheyenne Mountain when two shining silver objects appear, moving rapidly in tandem from east to west toward the escarpment. Just before they reach the mountain, they turn sharply upward, still in formation, and disappear. (Clark III 1179)

June 6 — The Joint Research and Development Board is created by the Secretaries of War and the Navy to coordinate research efforts. (Joint Research and Development Board, [Organization Authority Record,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://catalog.archives.gov/id/10482179&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727945237&usg=AOvVaw0vNDCxNqztKyU2yOh1Uu0O) June 6, 1946)

June 9 — Night. An enormous light drops earthward over Sala, Sweden, leaving a long, fiery trail. An explosion is heard.

(Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History: 1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727945613&usg=AOvVaw0L0-_UFQTAwg2S9iO1jw7a), The Author, 1988 ed., p. 3)

June 9 — 10:17 p.m. A rocket-like light passes over Helsinki, Finland, at 10,000 feet leaving a smoke trail and making a distant rumble. A luminous afterglow lasts 10 minutes. (Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History: 1946, the Ghost](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727945953&usg=AOvVaw15dAbT6sRjG1Sh-Sf2_0Oi) [Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727946187&usg=AOvVaw2sP9OKPju7oP7ZGFRgVead)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727946408&usg=AOvVaw0Uo29UwOjtuKG0Vh4fp93g) The Author, 1988 ed., p. 3)

June 10 — Lieut. Gen. [Hoyt Vandenberg](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hoyt_Vandenberg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727946826&usg=AOvVaw3bdfro6tyYxir63d8l4OVf) replaces [Souers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sidney_Souers&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727947123&usg=AOvVaw1Q4qKj0_re9-MzzGnMCM-w) as director of the CIG. He expands it and wins the right to collect intelligence in Latin America. (CIA Historical Staff, [Chronology 1946–65](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://jfkfacts.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/CIA-Historical-Staff-Chronology-Volume-1-1946-55.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727947402&usg=AOvVaw1utV7Xb7wiyaonlMMkqZ-M)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://jfkfacts.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/CIA-Historical-Staff-Chronology-Volume-1-1946-55.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727947622&usg=AOvVaw3SHG5kf4IzhPSkuW2rWMt3) vol. 1, 1946–1955, p. 9)

June 12 — The Swedish Defense staff secretly orders reports of unknown rockets to be collected by military and civilian defense units in Sweden. (Anders Liljegren and Clas Svahn, “The Ghost Rockets,” UFOs 1947–1987, Fortean Tomes, 1987, p. 33)

June 18 — A first-strike scenario, the Pincher war plan, is created by the US military to strike Moscow and the Caucasus with 50 nuclear weapons if the Soviets invade the Middle East. It is never officially approved, but the Joint Chiefs agree to use it for planning purposes. (Phillip S. Meilinger, “[The Early War Plans,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.airforcemag.com/article/1212war/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727948081&usg=AOvVaw3PKOQO3NxbD6uarCZtXbyn)” Air Force Magazine, December 1, 2012)

June 25 — A four-engine Northrop XB-35 flying wing bomber makes its first test flight from Jack Northrop Field \[now Hawthorne Municipal Airport\] to Muroc Army Air Field \[now Edwards AFB\] in California. (Wikipedia, “[Northrop YB-35](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northrop_YB-35%23XB-35&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727948457&usg=AOvVaw2qsK8qxUOa4fG2afmcdq6B)”)

June 26 — The commander of the military district in Morjärv, Sweden, issues instructions on how to report incidents with “certain kind of light phenomena’ that might be associated with “tests made by foreign powers with guided weapons.” (Swords 12).

* * *

July — Amazing Stories publishes four short articles in its September 1945 issue by William C. Hefferlin, each describing a wonderful new invention that has come to the author, according to editor [Ray Palmer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raymond_A._Palmer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727948964&usg=AOvVaw3xeUyCAznR6e7g9o7i5met)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raymond_A._Palmer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727949149&usg=AOvVaw2ZIFvqaAD2sJ-aGAKwiQCs) “from Tibet by mental telepathy.” One of the inventions is a “circle-winged airplane.” In later issues, Hefferlin and his wife Gladys go on to describe the Rainbow City, an underground Martian city beneath Antarctica where the flying saucers originate. (“[A Description of Rainbow City from the Hefferlin Manuscript (Hollow Earth)](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.bibliotecapleyades.net/tierra_hueca/esp_tierra_hueca_26.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727949442&usg=AOvVaw3agZsxSlJrdOTofHK84QeV)”; Walter Kafton- Minkel, Subterranean Worlds, Loompanics, 1989, [pp. 160–167](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/subterraneanworldswalterkaftonminkel100000yearsofdragonsdwarfsthedeadlostracesufosfrominsidetheearth/page/n163/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727949821&usg=AOvVaw3IXnF9x5b7wDt3OtVousuO); Clark III 610)

July — Day. A long, silver-colored cigar appears suddenly out of the haze over Crane Beach, Ipswich, Massachusetts, moves noiselessly over the water, then disappears suddenly. (Lore and Deneault, [p. 148](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/mysteriesofskies0000lore/page/148/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727950146&usg=AOvVaw3gnr_m_1IyqtT6G-46R-qU); Clark III 1179)

July — 2:00 p.m. Hans Sorensen is cycling near Viskinge, Denmark, when he sees three discs flying silently overhead. The underside is uneven and dull gray, but they are like “polished mirrors” on top. (Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727950458&usg=AOvVaw1dF7hxZ1rGbO1JFwQyuNkY) [History: 1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727950706&usg=AOvVaw0A3i-bLXOGHQC_pbZof8KD), The Author, 1988 ed., p. 16)

July 1 — Able nuclear test, Bikini Atoll, Marshall Islands. Radio-controlled autopilots are installed in eight B-17 bombers, converting them into remote-controlled drones that are then loaded with automatic cameras, radiation detectors, and air sample collectors. Their pilots operate them from mother planes at a safe distance from the detonation. The drones can fly into Able’s mushroom cloud, which would have been lethal to crew members. (Wikipedia, “[Operation Crossroads](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Crossroads&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727951064&usg=AOvVaw3_cJ9TsqhTTD4HT-rmOkO4)”)

July 3 — The Joint Research and Development Board is established. Essentially it is [Vannevar Bush](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vannevar_Bush&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727951335&usg=AOvVaw2USzYoSYsrrH0d-kJMdJpk)’s existing cadre of brain trust from the still active Office of Scientific Research and the postwar Joint New Weapons Committee. Added to this are other reconstituted R&D committees and advisers like [Lloyd Berkner](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lloyd_Berkner&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727951557&usg=AOvVaw0pV1gSdndphP8_VL6fcvFP) of the Carnegie Institution of Washington. The original founding members are physicist [Alfred Lee Loomis](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alfred_Lee_Loomis&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727951790&usg=AOvVaw26Qpzr3IA7GAPfoB64RFp5), biologist [Caryl Parker Haskins](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caryl_Parker_Haskins&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727951991&usg=AOvVaw21oZUtCrh3cGbElA1kUbZ1), physicist [Luis Walter Alvarez](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luis_Walter_Alvarez&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727952195&usg=AOvVaw1jCbfqMDCRx2lcz7F_IkCk)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luis_Walter_Alvarez&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727952364&usg=AOvVaw2gxTWE2Y0t6scc-LaVFQ7z) physicist [William Shockley](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Shockley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727952564&usg=AOvVaw3blE-JCCcvCtmFnB_s9rNB), and [George Doriot](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Georges_Doriot&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727952763&usg=AOvVaw2hS8tPPkvQy0B-qsgY7Vkr). Two military representatives each from the Army, Navy, and Air Force complete the board’s membership. Counting Bush, this makes a board of 12. (Michael Hall and Wendy Connors, “The Research and Development Board: Unanswered Questions,” IUR 26, no. 2 (Summer 2001): 7–8)

July 6 — A special ghost rocket investigations committee is formed with Col. [Bengt Jacobsson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sv.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bengt_Jacobsson_(milit%25C3%25A4r)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727953111&usg=AOvVaw14HsN9i6eGF6AlRkCVpx-1) from the Royal Swedish Air Force Materiel Administration as chairman. Other members are [Henry Kjellson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sv.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henry_Kjellson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727953351&usg=AOvVaw1uVTh19hBkuslH0EfFlX7V) and Eric Malmberg from the Air Administration; Maj. Nils Ahlgren and Capt. [Gerdt Stangenberg](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sv.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gerdt_Stangenberg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727953742&usg=AOvVaw2XKe6tWp6OtFo6WiKR-h8c) from the Air Defense department; chemist [Gustaf Ljunggren](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gustaf_Ljunggren_(chemist)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727953979&usg=AOvVaw2kRO4X6IicJTdu9Km8zW_k); physicist [Martin Fehrm](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Martin_Fehrm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727954187&usg=AOvVaw23nnFnVcQO3lJl8cAI0H1C); and [Olof Kempe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sv.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olof_Kempe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727954382&usg=AOvVaw1PMPlE9KmMoCiawsj_kuok) from the Defense Radio Institute. They hold at least 12 meetings, beginning on July 10. (Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History: 1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727954643&usg=AOvVaw1c9HW-ojqE-NfG2FsDM-jc), The Author, 1988 ed., p. 13; Anders Liljegren and Clas Svahn, “The Ghost Rockets,” UFOs 1947–1987, Fortean Tomes, 1987,

p. 33; Swords 12)

July 6 — Astronomer [Bertil Lindblad](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bertil_Lindblad&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727955113&usg=AOvVaw0kK8yLDLjZAvA2nElQhTGE)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bertil_Lindblad&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727955293&usg=AOvVaw0E8tOT7q650Wz10CDH5L7H) after consulting with the Swedish Defense staff on ghost rocket reports, remarks that the “adjective ‘cigar-shaped’ is something new.” (Anders Liljegren and Clas Svahn, “The Ghost Rockets,” UFOs 1947–1987, Fortean Tomes, 1987, p. 33)

July 9 — A journalist finds three dubious fist-size fragments, one of iron and the other two slag-like, after a bright projectile is seen over a beach at Njurunda, Sweden. (Göran Jansson, “[Spökraketerna 1947,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.zenza.se/spokraketerna1946.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727955684&usg=AOvVaw2oTedebfBEyPuMY_X-VX36)” January 2005, p. 12; Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History: 1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727955916&usg=AOvVaw0tSaqs4z3bKxqCD_C39WDl), The Author, 1988 ed., p. 14)

July 9 — 2:30 p.m. [Erik and Asa Reuterswärd](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sv.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erik_Reutersw%25C3%25A4rd&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727956220&usg=AOvVaw2-IaIOO4Ni5FGUGrZsrBG_) take a photo of a greenish-white daylight meteor by a lake at Guldsmedshyttan, northwest of Lindesberg, Sweden. They are atop a forest watchtower and have a good view of the object. The image is circulated to newspapers throughout Sweden; however, the photo probably shows an unusual daylight meteor, not a ghost rocket. (Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History: 1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727956507&usg=AOvVaw1NwwMqCl5mxhlmQxRuV1sV)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727956706&usg=AOvVaw1XTnFv75xTSBXtuRESD3vr) The Author, 1988 ed., pp. 12–13; Clas Svahn, “The 1946 Ghost Rocket Photo,” \`IUR 27, no. 3 (Fall 2002): 12–14, 23; Swords 13–14; Clas Svahn, “[Spökraketerna: Den Största Gåtan,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ufo.se/index.php/fakta/arti/verkligheten-bakom-ufopodden-i-p3/1611-spoekraketerna&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727957042&usg=AOvVaw3lSBRjC6uFXoi2uUu8eJQ_)” Riksorganisationen UFO-Sverige, March 7, 2017)

July 9 — 2:30 p.m. Two people on the north side of Vaxön, Sweden, watch a glowing white object with a blue-white tail streak across the sky in about 2 seconds, disappearing to the southeast. Around the same time, a witness at Järna Station in Södertälje sees an object “like a glass flask in a thermos” descending from a high altitude. (Loren E.
