Gross, [UFO’s, a History: 1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727957412&usg=AOvVaw1zldXDMuaMk7J64g97-MHj)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727957608&usg=AOvVaw3OAbKtc1KdDXZFg74IyWYj) The Author, 1988 ed., p. 6)

July 9 — 2:30 p.m. A member of the US legation sees a silent ghost rocket falling rapidly over Stockholm, Sweden, according to a July 11 telegram from State Department official [Christian M. Ravndal](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/local/1984/10/28/cm-ravndal-ex-ambassador-dies-in-austria/bac979d2-d6fb-4c27-9ec3-beabb8db76bb/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727957968&usg=AOvVaw1EW5uIotpScAyG66SfZ7-2) to Washington, D.C. Hundreds of other observations take place over central Sweden. Ravndal suggests that the Soviets are trying to intimidate the Swedes. (Göran Jansson, “[Spökraketerna 1947,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.zenza.se/spokraketerna1946.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727958224&usg=AOvVaw0WFUC3lao5b7S3AeHbMwvk)” January 2005, p.11; Clark III 524, 527; Good Above, [p. 20](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/20/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727958434&usg=AOvVaw3qcdtx_Wma7T09RvOaEiEj); Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History: 1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727958667&usg=AOvVaw0jsIRbUaOHZq5bPjajOHop), The Author, 1988 ed., p.p. 6, betw. 12–13)

* * *

July 9 — 2:35 p.m. Efrain Johnson sees a strange, cigar- or sugarloaf-shaped object to the east of Ockelbo, Sweden. It shines like silver and appears “like some glistening mass.” It falls to the ground and is gone in a few moments. (Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History: 1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727959083&usg=AOvVaw2jI-D7UAT9JQWw98WJ6xRl), The Author, 1988 ed., p. 6)

July 9 — About 3:00 p.m. A housewife near Sörbo, Sweden, is washing on the shore of Södra Barken when she sees a falling object coming from the northeast. It changes color from blue to green and has a long tail. It tumbles into the lake about 320 feet away. (Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History: 1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727959432&usg=AOvVaw2CNCEBJkdpCHl_DGZ3NLTr)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727959649&usg=AOvVaw0qTnGX4OZIIp7KDXlQZw0e) The Author, 1988 ed., pp. 6–7)

July 9 — 3:30 p.m. A young man in Mockfjärd, Sweden, sees a silver-colored star diving toward the ground with a whistling noise. It comes down about 490 feet away from him, and he is blinded by the intense light. He thinks it crashes into Mt. Landholm. A powerful burning smell lingers for 15 minutes. (Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727959989&usg=AOvVaw2w5SwNMH3txuA_QG-UxqeA) [1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727960216&usg=AOvVaw0aSjUVo-aKhJz3deZPGQJx)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727960406&usg=AOvVaw38WYiY-IjaamkztH5pc9J_) The Author, 1988 ed., p. 7)

July 9 — 3:35 p.m. Many people see a bright red, rocket-like object moving swiftly over Turku, Finland, and leaving a short trail. It casts shadows on the ground. (Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History: 1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727960731&usg=AOvVaw1a90F_bTBePLdX5RPVFcnD)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727960919&usg=AOvVaw2dgn9QKL5sw453H4aLmpe7) The Author, 1988 ed., p. 7)

July 10 — A brilliantly glowing projectile trailing luminous smoke crashes into a beach near Norrvikssand, Sweden.

Airline pilot Torvald Linden and other witnesses find a shallow crater a little more than 3 feet in diameter. A mass of slag-like material, some of it reduced to powder (which burns the hands when touched) is found at the site and collected into bags. A journalist from Svenska Dagbladet on July 11 finds a “burnt-brown object with a hollow cylinder” with a diameter of about 1–2 inches. Military authorities take over the site. The debris is taken to Dr. B. Backlund at a laboratory in Kubikenborg, who finds it contains paper with microscopic black-and-white squares like a screen. Some porous, rust-colored fragments are also present. The same day, the beach is visited by Lt. Col. [Rudberg](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sv.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erik_Rudberg_(milit%25C3%25A4r)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727961424&usg=AOvVaw3L9IADl2jD_1OjlqeCTsso), Capt. C. Ljungdahl, and Capt. R. Westlin, who conclude that the material has been in the area for a long time. (Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History: 1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727961678&usg=AOvVaw0vuvvTITNv6cfJMTUs7C9l), The Author, 1988 ed., pp. 10–12)

July 10 — 2:30 p.m. A bluish flying cigar 10–12 times the diameter of the full moon in length passes over Stockholm, Sweden. (Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History: 1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727962060&usg=AOvVaw1tIXzykQIjcd2G5Q4Tf6js), The Author, 1988 ed., p. 9)

July 12 — Swedish Intelligence agrees to cooperate in sharing ghost rocket information with the British military attaché in Stockholm, Sweden, Maj. de Salis. (Swords 20)

July 12 — Day. The railway station master at Gryon, Vaud, Switzerland, is watching a B-24 Liberator flying overhead at 15,000 feet when he also sees a “flying bomb” looking like a big star traveling northeast at about 250 mph. (Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History: 1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727962496&usg=AOvVaw1F8ssQH517LDGO-ptaCfTq)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727962718&usg=AOvVaw1Rm8gMQaZARN9Ae6BYJdLc) The Author, 1988 ed., p. 14)

July 12 — 10:00 p.m. Inga Eriksson is in her garden in Usta, Örebro, Sweden, when she hears a sharp, sizzling sound in the air and sees three silvery triangular objects traveling horizontally from east to west. They are visible only for 2 seconds, but her mother notes that the electrical power has gone out in their home. (AFU case file)

July 15 — The Swedes provide the British attaché with analytical reports of all observations to date. (Swords 20)

July 16 –18 — US Secretary of the Navy [James Forrestal](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Forrestal&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727963149&usg=AOvVaw3j6t_RSs-NtfpGw121GBCR) makes an unexpected visit to Stockholm, Sweden, to meet with the Swedish Defense Minister [Allan Vougt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sv.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allan_Vougt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727963381&usg=AOvVaw0ud63KbfaWMZvV8US9Le07) and two members of the special committee on ghost rockets. (Anders Liljegren and Clas Svahn, “The Ghost Rockets,” UFOs 1947–1987, Fortean Tomes, 1987, p. 35)

July 18 — Two British intelligence officers arrive in Stockholm to meet with their counterparts in Sweden. One is from the Air Ministry (Squadron Leader Barrie Heath) and the other (Maj. Malone) is from MI10(a), a branch of the Directorate of Military Intelligence. (Swords 20)

July 18 — 12:00 noon. Sigvat Skaug and his son, who live along Lake Mjøsa in southeastern Norway, and his sister Åse Tandberg watch two rocket-like objects about 7 feet long pass over their heads at a very low altitude. They fall simultaneously into the lake, throwing the water several feet into the air. The objects look like V-1 rockets and come in low from the west at about 150 feet, causing the trees to sway. They fall into the lake about 1.2 miles from the western shore and 4.3 miles from Minnesund. (NICAP, “[‘Ghost Rocket’ Crashes into Lake](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/460718norway_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727963851&usg=AOvVaw0KqHqh-bRKxRg4MYBia62V)”; Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History: 1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727964091&usg=AOvVaw2Sbg0LmYU-J6IyXBjS6tC2)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727964284&usg=AOvVaw3YQGnYBSXyVBYZ9c32GO2N) The Author, 1988 ed., pp. 18–19; Göran Jansson, “[Spökraketerna 1947,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.zenza.se/spokraketerna1946.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727964521&usg=AOvVaw3iXK1U7wmk1gFQDRzVpsWR)” January 2005, pp. 19–20; Clas Svahn and Anders Liljegren, “[The Kölmjärv Ghost Rocket](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Sweden/AFU%2520Newsletter%2520(AFU)/AFU%2520Newsletter%2520-%2520No%252027%2520-%25201984.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727964830&usg=AOvVaw3MNrYV6W-Zo7fFfDy9XdQ_) [Crash Revisited,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Sweden/AFU%2520Newsletter%2520(AFU)/AFU%2520Newsletter%2520-%2520No%252027%2520-%25201984.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727965115&usg=AOvVaw2PIAKxQKJct2ZRP88Qr_rr)” AFU Newsletter 27 (Jan./Dec. 1984): 1–5; Swords 16; Clark III 526)

July 18 — Three workers see a ghost rocket above Ortviken, Sweden. Shortly afterward, Gunnar Falck watches a silvery cylinder moving over the northern part of Sundsvall. (Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History: 1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727965498&usg=AOvVaw3XCxxfL6hayT5Q6ynzzFk6), The Author, 1988 ed., p. 17)

July 19 — 11:15 a.m. In the village of Bölebyn, Sweden, Leonard Danielsson and his sons Kjell, Dan, and Hans see an “aeroplane” moving against the wind to the southwest. The boys say it looks like a large, metallic milk canister. It travels from horizon to horizon in about 20 minutes before disappearing in the northwest. (Swords 17)

July 19 — 11:30 a.m. Kurt Larsson, 11, is fishing at the north end of Lake Kattisträsket, Sweden, when he hears a roaring sound. A huge column of water rises out of the lake as if a mine has detonated. Military officers from Boden

* * *

investigate, but the lake is too muddy to send in a diver. They conclude that whatever fell is buried in 15 feet of mud. (Swords 24)

July 19 — 11:45 a.m. Many witnesses see a gray, winged rocket crash into Lake Kölmjärv, Sweden, with a loud bang close to the southwest bank. Knut Lindbäck says it generates a high plume of water when it hits the surface, “followed by another cascade as if something had detonated.” Water lilies and other aquatic plants are torn up and thrown on the shore. Lieut. Karl-Gösta Bartoll from the Boden engineer corps arrives the next day to supervise the salvage operation. Engineers Roland Rynniger and lab technician Torsten Wilner from the Defense Research Department also arrive with a Geiger counter. A three-week search turns up no traces of metal, even though the evidence points to an underwater explosion. (NICAP, “[‘Ghost Rocket’ Crashes into Lake](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/460719sweden_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727966198&usg=AOvVaw1O8LkS1h7q1i5OFu12KD4G)”; Göran Jansson, “[Spökraketerna 1947,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.zenza.se/spokraketerna1946.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727966413&usg=AOvVaw1PdBi6zY9PQ0Aes-X0h9WB)” January 2005, pp. 20–26; Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History: 1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727966655&usg=AOvVaw3tNRhPt3hRBtuDySjyUZG3)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727966847&usg=AOvVaw2uj5mfrxNUiKbqRckSIu0r) The Author, 1988 ed., pp. 20, 76; Clas Svahn and Anders Liljegren, “[The Kölmjärv Ghost Rocket Crash Revisited,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Sweden/AFU%2520Newsletter%2520(AFU)/AFU%2520Newsletter%2520-%2520No%252027%2520-%25201984.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727967137&usg=AOvVaw2Su9r7Tnbw1_LSVmYnYyvp)” AFU Newsletter 27 (Jan./Dec. 1984): 1–5; Swords 17–20, 24; Clark III 525, 526)

July 19 — 3:00 p.m. Karl and Tyra Axberg are sitting on the porch of their cabin on Lake Vassarajärvi in Norrbotten County, Sweden, when they hear a loud noise. A projectile comes in at a very low angle and hits the water at a 30° angle, continuing underwater for about 600 feet. A military team led by Karl-Gösta Bartoll can find no trace of a “ghost bomb.” (Swords 24–25)

July 19 — 3:40 p.m. Ingrid Hansson is sunbathing with her father on a floating jetty at the northern end of Lake Marmen, near Sunnanå, Sweden. She hears a violent roaring over the water and looks up to see an object bouncing along the surface, stirring up a wake. The object has created a water column 66 feet high upon impact. (Swords 25)

July 19 — Maj. Gen. [George C. McDonald](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/106278/major-general-george-c-mcdonald/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727967728&usg=AOvVaw3HGIuQMVC5jBFDUa06Sa9a) prepares a memorandum for the Commander of the Army Air Forces Gen. [Carl Spaatz](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Spaatz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727967979&usg=AOvVaw0alTFnR-cTn_-CmvtW-pm7) on reports of “rockets” over Scandinavian countries. (Jan L. Aldrich, comp., [The Ghost Rocket File](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Books/Digitized_by_AFU/Aldrich%252C%2520Jan%2520-%2520The%2520Ghost%2520Rockets%2520File.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727968269&usg=AOvVaw1vswsmmQbGKDEpxd-YOpD_), Fund for UFO Research, 2000, pp. 9–11)

July 24 — 1:20 p.m. Engineer Tennlund sees a small cigar-shaped object with a pair of small wings south of Vålberg, Värmland, Sweden. It comes from the direction of Norway (west) at great speed with no sound. Tennlund thinks it crashes into Vänern lake. (Anders Liljegren and Clas Svahn, “The Ghost Rockets,” UFOs 1947–1987, Fortean Tomes, 1987, p. 35)

July 25 — The Swedish military states that ghost rockets are not meteors. (Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History: 1946, the](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727968751&usg=AOvVaw05ItHt6dZ7jELhC4AMGEBt) [Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727968973&usg=AOvVaw22uHCU1EtnYxwd0V4k1Gcm)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727969171&usg=AOvVaw1fEaYTKIfUdxiAK110THZg) The Author, 1988 ed., p. 23)

July 25 — Baker nuclear test, Bikini Atoll in the Marshall Islands. (Wikipedia, “[Operation Crossroads](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Crossroads%23Test_Baker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727969477&usg=AOvVaw2YNpUOzRKTNM6vwIMqx3Qn)”; Fran Ridge, “[The](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/ncp/ncp-ridge10.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727969685&usg=AOvVaw2WPq4Sh6_w8985bXfIjEJk) [Baker Blast: Cause for Alarm?](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/ncp/ncp-ridge10.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727969891&usg=AOvVaw2A8RslPimWV2n2tLqLpHY3)” May 4, 2013)

July 27 — British Air Attaché Capt. Henderson informs the Foreign Office in London, England, that cooperation with Swedish Air Staff should be kept from the Americans. (David Clarke and Andy Roberts, Out of the Shadows, Piatkus, 2002; Joel Carpenter, “[Guided Missiles and UFOs: A Tangle of Fear, 1937–53, Part Two](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/gr/grchron2.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727970231&usg=AOvVaw3Kb9Rfpm51UMb5A_2HIX50)”; Swords 20)

July 28 — Night. Sections of Oslo, Norway, are shaken by two violent aerial explosions. An “intense white light” accompanies the blasts. (London Daily Telegraph, July 29, 1946; Clark III 526)

July 29 — Norway begins censoring ghost rocket reports just as Sweden is doing. (Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727970631&usg=AOvVaw0etqKHldxOnWjvUwq-z3i2) [1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727970875&usg=AOvVaw3Mtlnf1f89Nr8FlE8hXa4m)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727971070&usg=AOvVaw1beoAIkJtyVzpOlWwIIQ9n) The Author, 1988 ed., p. 25)

July 30 — 1:15 p.m. Two objects shaped like dark crosses are seen in the sky over Filipstad, Värmland, Sweden. (Anders Liljegren and Clas Svahn, “The Ghost Rockets,” UFOs 1947–1987, Fortean Tomes, 1987, p. 35)

July 30 — 3:12 p.m. William Jorgensen, a soldier at the fort at Oskar-Fredriksborg, Stockholm, Sweden, sees a silent flying object with short wings at a distance of about 6,560 feet. It is moving faster than a jet aircraft. (Anders Liljegren and Clas Svahn, “The Ghost Rockets,” UFOs 1947–1987, Fortean Tomes, 1987, p. 35)

July 30 — 5:00 p.m. A customs officer on the Norway-Sweden border watches a silvery torpedo with short wings. The object moves in from the south but changes direction with a sharp turn and continues east with a whining sound. (Anders Liljegren and Clas Svahn, “The Ghost Rockets,” UFOs 1947–1987, Fortean Tomes, 1987, p. 35)

August — Day. Charles A. Johnson is driving on US Highway 41 along Lake Michigan north of Chicago, Illinois, when he sees three silver discs going from east to west in a triangular formation. (Clark III 1179)

August — 8:30 p.m. A young man sees a pan-shaped object near a road in Sint-Niklaas, Belgium. A small entity holding an acacia branch is nearby. The being enters the object through an opening on the underside. Afterward, traces of burning on the ground are detected. (Center for UFO Studies, [HUMCAT Index 1940–1949](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/HUMCAT/HUMCAT_Index_1940-1949.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727971894&usg=AOvVaw3HaJAOoffYiwg4N_DL1fYi), p. 20; Clark III 266)

Early August — An astronomer and meteorologist is looking at some clouds through a telescope in Stockholm, Sweden, and sees a luminous object that he estimates is about 90 feet long, torpedo-shaped, and metallic. It has a “tapered tail that spewed glowing blue and green smoke and a series of fire balls.” The object explodes with a terrific flash. (“[Sweden Plans Radar Fight on ‘Rockets,’](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/22475643/the-los-angeles-times/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727972207&usg=AOvVaw3JQw3yqvb-NBVbgUZbrORh)” Los Angeles Times, August 13, 1946, p. 1; Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727972490&usg=AOvVaw2ud4XkiGvom12qbg2MT7_T) [History: 1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727972752&usg=AOvVaw3ZenTjjhEWjXutMD3GW0HE), The Author, 1988 ed., p. 39)

* * *

August 1 — President [Truman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_S._Truman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727973115&usg=AOvVaw2AFfxBd2DUsf-TB4RGR9P3) signs the Atomic Energy Act, transferring the control of atomic energy from military to civilian hands, effective on January 1, 1947. It categorizes information on atomic energy as “born classified,” even if it is not created by any US government agency. “Restricted Data” is not a level of classification; rather, a document can be classified as Confidential, Secret, or Top Secret, while also containing Restricted Data. In addition, a document containing Restricted Data can also contain Critical Nuclear Weapon Design Information. In this way, a document can be classified as Secret (S), Secret//Restricted Data (S//RD), or Secret//Restricted Data- Critical Nuclear Weapon Design Information (S//RD-CNWDI), depending on the type of information it contains. (Wikipedia, “[United States Atomic Energy Commission](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Atomic_Energy_Commission&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727973757&usg=AOvVaw2qirBzpeOWgOCDCEqRX7Sg)”)

August 1 — [Truman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_S._Truman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727974154&usg=AOvVaw2rHyq18cO-HyBTQLpLL3xO) approves the establishment of the Office of Naval Research for “planning, fostering, and encouraging scientific research” in relation to naval power and national security. (Wikipedia, “[Office of Naval](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Office_of_Naval_Research&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727974559&usg=AOvVaw0_CE2vTTTYww0TKTdekB_m) [Research](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Office_of_Naval_Research&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727974845&usg=AOvVaw2Prvx00H2W8PVWAY-OxrJQ)”)

August 1 —Col. [Edwin Kennedy Wright](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edwin_Kennedy_Wright&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727975172&usg=AOvVaw2eW4hENaq6cJQBFAsaW0Sm), [Vandenberg](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hoyt_Vandenberg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727975385&usg=AOvVaw3dA22FVsMvTtv5Tr8OB4Lj)’s executive assistant at the Central Intelligence Group, sends a memorandum to President [Truman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_S._Truman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727975601&usg=AOvVaw0GtdO5ERWNMRwrbxTvl3Xk) saying the ghost rockets conform to a V-1 shape and seem to be launched from the USSR. The report notes that the missiles can turn and fly circular courses, seemingly indicating radio control. Most information comes from the military attaché in Sweden and the conclusions are from the director of intelligence for the War Department general staff. (Swords 21–23; Jan Aldrich, “Investigating the Ghost Rockets,” IUR 23, no. 4 (Winter 1998): 10, 12)

August 1 — 6:00 p.m. AF Capt. Jack E. Puckett is flying over Tampa, Florida, in a C-47 transport and sees a long cylinder twice the size of a B-29 with luminous portholes. After 3 minutes, it disappears at a speed of 1,500 mph. (“[Rocket Craft Encounter Revealed by World War 2 Pilot,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/002%2520AUG-SEPT%25201957.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727976018&usg=AOvVaw3DNOVshlfOpGvMu-2cEsxl)” UFO Investigator 1, no. 2 (Aug./Sept. 1957): 15; UFOEv, [p. 19](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D31%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727976317&usg=AOvVaw0mo2xxGnCMhVciNRcfNUUG))

August 5 — 6:26 p.m. A luminous object is seen by a motorist near Landskrona, Skåne, Sweden. ()

August 5 — 11:00 p.m. A fast-moving, silent, circular object glitters in the sun over Skåne, Sweden, as it heads toward the south-southwest at a high altitude. (Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History: 1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727976699&usg=AOvVaw08b51UqPQCuMFtzXVdSv2d)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727976895&usg=AOvVaw0QGNzSop_irKhJTcv77I8z) The Author, 1988 ed., p. 28)

August 6 — The US delegation in Budapest, Hungary, reports that a German scientist now working for the Russians has revealed that the Soviets have developed guided rockets called V-3 and V-4 that are able to fly a round trip of 700 miles. (Jan Aldrich, “Investigating the Ghost Rockets,” IUR 23, no. 4 (Winter 1998): 10)

August 7 — A Top Secret message from the Commander-in-Chief Air Forces, Pacific, to Gen. [Lauris Norstad](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lauris_Norstad&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727977336&usg=AOvVaw1hQm-i9eS3dPpEJeKST81I), War Department Operations, requests guidance on the current classification of the substitute code word “Majestic” for Operational Plan Olympic (the invasion of Northern Japan). The plan has been downgraded to Restricted (Message CM1472 IN). The answer is that both code words had been declassified by the JCS on October 8, 1945 (Message CM96908 OUT 8 Aug 1946). (Jan Aldrich; Murray Bott, “[Military Codenames ‘Olympic’ and](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ufoupdateslist.com/2002/apr/m04-033.shtml&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727977644&usg=AOvVaw0f-irQHEQz8VYlY2S6sc0Y) [‘Majestic,’](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ufoupdateslist.com/2002/apr/m04-033.shtml&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727977886&usg=AOvVaw1GcJy6Pjr2bn9BUuWi1bdG)” UFO UpDates, April 4, 2002)

August 7 — Swedish Lt. Lennart Neckman of the Defense Staff’s Air Defense Division sees a clear, yellow flame passing low and slow over the countryside. (Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History: 1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727978199&usg=AOvVaw30lb1A2UVuvQDeJTZwNLnK), The Author, 1988 ed., p. 30)

August 8 — Chief of Swedish Air Defense Maj. Nils Ahlgren says that some of the rockets are seen at low altitude, maneuver in half circles, and appear to come from the south. (Göran Jansson, “[Spökraketerna 1947,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.zenza.se/spokraketerna1946.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727978591&usg=AOvVaw36EaMruPE0a-PpYEK7iGEO)” January 2005, p. 36)

August 11 — 8:47 p.m. Astronomer [Bertil Lindblad](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bertil_Lindblad&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727978854&usg=AOvVaw3y9IRRYDy_5xfX881iuTfX) sees an exploding fireball in Ljugarn on Gotland, Sweden. (Göran Jansson, “[Spökraketerna 1947,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.zenza.se/spokraketerna1946.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727979114&usg=AOvVaw1gWf3x3eFB9QB21gNUKtMG)” January 2005, p. 38)

August 11 — 9:00–10:00 p.m. Hundreds of people in central and southern Sweden see “ghost bombs” that fly from south to north, giving off a brilliant blue-white light. Sometimes two of the objects are seen flying together. Some witnesses see smaller silver balls come out of the larger objects, which are variously described as cylinders and torpedoes with a “wide nose” and “fire-spurting tail.” Stockholm is said to be “near the boiling point” with ghost rocket speculation. (Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History: 1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727979503&usg=AOvVaw3FLv4KVXJ_IQD2vMeJgs-B), The Author, 1988 ed., pp. 33– 39; Göran Jansson, “[Spökraketerna 1947,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.zenza.se/spokraketerna1946.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727979779&usg=AOvVaw3yhg4mKlU4Nkvo9fbuAU8T)” January 2005, pp. 38–40; Clark III 525; Anders Liljegren and Clas Svahn, “The Ghost Rockets,” UFOs 1947–1987, Fortean Tomes, 1987, p. 37; Don Berliner, with Marie Galbreath and Antonio Huneeus, UFO Briefing Document: The Best Available Evidence, Dell, 2000, [pp. 50–53](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufobriefingdocum0000berl/page/50/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727980280&usg=AOvVaw15z9b59IAf6NoIT1DKrhUz))

August 12 — 10:00 a.m. A twin-engine Saab 18 Swedish Air Force bomber crashes and explodes near Valdshult, Jönköping, Sweden, killing three airmen. Rumors circulate that it collided with a ghost rocket, but an investigation indicates that the pilot lost control. (Good Need, [pp. 39–40](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/38/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727980717&usg=AOvVaw0ujQujzeCgldCUgutM8MGg))

August 12 — 8:15 p.m. A torpedo-shaped ghost rocket moves slowly over a seaport town in southern Sweden, barely grazing the roofs and trailing smoke. It continues out to sea and seems to come down on a small island. Two men

* * *

go out to investigate, but the island is too overgrown to allow a search. (Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History: 1946,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727981404&usg=AOvVaw10MJC9VLO251e1ufH8vmur) [the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727981655&usg=AOvVaw3bmSae7srlh5Fo0_GyMhyx)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727981849&usg=AOvVaw1879SlBjhzRkhr9H1OHnDc) The Author, 1988 ed., pp. 40–41)

August 13 — Capt. [Roscoe H. Hillenkoetter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roscoe_H._Hillenkoetter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727982178&usg=AOvVaw23oy6G4CN9jyNZaSbyAbDt), US naval attaché in Paris, forwards as top secret a report by the French government on ghost rocket activity in Scandinavia. It states that “a good number of these projectiles are of the V- 1 type in the form of a torpedo with two small wings.” A map shows them originating in the Leningrad \[now St. Petersburg\] area, Russia. (Swords 21; Good Need, [pp. 38–39](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/38/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727982583&usg=AOvVaw2LaEi83DozcJM7NmkXQR8N); Jan Aldrich, “Investigating the Ghost Rockets,” IUR 23, no. 4 (Winter 1998): 11)

August 13 — The Hungarian report of August 6 causes Maj. Gen. [Stephen J. Chamberlin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stephen_J._Chamberlin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727983142&usg=AOvVaw3WnIpWZkm9v3VLYvgXFYjd)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stephen_J._Chamberlin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727983391&usg=AOvVaw2bHkl7BW8FHz1d5swfuJ8-) Army assistant chief of staff for intelligence, to ask Budapest for further information. Top-secret requests are sent to military attachés in London, Stockholm, Oslo, Helsinki, and Copenhagen asking for listings of all ghost rocket reports, as well as V-3 and V-4 missiles. The military attaché in Oslo reports that a Soviet ship in the north Baltic Sea has been transmitting code to shore stations regarding the ghost rockets. The military attaché in Moscow asks other European officials about where the rockets originate and gets several answers, which he forwards on to Chamberlin: Hiiumaa island, Estonia; Latvia; or Peenemünde, Germany. Gen. [Joseph T. McNarney](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_T._McNarney&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727983827&usg=AOvVaw2YpbvasQVLoXL5lohnjOvq) of the US Forces in Europe Theater replies that Peenemünde is a likely origin, since the site has been refurbished. The military attaché in Stockholm suspects Hiiumaa, Peenemünde, or Parikkala in Finland, while the naval attaché in Stockholm thinks that Łeba, Poland, is the launch site. (Jan Aldrich, “Investigating the Ghost Rockets,” IUR 23, no. 4 (Winter 1998): 10–11)

August 13 — The New York Times says the ghost rocket situation is extremely dangerous and that Sweden will not tolerate such violations. (“[Swedes Use Radar in Fight on Missiles,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1946/08/13/140131842.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727984596&usg=AOvVaw2KHNbN-hinvmum2UvfMW8l)” New York Times. August 13, 1946, p. 4)

August 13 — The US naval attaché and the Assistant US military attaché in Stockholm interview three Swedish Air Force officers assigned to the General Staff who say that they believe the objects are rockets. (Joel Carpenter, “[Guided](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/gr/grchron2.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727984987&usg=AOvVaw2px85CdcUVv9LAxsxh2MJZ) [Missiles and UFOs: A Tangle of Fear, 1937–53, Part Two](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/gr/grchron2.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727985203&usg=AOvVaw37Vnbmjwzi-wDN2AGdQdKu)”; Swords 21)

August 13 — Afternoon. A troop of Boy Scouts in Denmark see a rocket-like object moving quickly at an altitude of 1,600 feet. They can see small side wings and fins. A blue-white light streams from the bottom, and it diverges from a straight course to a 35° curve. (Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History: 1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727985519&usg=AOvVaw15xSJ9-IiYwTsll-v2Fh07), The Author, 1988 ed., p. 43)

August 13 — 8:00 p.m. A cigar-shaped object flies past a witness at Karlskrona, Sweden, at a distance of only 150 feet. Only 5 feet long, it emits a faint green light and trails smoke from the rear. (Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727985851&usg=AOvVaw3fmupKeB2Q7-yZsDnebnwh) [1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727986087&usg=AOvVaw0coRJoX29SxibTN1mOxL31)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727986311&usg=AOvVaw1wWw4CCLm-SE3h40hldRjr) The Author, 1988 ed., p. 43)

August 14 — The New York Times reports that Secretary of State [Dean Acheson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dean_Acheson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727986692&usg=AOvVaw0s2EMUYOKEZZ_gbyJAvf-D) is “very much interested” in the ghost rockets. (Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History: 1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727986947&usg=AOvVaw23MqS2p-eBokVug2Id4O_T), The Author, 1988 ed., p. 46; “[2 Swedes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1946/08/14/94056676.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727987213&usg=AOvVaw35VHZYQFhQw9s_kqR91qGP) [Escape a ‘Ghost Rocket,’](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1946/08/14/94056676.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727987447&usg=AOvVaw1OFMe9o2mZC0sr4QjQzKRk)” New York Times, August 14, 1946, p. 11)

August 14 — 10:02 a.m. Swedish Air Force pilot Lieut. Gunnar Irholm and his signaler, Cpl. Möller, are flying a B-18A bomber at 650 feet 4 miles northeast of Malingsbo in central Sweden when they see a dark cigar-shaped object approaching on their left. It has no visible wings, rudders, lights, flame or projections of any type. It appears to follow the terrain at 370–430 mph, maintaining the same height, then vanishes into a storm cloud. (“Ghost Rockets over Scandinavia,” Intelligence Review, no. 49, January 9, 1947, US Department of Defense; Don Berliner, Marie Galbraith, and Antonio Huneeus, Unidentified Flying Objects Briefing Document, UFO Research Coalition, December 1995, [pp. 33–35](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/rockefeller/Rockefeller-Briefing-Document/page/n25/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727987961&usg=AOvVaw3jmIPTKHZth6YwCSDDe6KH); Swords 15–16; “[Cigar Sighted from B-19 Bomber,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Sweden/AFU_Newsletter/AFU_2002_44.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727988208&usg=AOvVaw1njp-SJYJQoBRF2ZoGujLT)” AFU Newsletter, no. 44 (September 2002): 1–4)

August 15 — Night. Several residents of the east side of Waterloo, Iowa, see an object buzzing rapidly around some trees. It gradually ascends, surrounded by a cloud of white vapor, and disappears high in the sky. One person calls it “a great white bird; another, a bomb.” [Mrs. Russell Lampman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/188962570/gertrude-jessamine-lampman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727988584&usg=AOvVaw1KtGaAej6pLbaXBhX23twh) says that the object is “6 feet, 3 inches tall, like a large man, and rather rectangular in shape.” She and her [husband](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/188962549/russell-james-lampman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727988881&usg=AOvVaw0Q_6xu5RttId9ppqsIZiGV) watch it for an hour after it starts hovering about 20– 25 feet above a nearby alley. (Al Starr, “Street Scene,” Waterloo (Iowa) Sunday Times, August 18, 1946, p. II-1; “[Well, We Saw It First!](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92481379/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727989221&usg=AOvVaw2WhJZEmI0c5nvZtXusJ3VZ)” Waterloo Daily Courier, July 7, 1947, p. 2; Project 1947, “[UFO Reports: 1946](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1946b.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727989481&usg=AOvVaw3bqoxDFgHqiNkrSjyqKwAA)”)

August 16 — Col. L. H. Johnson, US naval attaché in Stockholm, transmits a “Top Secret Report R334-46 of 13 August 1946 Subject: SWEDEN Guided Missiles Rocket Sightings Over Sweden.” It concludes: “No tangible evidence to date as to nature or origin of rockets reported over Sweden, although Swedish Defense Staff insists that they are rockets.” (Joel Carpenter, “[Guided Missiles and UFOs: A Tangle of Fear, 1937–53, Part Two](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/gr/grchron2.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727989788&usg=AOvVaw2lOpo2WVosDwnpD0HH06rf)”; Jan L. Aldrich, comp., [The Ghost Rocket File](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Books/Digitized_by_AFU/Aldrich%252C%2520Jan%2520-%2520The%2520Ghost%2520Rockets%2520File.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727990042&usg=AOvVaw2T4lTPPiPzHnHkdMl-bevO), Fund for UFO Research, 2000, pp. 32–35)

August 16 — A missile produces an enormous explosion over Malmö, Sweden, that shakes or breaks many windows.

Some witnesses think they can see fragments of the object falling to earth. (“[Windows Broken by Rocket Bomb,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92459570/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727990413&usg=AOvVaw3pxPEIs44JWXLmGNPYIoUC)” Manchester Guardian, August 17, 1946, p. 6; Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History: 1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727990716&usg=AOvVaw0DHnvbnZtN1RosY3nYrsK9), The Author, 1988 ed., p. 50)

* * *

Late August — Margaret Sprankle, a civilian employee at Tinker AFB near Oklahoma City, Oklahoma, is returning from work when she sees, about 300 feet away, a large, metallic, lens-shaped structure about 75 feet in diameter. On the lower right side are 12–14 square windows; in each, visible from the shoulders up, is a figure. Their heads are very round. The object rotates 90° on its vertical axis and silently flies northwest and disappears in seconds. (Center for UFO Studies, [HUMCAT Index 1940–1949,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/HUMCAT/HUMCAT_Index_1940-1949.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727991146&usg=AOvVaw1lz6DFR4a3--MPl3CLdWqB) p. 22; Clark III 266)

August 18 — 8:00 or 10:00 p.m. An aerial object like a 9-foot cigar is seen moving slowly on the north side of Copenhagen, Denmark. It explodes with extraordinary force. (Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History: 1946, the Ghost](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727991537&usg=AOvVaw0SAbPJnFzneZei8m1bqlpy) [Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727991802&usg=AOvVaw2v4FrQSvn5_ZkkdEnwQjIp)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727992002&usg=AOvVaw2bloJXHK1vzjIYJQHR7yXd) The Author, 1988 ed., p. 53)

August 19 — The US military attaché in Moscow reports on the visit of Maj. [Stig Wennerström](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stig_Wennerstr%25C3%25B6m_(colonel)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727992335&usg=AOvVaw2dXCbbGmoIpF8DOyA6Hddn) of the Swedish Air Force, who reveals that radar indicates the ghost rocket launch site is at Peenemünde, Germany. The rockets appear to be radio-controlled, carry no warheads, are self-destructive, and are plotted over a range of 620 miles. Sometimes they follow zigzag courses. (Jan Aldrich, “Investigating the Ghost Rockets,” IUR 23, no. 4 (Winter 1998): 12)

August 19 — Two US experts on aerial warfare, aviation legend General [Jimmy Doolittle](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jimmy_Doolittle&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727992746&usg=AOvVaw2juafQoIKghMgNvdX1vJOd) and British Group Captain [Douglas Bader](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Douglas_Bader&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727992988&usg=AOvVaw2lh1HnPVkfSvj-o5ciCn_P)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Douglas_Bader&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727993173&usg=AOvVaw0-4zeT1bCbo4QkYl4l57hU) and General [David Sarnoff](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Sarnoff&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727993415&usg=AOvVaw2y7DiI6VGweTEw5lB8NAVw)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Sarnoff&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727993590&usg=AOvVaw0eZpMpZcF_NDoaKNIF9ZQB) president of RCA, arrive in Stockholm, Sweden, ostensibly on private business, and independently of each other. The official explanation is that Doolittle, who is now vice-president of the Shell Oil Company, is inspecting Shell branch offices in Europe, while Sarnoff, a former member of General [Dwight D. Eisenhower](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dwight_D._Eisenhower&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727993813&usg=AOvVaw2QvwdV5kEC_kiLwAAXUoXo)’s London staff, is studying the market for radio equipment. However, the story indicates that the Chief of the Swedish Defense Staff, Col. C. R. Kempf, makes no secret that he “was extremely interested in asking the two generals advice and, if possible, would place all available reports before them.” However, Doolittle denies the correlation to [Barry Greenwood](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Barry_J_Greenwood.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727994041&usg=AOvVaw0w7D2diInYZBgMJ33_C8lE) in 1984, and researchers have found no evidence to support a collaboration. (Joel Carpenter, “[Guided Missiles and UFOs: A Tangle of Fear, 1937–53, Part Two](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/gr/grchron2.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727994285&usg=AOvVaw223f7FOI5G8yQvFoJKMyM2)”; Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History: 1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727994521&usg=AOvVaw2YIFM0ob6a7BkWJeY-PPVO)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727994713&usg=AOvVaw1Sa58Y-20d6xQTlPdSllrd) The Author, 1988 ed., pp. 53–54; Clark III 527; Swords 21, 24)

August 21 — The General Staff in Norway issues a memorandum to the press asking it not to mention any ghost rockets seen over the country and to pass on all reports to the military Intelligence Department. In Sweden, the ban is limited to any mention of where the rockets are seen to land or explode. (London Daily Telegraph, August 22, 1946; Good Above, [p. 21](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/20/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727995118&usg=AOvVaw2aToFHRDvhj8pRMEiDKA1e))

August 22 — 3:00 p.m. Photographer Gösta Skog takes a color film of a ghost rocket at Getå, 100 miles south of Stockholm, Sweden. The cigar-shaped object appears out of a cloud at 3,000 feet, trailing exhaust. The film turns out to be overexposed. (Clas Svahn, “[Spökraketerna: Den Största Gåtan,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ufo.se/index.php/fakta/arti/verkligheten-bakom-ufopodden-i-p3/1611-spoekraketerna&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727995517&usg=AOvVaw01X-ox6AjBiU68sddaLms5)” Riksorganisationen UFO-Sverige, March 7, 2017; Swords 14–15)

August 22 — Director of the Central Intelligence Group (CIG) Lt. Gen. [Hoyt Vandenberg](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hoyt_Vandenberg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727995834&usg=AOvVaw27SUoVt1Mcy5hqUnfcYxdw) writes a top secret memo to [President Truman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_S._Truman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727996109&usg=AOvVaw21frd6SCvlakrkfK1w8sHn) via Adm. [William D. Leahy](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_D._Leahy&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727996351&usg=AOvVaw14qECvNxBQRzrVKNPFQX39)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_D._Leahy&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727996577&usg=AOvVaw3krHfEdWajbBSLIODnhMUI) stating that the “weight of evidence” points to Peenemünde (which has become a Soviet naval base), East Germany, as the origin of the ghost rockets, and that a US military attaché in Moscow has been told by a “key Swedish Air Officer” \[[Wennerström](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stig_Wennerstr%25C3%25B6m_(colonel)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727996886&usg=AOvVaw1IrK3jAKUuP5hp9KxRUmSO)\] that radar course-plotting leads to the conclusion that Peenemünde is the launch site. CIG speculates that the missiles are extended-range developments of V-1s being aimed for the Gulf of Bothnia for test purposes and “do not overfly Swedish territory specifically for intimidation; self-destruct by small demolition charge or burning.” (Joel Carpenter, “[Guided](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/gr/grchron2.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727997138&usg=AOvVaw1qVeO2TIwV6ydI7ySEX2xA) [Missiles and UFOs: A Tangle of Fear, 1937–53, Part Two](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/gr/grchron2.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727997396&usg=AOvVaw123SSg6pTkvzSjmZOgc8fJ)”; Barry Greenwood, “[Significant Ghost Rocket](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.greenwoodufoarchive.com/uhr/uhr15.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727997628&usg=AOvVaw1WLmYCmt60wfRaZHM-lxxo) [Documents Available,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.greenwoodufoarchive.com/uhr/uhr15.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727997847&usg=AOvVaw0l9-VOPFdVUdqTNhZcJMru)” UFO Historical Revue, no. 15 (June 2015): 1–8)

August 23 — The British Foreign Office states that English radar experts, including [Reginald Victor Jones](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reginald_Victor_Jones&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727998214&usg=AOvVaw0dD1etFLWNKFjXdmCzn_i1)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reginald_Victor_Jones&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727998392&usg=AOvVaw0SAn2tY-9pDQtOCRaCZs1h) having returned from Sweden, had “submitted secret reports to the British government on the origin of the rockets.” (Good Above, [p. 21](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/20/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727998614&usg=AOvVaw256b75PUt9njUGijmsvH3A))

August 24 — Stockholm Air Attaché Maj. Gen. [Alfred A. Kessler Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/106572/major-general-alfred-a-kessler-jr/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727998919&usg=AOvVaw1W3ZyBUsUx_sD3EaqbPUqb) informs the War Department that the Ghost Rockets are an “unintentional hoax which developed naturally but which exploited by Defense staff by implication and lack of frankness possibly interest defense budget and to alert west against east.” (Joel Carpenter, “[Guided](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/gr/grchron2.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727999204&usg=AOvVaw2k-TJYq3oNyWFbk17NleSg) [Missiles and UFOs: A Tangle of Fear, 1937–53, Part Two](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/gr/grchron2.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727999412&usg=AOvVaw1Y8WTBEfe0mu29gf6AM8g7)”)

August 24 — Admiral [Henry Kent Hewitt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henry_Kent_Hewitt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727999681&usg=AOvVaw1d2tm3947JJ8wap64q7SpB), Commander of US Naval Forces in Europe, writes a letter to the US naval attaché in Oslo, Norway, on “Rocket Bombs or Guided Missiles over Norway and Sweden.” Two “missiles” have fallen into a lake near Oslo, and the US Navy is “very interested.” (\[Adm. Henry Kent Hewitt\], Letter to US Naval Attaché, Oslo, “[Rocket Bombs or Guided Missiles over Norway and Sweden,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/46alusna.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889727999910&usg=AOvVaw2zq8OajyDBNhE662T0jcJn)” August 24, 1946)

August 24 — Evening. A Norwegian student and a Swedish engineer are boating on a small river “somewhere in Sweden” when a light approaches them from the southeast. It resembles a full moon and emits an intense light: “As it passed immediately overhead, it grew so bright you could see a well as on a sunny day.” The object, about 10 feet long, releases four stars that fall silently to the ground. (Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History: 1946, the](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728000274&usg=AOvVaw3Lwe2XENzcljJNutWCBTDW) [Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728000512&usg=AOvVaw3GBtt7C3GxTVuvxvnbs1g3)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728000708&usg=AOvVaw1DROkFaJcTaJFFZixMAR0p) The Author, 1988 ed., pp. 58–59)

* * *

August 26 — The US military attaché in Stockholm reports that the Swedes, possibly worried about a Soviet veto of their application for UN membership, have canceled their request for British radar equipment. (Jan Aldrich, “Investigating the Ghost Rockets,” IUR 23, no. 4 (Winter 1998): 13)

August 29 — The American embassy in Stockholm tells the State Department that the ghost rockets are probably Soviet missiles. (Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History: 1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728001222&usg=AOvVaw36Ol2QTPxt_uUWSlsmmokO), The Author, 1988 ed., p. 63A; \[[Memo on](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/460904_fbi.jpg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728001535&usg=AOvVaw2y0Mm_yezDoQ7VLswad98L) [telegram of August 27, 1946](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/460904_fbi.jpg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728001869&usg=AOvVaw395MWv2sPcSd8dv9GBwC72)\]; Good Above, [pp. 22](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/22/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728002156&usg=AOvVaw2a9YtVtmZlkH3BTEBXJ_PA), [447](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/446/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728002375&usg=AOvVaw3YyqQLJP_ZA6_NSafHNM3C))

September — German rocket engineer Walter Ziegler tells Army CIC that 400 men from his former rocket group at Bayerische Motoren Werke (BMW) in Munich, Germany, are invited by Russian military officers to a fancy dinner, wined and dined, then taken home. Several hours later, all 400 are woken up by the Russians and forced to take a trip. (Ziegler is not among them.) They are transported by train to a small town (“Kubischew”) outside Moscow, Russia, where they remain and work on secret military rocket projects under terrible conditions. (Jacobsen, Area 51, [p. 42](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/42/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728002793&usg=AOvVaw3Lm34vK1mtIxiHZ3erWEt5))

September 1–2 — Late night and early morning. Rocket-shaped objects are seen over northern Greece, according to Prime Minister [Konstantinos Tsaldaris](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Konstantinos_Tsaldaris&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728003079&usg=AOvVaw3bBGFUo2nDAITgIAZ-t0kP)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Konstantinos_Tsaldaris&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728003254&usg=AOvVaw1F6laIdREl-NTb2lGS_ZPN) Physicist [Paul Santorinis](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://el.wikipedia.org/wiki/%25CE%25A0%25CE%25B1%25CF%258D%25CE%25BB%25CE%25BF%25CF%2582_%25CE%25A3%25CE%25B1%25CE%25BD%25CF%2584%25CE%25BF%25CF%2581%25CE%25AF%25CE%25BD%25CE%25B7%25CF%2582&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728003474&usg=AOvVaw1C5mKNNMJ5AqMtcako2MyJ) is placed in charge of an investigation. He rules out Russian missiles, but the Army ends the investigation in 1947. (Clark III 525; Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728003751&usg=AOvVaw3J_uyu2dZYOwy6XtUlYBmU) [1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728003972&usg=AOvVaw1sggG8WYNAuil1BZVKfyhX)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728004163&usg=AOvVaw3HYC2kVYdEHsEiRnrSHNuk) The Author, 1988 ed., pp. 62–63; Good Above, [p. 23](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/22/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728004404&usg=AOvVaw2oTaVY8jBfj8bHJGhFFCEV))

September 7 — British pilot [Edward Mortlock Donaldson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Mortlock_Donaldson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728004677&usg=AOvVaw0dQVoeI1oWuOXiWkj9OOrX) attains an airspeed record of 616 mph in a Gloster Meteor F Mk 4 at Littlehampton, England. (Wikipedia, “[Edward Donaldson (RAF officer)](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Donaldson_(RAF_officer)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728004922&usg=AOvVaw2TneenkMGQy9U6_ISfwePd)”)

September 9 — The scientific advisor to MI6, English physicist [Reginald Victor Jones](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reginald_Victor_Jones&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728005225&usg=AOvVaw1W3kWuCUis6H3vBAOgY7Z5), considers the ghost rockets a social panic phenomenon. An RAF Intelligence report, “Investigation of Reported Missile Activity over Scandinavia,” identifies eight types of ghost rocket sightings: iron cylinder, magnesium-like light, white core surrounded by blue-green, shining ball with tail, torpedo-shape, black object with flame, small rocket, small missile. It takes the daytime reports seriously but concludes are probably only a few genuine reports of actual missiles. (Joel Carpenter, “[Guided Missiles and UFOs: A Tangle of Fear, 1937–53, Part Two](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/gr/grchron2.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728005496&usg=AOvVaw3Hbn8RiP_e6iPZM19lH8Rc)”; Swords 26–27; Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History: 1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728005759&usg=AOvVaw0RNpMqPh3OxBZxKzqr-HVD), The Author, 1988 ed., pp. 63–64)

September 11 — The Chief of Naval Intelligence requires naval attachés to forward information on Soviet rocket research and operations including launches from submarines. (NARA, US Naval Intelligence files; Jan Aldrich)

September 11 — [Jack Northrop](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jack_Northrop&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728006130&usg=AOvVaw3KFJ0hdj6qSmYGkjMO6lPp) grounds the XB-35, which has suffered gearbox and propeller control problems, until the Army Air Force can fix its propulsion system. (Wikipedia, “[Northrop YB-35](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northrop_YB-35%23XB-35&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728006384&usg=AOvVaw3YiiSL6b-eybheibX_hMi4)”)

September 11 — 2:00 p.m. [Justin B. Rinaldi](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/99039448/justin-beltran-rinaldi&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728006670&usg=AOvVaw0Pjvo-pBYNgTw7gkUEze36) is standing in a friend’s backyard in Engle, New Mexico, when he hears a loud whirring sound and sees a black object whiz by. It is pointed at one end, has a narrow body, and what appear to be fins on the tail. It is traveling fast at an altitude of 75 feet. Rinaldi sees it hit a clump of trees at a ranch house and the “branches parted like a great force had struck.” He and friends go to the site but can find nothing. (“[Flying Disc Tales Bring 2 Reports from Engle Area,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/52143552/nm-ufojun-29-1947-p1-part-1/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728006951&usg=AOvVaw2lrB-jiijKKmvQqZGERRIf)” Albuquerque Journal, June 29, 1947, p. 1; Clark III 530)

September 12 — Cmdr. [Robert A. Winston](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nytimes.com/1974/06/04/archives/robert-winston-navy-pilot-in-war-captain-author-of-books-in.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728007385&usg=AOvVaw1r8iUAK7MtLA5_I1JZOiEQ), acting naval attaché in Stockholm, Sweden, writes to the London naval attaché in a secret air mailgram that he suspects there is a secret British-Swedish collaboration on ghost rocket information designed to keep the US from learning the truth. (Jan Aldrich, “Investigating the Ghost Rockets,” IUR 23, no. 4 (Winter 1998): 13)

Mid-September — Two luminous globes that shine “like an electric arc” are seen flying in a straight line over Longwy, Meurthe-et-Moselle, France. (Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History: 1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728007785&usg=AOvVaw2hbBSiYjrhSj1kg3v_oCnP), The Author, 1988 ed., p. 66)

September 18 — Two greenish globes, one following close behind the other, zoom over Castanheira, Portugal. (Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History: 1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728008248&usg=AOvVaw0Bdbn6MIjpp9bkEvjCdq4E)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728008619&usg=AOvVaw2SDLR0EuOsOtR0Pdp7N5T1) The Author, 1988 ed., p. 67)

September 21 — Chemist [Gustaf Ljunggren](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gustaf_Ljunggren_(chemist)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728009134&usg=AOvVaw2v_Cymx15I5Ic1eNEYeeBr) of the Swedish National Defense Research Institute summarizes for the Swedish Defense staff his analysis of 27 finds of mysterious substances, allegedly from ghost rockets. None are radioactive and all have mundane explanations. (Anders Liljegren and Clas Svahn, “The Ghost Rockets,” UFOs 1947–1987, Fortean Tomes, 1987, pp. 33–34)

September 22 — 3:15 a.m. A rocket-shaped object is seen for 90 seconds over Florence, Italy. It makes an abrupt turn, then speeds south toward Rome. (Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History: 1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728009851&usg=AOvVaw0rM5tHNNHc2Eo3vSAr_Lng), The Author, 1988 ed., p. 69)

September 30 — [David Sarnoff,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Sarnoff&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728010349&usg=AOvVaw3DK_lfIfLsA_C-2Yn5gGh8) in a speech at the Waldorf-Astoria Hotel in New York City, says that the “ghost bombs are no myth but real missiles.” (Joel Carpenter, “[Guided Missiles and UFOs: A Tangle of Fear, 1937–53, Part](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/gr/grchron2.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728010772&usg=AOvVaw1PMwTK2wxKiTHYydSaQP5T) [Two](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/gr/grchron2.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728010982&usg=AOvVaw1AAoAreYkjlUjWN9smE54y)”; “[Sarnoff Predicts Weather Control and Delivery of the Mail by Radio,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1946/10/01/88376074.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728011220&usg=AOvVaw3EGz3BUw7BxdVehq3i-8cD)” New York Times, October 1, 1946,

p. 1, 48)

* * *

Fall — 9:00 p.m. Gladys McCage and her 4-year-old son see a yellowish-orange light coming from the northwest at a “terrific speed” toward their farm 8 miles north of O’Neill, Nebraska. Its color changes to red as it approaches, and soon it is hovering above the witnesses. They run toward the house and the cigar-shaped object swings up to the northeast. McCage says it is as big as a football field, has windows, and is making a loud noise. A yellowish- blue-green flame is shooting out near the back, and it is traveling too fast for any plane at the time. (Clark III 530)

October — [Ray Palmer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raymond_A._Palmer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728011792&usg=AOvVaw3PGOjuznrJs_LDhiQ71TOl) publishes a letter from [Maurice Doreal](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.joshuablubuhs.com/blog/claude-d-dodgin-aka-maurice-doreal-as-a-fortean&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728012067&usg=AOvVaw2BBmqNJ7KMOocFdgZlmgEX) (pseudonym of Claude D. Dodgin) of the Brotherhood of the White Temple in Denver, Colorado, regarding the “Shaver mystery.” Doreal claims intimate knowledge of the subterranean realms, which he claims are inhabited by the Black Brotherhood and protected by “space-warps.” In 1949 Doreal claims to have visited caves inside Mount Shasta, California, inhabited by Atlantean masters. He equates Shaver’s Dero with an evil group of Lemurians. (Walter Kafton-Minkel, Subterranean Worlds, Loompanics, 1989, [pp. 154–160](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/subterraneanworldswalterkaftonminkel100000yearsofdragonsdwarfsthedeadlostracesufosfrominsidetheearth/page/n157/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728012604&usg=AOvVaw2QKVyqhaGgI2MeVPwJphOH); Charmaine Ortega Getz, “The (Sort of) Amazing Story of Maurice Doreal and the Brotherhood of the White Temple Revealed at Last,” Weird Colorado, September 6, 2015)

October 1 — The US Military Attaché in London, England, writes a top-secret memo to the War Department complaining that the British “may not have given us all information on reported rockets over Scandinavia.” (Jan L. Aldrich, comp., [The Ghost Rocket File](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Books/Digitized_by_AFU/Aldrich%252C%2520Jan%2520-%2520The%2520Ghost%2520Rockets%2520File.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728013277&usg=AOvVaw1MniKUxjmhC-3vICvY8aZt), Fund for UFO Research, 2000, p. 73)

October 9 — Evening. [George Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728013625&usg=AOvVaw1rxu-59BVE5T4yOMuoTsvP) and some associates are watching a meteor shower associated with Comet 21P/Giacobini-Zinner when they see a “gigantic spacecraft” hovering above the mountain ridge south of Mount Palomar, California. He claims to meet a military officer a few weeks later who assures him that the object was indeed from another world. Others in San Diego see an object with a long, tube-shaped fuselage, giant wings, and two red lights. The medium [Mark Probert](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://hatch.kookscience.com/wiki/Mark_Probert&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728013893&usg=AOvVaw2uU3em_cQhEzoyBAJiuHKu) later tells the press that he has established psychic communication with the occupants and the object is called the Kareeta. (“[Sparks Fly As Comet Passes Earth,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/90991422/daily-news/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728014138&usg=AOvVaw2T-lEmV8EfGSBUl_MJYw-2)” Los Angeles Daily News, October 10, 1946, p. 3; Colin Bennett, Looking for Orthon, Paraview, 2001, pp. 28–29; Harold T. Wilkins, Flying Saucers on the Attack, Citadel, 1954, [pp. 41–48](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/flyingsaucersona00wilk/page/41/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728014522&usg=AOvVaw0C5J66nx6bPxFZq4whA2zg); Curt Collins, “[1946, Before Saucers, Kareeta: UFO Contact in](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2017/08/1946-before-saucers-kareeta-ufo-contact.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728014784&usg=AOvVaw0ookC1mlkgpzrnBmBT4a2H) [California,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2017/08/1946-before-saucers-kareeta-ufo-contact.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728015024&usg=AOvVaw0cBYCqoeP9z5NwYvDPupCB)” The Saucers That Time Forgot, August 8, 2017)

October 10 — 4:00 a.m. Waltraut Anlauf, a telephone operator in Friedland Refugee Camp, Lower Saxony, Germany, sees small, elongated flashes at a great height in the sky. They look like cigars and are luminescent white in front and bluish-white in back. She sees about 10 objects pass per minute. Sometimes there is an interruption of about 10 minutes, and then new groups appear. The sighting lasts one hour. Possibly these are part of the Taurid meteor shower. (Clark III 529)

October 10 — The defense staff in Sweden admits it cannot explain the ghost rockets because reports are too vague.

About 80% appear to be meteors (“celestial phenomena”), although radar has tracked a few unusual targets. The report concludes that they are not V-type bombs. (“[Swedish Inquiry Fails to Solve Rocket Case,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1946/10/11/94061697.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728015468&usg=AOvVaw0M9JPvavtrP7icgofCM6qO)” New York Times, October 11, 1946, p. 3; Loren E. Gross, [UFO’s, a History: 1946, the Ghost Rockets](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728015798&usg=AOvVaw1Vlia0Die2E__t7ZbwmbAu)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1946-The-Ghost-Rockets.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728016117&usg=AOvVaw13SXB4a-X3tcM6xzeBVf-S) The Author, 1988 ed.,

[Curtis LeMay](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Curtis_LeMay&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728018784&usg=AOvVaw1cFWW8Jacq10dXl0FWVv2u) answers an inquiry from Assistant Secretary of War for Air [Stuart Symington](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stuart_Symington&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728019024&usg=AOvVaw2SkkE3lDVQ-GH1cjlAgjv6) about establishing interim projects at the Air Materiel Center (AMC).
