1947 — 11:00 p.m. Air Force pilot [Edwin T. Yeoman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/51424479/edwin-t.-yeoman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728024455&usg=AOvVaw2N__XWZlp6_2aEebFI2MpN) is returning home with his wife [Eva](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/82894277/eva-etheleen-yeoman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728024755&usg=AOvVaw3rn7PWAWFKmxIGTqydKK2h) after going to a movie in Sacramento, California. As they drive northeast, they see a stationary light hovering at an altitude of 3,000–4,000 feet above Roseville. After watching it for 5 minutes, the light gets brighter, rises vertically for several thousand feet, makes an abrupt 90° turn, and shoots across the horizon from east to west. (CUFOS case file)

January 1 — The civilian US Atomic Energy Commission assumes responsibility for nuclear energy from the wartime Manhattan Project. The Armed Forces Special Weapons Project assumes responsibility for all aspects of nuclear weapons remaining under military control. (Wikipedia, “[United States Atomic Energy Commission](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Atomic_Energy_Commission&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728025170&usg=AOvVaw32963KWYokbl2iejxUXAIn)”; Wikipedia, “[Armed Forces Special Weapons Project](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Armed_Forces_Special_Weapons_Project&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728025392&usg=AOvVaw3oJlgB2AlBt2X0qvwCNZqB)”)

January 9 — The US Defense Department’s Intelligence Review, no. 49, contains a four-page summary of ghost rocket sightings and suggests some may have been Soviet test missiles or jet airplanes. (“Ghost Rockets over Scandinavia,” Intelligence Review, no. 49, January 9, 1947, US Department of Defense; Don Berliner, Marie Galbraith, and Antonio Huneeus, Unidentified Flying Objects Briefing Document, UFO Research Coalition, December 1995, [pp. 33–35](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/rockefeller/Rockefeller-Briefing-Document/page/n25/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728025945&usg=AOvVaw2RameZImCufBLKdCrE-WOe))

January 16 —11:30 p.m. An RAF Mosquito plane chases an unidentified target detected on radar at RAF Trimley Heath Radar Station \[now closed\] near Felixstowe, Suffolk, England, moving at a speed calculated to be faster than sound at an altitude of 38,000 feet over the North Sea, 50 miles north of the Netherlands acoast. It descends to 17,000 feet and takes controlled, evasive action. The plane pursues it for 40 minutes, even though the pilot cannot see it visually, until he loses it over the Norfolk coast. (UFOFiles2, [p. 29](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/the-ufo-files-the-inside-story-of-real-life-sightings-david-clarke/page/n51/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728026292&usg=AOvVaw0jmbNzGTwPH6XM8_SM9O-f); ClearIntent, [p. 151](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/clearintentgover00fawc/page/150/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728026510&usg=AOvVaw3sd18Xg1FkOdJo-5kj0L5D); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728026717&usg=AOvVaw2gK1phsOGDUfS4Sh4S0Mml), p. 16; David Clarke, “[Operation Charlie,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://project1947.com/1947/opcharlie.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728026920&usg=AOvVaw241Im8o-J6D5xzkZ6p0CuJ)” 2002; Martin L. Shough, “[A New Study of the British ‘Ghost Airplanes’ of](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.martinshough.com/aerialphenomena/opcharlie.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728027138&usg=AOvVaw28kuzHJZJRFsTg6RGZq7qA) [1947,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.martinshough.com/aerialphenomena/opcharlie.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728027342&usg=AOvVaw06zSnrFIjZte0phCjZiLOA)” April 2009)

January 17 — 11:37 p.m. After two unidentified targets similar to yesterday’s are reported by RAF Neatishead, northeast of Norwich, England, over the North Sea, another radar track enters the Eastern Sector area, and an RAF Mosquito piloted by Flight Lt. William Kent is scrambled to 18,000 feet. Kent attempts to close in, but his onboard radar is unable to keep it on track because the target is “jerking violently” and taking evasive action.

After 20 minutes, the target descends below 2,000 feet and is lost from ground radar. Unofficially the radar operators give the intruder a name—Charlie—and when the Air Ministry later begins a concerted effort to solve the mystery, its code name is “Operation Charlie.” (Martin L. Shough, “[A New Study of the British ‘Ghost](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.martinshough.com/aerialphenomena/opcharlie.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728027762&usg=AOvVaw1zYtjF_-8spzExNskVoOWy) [Airplanes’ of 1947,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.martinshough.com/aerialphenomena/opcharlie.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728028022&usg=AOvVaw1A583LoistvJjf05-uj-el)” April 2009)

January 20 — In London, [Ben Lockspeiser](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ben_Lockspeiser&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728028335&usg=AOvVaw2b_wgfYoAMyzcYubLec0K3)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ben_Lockspeiser&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728028508&usg=AOvVaw2936kJwoleoYsR6Sz9TgxE) chief scientist for the UK Ministry of Supply, after meeting with Swedish scientists and air force authorities, informs the American naval attaché in London, England, Cmdr. Jenkins, that the Swedes doubt the rockets are from Russia but prefer that the US and UK continue to think so. Natural phenomena and popular imagination are considered the causes. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Jan-Jun-23-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728028758&usg=AOvVaw0NE1IC5ZeVVeDCjXqJdHyc) [Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1947 January 1st–June 23rd, Supplemental Notes,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Jan-Jun-23-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728028981&usg=AOvVaw03OJVCNPsF58Ng789s8H01) The Author, 2000, pp. 3–5)

January 23 — Night. Three senior RAF officers are visiting RAF Neatishead in Norfolk, England, for an interception exercise when an unidentified radar target makes another appearance at 28,000 feet. RAF Mosquitos from Yorkshire are scrambled, but by the time the aircraft reach the area, the target is gone. (Martin L. Shough, “[A](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.martinshough.com/aerialphenomena/opcharlie.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728029310&usg=AOvVaw11x1eNfBzL9YfAf_lTCLqa) [New Study of the British ‘Ghost Airplanes’ of 1947,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.martinshough.com/aerialphenomena/opcharlie.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728029581&usg=AOvVaw3wnVAH_s70n_QJsMzTjtRD)” April 2009)

January 27 — RAF Flying Officer Stewart of the Northern Signals Area, after investigating the Operation Charlie radar incidents at RAF Neatishead, England, issues a report, no longer extant, that suggests that some of the targets are radiosonde balloons released by the USAAF’s 8th Weather Squadron in Downham Market, Norfolk. However,

* * *

RAF and Air Ministry sources continue to refer to the sightings as unexplained over the following months. (Martin L. Shough, “[A New Study of the British ‘Ghost Airplanes’ of 1947,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.martinshough.com/aerialphenomena/opcharlie.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728030001&usg=AOvVaw2lcrvk8slgMCbmmpaNfpqK)” April 2009)

January 29 — Secretary of War [Robert P. Patterson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_P._Patterson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728030272&usg=AOvVaw35JTcqSpo9FHfhvOEaTpfu) and Secretary of the Navy [James V. Forrestal](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Forrestal&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728030500&usg=AOvVaw1xFRTSUJfY3MGOwc2Jg8_d) issue a memorandum that formally establishes the Armed Forces Special Weapons Project, a new agency to take over responsibility for the aspects of nuclear weapons that still remain under the military. It is to be jointly staffed by the Army and Navy. Los Alamos Laboratory’s ordnance engineering Z Division and AFSWP establish themselves at Sandia Base, New Mexico, bringing the strict secrecy that has prevails at Los Alamos. (Wikipedia, “[Armed Forces](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Armed_Forces_Special_Weapons_Project&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728030803&usg=AOvVaw2lQ2o5yvrRKKXE6yqAb_9_) [Special Weapons Project](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Armed_Forces_Special_Weapons_Project&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728031013&usg=AOvVaw3ZqPNOeutaB8U-cgZ1tA2E)”)

February 6 — Around 7:30 a.m., [Frederick Walter Flavel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/202761273/frederick-walter-flavel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728031342&usg=AOvVaw0r7fz546NjznqazrXM8a_b) and his wife Emma are walking to their house in Lock, South Australia, when they see five gray, oblong objects rise apparently from the sea and move from northwest to southeast. At 9:00 a.m., [Ronald Ernest Ellis](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://ufos-scientificresearch.blogspot.com/2016/01/port-augusta-south-australia-flying.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728031630&usg=AOvVaw3ZZR6WyzWi1A1Aht-3Lakf) and two other railroad workers in Port Augusta, South Australia, watch five white or light-pink egg-shaped objects moving across the sky from north to south at about 6,000 feet. They quiver, cast shadows on the ground, and move out of sight in a few seconds. (NICAP, “[Five Objects Cast](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470206portaugusta_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728031917&usg=AOvVaw3V9cCJ9WzWWh1n4u-lQMH_) [Shadows](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470206portaugusta_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728032118&usg=AOvVaw0L8mKPS3XATAAd0kMlTBwE)”; Chris Aubeck and Martin Shough, Return to Magonia: Investigating UFOs in History, Anomalist, 2015, pp. 329–350)

February 8 — A US Navy Privateer bomber flying over Sweden picks up signals that might be directing rockets. (Letter from US Naval Forces Europe, London, to Chief of Naval Operations; Jan Aldrich)

February 17 — Capt. J. B. Pearson Jr., US naval attaché in London, England, sends an intelligence report to the Chief of Naval Intelligence about his conversation with Col. Westergard, head of the Airplane Design Section for the Swedish Air Ministry. Westergard tells him some 40% of the 1,000 ghost rocket sightings are “reliable.” They seem to originate in Peenemünde, Germany, and fly toward Finland. The best observation is from an artillery officer who sees an object in his optical range finder and follows it for about 90 seconds. It is in level flight at 4.5 miles distance and is about 36 feet long and torpedo shaped. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Jan-Jun-23-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728032591&usg=AOvVaw2zrVxOcwqnKUJqJsJXBChF) [Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1947 January 1st–June 23rd, Supplemental Notes,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Jan-Jun-23-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728032822&usg=AOvVaw33On4ZrCJTAFp0Gqb1J9rW) The Author, 2000, p. 7)

February 28 —Capt. [Emmet O’Beirne](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://collegiatewaterpolo.org/memorial-day-weekend-hero-rear-admiral-emmet-obeirne/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728033136&usg=AOvVaw2y2J3Glmtq5Y-i1j_fX1yO)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://collegiatewaterpolo.org/memorial-day-weekend-hero-rear-admiral-emmet-obeirne/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728033332&usg=AOvVaw1vXu5X46YlMwUyPQY0suNJ) Chief of the Defensive Air Branch, writes a memorandum to the chief of the USAF Office of Air Intelligence about the branch’s interview with H. W. Flickinger, vice president for exports at Republic Aircraft Corp. after his return from Sweden: “He stated that he had seen one of the Swedish ‘spook rockets’ in flight, which resembled the V-1 buzz bomb but was somewhat smaller. The noise of this missile was more that of a rocket than like a V-1.” (Jan Aldrich)

March 21 — A cigar-shaped object with smoke coming from its tail is seen flying from east to west at considerable height over southern Sweden by several witnesses. It looks metallic and is about 60 feet long, flying slowly. The object seems to turn around and fly back eastward briefly. (“[‘Phantom Bomb’ Returns to Skies over Sweden,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1947/03/22/87514553.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728033717&usg=AOvVaw1b-c_RDeteWcQqIfKLoENu)” New York Times, March 22, 1947, p. 8; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1947](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Jan-Jun-23-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728034049&usg=AOvVaw2V8Xt6KbjSTG9_pTHmeKl6) [January 1st–June 23rd, Supplemental Notes,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Jan-Jun-23-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728034275&usg=AOvVaw3bd2pONdqZ_ByafDvEP1R9) The Author, 2000, p. 9)

April — The June 1947 issue of Amazing Stories is devoted in its entirety to “proofs” of [Richard Shaver](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Sharpe_Shaver&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728034682&usg=AOvVaw2GqYHEHD67pIbAz12sdEsQ)’s claims and includes four of his novellas. [Vincent Gaddis](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vincent_Gaddis&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728034888&usg=AOvVaw04sX4PGqRaj14tl9Yh_6ac) has written a prescient article on UFOs, titled “Visitors from the Void.” (David Halperin, “[The Shaver Mystery—Richard Shaver, Ray Palmer, and the Quest for Lemuria (Part](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.davidhalperin.net/the-shaver-mystery-richard-shaver-ray-palmer-and-the-quest-for-lemuria-part-2/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728035195&usg=AOvVaw0td8D84eaYC0c8iXgoP90H) [2),](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.davidhalperin.net/the-shaver-mystery-richard-shaver-ray-palmer-and-the-quest-for-lemuria-part-2/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728035446&usg=AOvVaw37q8f6NHgdWzD84BxOWtWg)” July 11, 2014; Richard S. Shaver, “[Formula from the Underworld,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/AmazingStoriesVolume21Number06_692/page/n9/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728035683&usg=AOvVaw3m1DHGTCmkntqVBzg53ff2)” Amazing Stories 21, no. 6 (June 1947):

10–29; Vincent H. Gaddis, “[Visitors from the Void,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/AmazingStoriesVolume21Number06_692/page/n157/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728036032&usg=AOvVaw3EX4RMcv4pW3NcZZ7JG_J7)” Amazing Stories 21, no. 6 (June 1947): 159–161)

April — 11:00 a.m. US Weather Bureau meteorologist Walter A. Minczewski watches a silvery disc through a theodolite while tracking a ceiling balloon in Richmond, Virginia. It is traveling east to west at less than 15,000 feet and has a flat bottom and a dome on top. (NICAP, “[Silvery Disc Seen through Theodolite](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/4704XXrichmond_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728036412&usg=AOvVaw2J4TbkosKm2j54na_UVRhT)”; James E. McDonald, “[Statement on Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23meteorologists&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728036657&usg=AOvVaw3gpMZnfhXAYbporMxRCpEh)” in Symposium on Unidentified Flying Objects, Hearings, US House Committee on Science and Astronautics, 90th Cong., 2nd Sess., July 29, 1968, p. 62; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Jan-Jun-23-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728036948&usg=AOvVaw33oUOvtYhkqDka02KLg43c) [Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1947 January 1st–June 23rd, Supplemental Notes,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Jan-Jun-23-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728037293&usg=AOvVaw1om5Z_G8cIjT0shD89VEfD) The Author, 2000, pp. 17–21; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728037683&usg=AOvVaw3wytp_BbELauSnHyKFvl9r)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728037863&usg=AOvVaw1nC0F4OrzYlkdVNdFyatOO) p. 16)

April 15 — The US Naval Attaché in Stockholm issues a secret intelligence report, “Sweden: Guided Missiles, Alleged Rockets over Sweden.” Both the naval and military attachés agree that there is nothing to the ghost rocket episode. No foreign missiles have overflown or landed in Sweden, according to the evidence a, vailable. “Swedish officials prefer to dismiss it as an unexplained press sensation.” (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Jan-Jun-23-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728038199&usg=AOvVaw3CZIrbCVijhohRAosdcyC7) [Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1947 January 1st–June 23rd, Supplemental Notes,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Jan-Jun-23-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728038479&usg=AOvVaw2ocNYKmr0nGtJfGOsly3yU) The Author, 2000, p. 16)

April 17 — Col. [Oliver G. Haywood Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oliver_Haywood&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728038878&usg=AOvVaw2Xi51v_Hfm-OB-5ltkspky) of the Atomic Energy Commission writes a memorndum to [Harold A. Fidler](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harold_A._Fidler&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728039183&usg=AOvVaw0NrqIApRq-83xbWybqUBfD) at the Clinton Engineer Works in Oak Ridge, Tennessee, saying: “It is desired that no document be released which

* * *

refers to experiments with humans and might have adverse effect on public opinion or result in legal suits. Documents covering such work should be classified ‘secret.’” (Advisory Committtee on Human Radiation Experiments, memo, “Documents Retrieved from Oak Ridge Operations: The Atomic Energy Commission’s Declassification Review of Reports on Human Experiments and the Public Relations and Legal Liability Consequences,” December 6, 1994; Wikipedia, “[Unethical human experimentation in the United States](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unethical_human_experimentation_in_the_United_States%23Human_radiation_experiments&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728039948&usg=AOvVaw05kNn5mYIFQV_sVcbFgpBH)”)

Late April or early May — 12:05 p.m. Mrs. William Down and Mrs. H. G. Olavick of Tucson, Arizona, see an unusual, fleecy cloud in an otherwise cloudless sky. Moving around it in “yo-yo fashion” are a number of small discs with a dull-white finish. They move up and down and sideways, occasionally disappearing into or behind the cloud.

They watch the objects for 5–7 minutes, then all the discs disappear above the cloud, while a larger object emerges from the cloud and moves eastward. Behind it comes a V-formation of nine of the smaller discs, which then climbs at high speed toward the northeast and disappears in 2–3 seconds. The witnesses assume the objects are some new type of aircraft. (Bloecher, [p. ix](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_Introduction.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728040382&usg=AOvVaw1qY4YcnZy0OtDGiVCtfT7n); Herbert S. Taylor, “Satellite Objects and Cloud Cigars,” IUR 29, no. 1 (Spring 2004): 4)

May — 9:00 p.m. Harry Bentrup Jr. is on his porch in Jennings, Missouri, when a circular object surrounded by a ring of luminous green lights swoops in quickly from the east, hovers above him for 15 seconds, then takes off to the west. (MUFON case file)

May 1? — Mrs. W. C. Clark of Memphis, Tennessee, watches two objects “like tennis balls” fly over her yard. (“Three Memphians Say They Saw Objects,” Memphis (Tenn.) Commercial Appeal, July 7, 1947, p. 2)

May 1 — Rear Adm. [Roscoe H. Hillenkoetter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roscoe_H._Hillenkoetter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728041138&usg=AOvVaw2T5yMDfs3rJUMK_MOmyXAP) replaces [Hoyt Vandenberg](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hoyt_Vandenberg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728041391&usg=AOvVaw10hiCdISPS7VAlCH6ekOtN) as Director of Central Intelligence. ()

May 5 — [Hillenkoetter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roscoe_H._Hillenkoetter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728041766&usg=AOvVaw1lUdZ9zMvXEFpmmMlCl6V9) writes to Baruch, saying that his CIRES plan is “on the verge of being put into effect.” (Jan Aldrich)

May 10 — Rose Slawuta of Newark, New Jersey, sees a shining, elliptical object with a gold band around it approaching fron the west. (Newark (N.J.) Star-Ledger, July 7, 1947; Bloecher, [p. I-2](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionI.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728042208&usg=AOvVaw2WpDj_TEazUdIInEK9Nr-9))

May 14 — 8:30 p.m. A spherical object 3-4 feet in diameter is seen over Budapest, Hungary, passing southeast to northwest at about 3,000 feet altitude in a flat trajectory. (Allied Control Commission for Hungary; George Mitrovic, [The Gateways to the Gods](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sites.google.com/site/georgemitrovicauthor/excerpts-from-gateways-to-the-gods&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728042510&usg=AOvVaw0_AGT09Olgt16ewmC9y8oz)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sites.google.com/site/georgemitrovicauthor/excerpts-from-gateways-to-the-gods&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728042720&usg=AOvVaw3Lh4Rx2VB-DZRlLPnBpa9r) Kindle, 2012)

May 15 — 4:11 p.m. A Hermes test missile (V-2) at White Sands Proving Ground, New Mexico, goes off course and lands 6 miles east of Alamogordo five and a half minutes after launch. Commanding Officer Lt. Col. Harold R. Turner blames “peculiar phenomena” for the accident. The official explanation is that the V-2 had a defective fin. Trade consultant and former state representative [Jon Andrew Kissner](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://prabook.com/web/jon_andrew.kissner/883947&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728043192&usg=AOvVaw1XvBkWmpwpO0Ar9U2JmBD6) finds evidence in 1994 that possibly another object was seen in the vicinity of the rocket after the launch that might have been responsible for the failed test. (“[V-2 Goes Astray, Lands in Six Miles of Alamogordo,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92531031/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728043482&usg=AOvVaw1RtFofQT75icAi5W_l1Akx)” Las Cruces (N.Mex.) Sun-News, May 16, 1947, p. 1; Good Need, [pp. 55–57](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/54/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728043758&usg=AOvVaw2YuGMhJjlwjR2yClseyt9e); Wikipedia, “[Hermes program](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hermes_program&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728043987&usg=AOvVaw1ejQDnGFOVin1238B06Sjt)”)

May 17 or 19 — 8:30 p.m. Byron B. Savage, an RCA field engineer, sees a frosty-white or silvery elliptical object about the size of a B-29 heading northwest at 10,000 feet over Oklahoma City, Oklahoma, at three times the speed of a jet (about 1,800 mph). As it noiselessly passes overhead, it appears to be circular. (NICAP, “[Round and Flat](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470517oklacity_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728044283&usg=AOvVaw3BsDjNo1sJ0E-BSJDXApRL) [Object Observed by Field Engineer](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470517oklacity_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728044484&usg=AOvVaw2BebGcVZEE-lIpRZu45-73)”; Oklahoma City Times, June 26, 1947; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Jan-Jun-23-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728044762&usg=AOvVaw1TLbaUa0sIwdE1WO-bbf5S) [of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1947 January 1st–June 23rd, Supplemental Notes,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Jan-Jun-23-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728044983&usg=AOvVaw2QEiuoaYPO7JXCB2rhI97E) The Author, 2000, pp. 27–28; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728045268&usg=AOvVaw0ES2OnVYyYOkWAftKztNeS)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728045435&usg=AOvVaw1O2ah9uuyjJvm2zvqpTLwx) p. 16)

May 19 — Around 12:30 p.m. Navy veteran [Dean A. Hauser](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/110621454/dean-arnold-hauser&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728045719&usg=AOvVaw2nK3cEXxdFSpOap4nf6_Ej) and six other Pike’s Peak Railway workers (including Ted Weigand, Marion Hisshouse, T. J. Smith, L. D. Jamison) at Manitou Springs, Colorado, are taking a lunch break when they watch a silver object come in from the northwest, hover overhead, and gyrate at 1,000 feet. The UFO is moving “erratically in wide circles” and reflects light like it is made of metal. After 20 minutes it disappears in a straight line to the west-northwest. (“Manitou Vets Relate Story: Another ‘Disk’ Seen,” Denver Post, June 28, 1947, p. 1; Bloecher, [p. I-1](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionI.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728046055&usg=AOvVaw39y5-DKfzdzn2a0rVdFc6B); Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1947](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Jan-Jun-23-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728046278&usg=AOvVaw0vL67BRd0dbF2fITczxz7F) [January 1st–June 23rd, Supplemental Notes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Jan-Jun-23-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728046496&usg=AOvVaw3-fddrFb7Sk34973IN6bAU), The Author, 2000, pp. 29–30)

Late May — 11:00 a.m. [Colden R. Battey](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/26920458/colden-rhind-battey&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728046837&usg=AOvVaw1YIl8f9FHuRNbV5aJWi_n4), a physician from Augusta, Georgia, is fishing 10 miles off St. Helena Sound, near Beaufort, South Carolina. He notices a formation of four disc-like objects flying overhead in a southeasterly direction at a terrific rate of speed. The discs appear to be spinning on their axes and are at an estimated altitude of 20,000 feet. They are silvery and appear highly polished, and on their undersides Battey can see a circular rim or projection, about one-quarter of the way from the edges. No sound is heard as they fly overhead. The formation speeds out of view in less than 20 seconds. (NICAP, “[Four Discs Flying Overhead](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/4705XXbeaufort_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728047107&usg=AOvVaw3OhyBDpEA0JwlMH8C7GBZs)”; Bloecher, [p. I-2](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionI.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728047318&usg=AOvVaw1z6mqMW-QKInxCy8yIqfXO))

May 29 — 7:30 p.m. A Hermes II test missile (a modified V-2) is launched from White Sands Proving Ground in New Mexico to test the “Organ,” a series of ramjet air intakes designed to take pressure measurements. The missile travels south instead of north and lands in the Tepeyac Cemetery, 3 miles south of Juárez, Mexico, creating an

* * *

international incident. It leaves a crater 50 feet wide and 24 feet deep. German scientists [Wernher Von Braun](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wernher_von_Braun&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728047733&usg=AOvVaw0Tp6Tzq84Qv6AoXKl2cAkS) and [Ernst Steinhoff](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ernst_Steinhoff&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728047964&usg=AOvVaw1eXPSYPG6hiZg0iq5b-0Cu) are conducting the test. (Wikipedia, “[Hermes program](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hermes_program%23Hermes_II\)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728048267&usg=AOvVaw21w5H7PR0bJxyaVhiz6Kw9)”; J. Terry White, “[The Hermes II Incident,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.whiteeagleaerospace.com/the-hermes-ii-incident/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728048488&usg=AOvVaw30jk5MsjcaAIzAD3GA8PGt)” White Eagle Aerospace, May 2, 2011)

June — AMC civilian engineer W. R. Presley takes a muddy photo of a UFO at Oak Ridge, Tennessee. It is most likely a photographic flaw. (Hynek UFO Report, [p. 142](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/142/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728048853&usg=AOvVaw1KBAZ4KMs-QX2URc0NCPVh))

June 2 — Private pilot [Forrest Wenyon](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/132907687/forrest-proffitt-wenyon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728049143&usg=AOvVaw1KsUwFj975djGgqRz2_9oA) is flying over Rehoboth Beach, Delaware, and sees a silvery, jar-shaped object cross in front of his plane. It has a silver-white, fiery exhaust. (NICAP, “[Jar-Shaped Object Crosses in Front of](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470602rehoboth_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728049387&usg=AOvVaw1ZqIltwCahKKzfF4nAodov) [Aircraft](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470602rehoboth_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728049599&usg=AOvVaw3WsrAxUAqVa2SgQB92vNwG)”; Bloecher, [p. III-9](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionIII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728049841&usg=AOvVaw1qeY9vyWjHNZMcCiJ3ZEA1); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728050078&usg=AOvVaw0Hz-0_MskyCUh2_ggbKEan), p. 16)

June 4 — Project Mogul flight number 4 is allegedly launched from Alamogordo Army Air Field. (Kevin D. Randle, “The Project Mogul Flights and Roswell,” IUR 19, no. 6 (Nov./Dec. 1994): 6–7, 23; Robert J. Durant, “[Project Mogul](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/Roswell/durant.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728050411&usg=AOvVaw3Bh5Lq8T65dWjI1tv-A6ms) [Still a Flight of Fancy,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/Roswell/durant.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728050639&usg=AOvVaw2IdLO5qFTv7UpN0CGiIrHj)” IUR 26, no. 1 (Spring 2001): 17–27; David Rudiak, “[The Phony Mogul Balloon](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://roswellproof.homestead.com/Flight4_Trajectory.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728050918&usg=AOvVaw1lfDBnScfLKBSFhzXu7_VA) [Trajectory,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://roswellproof.homestead.com/Flight4_Trajectory.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728051145&usg=AOvVaw1WMkYbSBC0NPmGNqHNVIRc)” 2002; Kevin D. Randle, “[Mogul and Roswell,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2013/07/mogul-and-roswell.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728051363&usg=AOvVaw17NyWBVwwi4EIkuQfgafvS)” A Different Perspective,” July 11, 2013; Kevin D. Randle, “[A Few Facts about Project Mogul,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2013/07/mogul-and-roswell.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728051597&usg=AOvVaw2ych8PUz6LrPvu7Uv34F1X)” A Different Perspective, August 12, 2013; Kevin D. Randle, “[Truth](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2016/04/truth-about-mogul.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728051815&usg=AOvVaw1xb8PCYDeK79i0bitcWJKM) [about Mogul,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2016/04/truth-about-mogul.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728052031&usg=AOvVaw13W2uG8YncqKpwYyam3m3K)” A Different Perspective, April 4, 2016)

June 9 — A still-unlocated air intelligence summary is released, alleging that the Soviets in eastern Siberia are producing (or may be able to produce) 1,400 (or 1,800) aircraft based on the [Horten brothers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Horten_brothers&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728052318&usg=AOvVaw3WSlNM7l3CDKSOEydQ3rQU)’ VIII-type, low-aspect, disc- shaped design by 1952. A Russian aviation historian thinks that the factories in question are at the time producing copies of the German Messerschmidt Me 262 jet fighter. A correct, more detailed summary of the intelligence report is published in December 1948 in Air Intelligence Report Number 100-203-79, “Analysis of Flying Object Incidents in the U.S.” (Jan Aldrich)

June 10 — 3:30 p.m. Gyorik Ferenc and others on Arena Street \[modern Dózsa György út\] in Budapest, Hungary, watch four yellow-red discs moving toward the northwest in a straight-line formation for about 30 seconds. They are about 165 feet apart. The objects make a small arc around a corner of a park before disappearing. ([Project Blue](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/1947-06-9668691-Hungary/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728052646&usg=AOvVaw0AX2QAV3TlalJSGUaVI4aY) [Book record](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/1947-06-9668691-Hungary/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728052891&usg=AOvVaw1uuC36iMP-6KJmVOY2c4NK); Joe Brill, “UFOs behind the Iron Curtain,” Skylook, no. 76, March 1974, p. 8)

June 12 — 6:15 p.m. [Lovena Erickson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/21780741/lovena-erickson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728053227&usg=AOvVaw0rQ-t7AYB1nV6hV4_g9aRd) sees two high-speed, round objects at a high altitude over Weiser, Idaho. They move up and down twice and leave a vapor trail that persists for more than an hour. (NICAP, “[June 12, 1947,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/weiser470612dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728053466&usg=AOvVaw1Tszq18dFvb3CfU3qtYHFJ) [Weiser, Idaho](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/weiser470612dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728053668&usg=AOvVaw1VXG1KWH5ProwgKqzQcj6z)”; Bloecher, [p. II-8](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728053879&usg=AOvVaw0GBdfSdn9kmvkJ0vR9bGCN)[;](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728054062&usg=AOvVaw2SaZDHn6gI9YKUD0ekSoix) [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728054257&usg=AOvVaw0JiFIVAQcpUhk_3ZAstaj_), p. 17)

June 18 — Day. E. H. Sprinkle is one of a half-dozen Eugene, Oregon, residents who spot a formation of round objects “racing overhead” on a course to the northeast. Watching from Skinner’s Butte outside town. Sprinkle takes a snapshot of the objects with an inexpensive camera as they race over. Enlargements of the photograph show “seven dots” in a formation “shaped like an X or a Y, lined up across the sky.” Newspaper photographers say the dots “might be a fault in the developing process” that sometimes appears on a negative that has not been agitated properly in the developer. (“[Local Man Asserts Flights Seen Here,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/11713669/case-13-e-h-sprinkle/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728054579&usg=AOvVaw1zJunt_slpx5AyZo5SVQIT)” Eugene (Oreg.) Guard, June 26, 1947, p. 1; Bloecher, [p. IV-3](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionIV.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728054848&usg=AOvVaw2pLdz8lDw3YUHUfaiY0Qf_))

June 19 — USAAF Col. [Albert Boyd](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albert_Boyd&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728055107&usg=AOvVaw3BjzTifgsBZNuo2O_8641n) reaches a world airspeed record of 624 mph in a Lockheed P-80R Shooting Star at Muroc AFB \[later Edwards AFB\], California. (Wikipedia, “[Albert Boyd](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albert_Boyd&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728055341&usg=AOvVaw38r65A4aCWXAEJ-6o8gb7q)”)

June 19 — Maj. Gen. [Stephen Chamberlin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stephen_J._Chamberlin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728055612&usg=AOvVaw27DgW9RAzJ_0QNVx8ooPzU)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stephen_J._Chamberlin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728055785&usg=AOvVaw209kJeWvBDkFVC1b5G8fUD) head of War Department Intelligence, authorizes three electronic signals intelligence flights between July 1 and August 1 to look for radio signals over the Baltic Sea. The Swedish military is told that they are training flights. (Jan Aldrich)

June 21 — 11:55 a.m. [Guy R. Overman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/158858384/guy-r-overman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728056080&usg=AOvVaw2-g_qJpJi-HuoWfJyBiKl8) watches several silvery objects moving below a plane at Spokane, Washington. (NICAP, “[Eight Disc-Shaped Objects As Big As a House](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470621spokane_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728056317&usg=AOvVaw2bedRHsaWve8vYPSLA5QCg)”; Bloecher, [p. II-18](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728056531&usg=AOvVaw2X5AtPK_G53GmkL6ule4a6); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728056735&usg=AOvVaw2yYtTNWbvu4Zii4qtYDmob), p. 17)

June 21 — Log salvager [Harold A. Dahl](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/125878620/harold-albert-dahl&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728057001&usg=AOvVaw0e9TJREnRRHjB2Bsay7kxK) is patrolling east of Maury Island, Washington, with his 15-year-old son Charles and two crewmen when he allegedly sees six doughnut-shaped objects. Five of them are circling the sixth, which seems distressed. When it is directly above the boat at 500 feet, it supposedly spews some hot slag-like material that breaks Charles’s arm and kills his dog. Dahl claims he filmed the objects. (Clark III 721; John A. Keel, “The Maury Island Caper,” UFOs 1947–1987, Fortean Tomes, 1987, pp. 40–43)

June 22 — [Dahl](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/125878620/harold-albert-dahl&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728057440&usg=AOvVaw3AEKDOXdWCQOyRph7EoJS7) claims he is visited by a mysterious dark-suited man who knows all about the sighting. He tells his associate [Fred L. Crisman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fred_Crisman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728057689&usg=AOvVaw2_z44TP97rxNSH91g6Mq6-)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fred_Crisman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728057854&usg=AOvVaw3og8qWYgpR7aHP3DBf5SSW) and they allegedly go to the beach to pick up fragments. Dahl mails [Ray Palmer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raymond_A._Palmer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728058055&usg=AOvVaw01fl8gxPX2_tlg7calQvME) in Chicago, Illinois, some fragments. (Clark III 721; Kenn Thomas, Maury Island UFO: The Crisman Conspiracy, IllumiNet, 1999; Charlette LeFevre and Philip Lipson, “[The Maury Island UFO Incident,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nwlegendsmuseum.com/MauryIsland.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728058356&usg=AOvVaw11aI0LhglOkzy97OJ-8yOU)” February 2014)

June 22 — [Edward Louis DeRose](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/69230713/edward-louis-derose&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728058633&usg=AOvVaw0500xlicYqsQM4agviWf07) in Greenfield, Massachusetts, sees a small, round-shaped, silvery-white object moving in a northwesterly direction faster than a speeding plane at an estimated altitude of 1,000 feet. The object stays in view for 8–10 seconds until obscured by a cloud bank. It reflects the sunlight strongly as if is made of polished aluminum or silver. (Air Force Base Intelligence Report, “[Flying Discs,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/garrett_073047doc.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728058952&usg=AOvVaw2QD2jXm0zhNSfsYSpAW2jx)” July 30, 1947; Kevin D. Randle, “[Roswell, Nathan Twining, and the Mini-EOTS,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/roswell-nathan-twining-and-mini-eots.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728059188&usg=AOvVaw38P9YvPgYI-hzumG4a6SlM)” A Different Perspective, October 6, 2014)

June 22 — 3:30 p.m. [G. Oliver Dickson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/146611498/george-oliver-dickson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728060231&usg=AOvVaw3kubR5uYEHDgf6hMBky4eU) sees a shiny disc “a little like a blimp” flying north to south about 3,000 feet above Mount Franklin just north of El Paso, Texas. He estimates it is about 40 feet across and 5 feet thick. (“[More](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/23324523/el-paso-times/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728060626&usg=AOvVaw0YWecJkkGUmGtHnJsMnl9Y) [El Pasoans Report Seeing](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/23324523/el-paso-times/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728060862&usg=AOvVaw3px63yVhL1vGWSADbniih7) [‘Flying Discs’ in Southwest,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/23324567/el-paso-times/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728061075&usg=AOvVaw3G5l1YMzPewFblif2xXIAd)” El Paso (Tex.) Times, June 29, 1947, pp. 1–2)

June 22 — Evening. Yale University astrophysicist [Lyman Spitzer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lyman_Spitzer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728061396&usg=AOvVaw1-XS3vVBTii2IZmfZMDiSy) is speaking on WTIC radio in Hartford, Connecticut, and speculates that if life on Mars developed a bit earlier than on earth, it is possible that Martians have been civilized for millions of years. “Unless they had spent some time in a large city or had landed sufficiently recently to be photographed, we would have no record of their being here,” he says, and that “any few men who had seen them would probably not be believed by anyone else.” (“[Mars May Be Peopled, Says Yale Speaker,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/17766510/hartford-courant/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728061679&usg=AOvVaw36o-6p0RSULHXiH1rdwVDz)” Hartford (Conn.) Courant, June 23, 1947, p. 1; Clark III 455)

June 23 — Afternoon. Disabled stunt pilot Richard Rankin views 10 flat, circular objects flying in a V-formation over his house in Bakersfield, California. About two hours later, 7 of the objects are seen flying in the opposite direction. (Bloecher, [p. II-3](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728062028&usg=AOvVaw2u9UFOw7uWgYBKiixWWKNB); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728062246&usg=AOvVaw1IjLHJ5gSXiOkj7gbRRHg6)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728062436&usg=AOvVaw3Tn1szSvuIqi3-wxTWdPMU) p. 17; Kevin D. Randle, “[More Pre-Arnold UFO Sightings,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2013/06/more-pre-arnold-ufo-sightings.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728062685&usg=AOvVaw3Yd0m81BvxKhwXuWmNARaV)” A Different Perspective, June 30, 2013)

June 23 — 9:30 p.m. [Richard L. Bitters](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/70717504/richard-lowell-bitters&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728062968&usg=AOvVaw13OJzDgjmzsmVyOU3hZcfG) and his wife [Martha](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/156731314/martha-rose-bitters&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728063225&usg=AOvVaw31K7R7CXp3-8F-nTHiEEIb) are returning from a movie in Wapakoneta, Ohio, when they see a saucer-like object flying an uneven course in the sky. (“[Saucer Just Didn’t Fit Editor’s Idea of a ‘Scoop,’](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/101812679/wisconsin-state-journal/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728063480&usg=AOvVaw1Fm2SBAZ0xj9QJpd3pwJms)” Madison Wisconsin State Journal, July 7, 1947, p. 2; Bloecher, [p. III-6](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionIII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728063752&usg=AOvVaw2rjkGpPDDvDlAgs1AZkCrB))

June 24 (or 30) — Afternoon. [Bill Schuening](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/55395519/william-mathais-schuening&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728064077&usg=AOvVaw2NVHp47H0y1MCLp51cGIRN)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/55395519/william-mathais-schuening&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728064286&usg=AOvVaw3Igs7J8SUcPtoeUm4_eepE) a farmer, is driving his pickup truck down a remote rural road 25 miles north of Pendleton, Oregon, when he hears a loud humming sound. Coming over a rise, he sees in a nearby field a large disc-shaped object hovering 5–6 feet off the ground. He can also see two short (3 feet tall) figures wearing green suits and white helmets standing underneath the object. The figures suddenly vanish, and the craft then shoots towards the Columbia River, makes a big circle, and flies towards the mountains. (NICAP, “[Man Sees](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470624pendleton_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728064569&usg=AOvVaw2mkPIFypRjUWiC77drj4V1) [Figures Standing near Disc](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470624pendleton_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728064781&usg=AOvVaw11eVWEM-7g1mWkY1M-44fJ)”; Clark III 267; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1947-06-24-usa-pendleton.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728064998&usg=AOvVaw2srAr4jOGujOvXGyxDoHlj)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1947-06-24-usa-pendleton.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728065183&usg=AOvVaw1653c3014utOfkuIPp1k7n) November 7, 2018)

June 24 — 1:50 p.m. Railroad engineer Charles Kastl sees 9 or 10 spinning discs in the air about 12 miles east of Joliet, Illinois. They are a string of flat circular objects “going faster than anything I’ve ever seen.” Kastl can see no connecting link between them, but they act as though the leading disc has a motor in it to power the others, because when it flips, the others do as well. When it rights itself, the others also right themselves. (“[Flying Discs](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92584166/the-gazette/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728065488&usg=AOvVaw19G9o7ws_pNs0xefZvmYQz) [Seen by Railroad Man,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92584166/the-gazette/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728065736&usg=AOvVaw3xoFVox9OYtXWcySUjNKIT)” Cedar Rapids (Iowa) Gazette, June 28, 1947, p. 2; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728066027&usg=AOvVaw2bfdtjdoama0ai0uTjRKia)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728066236&usg=AOvVaw1tjKbEQ3eVEkrKsyrL8r9E) pp. 1–2; NICAP, “[Engineer](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470624illinois_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728066475&usg=AOvVaw2JAMqukjYabN1e9C2M8k_p) [Reports 10 Shiny Flat Discs](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470624illinois_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728066686&usg=AOvVaw0Aw_gxiGbA84-ww5tGBlxi)”; Kevin D. Randle, “[The June 23, 1947 UFO Sighting,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2013/03/the-june-23-1947-ufo-sighting.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728067026&usg=AOvVaw3uAkcCq876ssgE-BtBQZMq)” A Different Perspective, March 20, 2013)

June 24 — 3:00 p.m. Boise, Idaho, businessman [Kenneth Arnold](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenneth_Arnold&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728067404&usg=AOvVaw2JBW26pzCfYh5qB3IDCpKE), flying his CallAir Model A-2 from Chehalis to Yakima, Washington, sees a string of nine objects flying in an echelon formation past Mount Rainier, Washington. At first he assumes they are jets, but he can see no trails. They cover the 50-mile distance between Rainier and another peak in 1 minute 42 seconds. He estimates their speed to be at least 1,200 mph. The objects swerve in and out of the smaller peaks, flipping from side to side in unison, dipping, and presenting their lateral surfaces, which reflect the bright sunlight and cause the flashes he saw earlier. They are in view for about two and a half minutes and are last seen heading south over the last high peak of Mount Adams. Arnold tells the airport staff about it in Yakima at 4:00 p.m. and they call ahead to Pendleton, Oregon, to alert them of Arnold’s arrival at an air show and his story. A large crowd awaits him, and a discussion follows. The consensus is that Arnold has seen guided missiles. But no such technology exists at the time that can match the objects’ description and performance, and the late 1990s explanation that Arnold observed a flight of white pelicans is equally improbable. Researcher [Martin](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/shough.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728067698&usg=AOvVaw0kdZAsWunykP3KkFRnrfBo) [Shough](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/shough.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728067917&usg=AOvVaw2T2zemLyrQ41h2JMSkLXEw) concludes in 2010: “Examination of the sighting report in detail improves its evident internal consistency, rather than degrading it, and study of the principal contending explanations reveals that they are each very much less attractive when tried out in quantitative detail against the best information than they may appear at first sight.” (Wikipedia, “[Kenneth Arnold UFO Sighting](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenneth_Arnold_UFO_sighting&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728068198&usg=AOvVaw18wbUz_1JAWBcN7r-AEO-N)”; \[[Project Blue Book file](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.fold3.com/image/9668731&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728068407&usg=AOvVaw2X2GHowfFSOv-O-_G92Y1A)\]; NICAP, “[Kenneth Arnold](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470624ranier_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728068611&usg=AOvVaw1PKOjfvuXkv1qn8lyJFbUU) [Sighting](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470624ranier_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728068804&usg=AOvVaw1UE0aP9Bn5vbRAAvdX3wl_)”; Center for UFO Studies, \[[clippings and reports](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/cases/1947_06_24_US_OR_Mt_Rainier_NICAP_Arnold.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728069020&usg=AOvVaw2PSyYHnpBYAZipzRtOxe2L)\]; Kenneth Arnold and Ray Palmer, The Coming of the Saucers, Palmer, 1952, pp. 9–13; Bloecher, [p. I-2–3](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionI.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728069292&usg=AOvVaw1iGQU5CzBRXKH4XFWuvxA6); Patrick Gross, “[The Kenneth Arnold Sighting, June 24,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/arnold.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728069565&usg=AOvVaw3d_yX2TXgJx5FoaqZTpEhz) [1947](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/arnold.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728069787&usg=AOvVaw0x78vkzlAGe5yU86J6b9nc)”; Kim Hansen, “UFO Casebook,” UFOs 1947–1987, Fortean Tomes, 1987, pp. 48–53; John A. Keel, “[Kenneth Arnold and the F.B.I.,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201987%2520V%252032%2520N%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728070133&usg=AOvVaw2RTCRAWHiF8MvEmu4WacLu)” Flying Saucer Review 32, no. 5 (August 1987): 2–12; Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Revision.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728070428&usg=AOvVaw1plJpsdWdUYo5IgJ8niJeo) [History: Volume 1, 1947,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Revision.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728070660&usg=AOvVaw0_7zRtayfgRiavltcTSlVw) The Author, February 1991, pp. 5–9; Bruce Maccabee, “The Arnold Phenomenon: Part One,” IUR 20, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1995): 14–17; Bruce Maccabee, “The Arnold Phenomenon: Part Two,” IUR 20, no. 2 (Mar./Apr. 1995): 10–13, 24; Michael David Hall and Wendy Ann Connors, Alfred Loedding and the Great Flying Saucer Wave of 1947, Rose Press, 1998, [pp. 14–22](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/docs/loedd/loedd_chapter_3.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728071164&usg=AOvVaw0oF57LzubVbcUIezQb-RQI); Don Berliner, with Marie Galbreath and Antonio Huneeus, UFO Briefing Document: The Best Available Evidence, Dell, 2000, [pp. 54–59](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufobriefingdocum0000berl/page/54/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728071439&usg=AOvVaw2lxEyIqLKV2uq1T9dX5l5U); Martin Shough, “[The](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/cases/1947_06_24_US_OR_Mt_Rainier_Shough-article_Arnold.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728071668&usg=AOvVaw3LhTCUFnKjdLoHEfS840JD) [Singular Adventure of Mr. Kenneth Arnold,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/cases/1947_06_24_US_OR_Mt_Rainier_Shough-article_Arnold.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728071886&usg=AOvVaw1kR9-M3eovSpGAwr6x0Y-a)” June 2010; Bruce Maccabee, Three Minutes in June: The UFO Sighting That Changed the World, The Author, 2017; Nigel Watson, “Was It a Bird? Was It a Plane?” Fortean Times 355 (July 2017): 46–49; Clark III 169)
