June 24 — 3:30 p.m. Idaho Lieutenant Governor [Donald S. Whitehead](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_S._Whitehead&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728072361&usg=AOvVaw2Lnuwphe5C3bKdcNmGHrDf) and Justice of the Peace [Jacob M. Lampert](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/59830636/jacob-m-lampert&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728072620&usg=AOvVaw2FLdB5VIxwkOxJVJuRLBoD) see an object with a brilliant head and a smoky tail from an office window in downtown Boise, Idaho. It dips from view after about 20 minutes. (“[Whitehead, Lampert, Join ‘Disc List,’](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92600524/the-idaho-statesman/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728072885&usg=AOvVaw2pjFAQSDBlg2pBaV31wwpN)” Boise Idaho Statesman, July 3, 1947, p. 9; Bloecher, [pp. III-18–19](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionIII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728073183&usg=AOvVaw1Tyf9kQiRSvxCgjv2y6UC7))

June 24 — Afternoon. Fred M. Johnson, a prospector in the Mount Adams, Oregon, area, sees 5-6 oval objects with tails about 30 feet in diameter. He watches one through a telescope. They are not flying in any sort of formation and as they bank in a turn, the sunlight flashes off them. As they approach, Johnson notices that his compass begins to spin wildly. When the objects finally vanish in the distance, the compass returns to normal. Johnson’s report is the very first “unidentified” case in the Project Sign files. (NICAP, “[Prospector Compass Incident](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470624cascades_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728073490&usg=AOvVaw3aAmxKKS28_GpjLqAT_DZI)”; Bloecher, [p. IV-](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionIV.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728073838&usg=AOvVaw2ndM9-ASQu2ET6D3ejYSJK) [3](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionIV.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728074188&usg=AOvVaw0vRXzjXPfdpYGvHTBjOV7I); Clark III 170–171; Bruce Maccabee, “The Arnold Phenomenon: Part Three,” IUR 20, no. 3 (May/June 1995): 6–7; Martin Shough, “[The Singular Adventure of Mr. Kenneth Arnold,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/cases/1947_06_24_US_OR_Mt_Rainier_Shough-article_Arnold.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728074696&usg=AOvVaw1-rHPEnesLfj8WG6H31K3D)” June 2010, pp. 106, 109–110; Randle, Levelland, 2021, pp. 58–59)

June 25 — [Kenneth Arnold](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenneth_Arnold&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728075219&usg=AOvVaw38pypr1DZvieJybmQg3BWx) goes to the East Oregonian office in Pendleton, Oregon, and speaks with reporters Nolan Skiff and [William C. Bequette](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/72655957/william-c-bequette&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728075700&usg=AOvVaw1VvBw4lPm3XM8oRWgO3cQS)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/72655957/william-c-bequette&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728075919&usg=AOvVaw0pgENv6GHTVF-uNpwDCw4t) Arnold says the “saucer-like” objects were racing over the Cascade Mountains with a peculiar weaving motion “like the tail of a Chinese kite.” Bill Bequette writes the first saucer news story for the newspaper. He does not use the term “flying saucer,” but headline writers in other papers use it (such as the Philadelphia Inquirer on June 26), and reporters start picking it up. (“Impossible! Maybe, But Seein’ Is Believin’, Says Flier,” Pendleton East Oregonian, June 25, 1947, p. 1; “[Flying Saucers Puzzle Pilot,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/21137758/the-philadelphia-inquirer/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728076292&usg=AOvVaw2iMwah93qXLNb-LfctV8fp)” Philadelphia Inquirer, June 26, 1947, p. 1; Clark III 170; Kenneth Arnold and Ray Palmer, The Coming of the Saucers, 1952, Palmer, pp. 13–15; Pierre Lagrange, “A Moment in History: An Interview with Bill Bequette,” IUR 23, no. 4 (Winter 1998): 15, 20; “[Saturday Night Uforia: ‘It Seems Impossible—But There It Is,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.dailykos.com/stories/2009/4/18/720521/-&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728076725&usg=AOvVaw3XDe19la45TS0FhjJqTRBj)’” Daily Kos, April 18, 2009; Phil Wright, “[The Sighting,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.eastoregonian.com/news/local/the-sighting/article_1dc33f61-868d-5c36-b159-87c8465fb662.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728077017&usg=AOvVaw1cNX5Ri7hwSmJLbEZxt88z)” Portland East Oregonian, June 16, 2017)

June 25 — Shortly after 12:00 noon. W. I. Davenport is working on the roof of a house at 82nd Street and Holmes Road in Kansas City, Missouri, when he hears the sound of a motor. Looking up, he sees 9 objects approaching from the east. They are aluminum-colored and leave vapor trails. (“[Puzzle in Sky Whiz,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/101813674/the-kansas-city-star/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728077599&usg=AOvVaw3MgVvcGBQvwfQxgUCZyrFW)” Kansas City (Mo.) Star, June 26, 1947, p. 6)

June 26 — 2:00 a.m. Mrs. J. M. Harrison watches a large fireball pass toward the northwest from her residence at 4639 South Oakenwald, Chicago, Illinois. It breaks up into two dozen small discs that whirl around rapidly. (“[Dr. Urey](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/23171861/chicago-tribune/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728078138&usg=AOvVaw2NvY6Q_0XNuzYi6_pvVDNX) [Scoffs at ‘Atom Angle’ to Flying Disks,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/23171861/chicago-tribune/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728078453&usg=AOvVaw3hlcwq9AgSYT5MTo_0qtrc)” Chicago Tribune, July 6, 1947, p. 8)

June 26 — [Kenneth Arnold](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenneth_Arnold&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728078936&usg=AOvVaw2A4oAYcJov9k5qkIS_DoVb) is interviewed live on KWRC radio in Pendleton, Oregon, by broadcaster [Theodore A. “Ted”](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/77642903/theodore-a_-smith&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728079315&usg=AOvVaw3TdJwmPc8UHlyyoN1IaQJR) [Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/77642903/theodore-a_-smith&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728079647&usg=AOvVaw304lot97oOI5gS9yGQwT0L)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/77642903/theodore-a_-smith&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728079919&usg=AOvVaw3bcpZVrmR2BepQljuhUjf7) (Patrick Gross, “[About the June 25, 1947, Interview on WKPG Radio by Bill Bequette](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/arnoldrepbequette.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728080261&usg=AOvVaw0gOX1QW0n8X8bJQJzHoPfL)”; “[Kenneth Arnold](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v%3DE0D8eAm8h2Y&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728080563&usg=AOvVaw1AZ3wAJkyS-CPM3ZfGpwtL) [Interviewed by Bill Bequette](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v%3DE0D8eAm8h2Y&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728080777&usg=AOvVaw0ORNP_MKFIta0vggKs4voe) \[actually Ted Smith\],” Nutsandbolts UFO YouTube channel, December 12, 2010)

June 26 — Northrop delivers a second four-engine XB-35 flying wing aircraft to Muroc AFB \[now Edwards AFB\], California. (Wikipedia, “[Northrop YB-35](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northrop_YB-35%23XB-35&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728081125&usg=AOvVaw0fOJ2v7p3FhdS05zk6Ch1M)”)

June 27 — 9:50 a.m. Mrs. W. B. Cummings is driving about 5 miles southeast of San Antonio, New Mexico, when she sees a bright silver object descending quickly in the east. It leaves a short white trail. White Sands officials say there has been no missile testing since June 12. (“[More El Pasoans Report Seeing ‘Flying Discs’ in Southwest,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/23324523/el-paso-times/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728081564&usg=AOvVaw24mU7PpXaNc1_Enq8Pw-Rn)” El Paso (Tex.) Times, June 29, 1947, p. 1)

June 27 — Pentagon Army AF Public Relations Officer Capt. Tom Brown says the army has no idea what the discs are. (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: Volume 1, 1947,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Revision.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728081970&usg=AOvVaw0Mqki0yH9cQ9pBglfQWUka) The Author, February 1991, p. 16)

June 27 — In a United Press dispatch from Pendleton, Oregon, [Kenneth Arnold](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenneth_Arnold&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728082278&usg=AOvVaw3OkLkh34sQCOWy_uhP3VrP) expresses frustration over the furor that his saucer sighting has caused. A preacher has called him from Texas to say that the flying discs are “harbinger of doomsday.” A woman recognizes Arnold in a Pendleton café and runs out shrieking that he is “the man who saw the men from Mars.” He says the whole thing has gotten out of hand: “Half the people I see look at me as a combination Einstein, Flash Gordon, and screwball. I wonder what my wife back in Idaho thinks.” (“[Report of](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/52122451/ufo-june-27-1947-p1/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728082561&usg=AOvVaw1mBUpK4xDugngZNcnB7YAQ) [‘Flying Saucers’ Causes Furor; Texas Preacher Calls Flock for World’s End,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/52122451/ufo-june-27-1947-p1/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728082781&usg=AOvVaw1UJBg3nEp_CZ-UW7LDJYjO)” Medford (Oreg.) Mail Tribune, June 27, 1947, p. 1)

June 27 — Day. Capt. [Robert D. Dwan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/197782484/robert-d-dwan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728083110&usg=AOvVaw02krzGyLvUkndahrk8IKMv)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/197782484/robert-d-dwan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728083291&usg=AOvVaw3GE1_Gm7idfmk-eHHggreM) a pilot out of Alamogordo Army Air Field \[now Holloman AFB\], New Mexico, is flying a private plane near Engle, New Mexico, at 3,000 feet, when he looks down and sees a “ball of fire, with a fiery blue tail behind it.” The object is about 2,000 feet below him, and he is “certain it is a meteorite.” The object disintegrates as he watches it. (Bloecher, [pp. III-9–10](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionIII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728083608&usg=AOvVaw2gjBvVgpM06zbHHv3sLnrI))

June 27 — Afternoon. Clyde Homan sees two groups of loosely bunched objects, rocking back and forth as they fly noiselessly above Woodland, Washington. The objects are bright, flat, and moving at an estimated 600 mph. (Bloecher, [pp. II-1–2](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728083910&usg=AOvVaw3SRCWnCebs-Xp3xugv48bx))

* * *

June 28 — 1:15 p.m. Lieut. [Eric B. Armstrong](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/63573411/eric-baum-armstrong&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728084278&usg=AOvVaw2xcCogUNWq_nWxf_AYicPw), flying an F-51 at 6,000 feet 30 miles north of Lake Mead, Nevada, sees a formation of 5–6 objects streak by his plane. They are in close formation at an estimated speed of 285 mph. (NICAP, “[Formation of 5–6 Objects Head toward P-51](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470628ftmeade_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728084501&usg=AOvVaw2pJmHLg8Ph_FQJPmU4nltj)”; Bloecher, [p. III-10](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionIII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728084722&usg=AOvVaw26vQ6VALL8v_JnXSinNH56); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728084917&usg=AOvVaw0yP3OAuqcjT0vYH9Xaiy37), p. 17)

June 28 — 9:20 p.m. Two pilots and two intelligence officers (Capt. [Wilson H. Kayko](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/102557048/wilson-harold-kayko&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728085281&usg=AOvVaw0tWIavW1b18IVJferddLbW), Capt. John H. Cantrell, 1st Lt. Theodore Dewey, and Capt. Redman) at Maxwell Field \[now Maxwell AFB\] in Montgomery, Alabama, see a bright light zigzagging across the sky for 25 minutes. When it is directly overhead, the UFO makes a sharp 90° turn and disappears to the south. (NICAP, “[Object Zig-Zags with Bursts of Speed](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470628maxwellafb_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728085680&usg=AOvVaw21lfjjZewww_ekAfpXhaLV)”; Bloecher, [p. III-3](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionIII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728086069&usg=AOvVaw0VQV25OpLBBZjXP7PooNyC); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728086411&usg=AOvVaw1a4dpw7lgnU3hE_G_RjquJ), p. 18)

June 29 — 1:15 p.m. [Carl J. Zohn](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.geni.com/discussions/92999&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728086854&usg=AOvVaw1MjB0aomNRDQgISsluA7MT)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.geni.com/discussions/92999&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728087111&usg=AOvVaw0_Y_mQif7er5zJB6y5kQwx) a guided missile expert with the Naval Research Laboratory, is 20 miles east-northeast of Las Cruces, New Mexico, to observe a V-2 rocket launch scheduled for July 3. Between 1:00 and 1:30 p.m., he is riding out to the testing grounds with John R. Kauke and NRL scientist [Curtis C. Rockwood](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/99407032/curtis-c-rockwood&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728087485&usg=AOvVaw276195lAusgMH1YgG0hPwB) (and his wife Nancy) when they see a silvery disc flying at 8,000–10,000 feet. It has no appendages, wings, tail, or propellers. After about 60 seconds it disappears. (NICAP, “[Naval Research Lab Rocket Scientists See Silver Discs](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470629lascruces_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728087918&usg=AOvVaw21sgsvq634evMo1AtmEceH)”; Bloecher, [p. III-18](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionIII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728088294&usg=AOvVaw0fAQZP11Gm6oulFFwD4kxK); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728088654&usg=AOvVaw2WQjToWcTav-mlHh0q0K2_)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728088932&usg=AOvVaw1BEM2KTvb14V-_FPeQjXkk) p. 18; Evelyne Tsezana, “[Grandpa Zohn Saw UFOs in New Mexico,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.geni.com/discussions/92999&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728089284&usg=AOvVaw1o_SwpcfBm24c43tzyG1QJ)” Geni, April 6, 2011)

June 30 — 9:10 a.m. Naval Lt. William G. McGinty is flying a P-80 from Williams AFB \[now Phoenix-Mesa Gateway Airport\], Arizona, near the Grand Canyon when he observes two circular objects diving at inconceivable speed and landing 25 miles south of the canyon. (NICAP, “[P-80 Pilot Sees Circular Objects Dive and Land](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470630grandcanyon_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728089728&usg=AOvVaw2Wcnmnj355prxqumWQ8rYf)”; Bloecher, [p. II-12](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728089952&usg=AOvVaw347mBqT8Z0Wer1OvQhSDg0)[;](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728090142&usg=AOvVaw1ooxDcUk9Wii3ckGZYdCOY) [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728090350&usg=AOvVaw1LP2KlHig7EACIvECbn8I5)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728090517&usg=AOvVaw3IjaIPARjINmtxKeAqSyxr) p. 18)

June 30 — Eighth Air Force Brig. Gen. [Roger M. Ramey](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/1686367/lt-gen-roger-m-ramey/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728090824&usg=AOvVaw0WcGmElR_slvJZhTX1elmG) and intelligence officer Col. [Alfred Kalberer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/124983070/alfred-f-kalberer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728091070&usg=AOvVaw0S4_XM_aHQaZV6Il3fuqpt) hold a press conference in Fort Worth, Texas, on the flying discs. Ramey thinks people are “seeing heat waves.” Kalberer labels the sightings as “Buck Rogers stuff.” (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Jun-24-July-6-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728091473&usg=AOvVaw2ozf_5_TkLlYTTiG1YIxwK) [History: 1947 June 24th–July 6th, Supplemental Notes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Jun-24-July-6-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728091770&usg=AOvVaw2jRVUY97MAhaAvFG5r0uke)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Jun-24-July-6-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728091988&usg=AOvVaw22sm93hyO-D8K64_lXCwdZ) The Author, 2000, p. 17)

June 30 — Around this time the Air Force Research and Development office of the Air Materiel Command organizes an informal project at Wright Field in Dayton, Ohio, to collect UFO reports in the interests of national security. The project officer at Wright Field is Lt. Col. [Edward G. Nabell Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/50579195/edward-gordon-nabell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728092349&usg=AOvVaw2PIXIE99QiAior5vB7M-pW) ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728092610&usg=AOvVaw06lzluIUAmNrI206YBirQ7), p. 13)

Summer — Naval Cmdr. [L. H. Witherspoon](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/36454572/luther-h-witherspoon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728093002&usg=AOvVaw1gWqUz22P-m-lWAlMC7qMK) sees a disc-shaped UFO flash over the airport at Pittsburg, Kansas. (UFOEv, [p. 30](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D42%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728093418&usg=AOvVaw0gdM58aMasmN0DWd5Qp-i9))

Early July — A cyclist near Amfreville-la-Mi-Voie, Seine-Maritime, France, encounters an oval object, 10 feet long and 5 feet high, resting on the road 100 feet in front of her. Two small beings dressed in outfits and headgear are busy around it. When she honks her horn, the entities scurry into the object, entering it through a 20-inch opening. The UFO rises, oscillates, and streaks away. (Clark III 267; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1947-07-france-amfreville.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728093925&usg=AOvVaw1_VYpt4Xo0TXrBdJA91ix5)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1947-07-france-amfreville.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728094132&usg=AOvVaw1hK9yhWjINaY4T_xnzfKKU) August 81, 2006)

July 1 — Day. Animal ecologist [Charles K. Gunn](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/205141223/charles-kenneth-gunn&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728094417&usg=AOvVaw3u2WNE-aoIZCL8fWlyRh70)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/205141223/charles-kenneth-gunn&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728094611&usg=AOvVaw0eY7KezTnnsYTBdZqhFF6m) his wife, and two passengers are driving near North Bedeque, Prince Edward Island, when they see a bright, shapeless object speeding along in the sky for 30 seconds. (Bloecher, [p.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionIII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728094839&usg=AOvVaw0VR17Lx3J7bSw_5zrcXxLT) [III-18](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionIII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728095050&usg=AOvVaw3OQlW3sWWfDUFqHbX05cg1))

July 1 — A target is picked up on radar at Chitose Air Base, Hokkaido, Japan, moving 16 miles north at speeds in excess of 500 mph. The blip instantly reverses course four times, breaks into two objects, then merges into one again. (Col. James F. Olive Jr., “[Radar Pick-Ups of High-Speed Targets in the Far East,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/26sept1947letter.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728095338&usg=AOvVaw2MBVy-JRbf9KGQrZZELBMi)” Memorandum for Assistant Chief of Air Staff, Washington, D.C., September 26, 1947)

July 1 — Col. [Alfred Kalberer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/124983070/alfred-f-kalberer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728095622&usg=AOvVaw1tuTynOfEdI-mlgWh1_61N) holds another press conference in Fort Worth, Texas, and brings astronomer [Oscar Monnig](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oscar_Monnig&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728095857&usg=AOvVaw0k3XjL2XdqoRSIZolz9Xpu) along to comment that the discs are “an interesting study in human psychology.” (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Jun-24-July-6-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728096118&usg=AOvVaw0EfCSnlBs9LD6E0oM7Nubp) [Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1947 June 24th–July 6th, Supplemental Notes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Jun-24-July-6-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728096362&usg=AOvVaw3tf7IEgVq4AKPuRDqroDW5), The Author, 2000,

pp. 23–24)

July 1 — Night. Albuquerque, New Mexico, Chamber of Commerce official [Max Hood](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/64056498/max-h_-hood&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728096821&usg=AOvVaw03TYaQYEaW_tzUJ-ujNoK6) sees a bluish disc zigzagging for about 30 seconds. (Bloecher, [p. III-17](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionIII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728097230&usg=AOvVaw2PRTl6545toGdz-uO02L4o); Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Jun-24-July-6-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728097608&usg=AOvVaw0hKATaCQfTaivHRWsB6OmG) [1947 June 24th–July 6th, Supplemental Notes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Jun-24-July-6-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728098008&usg=AOvVaw0Tx_1RFHBsJB58s6BD96ez)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Jun-24-July-6-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728098325&usg=AOvVaw37cpnyNJ78dkiDDJ3aWZ-j) The Author, 2000, pp. 23)

July 1 — 10:10 p.m. Meteorologist Ellwood E. Unger and his wife watch a round, orange, luminous object going about 100 mph after they leave a movie theater in Louisville, Kentucky. (Bloecher, [p. III-2](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionIII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728098862&usg=AOvVaw2k71Xxbe0F0BZougGldxju); Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Jun-24-July-6-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728099111&usg=AOvVaw2BioDqdNrRBWCZe7hAIqJe) [Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1947 June 24th–July 6th, Supplemental Notes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Jun-24-July-6-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728099481&usg=AOvVaw0hE3qE48vpoLcLJz2ICF3J), The Author, 2000,

p. 23)

July 1? — 11:00 p.m. Mrs. A. M. King is with another passenger on the deck of the Union-Castle Mail [SS Llandovery](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.polishresettlementcampsintheuk.co.uk/passengerlist/otherships.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728100072&usg=AOvVaw02b1HEt1R2jle5Ze1blHOL) [Castle](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.polishresettlementcampsintheuk.co.uk/passengerlist/otherships.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728100343&usg=AOvVaw1SNyOqAE7UuaEG_F6YqNV8) as it is steaming through the Mozambique Channel. They notice a star-like object traveling fast toward the ship. It shines a strong beam of light on the water within 150 feet of the ship, then descends, the beam shortening and becoming brighter as it nears the water. Soon the light switches off and they can see a metallic object that looks like a cigar with the end cut off. It remains about 20 feet above the sea, moving parallel with the ship. King

* * *

estimates it is about four times the length of the ship and four times as tall. After a few seconds, a large flame erupts from the rear of the object. It vanishes soundlessly in the darkness. (Lorenzen, FS Hoax, [pp. 18–19](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/1966CoralLorenzenFlyingSaucersTheStartlingEvidenceOfTheInvasionFromOuterSpacenotOCR/page/n15/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728100930&usg=AOvVaw2V33vur8XDy7hepecQQsNp))

July 1–3? — According to [Annie Jacobsen](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Annie_Jacobsen&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728101224&usg=AOvVaw1IISTgGsoK3oz2HcLd9awe)’s informant, EG&G engineer [Alfred O’Donnell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://obituaries.reviewjournal.com/obituary/alfred-o-donnell-1082038666&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728101488&usg=AOvVaw0_L_TK3UDjcDs6uJe9RNdC), the upcoming Roswell, New Mexico, crashes are the result of a psychological warfare operation by Soviet leader [Joseph Stalin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Stalin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728101742&usg=AOvVaw3wbtBUd8kwIPrrcNg_xpS5) to fly into US airspace two disc- or wing-shaped aircraft based on a [Horton brothers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Horten_brothers&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728101994&usg=AOvVaw0IaGJvSDqgEpWO5y8kcWhz) design obtained at the end of World War II. One craft allegedly contains living dwarves or children (human guinea pigs) who had been surgically altered using similar methods to those used in Auschwitz concentration camp by Nazi doctor [Josef Mengele](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Josef_Mengele&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728102290&usg=AOvVaw3LEscrai_El0isVyArlWLG). This aircraft is remotely controlled by the crew of the second craft. The idea is to land the first aircraft in a visible location in the US, perhaps in Washington, D.C. The children would exit the craft and present themselves to the highest echelons of the government. However, the two aircraft crash in the New Mexico desert and, he claims, the Atomic Energy Commission is put in charge of the remains. (Jacobsen, Area 51, [pp. 367–374](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/366/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728102623&usg=AOvVaw1nOjmlljE6RJb0JwS_QJJA); Kremlin 30–36)

July 1–3 — US Signal Corps radar sites in southern New Mexico and one at Kirtland Air Force Base near Albuquerque allegedly track an object “flitting around” the sky, frequently returning but finally disappearing on the night of July 4. Much of this story originates with now-discredited Roswell witness [Frank Kaufmann](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/13371870/frank-j-kaufmann&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728103037&usg=AOvVaw1i6uzTi4ssV38Nn5Name3r), who claims he was ordered to bring a group of radar experts to Alamogordo to evaluate unexplained radar targets at White Sands Missile Range. (Kevin D. Randle and Donald R. Schmitt, The Truth about the UFO Crash at Roswell, Evans, 1994, [p. 159](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/truthaboutufocra0000rand/page/158/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728103344&usg=AOvVaw3samQTw7Kb8Ilkm1APIJCh); Kevin D. Randle, A History of UFO Crashes, Avon, 1995, [p. 8](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/historyofufocras0000rand/page/8/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728103641&usg=AOvVaw28BfZOK6HwnteDAEcEggl2); Jim Wilson, “[Roswell Plus 50,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://greyfalcon.us/ROSWELL%2520PLUS%252050.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728103847&usg=AOvVaw2QM9bt0YS53GBK14nBSeTN)” Popular Mechanics 174 (July 1997): 48–53; Kevin D. Randle, “Frank Kaufmann, Roswell Witness,” IUR 27, no. 3 (Fall 2002): 8, 17–19; Mark Rodeghier, “Frank Kaufmann Exposed,” IUR 27, no. 3 (Fall 2002): 9–11, 26)

July 2 — 8:00 p.m. Spectators at a baseball game at the Cincinnati (Ohio) Milling Machine Company watch two slow- moving discs hovering above the field for 10 minutes. (“[100 at Ball Game Tell of Seeing Two Mystery Saucers,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/101830625/the-cincinnati-post/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728104388&usg=AOvVaw0HpYt9FDp8-7Ay06vCykEA)” Cincinnati (Ohio) Post, July 7, 1947, p. 1)

July 2 — 9:50 p.m. Mr. and Mrs. [Dan Wilmot](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/rw/w/paulwilmot.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728104821&usg=AOvVaw0HngNwZ_qDh612VJvlTrGH) see an oval object like two inverted saucers pass over their house moving northwest in Roswell, New Mexico. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728105181&usg=AOvVaw0vuhC3ZuApvwjTLrcL3fFD), p. 19; Kevin D. Randle and Donald R. Schmitt, The Truth about the UFO Crash at Roswell, Evans, 1994, [p. 159](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/truthaboutufocra0000rand/page/158/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728105518&usg=AOvVaw0tcm55mfO1ZOiORZE0L2kg); Kevin D. Randle and Donald R. Schmitt, “When and Where Did the Roswell Object Crash?” IUR 19, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1994): 13–14)

July 3 — 8:55 a.m. William F. LeFevre watches a shiny, mirror-like disc zoom over River Drive near West 8th Street in Denver, Colorado, at several thousand feet and make a 45° turn before vanishing toward the southwest. (Denver Post, July 5, 1947; Michael David Hall and Wendy Ann Connors, Alfred Loedding and the Great Flying Saucer Wave of 1947, Rose Press, 1998, [p. 44](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/docs/loedd/loedd_chapter_3.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728106048&usg=AOvVaw1wFyE6HXgLwJrXLm6yJVZf))

July 3 — Morning. Project Mogul Flight number 8, a cluster of plastic balloons, is launched from Holloman AFB, New Mexico. (Kevin D. Randle, “The Project Mogul Flights and Roswell,” IUR 19, no. 6 (Nov./Dec. 1994): 6–7, 23)

July 3 — 2:30 p.m. Amateur astronomer John F. Cole watches a group of 10 objects moving northwest near Harborside, Maine, at 600–1,200 mph. Each is 50–150 feet wide. The objects are milling about in loose formation like a “swarm of bees” for 10–15 seconds. (NICAP, “[Astronomer Observes Ten Large Objects](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470703sbrooksville_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728106467&usg=AOvVaw2z8aU1FctS18KtmunXXjpk)”; Bloecher, [p. III-18](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionIII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728106709&usg=AOvVaw331eqxY-m_XclvvrT8JV7A); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728106910&usg=AOvVaw0QTif-jfEGlzLjVMUxIvbQ)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728107091&usg=AOvVaw1CoTtUeKUClFtaOBxFxGe8) p. 19; James E. McDonald, “[Statement on Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23astronomers&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728107401&usg=AOvVaw3dTj3ki3PlWUbOSIGcNZMe)” in Symposium on Unidentified Flying Objects, Hearings, US House Committee on Science and Astronautics, 90th Cong., 2nd Sess., July 29, 1968, p. 60)

July 3 — The St. Louis Post-Dispatch reports that the Air Research Center at Wright Field, Ohio, and the army intelligence service are looking into the flying discs. An INS dispatch states that Commander of the Army Air Force Gen. [Carl Spaatz](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Spaatz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728107866&usg=AOvVaw1U963p6sUcLABcuhargeCx) has asked Wright Field to look into such reports. Air Materiel Command’s Lt. Gen.

[Nathan F. Twining](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nathan_Farragut_Twining&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728108161&usg=AOvVaw2uVacIhrngonBTCwMDJ9Ah) tells Idaho Evening Statesman reporter [David N. Johnson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/39757884/david-n_-johnson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728108458&usg=AOvVaw0PwsAw8XjlqhJnw-HbsHiC) that officials are indeed looking into the discs and that Wright Field has no comparable technology. Lieut. [William C. Anderson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Charles_Anderson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728108713&usg=AOvVaw0Qg4ekJXXILRQnAkER_R0V), Wright Field public relations officer, says there is no confirmation that the discs exist. Maj. [Paul Gaynor](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/81697834/paul-f-gaynor&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728108942&usg=AOvVaw1WnBTZkaxbXxHxzKJwfj6-) says the Army Air Force needs more concrete information. German scientists working at Wright Field are asked about the discs, but they say they have heard nothing about any such experiments in Europe. (“[Army Gets Around to Checking ‘Flying](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/37261859/army-gets-around-to-checking-flying/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728109218&usg=AOvVaw0qKizdXGcs6olBxR5vHiYs) [Discs’ and Is Mystified,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/37261859/army-gets-around-to-checking-flying/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728109448&usg=AOvVaw2gxt8YaxZuRJa2Fut1OhlA)” St. Louis Post-Dispatch, July 3, 1947, p. 1; Dave Johnson, “[AAF Investigates Reports](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92600372/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728109775&usg=AOvVaw2UhRLM0bQFJBatNFj8jPTf) [of](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92600524/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728110006&usg=AOvVaw3gTXm84ajhsk8WtdS2z9FA) [Mysterious Air Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92600524/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728110258&usg=AOvVaw2obrQfo_c2BZcIIYgDc-H4)” Boise Idaho Daily Statesman, July 3, 1947, pp. 1, 9; “[Military Says ‘No Results’ in Disc](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92602735/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728110528&usg=AOvVaw01LXOfSbgNlrmeWNKZR6RA) [Probe,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92602735/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728110857&usg=AOvVaw0UlrpLtgH9ZLpnAzEAS7ee)” Boise Idaho Daily Statesman, July 4, 1947, p. 2; “[Weird ‘Flying Saucers’ Seen over 10 States,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92602122/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728111152&usg=AOvVaw0Csac9FKvYrgUIP_Jzwesc)” New York Daily News, July 4, 1947, Final ed., p. 8)

July 3 — 5:45 p.m. Farmer Ewen McNeill in Village Green, east of Charlottetown, Prince Edward Island, sees a black, rocket-shaped projectile trailing a blindingly white flame and a smoke trail pass overhead as he is working his fields. It seems to be flying at 10,000 feet and is visible for 15 seconds. Around the same time, a resident of Augustine Cove watches an “object the size of an apple” traveling south at high speed. (Bloecher, [p. II-17](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728111532&usg=AOvVaw1bjaGH1EycMr7hFeI-BzoV); Chris Rutkowski, Canada’s UFOs: Declassified, August Night, 2022, p. 64)

* * *

July 3 — 6:30 p.m. Mrs. Walter Johnson and her family see 8–9 discs flying out of the southern sky 6 miles west of Saint Maries, Idaho, over the St. Joe River. The objects came in “very fast, slow down jerkily, then flutter to the ground like leaves.” Mrs. Johnson thinks the objects are about the size of a “five-room house.” When they reach a clearing in the timber, they appear to “settle Down” a few at a time. Mrs. Johnson reports the sighting to intelligence officers at the Spokane Army Air Base \[now Fairchild AFB\], and an intensive air search is carried out by two missions of the National Guard’s 116th Fighter Group. Local sheriff’s deputies also make a ground search, but no traces of alanding can be found. (“[‘Saucer’ Reports Increase](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/101831002/the-spokesman-review/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728112002&usg=AOvVaw1HtgHCgaxbDtFX1bBSMKxr) [As Sky Is Searched in Vain,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/101831059/the-spokesman-review/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728112239&usg=AOvVaw0UsKnbn3ua6psKOZuXNBds)” Spokane (Wash.) Spokesman-Review, July 7, 1947, pp. 1, 6; “[Dishman Residents Saw ‘Flying Saucers’ Land,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/101830909/the-spokesman-review/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728112545&usg=AOvVaw0K3pxuWUHKfzQqFSOgd_vz)” Spokane (Wash.) Spokesman-Review, July 7, 1947, p. 6; Bloecher, [p. II-12](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728112820&usg=AOvVaw3Z-56LbJ1AqAd505aamf0y))

July 3 — 7:30 p.m. Project Mogul Flight number 9, a cluster of plastic balloons, is launched from Holloman AFB, New Mexico. (Kevin D. Randle, “The Project Mogul Flights and Roswell,” IUR 19, no. 6 (Nov./Dec. 1994): 6–7, 23)

July 4 — 3:00 a.m. Lenora Woodruff wakes up in her home at 184 S. Arlington Avenue, East Orange, New Jersey, when several airplanes fly overhead. She looks out and sees a “strange goldenish platter” moving swiftly across the sky. It disappears in a second. (“[South Plainfield Woman Reports Seeing ‘Flying Saucer’ Formation,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92602987/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728113260&usg=AOvVaw3sF4MUarHU0yusvpHY2Vtn)” Bridgewater (N.J.) Courier-News, July 5, 1947, p.1)

July 4 — After 4:00 a.m. Mrs. Martin Kole is awakened in her home in Alexandria, Virginia, by something shining through her bedroom window. She sees a large, roiund object hovering in the southwestern sky. She watches it for a few minutes, then goes back to bed. (Bloecher, [p. II-6](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728113622&usg=AOvVaw34BWyn_SL2Tq5yD21wckTo))

July 4 — The United Press service rounds up theories about the flying discs. It quotes Army Air Force “experts” saying that the sightings might be caused by weather conditions, or meteorites, or foreign aircraft that it is “our responsibility to know about it and take proper action.” Occultist Ole J. Sneide from San Francisco, California, thinks they are “oblate spheroid space ships from other planets” with hidden bases on the dark side of the moon. This is apparently the first public mention of an extraterrestrial origin for flying saucers in the media. (“[U.S. Stops](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92615877/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728114012&usg=AOvVaw0zakLEJ6RkLNwiQx4_hBVI) [‘Laughing Off’ Stories of Flying Disks,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92615877/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728114242&usg=AOvVaw1FUjcQK-t_akst0_Bi-3d5)” Hollywood (Calif.) Citizen-News, July 3, 1947, p. 1; “[Flying Disks Said](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/42476035/the-eagle/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728114520&usg=AOvVaw1H47iqrzUpyek7ZR1uGrv6) [‘Space Ships’ from Other Solar Systems,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/42476035/the-eagle/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728114729&usg=AOvVaw3DaGwhoWhAJY09_Vq_pssd)” Bryan (Tex.) Eagle, July 3, 1947, p. 8; “[Buck Rogers Special,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/16265447/the-press-democrat/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728115005&usg=AOvVaw0Hj2lDik6nadCdRgbHcgCu)” Santa Rosa (Calif.) Press Democrat, July 4, 1947, p. 2; Curt Collins, “[A 1947 Pioneer of the UFO Extraterrestrial](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2021/12/a-1947-pioneer-of-ufo-extraterrestrial.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728115312&usg=AOvVaw0ZrUul_W4JtLOaMLAfSxcJ) [Hypothesis,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2021/12/a-1947-pioneer-of-ufo-extraterrestrial.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728115558&usg=AOvVaw31dHVOde1CAzTB2bCGelne)” The Saucers That Time Forgot, December 16, 2021)

July 4 — 10:30 a.m. CAA official Irving C. Allen is flying a small aircraft near Moscow, Idaho, when he sees a white disc moving north for 5 minutes as it crosses his path several miles in front of him. (Bloecher, p. [III-10](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionIII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728115863&usg=AOvVaw0yXEmtVbGMnHAFsZI5cavS))

July 4 — 11:00 a.m. C. J. Bogne and other witnesses in a car near Redmond, Oregon, see four discs flying past Mt.

Jefferson on a straight course at high speed. (Ruppelt, [p. 20](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/20/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728116194&usg=AOvVaw0ZTLTisKj_LqmHEO5BVDv_); Bloecher, [p. II-9](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728116417&usg=AOvVaw2wpyZaFE4l9Ixswfu_7on7); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728116625&usg=AOvVaw3FOnEQNi5yBPqf80H3Noc0)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728116792&usg=AOvVaw339yYyhsQ4ZnAZ9WsxIWPS) p. 19)

July 4 — 11:00 a.m. Harry Hale, production manager of the Portland Oregonian, sees one shiny disc moving swiftly just west of Beaverton, Oregon. (“Air Liner Crew Confirms Flying Disks over State; Many Seen during Day over City,” Portland Oregonian, July 5, 1947; Project 1947, “[UFO Reports, 1947](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/fig/1947c.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728117178&usg=AOvVaw3Cx_KbkFcyMdY4nM9-4aNw)”)

July 4 — 1:05–5:30 p.m. Many people in Portland, Oregon—including KOIN newsman Frank Cooley, deputy Clark County Sheriff [Fred Krives](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/153181842/fred-c-krives&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728117455&usg=AOvVaw3w1w2dlo1GM6dgY5Meq5BU)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/153181842/fred-c-krives&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728117649&usg=AOvVaw38RJQ9RlVWuyZTCXblbbYl) Portland police officer [Kenneth A. McDowell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/3913015/kenneth-a-mcdowell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728117893&usg=AOvVaw2qjvx7S5MhlzNw5XjT1MzU), and Oregon highway patrol Sgt. Claude Cross—view five large discs moving at high speed to the east, two flying south and three to the east, with an oscillating or wobbling motion, sudden 90° turns or zigzagging. Radio reports alert other officers (including [Walter Lissy](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/36301214/walter-arnold-lissy&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728118166&usg=AOvVaw2qFU4r-If0ojaySBji5XOT)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/36301214/walter-arnold-lissy&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728118357&usg=AOvVaw21k2Hu9FZ47KkK-1FO0KCW) [Robert Ellis](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/621613/robert-clark-ellis&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728118585&usg=AOvVaw3r87be2mCLtpRRKuVJR0Pf)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/621613/robert-clark-ellis&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728118767&usg=AOvVaw1DqCxdli5sMuEdMpxENSnh) and [Earl Patterson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/3922233/earl-f-patterson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728118978&usg=AOvVaw2HDZdnyjEh8Ot7u6wYRyJA)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/3922233/earl-f-patterson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728119164&usg=AOvVaw2Y08uOge4PLZt0tCg7nl2b) all WWII veterans) who see the metallic objects that look like a disc or hubcap or pie-pan or half-moon flashing in the sun. McDonald, “[Statement on Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23cities&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728120885&usg=AOvVaw3IvgcUnQFTpGQk2atdM5Kh)” in Symposium on Unidentified Flying Objects, Hearings, US House Committee on Science and Astronautics, 90th Cong., 2nd Sess., July 29, 1968, p. 58; Michael David Hall and Wendy Ann Connors, “Alfred Loedding: New Insight on the Man behind Project Sign,” IUR 23, no. 4 (Winter 1998): 5)

July 4 — 2:50 p.m. Seven people at Twin Falls Park, seven miles east of Twin Falls, Idaho, watch a group of discs in a rough V-formation flying at great speed. A second flight of 9–10 objects circle overhead in a loose formation. They gain altitude rapidly and move to the west. (“[Flying Saucer Mystery Grows,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/101831558/tucson-daily-citizen/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728121337&usg=AOvVaw3UcjxZEmQnQles0wXwFV9e)” Tucson (Ariz.) Daily Citizen, July 5, 1947, p. 4; Bloecher, [p. II-5](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728121632&usg=AOvVaw3pJCltH8jtf6qYqjMRovP4))

July 4 — 5:00 p.m. Nova Hart and his wife Marveline are picnicing off Old Saint Charles Road west of Pattonville, Missouri. They see a saucer-shaped object, ribbed like a “parachute canopy,” gliding slowly (50–60 mph) and silently from south to north about 300 feet off the ground. It seems to have a propellor attached to a red conical structure on its underside and is about 20–25 feet in diameter. (Bloecher, [p. II-14](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728121942&usg=AOvVaw1ct3qpdFa3r69V_Ve3ZaOb))

July 4 — After 5:00 p.m. Private pilot Dan Whelan and passenger Duncan Underhill are flying at 5,000 feet west of Long Beach, California, when they see a disc about 2,000 feet above them, traveling at 400–500 mph. They estimate it

* * *

is 40–50 feet in diameter and flying north-northwest. (“[‘Air Disc’ Mystery Grows,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/101836806/los-angeles-evening-citizen-news/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728122373&usg=AOvVaw2R2xQ55WQCEo_Wtw05dt0K) [Baffles U.S.,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/101836843/los-angeles-evening-citizen-news/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728122617&usg=AOvVaw3dM9oTJcUJ3r2N5awPXwCL)” Hollywood (Calif.) Citizen-News, July 5, 1947, pp. 1, 3; Bloecher, [p. III-10](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionIII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728122893&usg=AOvVaw1T60jkWYVT8Vh07-9Qo8SG))

July 4 — 5:45 p.m. Coast Guard Yeoman [Frank Ryman](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://luforu.org/frank-ryman/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728123146&usg=AOvVaw0aqx-JDnOKWUB-LdBncv-y) photographs a round disc over his home at 12321 22nd Street NE, Lake City, Seattle, Washington. The object is in sight for 4–5 minutes and is seen by at least 20 others, traveling 500 mph. The photo shows a small, blurred white oval against a background of sky, but when enlarged the object is quite distinct. The Air Force explains it as a weather balloon. (“[Observers Report Discs](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92620403/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728123402&usg=AOvVaw10jU8KqxMrMHAiRUcJK3gr) [over Entire Western](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92620514/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728123607&usg=AOvVaw2wX36gsXOcqx-q8dQLvxNH) [Area,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92620514/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728123802&usg=AOvVaw2uKtXJNcHIgYgVCy5_vfu1)” Salt Lake City Deseret News, July 5, 1947, p. 1; Bloecher, [pp. IV-3–4](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionIV.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728124073&usg=AOvVaw0wUu8ad01-bNvReC_wCHJT); London UFO Research Unit, “[Seattle, Washington, America, North America](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://luforu.org/seattle-washington-america-north-america/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728124298&usg=AOvVaw2e-YGi8QKopiKIzH9BKu5K)”; Michael D. Swords, “[Can You Learn Anything from UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://thebiggeststudy.blogspot.com/2012/07/can-you-learn-anything-from-ufo-photos.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728124538&usg=AOvVaw3ngATYyx4aOdZn_JMwxk4R) [Photos, Part Two,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://thebiggeststudy.blogspot.com/2012/07/can-you-learn-anything-from-ufo-photos.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728124773&usg=AOvVaw2K3DZ1ukpjOsp5bEH3LjY6)” The Big Study, July 5, 2012; Kenneth Lloyd Larson, “A Summer 1947 Sighting,” IUR 20, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1995): 19–20)

July 4 — 6:30 p.m. United Press correspondent John C. Corlett, along with artist V. H. Selby and their wives, see a white disc speeding over Boise, Idaho, at an altitude of about 10,000 feet. It takes about 3 seconds to disappear. (“View of ‘Flying Saucers’ over Ontario Dumbfounds Veteran Pilot, Other Crew Member of Airliner,” Portland Oregonian, July 5, 1947; Project 1947, “[UFO Reports, 1947](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1947d.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728125198&usg=AOvVaw0jwRlPJnYEur7b3-WCww8J)”)

July 4 — 7:00 p.m. George Aster and others at Hauser Lake, Idaho, watch a flying disc for 30 minutes as it hovers with a lateral oscillation about 30° above the horizon at an estimated 20,000 feet. It shoots straight up and vanishes when a small aircraft approaches it. (“[Disks Seen Here Today, Is Report,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/101831840/spokane-chronicle/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728125505&usg=AOvVaw34K4GLpxs_Fl-0me4chZEW)” Spokane (Wash,) Spokesman- Review, July 7, 1947, p. 1; Bloecher, [pp. II-6–7](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728125805&usg=AOvVaw11-0fATBRK3PmTJwttcX4a))

July 4 — Sunset. [Henry Seay](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/38951275/henry-e-seay&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728126091&usg=AOvVaw1OFW1xkNGALmyvoHAKe2rF)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/38951275/henry-e-seay&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728126272&usg=AOvVaw1hmkM9Y8qbhd1Ywkf_Q90D) a farmer living 2 miles north of Fayetteville, Arkansas, watches three yellow discs flying overhead to the southwest, dropping sparks, and frightening his cattle and horses. After several seconds, the object rises up vertically 30–40 feet and shoots off horizontally at 50 mph. (Bloecher, [p. IV-1](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionIV.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728126532&usg=AOvVaw0Vfdb6riyCrP06g2wpe8zA))

July 4 — Sunset. M. K. Leisy, a junior intern at the Institute of the Pennsylvania Hospital at 44th and Market streets

in Philadelphia, is reading on the porch of the hospital when he hears a loud roar. A large transport plane passes overhead, but he also sees a dark sphere with a luminous halo around it moving below the clouds at a moderate speed. It disappears into the clouds. (“[Flying Discs](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/12116307/the-philadelphia-inquirer/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728126939&usg=AOvVaw3-6CZxrOVU_6r_cjyCK3PV) [Seen over City,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/12116307/the-philadelphia-inquirer/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728127165&usg=AOvVaw37eh8BiprGUlwppyZdOLIj)” Philadelphia Inquirer, July 5, 1947, pp. 1, 3; Bloecher, [pp. II-14–15](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728127437&usg=AOvVaw2CvxoWtG6w94CH48albu1R))

July 4 — 9:12 p.m. United Air Lines Flight 105 pilots Capt. Emil J. Smith and First Officer Ralph Stevens are flying from Boise, Idaho, to Seattle, Washington, when they see a formation of five discs over Emmett, Idaho, silhouetted against the sunset. Stewardess Marty Morrow sees them as well. The objects appear to merge and speed away to the northwest. Another group appears and arranges itself in a straight line. The nine objects are seen at least 12 minutes over a distance of 45 miles. (“View of ‘Flying Saucers’ over Ontario Dumbfounds Veteran Pilot, Other Crew Member of Airliner,” Portland Oregonian, July 5, 1947; Project 1947, “[UFO Reports, 1947](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1947d.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728127818&usg=AOvVaw1pFSP-iCelS93NwChIq3zv)”; NICAP, “[5](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470704emmett_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728128022&usg=AOvVaw03lffGGyF0y2PydTA1QBfs) [Discs Sighted by United Flight](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470704emmett_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728128253&usg=AOvVaw1nM82UeCwEk76w8IZTc5z4)”; Bloecher, [pp. III-10–11](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionIII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728128480&usg=AOvVaw1eTm-RD5aJ6CYjQe4aDigT); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728128684&usg=AOvVaw0vfuALg4e5mQVaT8FnCavC), p. 20; Kenneth Arnold and Ray Palmer, The Coming of the Saucers, 1952, Palmer, pp. 18–19; James E. McDonald, “[Statement on Unidentified Flying](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23pilots&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728128967&usg=AOvVaw2jzNPvZbPesOwkoxGozNlQ) [Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23pilots&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728129218&usg=AOvVaw0pDS7wyFxNHuosnYTFXS4e)” in Symposium on Unidentified Flying Objects, Hearings, US House Committee on Science and Astronautics, 90th Cong., 2nd Sess., July 29, 1968, pp. 41–42)

July 4 — The first of the special flights from Washington, D.C., arrives at Roswell Army Air Field \[now closed\], New Mexico (presumably to investigate the radar reports claimed by [Frank Kaufmann](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/13371870/frank-j-kaufmann&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728129597&usg=AOvVaw3pYfghXWyvjZ6iSCoEoyO8)). On the plane is Warrant Officer Robert Thomas. Thomas and his companions are in uniform upon arrival, but quickly change to civilian clothes. Thomas wants an on-site briefing as soon as it can be arranged. These men remain at RAAF throughout the later retrieval. (Kevin D. Randle and Donald R. Schmitt, The Truth about the UFO Crash at Roswell, Evans, 1994, [pp. 160–161](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/truthaboutufocra0000rand/page/160/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728129899&usg=AOvVaw2SMbpQfArLlAydvOppwxiU))

July 4 — During a thunderstorm near Corona, New Mexico, [W. W. “Mack” Brazel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/9454979/william-ware-brazel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728130188&usg=AOvVaw04fIa5Ei1WP1fsHDCFAENP) hears a tremendous thunderclap that sounds like an explosion but is somehow different from the rest of the thunder. Others in the area report the same phenomenon. (Kevin D. Randle and Donald R. Schmitt, The Truth about the UFO Crash at Roswell, Evans, 1994, [p. 160](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/truthaboutufocra0000rand/page/160/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728130502&usg=AOvVaw07PraHEi5LpC8vs_MlpCDh))

July 4 — 11:27 p.m. Army Signal Corps radar sites in southern New Mexico supposedly continue to track a mysterious object. Kirtland AFB’s commander scrambles a fighter jet piloted by Kenny Chandler to locate the object, but he cannot find it. Before midnight, [Frank Kaufmann](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/13371870/frank-j-kaufmann&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728130800&usg=AOvVaw2a6ADCXedrQNXLfgnbYEkf) allegedly sees a brilliant glow on the radar display, pulsates a number of times, then explode in a starburst. The belief is that the object has now crashed. [Jim Ragsdale](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/61745306/james-raymond-ragsdale&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728131059&usg=AOvVaw2lxbVRw3bGpqE-RAl_0U_f) and “Trudy Truelove” supposedly see a bright flash of light and hear a roaring sound that passes overhead. Ragsdale knows that something has struck the ground close to their campsite. (Kevin D. Randle and Donald R. Schmitt, The Truth about the UFO Crash at Roswell, Evans, 1994, [p. 160](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/truthaboutufocra0000rand/page/160/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728131388&usg=AOvVaw2vtJDRfsJOlhb0LjaDS8RQ); Jacobsen, Area 51, [p. 36](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/36/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728131638&usg=AOvVaw1AeVcbIkEFzB8WCrvRD4_3); Kevin D. Randle and Donald R. Schmitt, “When and Where Did the Roswell Object Crash?” IUR 19, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1994): 14; Kevin

D. Randle, “The Truth about the Jim Ragsdale Story,” IUR 21, no. 3 (Fall 1996): 13–16, 29–30; Jim Wilson, “[Roswell Plus 50,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://greyfalcon.us/ROSWELL%2520PLUS%252050.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728132088&usg=AOvVaw14OfiOxUbyHsiKKVhnNANA)” Popular Mechanics 174 (July 1997): 48–53; The Roswell Files, “[Jim Ragsdale](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.roswellfiles.com/Witnesses/ragsdale.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728132357&usg=AOvVaw3Kek2rGMibnq-0H7ZixG0a),” April 11, 1998; Kevin D. Randle, “Frank Kaufmann, Roswell Witness,” IUR 27, no. 3 (Fall 2002): 8, 17–19; Mark Rodeghier, “Frank Kaufmann Exposed,” IUR 27, no. 3 (Fall 2002): 9–11, 26; Kevin D. Randle, “[Jim Ragsdale’s](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2015/04/jim-ragsdales-roswell-tale.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728132792&usg=AOvVaw0_7zfooJjVcIy1a7MOwny3) [Roswell Tale,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2015/04/jim-ragsdales-roswell-tale.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728133024&usg=AOvVaw1YqNIpSe0Jp0dPm3bNhcqT)” A Different Perspective, April 22, 2015)

July 5 — 3:00 a.m. Acting on what he claims are orders from Brig. Gen. [Martin F. Scanlon](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Martin_F._Scanlon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728133301&usg=AOvVaw2MzXHW-C-s0yluDb3w1dvE) of the Army's Air Defense Command, discredited Roswell witness [Frank Kaufmann](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/13371870/frank-j-kaufmann&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728133566&usg=AOvVaw3tKKjoVW8KR4MxdVGx4FTk) returns to Roswell Army Air Field from Alamogordo to alert Colonel [William H. Blanchard](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_H._Blanchard&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728133805&usg=AOvVaw25yBlBwTQcXbTu7eMAHAPt), Roswell AAF commanding officer, about a potential crash. (Jim Wilson, “[Roswell Plus 50,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://greyfalcon.us/ROSWELL%2520PLUS%252050.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728134009&usg=AOvVaw3R0GdZlRpUXYo5mKmT4E3a)” Popular Mechanics 174 (July 1997): 48–53)

July 5 — 5:00 a.m. Archaeologists, including [William Curry Holden](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Curry_Holden&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728134339&usg=AOvVaw0X42cK9nzPQIjcPIaA4fAi), working the sites around Roswell, New Mexico, stumble across an impact site where an object has crashed. One of them heads to the closest phone to tell Sheriff [George A. Wilcox](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.rdrnews.com/2018/11/12/a-sheriff-without-a-gun-memoirs-of-a-sheriffs-wife/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728134589&usg=AOvVaw3TPBdwD9ilufHq3KgmLVkm) of the discovery of the remains of a crashed aircraft of some kind. Wilcox calls the local fire department to alert them about the crash. One truck, with [Dan Dwyer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/rw/w/dandwyer.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728134838&usg=AOvVaw1cFbNk0DyWz1a-APyxP8mq) on it, responds to the call. The site is about 35–40 miles north of Roswell. The Roswell Fire Department, escorted by members of the Roswell Police Department, makes a run along Pine Lodge Road northwest of Roswell. They are among the first civilians to stumble across the impact site. (Kevin D. Randle and Donald R. Schmitt, The Truth about the UFO Crash at Roswell, Evans, 1994, [pp. 33–36](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/truthaboutufocra0000rand/page/32/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728135166&usg=AOvVaw2SeF4ifwjRL13UtisNlN7w); Thomas J. Carey, “The Search for the Roswell Archaeologists: Casting the Net,” IUR 18, no. 6 (Nov./Dec. 1993): 3–8, 23–24; Thomas J. Carey, “The Continuing Search for the Roswell Archaeologists: Closing the Circle,” IUR 19, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1994): 4–12; Kevin D. Randle and Anthony Bragalia, “Two Roswell Witnesses, Reconsidered,” IUR 32, no. 3 (July 2009): 6–8, 24)

July 5 — 5:01 a.m. Project Mogul Flight number 10, a cluster of plastic balloons, is launched from Holloman AFB, New Mexico. (Kevin D. Randle, “The Project Mogul Flights and Roswell,” IUR 19, no. 6 (Nov./Dec. 1994): 6–7, 23)

July 5 — 5:30 a.m. According to discredited Roswell witness [Frank Kaufmann](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/13371870/frank-j-kaufmann&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728135765&usg=AOvVaw1CQ9d5t2VoR-gA3aELWxMH), a small contingent of men from Roswell Army Air Field in New Mexico drive north on what is now US Highway 285. Near mile marker 132, they turn off the road and began driving across the desert, stopping from time to time to cut the barbed-wire fencing. They discover a heel-shaped craft measuring about 25 feet long and 12 feet wide embedded in a cliff. The soldiers find civilians on the site already. Besides the archaeologists, a local man named Larry Campbell (later called Jack Armstrong or Cactus Jack) also claims to have been there. They escort them off while others secure the area. Five bodies are allegedly found on the site. The impact site is cleaned and secured by 11:30 a.m. [Annie Jacobsen](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Annie_Jacobsen&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728136020&usg=AOvVaw3MNqaG-2OxCJWrE_7ifnwL) has interviewed [Alfred O’Donnell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://obituaries.reviewjournal.com/obituary/alfred-o-donnell-1082038666&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728136283&usg=AOvVaw0O-J3g_UpKsAM0NI1l8H4F), later an engineer at EG&G, who tells her that one of the objects crashed and was recovered by the Joint Chiefs, including the airframe, propulsion equipment, and the power plant. It has no wings or tail. The fuselage is round and there is a dome on top. Inside there are Cyrillic letters stamped or embossed in a ring running around the inside. Army intelligence officers suspect that the craft is the brainchild of German airplane engineers, [Walter and Reimar Horten](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Horten_brothers&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728136529&usg=AOvVaw20S7IdeuC8LQWBUWXJPrxE), working for the Russian military. A frantic search to find what happened to the brothers allegedly takes place; informants like Austrian physicist [Adolf Smekal](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adolf_Smekal&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728136751&usg=AOvVaw0ng63N6Qs3HJ9-ZKbjRWcT) of Frankfurt, Germany, provide leads, with confusing results for several months. (Kevin D. Randle and Donald R. Schmitt, The Truth about the UFO Crash at Roswell, Evans, 1994, [p. 161](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/truthaboutufocra0000rand/page/160/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728137066&usg=AOvVaw1wkw93vjn2RpL5rrzzQYuV); Thomas J. Carey, “The Strange Saga of ‘Cactus Jack,’” IUR 22, no. 1 (Spring 1997): 3–11; Jim Wilson, “[Roswell Plus 50,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://greyfalcon.us/ROSWELL%2520PLUS%252050.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728137331&usg=AOvVaw3UhIzLEghFtN7-A16PNMz6)” Popular Mechanics 174 (July 1997):

48–53; Jacobsen, Area 51, [pp. 36–40](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/36/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728137699&usg=AOvVaw1hudnOW456VSSiZL4c1GXg))

July 5 — 10:00 a.m. W/O Robert Thomas and his crew proceed to the impact site. The bodies, originally covered by sheets, are now in lead-lined body bags. Only those with the highest clearance are allowed close to the center of the impact. Guards are posted, facing out, to keep the curious away. According to researcher Kathy Kasten, the dead bodies are taken to Roswell Army Air Field, but one is still alive and taken to Fort Stanton \[now closed\] in Lincoln, New Mexico, whose Marine Hospital was used to confine troublesome German and Japanese detainees during World War II. Allegedly, aerospace physician [William Randolph Lovelace II](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Randolph_Lovelace_II&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728138045&usg=AOvVaw0dE1XQZTg5F3LvQcIiO4Nt) travels there from Albuquerque to examine the survivor, who reportedly dies one week later and is buried in the Fort Stanton cemetery. (Kevin D. Randle and Donald R. Schmitt, The Truth about the UFO Crash at Roswell, Evans, 1994, [p.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/truthaboutufocra0000rand/page/160/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728138359&usg=AOvVaw2MGLTu-wYgy62i3C93vvSD) [161](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/truthaboutufocra0000rand/page/160/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728138579&usg=AOvVaw0JhaTrF9aOTrfu2Y9jPXwY); Nick Redfern, The Roswell UFO Conspiracy, Lisa Hagan, 2017, pp. 204–221)

July 5 — Following the rain the night before, [Brazel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/9454979/william-ware-brazel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728138913&usg=AOvVaw1kBYIgd2I_WLhiFH2DYqdm) inspects the pastures surrounding the J. B. Foster ranch house southeast of Corona, New Mexico. Riding with him is the young son of the Proctors, [William D. Proctor](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/80134486/william-d-proctor&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728139169&usg=AOvVaw20Ig9hZqBIdG669toiXQvm). During the inspection, Brazel discovers a large debris field. Scattered on the slopes and into the sinkhole and depressions are plastic-like beams, pieces of lightweight balsawood-like material only stronger, light metallic foil (which doesn’t stay bent or folded, resumes its original shape, and won’t tear), and heavy-gauge monofilament. The debris is thick enough that the sheep refuse to cross the field and are driven around it to water more than a mile away. Brazel, taking a few scraps of the material, heads to the home of his closest neighbors, [Floyd](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/99049640/floyd-proctor&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728139420&usg=AOvVaw1QiWKZBXjuBjw0eOqokCTo) and [Loretta](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/144211794/susan-loretta-proctor_hodges&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728139692&usg=AOvVaw3OmzVi081j0hRnUq6HAg10) [Proctor](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/144211794/susan-loretta-proctor_hodges&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728139910&usg=AOvVaw0I8ZdqLdeMPQ_kcQjrbr_D)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/144211794/susan-loretta-proctor_hodges&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728140104&usg=AOvVaw30KqoenIjBfjzVhXVWcFJk) He shows them “a little sliver” of material that he can neither burn nor cut. Some of the beams have
