Swords, GrassRoots UFOs: Case Reports from the Timmerman Files, Fund for UFO Research, 2005, pp. 125–127)

July 5 — 2:30 p.m. Automobile dealer [Kjell Qvale](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kjell_Qvale&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728142109&usg=AOvVaw2LZERUXQ6BnYK1j5lk03uJ) and dozens of others see a triangular formation of silvery discs flying south near Auburn, California. They appear directly overhead and are in view for 3–4 minutes, disappearing one at a time, but not over the hdorizon. (“[Skeptical Experts Call](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/101844130/the-san-francisco-examiner/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728142380&usg=AOvVaw3RmJIuVvNzOvIgeWzu2rCj) [Disc Reports ‘Mass Illusion,’](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/101844237/the-san-francisco-examiner/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728142616&usg=AOvVaw0lxGzmKCoFaGiiwcS8lOKC)” San Francisco Examiner, July 8, 1947, p. 1; Bloecher, [p. II-5](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728142896&usg=AOvVaw2a7KUCFw9_QR3pBTs7iEb7))

July 5 — Later that evening, [Brazel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/9454979/william-ware-brazel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728143175&usg=AOvVaw1-GrIpq7mc-B5kMhBBLo_u) removes the large, circular piece of the debris from the range. Brazel either loads it into the back of his truck or drags it along behind. He stores it in a livestock shed about three miles north of the crash site. (Kevin D. Randle and Donald R. Schmitt, The Truth about the UFO Crash at Roswell, Evans, 1994, [p.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/truthaboutufocra0000rand/page/162/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728143493&usg=AOvVaw0lF4SupIetpvGEIWGUTvpH) [163](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/truthaboutufocra0000rand/page/162/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728143713&usg=AOvVaw1x4_8gXfO9DeAivk5VxIx7))

July 6 — [Brazel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/9454979/william-ware-brazel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728143982&usg=AOvVaw3ipW63qkbcwW1-hVFUrXSO) gets up early, completes his chores, and then drives into Roswell, New Mexico, about 75 miles away. He stops at the office of Sheriff [George A. Wilcox](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.rdrnews.com/2018/11/12/a-sheriff-without-a-gun-memoirs-of-a-sheriffs-wife/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728144258&usg=AOvVaw2UhRX2nBP1tl0MEk7J8r1s)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.rdrnews.com/2018/11/12/a-sheriff-without-a-gun-memoirs-of-a-sheriffs-wife/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728144466&usg=AOvVaw2mrwaJtDHCUdJaE2jOCnSw) Contrary to published reports, Wilcox is excited about the find and suggests the military at the Roswell Army Air Field \[now closed\] be notified. While waiting for the military officers to arrive, Wilcox dispatches two of his deputies to the ranch. They have only the directions given by Brazel, but both men are familiar with the territory; and Wilcox believes they will be able to find the debris field. KGFL reporter Frank Joyce calls Wilcox, who tells him Brazel is in his office with an interesting story. Brazel allegedly gets on the phone with Joyce and mentions debris and a stench from dead bodies. (Kevin D. Randle and Donald R. Schmitt, The Truth about the UFO Crash at Roswell, Evans, 1994, [pp. 163–164](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/truthaboutufocra0000rand/page/162/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728144924&usg=AOvVaw3GAID7jEeTpW88YGO0rDT_))

July 6 —1:45 p.m. Maj. A. B. Browning and the crew of a B-25 flying over Clay Center, Kansas, see a silvery disc about 30–50 feet in diameter slightly lower than their plane. It paces them for a while then shoots off. (NICAP, “[30–50ʹ](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470706claycntr_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728145354&usg=AOvVaw1wQygj8P_1gqbQYHHUUfVp) [Circular Object Paces B-25, Accelerates](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470706claycntr_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728145607&usg=AOvVaw24kAlCu-xhQQFeyzOhZt8s)”; Bloecher, [p. III-11](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionIII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728145884&usg=AOvVaw3VJbTR-l6USiP_BnEY4MVT); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728146186&usg=AOvVaw16kyY825vK3XT8qIKAE1Lq), p. 21)

July 6 — Day. Army Air Corps Capt. [James H. Burniston](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/98562028/james-herbert-burniston&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728146591&usg=AOvVaw0ttN1AyCP7qjgictCC2R5f) and his wife watch a round, flat object that oscillates on its lateral axis of travel three quarters of the way across the sky in a few seconds at Fairfield-Suisun Army Air Field \[now Travis AFB\] near Fairfield, California. (NICAP, “[Round Flat Object Size of C-54](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470706fairfieldsuisan_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728146870&usg=AOvVaw1lVyHIIpsbhAv9rNIpp_Ix)”; Bloecher, [p. III-3](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionIII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728147128&usg=AOvVaw3AaIXnJ2J8IqkoDLGXdAih); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728147356&usg=AOvVaw1swc6hyanr-aR7iIjGNMf6)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728147548&usg=AOvVaw2Yy_0n7smfXO0LsoD81UuR) p. 21)

July 6 — 2:45 p.m. [David A. Kenney](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.dailybreeze.com/2019/04/17/decades-after-hush-hush-wwii-role-rancho-palos-verdes-very-own-secret-james-bond-is-honored-with-prestigious-military-medal/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728148013&usg=AOvVaw2Vif2RuAMan3kM_1buOOl6), an aircraft instruments engineer, and two others watch an oval-shaped UFO flying at a high altitude for nearly 2 minutes near Encampment, Wyoming. (Bloecher, [p. III-17](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionIII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728148341&usg=AOvVaw3YL6AfMBmIA3AdlUhM-i5L); David Kenney, “Right Place, Right Time,” IUR 30, no. 4 (August 2006): 28)

July 6 — Afternoon. Francis Howell and his wife are in their yard at 317 Ash Street in Tempe, Arizona, when they see an object floating down to the ground with a kite-like motion. It appears to be about 2 feet across and made of aluminum. It disappears behind some trees. The Howells and some neighbors walk toward the place where it apparently has landed, and they see the disc ascend at a 45° angle and move at high speed toward the northwest. (“[Tempeans See ‘Disc,’](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/101844590/arizona-republic/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728148780&usg=AOvVaw2UiEB1melCowaBYazTVFAZ)” Phoenix Arizona Republic, July 7, 1947, p. 1; Bloecher, [p. II-13](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728149107&usg=AOvVaw0G4jDYPV8G95qd5lug7HEW))

July 6 — Colonel [William H. Blanchard](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_H._Blanchard&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728149385&usg=AOvVaw3ojyX0vJIIiK7SuVwrzjTe), Roswell AAF commanding officer, entrusted with oversight of the first and only atomic-bomb strike force in the world, the 509th Bomb Group, orders [Jesse A. Marcel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/rw/w/jessemarcel.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728149641&usg=AOvVaw204LJsV0jXifMCn6npdfxm), the air intelligence officer, to investigate the debris report. Marcel immediately drives to the sheriff’s office. Marcel interviews [Brazel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/9454979/william-ware-brazel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728149895&usg=AOvVaw1iULX1wbNof3qjT1PmYIrn)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/9454979/william-ware-brazel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728150131&usg=AOvVaw3fp8hvfUY2OeVsL5lw8_lQ) examines the pieces of the material that Brazel brought in, and decides he had better visit the ranch to examine the field for himself. Marcel, taking some of the debris with him, returns to the base and reports to Blanchard on what he has seen. Blanchard, convinced that he is in possession of something highly unusual, perhaps Soviet, alerts the next higher headquarters. Marcel and Blanchard all know this is from not any type of balloon. Marcel returns to the sheriff’s office with the senior counterintelligence agent assigned to the base, CIC Captain [Sheridan W.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/177397132/sheridan-wear-cavitt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728150419&usg=AOvVaw0zjARNznd6Q6mf5xRq2vBf) [Cavitt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/177397132/sheridan-wear-cavitt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728150650&usg=AOvVaw0IVdPnvPIR8DANlRWrQqAS)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/177397132/sheridan-wear-cavitt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728150843&usg=AOvVaw3khggIryFkXwCmuf5kntdd) They escort Brazel back to his ranch and examine the debris field. Acting on orders from Major General [Clements McMullen](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clements_McMullen&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728151068&usg=AOvVaw07_3-WwqNOV6HPvaA09uxn)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clements_McMullen&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728151241&usg=AOvVaw3grjALmU4cSwFDYf1pTMhh) deputy commander of the Strategic Air Command, Blanchard obtains more of the debris from the sheriff’s office. It is sealed in a courier pouch and loaded on an airplane to be flown on to the Fort Worth Army Air Field, where it is given to Colonel [Thomas J. DuBose](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/rw/w/thomasdubose.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728151482&usg=AOvVaw0heNEZDub-MxBZw_GQeE67) for transport on to Washington, D.C. After Marcel and Cavitt leave with Brazel, the two deputies return to say they did not find the debris field but observed a burned area in one of the pastures. There the sand has been turned to glass and blackened. It looks as if something circular has touched down. (Kevin D. Randle and Donald R. Schmitt, The Truth about the UFO Crash at Roswell, Evans, 1994, [pp. 37–40](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/truthaboutufocra0000rand/page/36/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728151816&usg=AOvVaw3YEQd2YMd7O1CnC500dZvC)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/truthaboutufocra0000rand/page/36/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728152001&usg=AOvVaw1labCBFH3Z8iAf6JmUPkB5) [164](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/truthaboutufocra0000rand/page/164/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728152214&usg=AOvVaw0OmVKboLh6N9aRozXSw8N9); Good Need, [p. 89](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/88/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728152423&usg=AOvVaw2QCfSWJGzIiel-WMLLvvrA); Nukes 482–483)

July 6 — 8:45 p.m. Army Staff Sgt. [Ira L. Livingston](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/109070324/ira-l-livingston&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728152740&usg=AOvVaw0dFaIhcjjuzBdvMwF_3kdC) watches a procession of glowing round objects moving at 500 mph over Birmingham, Alabama. A new one appears every 5 seconds. Many others report UFOs in the area between

* * *

8:00 and 9:00 p.m. Robert Crossland, a copy reader for the Birmingham Age-Herald, takes a photo that shows two round white spots close together. (Bloecher, [pp. III-3](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionIII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728153376&usg=AOvVaw18tl-Lp7DAoPal4eWKigCh)–4, [IV-4](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionIV.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728153783&usg=AOvVaw37xpj6BUfY32O3Bvb0pZ6u); Michael David Hall and Wendy Ann Connors, Alfred Loedding and the Great Flying Saucer Wave of 1947, Rose Press, 1998, [pp. 67–68](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/loedding/LoeddingBook.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728154232&usg=AOvVaw3JiyUh2zV_67o-A6QMjGVg))

July 6 — 9:00 p.m. Because of the distance to the ranch over roads that are less than adequate, [Brazel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/9454979/william-ware-brazel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728154727&usg=AOvVaw0R0TAZ5XBiV8UvbzdgYJdl), [Marcel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/rw/w/jessemarcel.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728155099&usg=AOvVaw2-cjMTfcvvg97SITrOCpXs), and [Cavitt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/177397132/sheridan-wear-cavitt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728155470&usg=AOvVaw100CZ6SRC-gWX_0rpYXFfR) do not arrive until after dark. They stay at the “Hines” house (an old ranch house close to the debris field), eat cold beans, and wait for daylight. Marcel runs a Geiger counter over the large piece of wreckage Brazel has stored in the cattle shed. He detects no sign of radiation. (Kevin D. Randle and Donald R. Schmitt, The Truth about the UFO Crash at Roswell, Evans, 1994, [p. 165](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/truthaboutufocra0000rand/page/164/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728156059&usg=AOvVaw1gobN36TnRyDAXMMe_Ff_h))

July 7 — 2:00 a.m. A special flight (the first) leaves Roswell AAF for Andrews AAF in Washington, D.C. Some of the debris and the bodies are on that flight. (Kevin D. Randle and Donald R. Schmitt, The Truth about the UFO Crash at Roswell, Evans, 1994, [p. 165](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/truthaboutufocra0000rand/page/164/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728156671&usg=AOvVaw39cDhJmVuKrNoS-vX-rQaU))

July 7 — [Brazel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/9454979/william-ware-brazel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728157130&usg=AOvVaw0EGw9Wb4SYH8R9bcgyr1as) takes [Marcel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/rw/w/jessemarcel.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728157550&usg=AOvVaw0c5B38N8aFQBY4npLOW5CW) and [Cavitt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/177397132/sheridan-wear-cavitt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728157965&usg=AOvVaw2oqlYWhmfHS6fav3yYQlBg) out to the debris field. It is three-quarters of a mile long and 200–300 feet wide. A gouge starting at the northern end of it extends for 400–500 feet toward the other end. It looks as if something has touched down and skipped along. The largest piece of debris is recovered at the southern edge of the gouge. The debris is as thin as newsprint, but incredibly strong. There is foil that, when crumpled, unfolds itself without a sign of a wrinkle, I-beams that flex slightly and have some symbols on them, and material resembling Bakelite.

Marcel and Cavitt walk the perimeter of the field and then range out looking for more details or another crash site but find nothing else. Finally, they return and spend the remainder of the day collecting debris. They load the rear of Marcel’s car and then the jeep carryall driven by Cavitt. About dusk they begin the trip back to Roswell. (Don Schmitt and Kevin D. Randle, “The Roswell Material,” IUR 16, no. 6 (Nov./Dec. 1991): 10–11; Kevin D. Randle and Donald R. July 7 — AMC commander Lieut. Gen [Nathan Twining](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nathan_Farragut_Twining&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728162273&usg=AOvVaw0j1MeoRIcIdVo0lpvVba2Y) unexpectedly flies to Alamogordo AAF and Kirtland AAF in New Mexico, remaining there until July 11. Army Air Forces Commander Gen. [Carl Spaatz](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Spaatz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728162517&usg=AOvVaw0CwCJllbXR5QdIwsm1n9dx) is supposedly “vacationing” in Washington State. July 7 — A hoax in Shreveport, Louisiana. A 16-inch aluminum disc with smoke coming out of it is found. Army investigators find “Made in USA” on the disc. It is one of many homemade gadgets, weather balloon radar targets, circular saws, and other disc-like debris that people find or make in order to have some fun in the press or with gullible saucer-seekers. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728163125&usg=AOvVaw27vl0vXWKEwijd5FruKu-1)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728163305&usg=AOvVaw1vjSmrdL91FofZw6LOAwyw) p. 21; “[Speaking of Pictures: A Rash of Flying Disks Breaks Out over the](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://books.google.com/books?id%3DYU4EAAAAMBAJ%26q%3DRash%252Bof%252BFlying%2523v%253Dsnippet%26q%3DRash%2520of%2520Flying%26f%3Dfalse&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728163549&usg=AOvVaw15shDOu3tgH2xTz48CX1jN) [U.S.,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://books.google.com/books?id%3DYU4EAAAAMBAJ%26q%3DRash%252Bof%252BFlying%2523v%253Dsnippet%26q%3DRash%2520of%2520Flying%26f%3Dfalse&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728163795&usg=AOvVaw20dbBaUmmiV1xZaVb4bYZA)” Life, July 21, 1947, p. 14; ClearIntent, [p. 149](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/clearintentgover00fawc/page/148/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728164181&usg=AOvVaw1fs-BAYaQY9bJ3WpI6Avro); Kevin D. July 7 — 11:30 a.m. Flight instructor Kenneth Jones out of Elkhart, Wisconsin, is practicing take-offs and landings with a student near Koshkonong. They watch a disc descending vertically on edge through the alto-cumulus clouds at 6,000 feet, stop at 4,000 feet, assume a horizontal orientation, and fly horizontally for 15 seconds, covering 23 miles at 5,500 mph. At one point it heads straight towards them on a course of about 120°, then stops again

(apparently overhead) and disappears. (Bloecher, [p. July 7 — Gen. [Hoyt Vandenberg](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hoyt_Vandenberg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728168939&usg=AOvVaw0zJMtBjjwFWUAE6bIqZ0oE)’s activity log: 1:10 p.m., answers a Toronto Star reporter’s question about possible secret military aircraft. [Curtis LeMay](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Curtis_LeMay&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728170167&usg=AOvVaw0OfTCninHeoVEu46FlVREM) discuss the discs. Col. Warren, at Ellington Field \[now Ellington Airport\] in Houston, Texas, calls concerning the Shreveport disc. 4:20 p.m., Col. Warren calls back and says the incident is a hoax. (David Rudiak, “[Lt. Gen. Hoyt](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://roswellproof.homestead.com/vandenberg.html%23anchor_24&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728170554&usg=AOvVaw351UMg4v8ZmUMS-6qywd3k) [S. Vandenberg and Roswell,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://roswellproof.homestead.com/vandenberg.html%23anchor_24&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728170866&usg=AOvVaw3kYiBsM3hhkhmnYiwpxWq4)” Roswell Proof, 2001)

July 7 — 2:30 p.m. Capt. [Robert J. Southey](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/145990631/robert-j-southey&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728171220&usg=AOvVaw2t6DvMu0qL8vciS0XMOThx) and [Clem Hackworthy](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/79255728/clement-r-hackworthy&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728171491&usg=AOvVaw3ynHBrhBlLiYHnneG4Eoj9) are flying a private aircraft near East Troy, Wisconsin, when they see a fast-moving silver object flying southeast from Eagle to Muskego, covering 17 miles in 20 seconds (approximately 3,060 mph). Schulgen](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.generals.dk/general/Schulgen/George_Francis/USA.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728172771&usg=AOvVaw1v4LqHcx4licRMCayX4KZV)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.generals.dk/general/Schulgen/George_Francis/USA.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728172960&usg=AOvVaw2kYlVVbUbWXc7B0Z4aH1jF) chief of the Requirements Intelligence branch of Army Air Force Intelligence. July 7 — [John Philip Bessor](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.joshuablubuhs.com/blog/john-philip-bessor-as-a-fortean&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728173874&usg=AOvVaw2RFA4xeuBDiCPd4qq4_CAd) of Zelienople, Pennsylvania, writes to the US Air Force to offer his own theory that UFOs are “a form of space animal, or creature, of a highly attenuated (ectoplasmic?) substance, capable of materialization and dematerialization, whose propellant is a form of telekinetic energy.” (“Report from the Readers,” Fate 4, no. 4 (May/June 1951): 88; John P. Bessor, “Are the Saucers Space Animals?” Fate 8, no. 12 (December 1955): 6–12; Curt Collins, “[The 1947 ET Hypothesis of John P. Bessor,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2019/02/the-1947-et-hypothesis-of-john-p-bessor.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728174316&usg=AOvVaw1Z9AOLVwc98QjPyQ7ZtktT)” The Saucers That Time Forgot, February 15, 2019)

July 7 — 5:20 p.m. Radar technician David W. Chase watches a disc-shaped object passing overhead at Medford, Oregon.

It appears to be flying at 600–700 mph on edge at right angles to the surface of the earth, though following its contours at 500–1,000 feet. The object gives off a bright light. (Bloecher, [p. July 7 — 7:45 p.m. Five students on a practice baseball field at Ohio State University in Columbus, Ohio, see three metallic oval objects flying swiftly and silently in a triangular formation overhead. They seem to be about 10 feet in diameter and are flying east over the Olentangy River. They are out of sight within 10 seconds. (Bloecher, [p. II-](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728175075&usg=AOvVaw2G-WDC1MaGJPRwxKRyET7H) [6](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728175299&usg=AOvVaw26SHHvDXWkrZgzEFjB2xVx))

July 7 — 9:00 p.m. [Orrin Williams](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/130342662/orrin-williams&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728175604&usg=AOvVaw2n12hqz38yhaZi4ZmV1OVS) and his wife [Albertine](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/130342714/albertine-williams&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728175851&usg=AOvVaw0EX3Rtl0kUQLf46zrFxlG8)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/130342714/albertine-williams&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728176090&usg=AOvVaw220Bl5onnbT0L2TIFPuai7) along with Mr, and Mrs. Cecil Grant, are fishing on Great Pond near Rome, Maine, when they see a “spinning rocket” come out of the southern sky and stop abruptly overhead, where it hovers as a ball of fire. A similar object comes from the east, passing close by the first one. A third object approaches from the east and stops by the first object before moving on. The first object then retraces its path to the south at high speed. The display lasts several minutes. (Bloecher, [p. II-10](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728176349&usg=AOvVaw2qi_LfQVSkkX6AtG47qGhb))

July 7 — 9:00 p.m. [William A. Rhodes](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2010/10/beyond-rhodes-photographs.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728176653&usg=AOvVaw00pbhSIpTWIz9nfEC9kHqd)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2010/10/beyond-rhodes-photographs.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728176877&usg=AOvVaw3IWjY0zZ5OI2C6XqmjR6Pb) an independent scientist and inventor in Phoenix, Arizona, takes two photos of a dark, heel-shaped disc at his home at 4333 N. 14th Street. The photos are reproduced in the July 9 issue of the Arizona Republic. A few weeks later, an Army Air Corps Intelligence officer from Hamilton Army Airfield \[now closed\] in Novato, California, visits Rhodes and takes the prints and negatives, but Rhodes is unable to get them back. However, [Kenneth Arnold](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenneth_Arnold&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728177189&usg=AOvVaw0D9wbu9-MwQk4k5XlsLbVQ) obtains them on a later visit to Hamilton, and they wind up with [James E.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_E._McDonald&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728177426&usg=AOvVaw2zaYGrQKBXyCEcR1ceV9Di) [McDonald](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_E._McDonald&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728177682&usg=AOvVaw0_RM5DUv6M_aXJiD8rEac8)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_E._McDonald&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728177855&usg=AOvVaw3qkiVQToX2z-MUk4eH05B0) Rhodes actually has an informal top-secret clearance because of his invention of a degaussing device for ships. IV-4](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionIV.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728178298&usg=AOvVaw1kZg3Pwoh_mbOGARLOKEEh); Michael D. July 7 — 9:30 p.m. Charles Crockett, 15, is walking along Western Avenue in Manchester, Maine, when he sees a cluster of luminous objects to the west, just above the treetops on the north end of Cobboseecontee Lake. They are still visible when he arrives home and alerts his mother and grandmother. Possible searchlight beams. (“[‘Flying](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/101847782/the-bangor-daily-news/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728178922&usg=AOvVaw0k67m86RyZsNY6e3CjCVvK) [Saucers’ Still Seen](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/101847782/the-bangor-daily-news/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728179153&usg=AOvVaw2-gymD0bRVQPofKp35VBUw) [Flitting](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/101847866/the-bangor-daily-news/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728179411&usg=AOvVaw2iIA3gjo7QaAITlM9a5u4g) [in N.E. Sky,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/101847916/the-bangor-daily-news/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728179637&usg=AOvVaw1PPYsmt-aMi_X-O3VbQg9u)” Bangor (Maine) Daily News, July 8, 1947, pp. 1–2; Bloecher, [p. II-20](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728179920&usg=AOvVaw2tMUYAuGsM8KUM4c9boNhU))

July 7 — 10:15 p.m. Louisville Times photographer [Al Hixenbaugh](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/1950_06_26_US_KY_Louisville_Hixenbaugh_Background.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728180281&usg=AOvVaw38rFsdNyriLVWya6Rhjcvq) is at Preston Street and Bickels Lane in Louisville, Kentucky, when he notices three “fiery balls” in the sky. He takes a 5-second exposure, capturing two of the objects that show as slightly curved streaks. He estimates they are 1–2 miles away, moving at 200 mph, and at an altitude of 1,000–2,000 feet. Robert Delara of 2745 West Market Street also sees the three objects shooting northward. (Louisville (Ky.) Times, July 8, 1947; “[‘Flying Liver Pills’ over Kentucky,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92678766/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728180612&usg=AOvVaw0xWuUlhDtGxFwKWpq58F2o)” Cincinnati Enquirer, July

9, 1947, p. 1; Bloecher, [pp. IV-4–5](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionIV.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728181038&usg=AOvVaw2ItGKN9Z7yWztcxQVphr-b); “[La Fotografía (y la Pélicula) Al Hixenbaugh 1,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://marcianitosverdes.haaan.com/2017/02/la-fotografa-y-la-pelcula-al-hixenbaugh-1/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728181291&usg=AOvVaw2DDzGQsTujV6fhbERPBSVE)” Marcianitos Verdes, February 5, 2017)

July 8 — 2:00 a.m. [Marcel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/19717326/jesse-antoine-marcel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728181596&usg=AOvVaw30JXlqlbGOT-8zAlVlFELV) stops at home in Roswell to show his wife [Viaud](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/87431527/viaud-marcel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728181853&usg=AOvVaw3zuvl3JBKlikK40N7S9T7B) and son [Jesse Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/116270028/jesse-antoine-marcel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728182236&usg=AOvVaw0HL6gSHNop7Ac4EC5wnZ5y) some of the Corona, New Mexico, crash debris. Over the next hour they examine it on the kitchen floor. Marcel Sr. says it is a flying saucer. Marcel is not breaking regulations since nothing has yet been classified. With the help of his son, Marcel loads it into the car to be taken to Roswell AAF. (Kevin D. Randle and Donald R. Schmitt, The Truth about the UFO Crash at Roswell, Evans, 1994, [p. 166](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/truthaboutufocra0000rand/page/166/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728182854&usg=AOvVaw1alvjgk53F8TtM5lDVnD23); Robert J. Durant, “C. B. Moore’s Mogul Tape,” IUR 23, no. 2 (Summer 1998): 7–9, 32; Robert A. Galganski, “Probing the Roswell Thin-Strut Debris,” IUR 24, no. 3 (Fall 1999): 8–12,

30; Karl T. Pflock, et al., “Debris Details,” IUR 24, no. 4 (Winter 1999): 28–29)

July 8 — 6:00 a.m. [Marcel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/19717326/jesse-antoine-marcel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728183821&usg=AOvVaw305mbnmWuvlIztcmmWj9Ug) and [Cavitt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/177397132/sheridan-wear-cavitt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728184276&usg=AOvVaw1cti-AmB3FS9sb38JFeUMZ) visit with [Blanchard](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_H._Blanchard&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728184636&usg=AOvVaw2WMeFMw-Q-8zhCCM0OAaSH) in his quarters and tell him what they have seen. Blanchard calls base Provost Marshal Maj. [Edwin D. Easley](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/42373439/edwin-dean-easley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728184906&usg=AOvVaw2lsU0lK0AHbkDRE7wWXkuT) and orders him to post guards on the roads around the debris field. Armed guards encircle the primary areas, denying access to anyone without official business. Easley is directed to locate [Brazel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/9454979/william-ware-brazel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728185178&usg=AOvVaw2dw0JmdJd3-AAmd6VpX4Ls) and have him escort the MPs to the debris field. Blanchard calls Eighth Air Force headquarters in Fort Worth, Texas, and advises them of the new find. (Kevin D. Randle and Donald R. Schmitt, The Truth about the UFO Crash at Roswell, Evans, 1994, [p. 166](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/truthaboutufocra0000rand/page/166/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728185516&usg=AOvVaw06NN7j2yeVIs0ixFxrPyfc))

July 8 — 7:30 a.m. The regular 9:00 a.m. Roswell Army Air Field staff meeting is moved up 90 minutes. The main topic for discussion is [Marcel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/rw/w/jessemarcel.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728185850&usg=AOvVaw2X8-j8m53JJG5owJcw8YSo) and [Cavitt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/177397132/sheridan-wear-cavitt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728186106&usg=AOvVaw2Pp3pueACYWXioqJyT03Dh) reporting an extensive debris field near Corona in Lincoln County, New Mexico, approximately 75 miles northwest of Roswell. A preliminary briefing is provided by [Blanchard](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_H._Blanchard&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728186541&usg=AOvVaw1ax-NoI4G88kccZjaxEpOM) about the separate impact site approximately 40 miles north of Roswell. Samples of wreckage are passed around the table. Pieces that resemble metal foil, paper-thin yet extremely strong, and pieces with unusual markings along their length are handed from man to man, each voicing their opinion. No one is able to identify the crash debris. (Kevin D. Randle and Donald R. Schmitt, The Truth about the UFO Crash at Roswell, Evans, 1994, [p. 166](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/truthaboutufocra0000rand/page/166/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728187084&usg=AOvVaw3O8SEvadnj_BB21GBvBX5_))

July 8 — 9:00 a.m. [Cavitt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/177397132/sheridan-wear-cavitt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728187579&usg=AOvVaw3rmYlB7FOdsjou2m0ZZiw8) and [Lewis S. Rickett](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/47990919/lewis-s_-rickett&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728188034&usg=AOvVaw3MxJQpjufXfkltGXy_oB7W)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/47990919/lewis-s_-rickett&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728188349&usg=AOvVaw2O2TXXiKjBj88nq3kwWBYF) who has returned from an assignment in Carlsbad, New Mexico, drive a staff car to the impact site north of Roswell, followed by MPs. They are stopped by the guards who are still posted. When they arrive, they see that a small containment of debris remains that Rickett is allowed to examine. (Kevin D. Randle and Donald R. Schmitt, The Truth about the UFO Crash at Roswell, Evans, 1994, [p. 166](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/truthaboutufocra0000rand/page/166/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728188920&usg=AOvVaw0MI7jcmde6h0wvG7aT9kBn))

July 8 — 9:30 a.m.–9:20 p.m. Five separate UFO sightings take place at Muroc AFB \[now Edwards AFB\] in southern California, the Air Force’s aircraft testing and development center. [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728189431&usg=AOvVaw03iFCQq8fWG5oQafartthI) says these are the first sightings “that really made the Air Force take a deep interest in UFOs.” At 9:30 a.m., 1st Lt. [Joseph C. McHenry](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/69719785/joseph-charles-mchenry&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728189870&usg=AOvVaw3hYDpEk_uNP5rWYxT47c_B) and three others see three discs heading in a westerly direction. At 10:10 a.m., XP-84 test pilot Maj. [Jowell C. Wise](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/41163741/jowell-clark-wise&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728190155&usg=AOvVaw2FHMaW3prpNBkOLj82WBJ_) sees a yellowish-white object at 10,000 feet traveling about 200 mph. At 11:50 a.m., Maj. [Richard R. Shoop](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/197896549/richard-raymond-shoop&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728190572&usg=AOvVaw1q-hP32YXCCxvWpTejgTcI), Col. S. A. Gilkey, and Capt. [John P. Stapp](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Stapp&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728190813&usg=AOvVaw08JvReEO_BSYD1J4lpsNth) are sitting in an observation truck at Rogers Dry Lake and see a round, white aluminum-like object descending from 20,000 feet for about 90 seconds; it has two knobs or thick fins on the top. Around 4:00 p.m., a pilot flying an F-51 some 40 miles south of Muroc sees a “flat object of a light-reflecting nature”; it is flying too high for him to climb up to it. At 9:20 p.m., spherical objects are again seen in the area, this time at 8,000 feet and moving against the wind at 300 mph. (NICAP, “[Observers Sight Saucer over Base](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470708muroc1_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728191105&usg=AOvVaw2u8XFm7zp8On9yENcUonpZ)”; NICAP, “[Object Observed by Four Witnesses in Observation](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470708muroc2_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728191314&usg=AOvVaw092NAro9_fkQsEyk-lcUXb)”; NICAP, “[Object Descends to Ground Level,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470708muroc3_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728191524&usg=AOvVaw3gnZ6iFknTzE5TOQfD2anb) [Rises](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470708muroc3_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728191738&usg=AOvVaw26yErkNnVJTFR4UBTz7WS2)”; NICAP, “[Flat Object with Fin Observed by F-51 Pilot](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470708muroc4_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728191944&usg=AOvVaw3avR3MDcKGuaZVcxYI7PNN)”; Bloecher, [pp. III-4, 12](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionIII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728192262&usg=AOvVaw0jP1Yd0HJlAo1cW9fyQQ1O); Clark III 783–784; Sparks, pp. 22–23; Patrick Gross, “[The Muroc Army Air Field Incidents](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/muroc.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728192841&usg=AOvVaw3P4mbcFkd4Mll6w-6WB4R9)”)

July 8 — 11:00 a.m. Col. [William Blanchard](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_H._Blanchard&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728193169&usg=AOvVaw028ZHSuH7CQqLFXJPuS6UC) dictates a press release about the Roswell recovery to Public Information Officer Lt. [Walter Haut](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/rw/w/walterhaut.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728193451&usg=AOvVaw3qtZwxaO7zTLl7cKvCVUxy)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/rw/w/walterhaut.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728193699&usg=AOvVaw0RJG7pu5_qPRH4eKK4IrBm) who delivers the release to radio stations around noon (the first apparently to Frank Joyce at KGFL) and the newspapers in Roswell, New Mexico. (Kevin D. Randle and Donald R. Schmitt, The Truth about the UFO Crash at Roswell, Evans, 1994, [p. 167](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/truthaboutufocra0000rand/page/166/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728194128&usg=AOvVaw0UqSOJkY3CqDn_VzSWH_a3))

July 8 — The Army Air Force issues a press release saying that, based on a “preliminary study,” the flying discs are not secret bacteriological weapons designed by a foreign power, experimental army aircraft, or spaceships. However, Army and Navy officials are not certain what they are. (“[‘Saucer’ Dept.—All Designs,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/25102626/numerous-flying-saucer-reports/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728194523&usg=AOvVaw2VPDenC3gWjq0bnzD2yI9V)” Racine (Wis.) Journal Times, July 8, 1947, p. 6)

July 8 — Rep. [Lyndon B. Johnson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lyndon_B._Johnson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728194866&usg=AOvVaw1G31aZHGBgAXn8Ndtya2cT) (D-Tex.) requests information on the flying discs from the War Department. Someone from Gen. [Carl Spaatz](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Spaatz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728195139&usg=AOvVaw36EfuwRk1tXJlkCC69izud)’s office writes back on July 21 to tell him the Army Air Forces are looking into it, but there is “no indication” that the discs are “new or unusual missiles or aircraft.” (Swords 38)

July 8? — British radio and TV entertainer [Hughie Green](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hughie_Green&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728195451&usg=AOvVaw2cH4CZ-6Mu2AnswJ2wXZji) is driving across the US. About 250 miles west of Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, he hears an announcement that a flying saucer “had crashed in New Mexico and that the Army were moving in to investigate. Later the program was interrupted again and quite a few details were given.” When he arrives at Philadelphia, there is nothing in the newspapers or on the radio. (“[Star Puzzled,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1955%252CMar-Apr%252CV%25201%252CN%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728195777&usg=AOvVaw366FV0DfTSNPTtkdx9Y9sD)” Flying Saucer Review 1, no 1 (Spring 1955): 3; Clark III 319; “[Hughie Green: ‘Peripheral Witness to Roswell?’](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.abovetopsecret.com/forum/thread892300/pg1&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728196096&usg=AOvVaw1v3avgAH3sTx7wgR9oOGRy)” Above Top Secret forum, October 20, 2012)

* * *

July 8 — 1:00 p.m. [Marcel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/19717326/jesse-antoine-marcel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728196459&usg=AOvVaw1c4HmCLZgGDsAoLg8NAKN3) goes on a B-29 special flight (the second) to Fort Worth Army Air Field, Texas, with the wreckage to report to Gen. [Roger M. Ramey](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/1686367/lt-gen-roger-m-ramey/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728196752&usg=AOvVaw16gO57hRGRZZ51V0Y5QLSN). The pilot is Lt. Col. [Payne Jennings Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Payne_Jennings_Jr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728196965&usg=AOvVaw1huIzooi_U0qtmif-pB_qz) with Lt. Col. [Robert](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/81472407/robert-ivan-barrowclough&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728197369&usg=AOvVaw3OJAONdU29xMWycNqvvGEd) [Barrowclough](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/81472407/robert-ivan-barrowclough&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728197746&usg=AOvVaw2xnEXaPBrpYK3zhT7AGvls) riding in the bombardier’s seat. Only a few packages are loaded onto the plane. One, a triangular package about two feet long, is wrapped in brown paper. The other three are about the size of shoe boxes. They are so light that it feels as if there is nothing in them. When it lands in Fort Worth, the enlisted soldiers on the plane are ordered to remain aboard until a guard is posted and Marcel gets off taking one of the packages that he has been carrying on his lap. According to Flight Engineer M/Sgt. [Robert Porter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/rw/w/robertporter.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728198229&usg=AOvVaw3RmfwP1iez9dP4Xh3KiVMf), the soldiers go to the mess hall once the guard is posted. The remaining debris is transferred to a B-25 that is flying to Wright Field in Dayton, Ohio. Marcel goes to Ramey’s office and puts the package on his desk. They both go to a map room, where Marcel shows him where the debris was found. When they return to Ramey’s office, Marcel sees that the package he brought has been substituted by a torn-up weather balloon. Ramey proposes a plan that possibly originates from his bosses at the Pentagon. Attention needs to be diverted from the more important impact site north of Roswell by acknowledging the Corona location. Too many civilians are involved, and the press is already alerted. (Kevin D. Randle and Donald R. Schmitt, The Truth about the UFO Crash at Roswell, Evans, 1994, [pp. 167–168](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/truthaboutufocra0000rand/page/166/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728198821&usg=AOvVaw0CF6m6cmkJOtgTxqgipdu1); Thomas J. Carey and Donald R. Schmitt, “Flight to Fort Worth: From Complicity to Cover-Up,” IUR 25, no. 2 (Summer 2000): 7–13, 30)

July 8 — 2:26 p.m. [Haut](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/rw/w/walterhaut.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728199404&usg=AOvVaw3DThXnUmg61MBgK8hDCpvF)’s press release about the recovered disc reaches the Associated Press wire. The story announces: “The army air forces here today announced a flying disc had been found” the previous week. It says that the disc is recovered by intelligence officers of the 509th Bomb Group at Roswell Army Air Field \[now closed\], New Mexico, with the help of local ranchers and the Chavez County Sheriff’s Office. It adds that the disc is being loaned by Maj. [Marcel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/19717326/jesse-antoine-marcel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728199837&usg=AOvVaw0flTL-rmT8qwYuynoF4G1I) “to higher headquarters.” (Kevin D. Randle and Donald R. Schmitt, The Truth about the UFO Crash at Roswell, Evans, 1994, [p. 167](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/truthaboutufocra0000rand/page/166/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728200372&usg=AOvVaw07hazyUQsmnrophcVU7J5I))

July 8 — 2:30 p.m. [Blanchard](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_H._Blanchard&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728200830&usg=AOvVaw0Y5_cQFjQrYurtfA_SkSWT) decides it is time to “go on leave.” Too many phone callers into the base are asking to speak with him. He, along with a few members of his staff, drive out to the Corona, New Mexico, debris field. Those left at the base are told to inform the reporters that the colonel is now on leave. (Kevin D. Randle and Donald R. Schmitt, The Truth about the UFO Crash at Roswell, Evans, 1994, [p. 167](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/truthaboutufocra0000rand/page/166/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728201401&usg=AOvVaw2XxSccXQBuQc3LbACESs7i); Kevin D. Randle, “When a Leave Is Not a Leave: Col. Blanchard and the Roswell Timeline,” IUR 19, no. 4 (July/Aug. 1994): 18–20; Karl T. Pflock, “Taking Liberties with a Leave,” IUR 20, no. 2 (Mar./Apr. 1995): 18)

July 8 — 2:41 p.m. The press release is put on the United Press wire. ()

July 8 — 3:50 p.m. An Army National Guard pilot flying near Mount Baldy, California, observes a flat object, reflecting light, about the size of a fighter. He gives chase, attempting to keep it in sight, but is unable to do so. (Air Force Base Intelligence Report, “[Flying Discs,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/garrett_073047doc.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728202219&usg=AOvVaw2ttMyQcxT5m2HDQSm4l9B6)” July 30, 1947; Kevin D. Randle, “[Roswell, Nathan Twining, and the](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/roswell-nathan-twining-and-mini-eots.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728202460&usg=AOvVaw2l5D3ek_eKRY6aOHC7As9E) [Mini-EOTS,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/roswell-nathan-twining-and-mini-eots.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728202700&usg=AOvVaw1t45uztbK-tBEkIq9CFKsd)” A Different Perspective, October 6, 2014)

July 8 — 4:26 p.m. Thomas Dale is flying a small plane at 2,800 feet over Alton, New Hampshire, with passenger Jere Stetson. They see a metallic object some 2 miles away to the east and some 1,500 feet below their aircraft. It approaches them at great speed before veering to the north. They estimate it is 20 feet long and “not exactly round.” (Bloecher, [p. III-12](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionIII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728203009&usg=AOvVaw0tEtp0ixPFy-1FcOV3dNs-))

July 8 — 4:30 p.m. The Roswell Daily Record carries the “RAAF Captures Flying Saucer” story. In Fort Worth, Texas, [Ramey](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/1686367/lt-gen-roger-m-ramey/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728203407&usg=AOvVaw2VJoyHAd8L2qrCILmMnbt1) issues a statement saying the Roswell officers were fooled and that the material is a Rawin target device suspended by a Neoprene rubber balloon. (“Rawin” is a method of determining wind speed and direction by using radar or radio waves to track a balloon carrying either a radar-sensitive target or radio transponder.). The debris is switched for the newspaper photographer, [James Bond Johnson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/47401399/james-bond-johnson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728203693&usg=AOvVaw3auB4pVaZlOu18ib_XZi-7), at a press conference held by Ramey and Col.

[Thomas J. DuBose](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/rw/w/thomasdubose.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728203955&usg=AOvVaw0YxVIC425BT2_eGg3x4b1I) in late afternoon. Johnson takes six photos of the debris and leaves after 20 minutes. One of the photos shows Ramey holding a piece of paper (the “Ramey memo”) with words written on it; unfortunately, the resolution is inadequate to decisively “deblur” the text using modern technological methods. A weather officer, Maj. [Irving Newton](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.legacy.com/obituaries/sanantonio/obituary.aspx?n%3Dirving-newton%26pid%3D134553090&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728204239&usg=AOvVaw2BvcbPzj5w0v5Hey2oALgD)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.legacy.com/obituaries/sanantonio/obituary.aspx?n%3Dirving-newton%26pid%3D134553090&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728204444&usg=AOvVaw2j8S4O2p-167L9St_PAxy_) is called in to identify the debris as from a balloon. A photo of Newton with the debris is taken by another photographer. (Kevin D. Randle and Donald R. Schmitt, The Truth about the UFO Crash at Roswell, Evans, 1994, pp. 41–43, 168; Donald R. G. Fitch, \[[FBI memo](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://docs.wixstatic.com/ugd/aa4aac_677b6f3d275b4e7e88a312e65ec5fb48.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728228952&usg=AOvVaw38uFoOkfKIlax_vMzp6VOr)\], July 10, 1947; ClearIntent, [p. 148](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/clearintentgover00fawc/page/148/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728229176&usg=AOvVaw0eWRXp_Hr0fmC3pwfeZ41u); Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1947 July 7th–July](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-July-7-July-10-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728229406&usg=AOvVaw01M3XaPVdhdqNluDUND9cT) [10th, Supplemental Notes,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-July-7-July-10-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728229635&usg=AOvVaw0g51mR4LbHRNGyFa8b69Bh) The Author, 2001, p. 14)

July 9 — Shortly after 5:00 p.m. Electrician Raymond Edward Lane and his wife are picking huckleberries near Midland, Michigan, when they hear a kind of “puff” noise nearby. Looking up, they see a ball of white, sparkling fire, like a Fourth of July sparkler, about the size of a bushel basket, no more than 100 feet away. It is hovering several feet above a stretch of sand. After about 10 or 15 seconds, the light goes out and the object vanishes. The only thing that remains is a peculiar dark substance on the sand and some metallic fragments. Lane collects fragments of the material in a tin can and brings them the next morning to Robert S. Spencer, a senior researcher at the Dow Chemical Company materials research laboratory in Midland. Spencer goes to the site with Lane and Dow’s internal security chief Edward Fales. Spencer has the Dow spectroscopy laboratory analyze the fragments and reports that the shiny pellets are largely silver mixed with a bit of silicon. They conclude that it consists of fused sand. By the end of September, the lab has analyzed ashlike powder found at the site. It turns out to be thorite that is slightly radioactive, mixed with magnesium hydroxide and other trace minerals. The conclusion is that the sighting is the result of some kind of home-made fireworks experiment, although Dow chemist [John Josef Grebe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/107960608/john-josef-grebe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728230041&usg=AOvVaw0-csZ6Ko7N4ooYmVszhmOx) suspects it might have been a small missile. (NICAP, “[Object Hovers over Sand](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470709midland_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728230285&usg=AOvVaw3-zNE6_QrkWuwO1Lo9kCAE)”; Bloecher, [pp. IV-2–3](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionIV.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728230499&usg=AOvVaw1hiFc6ReLKKuT5bdRfR8f8); Joel Carpenter, “[The Midland Fireball: Dow Chemical, UFOs, and Evidence,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/articles/dow.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728230716&usg=AOvVaw2gv56FyaQ6Db-DHZYV7eS9)” IUR 23, no. 3 (Fall 1998): 28–32)

July 9 — 11:30 p.m. Constable Eric Kearsey sees four yellowish discs flying in close formation above Grand Falls, Newfoundland. He calls other people to watch them as well. They are moving at high speed to the east with a dipping motion. At 11:40 p.m., an egg-shaped object “the size of a barrel head” passes overhead in the same direction. (St. John’s (Newf.) Evening Telegram, July 9, 1947; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-July-7-July-10-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728231154&usg=AOvVaw2hNEE5AJjCVZKa2hxTsYL-) [Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1947 July 7th–July 10th, Supplemental Notes,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-July-7-July-10-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728231384&usg=AOvVaw2qIP8gKS2lilKtzldXMOiE) The Author, 2001, pp. 45–46)

[D. Milton](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://bhunt34.wordpress.com/2015/12/30/acme-press-photos/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728231960&usg=AOvVaw34bbt2cojlzqWiKATF0PBg) [“Mickey” Ladd](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Ladd.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728232167&usg=AOvVaw2mrBPBZdGbybyAAGMf_VQ6) at FBI headquarters in a memo titled “Flying Disks.” Ladd adds a note saying that the “Bureau does not believe it should go into these investigations” because many cases are “pranks.” Associate FBI Director [Clyde Tolson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clyde_Tolson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728232416&usg=AOvVaw37y0SDTQwwDxuSfLvCcRYS) adds, “I think we should do this,” while [J. Edgar Hoover](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Edgar_Hoover&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728232653&usg=AOvVaw2mRU1aeiu1-DVmjpPbH1V8) writes, “I would do it but before agreeing to it we must insist upon full access to discs recovered. [Nathan Twining](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nathan_Farragut_Twining&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728239446&usg=AOvVaw3aplkWdWlwdEZHAfS5FtTD) stops at White Sands before returning to Wright Field, Ohio. July 10 — 4:47 p.m. University of New Mexico astronomer [Lincoln LaPaz](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lincoln_LaPaz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728239772&usg=AOvVaw1mdOXzWR6ijA8kb4oATPNn)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lincoln_LaPaz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728239940&usg=AOvVaw1C9tGnGMmHcgauqJHsCC9x) his wife Leota, and two daughters, Jean and Mary, are driving west on Highway 60 near Fort Sumner, New Mexico, when they see a sharply outlined, white ellipsoidal object wobbling in the sky to the west about 25 miles away. They watch it for about 30 seconds, then it disappears behind a cloud, but reappears 5 seconds later further to the right. He estimates its size as 245 feet long and 100 feet thick at the maximum, with a horizontal speed of 120–180 mph and a vertical speed of 600–900 mph. It moves silently with no vapor trail. It resembles no known aircraft. July 10 — 5:30 p.m. Three civilian airline mechanics (John N. Mehrman Jr., Robert Leidy, and John E. Woodruff) at Ernest Harmon AFB \[now Stephenville International Airport\] are returning from a fishing trip and driving up a mountain road near Stephenville Crossing, Newfoundland. They see a bluish-black exhaust trail that has cut through some clouds leaving a “hole.” Woodruff sees a disc-shaped object the apparent size of a C-54 transport plane coming out of the clouds and traveling at a terrific rate of speed. The hole remains in the cloud for more than an hour. Leidy takes two Kodachrome photos of the exhaust trail. The sighting later impresses Project Sign personnel to the extent that they ask questions about UFO effects on clouds. (NICAP, “[Harmon Field Photo](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470710fortsumner_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728242460&usg=AOvVaw0VQsoc2AGz1hAEbt1jH5OS)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728242717&usg=AOvVaw23lXo09pSKkmY9HmOfxZqp)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728242885&usg=AOvVaw2-LSdwuoFrRH7pdkcOQVi7) p. 24; Michael D. Swords, “[Can You Learn Anything from UFO Photos, Part Two,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://thebiggeststudy.blogspot.com/2012/07/can-you-learn-anything-from-ufo-photos.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728243127&usg=AOvVaw307VvjysX5xL6q1h6qaqAB)” The Big Study, July 5, 2012; Swords 38–39; Loren E. July 11 — Debriefings of all military participants in the debris recovery operation take place. They are taken into a room in small groups and told that the recovery is highly classified and not to talk about it. Military personnel warn civilians around Roswell, New Mexico, that they are not to talk about what happened. (Kevin D. Randle and Donald R. Schmitt, The Truth about the UFO Crash at Roswell, Evans, 1994, [pp. 72–76](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/truthaboutufocra0000rand/page/72/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728244364&usg=AOvVaw09eILwnPhGmPfxOuVEqHX_), [172](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/truthaboutufocra0000rand/page/172/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728244591&usg=AOvVaw1Z0mbF_uIq9yXEtfPOsuFq))

This is one of the first cases of “vehicle interference” UFO cases involving an airplane. July 23 — José C. Higgens and some assistants are surveying a field in Campina do Amoral in the Colônia Goio-Bang, located between Luiziana and Mamboré, Paraná, Brazil. On hearing a sharp sound, they see a grayish-white disc- shaped object about 100 feet in diameter, which soon lands and rests on curved metal feet. His assistants flee, but Higgens goes up to examine it. He sees a small, glass window, then two odd-looking beings observing him curiously. A door opens in the craft, and three other hairless beings dressed in transparent overalls. They have large, round eyes with eyebrows and pronounced eyelashes. Their legs are disproportionately long and they are about 7 feet tall. One points a small tube at Higgens. They are speaking in an unknown, sonorous language. He walks toward the door and can see only a small cubicle, bordered by another door, and several portholes. Higgens by gestures asks where they are from and the leader draws a map in the dirt, indicating a seventh planet, presumably Uranus. He eludes them by pretending to look for his wife and goes into a hidden spot in the woods. After 30 minutes the beings climb into the object and take off. (Wikipedia, “[Caso José Higgens](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://pt.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caso_Jos%25C3%25A9_Higgens&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728255907&usg=AOvVaw0o2vJxzjZMthpI4YyVWC28)”; Clark III 576–

July 26 — President [Truman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_S._Truman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728259888&usg=AOvVaw3L6whuA-ni5-XIWoG_UBfn) signs the National Security Act, a major restructuring of the military and intelligence agencies. It creates a unified National Military Establishment (Army and Navy) and a Department of the Air Force, both under the new Secretary of Defense. The Joint Research and Development Board becomes the R&D brain center. Each of the three service secretaries maintains quasi-cabinet status. It establishes the National Security Council to advise the president and the Central Intelligence Agency, the first peacetime intelligence agency in the US. The CIA is prohibited from conducting domestic surveillance, but [Allen Dulles](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allen_Dulles&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728260176&usg=AOvVaw25_X53CAahRTA1sJ2_ryUo) ensures it can handle “other functions” affecting “national security” without scrutiny from Congress or (sometimes) the president. Much of the CIA’s funding initially comes from wealthy Americans. The act creates the first black military and intelligence budget. (Wikipedia, “[National Security Act of 1947](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Security_Act_of_1947&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728260438&usg=AOvVaw0C4QOxGkWw8Ty0Y3HdBLol)”)
