Johnson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/39757884/david-n_-johnson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728262541&usg=AOvVaw34B4QNcyZ9xq4apLtyC1v2) about their UFO sightings. [Leverett G. Richards](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://apnews.com/1736a07c919af497dd11932e2c39e12a&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728262835&usg=AOvVaw0dZMTtfuQtnOvy2saCYuUU)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://apnews.com/1736a07c919af497dd11932e2c39e12a&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728263038&usg=AOvVaw1hVw8QJDivd7S67DDXQM1u) aviation editor of the Portland Oregonian, informs the FBI of this information. He also calls Lieut. Gen. [Nathan Twining](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nathan_Farragut_Twining&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728263314&usg=AOvVaw2c7p7TETt5hV26DftLxqLV), who leaves “the impression that the AAF instituted this investigation to wash out the disc reports since they are definitely not of AAF origin.” (Memo for FBI Director from Mr. D. M. Ladd, August 14, 1947)

July 28 — After assessing the Ernest Harmon AFB, Newfoundland, report, Gen. [Schulgen](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.generals.dk/general/Schulgen/George_Francis/USA.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728263638&usg=AOvVaw1kGRsLvXnZKc_vqLxEc8aC) orders Col. [Howard M.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/colonel-howard-mccoy-and-mj-12.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728263894&usg=AOvVaw2rthSDhaZ4fHeYWS22Ivyv) [McCoy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/colonel-howard-mccoy-and-mj-12.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728264135&usg=AOvVaw1P4EaPfpteVC_Uqvfv4Zah)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/colonel-howard-mccoy-and-mj-12.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728264328&usg=AOvVaw1cADSLFtzn-0wvzSv3ozyk) deputy commander of T-2 intelligence at Wright Field, Ohio, to send a top-level assessment team (possibly [Alfred Loedding](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/209268646/alfred-christian-loedding&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728264573&usg=AOvVaw3Ywnp5Ty38jNm62QUpwx-x) or Col. [William R. Clingerman Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/113944251/william-r_-clingerman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728264822&usg=AOvVaw0eBW7DUQIvNqlJqfZfYieE)) to Stephenville “immediately” and report directly to the Pentagon afterwards. McCoy suspects German or Russian technology. (Michael D. Swords, “Project Sign and the Estimate of the Situation,” JUFOS 7 (2000): 33–34; Swords 39)

July 28 — 8:34 p.m. Capt. Charles F. Gibian and First Officer Jack Harvey are piloting United Air Lines Flight 105 and descending above Mountain Home, Idaho, in preparation for landing in Boise. Harvey sees an object that seems to be another aircraft ahead of them and to the south, but it rapidly moves to the northwest in a weaving fashion, diminishing in size and vanishing from view. (“[United Air Lines Crew Reports Sighting](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/101853888/the-idaho-statesman/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728265233&usg=AOvVaw1CjqS5USGO68haasO0FJK-) [Flying Saucer between](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/101854006/the-idaho-statesman/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728265452&usg=AOvVaw1wc2SgEuVspFVT7Fi0URxw) [Mountain Home and Boise,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/101854006/the-idaho-statesman/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728265676&usg=AOvVaw0mRH2y85GJCJTFW5gJoMGU)” Boise Idaho Daily Statesman, July 29, 1947, pp. 1–2; Bloecher, [pp. III-13–14](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionIII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728265950&usg=AOvVaw3XrawezugEGRHHWEE9jFpN))

July 29 — A memo from FBI agent E. G. Fitch says that Special Agent [Reynolds](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://cdnc.ucr.edu/cgi-bin/cdnc?a%3Dd%26d%3DMT19611122.2.2%26e%3D-------en--20--1--txt-txIN--------1&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728266245&usg=AOvVaw1qH0jy9mciH96kYHIdXhaH) has met with Gen. [Schulgen](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.generals.dk/general/Schulgen/George_Francis/USA.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728266498&usg=AOvVaw2xSx_VXozMXgp-nd-DoK8X) again, who assures him that “all discs recovered would be made available for the examination by the FBI agents.” (ClearIntent, [pp. 149–150](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/clearintentgover00fawc/page/148/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728266762&usg=AOvVaw2iXwLXKRR62no2v-EUG2Oj))

July 29 — 6:55 a.m. [Kenneth Arnold](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenneth_Arnold&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728267028&usg=AOvVaw3TJTZRdlym_kWwEIlIAXk_) is flying to Tacoma, Washington, to investigate the Maury Island mystery. As he is over Union, Oregon, preparing to land at La Grande to refuel, he sees a cluster of 25 small (24–30 inches) brass- colored discs with a spot in the middle moving at a terrific speed. They come within 1,200 feet of his aircraft before veering away. At La Grande, he phones aviation editor [David N. Johnson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/39757884/david-n_-johnson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728267301&usg=AOvVaw3nADRMO0WGUy3nUpifD3WC) about his sighting, then reaches Tacoma at dusk. He gets a room (502) at the Winthrop Hotel, where a room and a bath have already been mysteriously reserved for him. [Harold A. Dahl](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/125878620/harold-albert-dahl&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728267583&usg=AOvVaw3TLXjg-JH-Ye-ZISiWPQov) visits Arnold that night, then takes him to [Fred Crisman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fred_Crisman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728267823&usg=AOvVaw1r0ueJtPihOrqTawK3laK5)’s place to see some Maury Island fragments. Arnold thinks it looks like lava. (Kenneth Arnold and Ray Palmer, The Coming of the Saucers, Palmer, 1952, pp. 25–38; Bloecher, [pp. I-15–16](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionI.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728268105&usg=AOvVaw3fxlXkYfa06SMZRmHnZguL)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionI.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728268284&usg=AOvVaw2kZzjikzRv9zJfV8t0PrXU) [III-14](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionIII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728268494&usg=AOvVaw3fpnYWvRvL37y1Q5WHtmCb); Clark III 720–721)

* * *

July 29 — 2:50 p.m. Assistant Base Operations Officer Capt. [William H. Ryherd](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/72481935/william-henry-ryherd&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728268844&usg=AOvVaw1Csk-INscIdS1O0YMfGBnj) and ex-AAF B-29 pilot 1Lt Ward Stewart see two round, shiny, white objects near Hamilton Army Airfield \[now closed\] in Novato, California. The objects are 15–25 feet in diameter and are flying at about 750 mph at an altitude of 6,000–10,000 feet heading south. One object flies straight and level; the other weaves from side-to-side like an escort fighter. (Bloecher, p.

[III-5](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionIII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728269197&usg=AOvVaw1jdZQoAcgE4-vEdMyIWFTN)[;](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionIII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728269383&usg=AOvVaw24qSUm0gSIa0OiseK7k_4y) [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728269600&usg=AOvVaw2GCSZ4DVQX5VtgSikMLPvS)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728269769&usg=AOvVaw0jxq1p9z_dPN93t_CqjNjl) p. 25)

July 30 — [Arnold](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenneth_Arnold&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728270036&usg=AOvVaw3LWA3h6Nr4Z5V1NEq_GAVf) calls United Airlines pilot Capt. Emil J. Smith and asks him to come listen to the Maury Island, Washington, story. Smith arrives in Tacoma in the afternoon and cross-examines [Dahl](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/125878620/harold-albert-dahl&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728270304&usg=AOvVaw1QY8h7ThUXt6BrlKVJP5dS) and [Crisman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fred_Crisman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728270535&usg=AOvVaw2hm73kb6ctqjO-z4qWWq6x). Smith stays with Arnold at the Winthrop Hotel. Journalist [Ted Morello](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://tedmorellojournalist.wordpress.com/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728270740&usg=AOvVaw3VwQLJYz0uvc-Govh_26Vn) of United Press calls Arnold and says that a crackpot has been calling him, explaining everything that is going on in the hotel room, including conversations with Smith when they are alone. They try but fail to locate a listening device in the room. (Kenneth Arnold and Ray Palmer, The Coming of the Saucers, Palmer, 1952, pp. 38–46; Clark III 721)

July 30 — The FBI issues a policy statement on “Flying Discs,” saying that sightings should be investigated to see whether an “individual might be desirous of seeking personal publicity, causing hysteria, or playing a prank.” (“Flying Disks,” Section B, Bureau Bulletin no. 42, Series 1947, in Black Vault FBI documents compilation, [p.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://documents.theblackvault.com/documents/ufos/fbi/ufo1.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728271217&usg=AOvVaw2kmdGVbMe9P8zRn50d089X) [48](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://documents.theblackvault.com/documents/ufos/fbi/ufo1.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728271444&usg=AOvVaw2oe8BBZuICKzs__Jv-WwgS); ClearIntent, [p. 150](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/clearintentgover00fawc/page/150/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728271665&usg=AOvVaw2BbFvWfnq33BtuJ5FqsZA_))

July 30 — A memo with the subject line, “Recovery ‘Flying Discs,’” purportedly written by Maj. [Edwin D. Easley](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/42373439/edwin-dean-easley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728271955&usg=AOvVaw0W5IO58G0UJjzKhrkFRrSw), acknowledges that the Roswell, New Mexico, crash could “represent an interplanetary craft of some kind.” However, it is now largely considered a forgery by [Frank Kaufmann](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/13371870/frank-j-kaufmann&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728272185&usg=AOvVaw2pwtPRI-gj21Ns42Aw8lCG)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/13371870/frank-j-kaufmann&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728272365&usg=AOvVaw3_-8rfkEfrJYL536e3BVDn) (Kevin D. Randle, “Frank Kaufmann, Roswell Witness,” IUR 27, no. 3 (Fall 2002): 8, 17–19; Mark Rodeghier, “Frank Kaufmann Exposed,” IUR 27,

no. 3 (Fall 2002): 9–11, 26)

July 30 — The Garrett Estimate, an Air Force Base Intelligence Report on “Flying Discs”—an informal estimate of the situation based on 16 reports selected by Collections Officer Lt. Col. [George D. Garrett](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/33467541/george-duncan-garrett&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728272872&usg=AOvVaw0WypNZUdPvfNBxNz7gyynv)—says that the “flying saucer situation is not all imaginary or seeing too much in some natural phenomena. Something is really flying around.” Also, “Lack of topside inquiries . . . give more than ordinary weight to the possibility that this is a domestic project, about which the President, etc., know.” The study is passed up the line to Gen. [George Schulgen](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.generals.dk/general/Schulgen/George_Francis/USA.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728273131&usg=AOvVaw1lQqmbytIZgzZlf0asgeTd) and [Hoover](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Edgar_Hoover&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728273366&usg=AOvVaw0YLTxSNDeFzKmiul0K3Ql4) at the FBI for comment, subtly indicating that investigating a domestic project is a waste of time. (Air Force Base Intelligence Report, “[Flying Discs,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/garrett_073047doc.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728273665&usg=AOvVaw1GR2v9wMFXLBFN7vgny6x7)” July 30, 1947; Michael D. Swords, “Project Sign and the Estimate of the Situation,” JUFOS 7 (2000): 32–33, 57–61; Swords 39, 474–475; Kevin D. Randle, “[Roswell,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/roswell-nathan-twining-and-mini-eots.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728273965&usg=AOvVaw1NZpVtFTfppERy_9IH9Bui) [Nathan Twining, and the Mini-EOTS,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/roswell-nathan-twining-and-mini-eots.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728274210&usg=AOvVaw1hIp1VGlBKkOwk3fCW48qS)” A Different Perspective, October 6, 2014)

July 31 — [Crisman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fred_Crisman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728274476&usg=AOvVaw16H-IgCQJklcGF7Eszijp9) and [Dahl](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/125878620/harold-albert-dahl&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728274748&usg=AOvVaw1F0Pmq-75FoZynw0n1V2UJ) bring heavy fragments and white metal from the Maury Island case to the Winthrop Hotel room in Tacoma, Washington. They cannot locate the photos. [Arnold](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenneth_Arnold&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728274984&usg=AOvVaw1VCY0t_bIH2C_1QmX-49np) calls [Brown](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/65326329/frank-mercer-brown&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728275228&usg=AOvVaw2KmdJSNUHbq5vWQ_AQk0GF) and [Davidson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/43927275/william-lee-davidson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728275487&usg=AOvVaw1zdJpSByfIv1uh2BvQCvue) at Hamilton Army Airfield in Novato, California. They quickly depart for Tacoma. [Morello](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://tedmorellojournalist.wordpress.com/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728275755&usg=AOvVaw1jPUBTSrKTn0E-oDTBXEoX) calls Arnold and says his informant knows that Brown and Davidson are on their way in a B-25. They arrive in the late afternoon. The five men talk until 11:00 p.m., when Crisman offers to go home and get more Maury Island fragments. He returns with slightly different, more slag-like rock stuffed in a large cereal box, which is loaded into Brown’s army vehicle.

Brown and Davidson leave to go back to Hamilton for Air Force Day the next day. Morello calls again and says his informant told him everything about what has just taken place. (Kenneth Arnold and Ray Palmer, The Coming of the Saucers, Palmer, 1952, pp. 46–57; \[FBI teletype, August 6, 1947\], [pp. 87–88](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://documents.theblackvault.com/documents/ufos/fbi/ufo3.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728276181&usg=AOvVaw2Mns8kQAp7Q59XhDeRtSKD))

July 31 — Capt. [Edward Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728276626&usg=AOvVaw01L-NdFuJi7jPEIOTPnjQf): “By the end of July 1947, the UFO security lid was down tight. The few members of the press who did inquire about what the Air Force was doing got the same treatment that you would get today if you inquired about the number of thermonuclear weapons stock-piled in the U.S.’s atomic arsenal. . . \[At T-2 there was\] confusion almost to the point of panic." (Ruppelt, [p. 22](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/22/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728277054&usg=AOvVaw2Mk6zkVYuhSghPkk5XwvCV))

August — USAF fighter pilot W. Boyce sees a hovering disc above Media, Pennsylvania. (UFOEv, [p. 33](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D45%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728277628&usg=AOvVaw3P9EFkCiwPzCMATgj397Nt))

August — T-2 Intelligence and Army Air Force Intelligence hold meetings over the next two months and prepare documents requesting an authorized project to investigate UFOs, per General [LeMay](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Curtis_LeMay&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728278114&usg=AOvVaw1Zp30oRrvFthWkfLYzESX_)’s 1946 instructions. ()

August — The Air Materiel Command headquarters replaces T-2 Intelligence with the Technical Intelligence Department, tasked with producing reports and estimates on foreign air weapons. It begins to develop a photoanalysis capability. ()

August — The Denver Post runs a story that claims the military is building a secret base consisting of huge caverns for atomic weapons defense purposes. The article says the new base is in the Manzano Mountains southeast of Sandia Base, New Mexico. The military responds by issuing a statement that operations and construction near Sandia Base are top secret. In fact, however, the Armed Forces Special Weapons Project is building one of several bases around the country that will be used for nuclear weapons storage. The AFSWP code-names the base “Site Able.” (Wikipedia, “[Sandia Base](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sandia_Base%23Manzano_Base&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728278680&usg=AOvVaw04P90X4MMyDswETd4qgVFD)”)

* * *

August 1 — [Brown](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/65326329/frank-mercer-brown&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728279112&usg=AOvVaw2I68xymn15P3YVNoRnYIod) and [Davidson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/43927275/william-lee-davidson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728279403&usg=AOvVaw3DMbq_If8OvB-35LS_urLG) make a stop at McChord Field near Tacoma, Washington, to speak with intelligence officer Maj. [George Sander](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/72303755/george-sander&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728279763&usg=AOvVaw32pYke-ItTMr2EpYZEkLeD)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/72303755/george-sander&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728279988&usg=AOvVaw37hmAMQZ2fBLDLhf26I8to) then board the B-25 for Hamilton Army Airfield \[now closed\] in Novato, California. It explodes and crashes near Kelso, Washington, at 1:30 a.m., 20 minutes after taking off, when the left engine catches fire. An army hitchhiker and engineer parachute to safety. Brown and Davidson fail to signal distress or bail out. After hearing the news, [Arnold](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenneth_Arnold&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728280286&usg=AOvVaw34g0nsTdS-fJfhsPqbBNk-) calls [Palmer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raymond_A._Palmer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728280608&usg=AOvVaw3MM_Fjvsc_ug9N69yveyR8) and offers to return his money. Palmer says to just mail him some fragments. Arnold and Smith visit [Morello](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://tedmorellojournalist.wordpress.com/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728280957&usg=AOvVaw2aaHdH2M0ByeHONLagsdLb) and [Dahl](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/125878620/harold-albert-dahl&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728281252&usg=AOvVaw1FnP111W-fqWDHT4dBennM) and [Crisman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fred_Crisman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728281582&usg=AOvVaw2Vulpo0zuzgblxNRjl_MQn). They talk to Tacoma Times reporter [Paul](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/107053568/paul-christian-lantz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728281912&usg=AOvVaw2VY_EzK__PCvKBmivaTZFJ) [Lantz](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/107053568/paul-christian-lantz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728282161&usg=AOvVaw0dVCHP8cwX-yuqT_oWOfCG) in the hotel lobby, who writes the article “Sabotage Hinted in Crash of Army Bomber at Kelso.” Debris from the crash is not discovered until 2007. (“Air Force Day Marred As B-26 Crashes Here,” Longview (Wash.) Daily News, August 1, 1947, p. 1; “[‘Flying Saucers’ Figure in](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/786650/kelso-b-25-crash-pt-1-of-2-galveston/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728282612&usg=AOvVaw1cgz1LeV2FYNwjVkshykV4) [Two Air Crash Deaths,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/786644/kelso-b-25-crash-pt-2-of-2-galveston/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728282884&usg=AOvVaw1PNBAS9gvXysh8AyqwBH4M)” Galveston (Tex.) Daily News, August 3, 1947, pp. 1, 5; Kenneth Arnold and Ray Palmer, The Coming of the Saucers, Palmer, 1952, pp. 57–72; Charlette LeFevre and Philip Lipson, “[The Maury Island UFO Incident,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nwlegendsmuseum.com/MauryIsland.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728283301&usg=AOvVaw30KNF_NB9nJb_pd7C-3hzr)” February 2014; Leslie Slape, “[Marker Placed near Kelso to Honor Pilots in ‘47 Crash,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/90030669/longview-daily-news/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728283556&usg=AOvVaw2SEWtqkQrVZkH9cAT-w_SE)” Longview (Wash.) Daily News, August 3, 2007, p. 9)

August 3 — Smith contacts Maj. [Sander](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/72303755/george-sander&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728284045&usg=AOvVaw15aA5EkxDlGd4LhNmafEAC)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/72303755/george-sander&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728284359&usg=AOvVaw1jBHwWH6dgP2xuNJjaPgHj) who relieves [Arnold](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenneth_Arnold&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728284728&usg=AOvVaw3ovqU2iD__w6f4cxkXvn-V) and Smith of all their fragments. He shows them a smelting lot where he finds similar pieces of slag. Smith and Arnold check out of the Winthrop Hotel in Tacoma, Washington. (Kenneth Arnold and Ray Palmer, The Coming of the Saucers, Palmer, 1952, pp. 73–84)

August 4 — Pilots Capt. [Jack](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://alaskaairmuseum.org/wp/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/jack-peck.jpg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728285426&usg=AOvVaw3A8eU7ja_MVgNEGN71OWbu) [Peck](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/25121894/jack-randall-peck&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728285821&usg=AOvVaw1XFOZN0Ln0s6XFq_EckFgj) and Vince Daly see a smooth UFO northwest of Bethel, Alaska, dead ahead as they are flying a DC-3 for Al Jones Flying Service. Peck hauls back on his controls to bring his plane up to safer altitude. Now 1,000 feet higher, the pilots glance downward and spot the UFO closer but on a changed course. Still dark against the sky, it looks to be as large as a C-54. Intrigued, Peck dives on the object as it pulls away, doing his best to get a better view, but it speeds up to an estimated 500 mph and is lost to view in four minutes. (NICAP, “[Smooth Black Object Crosses Path of DC-3](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470804bethel_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728286295&usg=AOvVaw36ruItPRDnFKIUZsRT9Y1d)”; Harold D. Johnston, “[Matters of National Interest,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/bethel.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728286641&usg=AOvVaw0xz0KrngDA8c0vuM37yhCP)” August 5, 1947; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728287034&usg=AOvVaw1VL38IuFt9CSBPkrzvrr4x), p. 25)

August 6 — An FBI memo from E. G. Fitch to [D. Milton Ladd](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Ladd.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728287504&usg=AOvVaw21gORqEvFJwRejrFyKLG8b) identifies either [Brown](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/65326329/frank-mercer-brown&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728287828&usg=AOvVaw0j6NiSqUHERELgXtiUQ83w) or [Davidson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/43927275/william-lee-davidson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728288090&usg=AOvVaw3Vk1zCO0n2f65VAb2UJdx9) as a CIC agent on a top secret mission. (Jason Colavito, ed., “[Inquiry into Richard Shaver and Ray Palmer, Federal Bureau of](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.jasoncolavito.com/inquiry-into-shaver-and-palmer.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728288360&usg=AOvVaw2CyF-5feyLkXoCjdrOFIYR) [Investigation, 1947”](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.jasoncolavito.com/inquiry-into-shaver-and-palmer.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728288584&usg=AOvVaw1E3XFqY4Ij8qNrvuG4hQz9))

August 7 — The Seattle, Washington, FBI office interrogates [Crisman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fred_Crisman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728288853&usg=AOvVaw2OWKN-RSD91NVJK0PX3CL3) and [Dahl](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/125878620/harold-albert-dahl&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728289209&usg=AOvVaw13uSdMCN5UewQsXSfhzhWj) and announces the Maury Island incident is a hoax. The FBI file notes that Dahl stated that “if questioned by the authorities he was going to say it was a hoax because he did not want any further trouble over the matter.” Dahl’s daughter Louise admits in 2007 that the whole story was made up, as did her brother Charles in the late 1960s, who called Crisman a “smooth-talking con artist.” The affair had started as a joke and blossomed into something worse. Associated Press reporter Elmer Vogel says that Dahl’s wife had compelled him to tell Vogel the truth. [Morello](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://tedmorellojournalist.wordpress.com/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728289530&usg=AOvVaw0w3pBctJeR-_5Wpo7Z_Mjv) also speaks to Crisman, who admits the story is baseless. (Clark III 721; Kenneth Arnold and Ray Palmer, The Coming of the Saucers, Palmer, 1952, pp. 105–111; Jason Colavito, ed., “[Inquiry into Richard Shaver and Ray Palmer, Federal Bureau of](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.jasoncolavito.com/inquiry-into-shaver-and-palmer.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728289980&usg=AOvVaw0n7uiG_a1vUn62ivbf2jqw) [Investigation, 1947”](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.jasoncolavito.com/inquiry-into-shaver-and-palmer.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728290242&usg=AOvVaw0z8rR5Js9Tg2Nlc8SA520u); Kenn Thomas, Maury Island UFO: The Crisman Conspiracy, IllumiNet, 1999; Anthony Bragalia, “[Maury Island No Longer a Mystery: A UFO Hoax Exposed!](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ufodigest.com/article/maury-island-no-longer-a-mystery-a-ufo-hoax-exposed/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728290683&usg=AOvVaw3yDJ3izJXnF0oeb_6-b-ze)” UFO Digest, July 8, 2010; Brian J. Robb, “Conspiracy Central: The Life and Lies of Fred Lee Crisman,” Fortean Times 355 (July 2017): 32–39)

August 8 — Lt. Col. [Donald L.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.foreshadower.net/images/Col-Donald-L.Springer-USAF.jpg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728291044&usg=AOvVaw0AkPzui0ZmnOSoNkhB9RQE) [Springer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49321614/donald-l-springer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728291271&usg=AOvVaw2LoXIN9Z5SsU56vRk_uJGE), assistant chief of staff for army intelligence at the Fourth Air Force, who has just returned to Hamilton Army Airfield \[now closed\] in Novato, California, from Tacoma, Washington, says “there is not sufficient evidence or testimony available to this headquarters to conclude whether or not the reports of so- called flying disks in the Tacoma area or any other area have any basis of fact.” He adds that the Maury Island crash “did not occur.” (“[Fourth Air Force Drops Disc Inquiry; Search Held Futile,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92764388/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728291526&usg=AOvVaw2vjd_Osu0mTSxr8lKLDjKT)” San Francisco Examiner, August 9, 1947, p. 5)

August 9 — [John Derry](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.atomicheritage.org/profile/john-derry&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728291865&usg=AOvVaw1KsZM4ilQDiSSK1qDM_9a5)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.atomicheritage.org/profile/john-derry&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728292043&usg=AOvVaw0dyVqsQLqbjQKydEurTLWF) serving as acting general manager of the Atomic Energy Commission, proposes a set of guidelines that restate the proposition that secrecy can be based on reasons other than national security. The definition of Confidential that he proposes goes beyond the Army and Manhattan Project rules: “CONFIDENTIAL: Documents, information or material, the unauthorized disclosure of which, while not endangering the National security, would be prejudicial to the interests or prestige of the Nation or any Governmental activity, or individual, or would cause administrative embarrassment, or be of advantage to a foreign nation shall be classified CONFIDENTIAL.” The Derry memo calls for review by a classification board assembled from the AEC’s regional sites. In September, this board assembles in Oak Ridge, Tennessee. The available documentation does not show that Derry’s proposed rules go into effect, but it does show that the Classification Board blesses the illustrations of matter that “should be graded” Secret or Confidential. The former category includes “certain selected human administration experiments performed under MED \[Manhattan Engineer District\].” (US Advisory Committee on Human Radiation Experiments, “Final Report,” October 1995, [chapter 13](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://biotech.law.lsu.edu/research/reports/ACHRE/chap13_3.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728292423&usg=AOvVaw18nhyseFT-iPWi5eGWsIUz))

* * *

August 13 — 1:00 p.m. [Albert Clarence Urie](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/5096687/albert-clarence-urie&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728292789&usg=AOvVaw0wNo8qrEKPCv0xvaOk9nXG) and his two sons [Billy](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/5096696/william-thomas-urie&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728293093&usg=AOvVaw3JIsgpBDb2sgwawxLVprn0) and Kenneth see a straw hat–shaped, sky-blue object about 10 wide, 10 feet high, and 20 feet long. It has “pods” on the side emitting flames and is flying along the Snake River Canyon six miles west of Blue Lakes Ranch near Twin Falls, Idaho. The UFO is moving up and down towards them at 1,000 mph and an altitude of 75 feet about 1/2 mile away. Urie is about 300 feet from the object, which is about level with him and silhouetted against the canyon wall. It disappears behind a hill about one mile away. [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728293436&usg=AOvVaw3DBgJIRS7teNu7RNsw5s_v)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728293679&usg=AOvVaw2DZjWmQSBk0yF_XRGHvwWX) for Project Blue Book, later identifies it as an “atmospheric eddy.” (“[Flying Saucer Reported](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/72830786/the-times-news/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728293910&usg=AOvVaw0EgHeW4hWefKEHvoXJe5o3) [Flashing Down Canyon at 1,000 Miles Per Hour;](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/72830786/the-times-news/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728294180&usg=AOvVaw3md5nYE8guECIaZNSBReHX) [Two Others Seen,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/72831209/the-times-news/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728294459&usg=AOvVaw2zOZOKHt9qtQ46l6kB0LMo)” Twin Falls (Idaho) Times-News, August 15, 1947, pp. 1, 8; NICAP, “[Snake River Case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470813snakeriver_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728294918&usg=AOvVaw1QF0VgBNwso3EoTMtKNOUH)”; Hynek UFO Report, [p. 34](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/34/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728295344&usg=AOvVaw16VYejCPOqzXPY9U6K4hm0); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728295705&usg=AOvVaw00dDl-NT3qtJlvLsba2PAK), p. 26; Story, [pp. 337–338](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/encyclopediaofuf0000unse/page/336/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728296083&usg=AOvVaw1l6pNzqb1IZ8vkh-gpKbG7); Patrick Gross, “[Snake River, August 13, 1947](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/snakeriver1947.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728296478&usg=AOvVaw200HFE5z6ZQBSJpaDPFVW5)”)

August 13 — The San Francisco Examiner’s Washington Bureau hears a rumor from a US intelligence source that Soviet agents have been ordered to solve the mystery of flying saucers. It reports that the Kremlin believes that the discs are connected with Army experiments in anti-radar weaponry. (San Francisco (Calif.) Examiner, August 14, 1947, p. 1)

August 14 — The first Gallup poll on UFOs shows that 90% of Americans have heard of flying saucers; 33% don’t know what they are, 39% consider them hoaxes or misidentifications, 16% consider them US or Russian secret weapons. The ETH is not mentioned. (Project 1947, “[August 1947 Gallup Poll](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/gallup.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728297027&usg=AOvVaw3clv6WMwNFa7g5I53V-R0I)”; Robert J. Durant, “Evolution of Public Opinion on UFOs,” IUR 18, no. 6 (Nov./Dec. 1993): 9–10)

August 14 — Shortly after 9:00 a.m. Italian artist and author [Luigi Rapuzzi](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://it.wikipedia.org/wiki/L._R._Johannis&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728297427&usg=AOvVaw0iYoqUUwigez8nKG0hLEN2) (who uses the pseudonym L. R. Johannis) is hiking along the left bank of the Torrente Chiarzò near Raveo, Udine, Italy, when he sees a vivid red, metallic, domed disc on the riverbank about 165 feet ahead. It is about 33 feet wide and embedded in a cleft in the rock about 20 feet above thqwe stream. Looking around, he sees two “boys” on the edge of a grove of trees. He shouts at them and points to the object, walking toward them, but notices they are actually odd-looking dwarfs who are approaching him stiffly. They are about 3 feet tall and wearing dark blue coveralls with red collars, cuffs, and belts. Their greenish heads are covered in tight-fitting, brownish caps. He looks at them in astonishment for 2–3 minutes, then waves his geologist’s pick at them and asks where they come from. One of the entities raises its right hand to its belt, which emits a puff of smoke that knocks Rapuzzi to the ground as if from an electric shock. As he is lying there, one of them grabs his pick and he notices its green hand has 8 claws. They climb up the rock and into the disc, which soon shoots straight out and into the air, hovering briefly at an angle, then vanishes.

Rapuzzi feels a blast of wind that blows him across the ground. His pick is missing. (NICAP, “[Professor](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470814friuli_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728297829&usg=AOvVaw1uugf_4HiuNMSaV96bmYic) [Encounters ‘Lens’ and Creatures](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470814friuli_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728298065&usg=AOvVaw0PEE7Yna-pSguFv4jama6-)”; “[The Villa Santina Case,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR-SI%25201966%2520N%25201%252CThe%2520Humanoids.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728298314&usg=AOvVaw1E1bzzFM8xhPB1b7DUmrXg)” in Charles Bowen, ed., The Humanoids, special issue of FSR, Oct./Dec. 1966, p. 2; 1Pinotti 19–30)

August 14 — 10:40 a.m. Three men of the 147th Airways and Air Communications Service Squadron at Harmon Field, Guam, see two small crescent-shaped objects zigzagging at 1,200 feet. They disappear in the clouds and another object emerges and proceeds west. (Lt. Col. Donald L. Springer, “[Flying Disc,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/guam47.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728298732&usg=AOvVaw2BNZxyJaucwoXedo1Ox6me)” August 27, 1947; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728298986&usg=AOvVaw31HcT5xN8Uov7q9YEipNn6), p. 26)

August 14 — The FBI concludes that the plane carrying [Davidson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/43927275/william-lee-davidson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728299526&usg=AOvVaw1qoBTAWZeWHjvzVABVGQeD) and [Brown](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/65326329/frank-mercer-brown&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728299947&usg=AOvVaw20BkoXCSVQlPW_egCsklPc) was not sabotaged, nor was it carrying actual flying disc parts. (Memo for FBI Director from Mr. D. M. Ladd, August 14, 1947)

August 15 — In response to the August 13 San Francisco Examiner report, FBI Director [J. Edgar Hoover](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Edgar_Hoover&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728300596&usg=AOvVaw1gBsap5egQ0fzR-0ZPmb1d) asks the agency to look into whether Soviet spies are looking into whether the flying discs are a secret US technology. Assistant Director of the Domestic Intelligence Division [D. Milton](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://bhunt34.wordpress.com/2015/12/30/acme-press-photos/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728301046&usg=AOvVaw2DmkAoAATTEgmvud_05enU) [“Mickey” Ladd](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Ladd.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728301399&usg=AOvVaw3-2aY82vqOOVAOWSwTjrzq) at FBI headquarters assures FBI Deputy Director [Edward Allen Tamm](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Allen_Tamm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728301823&usg=AOvVaw35bGyHRFw9cEoCR0AQzP8K) that he is unaware of any such effort. ([Memo](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/a2019795_mvrht_Ufo/page/n221/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728302286&usg=AOvVaw2qPhYe_O9LnJ7XHlmP2J9E) to Assistant FBI Director E. A. Tamm from Agent D. M. Ladd, August 15, 1947)

August 15? — 9:30 p.m. Maj. [Elmer H. Hammer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://airforce.togetherweserved.com/usaf/servlet/tws.webapp.WebApp?cmd%3DShadowBoxProfile%26type%3DPersonAircraftExt%26ID%3D108161&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728302754&usg=AOvVaw0RUCQQmdM0tl3JPIpH38Hr) of the 28th Bombardment Wing at Rapid City Army Air Base \[now Ellsworth AFB\] near Box Elder, South Dakota, sees 12 objects flying at 6,000–10,000 feet in a tight diamond formation at 300–400 mph. The objects level off at approximately 5,000 feet and make a gentle large-radius turn of about 110° to the right about 4 miles away. They start climbing at an angle of 30–40° and appear to accelerate rapidly in the climb. The objects are approximately 100 feet long and have a brilliant yellow-white luminous glow. (NICAP, “[12 B-29-Sized Elliptical Objects Seen](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470815rapidcity_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728303054&usg=AOvVaw2gfpBW26wdM2XuCJiUDDwV)”; Hynek UFO Report, [p. 40](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/40/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728303447&usg=AOvVaw0zqsGLOJN5TguR1SZAzn01); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728303809&usg=AOvVaw1BXP2L_567ac4dE0xNxgK_), p. 26)

August 17 —A forest ranger at a fire lookout tower on Mt. Josephine, Skagit County, Washington, observes an object shaped like a huge clam that appears to fall tipped at an angle northeast of the fire tower. It slows to a stop, levels off, and floats “leisurely as if suspended by a cord” for a few minutes and finally moves off to the southeast with ever increasing speed. (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: Volume 1, 1947,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Revision.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728304198&usg=AOvVaw058ALV-BK0cYvmSjaf8KcE) The Author, February 1991, p. 61)

August 19 — FBI memo to [D. M. Ladd](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://bhunt34.wordpress.com/2015/12/30/acme-press-photos/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728304678&usg=AOvVaw2y2pMvGg35oQBwcDZKGwSr) from E. G. Fitch on “Flying Discs” mentions SAC Reynolds’s conversation with Lt. Col. [George Garrett](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/33467541/george-duncan-garrett&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728305145&usg=AOvVaw065xpOYdHmmZKe-b-ReOpO)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/33467541/george-duncan-garrett&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728305477&usg=AOvVaw01evB8IWOAD9z-1B97RcwW) who strongly suspects the Army or Navy is testing some new technology, condluding that “there were objects seen which somebody in the Government knows all about.” However Gen. [Stephen](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stephen_J._Chamberlin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728305897&usg=AOvVaw08D8MYtUUiWHd872ViWU_H) [Chamberlin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stephen_J._Chamberlin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728306264&usg=AOvVaw3faEH2spUL5qEwWar-Ek5-) and the War Department claim to have no involvement. (Memorandum from E. G. Fitch, “[Flying](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/fbi_081947doc.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728306686&usg=AOvVaw0brod-H0_IluBWUacp68kz) [Discs,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/fbi_081947doc.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728306929&usg=AOvVaw1P6gFaTr9FUTznN1ombvcf)” August 19, 1947)

* * *

August 19 — 9:30 p.m. H. H. Hedstrom (executive director of the Twin Falls Housing Authority) and three policemen (Richard A. Frazier, H. E. Roundtree, and Richard Scott) in Twin Falls, Idaho, see a formation of 12 objects flying in diamond formation at terrific speed. (NICAP, “[August 19, 1947, Twin Falls, Idaho](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/tfalls470819dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728307288&usg=AOvVaw0raN6IAJdATHkp0IYRqydx)”; Hynek UFO Report, [p. 39](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/38/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728307548&usg=AOvVaw0VKAObMdY1OXSXtdCTD4F_); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728307751&usg=AOvVaw3MrAM6H3Xv-f3tIxKHNHTF), p. 26)

August 20 — An Anglo-American intelligence team releases a report on secret German weapons. Foo fighters are said to be caused by a rocket-propelled plane launched straight up from the ground, intercepting Allied bomber formations by firing a spray of rocket shells from the nose. The pilot then parachutes back to the ground, a chute opens on the rocket, and it is recovered for re-use. (New London (Conn.) Day, August 20, 1947; Jan Aldrich)

August 22 — Col. [Robert Taylor III](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.arlingtoncemetery.net/rtaylor3.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728308169&usg=AOvVaw2ljHyc9wB8RyxF9tiw_H7d)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.arlingtoncemetery.net/rtaylor3.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728308345&usg=AOvVaw1ZEHJ6RXIMshYi9K1muidg) Collection Branch of Army Air Force Intelligence, summarizes the findings of Lt. Col. [Garrett](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/33467541/george-duncan-garrett&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728308689&usg=AOvVaw1oPyskYrT4yyn5f23qBQEg)’s investigations of UFOs in a letter to Gen. [Curtis LeMay](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Curtis_LeMay&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728309028&usg=AOvVaw0fVxPPVjKwdjo0tBUlUZ0z), Deputy Chief of Air Staff for Research and Development. Taylor requests any information on AAF projects that might give rise to such UFO reports. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1947 August 1st–December 31st,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Aug-1-Dec-31-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728309420&usg=AOvVaw04wHMWOT-xr4rWG-G63FFX) [Supplemental Notes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Aug-1-Dec-31-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728309812&usg=AOvVaw3Qdg2mYCh8HqYIPl_a6mGT), The Author, 2001, p. 27; Swords 39–40)

August 24 — The name Joint Research and Development Board is changed to simply Research and Development Board. (Michael Hall and Wendy Connors, “The Research and Development Board: Unanswered Questions,” IUR 26, no. 2 (Summer 2001): 8)

August 25 — USMC Maj. [Marion Eugene Carl](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marion_Eugene_Carl&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728310545&usg=AOvVaw1AiZqQIgVss_rbyJab4P2v) attains a world airspeed record of 651 mph in a Douglas Skystreak at Muroc AFB \[now Edwards AFB\], California. (Wikipedia, “[Marion Eugene Carl](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marion_Eugene_Carl&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728310865&usg=AOvVaw2Pu9D_B-XsbTtf-8egomuy)”)

August 28 — Microwave Early Warning radar on Shika Island off Fukuoka, Japan, picks up a target moving 450–478 mph at an altitude of 1,500 feet. It changes course, climbs, and is tracked to a distance of 62 miles. (NICAP, “[Target Tracked in a Climb](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/470828japan_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728311174&usg=AOvVaw3a1mGsLG8Bjv5oNz-UY2HM)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728311385&usg=AOvVaw3jZ8rm8QaR1Z52I1vR_S9y), p. 27)

August 29 — Gen. [LeMay](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Curtis_LeMay&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728311661&usg=AOvVaw2XapCdsfVAoXMynhwWemY6) answers Col. [Taylor](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.arlingtoncemetery.net/rtaylor3.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728311902&usg=AOvVaw2VNJLQn2EdyY5YyzaXGTUQ)’s August 22 request stating that there is no such project as described. (Swords 41)

Late August — Brig. Gen. [George F. Schulgen](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.generals.dk/general/Schulgen/George_Francis/USA.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728312208&usg=AOvVaw0LbPLkOBt3YFJaLU1vEKdQ) passes the updated Garrett Estimate on to Air Materiel Command head Gen. [Nathan Twining](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nathan_Farragut_Twining&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728312493&usg=AOvVaw0I_nquvMC_lRDFWO3djjh7) with a request for a statement on the discs so an authorized UFO project can be requested. Col. [Howard McCoy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/colonel-howard-mccoy-and-mj-12.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728312787&usg=AOvVaw0m7WoE6hTcU8EpPjnWBslu) asks for a meeting between [Alfred Loedding](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/209268646/alfred-christian-loedding&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728313063&usg=AOvVaw0jix5NDQWIJyjulNpgU1QU) (aeronautics engineer at T-3), Lt. Col. [George](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/33467541/george-duncan-garrett&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728313310&usg=AOvVaw2ZctevC2K3zbk8RdS1QJtD) [Garrett](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/33467541/george-duncan-garrett&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728313531&usg=AOvVaw0KhPvkORsPU1PSuCP-3ry8) (Collections), and Charles Carroll (a math and missiles expert who has been correlating UFO sightings with approaches of planetary bodies) “in order to set up a system for evaluating the information being received.” These four will later form the core of the ETH-friendly faction at Project Sign. (RosRept, [p. 13](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/books/The_Roswell_ReportR2.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728313796&usg=AOvVaw03C7d10QKJw1T5YoW7R8mE); Michael D. Swords, “Project Sign and the Estimate of the Situation,” JUFOS 7 (2000): 33–35; Letter to T-2 from Executive Air Intelligence Requirement Division, September 3, 1947; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728314101&usg=AOvVaw1gBRxBzuJlAOGS10W-g1pk)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728314290&usg=AOvVaw3HGkMRFqK7MhLdz2cVC6oC) p. 13; Swords 42, 43)

September — Astronomer [Lincoln LaPaz](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lincoln_LaPaz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728314613&usg=AOvVaw1vAttOvldEuAzbpiwu5WkB) arrives in Roswell, New Mexico, and rediscovers the area of blackened ground earlier found by two of [Wilcox](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.rdrnews.com/2018/11/12/a-sheriff-without-a-gun-memoirs-of-a-sheriffs-wife/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728314890&usg=AOvVaw1IGTaZbYYtTK9L5lEAaq6s)’s deputies. He speaks to some witnesses and determines there might have been more than one object. ()

September 3 — A memo from Col. R. H. Smith at Air Defense Command headquarters at Mitchel Field on Long Island, New York, states that the intent of USAF cooperation with the FBI was to “relieve the numbered Air Forces of the task of tracking down all the many instances which turned out to be ash-can covers, toilet seats, and whatnot.” (ClearIntent, [p. 156](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/clearintentgover00fawc/page/156/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728315207&usg=AOvVaw0LoA6PQuj8UcpPyDrDe3k0); Michael Hesemann and Philip Mantle, Beyond Roswell, Marlowe, 1997, [p. 66](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/isbn_9781569247815/page/65/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728315491&usg=AOvVaw2qQ1ORuBwy9ZwZyoIqHKwX))

September 3 — Dale Edwards and three friends are camping out in the Desolation Wilderness area west of Lake Tahoe, California, when one of them spots a huge gray UFO accompanied by a rush of warm air. The next day they encounter a circle, 40 feet in diameter, of recently burned grass and skunk cabbage. (“True Mystic Experiences,” Fate 2, no. 3 (September 1949): 74–82)

September 5 — In response to the Garrett Estimate, Gen. [Curtis LeMay](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Curtis_LeMay&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728315919&usg=AOvVaw3tjX3k0f3GVZsVqnZw3Qkw) states in a memo, copied to the FBI, that “a complete survey of research activities discloses that the Army Air Force has no project with the characteristics similar to those which have been associated with the Flying Discs.” (Michael D. Hall and Wendy A. Connors, Alfred Loedding and the Great Flying Saucer Wave of 1947, Rose Press, 1998, [p. 83](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/loedding/LoeddingBook.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728316245&usg=AOvVaw2xTybhxZWXWduwcjBpwL_R))

September 5 — In Washington, D.C., [Alfred Loedding](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/209268646/alfred-christian-loedding&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728316540&usg=AOvVaw0VfflDhz3yNyHWJ0q9J4qQ) (as Wright Field T-2’s liaison with the Pentagon) meets with [Garrett](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/33467541/george-duncan-garrett&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728316794&usg=AOvVaw0P7W1Z1gBaXe-ADZs_7dxU) and Carroll. Flying disk reports at the Pentagon are transferred to Wright Field, Ohio, shortly afterwards. (Michael D. Swords, “Project Sign and the Estimate of the Situation,” JUFOS 7 (2000): 34)

Mid-September — [Twining](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nathan_Farragut_Twining&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728317172&usg=AOvVaw14EftGbm3NFO77dqmiPbJu) passes the Garrett Estimate on to Col. [Howard McCoy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/colonel-howard-mccoy-and-mj-12.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728317423&usg=AOvVaw1UiKmvW8j85otcBko59w7E)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/colonel-howard-mccoy-and-mj-12.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728317651&usg=AOvVaw0cC9LJx63-e4p-hnS9eWmY) Maj. Gen. [Alden Crawford](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/107429/major-general-alden-rudyard-crawford/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728318068&usg=AOvVaw3YwyzwVM-GE2ebw4Tc23-q) (chief of T-3), Gen. [Franklin O. Carroll](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/107470/major-general-franklin-o-carroll/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728318556&usg=AOvVaw24SROuHxUQTnyV2k7c4-2V) (director of research and development), Col. C. K. Moore (aircraft laboratory chief), Col. Russell Minty (power-plant laboratory chief), and Brig. Gen. [Edgar P. Sorenson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/108681/brigadier-general-edgar-p-sorensen/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728319063&usg=AOvVaw0Tg1X4V08Cewot-HvAcTyr) (Air Institute of Technology commander). They each study [Garrett](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/33467541/george-duncan-garrett&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728319572&usg=AOvVaw2YiSsQvQy3qoIlpoSddvtf)’s report and hold a conference on the discs. (Michael D. Swords, “Project Sign and the Estimate of the Situation,” JUFOS 7 (2000): 33)

* * *

September 16 — An incoming radar target is picked up at Itazuke Air Base \[now Fukuoka Airport\], Fukuoka, Japan, moving 840–900 mph, then fading out. (Col. James F. Olive Jr., “[Radar Pick-Ups of High-Speed Targets in the](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/26sept1947letter.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728320343&usg=AOvVaw1dlv9cZtFJpLtJpiubsoGU) [Far East,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/26sept1947letter.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728320632&usg=AOvVaw0-uv2XG2bMhzXnaI9AiU71)” Memorandum for Assistant Chief of Air Staff, Washington, D.C., September 26, 1947)

September 17 — The US Senate confirms [James Forrestal](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Forrestal&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728320946&usg=AOvVaw2p2pRXtjSOK37BaN95AokS) as the first Secretary of Defense. ()

September 18 — The reorganization of military and intelligence agencies under the National Security Act takes effect.

The US Army Air Forces is disbanded and becomes the US Air Force. ()

September 19 — FBI Special Agent [Harry M. Kimball](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://imtfe.law.virginia.edu/contributors/harry-m-kimball&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728321387&usg=AOvVaw2awwZb5k4XX7nrX9vj2-8u) in San Francisco passes Col. R. H. Smith’s memo up the chain to [Hoover](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Edgar_Hoover&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728321647&usg=AOvVaw0j5prlmnTijebOvZF5V4k5)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Edgar_Hoover&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728321924&usg=AOvVaw0Hh-C2l2tUuHpiwbKz0fVf) (ClearIntent, [p. 156](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/clearintentgover00fawc/page/156/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728322296&usg=AOvVaw2kueaVM_rd8pMVhDUuPq9-))

September 19 — A dubious document, allegedly written on this date by DCI Adm. [Roscoe Hillenkoetter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roscoe_H._Hillenkoetter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728322754&usg=AOvVaw01ZUXLBV7a8mQA60bxKU5N) and titled “Examination of Unidentified Disc-Like Aircraft near Military Installations in the State of New Mexico: A Preliminary Report,” has been circulated by [Timothy S. Cooper](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://majesticdocuments.waskosky.com/about/investigation-team/timothy-s-cooper/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728323045&usg=AOvVaw26VfcA40YqYzYT54z3p9uo). It purports to verify the “recovery of unidentified planform aircraft” in two locations on July 6. (Good Need, [p. 95](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/94/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728323274&usg=AOvVaw1bqfVniPYLV94xO-_kFqA4))

September 19 — 5:30 p.m. A geophysicist employed by the Humble Oil and Refining Company is testing a weather radar at Grand Isle, Louisiana, when the radar detects an object moving in a southwesterly direction at about 1,000 mph. It persists for about one minute, so he records it in his notebook and discusses the sighting with other scientists. No visual sighting is made. (Houston Press, March 24, 1950; Jan L. Aldrich, “[Project 1947: A Progress](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/articles/ufomag96.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728323679&usg=AOvVaw205Jh6Azw147g2rlPrDHp0) [Report,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/articles/ufomag96.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728324022&usg=AOvVaw1rcBy7F86hhhPzbW37lRfR)” March/April 1996)

September 21 — Arrangements are made to transfer UFO files from [Garrett](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/33467541/george-duncan-garrett&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728324505&usg=AOvVaw2_vAFq7K_Fjx0Ja7XF3c2F)’s office in the Pentagon to [Alfred Loedding](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/209268646/alfred-christian-loedding&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728324916&usg=AOvVaw3ITteOX_RA0aUFsXl9bRq4) at AMC. (Swords 43)

September 23 — Head of Air Materiel Command Gen. [Nathan Twining](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nathan_Farragut_Twining&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728325488&usg=AOvVaw2CJ_WDaKucjrCry2oXuF-8) responds to [Schulgen](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.generals.dk/general/Schulgen/George_Francis/USA.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728325782&usg=AOvVaw276Y7Yx0J-3O8Zzf6TjUJx)’s request for UFO information with a classified letter composed by Col. [McCoy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/colonel-howard-mccoy-and-mj-12.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728326028&usg=AOvVaw36_WFbgDLkJUQr86rWuXAM) with the assistance of [Alfred Loedding](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/209268646/alfred-christian-loedding&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728326281&usg=AOvVaw32UYZQLIL5PxEh1qSP8NVm), “AMC Opinion Concerning ‘Flying Disks.’” Twining notes the discs are “real and not visionary or fictitious.” Reports (based on the cases in the Garrett Estimate) include “extreme rates of climb, maneuverability (particularly in roll), and action which must be considered evasive.” Twining gives three reasons to study the discs: They might represent a deep-black domestic project; to pick up physical evidence; and to find out if they are nuclear- propulsion devices from Russia or elsewhere. The letter lists common descriptions of the objects and recommends that USAF “issue a directive assigning a priority, security classification, and code name for a detailed study of the matter.” This will ultimately result in Project Sign. Henceforth all disc reports are to be sent to the Army and Navy Research and Development Board, the USAF Scientific Advisory Group, the Atomic Energy Commission, the National Advisory Committee for Aeronautics, Project RAND, and the Nuclear Energy for the Propulsion of Aircraft project at Oak Ridge. Twining promises a detailed “Essential Elements of Information” (EEI) to be formulated immediately so that all agencies will have guidance. (Lt. Gen. Nathan Twining, “[AMC Opinion](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/470923.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728326572&usg=AOvVaw18yjoxPo3E3VILTj2Znxf0) [Concerning ‘Flying Disks,’](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/470923.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728326769&usg=AOvVaw1Vmfelmz183Iud1qB4o7ku)” September 23, 1947; RosRept, [p. 14](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/books/The_Roswell_ReportR2.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728326973&usg=AOvVaw0rwBo36lKiStlkZJpmV3-I); Swords 42, 476–478; Good Above, [pp. 260–](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/260/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728327200&usg=AOvVaw1wcXTY-biBiUCP8__NRDJS)

[262](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/260/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728327457&usg=AOvVaw0boB_6QM279g4SQsM43kq3)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/260/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728327638&usg=AOvVaw1d6Q-ak7s3RRnqH6X7BUul) [476–478](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/476/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728327843&usg=AOvVaw0v_BzJ4bFYH-6MniKAP8rj))

September 24 — DCI [Hillenkoetter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roscoe_H._Hillenkoetter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728328129&usg=AOvVaw1Eo1cUWtuYxTiWcvr3j1Hx)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roscoe_H._Hillenkoetter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728328302&usg=AOvVaw0IyhG7G1Qu-K16bVND2P_j) in a letter to AMC, designates T-2 and the Air Intelligence branch of the US Navy Bureau of Aeronautics as National Assets. He indicates that he does not plan to duplicate air technical intelligence assets within the CIA. (Jan Aldrich)

September 24 — [President Truman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_S._Truman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728328594&usg=AOvVaw0gAvkUkjWtMk6oBcol3viX) meets with [Vannevar Bush](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vannevar_Bush&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728328821&usg=AOvVaw3Z-W4qt03uykOm12VqJb2N), chairman of the Research and Development Board, at the White House. Secretary of Defense [James Forrestal](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Forrestal&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728329023&usg=AOvVaw3csdgRcr1jr2GAinSpNQ2o) is also present. (Stanton T. Friedman, Top Secret / MAJIC, Marlowe, 1996, [pp. 68–69](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/topsecretmajic0000frie/page/68/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728329370&usg=AOvVaw2n4uO--u56Xre62SyDgYnG))

September 24 — A fake memo from President [Truman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_S._Truman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728329747&usg=AOvVaw0vdQXad-5Zl1bCGkC7kxot) to Secretary of Defense [James Forrestal](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Forrestal&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728330149&usg=AOvVaw3qGhqj342nM-k7ZzrtJnZP) allegedly establishes a top-secret control group, Operation Majestic Twelve (MJ-12), to deal with the UFO problem. (Clark III 360; Joe Nickell and John R. Fischer, “The Crashed-Saucer Forgeries,” IUR 15, no. 2 (Mar./Apr. 1990): 4–20; Ted R. Spickler, “The Truman MJ-12 Letter,” IUR 16, no. 3 (May/June 1991): 12–13; Good Above, [p. 551](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/550/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728330858&usg=AOvVaw0FX882I4x2xw_oFQBMjhyI))

September 24— Col. [Miles E. Goll](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Goll_M.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728331389&usg=AOvVaw1rPCQpD3EeplGODglh4bG-)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Goll_M.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728331675&usg=AOvVaw2iGENQlczVComxxsjAxhVz) in a memo signed for Col. [McCoy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/colonel-howard-mccoy-and-mj-12.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728331940&usg=AOvVaw3IthepYAq0y3mhkB6dSL6S), asks about a radar case in Japan that Charles Carroll had mentioned to [Alfred Loedding](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/209268646/alfred-christian-loedding&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728332174&usg=AOvVaw2NIOzZ7Ux0oqIJNUofoa0V) in their meeting of September 5. (Dr. Carroll’s UFO files; Jan Aldrich)

September 25 — A memorandum from Maj. Robert J. Thomas lists the names of nine military personnel in charge of events in the aftermath of the Roswell, New Mexico, recovery. However, it is now largely considered a forgery by [Frank Kaufmann](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/13371870/frank-j-kaufmann&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728332529&usg=AOvVaw1q5PWmFG4Wuu6sN14UvIMC). (Kevin D. Randle, “Frank Kaufmann, Roswell Witness,” IUR 27, no. 3 (Fall 2002): 8, 17–19; Mark Rodeghier, “Frank Kaufmann Exposed,” IUR 27, no. 3 (Fall 2002): 9–11, 26)

September 26 — A memorandum from Col. James F. Olive Jr., Chief of Air Intelligence Division, to the Assistant Chief of the Air Staff, A-2, summarizes three radar trackings of high-speed targets in Japan (Chitose Air Base, July 1; and MEW Radar Station, Fukuoka, August 28 and September 16). It concludes that there is insufficient information to state that they involved aircraft or missiles but supports the conclusion that they were not natural phenomena. The report is forwarded to T-2 on September 29. (Col. James F. Olive Jr., “[Radar Pick-Ups of High-](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/26sept1947letter.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728333003&usg=AOvVaw06qNJyMoiAUglSyhjKph9J)

* * *

[Speed Targets in the Far East,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/26sept1947letter.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728333305&usg=AOvVaw3xZ-C7e1hdS3ieXr_baDzz)” Memorandum for Assistant Chief of Air Staff, Washington, D.C., September 26, 1947).

September 27 — [Hoover](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Edgar_Hoover&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728333587&usg=AOvVaw3BtFniUKqfIvNyxksz5B_H) notifies USAF Maj. Gen. [George C. McDonald](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/106278/major-general-george-c-mcdonald/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728333863&usg=AOvVaw2nLtKO3tYxCc17gHtv5NZf), assistant chief of air staff, that he is advising all FBI agents to discontinue all flying disc investigations. ([Letter,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://docs.wixstatic.com/ugd/aa4aac_f0eedb874d1543789a0c586ad02b88cc.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728334104&usg=AOvVaw0aml4_hEA-o9LxHb9xe7a1) J. Edgar Hoover to Gen. George C. McDonald, September 27, 1947; ClearIntent, [p. 158](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/clearintentgover00fawc/page/158/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728334348&usg=AOvVaw3yLJoLHFfCwor65hsr5GHz); Michael Hesemann and Philip Mantle, Beyond Roswell, Marlowe, 1997,

[p. 67](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/isbn_9781569247815/page/67/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728334668&usg=AOvVaw1903R1XswoeJI1SuBQiBmJ))

September 30 — [Vannevar Bush](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vannevar_Bush&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728334915&usg=AOvVaw0CNWWLUZ72-6nTO_TzSXrx) is appointed head of the new Research and Development Board in the National Military Establishment. ([Research and Development Board: History and Functions](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/researchdevelopm00u/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728335155&usg=AOvVaw2gWLE3GKypZYwG7SkztB0r)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/researchdevelopm00u/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728335324&usg=AOvVaw2SCuHX3di3eBe6VzymmrQv) US National Military Establishment, June 1, 1948)

Fall — [Claude Degler](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://jophan.org/mimosa/m30/williams.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728335663&usg=AOvVaw21ohzpkY9XGZkemy1y8Nt4)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://jophan.org/mimosa/m30/williams.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728335826&usg=AOvVaw1fUScYFUHcJDkUNY9Icnte) under the pseudonym John Chrisman, publishes a single issue of the first flying saucer fanzine, Weird Unsolved Mysteries. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1947](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Aug-1-Dec-31-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728336112&usg=AOvVaw2tnOVRYgZbMiF474_WrMbe) [August 1st–December 31st, Supplemental Notes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Aug-1-Dec-31-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728336332&usg=AOvVaw0B0-YLAd3zNN6PC1h4duZB), The Author, 2001, pp. 56–69; Curt Collins, “[Claude Degler, One](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2019/04/claude-degler-one-of-ufologists-that.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728336608&usg=AOvVaw2Sh73dZliJZ_ps12fj6Ooq) [of the Ufologists That Time Forgot,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2019/04/claude-degler-one-of-ufologists-that.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728336866&usg=AOvVaw2yIIJFgMhAF_QdBCPedMXL)” The Saucers That Time Forgot, July 15, 2021)

Early October — Private pilot Selman E. Graves claims to have witnessed part of the recovery of a crashed UFO in Paradise Valley, Arizona, on property owned by his friend, Walt Salyer. (Good Above, [pp. 394–397](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/394/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728337153&usg=AOvVaw0MaupEh3G7_yRv10y9YTgw))

October 1 — Bureau Bulletin 59 ends all FBI cooperation with the Air Force on UFO investigation, although the FBI continues its own inquiries. (ClearIntent, [p. 159](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/clearintentgover00fawc/page/158/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728337484&usg=AOvVaw2DcBXG8VZriDAmtW-zdL7s))

October 1 — A letter from [Truman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_S._Truman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728337747&usg=AOvVaw3QLHbnsFsijf1ZSQ1lIv28) to [Vannevar Bush](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vannevar_Bush&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728337979&usg=AOvVaw0s11M0Hh5RHsYwqPsDJ5Ag) appears to bear the original Truman signature used in the MJ-12 fake memo. ()

October 7 — Capt. R. V. A. Therien of the Royal Swedish Navy states at USAF headquarters that some ghost rockets have been observed making 180° turns, and about 33 of the incidents are considered factual. (Loren E. Gross, [The](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Aug-1-Dec-31-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728338339&usg=AOvVaw05DeFplNjE2Q_B5kZHIpqG) [Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1947 August 1st–December 31st, Supplemental Notes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Aug-1-Dec-31-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728338588&usg=AOvVaw2mUbnZpUMg9xoUTvxJxK2T)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Aug-1-Dec-31-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728338775&usg=AOvVaw0it_tREqYJYMudW_9flLIl) The Author, 2001, p. 76)

October 14 — [Bernt Balchen](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bernt_Balchen&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728339058&usg=AOvVaw3ttDbX9maUUCplv9ZjQAvl)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bernt_Balchen&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728339231&usg=AOvVaw2MgVD5nFdDFrduOCC2c11X) Norwegian Airline director and former USAF Colonel, gives USAF headquarters information about two radar locations and a rocket firing incident observed in the Petsamo region (Pechengsky District) of Finland, recently ceded to Russia. Gen. [Alfred A. Kessler Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/106572/major-general-alfred-a-kessler-jr/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728339477&usg=AOvVaw0TIQFpK1HpnTsJjxP_h3pi), former US military attaché in Sweden, disputes Therien’s information. He says only two ghost rocket sightings are possibly factual, but there is no evidence to authenticate them. (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1947](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Aug-1-Dec-31-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728339738&usg=AOvVaw3eStDabz8rUGRqkEK67xaE) [August 1st–December 31st, Supplemental Notes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-Aug-1-Dec-31-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728340008&usg=AOvVaw13c4Yiwq7agb312y5VJbe1), The Author, 2001, p. 76)

October 14 — Test pilot [Chuck Yeager](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chuck_Yeager&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728340308&usg=AOvVaw32JPW1QSFwBYMYKy4SVVp2) unofficially breaks the sound barrier (670 mph) for the first time in an experimental rocket-powered Bell X-1 at Muroc \[now Edwards\] AFB, California. (Wikipedia, “[Chuck Yeager](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chuck_Yeager&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728340582&usg=AOvVaw3HX9i0rq_fRpYOZXa6GIQ2)”)

October 20 — A farmer named Britton sees two cigar-shaped UFOs traveling a straight course at high speed about one mile in height in trail formation near Dayton, Ohio. They leave a slight vapor trail then disappear suddenly. (NICAP, “[Farmers Observes Two Cigars](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/471020dayton_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728340856&usg=AOvVaw0fT7JHjfpD-IkR0W5ab0ci)”; Keyhoe, FSTS, p. 89; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728341061&usg=AOvVaw1K_IKPzzRp_o2G4s-nsAVP), p. 29)

October 21 — A preliminary EEI document, indicating that the radar detection of UFOs near Fukuoka, Japan, on September 16 has played a role in concerns about disc maneuverability, is circulated to the European Command by Lieut. Col. [Malcolm D. Seashore](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49311334/malcolm-d-seashore&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728341342&usg=AOvVaw10iB-MUl9nYLrC4SxAl-RG)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49311334/malcolm-d-seashore&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728341526&usg=AOvVaw37dewOxfkxk5hHurOsAIVS) former acting chief of the Analysis Section at AMC under [McCoy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/colonel-howard-mccoy-and-mj-12.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728341794&usg=AOvVaw27P7eN8mcog6RYKg4Qr6G8). It expresses concern about German/Russian technology and adds disc characteristics of hovering, disappearance, quick grouping, and sudden appearance. (“[‘Flying Disc’ Information Request to European Command, October](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/471021.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728342003&usg=AOvVaw3yunM9EAhiaVIEvmCDbsIv) [1947](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/471021.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728342191&usg=AOvVaw3JwgCs3kK0atkRRsy8QImT)”; Michael D. Swords, “Project Sign and the Estimate of the Situation,” JUFOS 7 (2000): 35; Swords 43, 479–484)

October 21 — The jet-propelled Northrop YB-49 makes its first test flight from Jack Northrop Field in Hawthorne, California, reaching Muroc AFB in 32 minutes. (Wikipedia, “[Northrop YB-49](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northrop_YB-49&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728342533&usg=AOvVaw3PEzqacyex99kIT2Y0aRzm)”)

October 28 — Brig. Gen. [George F. Schulgen](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.generals.dk/general/Schulgen/George_Francis/USA.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728342836&usg=AOvVaw0fRsqbkSzCYrigy-crcMKA)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.generals.dk/general/Schulgen/George_Francis/USA.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728343013&usg=AOvVaw0gRBIy6OnIJxlACKTWBCmM) Chief of USAF Intelligence Requirements Division, writes a five-page report based on the characteristics listed in the September 23 [Twining](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nathan_Farragut_Twining&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728343220&usg=AOvVaw0Im38jBI0ffSXBVVBuHPT5) letter (though in greater detail) and the preliminary EEI of October 21. Titled “Intelligence Requirements on Flying Saucer Type Aircraft: Draft of Collection Memorandum,” it lists things investigators should try to determine about UFO propulsion, control, construction, arrangement, landing gear, and power plant. It considers the objects “to be a manned aircraft, of Russian origin, and based on the perspective thinking and actual accomplishments of the Germans” (page 5, paragraph 4). \[However, a fake version of this document has the phrase “it is the considered opinion of some elements that the object may in fact represent an interplanetary craft of some kind…. The presence of an unconventional or unusual type of propulsion system cannot be ruled out and should be considered of great interest.” Other deletions and additions are present in the fake document.\] (George F. Schulgen, “[Intelligence](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/schulgen.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728343577&usg=AOvVaw1FunmR0DmveOl6VzXCOacD) [Requirements on Flying Saucer Type Aircraft: Draft of Collection Memorandum,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/schulgen.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728343782&usg=AOvVaw2YsdUY67NXlYgFl-mkirZi)” October 30, 1947 \[[PDF](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/schulgen.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728343969&usg=AOvVaw34FH5b4tdWTXhCFA2nqWkT) of real memo, pp. 1–6, [PDF](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/schulgen.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728344181&usg=AOvVaw0Em8iOa7MZRsiOdRBDT38o) of fake memo, pp. 7–12\]; RosRept, [p. 35](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/books/The_Roswell_ReportR2.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728344412&usg=AOvVaw3pVX7N-oNrNx-ax7Oi3ayy); Good Above, [p. 262](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/262/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728344618&usg=AOvVaw2DMwzu0YsO6aHkuGX-VikY); Robert G. Todd, “[Fake Air](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.roswellfiles.com/FOIA/SchulgenMemo.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728344844&usg=AOvVaw3RpQvKi_fa8A4iaWuSHXiJ)
