Craigie, after his retirement from the Air Force in 1955, indicates that he believes UFOs are a waste of time and only approved Project Sign because of internal USAF politics. (Joel Carpenter)

1948

1948 — David T. Keating, an employee of the USAF Nuclear Energy for the Propulsion of Aircraft group, is flying with the 166th Fighter Squadron of the Ohio National Guard out of Lockbourne AFB \[now Rickenbacker Air National Guard Base\] in Lockbourne, Ohio. While executing a flip of his P-51 at 18,000 feet, he sees a silvery disc zoom above his plane. He goes in pursuit of it at 325 mph and closes to within 240 feet of it. It seems to be 40 feet in diameter and 6 feet thick, with a vertical stabilizer rudder on the end. He keeps flying after it even when he loses sight of it. “About 10 miles south of the Ohio River,” he claims, “I spotted litter on a hillside and a path that had obviously been ripped up by a crashing plane.” Short on fuel, he returns to Lockbourne. He persuades his major to fly over the crash scene, and they send a truck to retrieve the remains. (Helen Knox, “Ridge Newcomer Tells of Game of Tag with ‘Saucer,’” The Oak Ridger, September 18, 1950; Clark III 325)

1948 — An airman stationed in Arizona is called out with a scientific team to examine a flying saucer that has crashed near Taos, New Mexico. When he arrives, the area is roped off and under military guard. The object is metallic with a flat circular airfoil. The cabin at the top center is too small for a normal-sized human. He is told by workers on the scene that bodies of “little men” have been removed from the craft. They discover that the ship is constructed of interlocking sections pinned together, but they cannot locate a power plant, except possibly some electromagnets below the cabin. (L. J\[ames\] Lorenzen, “[Aimé Michel’s Orthotenic Lines,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201958%252007%252000%2520-%2520July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728359066&usg=AOvVaw0jMEuB3mKgf2GRkAYgJECm)” APRO Bulletin, July 1958, pp. 6–7; Clark III 325)

1948 — British author and ex-MI5 operative [Bernard Newman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bernard_Newman_(author)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728359419&usg=AOvVaw1e9I23ZB_iLMOMwJjwsE8P) publishes a novel titled The Flying Saucer, the first book to use that phrase in its title. The story revolves around a group of scientists who create a fake Martian threat in order to bring the world together. Plot elements include a trio of staged saucer crashes (in New Mexico, Russia, and the UK), propaganda, and even an alien autopsy. (Bernard Newman, The Flying Saucer, Gollancz, 1948; Andrew May, “[The Flying Saucer,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://forteana-blog.blogspot.com/2013/06/the-flying-saucer.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728359837&usg=AOvVaw0OWwAvCZHJntL1nNOQmy7S)” Retro-Forteana, June 30, 2013; Kremlin 43–45)

1948? — Sylvia Hall, 11, wakes up at her home on the corner of Riggs Road and Lateral 1 Road south of Yakima, Washington, when her bedroom fills with bluish-white light pouring in through the closed west window. Some 100 feet above the ground is a huge bright cloud. Gliding down from it in groups of four on something like a ramp are tall people with bluish-silvery robes. She watches them for 10 minutes, then she has an overpowering desire to go back to bed. She tells no one about the experience until she is an adult. (Greg Long, “Strangeness at Yakima,” IUR 19, no. 4 (July/Aug. 1994): 16–17)

January 6 — 3:00 p.m. [Bernice Zaikowski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/70010841/bernice-mary-zaikowski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728360297&usg=AOvVaw3zbrSSqRL_ERpSkjF0pDvK), 61, of Chehalis, Washington, hears a “sizzling and whizzing” sound and looks up to see a “birdman” hovering 200 feet above her barn. She watches “a man equipped with long silver wings fastened over the shoulders with a strap” ascend rapidly, hover, bank, then fly away. “He flew in an upright position and appeared to be manipulating controls strapped to his chest.” The wings do not flap; instead they retract close to his body during ascent, and are extended to hover or proceed in horizontal flight. Zaikowski says

([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728361740&usg=AOvVaw3I-7YT6EXsTssA8mY5a9Jq)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728361895&usg=AOvVaw0oYSWbtffMZhrh8bY0WEvu) p. 30)

January 7 — 2:50 p.m. Capt. [Thomas F. Mantell Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/14958603/thomas-francis-mantell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728362168&usg=AOvVaw2DtXXulBVP6EDfB8uQ-EIO)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/14958603/thomas-francis-mantell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728362343&usg=AOvVaw1dj36VBE1ayk9fBLahKqZ8) a 25-year-old Kentucky Air National Guard pilot, and three others are flying F-51D fighters to Louisville, Kentucky. After Mantell reports his position to Standiford Field in Louisville, Tech/Sgt. [Quinton A. Blackwell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/39533254/quinton-a_-blackwell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728362568&usg=AOvVaw3_-vO4x61oolgYDhkQeqmT) at Godman Army Airfield at Fort Knox breaks in over the radio to request Mantell to intercept and identify the object. The object maintains a constant angular position as seen from Godman as it apparently moves away at about 240–300 mph at an altitude of 50,000–60,000 feet during most of Mantell’s pursuit. Flying at 300 mph and gradually climbing to about 22,000–23,000 feet, Mantell gradually overtakes the UFO from below, past Bowling Green, Kentucky, at about 3:10 p.m. In one of his last radio reports, Mantell says the UFO “appears to be a metallic object or possibly reflection of sun from a metallic object, and it is of tremendous size.” At 3:15 p.m., at 22,500 feet with oxygen running low, two other F-51Ds quit the chase.

Mantell continues to 25,000, blacks out, and crashes at 3:18 p.m. about 4 miles south-southwest of Franklin, Kentucky. The UFO disappears from view behind a cloud at Godman at 3:50 p.m. The Project Sign staff, still not yet formally organized, are under pressure to come up with some kind of answer, so they quickly float Venus (offhandedly suggested by Ohio State University astronomer [J. Allen Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728362941&usg=AOvVaw1r2-hdEYpNzXqvrunCCTXV)) as an explanation. This implausible explanation is not even believed by the Air Force, but it remains unchallenged for several years. In 1952, [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728363178&usg=AOvVaw3iLjaCAbroJVLZ5R_rCaF0) reopens the case and identifies the object as a secret Skyhook balloon, although he cannot confirm a launch that day. Army veteran [Clifford Stone](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufology.fandom.com/wiki/Clifford_Stone&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728363425&usg=AOvVaw03J3oGxK1DARvauS7A72-c) finds later that there had been no Skyhook launches since late December.

However, [Barry J. Greenwood](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Barry_J_Greenwood.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728363728&usg=AOvVaw3Vw5wrV_Jkysf4H7wmXhlZ) and [Robert Todd](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2007/04/robert-todd-is-gone.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728363962&usg=AOvVaw1QhrH9qMVgzbUfD3XPd5WZ) tentatively identify the balloon as one launched from Camp Ripley near Little Falls, Minnesota, on January 6. (Wikipedia, “[Mantell UFO incident](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mantell_UFO_incident&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728364204&usg=AOvVaw0EGcoPaWP-dBcU3qUYBQe3)”; NICAP, “[The Mantell](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/480107fortknox_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728364394&usg=AOvVaw1n3dHVWM07U5sQe0o6PdQ-) [Case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/480107fortknox_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728364586&usg=AOvVaw0I_e5qZAWqMstdNRmnFtE5)”; Clark III 706–710; Ruppelt, [p. 31](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/30/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728364799&usg=AOvVaw0ti6pZuzojGVqNxrH1Ray0); Good Above, [pp. 262–263](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/262/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728364998&usg=AOvVaw2fBWCL-OD1W4pWH9nrJHEQ); Good Need, [pp. 104–105](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/104/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728365206&usg=AOvVaw3ZSOMPxxgU4-GmE-4d8GOn); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728365390&usg=AOvVaw20m7SHrGo7oICZz58zsTcD), pp. 30– 31; Michael D. January 7 — 4:45–7:06 p.m. USAF 1Lt. [Paul I. Orner](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8773157/paul-i-orner&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728368705&usg=AOvVaw15BoaxCxGrgQzSPLPN4WAk) tracks an unidentified white light with red coloration in a weather theodolite at Godman Army Airfield in Fort Knox, Kentucky, for more than 2 hours. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728368946&usg=AOvVaw2_t_04lAn0z-d20B7BqDA7)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728369107&usg=AOvVaw0DFm5iY7WfLK6n6BpgDD6W) p. 31)

January 7 — 7:15 p.m. Air Traffic Controller and pilot [Alex A. Boudreaux](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/65980757/alex-a-boudreaux&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728369378&usg=AOvVaw1fz26nkj4ISuYA1CCtmc6e) and VHF Direction-Finding (DF) Operator and amateur astronomer [Frank M. Eisele](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/86972303/frank-m-eisele&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728369671&usg=AOvVaw07SomCx3DyfYSoOLg9bvZ6)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/86972303/frank-m-eisele&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728369889&usg=AOvVaw3PV1DbzMx-WipcSEf4KFS0) 103rd AACS Squadron, at Lockbourne AFB \[now Rickenbacker Air National Guard Base\] in Lockbourne, Ohio, spot a bright object to the southwest of the airfield that appears and disappears intermittently. Fighter pilot USAF Capt. [Charles E. McGee](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_McGee_(pilot)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728370113&usg=AOvVaw1EOMFRsVaLoY-2RNDJIw0X) sees the object on runway 23 landing approach when he is at about 1,800 feet. The light seems to be at about 3,000 feet to the southwest about 4–5 miles away, then later on the ground to the west about 6–7 miles away. USAF VHF DF Operator and pilot Albert

R. Pickering, Detachment 733, 103rd AACS Squadron, is awakened by the sudden emergence of a lighted amber- colored round or oval object about the size of a C-47 or larger \[60+ feet\] dropping out of the overcast bank 10,000 feet overhead. Lockbourne Control Tower at the same time radios a report of the object, which then maneuvers over to Commercial Point about 3–5 miles away to the west-southwest, then makes three full 360° circles over one spot in 30-40 seconds per turn over the runway, at a speed of more than 500 mph, leaving a luminous, amber- colored trail or exhaust about 5 times its length. Then the UFO goes to another location and does more 360°

* * *

turns. At one point, it disappears into the overcast for one minute, then reappears. Just before departing, it hovers or “appeared to touch down” on the grass extension past the end of the Lockbourne AFB runway for 10 seconds then leaves at 120° (ESE) heading into the overcast. It is also sighted by the pilot of a C-45 at 5,000 feet off the right wing at 7:53 p.m. (NICAP, “[Object Circles Base at High Speed / Touches Down](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/480107lockbourne_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728370884&usg=AOvVaw1zIurEApKkQQINK_AYGno0)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728371202&usg=AOvVaw32P9do1rmh0BzJv0ougX5f)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728371456&usg=AOvVaw3EGNDUxBUnVbPs13ugUvZ2) p. 32)

January 7 — 7:35 p.m. Base personnel at Clinton County AFB \[now Wilmington Air Park\] near Wilmington, Ohio, where Skyhooks are launched a couple years later, watch a quickly maneuvering object. It dances up and down and changes from red to green before speeding to the southwest. Sgt. LeRoy Ziegler thinks he can detect a faint exhaust trail. Project Sign calls it Venus, because it disappears about the time Venus does. (NICAP, “[Object](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/480107lockbourne_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728371955&usg=AOvVaw1hMkz2RsrIKOKuPyap99Ci) [Circles Base at High Speed / Touches Down](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/480107lockbourne_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728372295&usg=AOvVaw3KIMnf2yKvz0Lq6kswv2R5)”; NICAP, “[Part 2-11: ‘…Was Not the Planet Venus,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/mantell/mantell_part_2_11.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728372639&usg=AOvVaw3c6a2Iw-1Nq3X8_PeVCSqJ)” June 4, 2006)

January 9 — 11:30 p.m. Eastern Airlines pilot [Hugh DuBose](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/196415297/hugh-chester-dubose&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728373151&usg=AOvVaw1FsyzcAt_BEmirRuWOkOyE), flying a DC-3 aircraft at 3,000 feet altitude near Cartersville, Georgia, observes a circular object with a flat top cross his flight path at the same altitude and then turn earthward. The object is light sky-blue in color and is traveling at an estimated speed of 400 mph. (NICAP, “[Object Passes DC-3, Turns](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/480109cartersville_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728373540&usg=AOvVaw1eXk7-PXHjbGnpnEH42HvY)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728373859&usg=AOvVaw3HIio9514BSZQDl4yGEAkk)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728374113&usg=AOvVaw3UXnpmQ2FpLD2EiQahG1bR) p. 32)

January 21 — Col. [Riley F.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.generals.dk/general/Ennis/Riley_Finley/USA.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728374573&usg=AOvVaw348zeDJmXQSriMWxZcRhlk) [Ennis](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.wilsoncenter.org/blog-post/all-feasible-means&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728374914&usg=AOvVaw0V7CBZ3bGiwOB890h5sk9O), chief of the Army Intelligence Division, in a memo reiterates the [Schulgen](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.generals.dk/general/Schulgen/George_Francis/USA.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728375275&usg=AOvVaw11v7vtmE63Rg5KBjQ-aFYG) Draft of Collection Memorandum and stresses the need to investigate Soviet development of a jet-propelled flying wing aircraft. (Department of the Army, “[Unconventional Aircraft,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/hort1.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728375720&usg=AOvVaw2zsm7oqdWxz3Ru2axu-xXh)” Intelligence Collection Memorandum number 7, January 21, 1948)

January 22 — Project Sign officially launches at Wright Field. The primary investigators are Capt. [Robert R. Sneider](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49319130/robert-raphael-sneider&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728376218&usg=AOvVaw23rbnExG8TS8zX7saoEckP) (project chief), [Alfred Loedding](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/209268646/alfred-christian-loedding&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728376651&usg=AOvVaw3Ne1lnhyG6IwwuvXe68Bas) (T-3 engineer), [Lawrence Truettner](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/58335429/lawrence-hess-truettner&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728377062&usg=AOvVaw0fHNcR3JhB1ggrhgs99rG5) (T-2 engineer), and Col. [Albert Deyarmond](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Ori-ahvZRlU/VWjL8ELOjzI/AAAAAAAALts/kwi03CO17vE/s1600/Deyarmond%252BAlbert%252B7pictures%252B%252528dragged%252529.jpg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728377556&usg=AOvVaw0tgnt4hmcek8fwkmVTxfeN) (analyst in Intelligence Analysis Division). Also involved are Maj. [Raymond Llewellyn](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/124634808/raymond-anderson-llewellyn&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728377897&usg=AOvVaw2wAmtdYZtq-NdktiwHOahI) (chief of special projects branch), Lt. Howard W. Smith, [George W. Towles](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/59257302/george-w_-towles&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728378187&usg=AOvVaw20uUDTK9quyErxGDjpKSO4), and others as assigned. How much interest Col. [Howard](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/colonel-howard-mccoy-and-mj-12.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728378411&usg=AOvVaw1dvvAFhBiB9drdqWT7T0-t) [McCoy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/colonel-howard-mccoy-and-mj-12.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728378653&usg=AOvVaw3UCHs2qPDg6LYCOlaMRoE0) takes in the project is unknown. Its task is to collect, collate, evaluate, and distribute information on sightings in the atmosphere “which can be considered of concern to national security.” [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728379015&usg=AOvVaw1lYcFOHWeTRHLmK1dJ8QcP) later says that to be considered an “unknown,” it has to come from a competent observer and contain a reasonable amount of data. (Michael D. Swords, “Project Sign and the Estimate of the Situation,” JUFOS 7 (2000): 36–37; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728379545&usg=AOvVaw1-HZel-AI_kSl5UfRmaLaq)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728379797&usg=AOvVaw2WIZjZomxQpQj4MgyKCNVW) p. 11; Ruppelt, [p. 10](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/10/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728380140&usg=AOvVaw1cBzJMz7kFFSUjkPX_2x8W); NICAP, “[Project Sign Begins, 22 Jan 1948](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/waves/480122SIGNinit.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728380467&usg=AOvVaw31oTOls7XeEl6_d1IbyEel)”; Michael David Hall and Wendy Ann Connors, “Alfred Loedding: New Insight on the Man behind Project Sign,” IUR 23, no. 4 (Winter 1998): 24)

January 23 — Col. [William E. January 26 — Project Sign becomes formally operational as Project HT-304. Lt. Col. James C. Beam becomes its first project director. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728382701&usg=AOvVaw17Cf_BdtYeUb0pv2eFtR9i)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728382938&usg=AOvVaw2oHcx75V4pHVbam2qqZNDX) p. 13)

January 31 — The Research and Development Board dismisses flying saucers as “a mirage induced by mass self- hypnosis” in stories that appear in newspapers of this day. (“‘Flying Discs’ Book Declared Closed,” Pendleton East Oregonian, January 31, 1948; Project 1947, “[UFO Reports, 1948](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1948a.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728383380&usg=AOvVaw2FbNQGHXrs9DVoUFvCaqVV)”; Swords 52–53)

February — 2:00 a.m. Glancing out his window while getting a drink of water, farmer C. Bruce Stevenson notices a bight orange-amber glow near his farm buildings a few miles from Circleville, Ohio. He expects to find the buildings on fire, but instead there is a large, domed flying saucer gliding silently over the roof of his pig house about 100 feet away. The UFO, about 60 feet in diameter, maintains a slow speed and low altitude until it disappears from sight. (“[Bruce Stevenson Reveals](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92806196/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728383730&usg=AOvVaw0ctg7p0168sSmFYUIdSKQ7) [Close-Up View of Saucer,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92806336/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728383926&usg=AOvVaw2EMfAQVNJNtm82-UYiTFtz)” Circleville (Ohio) Herald, August 2, 1952, pp. 1–2; “[Bruce Stevenson Certain Saucer Wasn’t Reflection,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92806529/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728384278&usg=AOvVaw1-3TxP2NqMV1K2HZdhFl4a)” Circleville (Ohio) Herald, August 7, 1952, p. 1; Project 1947, “[UFO Reports, 1948](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1948a.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728384568&usg=AOvVaw3w7SwIteNHCh2JsIuUAMJn)”; Pete Hartinger, “America’s First Classic Close Encounter,” Pickaway Quarterly, Fall 1996, pp. 11–13)

February 4 — Capt. [Richard W. Geuss](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/693651/richard-william-geuss&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728385002&usg=AOvVaw3wAY5pgphkeaDmHEu-i-7f), acting assistant adjutant general, writes a memo on behalf of Lieut. Gen. [George](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_E._Stratemeyer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728385291&usg=AOvVaw3M2qgViQtSX_5cmd1TdQF_)

[E. Stratemeyer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_E._Stratemeyer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728385647&usg=AOvVaw2chFOrWitJnIjXzxauszI3)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_E._Stratemeyer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728385910&usg=AOvVaw3lIOhJE1ou1BNnoojMYZdK) to ADC and USAF commanding generals on “Investigation and Reporting of ‘Flying Disc’ Incidents.” It specifies that Air Force commanders are charged with evaluating military UFO incidents, in cooperation with CIC personnel and local FBI offices. Even hoaxes are to be passed on to the FBI. (Capt. Richard W. Geuss, “[Investigation and Reporting of ‘Flying Disc’ Incidents,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/480204investigation_reporting.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728386296&usg=AOvVaw3s1JuYuB7xecQnRiemz_IT)” February 4, 1948)

February 12 —Brig. Gen. [Charles P. Cabell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_P._Cabell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728386724&usg=AOvVaw0hCKtwr_OvqYzgdmz6N0pf)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_P._Cabell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728386982&usg=AOvVaw3g9RTbwa4H9rAh60wyPkjK) chief of the Air Intelligence Requirements Division, sends a secret memo to Maj. Gen. [Samuel E. Anderson.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Samuel_E._Anderson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728387315&usg=AOvVaw1-58a8ujkVmK6R8DEeEqv3) director of Plans and Operations, stating that the Commanding General of AMC feels that the responsibility for collecting information on “flying disks” should be complemented by a requirement that all USAF installations “provide a minimum of one each aircraft, with necessary crews, on a continuous alert basis. These aircraft should be equipped with gun camera, and such armament as deemed advisable, in order to

* * *

secure photographs necessary to the obtainment of all possible data on any reported and sighted unusual phenomena, of the ‘flying disk’ type, in the atmosphere.” (Good Above, [p. 263](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/262/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728387754&usg=AOvVaw0m7ChviqiIL2wkX_jnCQhW))

February 18 — 5:00 p.m. A smoke trail begins over Nebraska and runs south. A bolide explodes over Norcatur, Kansas, and the concussion from the blast breaks windows and rocks buildings over a wide area of Kansas, Nebraska, and Oklahoma. A huge shower of meteoritic stones fall over a large area of Norton County, Kansas, and Furnas County, Nebraska. Two Army B-29 bombers circle the area until nightfall. A farmer near Stockton, Kansas, sees a hovering object that leaves a bare spot in the ground. [Kenneth Arnold](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenneth_Arnold&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728388050&usg=AOvVaw0LdctFsWOYeZTLJl20VGxA) is persuaded that reports of the Norton County meteorite fall might actually have been UFO-related. Astronomer [Lincoln LaPaz](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lincoln_LaPaz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728388290&usg=AOvVaw3wbQklF5SKgzUSHY2TtSpF) directs the recovery of the massive achondritic meteorite in 1948. More than 100 stones are recovered, including one weighing about one ton. (Wikipedia, “[Norton County (meteorite)](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Norton_County_(meteorite)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728388560&usg=AOvVaw1C3yXHtqdPlvw-XYmqQTkB)”; “[Norton County,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Norton_County_(meteorite)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728388872&usg=AOvVaw3hetuvETRnsiJ9sttzA2Z8)” Meteorite Recon, October 8, 2015; Luna

Meteorite Hunters, “[Norton County, KS Fall 18FEB1948 More Than 60 Years Ago,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://lunarmeteoritehunters.blogspot.com/2009/02/norton-county-ks-fall-18feb1948-more.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728389310&usg=AOvVaw2I_x9Xhnv5G0pqSxlZq_ix)” February 26, 2009; Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1948](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1948.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728389554&usg=AOvVaw1-Gq8-NiTmRKywgL0bUr44)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1948.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728389733&usg=AOvVaw1RcPMI9UlA5I6osMuFCzvP) The Author, 1988, pp. 15–16; Michael D. Swords, “Project Sign and the Estimate of the Situation,” JUFOS 7 (2000): 37–40)

February 20 — 2:00 a.m. In Palm Beach, Florida, lawyer and writer [Charles Francis Coe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://prabook.com/web/charles_francis.coe/1076827&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728390191&usg=AOvVaw1dRNQzV6tEAT2AwbR3CNlQ) and his son Alan see a globe of light shooting across the sky to the northeast at terrific speed. Coe calls it a “ray or blob of light” and insists it is not a meteor. (“[Mystery ‘Globe’ Seen by Editor,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92800368/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728390557&usg=AOvVaw2CaMElJ5VrUzoyq3U5snU4)” Palm Beach (Fla.) Post, February 21, 1948, p. 1; “True Mystic Experiences,” Fate 1, no. 3 (Fall 1948): 105–113; Kenneth Arnold and Ray Palmer, The Coming of the Saucers, Palmer, 1952, p. 139)

February 20 — 1:15 p.m. Six surveyors, including Idaho Power Company surveyor [E. G. Hall](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.pinterest.com/pin/250653535486425230/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728391044&usg=AOvVaw02rojPFk6zuCSiBOTUkzvY), see a small flat, heart- shaped UFO flying in the sky at Emmett, Idaho. Through his theodolite it looks fuzzy across its back edge as if “dipped in cream.” He says it was about the size of a Piper Cub airplane and flying point first below the cloud level at between 2,000 and 4,000 feet. (Emmett (Idaho) Messenger, February 26, 1948; Kenneth Arnold, “Are Space Visitors Here?” Fate 1, no. 2 (Summer 1948): 13)

March 3 — Maj. Gen. [Samuel E. Anderson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Samuel_E._Anderson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728391626&usg=AOvVaw29X5_HM5DaoaTVHc7oKp09), USAF Director of Plans and Operations at the Pentagon, rejects a proposal by Col. [Howard McCoy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/colonel-howard-mccoy-and-mj-12.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728391943&usg=AOvVaw2L82v2TX4IkSgF2tP1EJm6) and Brig. Gen. [Charles P. Cabell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_P._Cabell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728392187&usg=AOvVaw0LsWVyal-9KZtCkYfJP_lw) for stationing fighter aircraft at all bases on continuous alert for UFOs. It costs too much and proper interceptions are unlikely. He orders all bases to send UFO information to Wright-Patterson AFB in Ohio. (Maj. Gen. S. E. Anderson, “[Flying Discs,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/480303AFdoc.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728392429&usg=AOvVaw3ZQoDevSZ5eFOmn2BFseNb)” March 3, 1948; Good Above, [pp. 263–264](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/262/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728392664&usg=AOvVaw1gMDg4VR8580mKvphGeHGp))

March 12 — Maj. [Earl S. Browning Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/123116993/earl-staten-browning&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728392949&usg=AOvVaw1Jh4QWAVsZTra1xElo-gYW), in a memo to the European command of the 970th CIC, writes that the [Horten](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Horten_brothers&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728393235&usg=AOvVaw2_WDb-e9_CsUPkjRakxMyS) [brothers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Horten_brothers&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728393604&usg=AOvVaw2xnQFdJq8bBsQzxxr47xDL) have been located and interrogated by US officials. Walter Horten has remained in Germany as an officer in the German Air Force. He thinks that sufficient types of flying wing prototypes existed when the Russians invaded Germany and may have served as models for flying discs. Reimar Horten had emigrated to Argentina when the war ended. (Jacobsen, Area 51, [p. 43](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/42/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728394076&usg=AOvVaw2TKkGzaeHfW0zLqQBg-FNa))

March 17 — Memo on “Flying Discs” from Maj. Gen. [George C. McDonald](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/106278/major-general-george-c-mcdonald/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728394383&usg=AOvVaw0j2Xmlr8HWhaQCtuesQgVP)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/106278/major-general-george-c-mcdonald/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728394599&usg=AOvVaw1QsuhwP3w3TMl4pZ3J2WaF) director of USAF intelligence, to the AMC commander, considers Col. [McCoy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/colonel-howard-mccoy-and-mj-12.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728394826&usg=AOvVaw3Q1lUAn1XIA5PdV0Qk-HoQ)’s proposal to maintain fighters on alert for UFOs “unfeasible.” (Maj. Gen.

George C. McDonald, “[Flying Discs,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/mcdonald.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728395140&usg=AOvVaw21HBa6Bmqicfl644rlpE74)” March 17, 1948)

March 17–18 — The USAF Scientific Advisory Board meets in Room 3E-869 of the Pentagon, with physicist [Theodore](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Theodore_von_K%25C3%25A1rm%25C3%25A1n&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728395568&usg=AOvVaw3_iPIQoPlq8tHA1rxPCKTU) [von Kármán](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Theodore_von_K%25C3%25A1rm%25C3%25A1n&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728395889&usg=AOvVaw0lXqPffqy52b6Lpe3yfp4x) presiding. Col. [McCoy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/colonel-howard-mccoy-and-mj-12.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728396287&usg=AOvVaw0HlBc-uqu4giB_2W-5r0m4) is present and speaks briefly about Project Sign, saying it has over 300 reports, many of them from experienced observers: “I can’t even tell you how much we would give to have one of those crash in an area so that we could recover whatever they are.” (Howard McCoy, “[Scientific Advisory Board](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/afsab.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728396678&usg=AOvVaw0Ch1R6MN_5rbv50B1qyEa1) [Conference Held 17–18 March 1948, Room 3E-869, the Pentagon, Washington, D.C.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/afsab.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728396974&usg=AOvVaw0iKlY4h-vQo7QL99LnT1x-)”)

March 23 — RAF pilot [John Cunningham](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Cunningham_(RAF_officer)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728397266&usg=AOvVaw1Y9JS3YqWjGd4oadtj81Ya) reaches an altitude of 59,430 feet in a de Havilland Vampire turbojet. (Wikipedia, “[John Cunningham (RAF officer)](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Cunningham_(RAF_officer)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728397519&usg=AOvVaw2va5GqNKoL37G_W0P5sXR2)”)

March 25 — 5:00 a.m. According to writer [Frank Scully](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Scully&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728397778&usg=AOvVaw3pn2sUZrCxx3kXXuZlfYD2), who hears the tale from a scientist he refers to as “Dr. Gee” and a Texas oilman, a UFO crashes on a rocky plateau off Hart Canyon Road east of Aztec, New Mexico. When Air Force investigators and government scientists arrive on the scene, they crawl through a broken porthole and find the bodies of 16 small humanlike beings (3–3.5 feet tall) dressed in the “style of 1890.” Their skin is charred a chocolate color, apparently as a result of the rush of terrestrial air through the shattered window. After a thorough study, the scientists conclude that the “vehicle probably flew on magnetic lines of force.” Segments of the craft, as well as the bodies, are supposedly transported to Wright Field in Ohio. Dr. Gee, who claims to have been on the scene, said the UFO is likely from Venus, as Martians “would probably be three or four times as large as human beings.” Soon afterward, a crash occurs in Arizona and 16 bodies are taken from the wreckage. A third spaceship goes down near Phoenix with 2 dead occupants. The story turns out to be a hoax dreamed up by two con men named [Silas Newton](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/127850405/silas-mason-newton&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728398082&usg=AOvVaw259DBtN3XeGnzyWr1VOCtb) and [Leo GeBauer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/news-photo/leo-gebauer-and-silas-newton-flak-one-of-their-defense-news-photo/162001660&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728398374&usg=AOvVaw2oeJDoSpx1lzAjrJ91txEk) (“Dr. Gee,” although Scully claims this was a composite character incorporating 8 informants, one of whom is said to be geophysicist [Carl A. Heiland](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/205437488/carl-a_-heiland&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728398640&usg=AOvVaw1DNDDVWAdL13iUaae7YhsT)). The hoax is loosely based on

* * *

a 1949 science fiction film titled The Flying Saucer. GeBauer and especially Newton are in later years involved in various swindles and fraudulent mining claims. In 1987, [William S. Steinman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://rr0.org/people/s/SteinmanWilliamS.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728399033&usg=AOvVaw0NMfwmswUQXpH-FStjVof2) and [Wendelle C. Stevens](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.openminds.tv/wendelle-stevens-passes-214/5310&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728399306&usg=AOvVaw3TKs9O3UO82KJ2f2g0oVpf) release UFO Crash at Aztec, which draws on speculation, rumor, unnamed informants, and paranoia to defend and embellish the original story. The latest to champion the Aztec crash is a North Carolina man named [Scott](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.daily-times.com/story/archives/2015/03/28/ufo-authors-return-hart-canyon-67-years-after/75996314/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728399664&usg=AOvVaw11xaPGBA4ZSmxEQfjraeuD) [Ramsey](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.daily-times.com/story/archives/2015/03/28/ufo-authors-return-hart-canyon-67-years-after/75996314/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728399906&usg=AOvVaw1-wqz-T1JweSAdyCfwRwWH)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.daily-times.com/story/archives/2015/03/28/ufo-authors-return-hart-canyon-67-years-after/75996314/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728400121&usg=AOvVaw2kXmfBEUE56HWjcYV7VAxq) who with his wife Suzanne has spent thousands of dollars looking for and interviewing witnesses and trying to prove it involves a real UFO crash and coverup in his 2015 book The Aztec UFO Incident. Ramsey thinks the object was tracked on radar by Air Force Station P-8 near El Vado Dam. (Wikipedia, “[Aztec, New](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aztec%252C_New_Mexico_UFO_hoax&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728400409&usg=AOvVaw3gg34bV_G194uNzjpJK50u) [Mexico UFO hoax](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aztec%252C_New_Mexico_UFO_hoax&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728400621&usg=AOvVaw2aWqorAh3vG42e5lBIwjk-)”; Frank Scully, [Behind the Flying Saucers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/behindflyingsauc00scul&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728400854&usg=AOvVaw3rzR3zJXOtd_Hlcp2lJ69r)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/behindflyingsauc00scul&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728401130&usg=AOvVaw02uZLhVi5tp44fgVqdm4E5) Holt, 1950; J. P. Minshall, “Aztec, New Mexico—A Crash Story Reexamined,” IUR 16, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1991): 11–15, 23; Good Above, [pp. 388–394](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/388/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728403042&usg=AOvVaw2IZengcnYxyv7Sj5lAMoYv); Good Need,

[pp. 117–123](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/116/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728403315&usg=AOvVaw1KVIjMyXHqMFt2ODEUS7yy); Jerome Clark, [review of](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.scientificexploration.org/docs/26/jse_26_3_ReviewClark.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728403556&usg=AOvVaw1iJedXprtPw5xf_EEIArSX) [The Aztec Incident](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.scientificexploration.org/docs/26/jse_26_3_ReviewClark.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728403818&usg=AOvVaw0_Jn-DT5jUDYXqgcO4cm7o)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.scientificexploration.org/docs/26/jse_26_3_ReviewClark.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728404035&usg=AOvVaw3JYWV8TrGzKgdtVL-CEGee) in Journal of Scientific Exploration 26, no. 3 (2012): 709–716; Scott Ramsey, Suzanne Ramsey, and Frank Thayer, The Aztec UFO Incident, New Page, 2015; Curt Collins, “[Flying Saucer Swindlers: Silas Newton and the UFO Crash,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2018/10/scientist-predicts-et-contact-fbi.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728404432&usg=AOvVaw25e2Er_gh69rwRGv8foH6W)” The Saucers That Time Forgot, April 5, 2020)

Spring — [Ray Palmer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raymond_A._Palmer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728404763&usg=AOvVaw19ippCiWlw4QC3ZXFaJd1Z) and Flying magazine editor [Curtis Fuller](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://occulthealth.com/fuller-curtis-1912%25E2%2580%25931991/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728405055&usg=AOvVaw1L0weSNgClzq34_tX_RJXz) publish the first issue of Fate magazine at Clark Publishing Company in Chicago, Illinois. It features a first-hand story and a 30-page UFO roundup by [Kenneth](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenneth_Arnold&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728405371&usg=AOvVaw3qdwg569r1AyM5c07TB7zg) [Arnold](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenneth_Arnold&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728405571&usg=AOvVaw0JY5MSpGWe7V9Rii8U4l5r)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenneth_Arnold&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728405742&usg=AOvVaw2XwgMKT9OMm4cfYBaL9sy-) as well as a history of unconventional aircraft by Curtis Fuller. Palmer and Fuller use the shared pseudonym “Robert N. Webster.” The issue sells a healthy 50,000 copies. It is still being published in 2022. (Kenneth Arnold, “[I](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/fate-1948-1_202110/page/4/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728406105&usg=AOvVaw2aJYlTw96lOBXcfyzEdCa9) [Did](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/fate-1948-1_202110/page/4/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728406384&usg=AOvVaw0qE7UFT7DIaP_4UUlgHnzM) [See the Flying Disks!](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/fate-1948-1_202110/page/4/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728406681&usg=AOvVaw0Wvse75KfMWJ_SjnzsmTZc)” Fate 1, no. 1 (Spring 1948): 4–10; Kenneth Arnold, “[The](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/fate-1948-1_202110/page/18/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728407199&usg=AOvVaw1fM-kKCwan_j9HneXHByH6) [Mystery of the Flying Disks,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/fate-1948-1_202110/page/18/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728407555&usg=AOvVaw1U3pYRVXKQRLNtv8afNzx0)” Fate 1, no. 1 (Spring 1948): 18–48; Robert N. Webster \[Curtis Fuller\], “[What Were](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/fate-1948-1_202110/page/12/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728408047&usg=AOvVaw10erX22MxT_Qk1-1dK-vUp) [the ‘Doughnuts’?](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/fate-1948-1_202110/page/12/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728408456&usg=AOvVaw2g6Y36NZq9EOux7C4D1ka_)” Fate 1, no. 1 (Spring 1948): 12–17; Clark III 872)

Spring — [Kenneth Arnold](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenneth_Arnold&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728408920&usg=AOvVaw0wxBSBsRTnmi7_5awjsDhk) visits the Landing Aids Experiment Station in Arcata, California, and interviews [Kenneth W.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://history.lbl.gov/Publications/Currents/Archive/Sep-4-1998.html%23RTFToC12&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728409195&usg=AOvVaw31425U86SnrohoaTmhVAjA) [Ehlers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://history.lbl.gov/Publications/Currents/Archive/Sep-4-1998.html%23RTFToC12&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728409506&usg=AOvVaw1OJyBJSUDEjcvvA3di00Xy)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://history.lbl.gov/Publications/Currents/Archive/Sep-4-1998.html%23RTFToC12&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728409789&usg=AOvVaw0m1AqwOGUmJtyfgcNmg59b) a radar technician (and later physicist) working on airport operational systems, including radar. He has been accumulating information on unidentified radar targets (he calls them “gizmos”) that cannot be seen with the naked eye and sending reports on their flight paths to Navy meteorologist [Florence Van Straten](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Florence_van_Straten&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728410101&usg=AOvVaw0LRIU9RU9KwkzBabftyGUw) and [Luis Walter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luis_Walter_Alvarez&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728410353&usg=AOvVaw059O6KwrNVX5Ra7TO-k3Qc) [Alvarez](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luis_Walter_Alvarez&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728410576&usg=AOvVaw3RAQRL4WHnwMiFJds7WKwT)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luis_Walter_Alvarez&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728410755&usg=AOvVaw2ZnViIwlXs5FxfBLJO_mOQ) the inventor of Ground Control Approach System radar. In many cases, the target indicates a small solid target flying around 30 mph. The targets always fly in the same path from northwest to southeast, along the coast. Sometimes they come to a complete halt; at other times they split into two objects, merging later. Ehlers notes that the targets have been attributed to insects, but he is skeptical. Later, he suspects they might be plasmas occurring at the inversion layer, but that does not explain their behavior. (Wesley Price, “[The Sky Is Haunted,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/sim_saturday-evening-post_1948-03-06_220_36/page/n13/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728411023&usg=AOvVaw0ya-ToKStQDFYOqv07BHLy)” Saturday Evening Post 220, no. 36 (March 6, 1948): 13; Ray Palmer, “New Report on the Flying Saucers,” Fate 4, no. 1 (January 1951): 63–81; “[Landing Aids Experiment Station,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.taloa.org/2n-landing-aids-experiment-station&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728411357&usg=AOvVaw28LjxosKNlMwpyGP6qHX0R)” Transocean Air Lines; Greg Long, “In Search of Gizmos: A 1947 Radar Case,” IUR 19, no. 6 (Nov./Dec. 1994): 15–20)

Spring? — President [Truman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_S._Truman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728411787&usg=AOvVaw1k_M48atyN-UbY0dPv21LX) asks Col. [Robert B. Landry](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/106440/major-general-robert-b-landry/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728412167&usg=AOvVaw2qqGbPKBmCZCWXaHBpfLjv)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/106440/major-general-robert-b-landry/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728412533&usg=AOvVaw08hCsbLJR0vkJnfhPD5_9S) his USAF aide, to provide him with quarterly verbal reports on the state of UFO information and research. He does so to the end of 1952, with possibly 18 briefings in all. (James

R. Fuchs, “[Oral History Interview with Robert B. Landry,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.trumanlibrary.gov/library/oral-histories/landryr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728413075&usg=AOvVaw3zwvu-zAVLtavftDIVl8-n)” Harry S. Truman Library and Museum, February 28, 1974)

April — Morning. US Weather Bureau meteorologist Walter A. Minozewski at the Richmond, Virginia, weather station and his staff catch sight of a bright metallic, elliptical disc while they are tracking a small ceiling balloon at 15,000 feet. He checks his observation through a theodolite telescope. The disc flies just below the balloon and remains in sight for 15 seconds, appearing much bigger than the balloon. It has a flat, level bottom and a dome on top. It remains on a westward heading at high speed, then vanishes off into the distance. (Ruppelt, [p. 41](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/40/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728413624&usg=AOvVaw3lzuYKwWbrhaMEbfcCcIum); Bloecher, [p. I-1](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/waves/Wave47Rpt/ReportUFOWave1947_SectionI.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728414046&usg=AOvVaw1_2MaG1kISfkoQcZ0q3jdw))

April 1 — 9:55 a.m. USAF 1stLt. Robert W. Meyers is leading a flight of four P-47s from the 67th Fighter Group about 9 miles southeast of Sorsogon City, Luzon, Philippines. At 1,500 feet, he notices an unusual silvery object about 3 miles to the east. Shaped like a flying wing or half-moon with a “turtle back,” it resembles no military craft in use at the time. The object flies below the squadron at 200 mph and an altitude of about 1,000 feet. Meyers estimates it is about 30 feet wide and 20 feet long. When he attempts to contact the other three P-47s, he realizes his radio is dead. As he makes a 270° left turn to get a closer look, the object makes a 90° left turn and moves away at tremendous speed. It is only visible for about 5 seconds. (NICAP, “[P-47 Flight Encounters Half-Moon Object](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/480401philippines_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728414601&usg=AOvVaw2cgZfAWpiIHG3TniKukyAD)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728414918&usg=AOvVaw3j7lMTo8JvKjgRci7joW8d)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728415170&usg=AOvVaw2AlrtnFXN3RJl4n_bnaetr) p. 33)

April 5 — Afternoon. At Holloman AFB, near Alamogordo, New Mexico, three highly trained balloon observers (Joseph Olson, Johnson, and Chance) are working on a secret project for the Air Force’s Watson Laboratories. They see

* * *

two objects. One observer follows one object, and the others follow the second as they diverge. All are certain that the objects aren’t balloons. They are large, whitish, roundish, very high, faster than any aircraft, and perform rapid, erratic motions. One object is lost at a low altitude. The other goes up quickly and seems to just disappear. The observation lasts about 30 seconds. The case is deemed important enough to send [Alfred Loedding](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/209268646/alfred-christian-loedding&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728415929&usg=AOvVaw0ccXtu6itOe2DJM7f3yJFL) and one of [Clingerman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/113944251/william-r_-clingerman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728416392&usg=AOvVaw1CEYePCLzR5jKS2uoFxp_0)’s assistants, Lt. Col. James C. Beam (the head of Project Sign), to New Mexico to interview Project Mogul scientist James W. Peoples and the other witnesses. Unfortunately, they are gone when Sign arrives. (They are later interviewed at the USAF Watson Laboratory complex in Red Bank, New Jersey.) The witnesses are very sure of themselves and the case is classed as “Unidentified.” While at Holloman, Loedding and Beam talk with Lt. Herbert G. Markley, who has worked with the Watson team. Markley remembers one of them speaking of unusual radar returns from their equipment, but later the Watson personnel say that these were probably just “angels” (spurious echoes due to atmospheric microstructures, insects, equipment malfunction, or other stimuli). Markley does report that UFOs are seen around Holloman often. He himself has seen a disc in late August 1947 and flat, round aeroforms on at least two further occasions. (NICAP, “[Team Watches 35-Meter Disc](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/480405holloman_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728416848&usg=AOvVaw3OjgU14kUxiwTXlFHBht7f)”; Ruppelt, [p.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/70/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728417215&usg=AOvVaw3z4TKSFLYBT3d0aQgCm1Bq) [71](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/70/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728417571&usg=AOvVaw2rzed5GGCLS5YPgcnBpK8W); Michael D. Swords, “Project Sign and the Estimate of the Situation,” JUFOS 7 (2000): 40–41; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728418087&usg=AOvVaw1qLUGlbHT4ksU5IVj5-yfL)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728418336&usg=AOvVaw24rAzXh15Wedhb78RbdKfS) p. 33; Project 1947, “[Holloman AFB UFO Sightings](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/holloman/index.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728418641&usg=AOvVaw1ReTGLNYnr86tiSb2xzxVd)”)

April 9 — Viola Johnson of Longview, Washington, and another witness see three “flying men” circling the town. She says they are “dressed in khaki-colored flying suits with helmets over their faces.” (Clark III 777)

April 15 — 6:17 a.m. The X-Ray nuclear device is detonated near Enewetak Atoll in the Marshall Islands. B-17 pilotless drone aircraft are flown through the cloud, and a drone light tank is used to recover soil samples from the crater. Unfortunately, it becomes bogged and must be towed out 10 days later. (Wikipedia, “[Operation Sandstone](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Sandstone&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728419001&usg=AOvVaw1tjONc4ZMg_fbt4BDLLtVi)”)

April 23 — A preliminary 25-page report, written by Project Sign’s Col. [Howard McCoy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/colonel-howard-mccoy-and-mj-12.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728419298&usg=AOvVaw1OgS1uVn0K-gpzMO-YeAu2) and Lt. Col. James C. Beam, summarizes UFO reports received through February 1, with attached memos and documents. It is addressed to Chief of Staff [Hoyt Vandenberg](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hoyt_Vandenberg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728419540&usg=AOvVaw2xfy2Whpe9xb9gAlCrmiEt) and Director of Intelligence [Charles P. Cabell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_P._Cabell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728419786&usg=AOvVaw1yJ9Vv8cg7ecSBX0yQ1yJH). The Rhodes photos and 99 other cases are listed. A comment by chemist [Irving Langmuir](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Irving_Langmuir&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728419980&usg=AOvVaw3Y3GdMZQgAFXsIb3Yg025t) is appended, noting his doubts about the reality of flying discs. (Col. Howard M. McCoy, “[Project Sign,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/PrelimSignRpt23Apr1948.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728420209&usg=AOvVaw0xFkH_CQVVuiMMF6bcwPTM)” April 23, 1948; Swords 54–55)

April 27–28 — Physicist [Joseph Kaplan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Kaplan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728420469&usg=AOvVaw0TqXW_Jf7JDXIwVz2B0sAt), a member of the USAF Scientific Advisory Board, visits the Kirtland AFB Office of Special Investigations, AEC’s Sandia Base, and Los Alamos in New Mexico, under orders from [Theodore Von Kármán](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Theodore_von_K%25C3%25A1rm%25C3%25A1n&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728420687&usg=AOvVaw0_JQzZF7ZESQifB-hQ_6C1)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Theodore_von_K%25C3%25A1rm%25C3%25A1n&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728420864&usg=AOvVaw2j7yWoQwvdg4lWLlDTlsqX) chairman of the USAF Scientific Advisory Board, to review UFO reports and investigations from the area. Kaplan and [Lincoln LaPaz](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lincoln_LaPaz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728421074&usg=AOvVaw2tsngYxFPL-DAUVI4j8was) meet with security personnel at Los Alamos. Kaplan reports that “these occurrences relate to the National Defense of the United States” and should be investigated scientifically.” (Good Above, [p. 266](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/266/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728421315&usg=AOvVaw3gjZxWMqAYFQgCYZej6fp3))

May — An article on secret Skyhook balloons (without mentioning the project name) by [Devon Francis](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://books.google.com/books?id%3D3yEDAAAAMBAJ%26pg%3DPA30%26lpg%3DPA30%26dq%3D%2522Devon%252BFrancis%2522%252Bwriter%26source%3Dbl%26ots%3DIzdAVqBh3t%26sig%3DACfU3U1jXdvaejIiBIFywFJVygyCQNFasA%26hl%3Den%26sa%3DX%26ved%3D2ahUKEwi1k8TAsczmAhWQGs0KHdyUCyc4ChDoATABegQIChAB%2523v%253Donepage%26q%3D%2522Devon%2520Francis%2522%2520writer%26f%3Dfalse&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728421760&usg=AOvVaw13uB281JyZ-RYe4EkecWA8) is published in Popular Science. (Devon Francis, “[New Balloons Explore Roof of the Airways,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/mantell/Popular_Science_194805.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728422093&usg=AOvVaw3y8ST0JCOz27vdK9UvpGzr)” Popular Science, May 1948, pp. 98–104)

May 5 — An Efficiency Rating report is written up for [Alfred Loedding](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/209268646/alfred-christian-loedding&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728422430&usg=AOvVaw2Y_z9GBKH_ZVzM9ad0rNne) from [Miles E. Goll](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Goll_M.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728422668&usg=AOvVaw3VTghwBNlshQda0noLAWD-), which mentions his work as a monitor for Project Sign. (Miles E. Goll, “[Efficiency Rating of Mr. Alfred C. Loedding,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/loedd/sign_loeddingdoc1.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728423015&usg=AOvVaw1g1dUE4aHWqWkYtDjbD11m)” May 5, 1948)

May 7 — Afternoon. Mr. and [Mrs](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/87207324/evelyn-w_-kaiser&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728423524&usg=AOvVaw2nm-qdzrbBQPKJwAyzhxfq)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/87207324/evelyn-w_-kaiser&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728423841&usg=AOvVaw3GqTOAK59Be9rvqiXBntae) [Fordyce J. Kaiser](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/87207277/fordyce-justin-kaiser&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728424208&usg=AOvVaw2TZ8eb-Wdm7HoaGcPI4Ju4) and their housekeeper Jean Bray, at 251 W. Waldorf Avenue, Memphis, Tennessee, see 50–60 unusual objects, apparently moving very high and fast, traveling in straight lines with slight zigzagging. They are shiny like bright aluminum with silvery trails. Lt. Col. James C. Beam of Project Sign goes to investigate. On the way back, he consults with astronomer [Paul Herget](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_Herget&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728424483&usg=AOvVaw1LseG0uBbsQI1KG2hRj69B) of the Cincinnati Observatory in Ohio, who thinks the objects are meteors and recommends Ohio State University astronomer [J. Allen Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728424730&usg=AOvVaw2CfEgY6xppFvXNxHk_oVr1) in Columbus as a project consultant. (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1948](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1948.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728424978&usg=AOvVaw22mnXru2h-gvPD2zKftIZ3), The Author, 1988, pp. 28–29; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728425369&usg=AOvVaw34WjQa0WavDFUiomCSRIqo),

p. 34; Michael D. Swords, “Project Sign and the Estimate of the Situation,” JUFOS 7 (2000): 41; Swords 55–56) May 12 — European Command HQ sends the director of intelligence at the US Forces in Austria a memo alleging that

[Walter Horten](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Horten_brothers&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728425772&usg=AOvVaw1wwKuZtPRyGqazsFdJxWX8) has admitted he has been in contact with the Russians. (Jacobsen, Area 51, [p. 43](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/42/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728426172&usg=AOvVaw18eb3CpfjBzJ9CKqK6jqYS))

May 14 — Douglas Aircraft Company creates the RAND Corporation, a global think tank to offer research and analysis to the US military. It is financed by the US government, endowments, corporations, universities, and private individuals. (Wikipedia, “[RAND Corporation](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RAND_Corporation%23RAND_Corporation&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728426472&usg=AOvVaw1GchW-WAu0HVOJGZlainWX)”)

May 15 — During the Zebra nuclear detonation at Enewetak Atoll in the Marshall Islands, a manned aircraft accidentally flies through the mushroom cloud. Because the pilot and crew “suffered no ill effects,” the Air Force decides that piloted aircraft could collect samples. The Los Alamos, New Mexico, personnel assigned to remove the filters from the B-17 drones have apparently carried out the same procedure on X-Ray and Yoke without problems, but this time three of them suffer radiation burns on their hands serious enough to be hospitalized and need skin grafting. One of the men who carries out the procedure for Yoke is then also found to have burns on his hands and is also hospitalized but is discharged on May 28. Once again, the drone tank gives trouble and bogs in the crater,

* * *

but the soil samples are retrieved by the backup drone tank. Both tanks are subsequently dumped in the ocean. (Wikipedia, “[Operation Sandstone](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Sandstone&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728426923&usg=AOvVaw0zJr9mBcC05IauLR0HorxS)”; Jacobsen, Area 51, [p. 224](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/224/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728427198&usg=AOvVaw2e0tQE6GGOITwq3hCmJBIr))

May 15 — A piston-driven YB-35 flying wing bomber makes its first and only flight at Edwards AFB in California. (Wikipedia, “[Northrop YB-35](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northrop_YB-35%23YB-35&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728427638&usg=AOvVaw0pk1M1KO06yaK6rMlJbEDl)”)

May 17 — Day. William A. Bonneville sees a bright white ball, three times as bright as a locomotive headlight, sail over the hills to the northwest between Plevna and Miles City, Montana. It moves south, then west, repeating these maneuvers for 20 minutes until it flies into a dark cloud. It is silent, and a long, bright light shoots out from beneath. (Michael D. Swords, “Project Sign and the Estimate of the Situation,” JUFOS 7 (2000): 41–44)

Late May — 11:40 a.m. Sgt. T. G. Jones and three other officers and two crew are aboard a York transport aircraft, accompanied by a formation of six Meteor jets, cruising at 10,000 feet above the Oxford/Bicester area in England, bound for RAF Acklington. Visiting US Maj. [Robin Olds](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robin_Olds&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728428117&usg=AOvVaw1b3HRoedo2hIkwdQ0DW8NN) is in one of the jets. They encounter a 100-foot oval object with three bumps or protrusions on the bottom, as Jones describes it through binoculars. Ground radar tracks the object, which is stationary and above 25,000 feet. Two jets go up to try to get a better look and get within a few thousand feet. The object departs vertically at a speed of 1,500 mph. (Jenny Randles, UFO Conspiracy, Cassell, 1987, [pp. 92–93](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoconspiracyfir00rand/page/92/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728428702&usg=AOvVaw0gCGs9l6kVuZCp4-wdjkm9))

May 28 — 3:00 p.m. USAF Reserve 1st Lt. Alexander Kokolonis is flying a C-47 at 6,000 feet six miles east of Monroe, Michigan, when he sees out of the navigator’s window three discs 2 miles to the left. He estimates they are 300– 400 feet in diameter, silvery-gold, and traveling well over 500 mph. They are seen for only 10–15 seconds.

Shortly afterwards, Kokolonis sees two similar objects and he alerts M/Sgt Ernest Davis Jr., who also sees them. (NICAP, “[Air Force Transport Buzzed by 3 UFOs](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/480528monroe_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728429316&usg=AOvVaw2TdKfjtC9FOJm2hmFql7Pe)”; Michael D. Swords, “Project Sign and the Estimate of the Situation,” JUFOS 7 (2000): 45)

May 31 — 1:20 p.m. A cigar-shaped object moves through the sky from the northwest at terrific speed over Wilmington, North Carolina. Mrs. H. D. Alspach, Mrs. Charles Colvin, and Mrs. [Isabell Hufham](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/35784611/isabell-hufham&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728429926&usg=AOvVaw2syWkS_tH1GybTdESsGZpL) see the object emit smoke. It appears about 3 feet long. It slows down over the Cape Fear River, veers off to the east, and then speeds away at a high altitude. (NICAP, “[Cigar Slows Down Then Speeds Up](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/480531wilmington_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728430353&usg=AOvVaw3skXMsG6uUX7zgicLypC5x)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728430685&usg=AOvVaw2cSMthcZo-f4mctqBqQSsx), p. 34)

Summer — USAF Maj. [Edwin A. Jerome](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49237425/edwin-anthony-jerome&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728431229&usg=AOvVaw3oRiNrs-dcGfFAWTRYhJuB) reports that a high-speed radar target appears during an inspection visit at Goose Bay AFB \[now CFB Goose Bay\], Labrador. It is calculated at going 9,000 mph at an altitude of 60,000 feet. The commanders assume that the US equipment is faulty, but the Canadians have tracked the same target. The following day, an object hovers over the base at 45,000 feet and moving only 10 mph. (NICAP, “[Edwin](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/48XXXXgoosedir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728431704&usg=AOvVaw3ljH_qRcriH4YW2CIeSflG) [Jerome Radar Case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/48XXXXgoosedir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728432039&usg=AOvVaw31im-BSnCTwO6nPS4uwi2k)”; UFOEv, [pp. 83–84](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D95%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728432398&usg=AOvVaw0V5WBLe-w3mZLS1B8X4oPT); Yurko Bondarchuk, UFO Sightings, Landings, and Abductions, Methuen, 1979, pp. 151–152; Chris Rutkowski and Geoff Dittman, The Canadian UFO Report, Dundurn Press, 2006, pp. 51–52; Chris Rutkowski, Canada’s UFOs: Declassified, August Night, 2022, p. 264)

Summer \[possibly 1958\] — Early afternoon. Aircraft instrumentation engineer [Victor G. Didelot](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/10708087/victor-george-didelot&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728433345&usg=AOvVaw3SZ8okQddjg-v1WSDvriCb) watches an elliptical UFO moving rapidly west to east roughly parallel to the shoreline of Lake Erie in Erie, Pennsylvania. It suddenly and silently ascends vertically at three times its horizontal speed and disappears. (UFOEv, [pp. 55–56](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D67%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728433683&usg=AOvVaw13I1hfFgMa0TZTYShdY9tZ))

Summer — Physicist [Carl A. Mitchell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/84905457/carl-a_-mitchell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728433967&usg=AOvVaw3XunFe1stqqul-1VDoSgDR) sees three luminescent greenish discs, one second apart, passing across the sky above Easton, Pennsylvania, from north to south. (UFOEv, [p. 49](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D61%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728434228&usg=AOvVaw0_pye9R6_GxSwBxRrECRro))

June 5 — A jet-propelled Northrop YB-49 crashes north of Muroc \[now Edwards\] AFB in California after completing a number of maximum forward center-of-gravity tests, killing its pilot, Maj. [Daniel Forbes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daniel_Forbes&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728434533&usg=AOvVaw18mqLfV4RrYfPFTv-g9Znf) (for whom Forbes AFB in Topeka, Kansas, is named), copilot Capt. [Glen Edwards](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glen_Edwards_(pilot)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728434841&usg=AOvVaw21gLFNlKVyZ3C29Nd51orh) (for whom Edwards AFB is named), and three other crew members. The aircraft suffers structural failure, with both outer wing sections becoming detached from the center section. (Wikipedia, “[Northrop YB-49](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northrop_YB-49&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728435129&usg=AOvVaw2DX8Cb54pEy3S-gj06Q30a)”)

June 16 — Soviet test pilot Arkady Ivanovich Apraksin is flying at an altitude of 6.5 miles above a solid layer of clouds south of the Kapustin Yar site, Astrakhan Oblast, Russia. He sees an unconventional aircraft in the shape of a cucumber with cones of light radiating from it descending across his path. The base tells him it has tracked the object on radar and given it instructions to land, but it does not respond. Apraksin is ordered to intercept it and open fire if it refuses to land. When he closes to within 6 miles, the light beams open up like a fan and shine into his aircraft, blinding him. The plane’s electrical systems malfunction. He glides the plane to a safe landing after the UFO disappears. Apraksin is interrogated heavily. (Good Above, [p. 221](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/220/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728435447&usg=AOvVaw1hlS7oS5WSLStqr6Yv2hI1); Joe Brill, “UFO’s behind the Iron Curtain,” Skylook, no. 87, February 1975, pp. 14–15)

June 18 — The National Security Council issues Directive 10/2, calling for covert action against the USSR, and granting the authority to carry out covert operations against “hostile foreign states or groups” that could, if needed, be denied by the US government. To this end, the Office of Policy Coordination (OPC) is created inside the new CIA. [Frank Wisner](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Wisner&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728435921&usg=AOvVaw1j83jDUdnUgtiwo8GYh6GB)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Wisner&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728436094&usg=AOvVaw2V-nbo-RZkmbgyZE1kn3_D) the head of the OPC, answers not to the CIA director, but to the secretaries of defense, state, and the NSC, and the OPC’s actions are a secret even from the head of the CIA. Most CIA stations have two

* * *

station chiefs, one working for the OSO, and one working for the OPC. (“[Note on U.S. Covert Actions,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://history.state.gov/historicaldocuments/frus1964-68v12/actionsstatement&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728436498&usg=AOvVaw1sHVOe-g1-4MkqDYtSxRX1)” from Foreign Relations of the United States, 1964–1968, Volume XII, Western Europe, Office of the Historian, Foreign Service Institute, US Department of State)

June 29 — ATIC’s chief of operations, C. A. Griffith, writes to a military representative in Norway to send all UFO reports to Wright-Patterson AFB in Ohio. (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1948](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1948.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728436867&usg=AOvVaw2EolSLtQAFBdtgBzm43Uub)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1948.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728437051&usg=AOvVaw3i_VFYTMuxOP5rdqVAdAvb) The Author, 1988, pp. 32–33)

June 30 — A couple are driving near Hecla, South Dakota, when they see an unusual star. They stop the car and get out, but it is not moving. They drive on and stop again. A few pieces break off the original star and arrange themselves in a triangle formation. They all now look like polished aluminum; they rise to a great height and vanish. (Michael

D. Swords, “Project Sign and the Estimate of the Situation,” JUFOS 7 (2000): 45–46; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728437556&usg=AOvVaw0Ito5GQXcCQuTIfBTzKAdL), p. 35; Swords 57)

July — 1:00 p.m. Former Air Force pilot Don Newman and three friends watch a disc-shaped, domed UFO, about 100 feet in diameter, maneuvering over Pasco, Washington. “The exterior finish appears to be spun or burnished aluminum.” The object slows, then accelerates rapidly, dives, and climbs over the area. (UFOEv, [p. 38](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D50%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728437890&usg=AOvVaw3d5quMZ-1K6_tkclW33j2V); NICAP, “[Summary of letter from Witness to Major Keyhoe, dated March 10, 1958](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/reports/4807XXpasco_report.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728438119&usg=AOvVaw05FlOdZWlT1ITb6PqkrVhJ)”)

July 1 — A Maj. Hammer is flying above Rapid City AFB \[now Ellsworth AFB\], South Dakota, when he sees 21 brilliant, yellow-white, oval-shaped objects. They are about 100 feet in diameter and flying in a tight diamond formation. They make a high-speed dive, level, make a perfect turn in formation, angle upwards at 30°–40°, and accelerate out of sight. He estimates their cruising speed at 500 mph. (Swords 57–58; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728438396&usg=AOvVaw29pr_MeRA82_s7rnkXCt7F), p. 35)

July 4 — Day. Edward E. Thompson watches a brilliant spherical UFO for five minutes while sitting in Johnson Park in Camden, New Jersey, across from the Cooper Free Public Library. (“[Report from the Readers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/fate-1949-4_202110/page/93/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728438684&usg=AOvVaw0FhUMVvV6UwIHAfcE5DcLZ),” Fate 1, no. 4 (Winter 1949): 93–94)

July 7 — A silver, disc-shaped object allegedly crashes some 30 miles south-southwest of Laredo, Texas. US servicemen are reportedly dispatched from a nearby military base to cordon off the UFO crash site until a special US retrieval team arrives to examine the wreckage and carry it away to a military base in San Antonio, Texas. Supposedly the badly burned body of a nonhuman entity is recovered from the crash site. Ufologist [Leonard Stringfield](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leonard_H._Stringfield&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728439029&usg=AOvVaw1XzIrfQ-sQaDK1SZHZbg1U) hears rumors of the crash in 1977, but few further details emerge. Early in 1978, Stringfield describes the humanoid found at the crash site as “about 4 feet, 6 inches tall, completely hairless, with hands that had no thumbs.” That description seems to fit the body shown in two photographs that are mailed to Willard F. McIntyre in December 1978. The body depicted in the photos sent to McIntyre has come to be known as the “Tomato Man” due to its large, roundish head. Many UFO researchers, including [Ron Schaffner](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.unknownexplorers.com/ronschaffner.php&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728439302&usg=AOvVaw3TdYrR-RfNhtAHdI7vx621) and [Kevin Randle](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kevin_D._Randle&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728439525&usg=AOvVaw3WTKGmGRCWnNVgtkooSb7n), believe the body is that of a human pilot who is badly disfigured by intense heat following a plane crash. They argue that one of the photos shows a pair of eyeglasses, such as a human pilot would wear, near the body. (William S. Steinman and Wendelle C. Stevens, UFO Crash at Aztec, UFO Photo Archives, 1986, pp. 402–422; Kevin D. Randle, A History of UFO Crashes, Avon, 1995, [p. 188](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/historyofufocras0000rand/page/188/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728439868&usg=AOvVaw3W0OygptbeHuRsH6HBXO9E); Good Above, [pp. 397–398](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/396/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728440073&usg=AOvVaw3b1aPJJcMG4f2CApwRQd8t); “[Laredo 1948,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://roswellbooks.com/museum/?page_id%3D80&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728440275&usg=AOvVaw2Nj9ZoZdqXtlCjRFmCkYYe)” Texas UFO Museum and Research Library, March 8, 2009; Noe Torres and Ruben Uriarte, The Other Roswell: UFO Crash on the Texas– Mexico Border, Roswell Books, 2008)

July 9 — Caramia and Carpenter, two officers of the USAF 72nd Reconnaissance Group, are fishing at Fielding Lake, Alaska, when they hear a loud roar and notice about 20 gray discs or spheres moving at 500 mph in loose formation from west-northwest to east-southeast at about 5,000 feet. (Barry Greenwood, “[The Estimate of the](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.greenwoodufoarchive.com/uhr/uhr16.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728440679&usg=AOvVaw12-3kYh9vF7thCx8Ix996C) [Situation: Well, Not Exactly!](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.greenwoodufoarchive.com/uhr/uhr16.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728440926&usg=AOvVaw3_-m_KrjRBR8hAfHs6V7Mu)” UFO Historical Revue, no. 16 (July 2015): 5–10)

July 9 — 9:47 p.m. While on the ground in Osborn, Ohio, the USAF Project Sign officer who had flown to investigate the Hecla case, sees a self-luminous, yellow-white object flying at 500–600 mph. It seems to pulse its lights at 3- second intervals as it moves away. (Swords 58; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728441255&usg=AOvVaw2NXC4I9nbajXYfVNK9LLUb)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728441424&usg=AOvVaw176KEEdfsXi59DvAf8B-Cd) p. 35)

July 14 — Day. [Charles W. Shangle Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.saturdaynightuforia.com/html/articles/articlehtml/itn48p7.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728441724&usg=AOvVaw0gtfzZ7brOD38aqy9E41Wu) watches two groups of about 16 UFOs maneuvering at 300–600 mph over Boise, Idaho. Two of the objects exhibit a “falling leaf” motion. (“True Mystic Experiences,” Fate 2, no. 1 (May 1949): 75–79)

July 17 — 4:50 p.m. Two Kirtland AFB sergeants on a fishing trip with their families five miles south of San Acacia Diversion Dam, New Mexico, see a group of 7 aluminum-like, spherical objects approach from the south at 20,000 feet pass overhead at 1,500 mph. They first appear like snub-nosed jet fighters of an unknown type, shifting from V -ormation to L-formation to circular formation to no regular formation. A regular pulsating flashing light appears in the group at 30° from zenith to the north, and at this oblique angle the objects do not appear circular. There is no noise or trail. (NICAP, “[Two Military Families Report Seven Objects](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/480717san-acacia-dam_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728442314&usg=AOvVaw1uvD73R7NGfiKYwKZgsjEg)”; Swords 58)

July 20 — The Netherlands government reports that a wingless, cigar-shaped object with two decks of windows is seen flying rapidly on four separate occasions by two Dutch citizens over The Hague (and/or Arnhem). (NICAP, “[High](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/480720netherlands_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728442787&usg=AOvVaw1_UDSuMLX8aU9juPQphG9O) [V-2-Like Craft Observed](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/480720netherlands_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728443090&usg=AOvVaw1ALG-Lv2gLD_XfORU8DDNa)”; Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1948](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1948.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728443434&usg=AOvVaw1jf5yFaN8ExnPKMYHIn9ou), The Author, 1988, p. 86)

* * *

July 21 — The USAF Research and Development division sends a formal letter to the RAND Corporation authorizing them to select scientists to evaluate the possibility that the flying discs might be human-built spaceships. RAND’s reply is not known. (Swords 58)

July 24 — 1:45 a.m. A bright object is seen at Robins AFB in Houston County, Georgia, by ground maintenance crewman Walter Massey, who sees a “stream of fire” in the north. As it moves overhead, it seems more cylindrical. It moves off to the west. (NICAP, “[July 24, 1948, 0250E, Warner Robins AFB, Georgia](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/wrobbins480724dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728444210&usg=AOvVaw3mL9F-hob_yChtDOoZURy_)”)

July 24 — 2:45 a.m. Capt. [Clarence S. Chiles](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/22086850/clarence-shipe-chiles&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728444676&usg=AOvVaw2_c9mi-YOIlugd9aVfp-v4) and copilot [John B. Whitted](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/177623060/john-b-whitted&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728445075&usg=AOvVaw2Wwgx011oJNo-5dgLbqCSr) are flying an Eastern Airlines DC-3 at 5,000 feet, 20 miles southwest of Montgomery, Alabama, when they see an object about 100 feet long moving rapidly toward them on their right.
