Torpedo-shaped and wingless, the object has flames jetting 50 feet from its rear. There are two rows of square windows through which a bright light is glowing. They only see it for 5–10 seconds. It is half a mile away and moving at about 700 mph. After it passes the plane it swoops into a cloud bank at 6,000 feet. One passenger, [Clarence L.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://digital.klnpa.org/digital/collection/wcnp01/id/11648&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728445555&usg=AOvVaw1ZNIiigEFGloSZx5oG7iD9) [McKelvie](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/141102895/clarence-mckelvie&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728445894&usg=AOvVaw0gBdpvaHhB3vYwMQxvC6d_) of Columbus, Ohio, also sees it. (Wikipedia, “[Chiles-Whitted UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chiles-Whitted_UFO_encounter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728446318&usg=AOvVaw17uG23BhCdZYQEckUicfxg) [Encounter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chiles-Whitted_UFO_encounter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728446672&usg=AOvVaw05VIDvg0F6YUdrV_00W7QN)”; NICAP, “[Chiles-Whitted Case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/480724chiles_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728447004&usg=AOvVaw2cfp_d4VKWcB3h-vI7hWFj)”; Kenneth Arnold and Ray Palmer, The Coming of the Saucers, Palmer, 1952, pp. 90–91; James E. McDonald, “[Statement on Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23pilots&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728447491&usg=AOvVaw3Z_0o8Sr8oNCLfJVlFbHSG)” in Symposium on Unidentified Flying Objects, Hearings, US House Committee on Science and Astronautics, 90th Cong., 2nd Sess., July 29, 1968, pp. 42–43; Clark III 234–236; UFOEv, [p. 48](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D60%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728447864&usg=AOvVaw2DOIKQWuEzHKMmkdUQPkPQ); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728448080&usg=AOvVaw1HxAz9l9zG3BYksnaP7IAh), p. 36; Michael D. Swords, “Project Sign and the Estimate of the Situation,” JUFOS 7 (2000): 46–47; Swords 58–60; Good Above, [pp. 264](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/264/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728448346&usg=AOvVaw1OZfORHKhjCqNZHaxYx9wO)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/264/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728448520&usg=AOvVaw3MHGLGFpYSIDPjhXBjBOlS) [479](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/478/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728448733&usg=AOvVaw04qN1ohv5HbQi2KK6oikJN); Joel Carpenter, “[Watershed: The Chiles-Whitted ‘Rocketship’ Sighting,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/gr/chileswhitted.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728448933&usg=AOvVaw3WKL1lMioQVfEAMskl0me9)” 2002; Martin Shough, “[Analysis of the](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/reports/480724montgomery_shough.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728449133&usg=AOvVaw09HIhN9K8KXm1oNv0hVoLX) [Chiles-Whitted Sightings, July 24, 1948,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/reports/480724montgomery_shough.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728449376&usg=AOvVaw16TEbdAJZLg_JAo2XsWzKW)” February 2011; Kevin D. Randle, “[Chiles/Whitted and Skepticism,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2016/01/chileswhitted-and-skepticism.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728449601&usg=AOvVaw1Ntr3hZ4z5EPvNHCGAJMZb)” A Different Perspective, January 21, 2016)

July 25 — Chief of Air Force Intelligence Gen. [Charles Cabell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_P._Cabell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728449888&usg=AOvVaw0p8nEzwAWk_RQ7hEMf2DqM) phones [McCoy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/colonel-howard-mccoy-and-mj-12.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728450168&usg=AOvVaw3__jqk4lCI8KUcT29yqiIB)’s office at Wright-Patterson AFB in Ohio.

Sign is ordered to get into the field immediately and investigate the Chiles-Whitted case. By that afternoon, [Loedding](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/209268646/alfred-christian-loedding&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728450461&usg=AOvVaw0FDbSQvqVP2YQO4GVKj3nc)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/209268646/alfred-christian-loedding&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728450661&usg=AOvVaw2kT6j0ikXtm9cyS9XhB1QU) [Deyarmond](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Ori-ahvZRlU/VWjL8ELOjzI/AAAAAAAALts/kwi03CO17vE/s1600/Deyarmond%252BAlbert%252B7pictures%252B%252528dragged%252529.jpg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728450919&usg=AOvVaw2yEMhadf0jAkpKSFD1mH_u)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Ori-ahvZRlU/VWjL8ELOjzI/AAAAAAAALts/kwi03CO17vE/s1600/Deyarmond%252BAlbert%252B7pictures%252B%252528dragged%252529.jpg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728451144&usg=AOvVaw1g1eMVnkTkLYrUhDxDV6qa) and [Llewellyn](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/124634808/raymond-anderson-llewellyn&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728451370&usg=AOvVaw2UGyfMO-4NRRTHwoag-bG0) (now apparently director of Project Sign) are flown by Capt. Clarence Groseclose to Atlanta, Georgia. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728451641&usg=AOvVaw1vvGiv7hv9HdlId1freAXb)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728451800&usg=AOvVaw367Bp_-wSQh4r8kUhnTkVg) p. 13; Swords 60)

July 26 — [Loedding](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/209268646/alfred-christian-loedding&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728452073&usg=AOvVaw02_FD6cHLZHOZ4hk-5ZolZ)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/209268646/alfred-christian-loedding&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728452251&usg=AOvVaw2T6mO4KOAN1gPytzHIR7Kq) [Deyarmond](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Ori-ahvZRlU/VWjL8ELOjzI/AAAAAAAALts/kwi03CO17vE/s1600/Deyarmond%252BAlbert%252B7pictures%252B%252528dragged%252529.jpg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728452497&usg=AOvVaw2ZsDF4TflejThysSwa48UK)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Ori-ahvZRlU/VWjL8ELOjzI/AAAAAAAALts/kwi03CO17vE/s1600/Deyarmond%252BAlbert%252B7pictures%252B%252528dragged%252529.jpg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728452729&usg=AOvVaw1AtJu0y_xLnsGqPm77c5Dz) and [Llewellyn](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/124634808/raymond-anderson-llewellyn&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728452951&usg=AOvVaw30fmFqqC9Y4_YIVPYYhykd) interview [Chiles](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/22086850/clarence-shipe-chiles&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728453184&usg=AOvVaw0N7sTJgW6d6pCI5fyFqn8h) and [Whitted](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/177623060/john-b-whitted&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728453407&usg=AOvVaw1jfQMGk_M9951bN6ci67tA) in the Henry Grady Hotel, Atlanta, Georgia. They are impressed with their account. Mulling the case through September, Project Sign is disturbed even more than the [Mantell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/14958603/thomas-francis-mantell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728453653&usg=AOvVaw3jt3IKDZbZC2p8z6J5_EGd) incident, according to [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728453871&usg=AOvVaw22qvbxEG4rEwnTr_oH0q-0)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728454027&usg=AOvVaw0qxPBYQQzq4CX9Wm5dzkog) Capt. [Sneider](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49319130/robert-raphael-sneider&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728454226&usg=AOvVaw0wovAJ1YnR3rgAONOqoDQh) considers the shape aerodynamically feasible; consultant [J. Allen Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728454443&usg=AOvVaw1bXmBGEfJHfHqqgFotw31i) says it might be a fireball but considers that “far-fetched.” (Swords 60)

July 26 — Aeronautical engineer [Molt Taylor](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Molt_Taylor&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728454746&usg=AOvVaw3yqRNo7SU-TPef_wjGfA19) speculates to the Associated Press that “If we can build such craft, what is to prevent others from doing so, assuming that a similar order of intelligence exists on other planets? You and I may see the day when we will be united with Russia defending this planet against attack from space.” (“[It May Be](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92838283/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728454987&usg=AOvVaw2k7uJvjfnmorkljGJMpePO) [Men from Mars, Expert Says of ‘Saucers,’](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92838283/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728455172&usg=AOvVaw1VzjB40UQk5w83FIT1q4up)” San Francisco Examiner, July 28, 1948, p. 32; Loren E. Gross, [The](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1948-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728455446&usg=AOvVaw1Mcfhm2J_v2hKLWVGywYd9) [Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1948, Supplemental Notes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1948-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728455666&usg=AOvVaw3KWgqPRFN5InNbUa4zp1yQ), The Author, 2000, p. 65)

July 27 — Air Intelligence Memorandum on “Pattern of Flying Saucers” requires that a study be made by the Air Intelligence Division to examine the pattern of tactics of reported UFOs and develop conclusions as to their probability. This leads to the EEI “Analysis of Flying Object Incidents in the United States” (100-203-79) of December 10. The JIC report gives the incorrect date as August 6. (Col. Brooke E. Allen, “[Analysis of Flying](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/memo4chf.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728455981&usg=AOvVaw2aaewqcCgupCwHYZ_ncdLk) [Object Incidents in the U.S.,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/memo4chf.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728456182&usg=AOvVaw0fvP4FpA_9ovbo23uMpjB3)” October 11, 1948; “[Report by the Director of Intelligence, USAF, to the Joint](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/DI_JIC_April_28_1949.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728456384&usg=AOvVaw2UhmAVbxOF-9JXTZ-RHqfs) [Intelligence Committee on Unidentified Aerial Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/DI_JIC_April_28_1949.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728456589&usg=AOvVaw3wmcixDSrw8dZ82fiEMsb_)” April 28, 1949, p. 2; Jan L. Aldrich, “[New Top Secret](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/49docdex.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728456781&usg=AOvVaw0EXrIya5kNKSxgNM2G-y3z) [Document Revealed,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/49docdex.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728456965&usg=AOvVaw0L-S6x9kHEacilGf_gSmVQ)” Project 1947)

July 29 — 9:18 a.m. James Toney and Robert Huggins, both employees of an Indianapolis, Indiana, rug cleaning firm, are in a truck headed west when they see a shiny, propeller-shaped, aluminum object with 10–12 small cups protruding from either blade. It is 6–8 feet long and flying silently above the trees at 30 feet altitude some 300 feet away heading south. It approaches to about 100 feet at its closest. The object glides across the road at 25–30 mph in a slight descent then makes a 20° bank to the east and goes down in a wooded area. Toney and Huggins stop the truck and get out to look, but the object has disappeared behind trees. A later search finds no traces. (NICAP, “[Close Encounter with ‘Propeller-Shaped’ Object](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/480729indy_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728457304&usg=AOvVaw1rxs-gDc9xEXlN0TKDX8xN)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728457496&usg=AOvVaw0vEXozBq-2Bljif1SqoTb1), p. 36)

July 31 — 8:25 a.m. Mr. and Mrs. [Vernon Swigert](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/174882124/vernon-b-swigert&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728457766&usg=AOvVaw3TRqSuev5Y_UdGqe2gVGuf) of south-central Indianapolis, Indiana, see a cymbal-shaped or domed- disc object to the west of their home. It is about 20 feet across, 6–8 feet thick, white without any shine but shadowing on upper right. It flies straight and level from horizon to horizon, west to east heading 90°. They estimate its altitude as 2,000 feet covering a distance of 5 miles in 10 seconds. It shimmers in the sun as if spinning, is silent, and has no trail. (NICAP, “[Cymbal-Shaped Object Observed by Couple](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/480731indianapolis_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728458043&usg=AOvVaw2SnWG2gKTNh0iFmJmwjrgc)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728458238&usg=AOvVaw0Za3uAjJrf2Lp29_QOulYO), p. 37)

August 5 — This date given by [Edward Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728458550&usg=AOvVaw0CXRRoiURXnaCFHCFh28QC) for the lost “Estimate of the Situation,” in which Project Sign concludes that UFOs are interplanetary, is probably too early. See September 30. ()

* * *

August 15 — Morning. Future ufologist [Walter H. Andrus Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/152550777/walter-harrison-andrus&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728458962&usg=AOvVaw0R7jfaiiktAudZzntHofVt), his wife Genevieve, and son Donald see four UFOs flying in formation east to west over downtown, Phoenix, Arizona. They simply vanish in sequence, then the first three reappear one at a time in the northwest where they pass out of sight to the west. (Story, [pp. 17–18](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/encyclopediaofuf0000unse/page/16/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728459244&usg=AOvVaw2oTFpNbo0bN_B7PI3Ldzqp))

August 21 — A possible Russian rocket trail is seen over Katrineholm, Sweden, that remains visible for three hours “resembling a brilliant star surrounded by streamers of fire like the tentacles of an octopus.” However, there is no known record of a launch on this date of a V-2 or R-1 missile from the Russian base at Kapustin Yar, Astrakhan Oblast, Russia. It may be the same object viewed by Swedish Armed Forces Supreme Commander [Helge Jung](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Helge_Jung&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728459557&usg=AOvVaw0KIPdM-Lhp10lsPyiijBYd) of an “aerial explosion considered to be some form of guided missile originating from Estonian islands, possibly Dagö or Osel.” (“[‘Sky Octopus’ Seen above Swedish Town,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92839742/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728459789&usg=AOvVaw1pLUrlPTd8azwn-Z_yv4_i)” Richmond (Ind.) Palladium-Item, August 23, 1948,

p. 2; “Sky Octopus over Sweden,” Fate 2, no. 1 (May 1949): 35; Jan Aldrich, “Investigating the Ghost Rockets,”

IUR 23, no. 4 (Winter 1998): 14)

September — About this time Capt. [Robert R. Sneider](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49319130/robert-raphael-sneider&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728460371&usg=AOvVaw1bcYNO7Awndv9ZQwa4AJiR) becomes a co-chief of Project Sign with Lt. Howard W. Smith. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728460610&usg=AOvVaw2h0_wnxHT-IMHD_SiXeDJl)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728460765&usg=AOvVaw2B2_WogucymzA-C-ac5TyH) pp. 13–14)

September 1 — The CIA Office of Policy Coordination is formally established with the responsibility to engage in “propaganda, economic warfare, preventive direct action, including sabotage, antisabotage, demolition and evacuation procedures; subversion against hostile states, including assistance to underground resistance groups, guerrillas and refugee liberation groups, and support of indigenous anti-communist elements in threatened countries of the free world.” (Wikipedia, “[Office of Policy Coordination](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Office_of_Policy_Coordination&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728461085&usg=AOvVaw1F2PqhHmbQ2AL667ZPnERE)”)

September 15 — USAF Maj. [Dick Johnson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dick_Johnson_(test_pilot)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728461359&usg=AOvVaw3yV76P6JgLCT0b1oViiHAy) reaches an official airspeed record of 671 mph (slightly more than [Yeager](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chuck_Yeager&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728461582&usg=AOvVaw2d9inGsho5BBS47rglxk9x)’s first record) in a North American F-86A-3 Sabre at Muroc \[now Edwards\] AFB, California. (Wikipedia, “[North](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_American_F-86_Sabre&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728461790&usg=AOvVaw0JxN6uFSl_VOkD1mrF-lg0) [American F-86 Sabre](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_American_F-86_Sabre&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728461986&usg=AOvVaw0vOQdPG_eUbGRWXhd1cpTR)”)

September 16 — Before dawn. Fred Scott, 63, is walking around Grassy Mountain, Malheur County, Oregon, when he looks up and sees two “flying persons” to the south. They are 150–250 feet up, one following the other at a distance of 8–10 feet. Their wings are narrow and rounded at the tip and do not flap. Their legs are unusually short. They remain visible while Scott walks for at least another mile. (Center for UFO Studies, [HUMCAT Index](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/HUMCAT/HUMCAT_Index_1940-1949.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728462282&usg=AOvVaw37X2d6LiAyNGqNU5APxy_-) [1940–1949,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/HUMCAT/HUMCAT_Index_1940-1949.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728462479&usg=AOvVaw0BS3Li79SbtGahTJS0eFML) p. 43; Clark III 270)

September 23 — 9:40 a.m. At Los Alamos National Laboratory, New Mexico, a group of people are waiting for an airplane at the landing strip when one of them notices something glint in the sun. It is a flat, circular object, high in the northern sky. The appearance and relative size is the same as a dime held edgewise and slightly tipped, about 50 feet away. (NICAP, “[Flat Dime On-Edge Observed by Lab Personnel](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/480923losalamos_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728462796&usg=AOvVaw0bZ7szcXH_4MMM496qHXEm)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728462983&usg=AOvVaw3N8EbAo-vyKwV_eyATb7pQ), p. 38)

September 26 — 2:00 p.m. P. L. Lewis sees a white object moving rapidly across the sky at Port Hope, Ontario, then disappear when it is nearly overhead. Other white objects follow at about 50 mph in a northeasterly direction, accompanied by strands of spider web. Lewis speculates that the objects are balls of spiders’ threads, held together by thistledown. (P. R. Bishop, “Cobwebs or Flying Saucers?” Weather 4 (1949): 121–122; Philip J. Imbrogno, Files from the Edge: A Paranormal Investigator’s Explorations into High Strangeness, Llewellyn, 2010, [p. 54](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.google.com/books/edition/Files_from_the_Edge/yoqQRS7cY7cC?hl%3Den%26gbpv%3D1%26dq%3D%25E2%2580%259CCobwebs%252Bor%252BFlying%252BSaucers%253F%25E2%2580%259D%252BWeather%26pg%3DPT68%26printsec%3Dfrontcover&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728463440&usg=AOvVaw022QuA2ZvRmcXISB1okuac))

September 30? — Project Sign officer Capt. [Robert R. Sneider](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49319130/robert-raphael-sneider&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728463746&usg=AOvVaw0WLaRA5TMQe8p03Gvl-0HS) has decided that the time has come to climax Project Sign’s task and write the required “Estimate of the Situation.” Every intelligence operation’s task is ultimately to present such a best-guess summary, strongly backed with as much fact as possible. Using the Chiles-Whitted case as the core and collecting around it many cases from the summer of 1947 to September 1948, Sneider composes the document. The most recent case known to have been listed in the document is the September 23 Los Alamos National Laboratory sighting in New Mexico. Two prominent USAF intelligence officers ([Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728464018&usg=AOvVaw39dACzomej1vceqriRX5Ds) and [Dewey J.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8653239/dewey-j_-fournet&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728464244&usg=AOvVaw2hDfPS9EJcnzZTes4g1prn) [Fournet](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/ufochop2.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728464424&usg=AOvVaw2nQKAlBcCLM2-Eji8chtah) Jr.) see the document in 1952. “It was a rather thick document with a black cover and it was printed on legal-sized paper. Stamped across the front were the words TOP SECRET.” Ruppelt says the Estimate concludes that the best evidence indicated an extraterrestrial origin for UFOs. Sneider is probably the primary author.

[Deyarmond](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Ori-ahvZRlU/VWjL8ELOjzI/AAAAAAAALts/kwi03CO17vE/s1600/Deyarmond%252BAlbert%252B7pictures%252B%252528dragged%252529.jpg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728464785&usg=AOvVaw1Nwvr_AhHOXiu0ztnoKHs_)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/209268646/alfred-christian-loedding&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728464976&usg=AOvVaw0sQVgpzmG_LuxrauIUiIGj) [Loedding](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/209268646/alfred-christian-loedding&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728465166&usg=AOvVaw2TUGyMxrVw13sgkpchHaMq)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/209268646/alfred-christian-loedding&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728465342&usg=AOvVaw1Ur7kGbWrCSphE8UmxuggL) and [Truettner](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/58335429/lawrence-hess-truettner&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728465552&usg=AOvVaw2hWOOZBP4Ny0VDjIRjXs5E) almost certainly are part of the writing. [Llewellyn](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/124634808/raymond-anderson-llewellyn&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728465803&usg=AOvVaw0yezuDY5okNhMk1H-4zJGi) certainly looks in. All these people, as well as higher-ups in [Clingerman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/113944251/william-r_-clingerman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728466043&usg=AOvVaw2mwUD1z2hvF_HFt7pDv_-4)’s and [McCoy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/colonel-howard-mccoy-and-mj-12.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728466262&usg=AOvVaw008x49mndW6SXctUZ-8we3)’s offices, must approve it, at least in some sense. And an Estimate of UFOs as extraterrestrial is no small thing to assent to. The Estimate is probably addressed to Chief of Staff Gen. [Hoyt Vandenberg](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hoyt_Vandenberg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728466465&usg=AOvVaw06Es0DdxHqWzXzOCV9Lmp9), but it really is meant for Director of Intelligence Gen. [Charles Cabell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_P._Cabell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728466663&usg=AOvVaw2wxF9H8v2hzXmdeYnMCHKH)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_P._Cabell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728466835&usg=AOvVaw3HKxutq-hUx68fREesguaa) It is probably sent near the end of September, just before the [George Gorman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/711216/george-f-gorman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728467052&usg=AOvVaw3uPOVbVryU90YQ8M9Bpp0C) “UFO dogfight” in Fargo, North Dakota, on October 1. It probably lands in [Garrett](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/33467541/george-duncan-garrett&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728467305&usg=AOvVaw1OMtL8iyYHToyI0fmTAPnI)’s Collections office and is hand-carried to Cabell. Cabell may or may not be shocked. With a pro-ETH Wright-Patterson intelligence group on one side, an anti-ETH Pentagon Intelligence Requirements Office on the other, and open-minded collections officers and the powerful Research and Development chief (Gen. [Donald L. Putt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/105883/lieutenant-general-donald-leander-putt/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728467557&usg=AOvVaw1FsjG_6KQ4psP2jYcb3GhM)) in between, Cabell doesn’t want to decide this on his own. He hands the Estimate further upstairs to Vandenberg himself, who rejects it and bats it back to Cabell with a strong

* * *

sense of disapproval. Ruppelt adds that some months later the Estimate is completely declassified and “all but a few copies” are destroyed. (Ruppelt, [p. 45](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/44/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728467913&usg=AOvVaw0RwqTTf4yHett5-S5kYP7e); Clark III 436–437; Michael D. Swords, “Project Sign and the Estimate of the Situation,” JUFOS 7 (2000): 48–51; Hynek UFO Report, [pp. 13–14](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/12/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728468263&usg=AOvVaw24LKzuBsMs4PsGWNabEM47); Michael D. Swords, “The Lost Words of Edward Ruppelt,” IUR 20, no. 2 (Mar./Apr. 1995): 14–15; Swords 62)

October — [Vannevar Bush](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vannevar_Bush&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728468636&usg=AOvVaw0OGpvkTWZOuuocboZK36qI) resigns as chairman of the Research and Development Board, passing the job on to [Karl](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karl_Taylor_Compton&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728468861&usg=AOvVaw2_hOABPhhq6Rb4ISbRyEtN) [Taylor Compton](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karl_Taylor_Compton&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728469050&usg=AOvVaw3sGZqIRSS8l0tJYnSNjhqZ)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karl_Taylor_Compton&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728469216&usg=AOvVaw3PranM_CGXwkkfYEJKLi2C) (Michael Hall and Wendy Connors, “The Research and Development Board: Unanswered Questions,” IUR 26, no. 2 (Summer 2001): 9)

October 1 — The first Joint Army-Navy-Air Force Publication (JANAP) 146, based on Bernard Baruch Jr.’s CIRES system, is issued. It consists of instructions for military and civilian personnel on how to report sightings of enemy aircraft, missiles, submarines, and surface vessels. This version does not include UFOs. It is tabled shortly afterward by Maj. Gen. [Cabell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_P._Cabell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728469620&usg=AOvVaw1clMs0-NFA0uHhoKBe6ASb)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_P._Cabell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728469798&usg=AOvVaw17S5ZQ_4dTAxq8yyV6PIqC) (Antonio F. Rullán, “[Blue Book UFO Reports at Sea by Ships: Analysis of the](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.waterufo.net/bluebook/bbpdf.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728469998&usg=AOvVaw3nuaVxVtEqWA5SZmGhlv2j) [Blue Book Ship Database,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.waterufo.net/bluebook/bbpdf.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728470225&usg=AOvVaw0mVVoNCK_DUgPAwq2Hb3vN)” December 10, 2002, pp. 8–9; Swords 122)

October 1 — 8:30 p.m. 2d Lieut. [George F. Gorman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/711216/george-f-gorman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728470535&usg=AOvVaw2vJIFd2NPxzrpvFbTfm-ws) of the North Dakota National Guard, flying an F-51 near Fargo, North Dakota, spots an object traveling east to west. He describes it as a light 6–8 inches in diameter displaying incredible movements. He repeatedly gives chase beginning at 9:07 p.m., but each time is outmaneuvered by the light, which moves up to 600 mph. On his first pass he gets as close as 500 feet from the light at about 5,000 feet altitude. Gorman climbs to 14,000 feet but stalled out, unable to intercept the light, which is at about 16,000 feet. The light makes evasive and aggressive maneuvers, such as seeming to try to ram the F-51. When it drops to 11,000 feet, Gorman attempts to dive at it, but the light pulls up, rises vertically, and disappears at high speed.

The light is also seen by airport control tower operators [Lloyd D. Jensen](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.johnsoncountychapel.com/obituary/Lloyd-Jensen&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728470899&usg=AOvVaw1dKikAYpvo5pviMtsfbHn0) and Manuel E. Johnson, as well as others on the ground and pilot [Arthur E. Cannon](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/102783600/arthur-earl-cannon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728471138&usg=AOvVaw29uBgpKcweJfOtunFJ6MHo) flying a Piper Cub at 1,600 feet. Jensen watches the dogfight through 6x30 binoculars, the UFO appearing perfectly round with sharp edges and no fuzzy outline. Project Sign personnel arrive within hours and interview the witnesses. Eventually they conclude the object was a balloon, with evasive maneuvers the product of Gorman’s imagination, since ground observers do not see anything comparable. Some ufologists, among them [Aimé Michel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aim%25C3%25A9_Michel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728471404&usg=AOvVaw3N1OZe4Ch10U6SGPelpCRc) and [James E. McDonald](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_E._McDonald&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728471639&usg=AOvVaw2WljY0rKj0A8_LKPklzxoT), have rejected the balloon explanation. (Wikipedia, “[Gorman dogfight](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gorman_dogfight&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728471831&usg=AOvVaw2VWQZ2T6Etg8qq2-vaSozf)”; NICAP, “[Gorman (Fargo) Case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/481001fargo_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728472027&usg=AOvVaw3k1mDLWAdbnk_Ym8jBmOzo)”; Ruppelt, [pp. 41–43](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/40/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728472226&usg=AOvVaw0-mQloNFo-_s-fRsYfUWfA); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728472419&usg=AOvVaw3RCBIR85NFGgpjMJ9mdd37), p.

39; Michael D. Swords, GrassRoots UFOs: Case Reports from the Timmerman Files, Fund for UFO Research, 2005, p. 138; Clark III 536–537)

October 7 — A document from Project Sign to [Garrett](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/33467541/george-duncan-garrett&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728472800&usg=AOvVaw0RH1H5oE7LyaXyLWWKaDvr) and [Cabell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_P._Cabell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728473029&usg=AOvVaw1_zbQ4kidpHN7kv8bcdoa8) is an upbeat [Sneider](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49319130/robert-raphael-sneider&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728473256&usg=AOvVaw0EG8a8ZRNtG83xnSFiHlNM) report on the initial investigation of the [Gorman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/711216/george-f-gorman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728473492&usg=AOvVaw2u2W7tqErLxllkdlhZhSPI) dogfight, making the object sound extremely unusual and intelligent in behavior. This is almost like a supplement to the Estimate. (Michael D. Swords, “Project Sign and the Estimate of the Situation,” JUFOS 7 (2000): 50)

October 7 — A set of letters, composed not by [Sneider](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49319130/robert-raphael-sneider&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728473870&usg=AOvVaw2Ck3wpdkLDgkef9hYJwgMa) but actually by [Samuel Z. Hunnicutt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/63506334/samuel-z-hunnicutt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728474233&usg=AOvVaw1g2aE348UmgT04YMkIqPAM), a member of T-2 and the Sign team, and approved by MCI heavyweights [McCoy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/colonel-howard-mccoy-and-mj-12.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728474633&usg=AOvVaw20uXEG1OGvcbSoKfJBhuRj)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/colonel-howard-mccoy-and-mj-12.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728474943&usg=AOvVaw1vy8cIIagUd89m7jeFmxlP) [Clingerman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/113944251/william-r_-clingerman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728475310&usg=AOvVaw2h-fFvTrZNRou3zXiAnqq7)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/113944251/william-r_-clingerman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728475645&usg=AOvVaw05WvshetnyRBvVjM7TK7nS) and [Leland Money](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://outlet.historicimages.com/products/rrw34101&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728475996&usg=AOvVaw3bfZh62NNcQPv8KhGjlfoR), goes out to the CIA, US Army Intelligence, and the Office of Naval Intelligence. The query: What domestic technological developments do you know of that might explain UFOs and help us differentiate them from inimical (Soviet) foreign developments? (Michael D. Swords, “Project Sign and the Estimate of the Situation,” JUFOS 7 (2000): 50)

October 12 (or 22) — Project Sign’s Col. [William R. Clingerman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/113944251/william-r_-clingerman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728476407&usg=AOvVaw0JQRMe7NnhcBl92uIugyEW) writes a letter to USAF Chiefs of Staff requesting a study of UFOs by the RAND Corporation, similar to the one made by USAF R&D in July, especially the possibility that “some of the unidentified aerial objects that have been reported both in the United States and in foreign lands may have been experimental spaceships.        it is believed more likely that they represent the effort of

a foreign nation, rather than a product from beyond the Earth.” (Col. W. R. Clingerman, “[Request for Study by](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/gr/48randufostudy.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728476741&usg=AOvVaw3y6iBWU_p9kVJ2G9TFVAtB) [Rand Project,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/gr/48randufostudy.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728476946&usg=AOvVaw1TLUIzRCIlSKhgKWzEgEai)” October 12(?), 1948; Swords 58, 492–493)

October 15 — 11:05 p.m. On night patrol, 1st Lt. [Oliver “Bud” Hemphill Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/36271029/oliver-hemphill&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728477254&usg=AOvVaw3iTOIPpBrqAC4pgiPtutUP) of the 68th Fighter Squadron is flying a Northrup F-61 Black Widow some 50 miles northwest of Fukuoka, Japan, when the crew picks up an object on radar going 200 mph. As he closes to intercept, the object speeds up to 1,200 mph then slows down again. The plane tries closing in six times, but each time the object speeds away. On one pass the crew sees the object’s silhouette, which looks like a “rifle bullet” 20–30 feet long. The object “seems cognizant of the whereabouts of the F-61 at all times.” Radar operator Barton Halter thinks it is a “new type of aircraft.” (NICAP, “[F-61 ‘Black](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/481015japan_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728477685&usg=AOvVaw2OF1no-xpvJLxzXVvloEto) [Widow’ Radar Case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/481015japan_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728477967&usg=AOvVaw2WeCa-UDaovAmMlImpi6wG)”; James E. McDonald, “[Statement on Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23radar&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728478276&usg=AOvVaw3UMz4pUW6QmO7_-tl0aVX6)” in Symposium on Unidentified Flying Objects, Hearings, US House Committee on Science and Astronautics, 90th Cong., 2nd Sess., July 29, 1968, pp. 69–70; Hynek UFO Report, [pp. 134–137](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/134/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728478705&usg=AOvVaw0SXH8i8YWw_j5MBRF9YoQ-); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728478896&usg=AOvVaw2NYQkZGoxASxYobZcd_bTq), p. 40)

October 20 — The US Air Force Security Service is activated at Arlington Hall in Washington, D.C., with the mission of cryptology and communications security. (Wikipedia, “[United States Air Force Security Service](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Air_Force_Security_Service&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728479180&usg=AOvVaw3Xn_rSdkCWSgFhKAwBHMzl)”)

* * *

October 29 — Five US Air Force pilots observe a silvery object over Neubiberg Air Base \[now closed\] near Munich, Germany. The object disappears at a terrific speed after having remained over the air base more than 30 minutes. A similar object is seen days before by another group of American pilots. (Jan Aldrich, “[Early Top Secret UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/jtt.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728479580&usg=AOvVaw0F7-xfmE4ZDonmFPpn64gp) [Document Discovered,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/jtt.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728479772&usg=AOvVaw2x9hoPNpkX6KYI3bq-ijJG)” 2000)

Late 1948 — The search for a suitable US location for nuclear testing, codenamed “Project Nutmeg,” commences under the direction of expert meteorologist and Navy Captain Howard B. Hutchinson. The government is looking for a place where nuclear tests would have little impact on the American people or the American economy. Five primary sites are considered: Dugway Proving Ground, Utah; Alamogordo–White Sands Guided Missile Range, New Mexico; an area in Nevada between Fallon and Eureka; the Tonopah–Las Vegas Bombing and Gunnery Range (the site finally chosen in 1950, now part of Nellis Air Force Base); and the Pamlico Sound area off the coast of North Carolina. (“[Project Nutmeg: The Birth of the Nevada Test Site,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://permanent.access.gpo.gov/lps100925/www.nv.doe.gov/library/factsheets/DOENV_767.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728480160&usg=AOvVaw38NP-epGl-hhqkFKpUO4WC)” National Nuclear Security Administration, June 2004; Philip Howard, “[Project Nutmeg,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.villagecraftsmen.com/tag/project-nutmeg/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728480379&usg=AOvVaw069L9taOH_dW45hQjjhqif)” Village Craftsmen, April 21, 2012; Diane Tennant, “[How Outer Banks Almost Became a Nuclear Test Site,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.pilotonline.com/life/article_6662e143-8b1c-51b8-b3ef-2729d9bd713f.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728480623&usg=AOvVaw2LWILkJw0LZ1GIO53WbaJy)” Norfolk Virginian-Pilot, January 27, 2013)

November 1 — Radar operator M/Sgt Francis H. Mills at Goose Bay AFB \[now CFB Goose Bay\], Labrador, tracks an object too large for a bird, too small for a plane, flying at 60 mph. Not confirmed visually. (NICAP, “[600 MPH](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/481101goosedir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728480970&usg=AOvVaw12dLO7F0m1s91G_d9jMxzX) [Track at Goose Bay](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/481101goosedir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728481162&usg=AOvVaw3A9wiDc1tpBiPePg9g7ONv)”; NICAP, “[October 29, October 30, and November 1, 1948, Incident Nos. 188, 195, and 196:](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/reports/4810-11gooserep.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728481359&usg=AOvVaw0bPtjRhbG7WRD588CoNrvS) [Goose Bay, Labrador,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/reports/4810-11gooserep.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728481565&usg=AOvVaw1YaB3kH2_XDlRaCtTAU91C)” June 28, 2009; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728481752&usg=AOvVaw1moeQk8P_bjqF1ihYCSSzf)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728481902&usg=AOvVaw3fHxwRAI_HeQhEnAtelVpX) p. 42)

November 3 — Against most predictions, [Harry S. Truman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_S._Truman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728482157&usg=AOvVaw0vLQ3sxkvKEobW62ivRVgy) wins the US presidential election against Republican [Thomas](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_E._Dewey&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728482448&usg=AOvVaw399ODqVf8TakWjG_Zs-nlo)

[E. Dewey](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_E._Dewey&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728482680&usg=AOvVaw2mj3mm4DiLhap4OnMPyVYJ)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_E._Dewey&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728482838&usg=AOvVaw2Z5upvDcmMkZAhe9MLj7cQ) Secretary of Defense [James Forrestal](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Forrestal&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728483035&usg=AOvVaw1LGKMxjAMBEeGC15_dMRiE), like everyone else, expects to have a new boss in January. His relationship with Air Force Secretary [Stuart Symington](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stuart_Symington&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728483235&usg=AOvVaw3K4J36wcVuVkTXp7SXxGt5) has deteriorated, and he has not obtained a budget consensus from the Joint Chiefs. His mental health, physical condition, and authority are deteriorating. He is convinced that “foreign-looking men” are following him and that Symington is spying on him. Secret Service Chief [Urbanus E. Baughman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U._E._Baughman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728483539&usg=AOvVaw2yRqsHyLTM2_9gVtWDBoFW) begins to think Forrestal is suffering from a “total psychotic breakdown.” ()

November 3 — Gen. [Charles Cabell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_P._Cabell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728484036&usg=AOvVaw1aQAKoAwzSzghJqKRhiUoE) writes a firm letter to Wright Field in Ohio, asking Project Sign for another Estimate.

It is possibly composed by Maj. [Aaron “Jere” Boggs](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Boggs_J.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728484531&usg=AOvVaw0PFV8StfX6s-FFyaomZ-no) or Col. [Edward H. Porter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/105922/brigadier-general-edward-h-porter/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728484999&usg=AOvVaw33Wze-69QqBMtctyVG_DBi) at the USAF Defensive Air Branch. While admitting that the objects seem real, it also cautions that they are not identified. (Read: You may not identify them as extraterrestrial craft.) (Maj. Gen. C. P. Cabell, “[Flying Object Incidents in the United States,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/loedd/doc159.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728485427&usg=AOvVaw259Tj7ClJRpg0TcEBwXHCh)” November 3, 1948; Michael D. Swords, “Project Sign and the Estimate of the Situation,” JUFOS 7 (2000): 50– 51, 62; Swords 62, 64)

November 4 — A USAF Europe document transmits some information on the Swedish ghost rockets. “They have been reported by so many sources and from such a variety of places that we are convinced that they cannot be disregarded and must be explained on some basis which is perhaps slightly beyond the scope of our present intelligence thinking.” One of the objects was observed crashing into a lake by Swedish Gen. [Helge Jung](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Helge_Jung&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728485866&usg=AOvVaw0ILN4Jvf29BQ4lr2Ti-P0w) and his party. A salvage operation was unsuccessful. USAF officers visit Swedish Air Intelligence officials who have reached the conclusion that “these phenomena are obviously the result of a high technical skill which cannot be credited to any presently known culture on earth.” The document is distributed to the CIA (which in response to a FOIA request claims no record), Armament Intelligence Branch, and AMC. (“[USAFE 14, TT 1524, Top Secret,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/481104usafedoc.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728486125&usg=AOvVaw2DP2io_T0x6NDDfVjWuw0V)” November 4, 1948; Jan Aldrich, “[Early Top Secret UFO Document Discovered,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/jtt.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728486318&usg=AOvVaw3OIi18_DI5WZsanVX3PQCu)” 2000; Swords 62–63; Good Need, [p. 115](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/114/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728486537&usg=AOvVaw01RebU2X7AAb3zETnPKzCZ))

November 6 — Two UFOs, maneuvering like planes in a dogfight, are tracked on USAF radar over Wakkanai, Japan. (NICAP, “[Target Circles Radar Site](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/481106wakkanai_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728486800&usg=AOvVaw34vZLU3FRk_m-VlVH9NljD)”; Keyhoe, FS from OS, [p. 34](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsos/chIII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728487032&usg=AOvVaw07w3qMPN7oboqN-cBpWYtX); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728487214&usg=AOvVaw0qj-hY1En8sQkVzbhFoOWi)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728487367&usg=AOvVaw0fn4XzwGRpvO9UC20WEQyX) p. 42)

November 8 — A letter is sent with Col. [McCoy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/colonel-howard-mccoy-and-mj-12.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728487647&usg=AOvVaw1GDKzextUWgwssH3nYjXeW)’s signature to Gen. [Cabell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_P._Cabell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728487842&usg=AOvVaw3a6KGuOrL_iAmwshVzI4PK)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_P._Cabell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728488005&usg=AOvVaw2B93KEIOGWwrqbP8etMpX4) Written by Sign operative [Albert Deyarmond](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Ori-ahvZRlU/VWjL8ELOjzI/AAAAAAAALts/kwi03CO17vE/s1600/Deyarmond%252BAlbert%252B7pictures%252B%252528dragged%252529.jpg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728488263&usg=AOvVaw3Q3yL4wpUC95ZVOdeTYWF9)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Ori-ahvZRlU/VWjL8ELOjzI/AAAAAAAALts/kwi03CO17vE/s1600/Deyarmond%252BAlbert%252B7pictures%252B%252528dragged%252529.jpg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728488494&usg=AOvVaw0x73RYHSg4MmH_txe663dE) it is overtly submissive but covertly rebellious. It contains several comments agreeing with Cabell that the UFO phenomenon is not identifiable and that no concrete physical proof exists to identify it. At the same time it drops all sorts of hints, doubtless the same arguments used in the original Estimate, that the objects really are extra- terrestrial whether the Pentagon thinks so or not: It mentions the ETH; it mentions plotting waves against planetary approaches and finding a correlation; it mentions the books of [Charles Fort](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Fort&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728488748&usg=AOvVaw1OBZ_FgKec_H-qrm1FWUBC) as indicating that this has been going on for at least a century; it mentions that odd shapes (like the Chiles-Whitted case) can fly but require more advanced power plants than we have. (Col. H. M. McCoy, “[Flying Object Incidents in the United States,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1948c.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728488984&usg=AOvVaw073VURV7WCk8peO4PgUbZc)” November 8, 1948; Michael D. Swords, “The McCoy Letter,” IUR 22, no. 1 (Spring 1997): 12–17, 27; Michael

D. Swords, “Project Sign and the Estimate of the Situation,” JUFOS 7 (2000): 51, 63–64; Swords 62, 65, 494–

496)

November 12 — Project Sign personnel travel to the National Bureau of Standards in Washington, D.C., to attempt to convince [Cabell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_P._Cabell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728489487&usg=AOvVaw3OIyzMqGwnLtTAnzwFnD5R) and [Vandenberg](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hoyt_Vandenberg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728489740&usg=AOvVaw1yOfHmZnq3sKTqXCsoLc7R) on the ETH. It includes [Sneider](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49319130/robert-raphael-sneider&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728490015&usg=AOvVaw02xCEL_fYNZ4RBGHmLoLsF), and perhaps [Deyarmond](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Ori-ahvZRlU/VWjL8ELOjzI/AAAAAAAALts/kwi03CO17vE/s1600/Deyarmond%252BAlbert%252B7pictures%252B%252528dragged%252529.jpg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728490307&usg=AOvVaw2a3sS7ELj-ZKhkM1VgV7HE)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/209268646/alfred-christian-loedding&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728490498&usg=AOvVaw3khJo5EYICeJGrLiZVtZaP) [Loedding](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/209268646/alfred-christian-loedding&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728490697&usg=AOvVaw3I1d_ucJC-aRk17tEuixNE), [Truettner](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/58335429/lawrence-hess-truettner&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728490913&usg=AOvVaw37DAJZ5eG3BVu0TWeKBlH_), and [McCoy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/colonel-howard-mccoy-and-mj-12.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728491129&usg=AOvVaw24u7hYh-X2DOU_yfHgUFq4)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/colonel-howard-mccoy-and-mj-12.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728491309&usg=AOvVaw14epr_sIVaaq5AmK-c-rlS) On the Pentagon side, [Boggs](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Boggs_J.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728491608&usg=AOvVaw3wj0K3IwEw2NdJhjItNUzx) and [Cabell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_P._Cabell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728492017&usg=AOvVaw3dcBPLLkBchj_o3XAQdPAR) are there and perhaps Vandenberg, and they are having none

* * *

of the ETH. Back at Wright-Patterson AFB in Ohio, Deyarmond and Truettner begin writing a sanitized Project Sign report. More scientific oversight is requested for Sign personnel. The Scientific Advisory Board and [George](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://news.mit.edu/1999/valley-1020&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728492646&usg=AOvVaw0CYNdJOGx3zmh64XwwhJ4M) [Valley](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://news.mit.edu/1999/valley-1020&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728492951&usg=AOvVaw29tzM70xvJCfN_U-yNUO02) of MIT are to be made aware of all cases. So too are Boggs’s office, ONI, and maybe even the NBS. [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728493314&usg=AOvVaw1649kP8_r1i1fnnodmL4g-) is to be formally commissioned for an assessment, as well as [Irving Langmuir](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Irving_Langmuir&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728493577&usg=AOvVaw1wMVGkg-40qKu4QYf_sU6d) and Project Rand. (Col. H.

M. McCoy, “[Transmittal of Project ‘SIGN’ Incident Summaries,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/gr/nbsconference.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728493879&usg=AOvVaw23Yn0vrqFWQoEcnAZle5g-)” November 12, 1948; Swords 65; Michael D. Swords, “Project Sign and the Estimate of the Situation,” JUFOS 7 (2000): 51–52)

Mid-November — Late afternoon. [Clifford DeWitt Fife](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/81760336/clifford-dewitt-fife&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728494217&usg=AOvVaw3Iy8LtCylQ85QJKNRF4tW5) hears a whirring in the air near Nevada, Missouri. He looks up and sees a hovering, disc-like object. Two bright objects drop down out of the disc about 200–300 feet, then speed off to the southwest. The large object moves off to the northeast. (Nevada (Mo.) Daily Mail, November 30, 1948; Herbert S. Taylor, “Satellite Objects: A Further Look,” IUR 29, no. 2 (Summer 2004): 7)

November 18 — 10:00 p.m. USAF Reserve pilot Lt. [Henry G. Combs](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/512170/henry-gordon-combs&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728494659&usg=AOvVaw1oCkIB6AxM3b9EUXlEPbLt) is flying a T-6 Texas combat trainer when he sees an object flying west to east over Andrews AFB, Maryland. It has one continuously glowing white light. He makes a pass to check on it, but it takes evasive action and he duels with it for 10 minutes. The object performs very tight curves and quick accelerations to 600 mph. (NICAP, “[The Lt. Combs / T-6 Encounter](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/481118andrews_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728494988&usg=AOvVaw3lFqE6m2vChFsJ4F2mLOG_)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728495296&usg=AOvVaw0iQi2nPeSm5riqr_hCUDIU), p. 42; Richard H. Hall, Uninvited Guests, Aurora, 1988, pp. 236–237)

November 23 — 10:00 p.m. US Army Col. William P. Hayes sees a bright white, round light “larger than a basketball” descend slowly as he is driving 10 miles east of Vaughan, New Mexico. It explodes without a sound some 400– 500 feet above the ground. (NICAP, “[Another Object in Vertical Descent Explodes near Colonel](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/vaughn481123dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728495901&usg=AOvVaw0dc_p7-IgQYYUnq68ehx0k)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728496240&usg=AOvVaw3GBpComTs91YOLlMf5kV0l), p. 43; Clark III 539)

November 23 — 10:20 p.m. The first \[although see October 15\] documented radar-visual UFO case takes place at Fürstenfeldbruck Air Base in Bavaria, Germany. A UFO is seen circling at 27,000 feet. An F-80 pilot sent to intercept it describes it as bright red. It climbs abruptly to 50,000 feet at 900 mph. A second F-80 pilot verifies the report. (NICAP, “[Grnd Visual / Grnd Radar Track Object at 27,000ʹ](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/481123germany_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728496738&usg=AOvVaw3Pi-njX4ohdHPB6SM_Nq_l)”; Ruppelt, [p. 46](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/46/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728497092&usg=AOvVaw3juny3-okEv2M4RtninJr6); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728497412&usg=AOvVaw3DpZQumopnW8DBRWv4ipD5), p. 43)

November 24 — Writer Sidney Shalett has asked for USAF cooperation in writing an article on UFOs for the Saturday Evening Post. In a “Memorandum for the Record,” the USAF Directorate of Intelligence indicates that “publicity of this nature is undesirable but, if such articles are written, they will be less harmful to the national interest if a degree of guidance in their preparation is exercised.” Signed November 24 by [Cabell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_P._Cabell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728498174&usg=AOvVaw0i6Pkm1CPsF5qCjRJcfQ5v)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_P._Cabell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728498435&usg=AOvVaw1ud8GxfihW1tajCt-9eBzs) Director of Intelligence. (\[Maj. Gen. Charles P. Cabell\], “[Memorandum for Record,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1948d.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728498684&usg=AOvVaw239hIQo3vDMHOdiykUOuwA)” November 24, 1948)

November 30 — Maj. Gen. [Charles P. Cabell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_P._Cabell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728498962&usg=AOvVaw1VyqH3S2X5aEedHwdf9jSz)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_P._Cabell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728499128&usg=AOvVaw3S8RjVQIo-Qo1MF4Ej4MeG) in an Air Staff Summary Sheet, admits that he has tried to dissuade the press from publishing articles like Shalett’s. Cabell has asked Secretary [Forrestal](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Forrestal&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728499394&usg=AOvVaw1R2eTJ2hB6MZV93Zlec54W) for permission to feed Shalett some statistics, but the memo is apparently never sent. (Maj. Gen. C. P. Cabell, “[Publicity on Flying Saucer](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1948e.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728499630&usg=AOvVaw3zemEmLGcz_SjQqUTBZVMu) [Incidents,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1948e.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728499815&usg=AOvVaw3h8mW7ye228WUgP2rvE-_O)” Air Staff Summary Sheet, November 30, 1948; “[Memorandum for Mr. Forrestal](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1948f.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728500121&usg=AOvVaw29BYO8blmxWTrg07Y06gny)” \[unsent\])

November 30 — Letter from [Howard McCoy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/colonel-howard-mccoy-and-mj-12.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728500603&usg=AOvVaw0rFeYk_S9tUQn-6SSe4uVp) at AMC Dayton to Commanding General, Air Defense Command, Mitchel AFB \[now closed\], Long Island, New York. “It is requested that all reports of unusual sightings by radar stations of your command be made directly to this Headquarters by the most expeditious means.” (NICAP, “[1948 UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/chronos/1948fullrep.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728501037&usg=AOvVaw27Vz6Y_Jw7uJVKnTYGxxHf) [Chronology](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/chronos/1948fullrep.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728501371&usg=AOvVaw10AIHdCvn7PQ6ZHtFt6NAu)”)

November 30 — An interim report by Project Sign, one that apparently takes seriously the possibility that UFOs represent interplanetary probes, is accidentally destroyed. USAF Intelligence later requests a replacement copy from TID at Wright-Patterson AFB in Ohio. A recent FOIA to the National Archives answers that such a document would be in Project Blue Book files, but it is not. (Jan Aldrich)

December — A first-strike war plan (Sizzle) is developed to use 133 nuclear aerial bombs against 70 cities of the USSR. (“[Nuclear ‘Pincher’: The START II Treaty, the American ‘Escalation of Superiority’ Strategy, and Russia’s](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://nuke.fas.org/control/abmt/news/sov95091.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728502069&usg=AOvVaw2f_PH2prxF7gXlJ4n_FtbS) [Strategic Nuclear Forces,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://nuke.fas.org/control/abmt/news/sov95091.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728502471&usg=AOvVaw3L90bcwKxIFDpUbY2O9tCr)” from Sovetskaya Rossiya, April 8, 1995)

December 3 — 8:15 p.m. Sgt. December 10 — The revised Project Sign report is issued, Air Intelligence Report Number 100-203-79, “Analysis of Fly- ing Object Incidents in the U.S.” (AIR 203) \[Some copies are confusingly dated April 28, 1949.\] This is the cul- mination of Sign’s work since early August, augmented by ONI collaboration over the past two months. UFOs are not extraterrestrial (the idea is hardly noticed). UFOs are probably real, but if so, there is a small chance that they are Soviet and therefore dangerous. All in all, the word “Soviet” dominates the commentary. Swords, “Project Sign and the Estimate of the Situation,” JUFOS 7 (2000): 52)

December 20 — In a confidential memo to Lt. Col. [Doyle Rees](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/43562489/doyle-rees&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728521005&usg=AOvVaw2yuiKd74yRIFEhXZ9RI5Y9)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/43562489/doyle-rees&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728521174&usg=AOvVaw0-T3UMY1yd02WIL1ntBAnO) [LaPaz](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lincoln_LaPaz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728521416&usg=AOvVaw238wncgd2y0Q4GJK1Tv74x) argues that the green fireball he saw on December 12 was no meteor he has ever studied. He writes that the object moved far too slowly to have been a meteor and left no “trail of sparks or dust cloud” as would be typical of meteors flying at low altitudes. Other anomalous characteristics were the intense lime-green color, low altitude of only 8–10 miles yet exhibiting no sound, flat rather than arced trajectory, and turning on and off like a light switch. The interest in green fireballs inspires the creation of an informal group, the Los Alamos Astrophysical Association, whose members, all scientists and engineers with security clearances, are permitted to examine some classified Project Sign reports. This is essentially the beginning of Project Twinkle. (Clark III 540; World History Project, “[Project Twinkle Established](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://worldhistoryproject.org/1948/12/20/project-twinkle-established-to-monitor-green-fireball-sightings&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728521805&usg=AOvVaw2nBlRdQHFIbBuJIzy6rNGb) [to Monitor Green Fireball Sightings](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://worldhistoryproject.org/1948/12/20/project-twinkle-established-to-monitor-green-fireball-sightings&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728522040&usg=AOvVaw1lb1diZE9_LOmFMtJ5WtCP)”)

December 20 — 8:54 p.m. Shortly after they have packed up their Speed Graphic cameras provided by [LaPaz](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lincoln_LaPaz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728522374&usg=AOvVaw1oBDHHL9wCoClwVho-SFpk) to try to photograph the green fireballs, personnel (William D. Wilson, [Buford G. Truett](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/41035455/buford-glenn-truett&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728522622&usg=AOvVaw3ehXbwBXtljcesY6NUgD2O), [Clifford E. Strang](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49358793/clifford-e-strang&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728522826&usg=AOvVaw1nPPXZ5HT_dJ-oYKGIoR4a), and George S. Skipper) at an Atomic Energy Security Service post west of Los Alamos, New Mexico, spot a blue-white fireball moving in a nearly flat trajectory. Two objects separate from the main body and trail behind it. (NICAP, “[AFOSI Case 14: AESS OP Sighted Green Fireball with Triangulation](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/alamos481220dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728523052&usg=AOvVaw1Tzjgt9ZfsYf8qzAQZgmyF)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728523242&usg=AOvVaw0aFe9gsdyVoFrWl_4IYcEo)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728523395&usg=AOvVaw2pmWSBq_ZgBZyYoA4lHAL9) p. 46)

December 29 — The Fourth Army sums up the UFO situation in the southwest in a statement. In December 5–28, there were 23 reports of “flares or moving lights.” All but two are in New Mexico and are an intense white or greenish- white light. (Clark III 540)

1949

1949? — Evening. USAF Brig. Gen. [William M. Garland](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/107003/brigadier-general-william-m-garland/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728523994&usg=AOvVaw0OLyJftj0ZPFdc5hH3zjf8) is stationed at Mather AFB \[now Sacramento Mather Airport\] in Sacramento, California. He and a few other people, including some command pilots, are sitting in their yard when they see a “bright, silvery, round object” going too fast for an airplane. (Jan L. Aldrich, “[Brigadier General](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/garland.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728524248&usg=AOvVaw1LkKHEcf_XakY2y-HKykBp) [William Madison Garland, USAF](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/garland.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728524543&usg=AOvVaw11RJMYLOFz6hJyFM-waT8M)”)

1949 — 1:00 a.m. A group of soldiers of the 2nd Armored Division stationed at Fort Hood, Texas, are tasked with standing guard over a plateau in a remote, fenced-off part of the base. After a few weeks, they see bright lights in the sky. They approach the plateau and descend slowly and silently. Suddenly, part of the plateau opens up and they can see light coming from inside. The lights descend into the opening, which closes over them. (Michael D. Swords, “Timmermania: A Step Too Far into the Timmerman Files?” IUR 27, no. 4 (Winter 2002–2003): 9; Michael D. Swords, GrassRoots UFOs: Case Reports from the Timmerman Files, Fund for UFO Research, 2005,

p. 146)

1949 — Day. A student pilot is flying a two-seat Taylorcraft over Los Angeles, California. Just as he turns to a westerly flight heading, he sees an object speeding across the sky from north to south. Suddenly it stops abruptly, and the pilot heads toward the object climbing to within a few hundred feet. An intense flash of white comes from its tail and in less than a minute it is completely out of sight. (“[Recently Reported,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter/1981_CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter_V2.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728525461&usg=AOvVaw3Hlhkn4AG3fnNLR7uU1fSL)” CUFOS Associate Newsletter 2, no. 10 (October 1981): 5)

January — Project Sign personnel begin to be reassigned. [Loedding](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/209268646/alfred-christian-loedding&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728525914&usg=AOvVaw3TzjaBBs9mMTSL0UQxe50h) disappears from project records. [Deyarmond](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Ori-ahvZRlU/VWjL8ELOjzI/AAAAAAAALts/kwi03CO17vE/s1600/Deyarmond%252BAlbert%252B7pictures%252B%252528dragged%252529.jpg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728526351&usg=AOvVaw0iOWzFr_hxa4aXqrUO9dOR)’s attention goes elsewhere. [Truettner](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/58335429/lawrence-hess-truettner&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728526709&usg=AOvVaw0eYLMnjPecPbscmMPHxOtn) makes one last serious attempt at interviewing about nuclear propulsion (at Oak Ridge, Tennessee) and is given a negative opinion on UFOs by Col. [Ralph L. Wassell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/105267/brigadier-general-ralph-lowell-wassell/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728527021&usg=AOvVaw2t0LYocd7CeW8OnrYwe2j3). He, too, disappears from the project. The civilian members are relieved of their duties and reassigned to other intelligence tasks within T-2. For Loedding in particular, his role and prestige are never the same. After a few further years of intelligence work, both he and Truettner leave AMC. For the higher military ranks ([Llewelyn](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/124634808/raymond-anderson-llewellyn&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728527269&usg=AOvVaw3797hjMCCRmnvBNw4t0CnZ) and [Sneider](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49319130/robert-raphael-sneider&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728527508&usg=AOvVaw0DY4vv-0I5jP0JQYonXr40)), all we know is that they are soon no longer involved, perhaps not even assigned to the same base. Even [Clingerman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/113944251/william-r_-clingerman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728527731&usg=AOvVaw2OPJgBhFU3avkl1zzFZqsj) and [McCoy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/colonel-howard-mccoy-and-mj-12.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728527982&usg=AOvVaw3ewW23E-nRD3MHDGTlrQt4) become less involved, perhaps because they have also heard that their tenures will soon be up and they will be sent to school and then transferred. The only persons left active on the project are two of the lower ranks: Lieut. Howard W. Smith and civilian [George W. Towles](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/59257302/george-w_-towles&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728528238&usg=AOvVaw3GSQirI9EEKvm6fYF1o0I3)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/59257302/george-w_-towles&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728528422&usg=AOvVaw1Gw9ZPDvKCVYDGpX6WXwak) Their job is reduced basically to collection and filing. In this condition, or worse, the Air Force commitment to a UFO investigation project will remain until the summer of 1951. (Michael D. Swords, “Project Sign and the Estimate of the Situation,” JUFOS 7 (2000): 52–53)

January — Early morning. [Sarah Elizabeth Lampe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/92059354/sarah-elizabeth-lampe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728528810&usg=AOvVaw1qD-AaRnqsyFpwvF7oBHb9) watches an odd, disc-like electrical discharge, about 3 feet in diameter, that persists for “fully two minutes” during the Big Snow, 8 miles from Beatty, Nevada. (“True Mystic Experiences,” Fate 4, no. 2 (March 1951): 84–89)

January 1 — The CIA Office of Scientific Intelligence is established. [Willard Machle](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.dissentmagazine.org/online_articles/chromium-cancer-and-the-cia&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728529214&usg=AOvVaw1x_1aoen0SOImYcsJgWBXh) becomes assistant director for scientific intelligence. Problems almost immediately involve recruitment and filling positions with competent professionals. (Rear Adm. R. H. Hillenkoetter, “[Scientific Intelligence,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP79-01143A000300020001-7.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728529474&usg=AOvVaw1wdNe9hbhsOciqMuVEcJbi)” January 4, 1949)

January 1 — 5:00 p.m. Pilot [Thomas A. Rush](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/81587285/thomas-a-rush&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728529766&usg=AOvVaw3YM6rIzp8VxXM1Yd6xsSy3) and his wife are in a private plane flying east of Jackson, Mississippi. They see a cigar-shaped object, 60 feet long and 10 feet wide, cross their path at an altitude of 1,500–1,600 feet. It is only about 500 feet distant. The speed is approximately 200 mph, and it accelerates to 400–500 mph. The object makes a 50° turn and is visible for 10–12 seconds. (NICAP, “[Cigar-Shaped Object Encountered by Bush Pilot](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/490101jackson_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728530077&usg=AOvVaw0dH4L6CBBNNY7Pl0ecx6tu)”; Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1949, January–June](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1949-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728530321&usg=AOvVaw23BhHHL2WHYRbzV_3FScFc)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1949-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728530621&usg=AOvVaw1UZ4wtI-tDmD6aPM7iaMUK) The Author, 1988, pp. 1–2; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728530976&usg=AOvVaw10wNZlQcTIcZBHs0en_huh), p. 46)

January 4 — 2:00 p.m. USAF pilot Capt. [Paul R. Stoney](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49358280/paul-roberts-stoney&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728531401&usg=AOvVaw0-5FiK60aH0nSRezKzIAmV)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49358280/paul-roberts-stoney&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728531711&usg=AOvVaw1V7krgXIhoXF5g2xLr6Bcw) on the ground at Hickam Field \[now part of Joint Base Pearl Harbor–Hickam\] near Honolulu, Hawaii, sees a flat, white, elliptical object about the size of a T-6 aircraft, circle

* * *

at about 3,000 feet while oscillating to the right and left. It is apparently several miles off the base and slowly circling. It is bright white on the underside and darker on top and possesses no other structures. It proceeds for 15 minutes to make “rhythmical undulation” maneuvers in a cyclical manner. The “object seemed to maneuver under control at all times completing 360° turns and 90° turns.” The object then “departed climbing (into the northeast) at accelerated speed out of sight.” (NICAP, “[Disc Circles, Maneuvers, Climbs into the NE](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/490104hickam_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728532365&usg=AOvVaw0Ex8zSk1MH3ejqamjkla51)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728532702&usg=AOvVaw1rEn19vTEm4ekHourSO4E7)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728532956&usg=AOvVaw2kynyO2mjc2r8Kf539DZLc) p. 47)

January 5 — The USAF Technical Information Division at Wright-Patterson AFB near Dayton, Ohio, transmits Project Sign’s list of UFO incidents to the Air Weather Service for analysis and recommendations. (Jan Aldrich)

January 6 — 5:30 p.m. PFC Everitt sees a bright-white, diamond-shaped light in horizontal flight from southeast to northwest above the Ordnance section at Kirtland AFB, Albuquerque, New Mexico. It is about 1,500–2,000 feet altitude and flying faster than a jet. Possible meteor. (NICAP, “[Diamond-Shaped Light](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/490106kirtland_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728533524&usg=AOvVaw3fRo2gf6EtC6Cj7d2sY29k)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728533842&usg=AOvVaw3TbKDtwfwckA6L3fR6SnXS), p. 47)

January 7 — The Research and Development Board writes a memo to USAF Intelligence on the green fireballs. It is signed by David Z. Beckley, chief of the R&DB Technical Intelligence Branch. (Michael Hall and Wendy Connors, “The Research and Development Board: Unanswered Questions,” IUR 26, no. 2 (Summer 2001): 10)

January 10 — FBI special agent [Charlton C. McSwain](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/63259754/charlton-c_-mcswain&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728534549&usg=AOvVaw00LiYkr48N53CY_jJnHdzY) sends a memo to [J. Edgar Hoover](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Edgar_Hoover&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728534943&usg=AOvVaw09Nnto25TR7Ng6fmq_xDmD) enumerating the views of an AMC resident engineer (identified only as “Mr. E”) with the Nuclear Energy for the Propulsion of Aircraft project at Oak Ridge National Laboratories in Tennessee that the flying discs are human-made nuclear missiles originating in Russia. (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1949, January–June](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1949-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728535366&usg=AOvVaw3zrLIL0H5ei4F19GJbLuE_), The Author, 1988, pp. 6–10)

January 11 — Angered over his opposition to defense economization policies and meeting secretly with [Thomas Dewey](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_E._Dewey&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728535822&usg=AOvVaw1efETJNn24BiSkyV2NYtcD)’s Republicans, [Truman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_S._Truman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728536083&usg=AOvVaw2BPI8nKe8c-_xdVfT7z106) tells [Forrestal](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Forrestal&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728536428&usg=AOvVaw3t4rjrmo_8QgDbxjNqusrJ) that [Louis A. Johnson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Louis_A._Johnson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728536857&usg=AOvVaw0oyVmrb9iM-cgzSMnPFqbh) will soon replace him as Secretary of Defense. ()

January 13 — Col. [Eustis L. Poland](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/55674765/eustis-leland-poland&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728537212&usg=AOvVaw2B4CGd60KndwqL1aM3oT22) of US Army Intelligence (G-2) sends a memo on behalf of the Commander of Fourth Army at Fort Sam Houston in San Antonio, Texas, to the Director of Army Intelligence concerning the green fireballs. It recommends a scientific study because “these incidents are of such great importance, especially as they are occurring in the vicinity of sensitive installations.” (Col. Eustis L. Poland, “[Unconventional Aircraft,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/gfb/poland.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728537619&usg=AOvVaw1k8xqFQiNVqNOaXcfrKems)” January 13, 1949; Good Above, [pp. 265](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/264/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728537863&usg=AOvVaw0_QA_2G-xyK9Exi1XDPQ5s)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/264/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728538056&usg=AOvVaw0hJW1Jr5VGQoIqOAgQWbVL) [482](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/482/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728538258&usg=AOvVaw0qdijkpt-z0r-wlBU8jGTl))

January 24 — An FBI memo from [D. M. Ladd](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Ladd.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728538536&usg=AOvVaw0xUOY1H67GfxHTzxlm6EHm) to [Hoover](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Edgar_Hoover&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728538840&usg=AOvVaw0VLQAzUCcZYaIkueFSOZcX) documents speculation on a Soviet nuclear-powered disc by USAF Col. [Clyde D. Gasser](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/gfb/gasser.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728539080&usg=AOvVaw3E0SfuNJzV_kTYtUUK4Mw_) of the Nuclear Energy for the Propulsion of Aircraft (NEPA) project at Oak Ridge, Tennessee. Gasser reports rumors coming from Wright-Patterson AFB in Ohio that nuclear-powered disc-shaped planes might be making incursions into US airspace and returning to the USSR over the North Pole. (D. M. Ladd, “[Flying Discs](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/fbi_memo490124.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728539319&usg=AOvVaw1FDsvUIdyUTKDEEn-HeNeW)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/fbi_memo490124.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728539536&usg=AOvVaw3SdarXSdRfJUM5HFnwAfWx)” January 24, 1949)

January 27 — 10:20–11:20 p.m. Capt. [Eckerman Sannes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/140394050/eckerman-sannes&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728539844&usg=AOvVaw0yK1oBIJkqfceigVfHHXLf), acting chief of the Aircraft Branch at Eglin AFB near Valparaiso, Florida, and his wife are driving slowly on Cortez Road between Bradenton and Cortez, Florida, when they observe a “cucumber-shaped” object. The object, seen through binoculars, seems as long as two Pullman cars, with 7 lighted, square windows. It is throwing sparks and approximately 8–10 miles away. In the first sighting at 10:20 p.m., the object approaches from the south going north, moving from an altitude of 8,000 feet in a gradual descent until lost behind trees. In the second sighting at 11:20 p.m., the object is seen in the north, heading south and making a gradual turn to the west. It descends then climbs with a bouncing motion (up 4,000 feet, down 2,000 feet) at about 400–500 mph, resulting in an overall climb and loss to view at an altitude of around 40,000 feet. The bouncing appears to start after the final 270° course change to the west.
