May 31 — The Air Force Office of Special Investigations sends Project Grudge a copy of [Rees](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/43562489/doyle-rees&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728610921&usg=AOvVaw155yanMi_E0NUwzWTNmEwV)’s report on [Kaplan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Kaplan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728611124&usg=AOvVaw2ZJkwWzVXlKThUlABAvfm2)’s visit on April 28, the trip that USAF Intelligence had arranged to explore the possibility of a clandestine investigation separate from Grudge. Thus AMC learns of the conspiracy to keep it in the dark, but Rees fails to mention the involvement of USAF Intelligence. (Brad Sparks and Jerome Clark, “The Southwestern Lights, Part Three,” IUR 10, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1985): 15)

May 31 — The Navy review board, convened by Adm. [Morton D. Willcutts](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/60007154/morton-douglas-willcutts&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728611485&usg=AOvVaw2XaJ4phwT6UpNk-FaqMZ6u), completes hearings on [James Forrestal](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Forrestal&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728611689&usg=AOvVaw0oZvpj1VnmrKpEoeDqiGHf)’s death. The cause of death is remarkably inconclusive, and the investigation leaves many questions unanswered. ()

Summer — The gouge is said to be still visible in the debris field near Corona, New Mexico. [Mack Brazel,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/9454979/william-ware-brazel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728612169&usg=AOvVaw2KT-AQ-PE3Vw_986Nj7jdW) having found various scraps and bits for the past two years, mentions to someone in a bar in Corona that he has some material. The next day, a Capt. Armstrong and three others from Roswell Army Air Field supposedly confiscate the pieces. ()

* * *

Summer — 4:00 p.m. The French Navy patrol boat [La Rusé](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Le_Rus%25C3%25A9_(PC-472)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728612801&usg=AOvVaw10HZZT3GWjEhdyHjtAuUcu) (formerly the USS PC-472) encounters a cigar-shaped bluish object about one mile away off Casablanca, Morocco. The crew watches it for 1 minute until it shoots toward the horizon and out of sight. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, p, 36)

June 6 —9:05 p.m. Two observation posts at Killeen Base, Fort Hood, Texas, spot a hovering orange light. Lts. Virgil Williams and Marvin L. Jones are at one site and Lts. Bernard G. Raferty and [Alfred H. Jones](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.columbiamissourian.com/obituaries/family_obituary/alfred-h-jones-june-april/article_fd2cc992-66e6-11e9-b20d-83d2f6ecf611.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728613318&usg=AOvVaw1MsmETdaE3eEbOErPb6S52) are at the other. When they triangulate its location, they find it is 3 miles south of one observation post and 4.5 miles south of the plotting center, hovering 5,280 feet in the air. It is 30–70 feet in diameter. Suddenly it starts moving in level flight, then bursts into small particles. The duration is less than 3 minutes. This observation involves the first real- time triangulation of a UFO sighting. (Brad Sparks and Jerome Clark, “The Southwestern Lights, Part Three,” IUR 10, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1985): 12; Clark III 543; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728613664&usg=AOvVaw1tjgidbTifwsLZO-_2dSdz)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728613844&usg=AOvVaw2Z-QmwKp4z9S8VceVcVRoI) p. 66; Thomas Tulien, ed., [Proceedings of the Sign](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/Sign-Historical-Group-Workshop-Proceedings.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728614065&usg=AOvVaw2BST0BkP-jzTA3Qq6-RKhK) [Historical Group UFO History Workshop](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/Sign-Historical-Group-Workshop-Proceedings.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728614326&usg=AOvVaw36WGC7VuWq-_XR9RZmwUct), Sign Historical Group, November 2001, p. 43)

June 14 — 3:35 p.m. A crew of Navy engineers under Capt. [Robert Bright McLaughlin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/72103423/robert-bright-mclaughlin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728614655&usg=AOvVaw1EWpuy-Ll_6vvF66CEpfOr) is testing an Air Force V-2 rocket at White Sands Missile Range, New Mexico. When the V-2 attains a speed of 2,000 feet per second in its upward flight, it is joined by two smaller circular objects that pace it, one on each side. One then passes through the rocket’s exhaust, joins the other, and together accelerate upwards leaving the V-2 behind. Five other missile observation crews also see the objects. (NICAP, “[Two UFOs Pace V-2 Rocket](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/490614wsands_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728614914&usg=AOvVaw2QkQU2gBOqq5WYwWrPrexu)”; Robert McLaughlin, “[How](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/0%2520-%2520Articles/United%2520States/True/1950%252003%252000_True_Commander%2520McLaughlin.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728615234&usg=AOvVaw12PmBT8i3VT5gtlCjAQhBx) [Scientists Tracked a Flying Saucer,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/0%2520-%2520Articles/United%2520States/True/1950%252003%252000_True_Commander%2520McLaughlin.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728615494&usg=AOvVaw2V8HLoy1RhgkxvgWwr9wur)” True, March 1950, pp. 25–27, 96–99; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728615756&usg=AOvVaw0y7xntihlZjSq7mBPDWCP7)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728615913&usg=AOvVaw1S3-6RZAfhkbaV7DoEmCuN) p. 66; Swords 92–93)

June 22 — Three women (one a schoolteacher, another a biologist working at Oak Ridge, Tennessee, and a third who is the wife of a member of the Security Division, AEC, Oak Ridge) observe an odd trio of “flying saucers” for about 15 minutes: “It was described as consisting of two identical rectangular-shaped objects which appeared to be coordinated in movement and which moved in wave-like motion. The third object was circular in shape and appeared to be in level flight between and above the two rectangular objects. The rectangular objects appeared to be bright metal on top but dark underneath, while the color of the circular object was the same as that of frosted glass. The ‘flying saucer,’ when last sighted, was in level flight and was flying in a northwesterly direction. The weather was clear with high cumulus clouds. The ‘flying saucer’ flew at speed of from 10 to 15 mph over an area just about the center of Oak Ridge.” (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1949, January–June](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1949-Jan-Jun.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728616285&usg=AOvVaw0SqQud9u4p13iMQGQ1W_xl), The Author, 1988, pp. 83–84)

June 29 — 6:30 p.m. A former US Air Force tech sergeant observes three separate flights of three V-shaped or triangular objects from his front porch in Baltimore, Maryland. The objects veer sharply into a cloud at 2,500 feet altitude and then fly around it repeatedly. They have the ability to reverse their course 180° instantaneously. Through binoculars, they look like black, open boomerangs. More objects join them until there are 15–20, and he watches them for two hours. The formation moves from southeast to northeast and disappears. Fifteen other witness also see the display. (Marler 126–128)

July 3 — 10:40 a.m. Aeronautical engineer [Molt Taylor](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Molt_Taylor&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728616722&usg=AOvVaw2lYSrzylOY6_sfOapD3wMf), airport manager at Longview, Washington, is preparing for an air show when someone points out an object in the sky to the northwest. He announces it over the PA system to the crowd of 150–200 observers, including pilots, who watch a metallic disc cross to the southeast with a falling-leaf motion. Estimated altitude is 30,000 feet at 300 mph, with the approximate size of 100 feet. A second object is seen at 10:49 a.m. for 2 minutes. A third sighting takes place at 11:25 a.m. An object approaches from the west at about the same altitude, oscillating at 48 per minute, and disappears into the sun. (NICAP, “[Metallic Discus](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/490703longview_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728617069&usg=AOvVaw329vJLwH_FXwm8aS5n1iHh) [Object Observed by 150–200 Observers](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/490703longview_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728617325&usg=AOvVaw1gx5d-Gr5lXSCC-bRcXeCR)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728617525&usg=AOvVaw2jc4x49BBEXQYf19f6LxZ6)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728617691&usg=AOvVaw30xixeRhfwHSFZ94MZGanW) p. 67; Swords 82–83; James E. McDonald, “[Statement on](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23multiwit&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728617899&usg=AOvVaw39zzLQk_ghtWNw0I6pMVnT) [Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23multiwit&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728618112&usg=AOvVaw1ZiY4Uw8zxjGYjBY5sBCKz)” in Symposium on Unidentified Flying Objects, Hearings, US House Committee on Science and Astronautics, 90th Cong., 2nd Sess., July 29, 1968, pp. 48–49)

July 13 — [Kaplan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Kaplan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728618445&usg=AOvVaw0iBnrPislOCfdLErnznY88) responds to a July 1 letter from Gen. [Charles P. Cabell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_P._Cabell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728618673&usg=AOvVaw1vH3ZGq2k8xPjSv33lvZw_) inquiring about his April visit to Los Alamos, New Mexico. He explains that he has deliberately waited two months to report because he wanted to have a cooling off period from the deep impression the New Mexico witnesses had on him. Moreover, he wants to see if the green fireballs are still reported (they are) before he recommends a full-scale instrumented program. He says that [Norris Bradbury](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Norris_Bradbury&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728618932&usg=AOvVaw1w6rokyS38kqMQsY26Awxe)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Norris_Bradbury&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728619199&usg=AOvVaw2uJ92xhp6_a-ZmGKSSHdFR) the Los Alamos lab director, has urged that a classified scientific conference be held to discuss the phenomena. Kaplan suspects that the fireballs are an auroral phenomenon, but concedes that their horizontal motion and southern appearance are “difficult to explain.” He recommends a photographic and spectrographic patrol that would stay on to look out for the fireballs. (Brad Sparks and Jerome Clark, “The Southwestern Lights, Part Three,” IUR 10, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1985): 15)

July 24 — 12:03 p.m. Henry Clark, manager of a flying service, is flying a Piper PA-16 Clipper at 19,000 feet 10 miles northwest of Mountain Home, Idaho, when he sees a tight formation of 7 delta-shaped objects, 35–55 feet in diameter near his plane. They make a perfect and unbanked right turn 1,500 feet ahead of his plane, then they turn right again, passing the aircraft at about 450–500 mph. Clark’s engine runs rough during the sighting, which lasts

* * *

10 minutes. After he lands, he finds all his spark plugs burned out. When Blue Book investigates the case, they confiscate the spark plugs. (NICAP, “[Piper Clipper Encounters Seven Delta-Shaped Objects](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/490724mtnhome_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728620101&usg=AOvVaw2Vx1sKiaxKyaeW4DHaE9jK)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728620501&usg=AOvVaw3UqyVKizLT-pdVlPRHOrr1), p. 68)

July 24 — 8:30 p.m. An Air Force major and captain watch seven bluish-white lights pass over Fort Worth, Texas, in a V formation, moving rapidly from south to north. The distance between the lights does not vary during the 4–5 seconds they are visible. (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1949 July–December](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1949-July-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728621047&usg=AOvVaw0wvJeEnWP6vRBZr7z69hyy), The Author, 1988, p. 13)

July 24 — A green fireball is seen falling close to Socorro, New Mexico. The next day, scientist [William D. Crozier](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/44600139/william-dwight-crozier&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728621467&usg=AOvVaw0APeqdIAPXP7BASUADbo6A) collects dust samples from the School of Mines campus at Socorro. The samples contain copper particles of unusually large size. (Clark III 543–544; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728621743&usg=AOvVaw3t6aQH6OV9CZx_qhfZHNU-)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728621901&usg=AOvVaw336fMXaMiZT8YTK3l1V-v_) p. 68)

August — [George Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728622214&usg=AOvVaw2WP1I8No6uj9ldyTikk-lU) publishes Pioneers of Space, detailing his out-of-body visits to the Moon, Mars, and Venus. In private correspondence he later explains “how one may venture from one place to another, while his physical is in one place and he is in another. That is the way I have written this book. I actually have gone to the places I speak of.” (George Adamski \[ghost-written by Lucy McGinnis\], Pioneers of Space, Leonard-Freefield, 1949; “[Palomar Mountain, 1940–1960: From Obscurity to World Fame,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.the-adamski-case.nl/his-life/mount-palomar/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728622598&usg=AOvVaw1vQz4mCYuNbFlAIoSNq2UH)” The Adamski Case, September 22, 2019)

August — Actor, producer, and director [Mikel Conrad](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mikel_Conrad&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728622859&usg=AOvVaw1LCxpzZc-3QrWRPNG5G7b0), in promoting his soon-to-be-released film The Flying Saucer, claims that the movie contains actual footage of a spaceship recovered in Alaska by government agents. He produces a bogus FBI agent to “confirm” the story. The Air Force Office of Special Investigations interviews Conrad, who admits to perpetrating a publicity hoax. (Jerome Clark, “A Catalog of Early Crash Claims,” IUR 18, no. 4 (July/Aug. 1993): 16; Internet Movie Database, “[The Flying Saucer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0042469/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728623264&usg=AOvVaw2pq_pHatzBc4H31sHdR_bP)”)

August 8 — 11:30 p.m. Six airmen and tower operators at Medford Municipal Airport \[now the Rogue Valley International–Medford Airport\] in Oregon see 1–7 shiny objects traveling at variable speeds at an estimated altitude of 30,000 feet. They fly in formation for a while, then break off and return to formation again. Control tower operators using binoculars seem to distinguish wings on the objects. They remain visible until around 12:30

a.m. (NICAP, “[Winged Objects Cavort over Airport](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/490808medford_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728623643&usg=AOvVaw1GEalu7skoRzQZ3bg-dZOY)”)

August 10 — USAF’s AMC issues a final 600-page report, “Unidentified Flying Objects—Project Grudge,” Technical Report 102-AC-49/15-100, or “The Grudge Report,” authored by Lt. Howard W. Smith and [George W. Towles](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/59257302/george-w_-towles&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728624089&usg=AOvVaw1hsxrvP5ElLmU2bnoJikZo). [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728624349&usg=AOvVaw0BHF58Fj0enpdGNczGYQTR)’s April analysis is included as an appendix. Based on 237 cases, Hynek finds that 32% can be explained astronomically. Others say 12% are balloons, 33% are other misidentifications, hoaxes, or insufficient information. That leaves 23% (55) classed as unknowns. Despite this, witnesses are mostly deluded, hysterical, lying, or crazy, and “further study along present lines would only confirm the findings presented herein.” The report concludes there is little evidence to prove UFOs are real and do not represent a security threat. It recommends that press releases be created to “aid in dispelling public apprehension.” On the other hand, it suggests that military and government agencies interested in “psychological warfare” be informed of the findings. Appendix D is written by USAF Scientific Advisory Board member [George E. Valley](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://news.mit.edu/1999/valley-1020&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728624609&usg=AOvVaw3CGZy85WjPOWBQIfVNagnj), who writes that extraterrestrial civilizations “might observe that on Earth we now have atomic bombs and are fast developing rockets. In view of the past history of mankind, they should be alarmed. We should, therefore, expect at this time above all to behold such visitations.” Project Grudge enters a period of dormancy until July 1950. The report is classified Secret until August 1, 1952. (Lt. Howard W. Smith and George W. Towles, “[Unidentified Flying](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.academia.edu/43389931/Project_GRUDGE_Report_1949&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728624889&usg=AOvVaw3sT7jt8E5eZNmslwQbw08M) [Objects—Project Grudge,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.academia.edu/43389931/Project_GRUDGE_Report_1949&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728625109&usg=AOvVaw0dkR6QkMuepRHAmLpA6aMf)” Air Materiel Command Technical Report 102-AC-49/15-100; Hynek UFO Report, [p.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/18/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728625367&usg=AOvVaw3DOBAFCrzF0fyjEk9Ru4dz) [18](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/18/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728625576&usg=AOvVaw2lDrWL4kGsTEv9VPoYhokT); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728625765&usg=AOvVaw37c0eUr3Kp11gAio2pAZia), p. 12)

August 10 — The National Military Establishment is renamed the Department of Defense to unify the Army, Navy, and Air Force under the Secretary of Defense. It establishes the Joint Chiefs of Staff. (Wikipedia, “[United States](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Department_of_Defense&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728626094&usg=AOvVaw1DXzs4U1Xd-v-i5LexMHrk) [Department of Defense](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Department_of_Defense&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728626341&usg=AOvVaw3ThEYOMEJiKwJXTuoY06Ys)”)

August 17 — [Lincoln LaPaz](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lincoln_LaPaz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728626785&usg=AOvVaw2bmug9kOkWtWb1hmbVRlmP) submits the fifth of a series of reports on “anomalous luminous phenomena.” He notes that “Many of the green fireballs now appearing descend in nearly vertical paths, whereas, in earlier months almost all of the green fireballs observed moved almost horizontally. There appears to be a concentration of New Mexico incidents near weekends, especially on Sunday and near the hour of 8:00.” (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1949-July-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728627266&usg=AOvVaw0a5jELXHF7nI49DjOJraHq) [1949 July–December](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1949-July-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728627629&usg=AOvVaw1UbFfk1Y5gblVZmYDdNIEA)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1949-July-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728627936&usg=AOvVaw1oLkZluv4GOZdBN0HXC-MD) The Author, 1988, pp. 28–29)

August 16 — A young girl in Wola Drzewiecka, Poland, sees a dark green object nearby like two bowls put together and about 5 feet in diameter. She walks right up to it and touches its metallic surface with her index finger, getting a mild electric vibration and making her fingertip turn red. The object begins rotating, then rises up and disappears to the south at an altitude of 50 feet. In the distance she sees another object that she says remained in the same spot for several days. (Poland 18–19)

August 18 — [LaPaz](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lincoln_LaPaz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728628594&usg=AOvVaw03izdgw5Mv0W2hg938EtJ6) and USAF scientists meet with [William D. Crozier](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/44600139/william-dwight-crozier&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728629015&usg=AOvVaw3v9Zt3AhKRxe09EsbpQ3U6) to find out about his July 25 dust collection in Socorro, New Mexico. Crozier says he thinks the copper particles may have come from a campus building, although samples from the open country contain the same particles. LaPaz notes that copper is extremely rare in

* * *

meteorites, although it might explain the yellow-green color of the fireballs. He suggests that further air and ground samples be taken in areas where the fireballs are seen. (Clark III 543–544)

August 19 — Two prospectors, Buck Fitzgerald and Mase Garney, report that a flying saucer crashed near them in Death Valley, California. Two little men jump out and start running. The prospectors chase them over a sand dune, but lose them. (“[‘Little Men’ in Flying Disc,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93020559/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728629804&usg=AOvVaw0X1JnK7Wvs_0eebrsP5fZL)” San Francisco Examiner, August 20, 1949, p. 2; Clark III 269; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1949-08-19-usa-deathvalley.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728630287&usg=AOvVaw2dh4TSEyyQsgoVDYlyjE4T)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1949-08-19-usa-deathvalley.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728630628&usg=AOvVaw052M0UB6t06LZy07o7BcV9) August 22, 2006)

August 19 — 8:15–11:00 p.m. Rev. [Gregory Miller](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/5347017/gregory-a-miller&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728631104&usg=AOvVaw0leISy5i1Jkjt6FzRZR-we)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/5347017/gregory-a-miller&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728631394&usg=AOvVaw0YG2W7Y7-ME1e1dDJ0I0T2) pastor of the St. Peter and Paul Church in Norwood, Ohio, has purchased from Army surplus an 8-million-candlepower searchlight for his church carnival. Sgt. Donald R. Berger of ROTC of the University of Cincinnati is to operate it. During the festivities, Berger’s sweeping searchlight suddenly flashes across a stationary circular object in the sky. Miller and others join in and observe. When Berger moves the searchlight away, the disc continues to glow. Hundreds of calls are received by Cincinnati Post and Cincinnati Enquirer offices regarding fireballs and comet-like objects all across the Cincinnati area this first night. The searchlight picks up the same or similar objects on nine further occasions, the last being on March 10, 1950. (“[More Proof That ‘Saucers’ Exist,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/Orbit/ORBIT%2520Volume%2520I%25201954-1955R.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728632080&usg=AOvVaw1wCK0Pdrq8XPqZrMZq8SZl)” CRIFO Orbit 1, no. 5 (August 6, 1954): 1–2; NICAP, “[The Ohio Searchlight Incident](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/490819norwood_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728632437&usg=AOvVaw0EREGZmdbouIxhUQwaXTs7)”; Patrick Gross, “[The Norwood Searchlight Incident](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/norwood49.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728632739&usg=AOvVaw0sfFkgoprxLngMYDNt-USH)”)

August 20 —10:45 p.m. Astronomer [Clyde Tombaugh](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clyde_Tombaugh&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728633149&usg=AOvVaw1-ygzrcFs5HV47ozAEWQwS), his [wife](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/83427769/patricia-tombaugh&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728633384&usg=AOvVaw3k2ZGX0fouDBvxMt9RNjcA), and [mother-in-law](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/67133021/irene-b-edson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728633603&usg=AOvVaw1yPqC3exv2lS7eoB95DoEq) see a formation of rectangular bluish- green lights at Las Cruces, New Mexico, for about 3 seconds. (NICAP, “[Tombaugh Observes UFO Formation](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/490820lascruces_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728633839&usg=AOvVaw0uPaFq-frmMMG4n8hi7gE4)”;

H. B. Darrach Jr. and Robert Ginna, “[Have We Visitors from Space?](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/0%2520-%2520Articles/United%2520States/Life/1952%252004%252007_Life_Have%2520We%2520Visitors.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728634163&usg=AOvVaw099QX4yuIqLdEDDVlS7sfF)” Life, April 7, 1952, p. 89; “[Dr. Clyde](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/CSI_NY/CSI_NY_%252322.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728634430&usg=AOvVaw1PqrMtjV1OhM2A9SrH_G5t) [Tombaugh Provides Details on His Own Famous Sighting,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/CSI_NY/CSI_NY_%252322.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728634649&usg=AOvVaw3TuLmXNBSruV0c1Wtifwki)” CSI News Letter, no. 10 (December 15, 1957): 27; UFOEv, [p. 53](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D65%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728634930&usg=AOvVaw23EuiMAfoFkJ8KFEcJgt2u); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728635160&usg=AOvVaw0OwCn2yjhtk4I1LF5e3eb6)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728635319&usg=AOvVaw1eJy0jK8m3PHwpe1Z9iunG) p. 70; James E. McDonald, “[Statement on Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23astronomers&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728635535&usg=AOvVaw1UDqfp2omUFuixOeftHykd)” in Symposium on Unidentified Flying Objects, Hearings, US House Committee on Science and Astronautics, 90th Cong., 2nd Sess., July 29, 1968, pp. 59–60; Clark III 1129–1130; Swords 81–82)

August 29 — 7:00 a.m. The Soviet Union secretly conducts its first successful nuclear weapon test (First Lightning) at the Semipalatinsk Test Site in Kazakhstan. The design is very similar to the first US “Fat Man” plutonium bomb. The project is led by physicist [Igor Kurchatov.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Igor_Kurchatov&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728636066&usg=AOvVaw1dmBwKeznyarcWDKvYkFkW) (Wikipedia, “[RDS-1](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RDS-1&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728636285&usg=AOvVaw3pPxy1woU0xrm_cyc7FPdI)”)

September 1 — Col. John W. Schweizer of AFOIN writes to the director of USAF Intelligence: “reports that fall in the ‘fireball’ category will no longer be included in HQ Air Materiel Command and Directorate of Intelligence, HQ USAF, investigative activity on unidentified aerial incidents.” AMC hands green fireball reports over to the USAF Cambridge Research Laboratory at Hanscom AFB in Bedford, Massachusetts. AFOIN rejects an Army request for further facilities to study the green fireballs from field locations. (Clark III 543)

September 14 — The Geophysical Sciences Branch of the Air Force Research and Development orders the new AMC commander Lt. Gen. [Benjamin Chidlaw](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benjamin_W._Chidlaw&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728636694&usg=AOvVaw3FoOiS4MfnPi-zTD21DWAG) to have the Cambridge Research Laboratory in Massachusetts evaluate the New Mexico and Texas green fireball cases and consider the creation of an instrumented network. AMC is directed to send representatives from Boston to a meeting in New Mexico. (Lt. Col. John McK. Tucker, “[Light](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/490914_Light_Phenomena.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728636965&usg=AOvVaw0jcNTH3UrC1oSgMXEYHQh9) [Phenomena,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/490914_Light_Phenomena.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728637193&usg=AOvVaw3R0RYO1HT6xcoICfdTkVCW)” September 14, 1949; Brad Sparks and Jerome Clark, “The Southwestern Lights, Part Three,” IUR 10, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1985): 16; Clark III 544)

September 14 — 9:30–10:00 p.m. Two residents of Lubbock, Texas, see 9 clusters of objects “similar to ducks flying in formation,” bright silver and roughly round in shape. There are as many as 50 objects in all the formations except one. They seem to be traveling at 5,000 feet altitude, going north to south. Each light is visible for about 10 seconds, but it takes 30 minutes for all the objects to pass overhead. One witness is convinced the objects are ducks. (Clark III 692–693)

September 26 — 6:30 p.m. [Lester Wolfe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/79461100/lester-wolfe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728637621&usg=AOvVaw3KVqBxN6_rP7tMkZFh-ibZ) and five others 5 miles southeast of Lexington, Nebraska, are threshing wheat when they see three objects coming from the general direction of the sun (southwest). As the objects move, they give off a dazzling brilliance. They maintain a level flight with two of the objects changing positions as they fly. The power of the illumination remains constant throughout the incident (no pulses or flashes). Once the objects reach a direction northwest of the observers, they make a smooth 90° turn straight upwards and climb rapidly out of sight. Dean Wolfe is a recent graduate of a two-year course in aeronautical design and thinks the objects look like domed discs when viewed face forward, but are more like stubby, wingless, tailless fuselages when seen from the side. About 5 miles away, [Don](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/69079333/donald-e_-ballheim&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728637936&usg=AOvVaw0iSv72ctf-vSY6LVrvZ_Rm)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/69079333/donald-e_-ballheim&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728638117&usg=AOvVaw1XVPqdxglwncQXlcWhiX3I) [Minnie](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/69079543/minnie-estelle-ballheim&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728638322&usg=AOvVaw1Z2dayd70cphUHVhw25g2h)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/69079543/minnie-estelle-ballheim&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728638564&usg=AOvVaw1TrogCzrKYnSPjcWeTKxNz) [Elmer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/61298580/elmer-v-ballheim&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728638768&usg=AOvVaw0KWgJEOq9mzUP-dVJQml9r) and [Irene Ballheim](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/135430478/irene-m_-ballheim&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728639006&usg=AOvVaw0Kp5uDY0MbzZhNiXQRl4HP) see two fast-moving objects flying in the distance at level flight before abruptly turning straight up and flying upward. This group of people does not know their distant neighbors. (NICAP, “[90-Degree Turn Straight Up](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/490926lexington_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728639252&usg=AOvVaw0QRcQeXe1HOIEsDEcu82Zr)”; Swords 83–84)

September 27 — 1:30 and 3:00 a.m. At least five observers at Sandia Base, New Mexico, see fireballs of various colors traveling either in an arc or in tangent to the Earth. (Francis Ridge, “[The Nuclear Connection Project: The New](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/nmexico/newmexicosightings.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728639536&usg=AOvVaw0kb66SaWiz7Th6WxOn7uRG) [Mexico Sightings,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/nmexico/newmexicosightings.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728639735&usg=AOvVaw3_7n9xLQvWHv8Z2IKnR33g)” September 3, 2005; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728639926&usg=AOvVaw3Uala6BljnbC8k28HEOcHw), p. 71)

* * *

September or October — A Swiss Air Force officer sees a silvery disc 20 feet in diameter with jagged edges above Payerne, Vaud, Switzerland. He observes it flying at about 700 mph for 12 seconds. (Center for UFO Studies, \[[Payerne case file](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/cases/1949_10_13_CH_VD_Payerne_BB_DD_Color.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728640313&usg=AOvVaw34U_JOPPegCBCZgrWVRAuT)\])

Fall — A radar-tracking UFO case takes place at a key atomic base (probably Los Alamos, New Mexico). The base radar scope covers 200 miles of sky up to 100,000 feet. A legitimate radar contact tracks five apparently metallic objects at a great height moving south and crossing the radar scope in less than 4 minutes (an average of about 4,500 mph). (H. B. Darrach Jr. and Robert Ginna, “[Have We Visitors from Space?](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/0%2520-%2520Articles/United%2520States/Life/1952%252004%252007_Life_Have%2520We%2520Visitors.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728640708&usg=AOvVaw1OR_R_UgV9SIRC001yGFZz)” Life, April 7, 1952, p. 89)

Fall — Night. Donald Bushwell and his wife are traveling along a straight highway in New Mexico. Suddenly a disc about 50–60 feet across comes straight down the road toward them about 4 feet off the ground. It raises up a little before reaching the car and passes overhead. As it does so, his radio turns to static. (Tulsa (Okla.) Tribune, December 10, 1957; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728641149&usg=AOvVaw1zVUOxY9eqaaWb5heo1wsd)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728641358&usg=AOvVaw2ELXpH70Hn51qP2wXutLK4) p. 77)

October 10 — 1:07 a.m. A bluish-green fireball is seen moving to the northeast at 45° above the horizon at Sandia Base, New Mexico. Duration is from 4 to 15 seconds. (Francis Ridge, “[The Nuclear Connection Project: The New](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/nmexico/newmexicosightings.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728641641&usg=AOvVaw1nbZwp3bA8f0w2D7pefGKP) [Mexico Sightings,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/nmexico/newmexicosightings.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728641920&usg=AOvVaw0V6cImoA4mTVngMcvfLwxt)” September 3, 2005)

October 11 — The Navy releases only a brief summary of its findings in the death of [James Forrestal](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Forrestal&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728642189&usg=AOvVaw2A_zqfIMW8QZGGqRrSwpY0). The complete transcript is not released until 2004. (Ayn Rand Institute Watch, “[The Willcutts Report on the Death of James](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://ariwatch.com/VS/JamesForrestal/WillcuttsReport.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728642399&usg=AOvVaw0XmdoYzETiAyGDMO8INN4C) [Forrestal](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://ariwatch.com/VS/JamesForrestal/WillcuttsReport.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728642617&usg=AOvVaw0hrd0S34xSCzmcu8P9Bxsw)”)

October 12 — Columnist [Frank Scully](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Scully&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728642906&usg=AOvVaw3OLmGWYWsKCfhabxs6whEc) writes an article in Variety alleging that the US government has retrieved crashed spaceships in the southwestern desert. (Frank Scully, “[Scully’s Scrapbook,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Scully%2527s_Scrapbook_of_October_8%252C_1949&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728643223&usg=AOvVaw1NNRzoR0Br2L6mZd3Tgw7z)” Variety, October 12, 1949; Clark III 595, 1044)

October 14 — At another conference in Los Alamos, New Mexico, attended by 16 representatives of AFOSI, AMC ([Joseph Kaplan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Kaplan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728643555&usg=AOvVaw20TOgSJdKkldewdjVVEqMa) and Maj. [Frederic C. E. Oder](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nap.edu/read/12473/chapter/39&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728643780&usg=AOvVaw3X-L2PQQsej_xR-LlxGdkj)), Fourth Army, the FBI, AFSWP, and Los Alamos scientists ([Edward Teller](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Teller&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728643970&usg=AOvVaw1LyZsZcTKrxQTvdCYRCpvd)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Teller&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728644130&usg=AOvVaw2LELtkOfn9IW8PerEpVuDz) [George Gamow](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Gamow&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728644330&usg=AOvVaw1TGQZWWS48Wjvsh8M0HnaH)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Gamow&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728644519&usg=AOvVaw24VFC70lMVCdRu_qrVGQzM) and [Stanislaw Ulam](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stanislaw_Ulam&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728644710&usg=AOvVaw2N5_vx2hpKV4emAEhKT3Q3)), the green fireballs are identified as probably atmospheric in origin, but more observational data is needed. [LaPaz](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lincoln_LaPaz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728644970&usg=AOvVaw1TYdKVY1twO9uikoJcL_pz) and [Neef](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/100488651/melvin-ellis-neef&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728645244&usg=AOvVaw3hg4npoSjulGqPybFYFIS6) speak at length. Oder’s Cambridge Research Laboratory at Hanscom AFB in Bedford, Massachusetts, is selected for a field project, under LaPaz’s supervision. (Brad Sparks and Jerome Clark, “The Southwestern Lights, Part Three,” IUR 10, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1985): 16; Clark III 544; Swords 81; Good Above, [pp. 266–267](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/266/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728645576&usg=AOvVaw0iftRpHYqCeYfMJGZHvKXy))

October 14 — 1:15 p.m. [Harley C. Marshall](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://palomarskies.blogspot.com/2009/04/who-are-you-callin-dummy.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728645886&usg=AOvVaw1q69329www3N18qxTm18UQ)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://palomarskies.blogspot.com/2009/04/who-are-you-callin-dummy.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728646080&usg=AOvVaw237GWsLfArzlPtYNbaYUBg) manager of public relations at Palomar Observatory in San Diego County, California, is driving away from the observatory when he sees a perfect “V of V’s” formation of about 16–18 silver objects without tails or wings overhead traveling at high speed to the northwest and emitting a sound like jets. He stops and watches them disappear behind the cloud cover. Returning to the observatory, he phones electrician [Benjamin B. Traxler](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://calisphere.org/item/aa361e48f44cf8ee0f94886f6639c1db/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728646314&usg=AOvVaw2BRVCdKNRpSQr5jbu57IuM)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://calisphere.org/item/aa361e48f44cf8ee0f94886f6639c1db/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728646479&usg=AOvVaw0-kRBf_-RRBA_-kHHKshq3) who at 1:20 p.m. sees one dark UFO traveling to the southwest. Marshall checks the Navy Electronics Laboratory Geiger counter on site and sees that the needle has jumped off the scale for several seconds. For the next 10 days, another 21 incidents of off-scale cosmic-ray detector incidents occur at scattered times, fitting a periodic 1.5-hour time schedule, a phenomenon not seen before or after, and unexplainable by equipment failure or radio interference from aircraft. Two representatives of the Office of Naval Research and two from the Naval Electronics Laboratory in Point Loma, California ([Joseph P. Maxfield](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://maxfieldgenealogy.com/maxfieldjs9001.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728646729&usg=AOvVaw08AjuwxMj3JltdxznOfPCr) and G. L. Bloom), visit the observatory to investigate the readings, but not before they stop in at Alice Wells’s Palomar Gardens Café on the way in. After [George Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728646984&usg=AOvVaw2XTnbulPSm3-E3c0tOJLMR) claims he has seen increased UFO activity in the area (including a sighting about the same time as another observation by Traxler on October 21), they ask him if he would send them any photos he might take with one of his telescopes. He gives them a copy of a telescopic photo he took in February 1949 with his 15-inch reflector. The Naval Electronics Lab later attributes the photo to “electric discharge which frequently occurs in cameras during film pulling in dry or cold climates.” Several Navy aircraft of differing prop and jet types are flown near the observatory using radio, altimeter, and radars on October 21 and November 2 in an unsuccessful effort to trigger the Geiger counter. (NICAP, “[Geiger Counters Detect](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/491014palomar_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728647256&usg=AOvVaw3ySka5KcVeOv1kzdtEAK0y) [UFO Presence](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/491014palomar_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728647439&usg=AOvVaw2dmCmpPc9UPmF_tH9kETXQ)”; Clark III 38, 949–950; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728647635&usg=AOvVaw2TbEwHrbeY5lJqYYU7E6pl)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728647787&usg=AOvVaw0hflLZNE5ffPc5fKqaViEK) pp. 74–75; Swords 86–87; Maurice Weekley and George Adamski, “Flying Saucers As Astronomers See Them,” Fate 3, no. 6 (September 1950): 56–59; Colin Bennett, Looking for Orthon, Paraview, 2001, pp. 29–30)

October 23 — 7:15–10:45 p.m. Rev. [Gregory Miller](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/5347017/gregory-a-miller&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728648291&usg=AOvVaw0KzHtMC_8lfaGHSukJHUPa) has set up his searchlight once again at St. Peter and Paul Church in Norwood, Ohio. Sgt. Berger turns on the light and picks up a large object in the beam. At about 10:00 p.m., the searchlight picks up two distinct groups of five triangular objects that seem to emerge from the main disc. They descend on the beam then turn out of it. The same performance is repeated 30 minutes later. About 50 persons, including newspaper reporters observe the objects. Miller takes several photographs and asks Sgt. Leo Davidson of the Norwood police department to film the display. He uses three rolls, 25 feet each, and a Hugo-Meyer F-19- 3" camera with telephoto lens. Davidson also takes 10 still photographs of the large disc-shaped object that flies in

* * *

and out of the searchlight beam, using a Speed-Graphic camera with a 14-inch Wallensach telephoto lens. Two of these are exceptional shots, showing both the parent object and the smaller group. These two pictures are last seen by Time-Life correspondent Harry Mayo, who has prepared a feature story for Time, which was to include them. But Mayo’s story and Miller’s photos were not used in Time or Life and, in spite of requests by Miller, these two photos are never returned. (Harry Mayo, “[What Glows on Here? Norwood Muses,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/100226193/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728648900&usg=AOvVaw3gk0Gj_oQigTlAZIj8vlUJ)” Cincinnati Post, April 6, 1950, p. 1; “[More Proof That ‘Saucers’ Exist,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/Orbit/ORBIT%2520Volume%2520I%25201954-1955R.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728649169&usg=AOvVaw3iynXJ0ftZPcQdiXqNF1W8)” CRIFO Orbit 1, no. 5 (August 6, 1954): 1–2; NICAP, “[The Ohio](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/490819norwood_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728649431&usg=AOvVaw0oLb8t3HFAbj1vQJlF3L3B) [Searchlight Incident](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/490819norwood_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728649626&usg=AOvVaw39NQJl7Ln8gWDs5uJXzDhE)”; Patrick Gross, “[The Norwood Searchlight Incident](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/norwood49.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728649822&usg=AOvVaw0azpY2tfp8-H1Y6zQxaf0f)”)

November 3 — [Joseph Kaplan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Kaplan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728650119&usg=AOvVaw2T95jRuultRdNzBlW1ZYsb) brings the green fireball plan to the USAF Scientific Advisory Board at the Pentagon. By this time, he is convinced the fireballs are a rare type of meteor. But others are puzzled by the brightness, trajectories, and soundlessness, Kaplan says, “This high selectivity of direction seems to indicate that some group was trying to pinpoint Los Alamos with a new sort of weapon.” (Clark III 544)

November 3 — [Karl Taylor Compton](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karl_Taylor_Compton&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728650425&usg=AOvVaw0jAMtkN2su20MtpMO8mo04) resigns as chairman of the Research and Development Board around the same time that [Lawrence R. Hafstad](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lawrence_R._Hafstad&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728650665&usg=AOvVaw037IxtXbVblyvFcfwOpLJc) succeeds [Lloyd Berkner](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lloyd_Berkner&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728650923&usg=AOvVaw1rj5h-gfPBMp9UwLd6jOEC) as executive secretary. (Michael Hall and Wendy Connors, “The Research and Development Board: Unanswered Questions,” IUR 26, no. 2 (Summer 2001): 9)

November 3 — 11:00 a.m. USAF Capt. William H. Donnelly is driving south about 2 miles north of Rosarito, Baja California, Mexico, with a friend when he sees four objects to the east at a high altitude. All are oval and a metallic white color. They are constantly changing formation, moving up and down, back and forth. The objects continue to fly south rapidly and move in a horizontal line and disappear from sight in 20–40 seconds. (Jan Aldrich)

November 11 — 6:30 p.m. USNR Commander [J. R. Bodler](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/131997317/j_-r_-bodler&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728651388&usg=AOvVaw0K9xs69KTq53YJr9s1WIeK) is in charge of a merchant vessel (possibly the [USS](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Hemminger&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728651636&usg=AOvVaw19jRfEv_rlUOwM8GXozFLI) [Hemminger](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Hemminger&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728651831&usg=AOvVaw12r_ewo8iP3wY_9hRTpVXw)) in the Strait of Hormuz between the Persian Gulf and the Gulf of Oman. He observes a huge, pulsating submarine light wheel, some 1,000–1,500 feet in diameter, one mile from his ship. It is revolving around an ill-defined center with streaks of light like searchlight beams moving counterclockwise “like the spokes of a gigantic wheel.” He thinks it is caused by natural phosphorescence, stimulated by some marine life. (J. R. Bodler, “[An Unexplained Phenomenon of the Sea,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.usni.org/magazines/proceedings/1952/january/unexplained-phenomenon-sea&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728652105&usg=AOvVaw1Bl3untYuNOZevmCKLem-O)” US Naval Institute Proceedings 72 (January 1952): 66–67; Carl Feindt, [waterufo.net](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.waterufo.net/item.php?id%3D63&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728652364&usg=AOvVaw2nrjrnkSkfJ7QAMtaPnUgb))

November 27 — 5:49 p.m. Civil Aeronautics Administration Chief Controller W. W. Jones watches a blue-white fireball moving 5°–7° per second over Kirtland Air Force Base, Albuquerque, New Mexico. (Francis Ridge, “[The Nuclear](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/nmexico/newmexicosightings.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728652642&usg=AOvVaw3YogtDNrUjPUFfyuqxgOtY) [Connection Project: The New Mexico Sightings,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/nmexico/newmexicosightings.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728652839&usg=AOvVaw2STmI9GFKdtVaxffjuJru1)” September 3, 2005)

November 27 — 6:00 p.m. Kirtland AFB Deputy Base Commander Lt. Col. Charles E. Lancaster Jr. is driving near McIntosh, New Mexico, when he sees a green fireball descend near Albuquerque. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728653114&usg=AOvVaw2osbVUvVR0oXMPgEzJv86i)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728653272&usg=AOvVaw0OekWi9QBjzDPP_IWFrW2o) p. 77)

December — Capt. Bernard Baruch Jr. suggests to Gen. [Hoyt Vandenberg](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hoyt_Vandenberg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728653684&usg=AOvVaw2_o0IVRNv9Q2QECvjwKge1) that UFOs be added to JANAP 146 as required reporting subjects and that civilian pilots report UFO sightings according to military chains of command. (Swords 122)

December 2–3 — The US government releases radioactive fission products at the Hanford Site plutonium production facility in eastern Washington in an operation called Green Run. The radioisotopes are supposed to be detected by US Air Force reconnaissance. Sources cite 5,500–12,000 curies of iodine-131 are released and an even greater amount of xenon-133. The radiation is distributed over 500,000 acres encompassing three small towns and causes the cessation of intentional radioactive releases at Hanford until 1962, when more experiments commence. There are some indications that many other tests are conducted in the 1940s prior to Green Run, although this is a particularly large test. Evidence suggests that filters to remove the iodine are disabled during the test. (Wikipedia, “[Green Run](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Green_Run&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728654379&usg=AOvVaw2I5YZLsQusCJpIfz21k2tM)”)

December 4 — 5:00 p.m. Mario Restier is returning home from his father’s place in Volta Redonda, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, when he notices a disc land about 32–50 feet from the road. He hears a voice telling him not to be afraid and asking if he wants to know what it’s all about. Two beings about 5 feet 5 inches emerge from the UFO wearing togas and helmets. Restier asks them if they believe in God, and they answer, “God is one.” Encouraged, he enters the craft where he is offered a trip, put in a tub filled with liquid, and taken on a trip to a city on another world. He is shown a screen that depicts human nature, ambitions, and violence. After about 6 hours, he is returned to the spot where he was abducted. Returning to his father’s house, he finds it is April 14, 1950, and has lost nearly four months of earth time. (Brazil 23–24)

December 20 — Following consideration by the Defense Department’s Research and Development Board, [Joseph](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Kaplan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728654764&usg=AOvVaw3bfXydvBSPP7kZz7iywbOi) [Kaplan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Kaplan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728654973&usg=AOvVaw3RWCGuin9S_7paWQlqfkAV)’s green fireball project is approved by AMC. (Col. B. G. Holzman, “[Light Phenomena,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/491209_Light_Phenomena.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728655309&usg=AOvVaw3ZBqCMCsH8k4pTeWmMWuBQ)” December 20, 1949; Brad Sparks and Jerome Clark, “The Southwestern Lights, Part Three,” IUR 10, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1985): 16; Clark III 544)

* * *

December 24 — The January 1950 issue of True magazine is published, with [Donald Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728656092&usg=AOvVaw1TbCg7wk6TGYmTzS1_t8Rz)’s article, “The Flying Saucers Are Real.” Keyhoe argues that the Air Force knows UFOs are real, alien, and covering up information from the public in order to avoid panic: “For the past 175 years, the planet Earth has been under systematic close- range examination by living, intelligent observers from another planet.” The Air Force finds itself buried in letters, telegrams, and phone calls demanding information about flying saucers. (Donald E. Keyhoe, “[The Flying](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/0%2520-%2520Articles/United%2520States/True/1950%252001%252000_True_Donald%2520Keyhoe_Lagrange%2520scan.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728656575&usg=AOvVaw3DPntLv2A4qSYgPkFOlKA-) [Saucers Are Real,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/0%2520-%2520Articles/United%2520States/True/1950%252001%252000_True_Donald%2520Keyhoe_Lagrange%2520scan.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728657014&usg=AOvVaw16GiJrfsUYtK2O69jub1Cs)” True, January 1950, pp. 11–13, 83–87)

December 27 — USAF announces that Project Grudge is terminated. Its files are put into storage. The Grudge report is released again, reiterating that UFOs are the “result of (1) misinterpretations of various conventional objects; (2) a mild form of mass hysteria; or (3) hoaxes.” (Clark III 932–933)

1950

1950 — [N. Meade Layne](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Meade_Layne&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728658068&usg=AOvVaw3sgw46w0UlGcW3Zv-7SCxZ) publishes The Ether-Ship Mystery and Its Solution, which identifies UFOs as emanating from the etheric world, which coexists with and interpenetrates ours. The etherians must lower their “vibrational” rate in order to enter our realm. UFOs are “thought-constructs” that can take many forms and densities. He considers the etherians benign. (Meade Layne, [The Ether-Ship Mystery and Its Solution](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://borderlandsciences.org/project/etheria/mimeo/esm/index.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728658620&usg=AOvVaw0cK3M41Dqmd8QNTRiyHpSa)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://borderlandsciences.org/project/etheria/mimeo/esm/index.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728658810&usg=AOvVaw36Om7D5cZV_Dx3Y2SE3sfq) Borderland Sciences Research Associates, 1950)

1950 — William Ortiz, a deaf-mute, claims to have the first of three close encounters (the others in 1969 and 1975) with large-eyed aliens in UFOs in Colombia. After the first two events, he finds his hearing temporarily restored. The entities communicate to him using hand signals. (“[First Reported CEIII Alien Communicating with Deaf-Mute,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter/1982-83_CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter_V3.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728659168&usg=AOvVaw3SVjBdni245eKrzr7D5n0l)” CUFOS Associate Newsletter 3, no. 4 (Aug./Sept. 1982): 1, 3)

January — The Ground Observer Corps, an organization of civilians who watch the skies for enemy airplanes, is created by the US Air Defense Command. (Wikipedia, “[Ground Observer Corps](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ground_Observer_Corps&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728659566&usg=AOvVaw0dWeKNcAYiWPcC5y1XvBq0)”)

January — On the Seattle, Washington, to Anchorage, Alaska, route, an air freighter is paced for five minutes by a UFO. When the pilots try to close in, the craft zooms away at terrific speed. Later, the airline head reports that intelligence officers quizzed the pilots for hours. “From their questions,” he said, “I could tell they had a good idea of what the saucers are. One officer admitted they did, but he wouldn’t say any more.” (Donald E. Keyhoe, The Flying Saucers Are Real, Gold Medal, 1950, [p. 10](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/fsar/chI.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728659960&usg=AOvVaw2mbI-86_Nw6P9Gj1acYIP4))

January — [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728660219&usg=AOvVaw2k2yI_EZ1Fv0gQfZegRMpR) meets with Gen. [Sory Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/105625/major-general-sory-smith/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728660468&usg=AOvVaw2SOOuTno0eC3YXvPvFE2u0), director of public relations for the Air Force; Maj. [Jesse E. Stay](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/27668584/jesse-e_-stay&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728660706&usg=AOvVaw2o8DzAEbLeKNNrtkHkQM8f) and Jack

T. Shea, press officers; and Maj. [Jere Boggs](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Boggs_J.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728661000&usg=AOvVaw2dom7Luncy75e63tkjCVse)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Boggs_J.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728661171&usg=AOvVaw0Hiz19ro4c7rlH_b8XT4ru) Pentagon liaison to Project Grudge. Most of the interview involves questions for Boggs. Keyhoe is given two looseleaf notebooks with summaries of “Project Saucer” cases. His request to visit Wright-Patterson AFB in Ohio to look at the actual case files is turned down weeks later. (Donald E. Keyhoe, The Flying Saucers Are Real, Gold Medal, 1950, [pp. 147–154](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/fsar/chXVI.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728661442&usg=AOvVaw1lnZLM-PQH9WgAGqzjNkPa))

January 7 — 10:15 p.m. The assistant maintenance officer at Holloman AFB is driving south of Corona, New Mexico, when he sees a green fireball. It descends at a 60° angle, then levels out and travels 10° east before dropping out of sight behind a mountain. When first seen, it is yellowish-white, changes to orange as it descends, then turns bright blue-green as it levels out and disappears. (NICAP, “[January 7, 1950, Corona, NM, OSI Case 161](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/corona500107dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728661752&usg=AOvVaw2MwZsjHlGM63P_03ybTlu5)”: Clark III 544; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728661954&usg=AOvVaw1wf7-ScPb0C0O7GWcdxDVx)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728662114&usg=AOvVaw1dmC4G9vfpjDU0oLkbHXI3) p. 78)

January 9 — Time magazine reports on rumors of crashed saucers and small humanoids in New Mexico. (“[Visitors from](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://content.time.com/time/subscriber/article/0%252C33009%252C811681%252C00.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728662439&usg=AOvVaw2I5xmyUR5uAw50KzqUTcJS) [Venus](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://content.time.com/time/subscriber/article/0%252C33009%252C811681%252C00.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728662709&usg=AOvVaw3XXU3E2Wai1NZS22zJstkC),” Time, January 9, 1950)

January 12 — The AF Directorate of Intelligence quietly cancels the special intelligence collection directives to various government agencies for reporting UFO incidents, though routine intelligence channels still require UFO reporting, per AFCIR-CC7, “Reporting of Information on Unconventional Aircraft.” Cancellation is a follow-up to the widely announced closure of “Project Saucer.” AFOIN Director Gen. [Charles P. Cabell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_P._Cabell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728663065&usg=AOvVaw3bdlntyjLkV_k3CEgdZuFJ) believes that in fact AMC is taking its UFO project underground by announcing the closure. Months later Cabell discovers that AMC Intelligence under Col. [Harold E. Watson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/105276/brigadier-general-harold-e-watson/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728663330&usg=AOvVaw02X07KJ28M5ld-FiTq8S4V) is not running a secret UFO investigation, and Cabell is forced to make up for AMC’s negligence by conducting his own UFO investigations via his AF Intelligence staff. (Maj. Gen. C. P. Cabell, “[Reporting of Information on Unconventional Aircraft,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/NARA-PBB89-381.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728663573&usg=AOvVaw13-_8-okAJCxi4luMMGTv2)” January 12, 1950; Swords 498)

January 12 — 11:25 p.m. A B-29 aircraft is flying over the Gulf of Mexico (southwest of Florida) on a course of 260° when three objects are noted on the radar scope orbiting the B-29 from all quadrants. The objects are noticed by the radar operator, aircraft commander, navigator, and bombardier. One object is first sighted on a bearing of 330° traveling south. The objects travel across the scope in approximately 15–20 seconds on the 100-mile range setting. In a few minutes this object is joined by two others, which disappear in a few minutes. At short ranges the object is large and well-defined on the radar scope. The object goes off for about 100 miles, turns and comes in as

* * *

if for an attack, passes through the center of the scope, and emerges on the other side. The estimated speed of the object is 2,500–3,000 mph. The one object remains on the radar scope for approximately 30 minutes, following the B-29 all the time. The radar operator switches ranges on the scope and picks up the object on the 20- and 50- mile settings. Twice the object comes to within 20 miles of the aircraft and then apparently has the ability to hover, because the movement on the radar scope ceases for 5–15 seconds. After altering course the object no longer appears, but the radar is jammed for approximately 10 minutes. The crew makes no visual sighting. (NICAP, “[B-29 Radar Tracks Objects](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500112gulf_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728664072&usg=AOvVaw0yjSkPLeI4he2zq4Zp1b8-)”; Clark III 58; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728664264&usg=AOvVaw0i6s-vnCu_kmU6CjmyADvK)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728664424&usg=AOvVaw3jJzEpWb1oGSD4IUsI4l-Q) p. 79)

January 16 — The AFOSI office at Offutt AFB in Omaha, Nebraska, sends a message that recounts stories from Denver, Colorado, about crashed saucers in the southwest. The metal allegedly “defied analysis.” Bodies are said to be 3 feet tall. (Richard H. Hall, Uninvited Guests, Aurora, 1988, p. 74)

January 16 — [Tsuneo Saheki](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.kwasan.kyoto-u.ac.jp/%257Ecmo/cmo/175/cmo175.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728664824&usg=AOvVaw0P7YMtnwdgQRMaTD6Qtr_o) of the Osaka Planetarium in Japan sees an explosion on Mars, 60 miles high and 900 miles in diameter. Thomas Dobbins and William Sheehan investigate and find that this and other Martian flashes are likely caused by solar reflections on patches of ice crystals on the surface of Mars. (“[‘Terrific Explosion’ on Mars](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/89517126/st-louis-post-dispatch/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728665090&usg=AOvVaw0QZqKeuuNS7hA3VTZumMM5) [Reported by Japanese Observers,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/89517126/st-louis-post-dispatch/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728665298&usg=AOvVaw10SEgl8T6dHvljFN-LizqQ)” St. Louis Post-Dispatch, January 27, 1950, p. 13; John J. O’Neill, “[Mars Blast](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/89517518/the-ottawa-citizen/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728665560&usg=AOvVaw1teSP9ShGdhj9Gc-iU8ozE) [Puzzles Science,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/89517518/the-ottawa-citizen/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728665759&usg=AOvVaw3wXe_yJTU1EOMfxP1dM-qf)” Ottawa (Ont.) Citizen, July 16, 1952, p. 30; “[Some Curious Objects: Meteoritic Perhaps,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.alpo-astronomy.org/djalpo/42-1/DJALPO42-1-free.PDF&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728666021&usg=AOvVaw1aiPVftaGlSJh0v0aiSo7D)” The Strolling Astronomer 4, no. 5 (May 1, 1950): 8–9; Thomas Dobbins and William Sheehan, “[Solving the Martian](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.alpo-astronomy.org/mars/articles/MartianFlaresALPO.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728666284&usg=AOvVaw0l3XAu8vBnG6aS5sJWxQgF) [Flares Mystery,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.alpo-astronomy.org/mars/articles/MartianFlaresALPO.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728666488&usg=AOvVaw1Z1y5zxNfUl6NRghaBit-x)” 2002)

January 22 — 2:40 a.m. Navy patrol pilot Lieut. Smith makes a routine security flight out of Naval Air Station Kodiak \[now Coast Guard Base Kodiak\], Alaska. He obtains a radar reading on an object 20 miles north. It quickly vanishes. At 2:48, he tracks a similar object 10 miles southeast. Kodiak radar reports no known aircraft in the vicinity, but they are seeing the same track. At 3:00 a.m., the tug [USS Tillamook](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Tillamook_(ATA-192)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728666781&usg=AOvVaw3nU4nayD01ozqH0eD-Ekzc) is south of Kodiak when one of the men on deck sees a “very fast-moving red glow light, which appeared to be of exhaust nature.” The object comes from the southeast, moves clockwise around Kodiak, and returns to the southeast. Another officer sees it for 30 seconds and describes it as a “large ball of orange fire.” At 4:40 a.m., Lieut. Smith picks up another blip moving so fast that it leaves a trail on his screen. His crew sees the UFO close a five-mile gap in 10 seconds, an apparent speed of 1,800 mph. Witnesses report two orange lights that rotate around a common center. The object makes a sharp turn and heads directly towards Smith’s plane. Smith considers this a threatening situation and turns off his lights; the UFO flies by and disappears. At least 35 copies of Smith’s report are sent to FBI, CIA, AFOSI, and the State Department. None are ever officially released or published. (NICAP, “[USN P2V3 Patrol](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500122kodiak_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728667071&usg=AOvVaw2EReuy63_-uvYYAI-yfppj) [Plane and USS](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500122kodiak_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728667256&usg=AOvVaw2OUK1Kj3N2B9MPRXwvkDDP) [Tillamook](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500122kodiak_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728667410&usg=AOvVaw0W9ys87jOoKY99s1evVTYx) [Encounter](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500122kodiak_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728667572&usg=AOvVaw3w8iiBj70VMTYeAWrwr0IH)”; ClearIntent, [pp. 165–166](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/clearintentgover00fawc/page/164/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728667772&usg=AOvVaw2yl9RHA4V1s3PVl_7SXSuB); Clark III 58; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728667956&usg=AOvVaw1xb2Zl5e4lQTwUgu8--ajh), p. 80; Swords 90–91)

January 24 —4:50 p.m. USAF Capt. G. B. Edwards and copilot Theron C. Fehrevach are flying a C-45 transport plane from Pope AFB \[now Pope Field\], Fayetteville, North Carolina, to Bolling AFB \[now Joint Base Anacostia- Bolling\], Washington, D.C. While at 5,000 feet near Blacksburg, Virginia, Fehrevach notices a dark, 200–250 foot in diameter, hemispherical parachute-shaped object above them about 5–10 miles away. A large black smoky region is below it, possibly obscuring the lower portion of a sphere. The UFO is darker than the 50% cloud cover and “easy to distinguish as not being cloud.” The object moves smoothly without any noticeable turn radius.

Edwards puts the C-45 into a climb to 7,000 feet so they are at the same altitude as the UFO and turns to head directly toward it. Army Courier Service passenger 1st Lt. [John H. Van Santen](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/57018521/john-henry-van_santen&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728668340&usg=AOvVaw0dDqhuosMac67JfC0MW3r5) is alerted by Fehrevach and also sees the object move right then left again, then they all see the object recede at high speed and disappear. About 90 seconds later the object reappears about 30°–45° to the right of their heading, then oscillates right to left. It moves horizontally to dead ahead again and disappears by receding in the distance at high speed. (NICAP, “[C-25](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500124blackstone_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728668608&usg=AOvVaw0DZv-sCHxnL8DdHgj41rPk) [Transport Crew Encounters Object](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500124blackstone_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728668799&usg=AOvVaw0qStO70QlybLB9f6HSanvL)”; Martin Shough and Wim van Utrecht, “[Blackstone, Virginia, USA: January](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500124blackstone_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728668997&usg=AOvVaw27DfRm4ybpysy8A80uHEy_) [24, 1950,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500124blackstone_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728669196&usg=AOvVaw3jaFImrqDYkKUslz-p7fkZ)” September 30, 2015; Swords 91)

Late January — Gen. [Charles Cabell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_P._Cabell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728669445&usg=AOvVaw2W4icDUCINF6jcSIRBIopy), possibly inspired by the Kodiak, Alaska, case, sends a letter to ATIC asking why Project Grudge has ended, because he never disbanded it. ATIC responds that Grudge is no longer a special project and that UFO reports will be processed through normal intelligence channels. (Ruppelt, [pp. 69–70](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/68/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728669686&usg=AOvVaw0f1MyHmfSpkf46MPceSy2w))

January 26 — 4:00 p.m. Lt. Col. [Lester F. Mathison](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/102721979/lester-f-mathison&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728670028&usg=AOvVaw3O2YdJa5gQTLzq88Lp0mnM)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/102721979/lester-f-mathison&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728670206&usg=AOvVaw37M9Q4Ui8CPUMI_CTsvvdq) commanding officer of the 625th Aircraft and Warning Squadron at Elmendorf AFB \[now Joint Base Elmendorf-Richardson\], Anchorage, Alaska, notices three reddish objects above the cirrus cloud layer at 25,000–30,000 feet. They are moving to the north in a sightly curled trail fashion and disappear into some clouds. (“[Extract: History of the 57th Fighter-Interceptor Wing, January 1–March 31, 1950](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.greenwoodufoarchive.com/uhr/uhr08.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728670497&usg=AOvVaw20g1XrCKFxLkWtoSQ92SdL) [(Elmendorf AFB, Alaska),](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.greenwoodufoarchive.com/uhr/uhr08.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728670711&usg=AOvVaw2jGA30Z0vf-PuDE2XGncXN)” UFO Historical Revue, no. 8 (February 2001): 7–8)

February 1 — [Harry S. Truman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_S._Truman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728671126&usg=AOvVaw3v6FeONn0wsn33SBIh9CG2) issues Executive Order 10104 and creates the “Top Secret classification” designation. (US Office of the Federal Register, “[Executive Order 10104](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.archives.gov/federal-register/codification/executive-order/10104.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728671394&usg=AOvVaw1JPfPq6f8o0Bw_LsfVEqln)”)
