February 1 — A meteor-like object spewing smoke is seen by many people over Tucson, Arizona. The radio operator at Davis-Monthan AFB asks 1st Lieut. [Roy L. Jones Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/3594082/roy-l-jones&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728671745&usg=AOvVaw0DysioSuN3UpBsqaju3vw3) to investigate it in his B-29, but he cannot catch up with it. [Edwin Francis Carpenter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edwin_Francis_Carpenter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728671976&usg=AOvVaw2RRRIzAwhyea-WrYAeLceK)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edwin_Francis_Carpenter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728672143&usg=AOvVaw1DbbrUSJA5r-lt7htHe0Cx) head of the University of Arizona astronomy department, says he is certain the object is not a meteor. (Donald E. Keyhoe, The Flying Saucers Are Real, Gold Medal, 1950, [pp. 10–12](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/fsar/chI.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728672395&usg=AOvVaw1rT7zna7LDU7e5-cGELbKg); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728672583&usg=AOvVaw2vSTTPRj4BSakLBVHWy5x2), p. 81)

February 2 — [Lincoln LaPaz](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lincoln_LaPaz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728672834&usg=AOvVaw1O0Gv_MxwYW_j02Ph0fv6T)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lincoln_LaPaz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728672989&usg=AOvVaw0KB-gK_l--OEXmasvryr0c) citing the press of academic duties, withdraws from Project Twinkle. (Clark III 544) February 5 — 5:10 p.m. Four people at Falmouth Airport \[now part of Frances Crane Wildlife Management Area north of

Hatchville, Massachusetts\] see two illuminated cylindrical objects in the western sky. The witnesses include [Marvin R. Odom](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/48772567/marvin-r.-odom&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728673270&usg=AOvVaw1c8-tFdeTjRwhObvWMI-HP)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/48772567/marvin-r.-odom&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728673439&usg=AOvVaw2tEBPYmKMqTps4R8o8kwIS) owner of the airport, and Lt. [Philip Foushee Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/57692982/philip-amos-foushee&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728673709&usg=AOvVaw1DApP9O1MucVz8FnysZLfO) of Otis AFB \[now Otis Air National Guard Base\] near Mashpee. As the objects are maneuvering, a fireball drops from one. Five minutes later they both climb at high speed and disappear from view. (NICAP, “[Feb. 5, 1950; Teaticket, Mass.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/teaticket500205dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728674014&usg=AOvVaw2KY4h0H3ee3jPS65KDCHfk)”; Hyannis (Mass.) Cape Cod Standard Times, February 6, 1950; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728674421&usg=AOvVaw2MEQghyKZLzt2qKcoR9de_), p. 81)

February 8 — AFOSI Letter #85 is issued, directing Air Force personnel to relay UFO sightings to the Pentagon or AMC only if they are of “priority Counterintelligence interest.” (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: Volume 5, January–](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1950-Jan-Mar.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728674927&usg=AOvVaw3C6NerroTYM-PTfbj9U9dU) [March 1950,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1950-Jan-Mar.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728675276&usg=AOvVaw244QPVKdVm-xRTwPu4wgja) The Author, 1983, p. 18)

February 20 — [LaPaz](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lincoln_LaPaz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728675761&usg=AOvVaw0zR-teaiaoa0AvbiP0xsMt) writes to [Peter H. Wyckoff](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://journals.ametsoc.org/doi/pdf/10.1175/1520-0477-63.2.215&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728676014&usg=AOvVaw04pH2gWzlwD62YyHf3I5DB) of the USAF Cambridge Research Laboratories in Massachusetts that a “fireball project” ought not be pursued because any objects that are not meteors are probably US test missiles. But he concedes he might be wrong and says in that case, “intensive, systematic investigation of these objects should not be delayed.” (Clark III 544)

February 21 — Project Twinkle, with the assistance of Land-Air, Inc., has set up its first operations post, manned by two observers who scan the sky over Holloman AFB, New Mexico, with theodolite, telescope, and camera. (Clark III 544; Thomas Tulien, ed., [Proceedings of the Sign Historical Group UFO History Workshop](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/Sign-Historical-Group-Workshop-Proceedings.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728676382&usg=AOvVaw2RaSLisJGT_-llje7Iqbuf), Sign Historical Group, November 2001, p. 45)

February 22 — Navy pilots and others see two glowing UFOs, confirmed by radar, above the Naval Air Station at Key West, Florida. A plane is sent to investigate but it is “hopelessly outdistanced.” After hovering momentarily at a high altitude (50 miles?), they speed away. (Donald E. Keyhoe, The Flying Saucers Are Real, Gold Medal, 1950, [p. 12](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/fsar/chI.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728676797&usg=AOvVaw1KvYIbP1qs2QwzKW1cqNXE); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728677001&usg=AOvVaw2Qv1wasa4qtcfGu70EkANf)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728677159&usg=AOvVaw3PiRLkU5fj_50xUR2aCCiY) p. 81)

February 24 — 7:30 p.m. USAF Cpl. [Lertis E. Stanfield](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/63307920/lertis-eugene-stanfield&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728677423&usg=AOvVaw3VxIPHW60S2s0mVbcx5Ned) and other Holloman AFB Photographic Branch project staff at an observation post at Datil, New Mexico, take five photos (using a Cineflex camera with 3-inch focal length lens) of a circular, luminous white object that changes to red and green. Its angular velocity is greater than 0.5°/min in azimuth calculated by [Lincoln LaPaz](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lincoln_LaPaz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728677669&usg=AOvVaw3IbwEmLAKSemJlUx1_OrkT)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lincoln_LaPaz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728677825&usg=AOvVaw0rWSgZojWNs0tKV_JnFyEU) The object moves in a smooth straight-line motion from about 8:00–9:30

p.m. to the west, blinking red and green. It disappears at high altitude. (NICAP, “[AFOSI Case 175; Datil](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/datil500224dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728678106&usg=AOvVaw0JLtXqTLBW4vRkk71QelY2) [Observation Post Photographs Object](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/datil500224dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728678298&usg=AOvVaw2JvJiDS9PNf9eD5npR1T9_)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728678567&usg=AOvVaw17dqXIDNlxIqhXKw1tFD_5)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728678730&usg=AOvVaw1WEsu5RuyjJ0md4iKOdIuk) p. 82)

February 26 — 2:45 p.m. Three witnesses observe a bronze-colored object that looks like two cigarette ashtrays placed face to face over Vancouver, British Columbia. It slows down as it passes overhead and wobbles as it moves along. (Chris Rutkowski, Canada’s UFOs: Declassified, August Night, 2022, p. 64)

March — James J. Rodgers is named a chief of Project Grudge. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728679160&usg=AOvVaw2w99192cGoK3siLM4DIWVv), p. 14)

March — Naval Commander [Robert Bright McLaughlin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/72103423/robert-bright-mclaughlin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728679452&usg=AOvVaw1CVDFUom-i0BQz1sofaUIZ), in charge of a team of Navy scientists at White Sands Proving Ground, New Mexico, writes about the [Charles B. Moore](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_B._Moore&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728679677&usg=AOvVaw0mQ8TSlDuELK_t8L3kzp54) sighting of April 24, 1949, in a True magazine article and speculates on saucer propulsion systems. McLaughlin writes that the saucers are indeed “spaceships from another planet, operated by animate, intelligent beings.” The Navy, having gotten a preview of the article, removes him from White Sands and gives him an assignment at sea aboard the destroyer [USS Bristol](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Bristol_(DD-857)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728680028&usg=AOvVaw3-VgCAKh6kkwn7B87-_knv). (Robert B. McLaughlin, “[How Scientists Tracked a Flying Saucer,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/datil500224dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728680315&usg=AOvVaw2QsOHiUnZm_mqFy1MHWAdx)” True, March 1950, pp. 25–27, 96–99; Ruppelt, [pp. 70–](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/70/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728680763&usg=AOvVaw1_a3uV8xKRLgooRrFYGwbj) [72](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/70/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728681096&usg=AOvVaw3V1thHfrPJnJeNKauDogXJ); Swords 94–95)

March — According to [Karl T. Pflock](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karl_T._Pflock&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728681428&usg=AOvVaw1Du99OWwD-ZFJS9llmfHA3)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karl_T._Pflock&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728681715&usg=AOvVaw08PyAozAIQHl8HmDD2H-9u) two CIA agents clandestinely visit Aztec, New Mexico, UFO crash storyteller [Silas Newton](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/127850405/silas-mason-newton&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728682077&usg=AOvVaw3fZmfYWNWVhEK3qAzU6C3W) and tell him that, although they know he is lying, they want him to continue spreading the tale as disinformation. The two agents later wind up involved in the Psychological Strategy Board created in 1951. (Kremlin 37–42)

March 3 — At Selfridge AFB \[now Selfridge Air National Guard Base\] near Mount Clemens, Michigan, a lone UFO causes multiple radar trackings and is logged at speeds up to 1,500 mph. (NICAP, “[Object Descends Vertically,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500303selfridge_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728682727&usg=AOvVaw1kNgruuabTtCJ0KjAeyoWd) [Levels Out](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500303selfridge_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728683035&usg=AOvVaw1uB-OuU7nJqiIx-U8-ko43)”; Patrick Gross, “[Selfridge AFB, Michigan, March 3, 1950](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/selfridge50.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728683395&usg=AOvVaw17H1rGj5ZdMSlw0g2y9UuQ)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728683734&usg=AOvVaw2Hp-lvO1EEjREsP5HJEusv), p. 83)

March 8 — Mid-morning. TWA pilot Capt. W. H. Kerr reports to the CAA that he and two other TWA pilots (D. W. Miller and [Malvern H. Rabeneck](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.terraceparkfuneralhome.com/notices/Malvern-Rabeneck&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728684228&usg=AOvVaw0nlZOeSUOwHg7kAKOmS-Nx)) are watching a UFO hovering at high altitude near Dayton, Ohio. The CAA has already received about 20 other reports about it from Vandalia, Ohio. ATIC control tower operators at Wright- Patterson AFB pick it up visually and on radar (“a good, solid target”). Four F-51 interceptors are sent up. They see it as a huge, round, metallic object, but clouds move in. The object climbs vertically out of sight at high speed.

* * *

ATIC calls it the planet Venus, with radar returns from ice-laden clouds. (NICAP, “[Three Aircraft Spot UFO /](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500308wright-pat_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728684866&usg=AOvVaw1Z1J1h_ApTfa0X4Ij8xrMN) [Radar Track at ATIC](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500308wright-pat_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728685196&usg=AOvVaw1zbFM34whQL3wssRro_5vX)”; UFOEv, [p. 84](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D96%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728685577&usg=AOvVaw2WDLAOR7TEdRUeK15NIM6N); Ruppelt, [pp. 72–75](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/72/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728685959&usg=AOvVaw1Ov9hS6mIXymyCow_j4gEJ); Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: Volume 5, January–](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1950-Jan-Mar.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728686329&usg=AOvVaw2jQpa7qUZvpVmeYnbNQLwG) [March 1950,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1950-Jan-Mar.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728686693&usg=AOvVaw05Fp-0zlM-9BNwIjJCUDPE) The Author, 1983, pp. 32–37)

March 9 — 7:45 p.m. A crew of three radar controllers at Selfridge Air Force Base \[now Selfridge Air National Guard Base\] near Mount Clemens, Michigan, is busy monitoring the night flying units of the 56th Fighter-Interceptor Group. 1st Lt. [Francis E. Parker](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/117698545/francis-everett-parker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728687272&usg=AOvVaw1KklTJGlJ6NDlbWZIHzQcZ)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/117698545/francis-everett-parker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728687600&usg=AOvVaw2z5orYEOP3G4XICYXhIIVX) 1st Lt. [Frank K. Mattson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/101130001/frank-kansas-mattson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728687967&usg=AOvVaw2VFCIkMxvShhbQ-eQIKqzj)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/101130001/frank-kansas-mattson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728688236&usg=AOvVaw03dK8VK_-yf_6ctJpGi5l0) Sgt. McCarthy, and Cpl. Melton observe an intermittent target on the height range indicator (HRI) scope of the CPS-4 radar at 47,000 feet altitude and higher. Further indications of what Parker describes as a well-defined, clear target like an aircraft are picked up with increasing regularity over the next 45–60 minutes. During this time, the target seems to stay in the area where the F-80s are flying, but 20,000 feet above them. The radar operators are monitoring two different systems—a CPS-5 radar operating on long-wave frequencies at 40,000 feet, and a CPS-4 radar operating on short-wave frequencies—and the target appears on both scopes simultaneously without fade. The speed varies from a hover in low-density air to nearly 1,500 mph, well in excess of the fastest operational jet at the time, and a climb rate of up to 7,000 feet per minute. (NICAP, “[The Selfridge AFB Incident](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500309selfridge_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728688657&usg=AOvVaw1wPMQgBNJPuBKlZL1UMEYN)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728688938&usg=AOvVaw1zuMn5lwsBhjSXyUm0Nx5n), p. 84; Hynek UFO Report, [pp. 123–](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/122/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728689191&usg=AOvVaw3Z38VRHnLqRVG6cJ6CHqUj) [125](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/122/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728689410&usg=AOvVaw0A598pLEMmYIOl5icA8Utj)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/122/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728689674&usg=AOvVaw0vIgYtSuwerYlpQpV69J2w) [295–297](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/294/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728689988&usg=AOvVaw1q5ZH3wG_33e2h77okVDPZ); Clark III 1047–1049; Martin L. Shough, “Radar and the UFO,” UFOs 1947–1987, Fortean Tomes, 1987, pp. 215–217)

March 10 — A publisher and others see a bright disc hover over Orangeburg, South Carolina, for 15 minutes. It speeds away, leaving a trail. (UFOEv, [p. 149](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D161%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728690634&usg=AOvVaw3CkPby9GYAld8-Zb83fv2Z))

March 13 — Early morning. Army Signal Corps (Reserve) Maj. Taylor in Clarksburg, California, is sleeping when an odd droning noise wakes him up. Going outside, he notices the noise is coming from a brilliant light in the sky, one- half the size of the full moon. It sways for about 15 minutes, then moves away. (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1950-Jan-Mar.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728691167&usg=AOvVaw3ARSi6F6Fsy3J-NuDPMkXv) [Volume 5, January–March 1950,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1950-Jan-Mar.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728691559&usg=AOvVaw3E_veO1M_kXV_3AzAbM6oZ) The Author, 1983, p. 49)

March 13 — Day. At the Central Airport in Mexico City, Mexico, Santiago Smith (weather observer for Mexicana de Aviación), J. de la Vega of the airport commander’s office, and others see a total of four UFOs passing overhead. Smith observes one of them through a theodolite, describing it as the shape of a “half-moon.” (UFOEv, [p. 44](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D56%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728692068&usg=AOvVaw0mpw6ErlSUMods2l_PWU6A); “[‘Saucers’ No Illusion: Hundreds See Shy Visitors,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93070351/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728692412&usg=AOvVaw28dNNPDf9I5k_GiTnI8xoT)” Oakland (Calif.) Tribune, March 14, 1950, p. 9; Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: Volume 5, January–March 1950,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1950-Jan-Mar.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728692899&usg=AOvVaw1TPb3835YNAdQrKMGKspcZ) The Author, 1983, pp. 50–51)

March 15 — An Air Force Captain Hall, flying in Guatemala, hears from other pilots at La Aurora Airport in Guatemala City that large, fast, and highly maneuverable objects have flown directly over the runway. The stories also appear in the local press. When Hall returns to Brookley Air Force Base \[now Mobile Aeroplex at Brookley\] in Mobile, Alabama, he is interrogated by a USAF intelligence officer and told: “Listen, there is no such thing as a flying saucer. You won’t discuss them.” (Swords 96)

March 16 — The efforts of [Kaplan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Kaplan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728693535&usg=AOvVaw0DfZy3dna43OkdmAhEGTqo) and Maj. [Oder](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nap.edu/read/12473/chapter/39&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728693889&usg=AOvVaw3cOBAvSapjtemFiL-r3Mqm) to start a fireball research project come to fruition when the AF Geophysical Research Directorate headed by Oder issues a letter directive authorizing Project Twinkle. A $20,000 half-year contract is signed with Land-Air, Inc. which operates the phototheodolites at White Sands, New Mexico. Land-Air is to set up a 24-hour watch at a location in New Mexico to be specified by the Air Force, and the phototheodolite operators at White Sands are to film any unusual objects that happen to fly past. The official contract gives April 1 as the starting date. ()

March 16 — Just before 12:00 noon. Chief Petty Officer Charles Lewis sees a flying disc streak across the sky at Naval Air Station Dallas \[later Grand Prairie Armed Forces Reserve Complex\] near Dallas, Texas. It buzzes a high- flying B-36. It hovers under the bomber for a moment, then flies off and disappears. NAS Commander Capt.

[Milton Adolphus Nation](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://valor.militarytimes.com/hero/21419&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728694577&usg=AOvVaw1hC_fiHHNM3N8MtndVmfM4) vouches for Lewis and says that the base tower operators had seen a UFO 10 days before. (NICAP, “[Disc Buzzes B-36](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500316dallas_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728694840&usg=AOvVaw2PkxlpInB2_p1-jkURf5Yt)”; “‘Flying Saucers’ Sighted by Two,” Dallas Morning News, March 18, 1950; Ruppelt, [p. 75](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/74/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728695135&usg=AOvVaw21UM4VgDnZUsCjtzvHUygI))

March 16–18 — 11 a.m.–noon. Former Army Engineer Capt. and Farmington Times business manager [Clayton J. Boddy](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/203856575/clayton-joseph-boddy&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728695517&usg=AOvVaw2AifBFIBHAwWWI7Z5EbGP9) [Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/203856575/clayton-joseph-boddy&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728695765&usg=AOvVaw2QjD3KuvTsDbM1KJyKMgMu) and dozens of others watch 12–15 shiny “saucer-like discs” cavorting around the sky over Farmington, New Mexico. They hover, then move in great bursts of speed. The objects appear three days in a row. (NICAP, “[The](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500316farmington_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728696178&usg=AOvVaw1qvNG91NcK5y_YVicFQeBh) [Farmington Invasion](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500316farmington_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728696519&usg=AOvVaw2rM0CklAklYUKGP0kb2JkS)”; Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: Volume 5, January–March 1950,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1950-Jan-Mar.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728696887&usg=AOvVaw1-1sa62h-_T4OruvKojll2) The Author, 1983, pp. 56–64; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728697277&usg=AOvVaw0SyvE24f3ya9qVW1c6pSYG)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728697554&usg=AOvVaw0kQw7a0lHeDZhbPPet6yk3) p. 84; James E. McDonald, “[Statement on Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23multiwit&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728697915&usg=AOvVaw3r50iAu8yTNRVPvJiwHoQU)” in Symposium on Unidentified Flying Objects, Hearings, US House Committee on Science and Astronautics, 90th Cong., 2nd Sess., July 29, 1968, pp. 47–48)

March 18 — 8:40 a.m. Private pilot Robert Fisher, flying a Beechcraft Bonanza over Bradford, Illinois, encounters an oval object with a metallic sheen. He can still see the object when it flies behind some thin clouds. It moves away at an estimated speed of 600–1,000 mph. (UFOEv, [p. 38](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D50%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728698383&usg=AOvVaw0mySs6-nXRJtfJXbn-8d7v))

March 18 — The USAF publicly denies that UFOs are secret missiles or space-exploration devices. (Donald E. Keyhoe,

The Flying Saucers Are Real, Gold Medal, 1950, [p. 13](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/fsar/chI.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728698747&usg=AOvVaw3s78Hgs45UmqFOD2GGtVtU))

* * *

March 20 — 9:26 p.m. Chicago and Southern Airlines Capt. [Jack Adams](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/169984401/jack-alvin-adams&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728699122&usg=AOvVaw0WTOFej25vidbCgD-qLn2E) and First Officer G. W. Anderson Jr., flying a DC-3 at 2,000 feet and heading west from Memphis, Tennessee, to Little Rock, Arkansas, see a circular disc 100 feet in diameter approximately over Hazen, Arkansas. In the top center of the object is an extremely bright light blinking at an estimated 3 flashes per second. The bottom of the object appears to have 9–12 symmetrical oval or circular portholes in a circle approximately 75% of the distance from the center to the outer edge. The object passes directly in front of the airliner at a distance of not more than 2,640 feet and approximately 1,000 feet higher than the airliner. They watch the object for 25–35 seconds. Adams estimates its speed is greater than 1,000 mph. (NICAP, “[DC-3 Encounters 100ʹ Disc](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500320littlerock_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728699568&usg=AOvVaw2ERE9jhRKd4bp3TyA3a1cN)”; Little Rock Arkansas Gazette, July 24, 1955; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728699916&usg=AOvVaw1rJT3jr22UM_Quud_YjILe), p. 85; Swords 95–96; Tom Howell YouTube channel, “[UFO from the 1950s,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v%3DLj3VL8MGiHw&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728700117&usg=AOvVaw3cEg8DpNyVo6PwkmxKo1Fw)” October 3, 2006)

March 21 — 1:00–1:30 p.m. Sergeant Woods at Sandia Base, New Mexico, reports four round, silvery objects to the northeast. The objects appear to be more maneuverable than any known aircraft. The maneuvers are similar to those in dogfights involving two aircraft, but there seems to be no similarity to a conventional plane. They make right-angle turns and reverse direction instantaneously. The duration is about 30 minutes. Other witnesses at Sandia and Kirtland AFB report similar observations. (NICAP, “[Base Personnel Sight Strange Objects](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500321kirtland_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728700414&usg=AOvVaw3gBgHpdcwStSyGg6KtaeA8)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728700635&usg=AOvVaw1oNnpB2etKxz_xNzY3yV1q), p. 85)

March 22 — 11:00 a.m. Eleven sergeants in the 4925th Test Group watch a UFO northwest of Kirtland AFB, New Mexico. The shape is “similar to a flying wing air craft and tan in color, turning to brown around the edges.” It first travels northwesterly at 25,000–30,000 feet, then turns north and disappears with a tremendous burst of speed. (NICAP, “[Atomic Test Group Witnesses UFO in Broad Daylight](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500322kirtland_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728700917&usg=AOvVaw0pGSAzKcJixSNdXD_0naEp)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728701102&usg=AOvVaw1_p8_IHgsC47ii06JWPfj7), p. 85)

March 22 —FBI agent [Guy L. Hottel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://gwsports.com/hof.aspx?hof%3D81&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728701348&usg=AOvVaw0POyKHNFEtoxNLrgK9Ma6C) writes to FBI headquarters about a rumor that three UFOs have crashed and are recovered in New Mexico. They are 50 feet in diameter and “each one was occupied by three bodies of human shape but only 3 feet tall, dressed in metallic cloth of a very fine texture. Each body was bandaged in a manner similar to the blackout suits used by speed flyers and test pilots.” It goes on, “According to Mr. \[redacted\], informant, the saucers were found in New Mexico due to the fact that the Government had a very high-powered radar set-up in that area and it is believed the radar interferes with the controlling \[sic\] mechanism of the saucers." The informant is probably [Silas M. Newton](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/127850405/silas-mason-newton&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728701814&usg=AOvVaw2IFc-p8faLIwV2Hjzt56ws) or [Leo GeBauer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/news-photo/leo-gebauer-and-silas-newton-flak-one-of-their-defense-news-photo/162001660&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728702207&usg=AOvVaw2BgpWxkBAAWiAULf8DNGSF). On March 25, 2013, the FBI issues a release saying that the Hottel memo was simply a second- or third-hand claim “that we never investigated. Some people believe the memo repeats a hoax that was circulating at that time, but the Bureau’s files have no information to verify that theory.” (Guy Hottel, “[Flying Saucers, Information Concerning,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://vault.fbi.gov/hottel_guy/Guy%2520Hottel%2520Part%25201%2520of%25201/view&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728702620&usg=AOvVaw1JH1M6Ps7ZDzto1QAIvj1T)” March 22, 1950; Richard H. Hall, Uninvited Guests, Aurora, 1988, pp. 326–327; Good Above, [p. 527](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/526/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728703124&usg=AOvVaw11tX9eRDFrijxh4eFA-DSS); Federal Bureau of Investigation, “[UFOs and the Guy](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.fbi.gov/news/stories/ufos-and-the-guy-hottel-memo&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728703519&usg=AOvVaw2tQRs6z6e3-VAH2-N4jPUO) [Hottel Memo,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.fbi.gov/news/stories/ufos-and-the-guy-hottel-memo&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728703891&usg=AOvVaw16KpxvrVb_td--KAcX-Ijd)” March 25, 2013; Robert L. Hastings, “[The March 22, 1950 FBI Memo on Crashed Flying](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ufohastings.com/index.php/articles/the-march-22-1950-fbi-memo-on-crashed-flying-saucers&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728704303&usg=AOvVaw3UIV-kcIjnTZPHTDHwpgc4) [Saucers,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ufohastings.com/index.php/articles/the-march-22-1950-fbi-memo-on-crashed-flying-saucers&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728704676&usg=AOvVaw1-0fP1oYKhNVAMY71gKDoj)” UFOs & Nukes, April 18, 2011)

March 26 — Vice-Admiral [Louis Mountbatten](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Louis_Mountbatten%252C_1st_Earl_Mountbatten_of_Burma&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728705162&usg=AOvVaw2caQ6N6XZczVVaVVHOzfhS)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Louis_Mountbatten%252C_1st_Earl_Mountbatten_of_Burma&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728705404&usg=AOvVaw2YjPCSlVT-gcuFfy_Uxf7U) in a letter to his friend [Charles Eade](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Eade&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728705699&usg=AOvVaw0HfOrOL5qjs7EgwZUJSIov)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Eade&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728705955&usg=AOvVaw2mNK5nSMfzDwujpXWE73iD) editor of the London Sunday Dispatch, rejects the idea that flying saucers are secret weapons, admitting that “they do not come from our Earth…. Maybe it is the Shackletons or Scotts of Venus or Mars who are making their first exploration of our Earth.” (UFOFiles2, [p. 37](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/the-ufo-files-the-inside-story-of-real-life-sightings-david-clarke/page/n63/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728706372&usg=AOvVaw0tbF9Rvj3iZ27ZjEfNxLEg))

March 26 — Day. [Bertram A. Totten](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/40112790/bertram-a-totten&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728706721&usg=AOvVaw1jTKyy_24TmtiEluscXq3n)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/40112790/bertram-a-totten&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728706995&usg=AOvVaw0nTABzBUxz621yueR9o_Ve) a clerk at the Library of Congress, is flying his plane at 5,000 feet over Fairfax County, Virginia, when he spots an aluminum-colored disc about 40 feet in diameter and 10 feet thick flying 1,000 feet below him. He dives toward it, but it speeds up into the overcast. It glints when the sun hits it, and he notices a vapor trail. (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: Volume 5, January–March 1950,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1950-Jan-Mar.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728707279&usg=AOvVaw0OMcG60t77aSAL5o777WbC) The Author, 1983, pp. 79–80)

March 26 — 4:00 p.m. Former First Lady [Eleanor Roosevelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eleanor_Roosevelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728707662&usg=AOvVaw0-tsOluGK5N58_hFxTHvr9) interviews airline pilots Jack Adams and G. W. Anderson about their March 20 UFO sighting on her NBC television program, Today with Mrs. Roosevelt. (“[Anatomy of a](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.saturdaynightuforia.com/html/articles/articlehtml/anatomyofahoax-part5.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728708248&usg=AOvVaw0cAfSZuIdglxX0SX1g4jjT) [Hoax, Part Five,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.saturdaynightuforia.com/html/articles/articlehtml/anatomyofahoax-part5.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728708635&usg=AOvVaw3GZyZ2wOMY-gWW_UtGAyVJ)” Saturday Night Uforia)

March 26 — 8:50 p.m. CAA Tower operator Marie H. Matthews and United Airlines employees Robert Higbee and Fred Hinkle see a brilliant light northeast of Hubbard Field \[now Reno–Tahoe International Airport\] outside Reno, Nevada. It hangs motionless for 5–6 minutes, then moves slowly across the sky with a green light on either side of it. It suddenly zooms upward into a cloud bank. (UFOEv, [pp. 44–45](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D56%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728709175&usg=AOvVaw0nJeACMNAWAu0uJw7nnk6u))

March 27 — 10:30 a.m. USAF antiaircraft radar operator Cpl. Bolfango tracks a stationary target on radar over the Motobu Peninsula, Okinawa, Japan, at 18 miles range for 10 minutes at 13,000 feet. The object then moves on a 220° heading for 16.9 miles in 2 minutes (about 500 mph) to a point over a mountain, where it is lost. (NICAP, “[Tracked Stationary Target at 18 Miles](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500327okinawadir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728709646&usg=AOvVaw0qT05u5NsF-yszpDKFVk9o)”; Sparks, p. 85)

March 27 — Radio broadcaster [Henry J. Taylor](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henry_J._Taylor&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728710129&usg=AOvVaw1Gz3lw07DWc4ngFqze0a7c)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henry_J._Taylor&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728710300&usg=AOvVaw04Z7xwDNICRjtbqP1lQSix) on his syndicated radio program Your Land and Mine, announces the “wonderful news” that saucers are in fact US secret weapons, which will reassure the nation when the US Air Force confirms it. Within days, the story is twisted to specifically credit the Navy’s alleged “top secret” project the Flying Flapjack Vought XF5U. The story is apparently disinformation planted by ex-Hollywood writers in the

CIA Office of Policy Coordination’s Political and Psychological Warfare staff headed by [Joseph Bryan III](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.encyclopediavirginia.org/Bryan_Joseph_III_1904-1993&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728710741&usg=AOvVaw2SIZmGjmaSL9gqvNe4llbp)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.encyclopediavirginia.org/Bryan_Joseph_III_1904-1993&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728710919&usg=AOvVaw0nlmMa9vu3wfaQjpE9XLc1) a future president and board chairman of NICAP. (“[Radio Man Certain U.S. Is Owner of ‘Flying Saucer’ Missile](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93072159/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728711127&usg=AOvVaw0tsx4daQ0iQ2SoRAof7f9M) [Secret,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93072159/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728711313&usg=AOvVaw2td-XS75au8GQ46Av6wQZk)” Miami (Fla.) News, March 29, 1950, p. 9; NICAP, “[1950 UFO Chronology](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/chronos/1950fullrep.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728711578&usg=AOvVaw2zPJ9GFZ0aG589RcsdsT9W)”; Swords 97; Curt Collins, “[1950 Disclosure: UFOs Are Made in the USA,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2018/11/1950-disclosure-ufos-are-made-in-usa.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728711815&usg=AOvVaw20x7uYfgdgdO7_-7XzYh6U)” November 9, 2018)

March 28 — In response to a request from [J. Edgar Hoover](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Edgar_Hoover&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728712072&usg=AOvVaw1WJi06bV0P46vjCSVgwpzv) to his aide [D. Milton (“Mickey”) Ladd](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://bhunt34.wordpress.com/2015/12/30/acme-press-photos/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728712303&usg=AOvVaw3uA9Mvwo92rTxy2vhqNvxG) on “just what are the facts re ‘flying saucers,’ agent [S. Wesley Reynolds](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://cdnc.ucr.edu/cgi-bin/cdnc?a%3Dd%26d%3DMT19611122.2.2%26e%3D-------en--20--1--txt-txIN--------1&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728712567&usg=AOvVaw03rqo3RVLi5bmR80_gE54e) interviews Maj. [Boggs](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Boggs_J.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728712832&usg=AOvVaw2xGj5OU1iz4cNm6D-belp5) and Lieut. Col. [John V. Hearn Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/36938515/john-vernon-hearn&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728713077&usg=AOvVaw2cb3UIkbUD_6co7F3tx6oH) of Air Force Intelligence, who tell him that most UFOs are misidentifications and weather balloons. (Swords 95; Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: Volume 5, January–March 1950,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1950-Jan-Mar.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728713350&usg=AOvVaw27Xv3K86bPsOi3umSNw0YU) The Author, 1983, pp. 84–85)

March 28 — [Samuel Eaton Thompson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Samuel_Eaton_Thompson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728713714&usg=AOvVaw2pYFeNvGdo-fg97y4mkHWH) is on his way home to Centralia, Washington, from Markham. He drives through a wooded area between Morton and Mineral and decides to stop to take a break. On foot, he comes upon a large, globe-shaped craft hovering above a clearing. Naked children with dark tans and blond hair are playing on steps that lead from an open door to the side of the UFO. Several naked adults—humanoid, attractive, and also deeply tanned—then appear at the ship’s door. After realizing that Thompson means them no harm, they beckon him closer. The crew consists of 20 adults and 25 children, the latter from about 5–15 years of age. Thompson claims to have spent the next 40 hours with the humanoids. They are from Venus, he learns, and have stopped at Earth despite the fact that other Venusian saucers have been shot at by Earth-based military forces. The Venusians further claims that they are vegetarian and that they never grow ill. Thompson also claims the Venusians are naïve and childlike; they do not know who has built their flying saucers and seem to possess little to no curiosity. He goes back to get a camera and tries to take photos, but the object is too bright to appear on film. Thompson returns home on March 30. (“Centralian Tells Strange Tale of Visiting Venus Space Ship in Eastern Lewis County,” Centralia (Wash.) Daily Chronicle, April 1, 1950; Clark III 1127–1129; Jerome Clark, “The Coming of the Venusians,” Fate 34, no. 1 (January 1981): 49–55; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1950-03-28-usa-centralia.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728714483&usg=AOvVaw0PdR4-BWSMMEiY1LjjvPNm)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1950-03-28-usa-centralia.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728714668&usg=AOvVaw2NHZB4uh04LGpULG-JilUE) November 16, 2018)

March 31 — Syndicated columnist [Drew Pearson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drew_Pearson_(journalist)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728714936&usg=AOvVaw3x9h3f5lCoD3yh6ynqwFDO) publishes “Worried about Flying Saucers?” in which he sympathizes with the Air Force, which has to reply to groundless public excitement. His USAF contact has told him, “there ain’t no such animal.” Pentagon Public Relations Officer Maj. [DeWitt Searles](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DeWitt_Searles&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728715170&usg=AOvVaw0Am5LnaHhnEa2acmbmLva0) tells the press that all UFO cases are the result of misinterpretations, mass hysteria, and hoaxes: “As far as the Air Force goes, there’s no such thing as a flying saucer.” (Drew Pearson, “[Worried about Flying Saucers?](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92526588/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728715398&usg=AOvVaw0Id0ZhOE1_iaTphGrNq8gZ)” Honolulu Star-Bulletin, March 31, 1950, p. 5; “[Major Debunker of Flying Saucers, Keeps Saying, ‘No, No, 1,000 Times No,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92525956/the-rock-island-argus/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728715689&usg=AOvVaw0sLcpbCLU699Z_Mmo0yIPt)’” Rock Island (Ill.) Argus, March 31, 1950, p. 18; Swords 96–99)

Spring — Commander Augusto Vars Ortega of the Chilean Navy takes about 1,200 feet of color film of UFOs—one above the other, turning at tremendous speeds—in Antarctica. When NICAP asks the Chilean Embassy about the film in 1956, it tells [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728716082&usg=AOvVaw1rxYEsmOo1pte10ENmglLc) that the film is classified and not available. (Dan Lloyd, “[Things Are Hotting Up in](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1965%252CSep-Oct%252CV%252011%252CN%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728716327&usg=AOvVaw3B6iIegmcP4d5-0D8fzwVr) [the Antarctic,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1965%252CSep-Oct%252CV%252011%252CN%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728716546&usg=AOvVaw3hHg-w9E9pZnwZ93Gskuqb)” Flying Saucer Review 2, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1965): 5)

April — Daytime. While working on her lawn in Canby, Oregon, Ellen Jonerson glances over at her neighbor’s yard and sees a 12-inch-tall man with his back turned to her. When he turns around, she sees that he has a heavily tanned face, is of stocky build, and wears overalls and a plaid shirt. There is a skullcap on his head. She dashes inside to call a friend, then runs outside again in time to see the figure “waddling” away. He walks under a parked car and disappears. [Kenneth Arnold](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenneth_Arnold&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728716926&usg=AOvVaw1JHQyQ61q5sa-ZDdoFIz7x)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenneth_Arnold&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728717086&usg=AOvVaw1ht5JyfeBNP8fsJPVIjTZp) who interviews her, is convinced of her sincerity. (Center for UFO Studies, [HUMCAT Index, 1950–1951,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/HUMCAT/HUMCAT_Index_1950-1951.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728717301&usg=AOvVaw2vDos4LYjUlYAkuhY88Hju) p. 2; Clark III 270)

April 1 — Project Twinkle officially begins. ()

April 4 — Presidential press secretary [Charlie Ross](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charlie_Ross_(journalist)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728717644&usg=AOvVaw0emUd-PUeeCvquXAfRwi4y) states that [Truman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_S._Truman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728717931&usg=AOvVaw2yEDHkkpbYYldKoJUlAyhT) has conferred with his two top military advisers, Rear Adm. [Robert Dennison](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Dennison_(United_States_Navy_officer)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728718178&usg=AOvVaw26BVUJxX__TNHiYiCoAP02) and Brig. Gen. [Robert B. Landry](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/106440/major-general-robert-b-landry/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728718573&usg=AOvVaw3oJPhPSujkonXGA1orOMvJ), and that they claim the US has no such technology. Furthermore, the Air Force study has concluded there are no such things as flying saucers. Caltech aeronautics professor [Clark Blanchard Millikan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clark_Blanchard_Millikan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728718967&usg=AOvVaw12ffwdXuGsrifd4aj09tlP) agrees, saying: “If anyone should know about such a project, I should know—and I know of no development in the aircraft or guided missile field.” (Swords 97–99)

April 5 — Sen. [Richard Russell Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Russell_Jr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728719487&usg=AOvVaw2ZZgymDfXEvM4MMlwJRHo1) (D-Ga.) states to the press that he is “completely baffled” by flying saucer reports that are made by many pilots who would not be fooled by hallucinations or clouds. Sen. [Millard Tydings](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Millard_Tydings&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728719924&usg=AOvVaw0UgSQlDrbk2ro2CqI-G8MA) (D-Md.), chair of the Armed Services Committee, says he thinks saucers might be experimental US aircraft “in embryo stage.” Rep. [Albert J. Engel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albert_J._Engel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728720313&usg=AOvVaw3KoeahEolLq0McIWC8oerF) (R-Mich.) thinks the same. Sen. [Kenneth S. Wherry](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenneth_S._Wherry&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728720718&usg=AOvVaw0AXHZXk6uOZfKal53OUgCb) (R-Neb.) says the saucers are “like our foreign policy. It is in a state of confusion and no one seems to know what it is all about.” (“[Congress](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93077613/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728721111&usg=AOvVaw2BUy6ltgOkK7DO5AdI3o8H) [Split](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93077613/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728721427&usg=AOvVaw11D8iQ2a9uK22asv6UNQOO) [about Saucers,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93077743/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728721770&usg=AOvVaw2-1hYyFGJs-56uiynRAsWk)” Miami (Fla.) News, April 5, 1950, pp. 1, 6; Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: Volume 6,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1950-Apr-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728722236&usg=AOvVaw08hPb0azI6PNSqB9qUS62I) [April–July 1950](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1950-Apr-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728722598&usg=AOvVaw0zL7ZuVIFSIlkvvMugkF3g)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1950-Apr-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728722888&usg=AOvVaw2wneozt_DhrQYo5ou9SjPt) The Author, 1990, pp. 9–10; Swords 98)

April 6 — 4:45 p.m. Lt. [John J. Sevila](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/117282898/john-j.-sevila&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728723440&usg=AOvVaw0w--sshHoyBWcIIfceVFFl)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/117282898/john-j.-sevila&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728723737&usg=AOvVaw1u8fPjePcTAs2o4T6UwsXu) a pilot with the 131st Fighter Squadron, hears a sound like a flight of jet airplanes and rushes out of his house in Springfield, Massachusetts, to see them. Instead, he sees a perfectly circular object moving slowly westward at an altitude of 25,000 feet. He watches it for 5 minutes as it moves at a speed of 50–

* * *

100 mph. When the sun hits it directly, it shines like a mirror. (The Thunderbolt 1, no. 12 (April 1950): 5; Jan Aldrich)

April 7 — A CAA control tower operator at Logan Airport in Boston, Massachusetts, watches a blue light split into two lights that revolve around each other for 10 minutes. (Hynek UFO Report, [pp. 65–68](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/64/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728724646&usg=AOvVaw3M2SIKuzk4BtSmW0QP_Kt8); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728724970&usg=AOvVaw0IkTM9FSLEfaGMBD600ZXc)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728725215&usg=AOvVaw1Ks-QUHAVhl84eIi3MPtVV) p. 86)

April 7 — Newsman [Edward R. Murrow](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_R._Murrow&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728725652&usg=AOvVaw2kIK8V0O0qtORZsddGZwq2) produces the first extended TV commentary on UFOs, “The Case of the Flying Saucer” on CBS. He begins with the [Kenneth Arnold](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenneth_Arnold&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728726057&usg=AOvVaw2cLCgCvluWml6RQLOfLu9h) case, mentions Muroc AFB cases and [Mantell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/14958603/thomas-francis-mantell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728726477&usg=AOvVaw2dQjJWdSzjiZoGJD17YIjC), and quotes both True magazine and [Donald Menzel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Howard_Menzel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728726770&usg=AOvVaw2Y4-GRosfCjt0EH3QEJBax)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Howard_Menzel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728726939&usg=AOvVaw2dCfFt3EZRJrCG7DG5rBZA) Also on the show are [Henry J. Taylor](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henry_J._Taylor&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728727188&usg=AOvVaw0xY6fb3LAmkVqBImKa6wcR)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henry_J._Taylor&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728727354&usg=AOvVaw3sUS6k2JZ3JGCXR2-CgP5I) engineer [Charles H. Zimmerman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_H._Zimmerman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728727557&usg=AOvVaw3XUlOPAz2gUYz7w4DXsFyI), and [Charlie Ross](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charlie_Ross_(journalist)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728727761&usg=AOvVaw0jhRjZNucgS8InvKbdkp5x)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charlie_Ross_(journalist)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728727925&usg=AOvVaw23C0WyesbLi0kOqKbGErtQ) as well as people on the street. (“[Transcript of Ed Murrow–Kenneth Arnold Telephone](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter/1984-85_CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter_V5.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728728156&usg=AOvVaw2QIsIkiPsh9HAryZLVgKz-) [Conversation,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter/1984-85_CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter_V5.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728728373&usg=AOvVaw2hasb5VGqTaERAm6xzLn0K)” CUFOS Associate Newsletter 5, no. 1 (Feb./March 1984): 3; Edward R. Murrow, “[The Case of the](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v%3DhVvz8ebUeSk&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728728642&usg=AOvVaw2EaKEOnS6ioHH00BzICmll) [Flying Saucer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v%3DhVvz8ebUeSk&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728728832&usg=AOvVaw3HzfKo0GKWOkl2pRZ4QJsA) \[audio only\],” Bryce Zabel YouTube channel, February 24, 2018)

April 7 — US News and World Report comes out with a story on saucers that hints they are top-secret, jet-propelled Navy aircraft “that can outfly other planes.” (“[Flying Saucers—the Real Story: U.S. Built First One in 1942,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.flickr.com/photos/34917706%2540N07/7114216827/in/photostream/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728729225&usg=AOvVaw1iTd-UKLPgneuqDyFs9PIw)” US News and World Report 28, no. 14 (April 7, 1950): 13–15; Michael D. Swords, “Balloons, Missiles, and UFOs,” IUR 29, no. 1 (Spring 2004): 18)

April 7 — The National Security Council presents President [Truman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_S._Truman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728729609&usg=AOvVaw3ptUMuXWOjheiyIco9UIdn) with Report 68 (NSC-68), a 56-page top secret policy paper that provides the “blueprint for the militarization of the Cold War.” It advocates a large expansion in the military budget, the development of a hydrogen bomb, and increased military aid to US allies for the containment of Communist expansion. It essentially warns Truman that the US is losing the Cold War. Truman does not approve it until 1951. (Wikipedia, “[NSC-68](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NSC_68&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728729867&usg=AOvVaw2L4b3hWLdP3W4w9enodRd0)”)

April 8 — [Paul Limerick](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/41728149/paul-r-limerick&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728730184&usg=AOvVaw0LW0TVkVJZquTIJS5qo2_N), commander of the Veterans of Foreign Wars in Shelby, North Carolina, watches a round, aluminum-colored object with four other people for 2 minutes. It follows a horizontal course toward the southwest without making a sound, then shoots straight up and disappears. (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: Volume 6,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1950-Apr-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728730416&usg=AOvVaw3sRgw7u1aCsaEg5QSfgAsz) [April–July 1950](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1950-Apr-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728730634&usg=AOvVaw0Zt-hUoh7tRr_pIoiSvJD6)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1950-Apr-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728730819&usg=AOvVaw0G1UvGVzQbjZRaogHXgr-c) The Author, 1990, p. 13)

April 10 — 7:00 p.m. Several University of California, Berkeley, graduate students, including [Garniss H. Curtis](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Garniss_Curtis&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728731104&usg=AOvVaw2-3BLK2DOV86J4c7UbQNWV), [Robert](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.legacy.com/obituaries/santacruzsentinel/obituary.aspx?n%3Drobert-scott-creely%26pid%3D148482398&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728731326&usg=AOvVaw2T_Mac1Xwx6kGo-eeaqPzo) [Scott Creely](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.legacy.com/obituaries/santacruzsentinel/obituary.aspx?n%3Drobert-scott-creely%26pid%3D148482398&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728731558&usg=AOvVaw1pL7iOYctOuDhIuGcSQhu6), and [Louis I. Briggs](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://lsa.umich.edu/earth/about-us/faculty-history/louis-i--briggs.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728731780&usg=AOvVaw0VLMUCtgWfNf8LlxSCubly)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://lsa.umich.edu/earth/about-us/faculty-history/louis-i--briggs.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728731956&usg=AOvVaw27bkUCH3prteoM7pgxjU3Q) watch a bright light moving against the wind at about 10–15 mph at 1,500 feet altitude about 3–4 miles away from Berkeley, California, for two hours. It turns slowly to the south then turns around and heads slowly back. Four high school students in Monterey, California, see a gleaming object over San Francisco in the early afternoon. (NICAP case file; “[Saucer Visits San Francisco, Schoolboys Say,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93087065/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728732173&usg=AOvVaw3O8jU_9o3tTq5-uoOpN5LT)” Los Angeles Times, April 12, 1950, p. 17)

April 14 — RAND Corporation writer Jean M. Hungerford writes a 32-page research memorandum for the US Air Force titled “The Exploitation of Superstitions for Purposes of Psychological Warfare.” She uses recent examples of religious miracles that were used in Western propaganda, as well as horoscopes, chain letters, and folklore. (Jean

M. Hungerford, “[The Exploitation of Superstitions for Purposes of Psychological Warfare,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.rand.org/content/dam/rand/pubs/research_memoranda/2008/RM365.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728732581&usg=AOvVaw2NnosxbqFaJpzIYg3ApQh_)” USAF Project Rand Research Memorandum, RM-35, April 14, 1950)

April 17 — Newsweek publishes an article, “Flying Saucers Again,” on crashed saucers. (“Flying Saucers Again,”

Newsweek, April 17, 1950, p. 29)

April 17 — More than 15 people report seeing a UFO for 20 minutes at 2,000 feet on the eastern horizon at Los Alamos, New Mexico. One scientist watches the object through a telescope and says it looks flat, circular, metallic, and roughly 9 feet in diameter. It moves faster than any conventional aircraft. (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1950-Apr-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728733067&usg=AOvVaw1F60rMnhtxLH6JfAGrbpWU) [Volume 6, April–July 1950](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1950-Apr-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728733274&usg=AOvVaw3pLTIm0iReLyrNldPW7XdA)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1950-Apr-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728733446&usg=AOvVaw2knVFdxFP4kyernwg1Y_2J) The Author, 1990, p. 26; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728733667&usg=AOvVaw2Vz4JOoxxLy_rq2wHUuAkv), p. 86)

April 24 — 10:00 p.m. Bruno Facchini steps outside his house on the outskirts of Abbiate Guazzone, Varese, Italy, and notices something flashing near a power line. He goes to investigate and encounters a landed disc with an open door and steps leading down. Three or four men in diving suits and helmets are inside. One seems to be welding a pipe. Facchini speaks to them, but they respond with growling sounds. One points a small “camera” at him that emits a beam that knocks him over. Facchini lies still while the repairs are completed, and the UFO takes off. (Pino Carminati Ghidelli, “[Un Diaco è Atterrato,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Italy/Notiziario%2520UFO%2520(CUN)/Notiziario%2520UFO%2520-%25201971%252001-02%2520No%252037.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728733998&usg=AOvVaw0mNdlCtNjNAUKl02ZHCKuW)” Notiziario UFO, no. 37 (Jan./Feb. 1971): 19–22; Antonio Giudici, “[The Case of Bruno Facchini,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201974%2520V%252020%2520N%25206.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728734274&usg=AOvVaw3P4-Yj_X5rrA8tAsHp549X)” Flying Saucer Review 20, no. 6 (April 1975): 30–32; Ezio Barnardini, “[Facchini: Un CE3 Rivisitato,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Italy/Notiziario%2520UFO%2520(CUN)/Notiziario%2520UFO%2520-%25201985%252003-1986%252001%2520-%2520Vol%252020-21%2520No%2520104.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728734603&usg=AOvVaw2iuNimvP-PwIq55v23BSis)” Notiziario UFO, no. 104 (March 1985/Jan. 1986): 4–7; Clark III 267; Marcus Lowth, “[Bruno Facchini’s Extraterrestrial Encounter in Varese, Italy,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ufoinsight.com/aliens/encounters/bruno-facchinis-extraterrestrial-encounter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728734909&usg=AOvVaw1bpEtDVXnJG-qiTxHQlX7s)” UFO Insight, September 5, 2020; 1Pinotti 30–40; Patrick Gross, “[Abbiate Guazzone, Italy, April 24, 1950](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/abbiateguazzone.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728735125&usg=AOvVaw01KImjNF055RqbKXAdwA4z)”)

April 25 — Early morning. Military security patrols at the deactivated Dugway Proving Ground in western Utah view a series of unusual lights and objects moving above an ammunition storage area. One object is “surrounded by an aura of spears of light jutting diagonally from the main body.” (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History, Volume 6:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1950-Apr-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728735424&usg=AOvVaw1zHAGSQ58I64dgB9fxgiRM) [April–July 1950](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1950-Apr-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728735641&usg=AOvVaw2JpZYEqwklhwQunvPBO-sg)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1950-Apr-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728735817&usg=AOvVaw0jVZTMTM424HRKWU_fR4g8) The Author, 1990, p. 34)

April 25 — 3:00 p.m. Enrique Hausmann Muller takes a film of a bright, circular UFO with rays of flame spinning off its edge in a pinwheel fashion in Montuïri, Majorca, Balearic Islands, Spain. Probable hoax. (UFOEv, [p. 88](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D100%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728736172&usg=AOvVaw30K8YJSvPC0PBkUHq-SoF_); Loren E.

April 27 — While preparing for an MX-776A Shrike air-to-ground missile test at White Sands Proving Ground, New Mexico, Charles Riggs, a member of the Project Twinkle cinetheodolite camera crew supplied by Land-Air Inc., sees, tracks, and manages to film four high-flying objects streaking across the sky. Another station also tracks the objects. The photos show only a smudgy dark object, but the triangulation results in a calculation by mathematician Wilbur L. Mitchell and Capt. Perry Bryant of the objects’ size as 30 feet in diameter and 150,000 feet in altitude. (NICAP, “[Cinetheodolite Film Taken by Tracking Station](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500427whitesands_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728737674&usg=AOvVaw22nmR0NadR-AlLCAK3i3zK)”; Ruppelt, [p. 88](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/88/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728737928&usg=AOvVaw3tZS7puHT4wqRkGpXleifZ); Clark III 544–545; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728738128&usg=AOvVaw0WClCyRJYh7CmEX5-ip-4Z)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728738282&usg=AOvVaw1D2uM5_IzwA7uIxoXhjcSa) p. 88; Thomas Tulien, ed., [Proceedings of the Sign Historical Group UFO History Workshop](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/Sign-Historical-Group-Workshop-Proceedings.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728738489&usg=AOvVaw3mzAftARHP_OxGSUCL0jTc), Sign Historical Group, November 2001, p. 44; Good Above, [pp. 354–355](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/abovetopsecretwo00good/page/354/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728738740&usg=AOvVaw0VJb8X4lVKqJnsx8ggb_Yc); Bruce Maccabee, “The White Sands Films,” IUR 21, no. 1 (Spring 1996): 22–25)

April 27 — 8:25 p.m. TWA Flight 117 pilot Capt. [Robert Adickes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.latimes.com/archives/la-xpm-1988-01-05-fi-33312-story.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728739072&usg=AOvVaw0QRolj7eTB82R6qZOaFWBd) and Flight Officer Robert F. J. Fitzgerald and S. N. Miller) also see the object. It veers off at 400 mph, drops down to 1,500 feet, and disappears. Reisinger](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/194896161/william-j-reisinger&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728741448&usg=AOvVaw0lDOsVi04jR3WGyuoosKLd), and three enlisted men of the 625th Aircraft and Warning Squadron at Elmendorf AFB \[now Joint Base Elmendorf-Richardson\], Anchorage, Alaska, see a reddish-orange object hovering in the sky for 5 minuites. May 11 —7:30 p.m. [Evelyn Trent](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/84284227/evelyn-mae-trent&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728742010&usg=AOvVaw2Z4y1kaPxQKcB7jJMPcmr_)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/84284227/evelyn-mae-trent&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728742183&usg=AOvVaw3v6SI4ktsusVq2HGXYWzgX) who lives on a farm nine miles from McMinnville, Oregon \[near Sheridan, Oregon\], is walking back to her farmhouse after feeding rabbits. Before reaching the house, she sees a slow-moving, metallic disk-shaped object heading in her direction from the northeast. She yells for her husband [Paul](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/84283949/paul-arthur-trent&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728742427&usg=AOvVaw27ueXgG9O0peRx4N7NNkzZ), who is inside the house; he comes out and also sees the object. After a short time, he goes back inside to get a camera and manages to take two photos of the object before it speeds away to the west. Paul Trent’s father briefly sees the object before it flies away. The Trents assume they have seen some exotic military aircraft. They do not develop the film in the camera until they use it up and show the photos only to a few friends. Eventually it reaches the cover of Life magazine, but the Trents show no desire to make any money from the photos. Although the Colorado project initially thinks the photos seem genuine, three Interface Pilote pour l’Analyse de Clichés d’OVNIs researchers in 2013–2015 claim to find evidence of a model suspended from a string. Researcher [Brad Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Brad_Sparks.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728742741&usg=AOvVaw1t_oeA5VRbtNLD-NyT_mso) finds major mathematical and scientific errors in IPACO’s work, which actually supports a UFO conclusion. May 15 — Afternoon. Architect Enrique Carotenuto Bossa is driving in an isolated region in Bahía Blanca Partido (possibly between Macachín and Estación Hidalgo Ferrocarril Sarmiento), La Pampa, Argentina, when he sees a metallic disc resting on the ground to the left of the highway. He stops the car to investigate, approaches it, and sees an open door in its side. He goes inside and sees a “curved divan with three seats, two of which were occupied by small beings covered from head to foot (except for an opening for the face (in a kind of tight-fitting overall of a brown color.” The bodies are about 4 feet tall, and their faces seem charred or burnt. In front of them is a screen with “rays playing on it,” and on top of the screen is a rotating globe. The engineer runs out and drives back to his hotel. He returns the next day with two companions and finds only an ash heap. But they look up and see three UFOs—one a cigar-shaped object and two discs, hovering above them at 1,800 feet. The discs merge

with the cigar and speed away. (El Universal (Caracas, Venezuela), May 7, 1955; “[Man Enters Grounded Disc,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201955%252008%252000%2520-%2520August_%2528underlinings%2529.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728747968&usg=AOvVaw35P1cQSfiXt0fGD-UiIdIG)” APRO Bulletin, August 1955, pp. 1–3; Clark III 327–328; Willy Smith, “The Curious Case of the Argentine Crashed Saucer,” IUR 11, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1986): 18–19; Roberto E. Banchs and Richard W. Heiden, “Crash Landing in the Pampas,” IUR 24, no. 2 (Summer 1999): 4–10, 30; Roberto Banchs, “[General Acha (LP): Un](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://marcianitosverdes.haaan.com/2009/07/general-acha-lp-un-accidentado-aterrizaje-primera-parte/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728748395&usg=AOvVaw3vYyblopfAPvlNHcqqCu_P) [Accidentado Aterrizaje (Priemra Parte),](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://marcianitosverdes.haaan.com/2009/07/general-acha-lp-un-accidentado-aterrizaje-primera-parte/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728748634&usg=AOvVaw2XAE9ZIg1qgWvr6wUdmp1l)” Marcianitos Verdes, July 4, 2009)

May 20 — 12:15 p.m. Meteorologist [Seymour L. Hess](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seymour_Hess&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728748889&usg=AOvVaw16mo02bnh4TQozxjvDfgRQ) is strolling the grounds of Lowell Observatory in Flagstaff, Arizona, when he notices a round, gray-colored object approaching from the southeast at about 12,000 feet altitude.
