May 21 — 3:50 p.m. T/Sgt Edward Eles, [Earl DuQuoin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/88216492/earl-e.-duquoin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728750792&usg=AOvVaw0HY9DFsItWJ1hB95qwBaEk)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/88216492/earl-e.-duquoin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728750960&usg=AOvVaw2HK_EuL1WbOdbaxtxOTRpW) and four other airmen of the 187th Fighter Squadron of the Wyoming National Guard are on the airfield at the Municipal Airport in Cheyenne, Wyoming, when they see a V- shaped formation of four round, pure-white discs flying in a northerly direction. In a matter of seconds, the objects change formation and make a sharp right-angle turn, flying single file, and speed out of sight. (Cheyenne Wyoming State Tribune, May 22, 1950, p. 1)

May 24 — During an MX-674 Tarzon controllable vertical bomb test at Holloman AFB, New Mexico, Floyd Fannon and other USAF crew members see eight unidentified objects. They separately track and film two of the objects down the North American Aviation missile firing range. Project Twinkle cinetheodolite station P-8 films one object to the northeast for 6 frames (1.0 sec) moving uniformly to the south. Cinetheodolite station P-10, located 5.7 miles down range to the north from P-8 and 7 feet higher, films another object, hence no triangulation is possible. (NICAP, “[Cinetheodolite Film Taken by Tracking Station](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500427whitesands_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728751374&usg=AOvVaw1eyw-dxNxGi_XKcl9XBGlD)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728751579&usg=AOvVaw2pcBLnnCppHpO5FRn0-bKA), p. 91; Good Above, [pp. 354–355](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/abovetopsecretwo00good/page/354/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728751784&usg=AOvVaw0VJDd58Mhzlwm7VzJTcloA); Bruce Maccabee, “The White Sands Films,” IUR 21, no. 1 (Spring 1996): 22–25)

May 25 — Lt. Col. [Doyle Rees](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/43562489/doyle-rees&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728752131&usg=AOvVaw34cEy8CsPsNzCQZGMaOp8R) of the USAF Office of Special Investigations writes a confidential memo to Brig. Gen. [Joseph F. Carroll](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/107471/lieutenant-general-joseph-francis-carroll/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728752392&usg=AOvVaw1HB6QTmhzpek8PSGPiiAol)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/107471/lieutenant-general-joseph-francis-carroll/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728752598&usg=AOvVaw3n4jbzZFLK5TQWeDPgeQXM) Director of Special Investigations. In part, it states: “In a liaison meeting with other military and government intelligence and investigative agencies in December 1948, it was determined that the frequency of unexplained aerial phenomena in the New Mexico area was such that an organized plan of reporting these observations should be undertaken. The organization and physical location of units of this District were most suitable for collecting these data, therefore, since December 1948, this District has assumed the responsibility for collecting and reporting basic information with respect to aerial phenomena in this general area.” (NICAP, “[Summary of Observations of Aerial Phenomena, New Mexico Area, Dec 1949 to May 1950](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/waves/500525doc.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728752843&usg=AOvVaw23E2NbTB7s1PeKALWeSqe5)”)

May 29 — 9:20 p.m. Capt. [Willis T. Sperry](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/500529_Willis_T.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728753101&usg=AOvVaw1BfQoByot2BAmaA67TxN5g)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/500529_Willis_T.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728753259&usg=AOvVaw0HJ_kIgThNZe1BQjadSV7i) copilot Bill Gates, flight engineer [Robert Arnholt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/135568763/robert-carl-arnholt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728753461&usg=AOvVaw0C1uSRGa8ETar13fsO_aml), a stewardess, and several passengers on an American Airlines DC-6 airliner headed southwest out of Washington, D.C., en route to Nashville, Tennessee, are flying at 7,500 feet at 250 mph. About 7 miles west of Mount Vernon, Virginia, Gates alerts Sperry to a bright blue or bluish light ahead of them and increasing in size. Sperry makes an evasive 45° turn to the right and the object passes from 11 o’clock to 7 o’clock position to the left at a slightly higher altitude. The light very briefly passes between the aircraft and the upper part of the moon, revealing an object with a long silhouette (somewhat reminiscent of a submarine) without visible wings or empennage. The blue light is on the front of the object. Sperry turns left back onto his original course to get the object back in view, but it apparently stays stationary for about 30 seconds. Gates then notices the object circling around to the right side. Sperry banks right again, while the object paces the airliner about 20–30 seconds before it climbs to the east at a 30° angle at “fantastic” speed and disappears. (Wikipedia, “[Sperry UFO Case](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sperry_UFO_case&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728753736&usg=AOvVaw0NJ2JyeZdHJrB1js_C_lgV)”; NICAP, “[Capt. Willis Sperry Sighting](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500529mtvernon_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728753925&usg=AOvVaw0hAEMq-IbWz5uBF1yhbFBp)”; Loren

E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: Volume 6, April–July 1950](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1950-Apr-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728754192&usg=AOvVaw2k6IlsJrwgUsd4QHsAxCBz)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1950-Apr-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728754365&usg=AOvVaw3wmd3a5qG3S6JDENx4XMl7) The Author, 1990, pp. 52–53; Project 1947, “[UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1950b.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728754599&usg=AOvVaw3tIroN4VD49dIdgICpzSZA) [Reports 1950](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1950b.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728754784&usg=AOvVaw1354pk3wy0zYGk2KAFkPSC)”; Sparks, p. 91)

May 29 — A shiny, bright object streaking across the sky is spotted by two cine-theodolite stations at White Sands Missile Range, New Mexico, just before firing a test missile. The object is tracked and photographed by both stations. After the films are developed, it turns out that the stations had photographed different objects. Analysts estimate that the objects were higher than 40,000 feet, traveling more than 2,000 mph, and over 300 feet in diameter. (Ruppelt, [p. 89](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/88/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728755434&usg=AOvVaw0uFgRO8koGuRyjMdXBgkaS); Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: Volume 6, April–July 1950](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1950-Apr-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728755663&usg=AOvVaw1MTSol1ZomZNQUai5wCda8), The Author, 1990, p. 36)

Summer — Physicist [Enrico Fermi](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enrico_Fermi&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728756029&usg=AOvVaw2OyMD39rGfiUBGaqbT9G8R) first formulates the “Fermi Paradox” during a casual conversation (in Los Alamos, New Mexico?) with fellow physicists [Edward Teller](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Teller&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728756291&usg=AOvVaw3UfOaRng3jrl67L0_CX0gH)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Teller&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728756457&usg=AOvVaw2G_Sd0-DCw2lz-gJDkEynG) [Herbert York](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Herbert_York&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728756648&usg=AOvVaw1V3P-bZ8vK0wPH3ZdYjST-)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Herbert_York&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728756806&usg=AOvVaw2PEsVYROTmG73flZlrOOHk) and [Emil Konopinski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emil_Konopinski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728757029&usg=AOvVaw0iYRfajJ9ZY3dAPDExL1tp)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emil_Konopinski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728757231&usg=AOvVaw34y9xIlGh6qu2_IXe5Z9DY) While walking to

* * *

lunch, the men discuss recent UFO reports and the possibility of faster-than-light travel. The conversation moves on to other topics, until during lunch Fermi allegedly says suddenly, “But where is everybody?” (although the exact quote is uncertain). (Wikipedia, “[Enrico Fermi](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enrico_Fermi&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728757811&usg=AOvVaw2XLwbWIVfD3LDBS88ToIMd)”)

Summer — Evening. An 8- or 10-foot-disc lands in a field behind Mrs. Mason Vaughan’s house in Beaverdam, Virginia. From an open cockpit a “man with unusual goggles or headpiece” looks out. Surprised, the disc takes off abruptly, breaking off a limb from an oak tree on the way up. (Clark III 267; Center for UFO Studies, [HUMCAT Index](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/HUMCAT/HUMCAT_Index_1950-1951.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728758114&usg=AOvVaw1fzyBLUEDDOipEUIv8PNvV) [1950–1951,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/HUMCAT/HUMCAT_Index_1950-1951.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728758327&usg=AOvVaw29eI_hB7urrSNHppzzjK5i) p. 20)

June 1 — A pilot on patrol from RAF Tangmere in West Sussex, England, sights a “bright circular metallic object” that speeds past his Gloster Meteor jet fighter at 20,000 feet. As he undergoes a debriefing by squadron intelligence, he finds out that four RAF controllers at the radar station at RAF Wartling near Eastbourne have, at the same time, tracked an “unusual response” that vanishes from their screens, moving at terrific speed. (David Clarke, “[Flying Saucer Working Party,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://drdavidclarke.co.uk/national-archives-ufo-files-7/flying-saucer-working-party/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728758765&usg=AOvVaw26JqDkoRl75In8-U_Dpcl2)” Dr. David Clarke Folklore and Journalism, January 3, 2015)

June 8 — Gen. [Earle E. Partridge](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Earle_E._Partridge&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728759050&usg=AOvVaw21z3H2cebkBaIwMnBLUxPH) of the Fifth Air Force, responsible for the Korean Theatre, writes to Commanding Gen.

[George E. Stratemeyer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_E._Stratemeyer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728759317&usg=AOvVaw0Rar6XcnjCnys5uM2YmUq4)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_E._Stratemeyer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728759481&usg=AOvVaw1IHl9G0tzJg2asSvzE4pDM) asking for an analysis of certain UFO cases. (Swords 100–101)

June 12 — Eastern Airlines executive [Eddie Rickenbacker](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eddie_Rickenbacker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728759787&usg=AOvVaw2vnS0fzRnhk1o553ku1-ru) tells the press that if flying saucers “do exist, you can rest assured that they are ours.” (Swords 100)

June 12 — 4:00 p.m. Working in a quarry somewhere in California, geologist John Zimmerman and civil engineer Charles Fisher are watching a jet aircraft speeding through the sky and leaving a vapor trail. Suddenly Zimmerman notices that the vapor trail has been cut. Looking more closely, he notices a metallic disc making vertical loops around the jet. Two other discs come into view and perform the same aerobatics. (Wells Alan Webb, Mars, the New Frontier, Fearon, 1956, p. 124; UFOEv, [p. 50](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D62%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728760182&usg=AOvVaw20ocNN6V-i0oBSf-H8i8fZ))

June 17 — Oskar Linke and his 11-year-old daughter Gabriele are walking toward Haselbach, Thuringia, East Germany, in the twilight when she notices something about 420 feet away. It appears to be two men dressed in shiny metallic clothing who are stooped over and looking at something on the ground. Linke approaches to 30 feet away, looks over a small fence, and sees a large object about 40 feet in diameter that looks like a huge frying pan. It has two rows of holes in its periphery and a black conical tower about 9 feet high. The two men suddenly jump inside. The inside lights up, the object starts humming and rises slowly from the ground, rotating like a top. It rises from the ground with the aid of a central cylinder and is surrounded by flames, then takes off in the direction of Stockheim. Later he finds a circular depression in the ground at the spot. Linke resettles in West Berlin in 1951. He tells his story to a notary there on July 1, 1952, which is how it turns up in the Western press and explains a confusion in the date of the sighting. (NICAP, “[CE III by Two Witnesses / Oskar Linke Case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500617hasselbach_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728760527&usg=AOvVaw1OWmakQOnaUk8zpP-MqpIo)”; Central Intelligence Agency, “‘[Flying Saucers’ in East Germany,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/DOC_0000015464.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728760744&usg=AOvVaw0d_dwBO9wkWxG8_-wgU_Oe)” July 9, 1952; Andreas Müller, “[Das Haselbach-UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.grenzwissenschaft-aktuell.de/haselbach-ufo-1950-augenzeugin-spricht20160126/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728760971&usg=AOvVaw2RrrABAfgvr5-zODtO3qXD) [von 1950: Die Augenzeugin spricht,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.grenzwissenschaft-aktuell.de/haselbach-ufo-1950-augenzeugin-spricht20160126/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728761228&usg=AOvVaw3ywId6l59-VG5nw748DMCJ)” grenzWissenschaft-aktuell.de, January 26, 2016; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728761448&usg=AOvVaw185BTkyRhAScYHiDmuuKGy)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728761645&usg=AOvVaw21JdzxR9ohq3ZWx4nqjNR2) p. 92; Good Above, [pp. 513–514](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/512/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728761864&usg=AOvVaw1p5hJe9csU7leUUxLEOM_A))

June 21 — 1:35 a.m. Control tower operators Cpl. Roger G. Pryor and S/Sgt. [Ellis R. Lorimer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/99049849/ellis-reed-lorimer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728762140&usg=AOvVaw3vF7MtKE5CeC1ifsdMvYQ1) and airways communications staffer S/Sgt. Virgil Cappuro watch a flying disc speeding at 1,000–1,500 mph over Hamilton AFB \[now closed\] in Novato, California. The object shoots blue flame and makes a roar like thunder as it makes five passes over the base. They observe it through binoculars for 25 minutes. (NICAP, “[Disc Makes Five Passes](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500621hamilton_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728762382&usg=AOvVaw03h5C_RzP4P6zcwLs3Eq5n) [at Control Tower](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500621hamilton_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728762574&usg=AOvVaw2Qs-dX_hQlRth0FVVX_ClY)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728762759&usg=AOvVaw2q2hP25ekZx-UCUtERCMyy)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728762919&usg=AOvVaw1dopWcCQjkelUUMrgsR1xM) p. 92)

June 24 — A cigar-shaped UFO paces a United Airlines plane (Capt. E. L. Remlin, First Officer David Stewart, and observer Capt. [Samuel B. Wiper](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/16889611/samuel-b_-wiper&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728763214&usg=AOvVaw3tBPq7mGJnZ9LNmD65zmh9)) for 20 minutes near Daggett, California. The object is also seen by the crew of another airliner and a navy transport plane. The Navy pilot sees for 3 minutes a dark gray object with heat radiation at the tail end. He estimates altitude as 50,000–100,000 feet and a speed of 1,000–1,500 mph. The crews discuss the matter with two CAA ground stations. (NICAP, “[Three Aircraft Crews Observe UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500624daggett_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728763434&usg=AOvVaw1e94BE4fhFd2t07VLEbtUT)”; UFOEv, [p. 31](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D43%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728763653&usg=AOvVaw0dwmNmMv3cjVQSrSMetXpD); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728763883&usg=AOvVaw2Uo6c5GVMzT1JtGPtsQzlp)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728764036&usg=AOvVaw0iztzx2t9N3MvYJtyziP5v) p. 93)

June 25 — North Korea invades South Korea, beginning the Korean War. (Wikipedia, “[Korean War](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Korean_War%23Course_of_the_war&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728764306&usg=AOvVaw23v97fibrVRdvVNVvKRiWY)”)

June 27 — President [Truman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_S._Truman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728764581&usg=AOvVaw2i7TKV2vRYH10LEXyZkftN) orders US air and sea forces to help South Korea. (Wikipedia, “[Korean War](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Korean_War%23Factors_in_US_intervention&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728764817&usg=AOvVaw205nacYC-kMd27UnLnqfZF)”)

June 27 — 4:15 p.m. Al Hixenbaugh, a photographer for the Louisville Times, is at the corner of Longest and Everett avenues in Louisville, Kentucky, when he hears the sound of a DC-3 airplane overhead. He looks up and sees the plane as well as a large disc with a slight corona around it. He shoots 50 feet of film with his 16mm movie camera as the object remains motionless for 10 seconds before it starts getting smaller and disappears to the west. (Louisville (Ky.) Times, June 28, 1950, p. 1; “[How to Film UFO’s,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/Saucers%2520(Max%2520B%2520Miller)/Saucers%2520vol%25206%2520no%25203.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728765245&usg=AOvVaw36c9OmvIzaDnxyH5asf1vF)” Saucers 6, no. 3 (August 1958): 3; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728765499&usg=AOvVaw0vzGrbHgMpnbTm3UJDqlgp)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728765723&usg=AOvVaw2Ltcta2R_Z8eoTWqaHd1T3) p.

93)

June 30 — Midnight. Rev. Ross Vermillion, a former bomber pilot, and his wife are driving 9 miles west of Kingman, Kansas, when they see a bright red light hovering over US Hwy 54 near Cunningham, Kansas. They estimate it to be about 250 feet in diameter with a small canopy on top. The family of druggist Dwayne Mulnix of Meade,

* * *

Kansas, also sees the object and they stop and watch it for about 20 minutes along the highway. They begin to drive closer, but it speeds away. As seen in the bright moonlight, the object looks made of bright metal and has an elliptical body “as big as the cross-section of a B-29” with a rotor turning counterclockwise around its body. (NICAP, “[WWII Pilot Tells of Seeing Flying Saucer](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500630cunningham_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728766498&usg=AOvVaw0uVPis_cXEZE5XcAuQM_rE)”; Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: Volume 6, April–July](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1950-Apr-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728766878&usg=AOvVaw0_oL18R2TQvpZY-2e3fqtM) [1950](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1950-Apr-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728767228&usg=AOvVaw27jPuIlwgNnHl6vMfgpBQf)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1950-Apr-July.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728767535&usg=AOvVaw1riZziCryLGZwYaM6gZ2IH) The Author, 1990, pp. 66–69)

June 30 — 11:15 p.m. Two navy men (Petty Officer Carter and Able Seaman Connelly) at Royal Canadian Naval Air Station Shearwater, Dartmouth, Nova Scotia, are pulling duty on radar watch from dusk until dawn. They report four separate radar contacts bearing 160° at 5 miles over 90 minutes. Visual confirmation of two glowing objects is made by a chief petty officer in North Dartmouth. (NICAP, “[Navy Men Report Radar Contact](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500630dartmouth_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728768008&usg=AOvVaw0byUuy6RdyHihXDJV3PddT)”)

July — USAF Director of Intelligence Maj. Gen. [Charles P. Cabell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_P._Cabell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728768320&usg=AOvVaw1KmFgH6TtURjAm_v1WZM6N) orders secret UFO field investigations to be conducted by his staff Technical Capabilities Branch in the Evaluation Division under Maj. [Milton D. Willis](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49365086/milton-dean-willis&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728768672&usg=AOvVaw3SiBV-Pnb5fDFusqueq4pl). These begin this month and last until October 1951 when Cabell is replaced by Gen. [John A. Samford](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_A._Samford&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728768999&usg=AOvVaw0iGebJjc8s0ph2FRWcH5zK). (Clark III 936)

July — Editor [Curtis Fuller](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://occulthealth.com/fuller-curtis-1912%25E2%2580%25931991/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728769344&usg=AOvVaw36nEahYhLpP4h3HRjXD6gK)’s article, “The Flying Saucers: Fact or Fiction?” appears in Flying magazine. (Curtis Fuller, “[The Flying Saucers: Fact or Fiction?](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/0%2520-%2520Articles/United%2520States/Flying%2520Magazine/1950%252007%252000_Flying%2520Magazine_Curtis%2520Fuller.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728769682&usg=AOvVaw0xtJM_rmOHYBXkWI3wrWNW)” Flying 47 (July 1950): 16–17, 59–61)

July — Armed Forces Special Weapons Project concludes a top secret study, named Project Nutmeg, to search for an atomic weapons site in the continental US. AFSWP concludes that a site on the Air Force’s Las Vegas Bombing and Gunnery Range in Nevada is the right place. President [Truman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_S._Truman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728770119&usg=AOvVaw2zcanGvg5bMdIwEplDQITt) approves the location, known as Frenchman Flat. (Wikipedia, “[Sandia Base](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sandia_Base%23The_Armed_Forces_Special_Weapons_Project_and_its_successors&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728770431&usg=AOvVaw0-GOX2a0w-Jc_nEivMReGZ)”; “[Project Nutmeg: The Birth of the Nevada Test Site,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://permanent.access.gpo.gov/lps100925/www.nv.doe.gov/library/factsheets/DOENV_767.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728770701&usg=AOvVaw0zgmo2AFZdsIbao52HbiSs)” National Nuclear Security Administration, June 2004)

July — Mid-day. Electronics engineer Cliff Booth is having lunch in his office at a private contractor’s building at Holloman AFB, New Mexico, when he gets a call that a UFO has been reported by one of the range stations. Booth and an Askania cinetheodolite operator are asked to drive to another range station with a manually operated Askania and look for the object. Through the finders on the theodolite the object presents a side view to the observers and appears to be cigar-shaped and metallic, with a straw-colored iridescent radiance or luster. It also has fins one-third of the way back from the front of the fuselage and a row of at least three oblong ports extending to the rear of the object and located above the center line of the fuselage. The ports are a dark smoky gray but not luminescent. The object hovers in an almost horizontal position, elevation 20°–25°, azimuth northeast. Shortly after the men focus the instrument on the object to take a film, it begins maneuvering. Turning toward the camera, the object moves in, and the men can see the front—a round shape with the fins extending out from the sides. It then drops abruptly, as though beginning to fall, but stops. It moves toward the camera, turns sideways, then drops as before, but this time it exposes the side view again. The operator leaves to report the coordinates to headquarters, and when he returns the object is gone. The men turn over their exposed film to the Data Reduction Division for development and analysis. A week or so later they are called in and questioned by a young first lieutenant unknown to them who asks them over and over again if they have taken pictures and to describe the object they had seen. Then they are asked if they can identify the film of the object they photographed. One of the men becomes angry about the questioning, telling the officer he had seen what he reported, had photographed the object, and is convinced it is some sort of a vehicle from outer space. He is shown a film of 14 frames on a Recordak projector. The black-and-white presentation shows a blurred ellipsoid with a dark center, but no

details. (Puzzled about the film, he later talks to a mathematician-analyst employed by Land-Air, Inc.; she conjectured the object had been oscillating in the air, preventing a stable image.) The men are then told by their superiors to forget the whole thing. (Lorenzen, FS Hoax, [pp. 27–29](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/1966CoralLorenzenFlyingSaucersTheStartlingEvidenceOfTheInvasionFromOuterSpacenotOCR/page/n23/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728771304&usg=AOvVaw1YY7JqTU2aTd3p4aJ81hRK); Project 1947, “[APRO Files: Coral E.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/folio/apro_holloman.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728771532&usg=AOvVaw002UT9wC2TF-Tpfs0YScBj) [Lorenzen, Holloman Air Force Base UFO Sighting, July, 1950](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/folio/apro_holloman.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728771733&usg=AOvVaw35m_jyr1_JOHTzNcuZPgKd)”)

July — 1:45 p.m. A Civil Aviation Authority flight engineer observes a “wingless, fuselage-shaped” object maneuvering over Cincinnati, Ohio. The object climbs at a steep angle to 16,000–18,000 feet, hesitates, dives, and speeds away to the west. (UFOEv, [p. 45](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D57%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728772064&usg=AOvVaw0yhZXMsEmT-yc89Ugc85Bl))

July 2 — Dusk. While picnicking on the shore of Sawbill Bay on Marmion Lake, western Ontario, an anonymous employee of the Steep Rock Iron Mine claims to have seen a UFO resting on the water’s surface. A hatch opens and 10 figures, 3–4 feet tall, emerge, wearing shiny, metallic clothing. They seem to be drawing in lake water with a hose. The object soon rises and hovers, then swiftly takes off. The story appears in the mine’s house newsletter, then gets picked up by some Canadian newspapers and Fate magazine in its February/March 1952 issue. However, Robert Badgley, a Scarborough, Ontario, member of APRO, finds in 1974 that Steep Rock employee Gordon Edwards had written the fictitious tale to entertain readers of the newsletter and to satirize saucer stories. (“[Steep Rock Flying Saucer,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/fate-1952-02/page/68/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728772440&usg=AOvVaw1N_eiXQ37M9cZOS3XThMLG)” Fate 5, no. 2 (February–March 1952): 68–72; “[1950 Steep Rock](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201977%252011%252000%2520-%2520Vol%252026%2520No%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728772763&usg=AOvVaw3vahX9drb4TwNAXrMAgkmf) [Lake, Ontario Case Possible Hoax,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201977%252011%252000%2520-%2520Vol%252026%2520No%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728773030&usg=AOvVaw1QCPiwi_zz35d_yLoeItd3)” APRO Bulletin 26, no. 5 (November 1977): 5; John Robert Columbo, UFOs

* * *

over Canada, Hounslow, 1991, pp. 32–41; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1950-07-02-canada-steeprocklake.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728773537&usg=AOvVaw0qjbnq3MpR8CzBhwe-QJWx), January 31, 2007; Hammerson Peters, “The Little Green Men of Steep Rock Lake,” Mysteries of Canada, September 7, 2018)

July 4 — Evening. Aerojet engineer [Daniel Fry](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daniel_Fry&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728774171&usg=AOvVaw3HAWSy58--oez2Pskx-8Y5) is alone during the holiday at White Sands Proving Ground, New Mexico, when a flying saucer appears and hovers just above the ground. Fry approaches and strokes its surface when a voice booms, “Better not touch the hull, pal, it’s still hot.” After some conversation with the disembodied extraterrestrial named Alan, he is invited on board the craft, which flies him to New York and back in 30 minutes. Fry has further encounters and becomes a celebrity on the contactee circuit. He finally meets Alan in person in 1961. (Daniel Fry, The White Sands Incident, New Age, 1954; Clark III 518–520)

McGarrachy, USAF chief of General Investigations Division, expresses strong interest to acquire motion pictures of UFOs taken by civilians, perhaps in cooperation with the FBI, but not in a way to arouse public suspicion of USAF interest. Feiling](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.458bg.com/MN-BrunoWFeiling-WEB.jpg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728779413&usg=AOvVaw3IFOztmC3N21t4tHC_0OOP)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.458bg.com/MN-BrunoWFeiling-WEB.jpg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728779688&usg=AOvVaw2OR197iArSk99HDuDXzeS8) chief of the USAF Technical Analysis Division, on “Investigation of Flying Saucer Reports” says that UFO investigation takes up too much time. Walker](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eric_A._Walker_(engineer)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728780612&usg=AOvVaw2qd_zyecrgfRKJt-vtLdPj) becomes executive secretary of the Research and Development Board. August 4 — The crew (Master Nils Lewring, Chief Mate Jacob Koelwyn) of the M/V Marcala in the North Atlantic between Nova Scotia and the US Eastern seaboard watch an aluminum-colored cylinder-shaped UFO, apparently 10 feet in diameter, 50–100 feet above the surface. One of the other witnesses describes the sighting as “one of the most frightening experiences I have ever had.” (NICAP, “[Object 100ʹ above Sea Observed by Ship MV](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500804northatlantic_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728785740&usg=AOvVaw2xKh2PbiK2ato2tfBHDip9) [Marcala](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500804northatlantic_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728785919&usg=AOvVaw14wDWU3MZde7NaFDxsWZoU)”; ClearIntent, [pp. 115–116](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/clearintentgover00fawc/page/114/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728786139&usg=AOvVaw2yXHOzyfW0oR45ktqyuPI-); Good Above, [pp. 340–341](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/340/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728786343&usg=AOvVaw3dIblPihvO74LvILjY-o3m))

August 14 — 11:27 a.m. Flight Lt. [Stan J. Hubbard](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/obituaries/11320471/Wing-Commander-Stan-Hubbard-obituary.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728786984&usg=AOvVaw046TTc732h8RVFnsesufK9) and two other officers at Farnborough Airfield, Hampshire, England, hear a humming noise. 700–1,000 feet. He watches it for 30 seconds as it flies at a speed of 800–1,000 mph and makes a series of S- turns, oscillating as it moves. The other two officers see nothing. August 15 — 11:30 a.m. [Nicholas Mariana](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.theufochronicles.com/2006/05/marianas-ufo-film-one-of-best-produced.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728788373&usg=AOvVaw07cD1r_76nxyOrKTXetE8O) and his secretary Virginia Raunig are inspecting the Great Falls, Montana, baseball stadium in preparation for a game. He walks up to the grandstand and notices two fast-moving bright lights “like two new dimes in the sky.” He rushes to his car, parked 60 feet away, and gets his 16mm movie camera from the glove compartment. He films the objects passing behind a water tower, which provides a frame of reference for measuring distance, size, altitude, azimuth, and speed. In October he takes it to an Air Force officer for analysis. USAF notes that two jet interceptors were in the area and might be the objects on the film, but Mariana and Raunig had seen those too. Controversy soon arises when Mariana claims that the first 35 frames of his film—which he says most clearly show the UFOs as rotating disks—are missing. People in the Great Falls area who view Mariana’s film support him. They claim that the missing frames clearly show the UFOs as spinning, metallic disks with a “notch or band” along their outer edges. USAF personnel deny this accusation and insist that they have removed only a single frame of film that was damaged in the analysis. In 1952, Blue Book reviews the film; so does [Robert M. L. Baker Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_M._L._Baker_Jr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728788834&usg=AOvVaw2BIye41yNf-lOE7m6oF-_4) in 1954, and the Colorado project in 1967. All studies of the film agree that it was not faked and that the objects appear to be disc-shaped. (Wikipedia, “[Mariana UFO incident](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mariana_UFO_incident&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728789127&usg=AOvVaw1MA4M3VAbRwREcnHXU7Zkj)”; NICAP, “[Nick Mariana / Montana UFO Color Film](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500815greatfalls_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728789422&usg=AOvVaw0dOy3ucL-vjL2Ps2IFTmO9)”; “[Nick Mariana UFO Footage 1950 Great Falls Montana,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v%3DyGIH7ufiBII&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728789760&usg=AOvVaw20qCEQaigSf7j4J1L7k9JY)” parkerdonaldmusic YouTube channel, September 29, 2012; “[Air Force Takes over Films of Flying Disks,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93138384/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728790085&usg=AOvVaw2O4RVW4gMKAYrgeQMAbIBD)” Spokane (Wash.) Chronicle, October 5, 1950, p. 8; “[Colored Films on Saucers to Be Shown,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93139228/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728790365&usg=AOvVaw0UqmG_RHJWw_GReZ7M2_lb)” Twin Falls (Idaho) Times-News, October 19, 1950, p. 17; Clark III 767–769; UFOs Yes, 81–108; Condon, [pp. 407–415](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/406/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728790741&usg=AOvVaw14RKKqaFQ7x73lWJ9ieLu3); Margaret Sachs, The UFO Encyclopedia, Putnam, 1980, [pp. 127–128](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoencyclopedia00marg/page/127/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728791224&usg=AOvVaw1xJ3hgcVQSyxBg5gXC3aml); Barry Greenwood, “[On the Question of Tampering](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.greenwoodufoarchive.com/uhr/uhr07.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728791569&usg=AOvVaw0cdXJEtKhyAsSoKcGNl0eL) [with the 1950 Great Falls UFO Film,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.greenwoodufoarchive.com/uhr/uhr07.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728791922&usg=AOvVaw1Tq6ZLtHIWenlQLLlNynrS)” UFO Historical Revue, no. 7 (September 2000): 1–8; Michael D. Swords, GrassRoots UFOs: Case Reports from the Timmerman Files, Fund for UFO Research, 2005, pp. 138–139; Michael D. Swords, “[Can You Learn Anything from UFO Photos? Part Three,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://thebiggeststudy.blogspot.com/2012/07/can-you-learn-anything-from-ufo-photos_07.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728792575&usg=AOvVaw141fC_IfYVjPjHKTO5V7ZP)” The Big Study, July 7, 2012; Patrick Gross, “[The Great Falls, Montana, UFO Color Film, August 15, 1950](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/montana50.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728792953&usg=AOvVaw1xFz3w5EVMAm9Da-_ihyX9)”)

August 15 — A top secret meeting on UFOs takes place at the Metropole Building on Northumberland Avenue in London, England. It is chaired by Hugh Young, deputy director of intelligence, and attended by representatives of the Secret Intelligence Service and Wing Commander [Myles Formby](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/171579927/myles-hesketh-formby&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728793474&usg=AOvVaw2QuTHVef9wD3YKwOfYoLtt) of the Air Ministry’s technical intelligence branch. Young explains that [Henry Tizard](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henry_Tizard&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728793775&usg=AOvVaw1l7l_1PoyHKDHnij4Dqirt), chief scientific advisor to the Ministry of Defence, feels that reports of flying saucers should not be dismissed without investigation and has asked that a working party be set up to look into significant reports. RAF Fighter Command is advised that all future reports of aerial phenomena should go to the Flying Saucer Working Party. (David Clarke and Andy Roberts, Out of the Shadows, Piatkus, 2002, pp. 77– 78; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: January 1, 1947–December 31,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-1959-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728794144&usg=AOvVaw2OBYDMYrwD_G_0klJKig8n) [1959, Supplemental Notes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-1959-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728794410&usg=AOvVaw0s5Se07j5z5WoIX0M2te5c)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1947-1959-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728794605&usg=AOvVaw1DOnhOJsJl3ovaniB_EX7o) The Author, 2003, p. 35)

August 20 — An FBI informant meets with [George Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728795080&usg=AOvVaw1Bz1kDmvxx3qEoHEsnezW_) at Alice Wells’s restaurant, the Palomar Gardens Café, south of Mount Palomar, California. In addition to the standard flying saucer tales, Adamski mentions that the Federal Communications Commission has established contact with people from other planets who apparently have a communist economic system. He also predicts that Russia will dominate the world for the next 1,000 years. (Kremlin 63–71)

August 23 — FBI memo from [Alan H. Belmont](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://spartacus-educational.com/JFKbelmontA.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728795637&usg=AOvVaw2ixvOAdxzmUwasmqczswGq) to [D. Milton Ladd](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Ladd.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728796064&usg=AOvVaw164ryTxb6j8TKC2XrXeZAF) on green fireballs. (A. H. Belmont, “[Summary of](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/500823_FBI.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728796375&usg=AOvVaw08ny_YrRWZZArplUCmAgeA) [Aerial Phenomena in New Mexico, Miscellaneous—Information Concerning,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/500823_FBI.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728796589&usg=AOvVaw0j6wCJiajUqAnuorb-kM7Q)” August 23, 1950)

August 30 — 10:45 a.m. During a Bell Aircraft MX-776 Shrike missile test (for the later Rascal air-to-ground strategic missile) a USAF M/Sgt and eight Bell Aircraft employees at Holloman AFB, New Mexico, see two glaringly bright circular or elliptical objects maintaining relative position to each other following the B-50 Superfortress launch aircraft from above on both the dry run and hot run prior to missile release. The objects give a “strong glare at all times” (not reflected sunlight), maneuver at high estimated speeds up to 10 times the B-50 (roughly 2,500 mph) for short distances, leave no vapor trails, hover, accelerate rapidly, and make abrupt “square” turns with apparent size changing to indicate ascent and descent. (NICAP, “[Two Objects Filmed during Shrike Missile](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500830holloman_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728797081&usg=AOvVaw2oHXa4Fubk-3iEBSBtrE5E) [Test](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500830holloman_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728797407&usg=AOvVaw2bBnDb3mrqcWLxnH485_fa)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728797735&usg=AOvVaw25mywG4HRVzqixpJlJ1uP9)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728797997&usg=AOvVaw0PeoFOuF_o0lKcf4vBEEij) p. 98; Maj. R. G. Illing, “[Aerial Phenomena,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1950-08-30_USA_Holloman_AFB.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728798353&usg=AOvVaw0-XPQbJ9i0w3_s4NjipJ2D)” September 13, 1950; Swords 115)

August 31 — 10:00 a.m.–1:00 p.m. After V-2 missile launch no. 51 at Holloman AFB, New Mexico, Project Twinkle cinetheodolite crews track and film multiple objects sporadically several times from different directions at very high speeds over the course of 3 hours. Cinetheodolite station P-5 films an object using a one-frame-per-second 60 cm focal length camera with 35 mm color film. Frames 593 and 595 (2 seconds of nearly 10 minutes of film) show its elevation angle changing. An attempted interception by four F-86 jets from Kirtland AFB for one hour fails to locate the objects, which apparently return after the jets leave. Cinetheodolite observers note an object

* * *

with definite shape and 3D depth but indistinct edges and no smoke or trail. The object seems to “rock or oscillate.” It is lost when the observer looks away to get an angle reading. (NICAP, “[Objects Filmed after V-2](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500831holloman_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728798961&usg=AOvVaw1J2epJOa2AA7UYYiXq-Okd) [Launch](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500831holloman_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728799202&usg=AOvVaw3X6uu5_IIwGRQERcfuJdtE)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728799448&usg=AOvVaw2fWYV9jcYeKnFcWxJUlaMs)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728799662&usg=AOvVaw0yC3vzhwgCyiM-yDFNaIz8) p. 99)

September — 7:00 a.m. Three US Navy planes on a combat mission 100 miles south of the Yalu River in Korea are approached from below by two huge discs, at least 600–700 feet in diameter, traveling at 1,000–1,200 mph. The radar shows them as 1.5 miles away. Suddenly the objects halt, back up, and begin a jittering motion, keeping pace with them, circling above and below. When one pilot readies his guns, the aircraft radar goes haywire, apparently jammed. His radio transmitter is blocked by a buzzing noise. The discs are silvery and shaped like a “coolie’s hat, with oblong ports from which emanated a copper-green colored light which gradually shifted to pale pastel-colored lights.” A shimmering red ring circles the top portion of the disc. The objects soon speed away in the direction from which they had come. (Haines, Korea, [pp. 28–30](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/aadkw/aadkw_ch3.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728800115&usg=AOvVaw1YzsmVVe6UiIe9nwxB1jIA); Lorenzen, FS Hoax, [pp. 30–32](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/1966CoralLorenzenFlyingSaucersTheStartlingEvidenceOfTheInvasionFromOuterSpacenotOCR/page/n27/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728800639&usg=AOvVaw1F8XvmRidst3N-Ev__1ygx))

September — The first US Army large-scale aerosol vulnerability test occurs in the San Francisco Bay Area, California, using two types of bacteria (Bacillus globigii and Serratia marcescens) and fluorescent particles. Six simulated attacks are conducted, with the conclusion that it is feasible to attack a seaport city with biological aerosol agents from a ship offshore. The first open-air tests with biological simulants are conducted in 1950 in various locales, one of which is off the coast of Norfolk, Virginia. (Wikipedia, “[United States biological weapons program](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_biological_weapons_program%23Cold_War_(1947%25E2%2580%25931969)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728801289&usg=AOvVaw3v4p22HKREGv6wDoPrhY2N)”; David R. Franz, Cheryl D. Parrott, and Ernest T. Takafuji, “The U.S. Biological Warfare and Biological Defense Programs,” in Medical Aspects of Chemical and Biological Warfare, Office of the US Surgeon General, 1997, chap. 19)

September — [George Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728801898&usg=AOvVaw0SUhVvy5OBSbApzlna45bJ) first receives national exposure as coauthor of an article in Fate on his fake UFO photographs. A follow-up article in July 1951 features even more dramatic photos. (Clark III 39; Maurice Weekley and George Adamski, “Flying Saucers As Astronomers See Them,” Fate 3, no. 6 (September 1950): 56– 59; George Adamski, “I Photographed Space Ships,” Fate 4, no. 5 (July 1951): 64–74; George Noory, “[Fate](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.coasttocoastam.com/pages/fate-flashback-flying-saucers-in-the-1950-s/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728802499&usg=AOvVaw0m6VVbDxeT--8fS5aQPY9A) [Flashback: ‘Flying Saucers’ in the 1950’s,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.coasttocoastam.com/pages/fate-flashback-flying-saucers-in-the-1950-s/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728802843&usg=AOvVaw0dfnTrSNnfFusIufBMw_x2)” Coast to Coast AM, August 18, 2016)

September 5 — 4:09 p.m. Flight Lt. [Stan J. Hubbard](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/obituaries/11320471/Wing-Commander-Stan-Hubbard-obituary.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728803354&usg=AOvVaw127o6zzextxEwsHiWOS-44) is standing on the watchtower at Farnborough Airfield, Hampshire, England, with five other officers, one of whom is Wing Commander Frank Jolliffe. They all see, at a range of 10– 15 miles, a light gray disc following a rectangular flight path, consisting of a “falling leaf, horizontal flight, an upward “falling leaf,” then another horizontal stretch. The Working Party concludes they have imperfectly viewed some conventional aircraft. (David Clarke, “[Flying Saucer Working Party,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://drdavidclarke.co.uk/national-archives-ufo-files-7/flying-saucer-working-party/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728803777&usg=AOvVaw2ZsZ5fl9M4NJRK2sVJDa0_)” Dr. David Clarke Folklore and Journalism, January 3, 2015; Good Need, [pp. 150–151](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/150/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728804141&usg=AOvVaw3B9PuG779CExs8jVd71JTI); David Clarke and Andy Roberts, Out of the Shadows, Piatkus, 2002, pp. 87–93; UFOFiles2, [p. 41](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/the-ufo-files-the-inside-story-of-real-life-sightings-david-clarke/page/n71/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728804664&usg=AOvVaw0o8BxjltV0ba-x6CkeO7hP))

September 8 — Henry Holt publishes [Frank Scully](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Scully&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728805136&usg=AOvVaw0BMpbmevn7_liE4c7C3gq2)’s Behind the Flying Saucers, the first book on UFOs. It sensationally claims that the US government has retrieved a crashed flying saucer and several dead pilots. Rep. [Edward H.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_H._Jenison&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728805631&usg=AOvVaw0WYmm2r_CjHJxeEIqg3_6U) [Jenison](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_H._Jenison&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728805890&usg=AOvVaw1PhylU525ZvLJiDot6Kuux) (R-Ill.) condemns the book as contributing to mass hysteria during a time of war in Korea. USAF Public Information Officer Clare Welch estimates that 3–4 million people have heard about saucers, thanks to the book. (Frank Scully, [Behind the Flying Saucers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/behindflyingsauc00scul/page/n5/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728806162&usg=AOvVaw3IcdZMhqPDHFqAcu7HQpnF)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/behindflyingsauc00scul/page/n5/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728806436&usg=AOvVaw3ln-M6ooqF59zPcGqGbNrc) Holt, 1950; John L. Cotton, et al., “[Flying Saucers and Frank Scully,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.physics.smu.edu/%257Epseudo/UFOs/Scully/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728806830&usg=AOvVaw321jp3F2ne3_5VvEGZMnEE)” in KNW 2333: The Scientific Method, Critical and Creative Thinking (Debunking Pseudoscience), Southern Methodist University; Swords 103; Curt Collins, “[Operation Hush-Hush: The UFO Crash and ET Bodies Cover-](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2018/02/operation-hush-hush-ufo-crash-and-et.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728807260&usg=AOvVaw3MANeXdSZtAjNeBKvHibmU) [Up,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2018/02/operation-hush-hush-ufo-crash-and-et.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728807663&usg=AOvVaw1oJxFCI9_iRyysySSqeu6y)” The Saucers That Time Forgot, February 9, 2018)

September 8 — Air Force Intelligence Collection Division’s Collection Control Branch (AFOIN-CC-1) at the Pentagon issues a new intelligence reporting directive requiring special handling and reporting of UFO incidents, “Reporting of Information on Unconventional Aircraft,” thus reversing the cancellation directive of January 12, 1950. The action reflects the increasing interest by AFOIN Director Gen. [Cabell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_P._Cabell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728808177&usg=AOvVaw2Xdn3Fwcj0ulnjrugfEpp8) and his dissatisfaction with AMC inaction on UFO study at Wright-Patterson AFB. (NICAP, “[1950 UFO Chronology](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/chronos/1950fullrep.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728808610&usg=AOvVaw3CQEM2wl1Yp_m1ACiIQqFm)”)

September 13 — The Air Force responds to producer [Howard Hawks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Howard_Hawks&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728809059&usg=AOvVaw01TbXXFN5ijUVtnNkPH0d8)’s request for the use of military locations, personnel, and equipment for his upcoming film The Thing from Another World by refusing to participate and objecting to any display of USAF personnel or equipment on the grounds that “it is our policy not to participate in any proposal that will perpetuate this hoax.” (Swords 103–104)

September 15 — Canadian engineer [Wilbert B. Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Wilbert_B_Smith.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728809694&usg=AOvVaw3PJCFOJ-D4ER9STJ3Z7Vla) attends a classified briefing with physicist [Robert I. Sarbacher](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Dr_Robert_Sarbacher.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728810082&usg=AOvVaw2WC_MoFacfD7GOVGgDdXKS) of the US Defense Dept.’s Research and Development Board. Smith asks if there is any truth to the [Scully](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Scully&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728810472&usg=AOvVaw25pXR2MYx521S4CHgfzs9Q) crash- and-retrieval story and [Sarbacher](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.presidentialufo.com/old_site/sarbacher.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728810882&usg=AOvVaw2_wdDHALCKWY7Qfk7-lpoV) replies, “The facts reported in the book are substantially correct.” He says that UFOs are “classified two points higher even than the H-bomb.” In 1983, Sarbacher confirms the comment to [Stanton T. Friedman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stanton_T._Friedman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728811295&usg=AOvVaw2T7if_uC8_8n57tc4h3xwu)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stanton_T._Friedman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728811572&usg=AOvVaw3rzd9ngqUw4HGicwk5ZhjE) although he clarifies that he was speaking about crashed UFOs in general. He tells UFO researcher [William Steinman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://rr0.org/people/s/SteinmanWilliamS.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728811911&usg=AOvVaw3in3pJv0NFBLfU55yG33Wk) in November 1983 that he “was invited to participate in several discussions associated with the reported recoveries” of UFOs, but is unable to attend the meetings. He claims [Vannevar Bush](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vannevar_Bush&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728812349&usg=AOvVaw2xl0Ad7jbbBWv46pEQAs2z),
