[Eric A. Walker](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eric_A._Walker_(engineer)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728812900&usg=AOvVaw1-ydTtomR-UaDemWhIrJYK)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eric_A._Walker_(engineer)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728813161&usg=AOvVaw0RmFX4CVUiT0m_PJ1AzT15) and [John von Neumann](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_von_Neumann&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728813484&usg=AOvVaw3ut6-VnAFO0bLS7Fwr9N-K) are “definitely involved” in the program and probably [J. Robert](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Robert_Oppenheimer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728813924&usg=AOvVaw2Jfwi6ILwAEiIXX959mmw7) [Oppenheimer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Robert_Oppenheimer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728814156&usg=AOvVaw02ShC2kg-BQ1OEsmUqS_Kh) as well. (Clark III 1029–1031; Good Above, [pp. 519–521](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/518/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728814400&usg=AOvVaw03H-hqN2jq0PatLqPnPoSc); Northern Ontario UFO Research and Study, “[Dr. Robert Sarbacher](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Dr_Robert_Sarbacher.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728814611&usg=AOvVaw1nH7__k4P860y4l3-zookq),” March 1, 2010; Wilbert B. Smith, \[[Sarbacher interview notes](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://roswellproof.homestead.com/Smith_9_15_50.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728814853&usg=AOvVaw2QofKdpmEyPPbO4P7HRinc)\], September 15, 1950; Dolan II 320; Robert I. Sarbacher, \[[Letter to William Steinman](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://roswellproof.homestead.com/Sarbacher_Nov1983.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728815113&usg=AOvVaw3Ytc_ouLm3VuBGtpQXLPtE)\], November 29, 1983)

September 21 —MIT research associate and Air National Guard Maj. [Myron Herbert Ligda](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/919358/myron-george_herbert-ligda&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728815413&usg=AOvVaw2TqpahimoLFUokE5W6JsxW) and [Joseph V. Connelly](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/514815/joseph-v-connelly&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728815666&usg=AOvVaw2axLBA44ZTb7r43ADtYrXG) are testing radar near Provincetown, Massachusetts, under contract to the US Signal Corps, when they track an unknown object on a converging course with two F-86s. The clear target passes the planes at a speed of at least 1,200 mph, makes a right turn, then passes directly over or under the F-86s. (NICAP, “[SCR-615B Tracks UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/500921provincetown_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728815995&usg=AOvVaw2nQCXlY19hIOQicwnQeCKW)”; Hynek UFO Report, [pp. 139–141](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/138/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728816233&usg=AOvVaw0otOCQmJ_7AGfULZHSu87r); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728816422&usg=AOvVaw3i3o7lgYbKk3VbwN5CKeTQ)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728816583&usg=AOvVaw3nYXbPvwf-LZ33KMa5sOHp) p. 100; Swords 104)

September 25 — JANAP 146(A) is issued: “Communications Instructions for Reporting Vital Intelligence Sightings from Aircraft,” the start of CIRVIS reporting for commercial and military pilots. This adds UFOs to the list of sighting categories. All UFO reports are to be sent to the Air Defense Command at the Pentagon and to the Secretary of Defense. AMC at Wright-Patterson is not mentioned. (Swords 123)

September 25 — The Air Force Intelligence office, apparently at the request of Gen. [Hoyt Vandenberg](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hoyt_Vandenberg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728816925&usg=AOvVaw3uEWfYjTdOYTHM9rIGlK7J), orders all copies of the December 10, 1948, revised Project Sign report destroyed. (Good Need, [p. 114](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/114/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728817138&usg=AOvVaw2VCT-klqYkHUrY4AyZQG_3))

September 26 — 10:00 p.m. Policemen John Collins and Joseph Keenan are patrolling on Vare Avenue near 26th Street in South Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, when they see something like a parachute drifting down ahead of them at treetop level. It is about 6 feet in diameter and settles in an open field. After summoning Sgt. Joseph Cook and Patrolman James Casper, they go into the field to investigate. When they turn their flashlights on it, it gives off a purplish glow, “almost a mist, that looked as though it contained crystals.” Collins touches it and it dissolves in his hand, leaving an odorless, sticky residue. It completely evaporates in 25 minutes. This event inspires producer [Jack H. Harris](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jack_H._Harris&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728817488&usg=AOvVaw31l8uJm3utiGwzgzKX6b57) to ask his friend Irvine H. Millgate to come up with a story for what eventually becomes the 1958 horror film The Blob. (Clark III 1102; “Flying ‘Saucer’ Just Dissolves,” Philadelphia Inquirer, September 27, 1950, pp. 1–2; Rebekah McKendry, “The Supposedly True Story behind the Classic Film The Blob!” 13th Floor, October 21, 2015)

October — [Donald Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728818134&usg=AOvVaw1KsGTBX7wceYAqXgXwXkDq)’s True article is expanded into a paperback book, The Flying Saucers Are Real, which sells 500,000 copies. It brings many interested civilians and military people to accept UFO reality, government withholding of information, and the extraterrestrial hypothesis. (Donald E. Keyhoe, [The Flying Saucers Are Real](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/fsar/fsar-chapters.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728818565&usg=AOvVaw36pvGzteVp-KivR6xY8Vup), Gold Medal, 1950; Wikipedia, “[The Flying Saucers Are Real](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Flying_Saucers_Are_Real&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728818823&usg=AOvVaw3imLYFlrwRtElDBG07qSJU)”)

October — [J\[ack?\] L. Rohn](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/79820198/jack-l-rohn&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728819084&usg=AOvVaw1xfzhtOfLDy-yv58ClflDb) is named a chief of Project Grudge. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728819304&usg=AOvVaw0pXLD5ANTgbpEhrEPDvmiz), p. 14)

October — The Flying Saucer Working Party is created in the UK by Ministry of Defence Chief Science Adviser [Henry](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henry_Tizard&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728819586&usg=AOvVaw2A9f5s0_-QTFiRGTsWSbWK) [Tizard](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henry_Tizard&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728819787&usg=AOvVaw1ytkiIxe_MuNiRNR_H7k08)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henry_Tizard&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728819941&usg=AOvVaw1h2Xbg5Y2fTRYgH1CyHGIP) assisted by [Louis Mountbatten](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Louis_Mountbatten%252C_1st_Earl_Mountbatten_of_Burma&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728820201&usg=AOvVaw3jWon3cBK4IvEdDqmauiAA) and Air Chief Marshal [Hugh Dowding](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hugh_Dowding&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728820577&usg=AOvVaw0V7M8cgny7dYTCL4kEvTH1), both who have quietly concluded that flying saucers are real. It has five members, representing UK intelligence branches. Its charge is to study UFO reports. (Wikipedia, “[Flying Saucer Working Party](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flying_Saucer_Working_Party&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728820966&usg=AOvVaw1HDj-K8PRVQBA3eAzJ6gx9)”; Mark Rodeghier, “Britain’s Secret UFO Study,” IUR 26, no. 4 (Winter 2001–2002): 21–23)

October 3 — Geochemist J. D. Laudermilk watches a disc moving with a wobbling motion at 750 mph behind a mountain peak near Pomona, California. (UFOEv, [p. 49](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D61%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728821589&usg=AOvVaw3Bvdx0r4HTj5wpzDOWKEwz))

October 5 — A California Central Airlines plane, piloted by Capt. Cecil Hardin and Flight Officer Jack Conroy, is buzzed by a wing-like UFO with 8 bright lights between San Fernando and Van Nuys, California. Bands of blue light are visible across its width. (“[Now Add This to Saucer Mysteries,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93147090/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728822020&usg=AOvVaw0P8Me0cfrvYwOY_OC6FOVg)” Los Angeles Daily News, October 6, 1950, p. 2; NICAP, “[Mysterious Object Buzzes Airliner](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/501005sanfernando_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728822286&usg=AOvVaw3W86weE-JexSsyY8mW0M78)”; UFOEv, [p. 34](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D47%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728822500&usg=AOvVaw1OwgnBvolZeUescL9g_IIy))

October 7 — [Walter Bedell Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walter_Bedell_Smith&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728822774&usg=AOvVaw2Zj7iR0h6a4DAIcH2xBlQa) takes over as director of central intelligence. ()

October 12 — The Oak Ridger columnist [Robert Sharon Allen](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_S._Allen&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728823173&usg=AOvVaw2aTF3kzllChlJXIwiuj_z6) reports that the Atomic Energy Commission Security Service has issued a questionnaire to be used when UFOs are reported at its installations. (Robert S. Allen, “AEC Wants Info on Flying Saucers Seen near A-Plants,” The Oak Ridger, October 12, 1950; Project 1947, “[Robert S.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/allen/index.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728823475&usg=AOvVaw1gK7BkqdsDz22EzrJVR7as) [Allen Introduction](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/allen/index.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728823670&usg=AOvVaw2bqf8LIThCDnklX-S6cXI8)”)

October 12–November 5 — Some 15 radar and visual sightings of UFOs take place over restricted airspace at Oak Ridge, Tennessee. After the observation on October 23, an unexplained increase in alpha-beta background radiation is detected; after the November 29 sighting, an alpha and gamma ray increase is correlated with unidentified radar targets in the area. (ClearIntent, [pp. 171–173](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/clearintentgover00fawc/page/170/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728823983&usg=AOvVaw3bd4CxGCtYCqqHCrC3LReX); Memo from Strategic Air Command Knoxville to Director of FBI, “‘Flying Saucers’ Observed over Oak Ridge Area,” October 25, 1950; J. Edgar Hoover, \[[teletype in response](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs_oakridge/fbi_501205.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728824223&usg=AOvVaw1WYBJWsgGceQ9jfo1NdrBc)\], December 5, 1950; Bruce S. Maccabee, “[NCP-14: Saucers over Oak Ridge,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/ncp/ncp-brumac3.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728824439&usg=AOvVaw18onL8-AgM4Gn3uy3gUfKb)” from UFO–FBI Connection, Llewellyn, 2000, pp. 163–181; Francis Ridge, “[The Oak Ridge Sightings including All the Tennessee Blue Book](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/oakridge/oakridgesightings.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728824713&usg=AOvVaw0kvmXV4P4AIKyDhAwE3_Hf) [Unknowns,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/oakridge/oakridgesightings.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728824902&usg=AOvVaw0K6LUjIU5nJtsWlEltRXDB)” September 22, 2005; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728825085&usg=AOvVaw3gF1SXyPEKq_hk_xxwz3Tp)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728825269&usg=AOvVaw3vlaio4oaqGycvqgHg0Sin) pp. 100–102; Clark III 950; Swords 106–107; Hynek UFO Report, [pp.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/142/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728825519&usg=AOvVaw20oz6Y1fwyi5CBeLPEglRg)

[142–143](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/142/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728825769&usg=AOvVaw0oUXFq7KmGS2bN6B8APsvm))

* * *

October 13 — [J. Edgar Hoover](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Edgar_Hoover&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728826087&usg=AOvVaw2f43yPN2DU5yDCxRcTW-Qy) sends a teletype message to the Special Agent in Charge in Los Angeles, California, asking him to determine whether [Frank Scully](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Scully&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728826330&usg=AOvVaw2NHQkbk1ZL1gF01omzJVsS) is the same man who has been active in communist activities since the 1930s. (Anthony Bragalia, “[J. Edgar Hoover’s Saucer Crash Secrets,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ufoexplorations.com/j-edgar-hoovers-saucer-crash-secret&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728826626&usg=AOvVaw1f6rbi7GV0nlvB5yAaf2Zr)” UFO Explorations, April 2011)

October 15 — 4:20 p.m. After taking off from Raleigh, North Carolina, Miami Airlines DC-4 pilot Capt. George A. Woodward and copilot William Bardsley see four round, metallic objects descending slowly near Pope AFB \[now Pope Field\] at Fort Bragg. They look like two saucers fitted together and are about 100 feet in diameter, flying in a line about 25 feet apart. The pilots pursue the objects for about 3 minutes, but the objects recede then shoot away at tremendous speed. Around the same time, a similar object crosses the path of an Air Force jet near Pope AFB. (NICAP, “[Pilots Report 100-Ft Round Objects](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/501015pope_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728826958&usg=AOvVaw3UyS8U354fTDYFy2BmVCiT)”; NICAP, “[Aluminum-Like Object Crosses Path of Jet](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/501015pope2_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728827153&usg=AOvVaw1-QYuySrFmcOtGPFcWcaG1)”)

October 18 — USAF Brig. Gen. [Ernest Moore](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/106180/major-general-ernest-moore/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728827429&usg=AOvVaw2p5YYvjvPcMhQJCkozWetW) writes a memo to Col. [Harold E. Watson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/105276/brigadier-general-harold-e-watson/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728827692&usg=AOvVaw2ns14Ue5nWRtKasxJJpvwl) at Wright-Patterson AFB in Ohio, advising him of the standing policy of releasing no details about UFO case investigations. A form letter is to be used: “We have investigated and evaluated         incident and have found nothing of value and nothing which would change our previous estimates on this subject.” (Swords 102–103, 500)

November 5 — Four Pan American Airways employees (Fred Wilkinson, Patrick Joseph Maloney, Fred Perrior, and E. Newman) see a bright object fly east to west over Heathrow Airport, London, at 1,000 mph. (London Sunday Dispatch, November 12, 1950; “Saucers over England,” Fate 4, no. 2 (March 1951): 18)

November 7 — A military pilot flying a Douglas AD-4Q Skyraider near Lakehurst, New Jersey, engages in a dogfight with a steady white light that he at first mistakes for an aircraft. He gets on its tail, then the light reverses suddenly and passes 100–200 feet above his plane at incredible speed. He again tails it and the same thing happens. The light continues to “turn about me in wide, climbing turns, making about two orbits to my one.” He abandons chase at 11,500 feet. (NICAP, “[Light Makes 5–6 Head On Passes at Navy Plane](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/501107lakehurst_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728828343&usg=AOvVaw0THprGWe2ZNR_kJJYbda21)”; Hynek UFO Report, [pp. 68–70](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/68/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728828592&usg=AOvVaw1xC6IAMa4rdeP9xFGXIg3y); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728828779&usg=AOvVaw1HgG3rTFiguws0MAnog28R)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728828930&usg=AOvVaw0vIpAxvy0uv4ofjuf79NVA) p. 102)

November 16 — Col. [Harold E. Watson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/105276/brigadier-general-harold-e-watson/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728829211&usg=AOvVaw1BZxRCP4PvBWfJJ1B4GyKB) at AMC brings in news columnist [Bob Considine](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bob_Considine&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728829430&usg=AOvVaw3Tv5HruSqZ2zdzlTlwwjix) for an in-depth interview on flying saucers. Watson says: “I’ve seen lots of flying saucers…and every single saucer turned out to be the sun shining off the wing or body of a distant DC-4, or jet, or a weather balloon, or it was a reflection off a water-tank or something else that is readily explainable.” He characterizes witnesses as crackpots, religious fanatics, publicity hounds, or practical jokers. Considine asks him about airline pilot witnesses. Watson accuses them of being fooled by optical tricks and the power of suggestion. (Swords 107–108)

November 17 — Telenews Productions releases a 9½-minute short film, The Flying Saucer Mystery, apparently the first UFO documentary. The film’s main focus is on the best new evidence of 1950, the alleged first authentic photographs and motion picture film of flying saucers, the two snapshots by farmer [Paul Trent](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/84283949/paul-arthur-trent&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728829920&usg=AOvVaw2YmMaf5yqQYHihUtOmsrqh)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/84283949/paul-arthur-trent&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728830099&usg=AOvVaw0ADsQQ7iO5pa8CZi8oItF0) and the film shot by Louisville (Ky.) Times photographer Al Hixenbaugh on June 27, 1950. It also features UFO witness [Arthur](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/67846049/arthur-weisberger&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728830386&usg=AOvVaw0QIikaWd1o0X4-wGj2enfx) [Weisberger](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/67846049/arthur-weisberger&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728830605&usg=AOvVaw0IxLLqyxE8vUGS2um3hC8r) of Tucson, Arizona, describing his sighting, apparently the only record of the event, as well as [Donald](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728830825&usg=AOvVaw3IlH34Wo0PQgNJ33cPYhKk)

[E. Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728831050&usg=AOvVaw3_yTEFHvbnnOn9ZK99kHkJ) and Admiral [Calvin M. Bolster](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49125157/calvin-m-bolster&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728831307&usg=AOvVaw0YTNDP0IHGLU5kKI1R2M-H)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49125157/calvin-m-bolster&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728831476&usg=AOvVaw0T3q7_h7NF47J6_iSMmjF6) The film is apparently only shown for a few months and rotates among the Telenews Theaters across the nation. It is lost for decades until it resurfaces in the 1990s. (“[Flying](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v%3DhK_s_1m7lI8&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728831687&usg=AOvVaw0SjG1Ixhaq44UV88NOd64f) [Saucer Mystery,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v%3DhK_s_1m7lI8&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728831884&usg=AOvVaw3kv6bve4lAgfWfTjbWfc2A)” historycomestolife YouTube channel, July 3, 2010; Curt Collins, “[The First UFO Documentary:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2020/01/the-first-ufo-documentary-flying-saucer.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728832116&usg=AOvVaw2emr4-l33F1Y6keQ0nTUOe) [The Flying Saucer Mystery,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2020/01/the-first-ufo-documentary-flying-saucer.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728832425&usg=AOvVaw0OzlIebM03-rCVIQkdc8g0)” The Saucers That Time Forgot, January 9, 2020)

November 21 — [Wilbert Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Wilbert_B_Smith.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728832727&usg=AOvVaw0c7JhVrh2SXSlWLrqzQ8fn) writes a top secret memo to the Canadian Controller of Telecommunications claiming that he has talked to Canadian embassy staff in Washington, D.C., who tell him that the UFOs are the “most highly classified subject in the US government” (what [Sarbacher](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Dr_Robert_Sarbacher.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728832969&usg=AOvVaw3Zgs65jXm8x2hmCWcts8aw) told him) and that a “concerted effort is being made by a small group headed by Dr. [Vannevar Bush](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vannevar_Bush&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728833192&usg=AOvVaw3fJrLshTQK0gl58yfLKARe).” Sarbacher later verifies the information, saying the small group existed within the Research and Development Board. (W. B. Smith, “[Memorandum to the Controller of](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://roswellproof.homestead.com/Smith_11_21_50.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728833407&usg=AOvVaw3pk48RmtlP3ZYhzBJopWcN) [Telecommunications,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://roswellproof.homestead.com/Smith_11_21_50.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728833608&usg=AOvVaw2xSZtpme3jv9dMrC4BGUSa)” November 21, 1950; NICAP, “[The Smith Memo, November 21, 1950](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/smithmemodir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728833797&usg=AOvVaw22Kz4HDLRZR-AQXNhqsdGs)”; Good Above, [pp.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/182/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728833996&usg=AOvVaw0ZabFwVIe8gtKDSmiiXjLa) [183](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/182/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728834234&usg=AOvVaw2BVhN9vcGdKPnKITd7oLNu)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/182/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728834437&usg=AOvVaw0Yter87r0qk06U-OEEquWl) [464–466](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/464/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728834646&usg=AOvVaw18yC6W73Tg-DfJp0borA3D); Michael Hall and Wendy Connors, “The Research and Development Board: Unanswered Questions,” IUR 26, no. 2 (Summer 2001): 10–11)

November 26–27 —11:50 p.m. A “mysterious lighted object” flashing red, white, and green lights is seen above Huron (South Dakota) Regional Airport. Weather Bureau observer Gene Fowler, [Winfield Henry](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/61621047/winfield-d-henry&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728834986&usg=AOvVaw1uZchkzKHs6c0KJwDTJZgN) of the Civil Aeronautics Administration, and Gordon Moore and Chet Fuqua, ground personnel at Western Airlines, go up to the roof of the airport administration building for a better look. Fowler is able to watch it through a theodolite used for weather balloons for 8 minutes. He says, “The azimuth reading changed from 147 degrees to 161 degrees during that period and went up seven degrees vertically.” The Rapid City weather bureau and Aberdeen CAA in South Dakota estimate the object is 40–50 miles northwest of Bismarck, North Dakota. The object reappears at 1:30 a.m. and is visible, sometimes hovering, until 3:00 a.m. when it disappears to the northwest. In Aberdeen, CAA aircraft communicator William B. Hiller sees a star-like object at 2:00 a.m. and watches it for 90 minutes. It changes colors, glowing white, green, and red alternately. (“[Mysterious Sight May Be ‘Saucer,’](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93149224/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728835278&usg=AOvVaw3-R4DR5vT1PaXi4bkYVSat)” Rapid City

* * *

(S.Dak.) Journal, November 27, 1950, p. 3; Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: Volume 7, August–December 1950](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1950-Aug-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728835677&usg=AOvVaw2aLSjYwMqVDfEMS7BOkLyf),

The Author, 1982, pp. 59–60)

November 27 — [Bill Blair](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://airandspace.si.edu/support/wall-of-honor/capt-c-w-bill-blair&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728836002&usg=AOvVaw0WtQ6a6IYdP8iKw7lTcimZ)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://airandspace.si.edu/support/wall-of-honor/capt-c-w-bill-blair&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728836180&usg=AOvVaw1CBgOLNxPAV9FaPFiscuEe) a commercial pilot and flight instructor, watches six elliptical objects in loose echelon formation over Evansville, Wisconsin. They are making noises like a helicopter and are flying at 500 mph at 10,000 feet. (UFOEv, [p. 34](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D47%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728836405&usg=AOvVaw0nq8kWwB6Gn_L0533m706B))

December — The US seaplane tender [USS](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Gardiners_Bay_(AVP-39)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728836772&usg=AOvVaw2myUM_lYQ1rn_mMPsp4Ve4) [Gardiners Bay](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Gardiners_Bay_(AVP-39)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728836974&usg=AOvVaw09OMiInqCEnKIOVwgIkav1) is steaming up the channel from Incheon, South Korea, when the crew sees two mysterious, smoke-trailing objects that strike the water at tremendous speed. Two columns of water rise to 100 feet in height. No aircraft are sighted overhead. (Sanderson, [InvRes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.scribd.com/document/429706119/Invisible-Residents-The-Reality-of-Underwater-UFOs&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728837243&usg=AOvVaw1SrWDlUpeYfvx3La0b5qDc)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.scribd.com/document/429706119/Invisible-Residents-The-Reality-of-Underwater-UFOs&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728837434&usg=AOvVaw1RvLB_UgwJ0K62MNbLeEK9) p. 43; “[Sighting Flying](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.google.com/books/edition/Naval_Aviation_News/hmBGAQAAMAAJ?hl%3Den%26gbpv%3D1%26bsq%3D%25E2%2580%259CSighting%2520Flying%2520Discs%2520Again%253F%25E2%2580%259D&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728837686&usg=AOvVaw0MjUg8B_LhQ9wTFz73E1Vd) [Discs Again?](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.google.com/books/edition/Naval_Aviation_News/hmBGAQAAMAAJ?hl%3Den%26gbpv%3D1%26bsq%3D%25E2%2580%259CSighting%2520Flying%2520Discs%2520Again%253F%25E2%2580%259D&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728837934&usg=AOvVaw3dtCIvaeEvGKkhgp42S7UB)” Naval Aviation News 32, no. 2 (February 1951): 26)

December — Science writer [Gerald Heard](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gerald_Heard&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728838257&usg=AOvVaw1ZLlJnOrLiY2aj-RcRv4oY) publishes The Riddle of the Flying Saucers in the UK, in which he speculates that with conditions on Mars being severe, the only intelligent beings that can exist there would be advanced insects. A US edition is published in April 1951 as Is Another World Watching? The Riddle of the Flying Saucers. (Gerald Heard, The Riddle of the Flying Saucers, Carroll and Nicholson, 1950; Lyle Zapato, “[Of Bees and Men:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://zapatopi.net/blog/?post%3D201501270490.of_bees_and_men_the_riddle_of_the_flying_saucers&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728838697&usg=AOvVaw2sKMJ5zQ5scPaSWFQP_w3G) [The Riddle of the Flying Saucers,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://zapatopi.net/blog/?post%3D201501270490.of_bees_and_men_the_riddle_of_the_flying_saucers&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728838910&usg=AOvVaw2tRLvFUZpZurhzQtzRiZAn)” ZPi blog, January 27, 2015)

December 2 — Cmdr. [Charles Peter Edwards](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://rr0.org/people/e/EdwardsCharlesPeter/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728839162&usg=AOvVaw0puuQilADjLZASN6ZIbiBs), Canadian Deputy Minister of Transport for Air Services, approves [Wilbert](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Wilbert_B_Smith.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728839355&usg=AOvVaw3Yzy49GeYimdlqWpwM35Bd)

[B. Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Wilbert_B_Smith.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728839578&usg=AOvVaw0k_vuaRAmkt6l1F-DZgkC-)’s proposed plan to use the Department of Transport lab and field facilities during off-hours to gather quality UFO data. It is called Project Magnet. (“[What Was the Truth about Project Magnet?](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1964%252CJul-Aug%252CV%252010%252CN%25204.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728839835&usg=AOvVaw1_92tDPP9y6TlYRHj-c3ad)” Flying Saucer Review 10, no. 4 (July/Aug. 1964): 29; Clark III 1078; Good Above, [pp. 183–184](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/182/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728840105&usg=AOvVaw3QNN2iUgYZQobUPSYwCx2o))

December 5 — Engineer Lt. Col. John R. Hood disperses radiation counters around the Oak Ridge, Tennessee, National Laboratory’s restricted area. The intent is to map the presence of any unusual radiation, in the wake of numerous UFO reports over the facility. He also sets up a source of radioactive material to see if its presence has an effect on the air above it. If the air is unusually ionized, it might be the source of the anomalous radar targets. He also mentions using a magnetometer array, but there is no documentation of the result of this effort. (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: Volume 7, August–December 1950](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1950-Aug-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728840464&usg=AOvVaw1QZeL5egzflzBI1_VZTM_Y)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1950-Aug-Dec.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728840649&usg=AOvVaw0V9YyfVKp173VuERbrZG3l) The Author, 1982, pp. 64–65; Swords 107)

December 6 — 10:30–11:04 a.m. The ConAC Air Defense Controller notifies the HQ USAF that a number of unidentified aircraft are approaching the northeast area of the United States and that there is no reason to believe they are friendly. By radar contact it is determined that approximately 40 aircraft are in the flight at 32,000 feet on a course of 200° northeast of Limestone, Maine. The White House is notified at 10:31 a.m., and President [Truman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_S._Truman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728840974&usg=AOvVaw0Ww4vPh4ghLbOZZC22jN0L) discusses the reports in a meeting with UK Prime Minister [Clement Attlee](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clement_Attlee&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728841198&usg=AOvVaw1HGU9G7EAKKp_HwjKWyOr5). (NICAP, “[Radar-Inspired National](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/501206rina_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728841385&usg=AOvVaw1t9FDcddTQ92UoAWViWLe7) [Alert](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/501206rina_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728841573&usg=AOvVaw1v2WjqI-jIYF3bPGmcelPR)”; Bruce Maccabee, “[Immediate Saucer Alert! The Mystery of December 6, 1950,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/reports/rina4.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728841763&usg=AOvVaw2vk6KkDSWsu_Lghw7Ks3Z9)” July 1999; Clark III 824; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728841956&usg=AOvVaw3ibQxD4a6m4Mcjtg0uhZTY)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728842110&usg=AOvVaw0iIRweUUj5k9x982lmHwrf) p. 103)

December 6 — While F-94s are being tested at Dyess AFB near Abilene, Texas, radar catches a UFO on a high-speed intercept course with the planes. Some personnel see the object shortly afterward. Col. [Robert B. Willingham](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/151862594/robert-burton-willingham&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728842400&usg=AOvVaw0MNyqs-Lx3MGDUXEsRZCKQ) claims it is not a missile. It makes 90° turns at high speed. NORAD tracks it and the object is said to crash near the Mexican border near Del Rio, Texas. Willingham and a copilot take a light aircraft to the site but are escorted away. They do see part of the crash field and pick up a small piece of metal from the ground. Willingham takes it to a Marine Corps metallurgy lab in Hagerstown, Maryland, for analysis but never sees it again. (Kevin D. Randle, A History of UFO Crashes, Avon, 1995, [pp. 192–193](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/historyofufocras0000rand/page/192/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728842754&usg=AOvVaw2l_VsatNDdgECxsspgHW-2); Clark III 338; “[Del Rio 1955,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://roswellbooks.com/museum/?page_id%3D61&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728842944&usg=AOvVaw2-rb_iZ6D7w0_x4qv6yaU4)” Texas UFO Museum and Research Library, March 22, 2010; Kevin D. Randle, “[Del Rio UFO Crash and MJ-12,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2010/07/del-rio-ufo-crash-and-mj-12.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728843173&usg=AOvVaw1_CTjEJJxO265ZBFvIeVk-)” A Different Perspective, July 21, 2010; Kevin D. Randle, “MJ-12’s Fatal Flaw and Robert Willingham,” IUR 33, no. 4 (May 2011): 4–7)

December 6 — 5:00 p.m. Former aircraft purchasing agent [Harry Lamp](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/42739792/harry-g.lenn-lamp&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728843535&usg=AOvVaw0N7-IxdS2G2gLiM6GtONgW) and four boys spot a 75-foot silver object hovering at 3,000 feet above the northern part of Fort Myers, Florida. Through 10x binoculars Lamp sees it is 3–4 feet thick at the edges and 14 feet thick in the center, which revolves as it hovers. The object has a red rim with two white and two orange jets along it. It flies away at high speed. (NICAP, “[Large Object with Bubble on Top](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/501206ftmyers_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728843793&usg=AOvVaw3Rq7HElUFZYQCUUyKwEwau)”)

December 6 — Dubious MJ-12 documents refer to a UFO crash on the Mexico side of the US border in the area between El Indio, Texas, and Guerrero, Coahuila, Mexico. (“[El Indio 1950,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://roswellbooks.com/museum/?page_id%3D375&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728844065&usg=AOvVaw1GHdWnXsanNUKLWJaox-jp)” Texas UFO Museum and Research Library, February 5, 2014)

December 8 — The FBI office in Richmond, Virginia, sends a telegram to FBI headquarters saying that local Army Intelligence has been put “on immediate high alert for any data whatsoever concerning flying saucers.” It adds, “CIC advises data strictly confidential and should not be disseminated.” (Auerbach, \[[teletype memo](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs_oakridge/fbi_501208.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728844344&usg=AOvVaw3CJdpyuJHlnHGMbjVD9P0H)\], December 8, 1950; ClearIntent, [p. 175](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/clearintentgover00fawc/page/174/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728844563&usg=AOvVaw1Dl-l8un_TtbPid1bUt2ks))

December 10 — 7:30 p.m. RAF Group-Captain B. S. Cartmel and two friends are at the Wilderness Golf Course near Sevenoaks, Kent, England, when they see a bright light moving east to west in complete silence. It maintains a steady height of 3,000 feet moving at 130–150 mph and is visible for 5 minutes. (Good Above, [pp. 28–29](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/28/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728844843&usg=AOvVaw05U5dMUryjwG6x4heelr1r))

* * *

December 12 — The AFSWP’s Project Nutmeg officially selects the Tonopah–Las Vegas Bombing and Gunnery Range, Nevada, for domestic nuclear testing. (Wikipedia, “[Nevada Test and Training Range](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nevada_Test_and_Training_Range&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728845177&usg=AOvVaw3dtNVDsy97BXX45KF10eYA)”)

December 13 — 4:55 p.m. J. G. F. Moult and his mother are sitting at their home in Kimberley, South Africa, when they observe a bright object “like a huge mirror in the sky,” hovering, and moving laterally and up and down for about 3 minutes. It goes behind a cloud but can still be seen, appearing like a “piece of magnesium wire burning with a bright, purplish-white light.” It dives through the clouds, turns sharply, and shoots out of sight. (David Marais, “[The Outspan Magazine, January 1, 1954](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/outspan54.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728845480&usg=AOvVaw3c051xJu8-Pikg7Nhbc1Oj)”)

Late December — USAF Capt. [J. E. Broyles](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/3100492/james-edwin-broyles&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728845757&usg=AOvVaw1G5cc5eNWoJ4BAUTgU4npu) sees an aluminum-like oval object with a conical tail moving slowly in the sky near Cheyenne, Wyoming. (UFOEv, [p. 20](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D32%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728846010&usg=AOvVaw1rOxGHugbCiFUcIZ0d7rD6))

December 26 — Harvard University historian [William L. Langer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_L._Langer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728846272&usg=AOvVaw1Dj7D2eVWntj6B_sW3bNIh)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_L._Langer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728846487&usg=AOvVaw31KXG2x1w-pA40_DE7FQNJ) special assistant for intelligence analysis to US Secretary of State [James F. Byrnes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_F._Byrnes&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728846711&usg=AOvVaw0Smd0wPHYiON1KLgY6v1Z1)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_F._Byrnes&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728846870&usg=AOvVaw0wnn5IbvELRv3883PN-anp) organizes the CIA Office of National Estimates, a forerunner of the National Intelligence Council. (Central Intelligence Agency, “[Staff Conference: Minutes of Meeting Held in Director’s](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP80B01676R002300010024-2.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728847104&usg=AOvVaw15yw0F2swWjl3Xl_o3WuJl) [Conference Room, Administration Building, Tuesday, 26 December 1950, at 1100 Hours](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP80B01676R002300010024-2.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728847318&usg=AOvVaw3CvWFyTxa3g207GmfA0Hr3)”)

December 27 — Sunset. A TWA flight, piloted by Capt. Art Shutts, is enroute from Chicago to Kansas City. Near Bradford, Illinois, Shutts notices a bright white light ahead of the plane, also flashing red and green occasionally. It begins to “wobble and swerve unsteadily,” then streaks back and forth in a north-south line through an arc of 10–30°, changing direction abruptly. He notices that the horizon near the UFO appears to vibrate as if light is distorted, especially after the object puts on a burst of speed. It dims to a pinpoint and begins to slowly move south. Suddenly it lurches, accelerates rapidly, zooms upward at a 45° angle, makes a nearly square turn, plunges downward, and disappears below the horizon to the north. It is visible for 25 minutes. (UFOEv, [p. 40](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D52%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728847663&usg=AOvVaw1IBfOdgyHkk7OsDU051jPU))

1951

1951 — While flying an F-86 Sabrejet over West Germany, USAF pilot [Gordon Cooper](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gordon_Cooper&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728848151&usg=AOvVaw1U8RUHyEWdMTii08al0lWV) sees several metallic discs flying at a high altitude. He claims to “have two days of observation of many flights of them, of different sizes, flying in fighter formation, generally from east to west over Europe.” (Gordon Cooper and Bruce Henderson, Leap of Faith: An Astronaut’s Journey into the Unknown, HarperCollins, 2000, pp. 80–81; “[UFO Sightings by](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.syti.net/UFOSightings.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728848471&usg=AOvVaw2UzMYU0faYImSlPfzDudEa) [Astronauts,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.syti.net/UFOSightings.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728848668&usg=AOvVaw1Ha-qb-2t89AArAIOMT6Re)” Syti.net, January 30, 2001; “[Astronaut Gordon Cooper Talks about UFOs,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v%3DdvPR8T1o3Dc&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728848858&usg=AOvVaw0hSxfedYhP8wNE3Ta9fONb)” Elhardt YouTube channel, December 27, 2007)

1951 — The intelligence unit of the 1st Marine Aircraft Wing puts out periodic intelligence reports through 1953 that cover ground and air operations, unusual incidents, and UFO reports in Korea. The UFO reports are in a different category from unidentified aircraft. Some of these reports do not appear in Project Blue Book. (Jan Aldrich)

1951 — The Atomic Energy Commission uses its parallel system of secret-keeping to conduct controversial research, development, and engineering on aircraft and pilot-related projects, entirely without oversight. ()

1951 — [Marc Thirouin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marc_Thirouin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728849259&usg=AOvVaw3Drn8BkaYi524cXk91E7gN) founds the first UFO group in France, the Commission Internationale d’Enquêtes sur les Soucoupes Volantes, in Paris. It begins publishing Ouranos in June 1952 and issues 32 numbers through 1966, reviving in 1972 after Thirouin’s death with a new series that lasts until 1980. ([Ouranos](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/France/Ouranos/Ouranos%2520-%2520No%252001%2520-%25201952%252006.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728849585&usg=AOvVaw0dupz7_iwFAagK5trFKXFv)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/France/Ouranos/Ouranos%2520-%2520No%252001%2520-%25201952%252006.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728849794&usg=AOvVaw1XQ6mPERo2HOaM_goFHvEa) no. 1)

January — Author and journalist [Bob Considine](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bob_Considine&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728850126&usg=AOvVaw2kdAjHldlm-MAjqD55TOW5)’s article appears in Cosmopolitan, debunking all UFO stories as delusions and hoaxes, and quoting a weary Air Force Col. [Harold E. Watson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/105276/brigadier-general-harold-e-watson/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728850419&usg=AOvVaw3hBk6RHOwjOGppCt8ENsQb), who has replaced [McCoy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2014/10/colonel-howard-mccoy-and-mj-12.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728850657&usg=AOvVaw0iFNKFo8HUW9sHuJyOCaGw) in Project Grudge. It offends people so badly that many pilots afterward refuse to report UFO sightings to the Air Force.

USAF Public Information Officer Clare Welch, who has set this interview up, believes the Air Force has better things to do and is out of step with Cabell’s renewed interest. (Bob Considine, “[The Disgraceful Flying Saucer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/sim_cosmopolitan_1951-01_130_1/page/32/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728850978&usg=AOvVaw1YSyKtckhFW9hTcmNMmTjb) [Hoax!](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/sim_cosmopolitan_1951-01_130_1/page/32/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728851189&usg=AOvVaw0wme3U-rSZpJZJSoWa_T2A)” Cosmopolitan, January 1951, pp. 32–33, 100–102, [republished](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/cosmojan51.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728851449&usg=AOvVaw26anujOnF9s4Pvu8U59sAX) by Project 1947; Swords 113–114)

January 1 — 7:00 a.m. Katie Sowell watches an object about 30–50 feet in diameter, like two “upside down saucers” revolving counterclockwise and darting low over her farmhouse near Oak Grove, Louisiana. It has rectangular, opaque windows. It is seen for 15–20 minutes at close range. It banks and disappears, going straight up. (Huntsville (Ala.) Times, February 5, 1974; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1951-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728851828&usg=AOvVaw1Z4HtMxxe5IuauE1RoVwz6) [History: 1951, Supplemental Notes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1951-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728852043&usg=AOvVaw0v4Z09ECT27uZkuarNMR87)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1951-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728852212&usg=AOvVaw0ukUnEet7a0YJDRuk-xqC0) The Author, 2000, pp. 1–2)

January 1 — The Air Defense Command, inactivated since July 1, 1950, is reinstated as a major command at Mitchel AFB \[now closed\] in Long Island, New York. The HQ is moved to Ent AFB \[now the US Olympic Training Center\] in Colorado Springs, Colorado, a week later. (Wikipedia, “[Aerospace Defense Command](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aerospace_Defense_Command%23Reformation_1951&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728852559&usg=AOvVaw3qw4MHYsMsRIOaxdpJW9xu)”)

January 16 — Raymond Dugan and Raymond E. Stiles, members of the General Mills Aeronautical Research Laboratory balloon project, observe a round disc near their Skyhook balloon over Artesia, New Mexico. The balloon is at a height of 112,000 feet. A short time later, Dugan, Stiles, and four civilian pilots at Artesia Airport see two similar

* * *

objects circling the same balloon that then fly off to the northeast. (NICAP, “[Two Discs Approach Skyhook](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/510116artesia_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728852955&usg=AOvVaw3_CrgxLjTv_WQdSCsUl_Jp)”; Project Blue Book, \[[Artesia documents](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/510116artesia_docs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728853156&usg=AOvVaw2A5pySIFqd9617wrV6wFop)\]; J. Allen Hynek, The UFO Experience, Ballantine ed., 1974, [pp. 69–70](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/68/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728853412&usg=AOvVaw1pZny4hkug5tjYWIrBVLK4); Sparks, p. 104; Swords 166)

January 20 — 9:20 p.m. Sioux City, Iowa, CAA Control Tower operator John M. Williams sees an odd light in the west.

Capt. [Lawrence W. Vinther](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/80862109/lawrence-w-vinther&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728854016&usg=AOvVaw1meUEPkkUqwIv_BHNz4LBx) and copilot [James F. Bachmeier](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/308536/james-f-bachmeier&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728854248&usg=AOvVaw1BFltlKiV8bIyVMv9S_qHK) of Mid-Continent Airlines Flight 9 takes off and Vinther is asked by the tower to look for the light. While still in a climbing turn at about 1,000 feet, the pilots spot the object to the north-northwest at about 8,000 feet and 4 miles away. It looks like a B-29 fuselage with wings but no engines and blinks some lights like running lights. The object comes towards the DC-3, flies across the nose within 200 feet, then suddenly reappears on the other side, paralleling them for 2–3 seconds. The object then flies under them and disappears to the northwest. This is one of the first reports to make it into the CIRVIS system specified by JANAP 146. (NICAP, “[UFO Buzzes DC-3](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/510120siouxcity_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728854534&usg=AOvVaw1gZtnDJQOLxNumLQaXujXT)”; Lawrence W. Vinther, “[Another Saucer Mystery,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://books.google.com/books?id%3Da9uIro6WeNoC%26pg%3DPA23%26lpg%3DPA23%26dq%3DLawrence%252BW.%252BVinther%252C%252B%25E2%2580%259CAnother%252BSaucer%252BMystery%252C%25E2%2580%259D%252BFlying%252BJune%252B1951%26source%3Dbl%26ots%3DK4sPgAZVhR%26sig%3DACfU3U136sQ1yJhwBCv5Yaoa0kzTvEEWSw%26hl%3Den%26sa%3DX%26ved%3D2ahUKEwjAv72w3sX1AhVNITQIHWYgDJwQ6AF6BAgkEAM%2523v%253Donepage%26q%3DLawrence%2520W.%2520Vinther%252C%2520%25E2%2580%259CAnother%2520Saucer%2520Mystery%252C%25E2%2580%259D%2520Flying%2520June%25201951%26f%3Dfalse&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728854898&usg=AOvVaw3rMj-j1yhbCdeqQvielPCF)” Flying 48 (June 1951): 23, 56, [reprinted](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/vinther51.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728855196&usg=AOvVaw3qb0brUpYF9FQWU62H4UD_) by Project 1947; Ruppelt, [p. 84](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/84/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728855426&usg=AOvVaw0sUQ_nqlpDfzOnP7cy3GG2); Jan Aldrich; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728855649&usg=AOvVaw1BGGxW_1LOFCgSz1E5DHVi), p. 104; James E. McDonald, “[Statement on Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23pilots&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728855869&usg=AOvVaw15xblFN5_Nik_eRJ4lXBVW)” in Symposium on Unidentified Flying Objects, Hearings, US House Committee on Science and Astronautics, 90th Cong., 2nd Sess., July 29, 1968, pp. 43–44)

January 21 — 4:20 p.m. A UFO that appears to be over the restricted area at Oak Ridge National Laboratory, Tennessee, is sighted on the radarscope of an F-82 fighter. The GCI gives the go-ahead to intercept the target. The radar set on the F-82 is locked on and the run begins. The interception is unsuccessful, and the fighter returns to base. In all, three passes are made at targets, all with radar indications, but they cannot be completed since the target is over the restricted area that includes the X-10 plant. (NICAP, “[F-82 Attempts Intercept of UFO over AEC Plant /](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/510121oakridge_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728856239&usg=AOvVaw2R-AoSuN63j4ADe2bN4y2R) [Radar](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/510121oakridge_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728856426&usg=AOvVaw3tmuZ1OwJX9xHOq0vYOANc)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728856617&usg=AOvVaw0OU-veTWw7usYYtG-zKOzL)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728856768&usg=AOvVaw1kw0os3xJ9YmUie-HCzpsZ) p. 104)

January 22 — 11:00 a.m. USAF pilots Capt. [Ernest W. Spradley Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/3051370/ernest-warner-spradley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728857059&usg=AOvVaw2Rh5ZWYXMreO7xy8n9O0Y1) of Aerial Photo Lab and Capt. James E. Cocker of All-Weather Flying Division (both based at Wright-Patterson AFB in Ohio), a General Mills Aeronautical lab project engineer named McAleese, and another airman are flying in a C-47 heading east about 50 miles southeast of Holloman AFB, New Mexico, at about 10,000–12,000 feet, tracking a Project Gopher plastic balloon at about 50,000–70,000 feet, when they see a bright star-like object adjacent to the pear-shaped balloon. As they approach and fly under the balloon, they notice the object descend to the balloon’s level and grow larger in apparent size until about one-quarter to one-half the size of the 70-foot balloon. It appears to be round and flat like a dime, milky white or silvery in color, with a clear outline. Cocker and McAleese leave the cockpit and go to the astrodome to observe the object. After 3 minutes they see the object separate from the balloon and head west at high speed. After about 1 minute it emits a series of 3 bright photoflashes at one-second intervals and disappears from sight. (NICAP, “[C-47 Crew Encounter Object near ‘Gopher’](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/510121oakridge_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728857386&usg=AOvVaw1uJqONSDjhDx7XqhA7ml3B)”; NICAP, “[White Object Paces Balloon](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/510214alamogordo_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728857582&usg=AOvVaw0yRSpLjj8R0xh_z3eCp145)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728857770&usg=AOvVaw1AuFC8HJaEfyRb_trJYehE)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728857921&usg=AOvVaw379lTk8fxzHIUzD1bpvYXI) p. 105; Swords 114–115)

January 27 — An Air Force B-50D bomber drops the first atomic bomb, the Able blast, for testing in the US onto a dry lake bed known as Frenchman Flat, inside the Nevada Test Site. (Wikipedia, “[Operation Ranger](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Ranger&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728858192&usg=AOvVaw2D_GGK-XGCi7hKtB56zW9g)”)

January 29 — USAF Lt. Col. [Milton D. Willis](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49365086/milton-dean-willis&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728858455&usg=AOvVaw2XLVGxxAkPmtkwRB9EMxmM) replies to [Robert B. Sibley](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/204932537/robert-b_-sibley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728858690&usg=AOvVaw3dwJSCI8IpP_C-CPPggQxS), president of the Aero Club of New England, who has written Secretary of the Air Force [Thomas K. Finletter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_K._Finletter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728858888&usg=AOvVaw2VLIoOJzKbKADnur70N4hW) asking that the UFO project be reinstated because pilots are indeed seeing something that could be extraterrestrial. Willis writes that, although the UFO project is disbanded, the Air Force still investigates incidents and sends them to AMC if necessary, and an officer (Willis himself, who has replaced [Boggs](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Boggs_J.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728859139&usg=AOvVaw3v2KUc-vnFDPVdpP_--S4U)) monitors all UFO reports. As an aside to his superiors, Willis in a memo notes that “there have been several incidents, during the last six months, which cannot be explained and further investigation may be necessary.” (Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1951-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728859357&usg=AOvVaw045gyHxmgArWjAVyRiLT1c) [1951, Supplemental Notes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1951-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728859560&usg=AOvVaw1ZFvFJpvaVOLWrb54itawt)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1951-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728859734&usg=AOvVaw2BW58V4g497UQSgFiPqB5w) The Author, 2000, pp. 7 –8; Swords 113)

February 9 — 9:55 p.m. The crew (including Lt. [Fred W. Kingdon Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/69695127/fred-william-kingdon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728860082&usg=AOvVaw2cw2Qk9bXOGz_f2oxg5MLM) and US Naval Reserve Lt. Bethune](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/78330887/graham-eugene-bethune&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728860316&usg=AOvVaw2SJn1QSpSXhv-hTwMYILEW)) and passengers of a US Navy R5D transport flying west from Keflavík, Iceland, at 10,000 feet about 212 miles northeast of Gander, Newfoundland, observe a large orange-rimmed UFO with a dark center. It is about 400 feet in diameter and first seen moving above the surface of the ocean. As the plane approaches, the object changes colors, executes a sudden 180° turn and disappears over the horizon. Over time, several attempts to disguise the participants have resulted in confusion over the date. (NICAP, “[The Bethune Encounter](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/510210newfoundland_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728860549&usg=AOvVaw2kwTjo1Xxf9-bJJYr4KKD2)”; NICAP, “[Huge Object](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/510221newfoundland_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728860739&usg=AOvVaw3I6M-rjj8g6zU6g269sPm8) [Rushes up from Ocean Surface](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/510221newfoundland_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728860924&usg=AOvVaw2PEL_AG8qQBhPZLNyufSva)”; February 13 — [William Webster](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nytimes.com/1972/05/19/archives/william-webster-power-execijtive-expentagon-official-dead-led-new.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728864113&usg=AOvVaw082yqadVDYiYugJ67I2udy), chair of the Defense Department’s Research and Development Board, convenes a press briefing at the Pentagon and announces that “Careful studies have been made \[referring to the upcoming article in Look\]. I don’t believe anyone who has the opportunity to be informed and to look into this thing believes there is a flying saucer as such. As far as I know there is nothing to the flying saucers.” (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1951.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728864424&usg=AOvVaw1_J8U61R1VL1ZXTQJlh_K9) [History: Volume 8, 1951](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1951.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728864633&usg=AOvVaw3wzlcJBUi16xGgHp5Mh59B)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1951.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728864804&usg=AOvVaw2zmHCgfZReMDGFUthllMlY) The Author, 1983, pp. 13–14)

February 19 — 7:20 a.m. Capt. Jack Bicknell and Radio Officer D. W. Merrifield are flying a Lockheed Model 18 Lodestar aircraft out of Nairobi, Kenya, when they see a bright object hanging motionless about 10,000 above Mount Kilimanjaro in Tanganyika \[now Tanzania\]. They watch it for 3 minutes, then tell the passengers about it. Bicknell observes it through binoculars and sees a “metallic, bullet-shaped object which must have been over 200 feet long.” It has a vertical fin at one end, and at regular intervals along the fuselage are vertical dark bands. It remains completely stationary for 17 minutes. Two passengers take photos of it. Then it begins rising and moving eastward, disappearing at 40,000 feet. It leaves no vapor trail. (NICAP, “[Lodestar Crew Sees Stationary Silver](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/510219kilimanjaro_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728865143&usg=AOvVaw2hOZ7xtC7JO9blJGULLsbq) [Elongated Object](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/510219kilimanjaro_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728865353&usg=AOvVaw1_3tl0Fq8SbtHzFPolceB4)”; “[The Flying Saucer: Captain Bicknell’s Own Story,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/cases/1951_02_19_TZ_09_Mt-Kilimanjaro_Baller_MultiWit_Photor.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728865575&usg=AOvVaw1Bj0gEXOt3hsp72rQiw6eR)” Nairobi (Kenya) Sunday Post, February 25, 1951, p. 15; Center for UFO Studies, \[[case documents](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/cases/1951_02_19_TZ_09_Mt-Kilimanjaro_Baller_MultiWit_Photor.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728865848&usg=AOvVaw1XHekipzMQ0PPUpHGiLBxK)\]; UFOEv, [p. 124](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D136%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728866061&usg=AOvVaw3B_rvqmTsoLJup67Dwezi4); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728866254&usg=AOvVaw2ipeEwxdpUSqtz-XdsczU-)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728866418&usg=AOvVaw2kNyRhwDns1VcD6xaKdlC1) p. 105; Patrick Gross. “[February 19, 1951, Mount Kilimanjaro, Africa](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/kilimandjaro1951.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728866634&usg=AOvVaw3h34RWWI4z7TphBJZj4A6I)”; Barry Greenwood, “[Mt. Kilimanjaro, Tanganyika, February 19,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.greenwoodufoarchive.com/uhr/uhr16.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728866842&usg=AOvVaw1z6DO8Gonck4JIAc1-SDEe) [1951: Photo Located,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.greenwoodufoarchive.com/uhr/uhr16.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728867057&usg=AOvVaw3fEwXAb93VzP3sUd7lBUit)” UFO Historical Revue, no. 16 (July 2015): 1–4)

February 19 — Aviation Week praises the upcoming article in Look identifying UFOs as balloons. (Robert H. Wood, “Saucers, Secrecy, and Security,” Aviation Week 54 (February 19, 1951): 50, [reprinted](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1951a.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728867543&usg=AOvVaw1RzfieMNO4BD73AaZQc_sQ) by Project 1947)

February 20 — The Air Intelligence Training Bulletin publishes a facetious news item on how to recognize flying saucers, but implies they are all reflections. (“[Recognition of Flying Saucers,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/aitb_1.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728867901&usg=AOvVaw2cZYTjYNjT43jSH0uGDjxV)” Air Intelligence Training Bulletin, February 20, 1951)

February 25 — Project Twinkle head and chemist Anthony O. Mirarchi at the USAF Cambridge Research Laboratory in Massachusetts tells the Associated Press that he thinks UFOs are not “just balloons” (in response to [Liddel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/local/1979/10/03/urner-liddel-ex-physicist-headed-lunar-planetary-unit/126c1f5b-1d2a-4045-9bb5-9f7327808c1c/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728868297&usg=AOvVaw2VT9OK9Xu5dUIRVcCxrf2D)’s upcoming article) and urges a full investigation of what could be experiments by a “potential enemy of the United States.” He says that UFO reports show “maneuvered motion” that are not characteristic of a natural phenomenon. He says the “Navy report is erroneous. It lulls people into a false sense of security.” He reminds the nation of the critical installations in New Mexico, including Los Alamos, and argues that they are a target of reconnaissance: “If they were launched by a foreign power, then they could lead to a worse Pearl Harbor than we have ever experienced.” He blasts the US government for a policy of “suicide by secrecy.” The FBI and Air Force mull prosecuting Mirarchi for violating AFR 205-1. (“[A.F. Scientist Warns Saucers Major Threat,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93205228/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728868554&usg=AOvVaw0XWCpg_sF0FuG-a1Daaies)” Dayton (Ohio) Daily News, February 26, 1951, p. 1; “[Scientist Fears Flying Saucers Portend a Worse ‘Pearl Harbor,’](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/articles/MirarchiArticle.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728868812&usg=AOvVaw0V6QJiEsjCiXh1A5XZy3k7)” Oklahoma Daily Oklahoman, February 26, 1951, p 1; Swords 119–120; Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: Volume 8, 1951](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1951.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728869090&usg=AOvVaw3fZsQBwbFI5taqxBkR0NmV)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1951.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728869259&usg=AOvVaw01AyQ9YpdlqNE6fASzBahq) The Author, 1983, pp. 18–19)

February 27 — Physicist [Urner Liddel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/local/1979/10/03/urner-liddel-ex-physicist-headed-lunar-planetary-unit/126c1f5b-1d2a-4045-9bb5-9f7327808c1c/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728869621&usg=AOvVaw3VAw2wJrw8yNftZpLpb1DQ)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/local/1979/10/03/urner-liddel-ex-physicist-headed-lunar-planetary-unit/126c1f5b-1d2a-4045-9bb5-9f7327808c1c/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728869876&usg=AOvVaw1WCAC2VeReFe9fJuhZs4FU) Office of Naval Research, says in a Look magazine article that there is not a single reliable UFO report that is not attributable to the cosmic \[Skyhook\] balloons. The article is based on Liddel’s study in ONR’s Research Reviews in March. He claims to have studied “hundreds” of sightings in detail (probably from Project Grudge). As for UFOs sighted by Skyhook scientists themselves, he discounts them because these technicians are not aware of mirages and internal reflections in optical devices. (Richard Wilson, “A Nuclear Physicist Exposes Flying Saucers,” Look, February 27, 1951, pp. 60–64; Swords 117–118; Urner Liddel, “[Bogies at Angels 100,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dosu.32435069145381%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D75%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728870328&usg=AOvVaw1viHL1T6c29mg59WR2c8Ac)” Research Reviews, March 1951, pp. 1–6)

March — A ghost light is seen in Suffolk County, Virginia, and investigated by Nansemond County Deputy Sheriff [Hurley Jones](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/25642529/hurley-jones&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728870728&usg=AOvVaw2TCVm2b03VPbGt-kBcD_Ej)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/25642529/hurley-jones&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728870898&usg=AOvVaw36VLF9cRf_UWARvEKBV712) who sees the light three times. It looks like a car headlight 5 feet off the ground, three times. Jeston Reid said his father had seen the light in the 1870s. The location is apparently either Turlington Road or Jackson Road \[they intersect\] south of Suffolk, since locals say the old railroad along the Jackson and Whaleyville logging road used to run down that way, and the light has also been compared to a locomotive headlight. Some 200 people have been gathering along the road, hoping to catch a glimpse. (“[Mystery Light Is a Puzzle in Nansemond,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/91144882/the-times-dispatch/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728871152&usg=AOvVaw25_T-wbMhObQVk0QKqm8xW)” Richmond (Va.) Times-Dispatch, March 6, 1951, p. 2; “[Nansemond’s Mystery Light Is Nothing New to Old-](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/91144937/the-times-dispatch/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728871428&usg=AOvVaw05Rd4DmPoa6sW5O94thYZx) [Timers,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/91144937/the-times-dispatch/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728871635&usg=AOvVaw0xOLQaALImUVMZKK_rUBja)” Richmond (Va.) Times-Dispatch, March 7, 1951, p. 2; “[Mysterious Suffolk Light Has Deputy Believing](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/91145128/statesville-daily-record/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728871908&usg=AOvVaw333sQIW5JShhPoPbq4lICb) [in Ghosts,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/91145128/statesville-daily-record/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728872157&usg=AOvVaw3tjqOXSwuGV8n4CcjCG_Qj)” Statesville (N.C.) Daily Record, March 8, 1951, p. 1)

March — 11:30 p.m. Operations Officer Robert Wood is aboard the [USS Dyess](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Dyess_(DD-880)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728872605&usg=AOvVaw0NpS3EM_hberRl5iqi8HVQ) approximately 125 miles southeast of Cape May, New Jersey, when he picks up a radar target coming in from due east at a speed of 98–104 mph and an altitude of 3,000–4,000 feet. It stops and hovers about 30 miles away. Wood notifies the bridge, and the captain orders the ship to change course toward the object. About 30 minutes later, the UFO suddenly takes off toward the north at 3,000 mph, getting to within 35–40 miles south of Nantucket Island, Massachusetts, before it zooms

* * *

straight up. Altitude-determining radar tracks the object to 100 miles altitude. (“[March, 1951: Approximately 125](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1951a.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728873007&usg=AOvVaw1_zminnFmpwNtVLVSK1uZD) [Miles SE of Cape May, N.J.,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1951a.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728873206&usg=AOvVaw04oOGi7t_qIOA63oL-6pMU)” Project 1947)

March 14 — A group of nine Bell Aircraft engineers are flying at 15,000 feet in a B-50 Superfortress near Holloman AFB, New Mexico, during a test of a secret Bell aircraft. They spot a group of unknown objects flying in a confusing “swirl” that breaks into a V-formation and back to a “swirl,” then a V again. The objects are slightly higher than the aircraft and seem to be moving at high velocity. The engineers insist the objects are not geese, which actually can fly this high. (This may be the same incident as the August 30, 1950, case at Holloman.) (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: Volume 8, 1951](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1951.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728873521&usg=AOvVaw0xBjrG95fUVpL7tVwtGpcX)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1951.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728873779&usg=AOvVaw0aGrdAOELVt7wr4HGPgnAI) The Author, 1983, pp. 21–22)

March 15 — 10:20 a.m. George F. Floate, chief engineer of the Delhi Flying Club, and two assistants observe a swirly white cloud moving from north to south at about 4,000 feet altitude near the club’s hanger in New Delhi, India. The cloud is about 700 feet in length. At the end of it a bullet-shaped object appears, approximately 100 feet long and as big around as a C-47 fuselage. The witnesses shout out, and 17–20 people rush out of the hanger and see the object. It heads south for about 3 minutes where it makes an apparent loop, coming back over the field. At the top of the loop it is out of sight, but it is seen again in its dive. After recovering straight and level flight, the UFO proceeds to the southwest until it is lost to sight. Its speed is estimated at three times greater than the cruising speed of a British Vampire jet. The total duration is about 7 minutes. (NICAP, “[20+ Top Shelf Witnesses /](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/510315newdelhi_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728874433&usg=AOvVaw3oJLyZj9ZAWiiQSaGHJu80) [Metallic Cigar](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/510315newdelhi_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728874764&usg=AOvVaw1XzsIVJFQJaoMT4IzUMhui)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728875084&usg=AOvVaw0G9P9fE5Wh_1BQXEeTUUn6), p. 106)

Early spring — Dusk. US Army Pfc. [Francis P. Wall](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/74275338/francis-patrick-wall&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728875631&usg=AOvVaw3f0jrarceqyMyu_MkFvmbO) is on maneuvers with the 27th Infantry Regiment near Cheorwon, South Korea, when he sees an orange light like a jack-o-lantern coming down a mountain. Artillery airbursts do not seem to harm it. As it approaches, it turns into a brilliant blue-green disc pulsating with light. Wall asks permission to shoot and fires a round from his M-1 rifle at it. The object starts moving erratically from side to side, flashes on and off, and makes an engine-like noise. It sweeps the soldiers with a beam of light, and they feel a burning and tingling sensation. They retreat to their bunkers and continue to watch the object, which is still lighting up the area, and then it shoots away at a 45° angle. (Haines, Korea, [pp. 18–27](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/aadkw/aadkw_ch2.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728876151&usg=AOvVaw1CZHAeytTO_E2a88wrq9JF); Richard F. Haines, “GI Fires on UFO in Korea,” IUR 15, no. 6 (Nov./Dec. 1990): 23–24)

April 4 — The Truman administration forms the Psychological Strategy Board to coordinate and plan for psychological operations. The board is composed of the Under Secretary of State, the Deputy Secretary of Defense, and

the Director of Central Intelligence, or their designated representatives. The board’s first director is [Gordon Gray](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gordon_Gray_(politician)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728877214&usg=AOvVaw2ayfFI9bMNuS1MCyki4w3C)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gordon_Gray_(politician)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728877495&usg=AOvVaw3U5dFnOj8JLKztE6lQipqd) later National Security Advisor during the Eisenhower administration. The board is created in response to the growth of Office of Policy Coordination covert activities during the Korean War. The PSB is tasked with creating propaganda that will subconsciously turn people away from communism and toward democracy. It is abolished in 1953. (Wikipedia, “[Psychological Strategy Board](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psychological_Strategy_Board&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728878310&usg=AOvVaw0NRkdkFK3Twa3nLNUrkbNt)”)

April 7 — [Howard Hawks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Howard_Hawks&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728878774&usg=AOvVaw0HaT2p9zkNJZCb8mHCoRIt)’s film The Thing from Another World opens, starring [Margaret Sheridan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Margaret_Sheridan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728879222&usg=AOvVaw0PEqUpjz4wMr5bjfQJeZhl), [Kenneth Tobey](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenneth_Tobey&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728879559&usg=AOvVaw2JSKWa5bAhbJlT2z8Bg4Um), and [James Arness](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Arness&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728879889&usg=AOvVaw06RKV8MRqAH2Y5eTFN4p4b)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Arness&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728880080&usg=AOvVaw2gF3mq2QQLgQ-eeNcHSBre) about a crashed flying saucer found in the Arctic. It ends with the haunting lines by [Douglas](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0817930/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728880289&usg=AOvVaw3-HUK5Wt4ehzkI_w93rUbQ) [Spencer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0817930/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728880532&usg=AOvVaw3Ic8YPXFgYFmxsaPpLnn-f): “Watch the skies, everywhere! Keep looking. Watch the skies!” (Internet Movie Database, “[The Thing](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0044121/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728880734&usg=AOvVaw3Vr2SwQouAeCPfP-2PIU_A) [from Another World](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0044121/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728880935&usg=AOvVaw2G-zQiB5sXCjSMv1AuRiCp)”)

April 11 — Air Defense Command issues a memo on “Unconventional Aircraft” to all USAF facilities, encouraging them to report sightings in a timely manner. (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: Volume 8, 1951](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1951.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728881216&usg=AOvVaw2GAOMZ5u_4S7O9qNpXiYBK), The Author, 1983, pp. 25)

April 17 — Project Grudge’s Col. [Harold E. Watson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/105276/brigadier-general-harold-e-watson/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728881581&usg=AOvVaw00iUd76NGYvEX_ziLr7GaH) notes that JANAP 146 has no provision for UFO reports to be sent to Wright-Patterson AFB under the CIRVIS system. (Jan Aldrich)

April 21 — Drones are again used in the series of thermonuclear tests designated Operation Greenhouse at Enewetak Atoll in the Marshall Islands. During the Easy detonation, two T-33 drones are lost. One receives heavy damage from the shock wave, loses control, and crashes; the other refuses to respond to control signals and crashes on uninhabited Bogullua Island. The Air Force concludes that unmanned samplers are unreliable. (M/Sgt Leland B. Taylor, [History of Air Force Atomic Cloud Sampling](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.hsdl.org/?abstract%26did%3D485689&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728881925&usg=AOvVaw2QWakl-4Nsw59gUbm37hlx)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.hsdl.org/?abstract%26did%3D485689&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728882101&usg=AOvVaw3BnhX5ClpzCK4q1V4GoIva) US Special Weapons Center, January 1963, pp. 34–37; Jacobsen, Area 51, [p. 225](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/224/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728882595&usg=AOvVaw2vIy58mZrdapoSF3Xu905G))

April 23 — Col. [Harold E. Watson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/105276/brigadier-general-harold-e-watson/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728883098&usg=AOvVaw3-yTBMb85pi8wodRGYfsuP) writes a memo to the USAF Director of Intelligence, explaining his view that “little if any results” have been obtained from Project Grudge other than the objects are not from a foreign power. But since there is still dome doubt, all reports should be forwarded to AMC at Wright-Patterson AFB in Ohio . (Swords 121)

May 21— Wright-Patterson’s Technical Intelligence Department (T-2) becomes the Air Technical Intelligence Center (ATIC) and is assigned to the Directorate of Intelligence in the Pentagon. Project Grudge goes along with it. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728883660&usg=AOvVaw0Ac0TKxctOgwsVKG1M4o3D)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728883823&usg=AOvVaw2xTHPZBWtGqvoegLOLLfq3) p. 12; Clark III 936)

* * *

May 22 — 3:20 a.m. American Airlines pilot Capt. W. R. Hunt observes a blue-white, star-like object gyrating around the airplane at 21,000 feet for 20 minutes about 100 miles southwest of Dodge City, Kansas. It moves backward and forward, then up and down, then dives below the plane and speeds away. (“[Mysterious Bright Light ‘Plays Tag’](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/91223699/the-iola-register/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728884193&usg=AOvVaw26RZKG8N9bqDmpNkzFtWX9) [with Airliner over Kansas,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/91223699/the-iola-register/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728884400&usg=AOvVaw2r7lPIusZPyx3MuakIPFEc)” Iola (Kan.) Register, May 22, 1951, p. 1; Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: Volume](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1951.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728884668&usg=AOvVaw3bcl7VKrkUuDiW2DKG3LKz) [8, 1951](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1951.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728884882&usg=AOvVaw3rG40icQZpzkOHMhTbNb2w)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1951.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728885090&usg=AOvVaw3QzDcqS5eE8EN6kVo_n79G) The Author, 1983, p. 26)

June — Project Grudge only has one person on staff to investigate UFO reports, Lt. [Jerry W.
