Cummings](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Cummings_J.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728885448&usg=AOvVaw2X8CoJLRfU765F_1p0Dar4), who reorganizes the system and uses a more open-minded approach. (Jacobs, UFO Controversy in America, Signet ed., 1976, [pp.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufocontroversyin00jaco/page/56/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728885865&usg=AOvVaw1gyGbh7CLGHhzLPAJN8GW6) [56–57](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufocontroversyin00jaco/page/56/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728886118&usg=AOvVaw0WXZ1p-MctxO5hdUbbA6ti); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728886320&usg=AOvVaw39QCCsny2DbcvBBZO0jCP8)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728886483&usg=AOvVaw1yKnagtyilnOd7lSmCkY90) p. 14; Swords 121)

June — The UK Flying Saucer Working Party produces its six-page final report for the Ministry of Defence’s Directorate of Scientific Intelligence, DSI/JTIC Report number 7, Unidentified Flying Objects, classified Secret. The CIA’s chief scientist, [H. Marshall Chadwell,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Chadwell.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728886836&usg=AOvVaw3rkuwGvn8mRMwsGXVb1KBH) attends the meeting when the report is delivered. The report admits that no systematic investigation has been undertaken, but from the evidence examined, including reports by RAF pilots, explanations can probably be found for most reports. Copies are also submitted to Canada as well as US and UK officials. (Joe McGonagle, “[Flying Saucer Working Party: Commentary,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.uk-ufo.org/condign/fswpcmnt2.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728887112&usg=AOvVaw3m44xVLmk-ZYueuqDHSrKv)” part 2, The Real UFO Project; Good Need, [pp. 149–152](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/148/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728887329&usg=AOvVaw12hqZvwR8MqUXmUMlSfia0); David Clarke, “[Flying Saucer Working Party,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://drdavidclarke.co.uk/national-archives-ufo-files-7/flying-saucer-working-party/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728887580&usg=AOvVaw1rMrAEtQv6dQUAXlaiXwRD)” Dr. David Clarke Folklore and Journalism, January 3, 2015; UFOFiles2, [pp. 38–40](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/the-ufo-files-the-inside-story-of-real-life-sightings-david-clarke/page/n65/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728887819&usg=AOvVaw1Mxhe1y4TTwhty1tBmcYcf); Mark Rodeghier, “Britain’s Secret UFO Study,” IUR 26, no. 4 (Winter 2001–2002): 21–23; Ian Ridpath, “[Report of the UK Government’s Flying Saucer Working Party (1951 June),](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ianridpath.com/ufo/ukgwp.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728888086&usg=AOvVaw0hinKE7aQd2IniJ3XJ51GV)” Ian Ridpath’s UFO Skeptic Pages, January 2021)

June 1 — 10:00 p.m. An ATIC official at Wright-Patterson AFB is driving west near Dayton, Ohio, when he sees a large, bluish-white light moving parallel to the car. It looks like a “stubby cigar.” After 15–20 seconds, it makes a right- angle turn, becomes circular, and rapidly disappears. Its speed is “faster than an airplane, slower than a meteor.” (UFOEv, [p. 23](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D35%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728888388&usg=AOvVaw1cvdLQGrcDpEgeafaF3_wU))

June 19 — Day. Mechanic Joseph Matiszewski hears a whistling sound as he is walking in Sønderborg, Denmark, and sees an object land in a nearby meadow. Approaching to within 150 feet of it, he finds himself paralyzed and notices that birds have stopped singing and cows seem frozen in place. Four men with brown skin and wearing black shiny suits and translucent helmets emerge from the object and send Matiszewski some telepathic messages. Eight smaller objects are ejected from the large one and float above it. Other figures inside the craft and on its deck appear to be making repairs. The objects ascend to about 300 feet and climb rapidly after that. The paralysis subsides. (Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1951-06-19-denmark-sonderborg.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728888719&usg=AOvVaw2C5NJQwUMZKw9BcRp0wPfj)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1951-06-19-denmark-sonderborg.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728888899&usg=AOvVaw29S9CEvMYiDqF9en7erJKJ) July 1, 2007)

June 22 — Life magazine reporter [Robert Emmett Ginna Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.encyclopedia.com/arts/educational-magazines/ginna-robert-emmett-jr-1927&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728889338&usg=AOvVaw2mkiQfEO_IqQ4zC12E2VWc) visits Air Technical Intelligence Center at Wright-Patterson AFB in Ohio for the first time to gather information on “Project Saucer” for an article. The visit is coordinated by Jack T. Shea, special assistant to the director of public relations. (Jan Aldrich; Michael D. Swords, “1952: Ruppelt’s Big Year,” IUR 28, no. 4 (Winter 2003–2004): 8)

June 25 — The UK Flying Saucer Working Party is disbanded. (Good Need, [p. 152](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/152/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728889753&usg=AOvVaw0IEZvLKze-hn3XyMQhifmI))

Summer — A dubious story surfaces in 1956 that three UFOs had appeared above Mexico City International Airport at the same time as a visit by US Secretary of Defense [George C. Marshall](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Marshall&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728890098&usg=AOvVaw23IsVjyOPrL72mpuZRW2A6)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Marshall&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728890266&usg=AOvVaw0_KSF8m-p0UAPPiYfbTqbC) (However, there is no record of a visit by Marshall at this time; apparently his first visit to Mexico was a vacation in Cuernavaca in February 1952.) According to the story, Marshall tells a “highly placed American” and “prominent medical scientist” that UFOs are interplanetary and friendly, but they have crashed accidentally on three occasions. In 1965, the American informant is revealed to be [Rolf Alexander](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.barnesandnoble.com/w/creative-realism-rolf-alexander/1132618455&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728890516&usg=AOvVaw25cmFHMLvGT7H-Ch5OeMLo), who is in fact Allan Alexander Stirling, a New Zealand seaman who had jumped ship in 1920 and entered the US illegally. To support himself he promoted various dubious health cures while concocting a fictitious personal history. His activities were interrupted by prison sentences for mail fraud and embezzlement, and in 1954–1960 he claimed the ability to break up clouds with his psychokinetic abilities. (“[Let’s Talk Space: ‘Flying Saucers’ Are Real,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1956%252CJan-Feb%252CV%25202%252CN%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728890763&usg=AOvVaw2bKPqWXk2rp0a3eZEy-cF8)” Flying Saucer Review 2, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1956): 2–4; “[Rolf Alexander, M.D.,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1965%252CMar-Apr%252CV%252011%252CN%25202.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728891067&usg=AOvVaw1CMeX0jpWvzKn4zWZKhzlY)” Flying Saucer Review 11, no. 2 (Mar./Apr. 1965): 9; RosRept, [p. 99](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/The_Roswell_ReportR2.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728891321&usg=AOvVaw2Qzk8q7PiAhOmgQuV9N2c1))

July — The radiation-counter network set up at Oak Ridge National Laboratory, Tennessee, in December 1950 by Lt. Col. John R. Hood hits paydirt when a UFO appears, sighted both visually and on radar over the facility. He finds that the radiation counters have detected a significant rise in some kind of emission. Hood wants to expand the equipment, adding a debris-catching pursuit plane. However, information is lacking on this case and any follow- up. (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: Volume 8, 1951](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1951.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728891632&usg=AOvVaw1JZ4HJIaWXosnHmnT7o2iJ)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1951.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728891799&usg=AOvVaw02UbJPNoOGQynAXhfqG8Rg) The Author, 1983, p. 42)

July 1 — 10:50 p.m. Four night pilots of the 1st Marine Aircraft Wing in different areas around Seoul, Korea, simultaneously report a large green ball, very bright and trailing streaks of red then blue, passing overhead at 10,000–15,000 feet. (Haines, Korea, [p. 31](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/aadkw/aadkw_ch3.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728892131&usg=AOvVaw1mv1iZAEel56oO9RE3RkY4); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728892326&usg=AOvVaw11LH7tX3kGzKGg8PzCFE0f), p. 106)

* * *

July 4? — 10:00 p.m. Future ufologist [Irena Scott](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Irena_Scott&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728892643&usg=AOvVaw0--A5HLS2Ys60usielk-Km) and her sister Sue are sleeping at their home in Galena, Ohio, when they wake to see a small glowing light circling their bedroom in a meandering movement, but never bumping into anything. It circles the room three times, maintaining the same shape, brightness, and size (less than one inch).

After a few minutes, it moves in tight circles around the chandelier, then spirals downward, makes a noise, and emits tiny lights. Terrified, they rush out of the room and tell their father, who inspects the room but finds nothing. (Irena Scott, “Bedroom Light,” IUR 13, no. 2 (March/April 1988): 14–15)

July 9 — Day. USAF Lt. [George H. Kinmon II](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/186955724/george-herbert-kinmon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728893104&usg=AOvVaw2wuyINMAWe88kFN71wRbNW)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/186955724/george-herbert-kinmon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728893286&usg=AOvVaw0CRLnaLLJoUkbgrlqqdXVC) stationed at Lawson AFB \[now Lawson Army Airfield\] with the 117th Tactical Reconnaissance Wing, is flying an F-51 over Dearing, Georgia, when he sees a white disc “completely round and spinning in a clockwise direction.” It makes a headlong pass at his aircraft. It travels at “tremendous speed” and leaves no vapor trail. (NICAP, “[Aerial Encounter with Disc](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/510709augusta_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728893515&usg=AOvVaw2tkCBgTbEjhVFBzsTey4Uf)”; “Saucer Attacked Me, Pilot Declares,” Cleveland Press, July 30, 1952, p. 1, [reprinted](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://members.tripod.com/task_2/Saucer_attack.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728893775&usg=AOvVaw05dDJUUA1Dz2LfQi7F3MhZ) in Saucer Attack, April 1998; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728894077&usg=AOvVaw3symw1CvTN4EjO2XR6XqlQ), p. 107; UFOEv, [p. 23](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D35%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728894298&usg=AOvVaw0HCdNztlV89sjMDY0F84Sn); Richard H. Hall, Uninvited Guests, Aurora, 1988, pp. 328–330)

July 14 — Morning. During a guided missile launch, two radar operators at White Sands Missile Range, New Mexico, catch a fast-moving object on their scope. At the same time, a tracker watching a B-29 with binoculars sees a large UFO near the bomber. Another observer sights the UFO and, with a 35mm camera, shoots 200 feet of film. The UFO shows on the film as a round, bright spot. The film has never been released. (NICAP, “[White](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/510714holloman_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728894658&usg=AOvVaw2waJmJaLK3FRnPeEw6qgRn) [Sands Radar/Visual](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/510714holloman_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728894848&usg=AOvVaw1k72_z__Kli9MzSHJJjA2K)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728895042&usg=AOvVaw0tVjolsrGj6UpBC5fAphnM)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728895225&usg=AOvVaw1vOQ803nhXcOfcus1jOrs7) p. 107; Project 1947, “[Radar and Visual UFO Sighting, White Sands Missile](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/folio/19510714_wsmr.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728895450&usg=AOvVaw3_aiggi2LlbmO02Nk84O4o) [Range, New Mexico—July 14, 1951](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/folio/19510714_wsmr.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728895722&usg=AOvVaw2VaIAHELA9Ti68rgRqKmOt)”; Good Above, [pp. 354–355](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/abovetopsecretwo00good/page/354/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728896045&usg=AOvVaw1SGUJHHgCzBXVCsA0tc5dc))

July 25 — Personnel at Holloman AFB, New Mexico, write a report compiling the results of an organized skywatch of UFOs at the base. Several photos are taken. The report does not conclude what the objects are, but it does establish that some kind of objects have been seen. (“[Status of Project Blue Book,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/NARA-PBB85-612-615.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728896472&usg=AOvVaw387xTyKO0zDdvG-kQ2Awj8)” T52-6888, \[1952\], p. 1)

August — In an article in Popular Science, the editors ask UFO witnesses what they think the objects are. About 70% believe they are intelligently controlled devices, either man-made or extraterrestrial. (“[What Were the Flying](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://books.google.com/books?id%3DlyEDAAAAMBAJ%26lpg%3DPA74%26dq%3D%2522What%2520Were%2520The%2520Flying%2520Saucers%253F%2522%26pg%3DPA74%2523v%253Donepage%26q%3D%2522What%2520Were%2520The%2520Flying%2520Saucers%253F%2522%26f%3Dfalse&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728897197&usg=AOvVaw3PO_qdgLke775-_POj4DqH) [Saucers? Eyewitnesses Believe They Saw Secret Aircraft,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://books.google.com/books?id%3DlyEDAAAAMBAJ%26lpg%3DPA74%26dq%3D%2522What%2520Were%2520The%2520Flying%2520Saucers%253F%2522%26pg%3DPA74%2523v%253Donepage%26q%3D%2522What%2520Were%2520The%2520Flying%2520Saucers%253F%2522%26f%3Dfalse&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728897699&usg=AOvVaw04qnBN0gtlbpU1O4u7X-jz)” Popular Science 159 (August 1951): 74–75, 228)

August 3 — 11:00 p.m. [Walter N. Webb](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/NICAP-Bios/Webb.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728898244&usg=AOvVaw2XjnINAsb-ZZDzwhSwi-qA), nature counselor at Camp Big Silver on the shore of Silver Lake in southern Michigan, 3 miles south of Pinckney, is showing two boy campers some celestial objects through a reflecting telescope. He sees a glowing, yellowish light moving westward at a low elevation in an undulating path over hills to the south. It disappears behind the hills before he can train his telescope on it. (UFOEv, [p. 50](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D62%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728898523&usg=AOvVaw09iTovg8XkubDdxIFGADSY))

August 11 — Former USAF pilot [Robert O. Dodge](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/52665496/robert-oliver-dodge&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728898818&usg=AOvVaw1TBkx4Rh6gzPTxVwJmIoum) watches three disc-like UFOs in formation over Portland, Oregon. (UFOEv, [p. 34](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D46%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728899100&usg=AOvVaw35pX7qkB4qCIG6kvGolMrd))

August 15 — US test pilot [Bill Bridgeman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bill_Bridgeman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728899377&usg=AOvVaw0y72jjCclUhGReMVwdLedS) attains an unofficial altitude of 79,494 feet in a Douglas D-558-2 Skyrocket, an air-launched rocket plane powered by the XLR-11 liquid fuel rocket engine. (Wikipedia, “[Bill Bridgeman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bill_Bridgeman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728899655&usg=AOvVaw0XB8AI3xOMklUC96q00N6t)”)

Mid-August — 10:30 a.m. Mining engineer Alfred Roos hears a swishing sound at his ranch 10 miles east of Silver City, New Mexico. He looks up and sees two lens-shaped UFOs swooping at tremendous speed then hovering. They go back and forth between his location and Fort Bayard, two miles to the northwest, where they finally disappear into a cloud. (UFOEv, [p. 56](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D68%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728899950&usg=AOvVaw3ZQgK1HNMjBJ7t4M9vHjgf))

Mid-August — Midnight. A witness is on his porch in Waco, Texas, looking at the sky when he sees a V-shaped formation of 10–20 round, luminous objects silently pass over from west to east in a matter of seconds. (Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, pp. 41–42)

August 17 — 11:30 a.m. [Otto Bock](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.arnold.af.mil/News/Article-Display/Article/410184/otto-bock-helped-make-arnolds-g-range-a-national-defense-asset/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728900396&usg=AOvVaw2zSniyuR5d6wgu-pJzhmmF)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.arnold.af.mil/News/Article-Display/Article/410184/otto-bock-helped-make-arnolds-g-range-a-national-defense-asset/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728900625&usg=AOvVaw0Z7x8B0cT5ftOcyHHpWput) a German scientist with a specialty in optics who came to the US as part of Operation Paperclip, observes a high-altitude, metallic object through his 20x telescope for about 4 hours. He says the sighting is confirmed by four other persons. (Project 1947, “[Letter to Donald Keyhoe: Otto Bock, August 22,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1951a.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728900859&usg=AOvVaw1r8G3UXoSVmiovZ9UQR1mL) [1951](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1951a.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728901055&usg=AOvVaw0In121C9IMeNKXkj_A_dqJ)”)

August 20 — The CIA, approved by DCI [Roscoe Hillenkoetter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roscoe_H._Hillenkoetter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728901316&usg=AOvVaw1bzB3qVI8F1zauWM6g0Ax9)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roscoe_H._Hillenkoetter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728901482&usg=AOvVaw2Mc3hfCPWKZBWt0wPRMQnm) starts Project ARTICHOKE to study hypnosis, morphine addiction, and LSD to produce amnesia and other vulnerable states in subjects, as a way of exploring interrogation methods. (Wikipedia, “[Project ARTICHOKE](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Project_ARTICHOKE&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728901696&usg=AOvVaw1nBxUlU5s97s6ksnmetmrz)”; \[Central Intelligence Agency\], “[Project Artichoke,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://nsarchive2.gwu.edu/NSAEBB/NSAEBB54/st02.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728901908&usg=AOvVaw0P5nhZTbGyjfVnKcnXXqsG)” declassified(?), January 31, 1975)

August 23 — [Frank Wisner](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Wisner&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728902165&usg=AOvVaw36cqUDSRBL_YoxdcHuo2Ip) succeeds [Allen Dulles](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allen_Dulles&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728902474&usg=AOvVaw0dyWexcAKr5yFc60awBod4) as CIA Deputy Director of Plans in the Office of Policy Coordination, with [Richard Helms](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Helms&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728902837&usg=AOvVaw0-4jUZJmlisbk60wKb_XQd) as chief of operations. In this position, Wisner is instrumental in supporting pro-American forces that [toppled](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1953_Iranian_coup_d%2527%25C3%25A9tat&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728903254&usg=AOvVaw0kWj6zJToM6e_44fnieLti) [Mohammed Mossadegh](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mohammad_Mosaddegh&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728903465&usg=AOvVaw0Qk9M1udekxL2pC3k1xIh5) in [Iran](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728903708&usg=AOvVaw04TWYn88-8M9G8L409HQft) in 1953 and [Jacobo Árbenz](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jacobo_%25C3%2581rbenz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728904034&usg=AOvVaw0MaUvy9fsL9MSb5EskOITD) in Guatemala [in 1954.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1954_Guatemalan_coup_d%2527%25C3%25A9tat&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728904424&usg=AOvVaw1KTUfuJXSzISXfqtkUArV5) Sometime this year he visits [Richard M. Bissell Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_M._Bissell_Jr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728904788&usg=AOvVaw2-o9p2BNXP0eRmWr3_iwxz) and asks him to finance OPC operations by diverting some Marshall Plan funds, presumably for covert black ops. (Jacobsen, Area 51, [pp. 45–46](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/44/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728905223&usg=AOvVaw3LwmqoX22L0tOCRh7XinSg))

August 25 — Evening. Joseph Bryant and his wife, at 407 West Powell Street, Brownfield, Texas, see a loose group of glowing lights heading north to south. They are a “little bigger than a star.” A few minutes later a second group flies over, and then a third, which circles around the house. This time Bryant can hear them, and he identifies

* * *

them as plovers. When he hears about the Lubbock lights, he is sure the professors are seeing plovers. (Clark III 691–692)

August 25 — 9:10 p.m. Three Texas Technical College professors (geologist [Wilbur Irvin Robinson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/7739779/wilbur-irvin-robinson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728906006&usg=AOvVaw3EFYRrMufbGXD4mc_3GSaf), chemist [Aaron](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/179646789/aaron-gustav-oberg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728906342&usg=AOvVaw102skw4VujYJv-9-xT3YXQ) [Gustav “Gus” Oberg](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/179646789/aaron-gustav-oberg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728906660&usg=AOvVaw0y_j8VVdS4i2j9SC5xHD9w), and petroleum engineer [William Lyon Ducker Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://swco-ir.tdl.org/handle/10605/7356&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728906948&usg=AOvVaw2BJnjociaNIB10SGFVFJQd)) are sitting in a backyard at Lubbock, Texas, when they see a fast-moving, semicircular formation of 20–30 lights, as intense as bright stars but larger. Blue-green and silent, they move across the sky in seconds. A second group appears and repeats the performance. Others, including Carl Hemminger at Texas Tech, report seeing the same objects the same night. [J. Russell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/53450604/jone-russell-heitman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728907292&usg=AOvVaw1Fxfu3PSGFkwpCrg5YOF1w) [Heitman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/53450604/jone-russell-heitman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728907621&usg=AOvVaw2P46WXMRrapnIgTCsYb56r), head of the Texas Tech journalism department, says he had seen an identical group of lights several days earlier. The professors watch 10–12 such flights through November 1 (including on September 1 and 5), sometimes accompanied by colleagues [Ellis Richard Heineman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/114607095/ellis-richard-heineman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728907928&usg=AOvVaw1vC_yZLx64HAochpWvGJzG)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/114607095/ellis-richard-heineman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728908125&usg=AOvVaw1HRrNjYUBCSU4AFUSVlkWG) E. F. George, [Grayson Mead](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://texasbeyondhistory.net/lubbock/images/Lu1-ge17.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728908331&usg=AOvVaw2zH0HFdjiyfCN9I7suEJq8), and John Brand.

Some researchers, including [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728908645&usg=AOvVaw0OnLFKRssvKrg6y8KHzyMg) and [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728908862&usg=AOvVaw1dWXAbVcDBqsXmP8-0BVLX), think the witnesses are seeing migrating plovers attracted to Lubbock’s new vapor street lights, although Ruppelt changes his mind later. (Wikipedia, “[Lubbock Lights](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lubbock_Lights&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728909068&usg=AOvVaw2NWdiprjdb1jlR85HdWFPj)”; NICAP, “[The Lubbock Lights / Carl Hart Photos](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://nsarchive2.gwu.edu/NSAEBB/NSAEBB54/st02.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728909269&usg=AOvVaw2u86TfaAbSk9_2zZer7cXg)”; Clark III 688–690; Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: Volume](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1951.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728909471&usg=AOvVaw32cnsDw9zTk01qRDVqh-fC) [8, 1951](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1951.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728909673&usg=AOvVaw1ICEGNbnOarxAx26QwAz-o)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1951.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728909843&usg=AOvVaw3OTFkWoQZXQUWX0pXS034b) The Author, 1983, pp. 45–55; Swords 130–132; “[Lubbock 1951,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://roswellbooks.com/museum/?page_id%3D152&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728910072&usg=AOvVaw2yq7H5caB7RR3ibwze5FGl)” Texas UFO Museum and Research

Library, November 15, 1999)

August 25 — Around 9:58 p.m. Hugh Young, a security guard at Sandia Base, and his wife Emily are in their trailer home in east Albuquerque, New Mexico, and watch a large object like a flying wing, but 1.5 times as large as a B-36, flying at 80 feet at about 300 mph. It has glowing white lights on the trailing edge of the wing and is completely silent. (NICAP, “[Flying Wing over Sandia Base](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/510825albuquerque_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728910421&usg=AOvVaw2gDK1bYqAviv92fWbu6vp1)”; Clark III 691; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728910618&usg=AOvVaw2Z0wfCRZxxPl6gcQia07WF), p. 108)

August 26 — 8:28 p.m. A radar station at Larson AFB \[now Grant County International Airport\], near Moses Lake, Washington, tracks a UFO at 13,000 feet going 950 mph on two different sets, AN/CPS-1 and AN/CPS-4, for about 6 minutes. An F-86 is scrambled, but radar contact is lost before the plane gets off the ground. An electronic signal is received from this object that appears to be a mode-one IFF response from an AN/APX-6 transponder.

This response is received twice at approx.115 miles and 80 miles from the radar station. (NICAP, “[Two Radars](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/510826larson_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728910962&usg=AOvVaw24bTegM0C7vx4VpN-QsLVY) [Track 900 MPH Target](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/510826larson_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728911152&usg=AOvVaw182AWWpq0mQoj-utbL-4mA); Clark III 692; Ruppelt, [pp. 96–98](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/96/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728911355&usg=AOvVaw2jC2RuN_GU31ABzbsQJuzK), [108–109](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/108/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728911572&usg=AOvVaw2OpLfHI4hYxKS9Q13lzC61); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728911757&usg=AOvVaw0XgicnxTDd2cXc8HBotVkr), p. 108)

August 27 — At a conference at Holloman AFB, New Mexico, on the green fireballs, Project Twinkle’s Maj. [Edward A.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.roswellproof.com/Dyvad1951.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728912007&usg=AOvVaw08seR_xHFXgvZtah6ikj3i) [Doty](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.roswellproof.com/Dyvad1951.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728912213&usg=AOvVaw2X_ZSsc1IQrV_Rk3jwy8mn) expresses skepticism about the project. Meteorologist [Bernard “Duke” Gildenberg](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.legacy.com/obituaries/alamogordonews/obituary.aspx?n%3Dbernard-david-gildenberg-duke%26pid%3D166827255&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728912472&usg=AOvVaw3cabaC7dZLFAFeXAa54_73) tells those assembled that he has never seen anything out of the ordinary, nor has astronomer [Clyde Tombaugh](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clyde_Tombaugh&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728912712&usg=AOvVaw0vM903RIim3V0e6k94G0JO). The commanding officer at Holloman wants to cease allocating funds for the project. (Clark III 545)

August 28 — Project Twinkle personnel talk to [LaPaz](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lincoln_LaPaz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728912970&usg=AOvVaw2t0Gxky9bjDnme-DVfwENV) about the green fireballs and he insists they are not meteors. (Clark III 545)

August 30 — 11:30 p.m. A Texas Tech freshman named Carl Hart Jr. sees the same formation of 18–20 lights over Lubbock, Texas, and takes five photos. He gets the roll of film developed the next day and takes it to the Lubbock Morning Avalanche, which puts them out on the Associated Press wire. ATIC examines the photos and notes that the “two rows of spots behaved differently. One row only shows slight variation from a precise V formation throughout, whereas the other now appears to pass from above the first row, through it to a position below.” Biologist [James Cecil](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://swco-ir.tdl.org/handle/10605/7399&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728913554&usg=AOvVaw15vae6ZobcoJPmmpexT5Os) [Cross](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/105726781/james-cecil-cross&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728913891&usg=AOvVaw2JUHkLBg9iCTOOnksTGMW0) looks at the Lubbock photos under a microscope and rules out the bird explanation. See also Life, Apr. 7, 1952. While investigating the Lubbock Lights, [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728914324&usg=AOvVaw2BLR0R_kHwBwwXMOq5qOiQ) also learns that several people in and around Lubbock claim to have seen a “flying wing” moving over the city. Among the witnesses is the wife of Dr. [Ducker](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://swco-ir.tdl.org/handle/10605/7356&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728914641&usg=AOvVaw2jhOEmiw6mjZDp4TcSIKoz)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://swco-ir.tdl.org/handle/10605/7356&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728914802&usg=AOvVaw2tu2QFQqwYGNrWPIHb7-to) who reports that in August 1951 she observed a “huge, soundless flying wing” pass over her house.

Ruppelt knows that USAF does possess a “flying wing” jet bomber, and he feels that at least some of the sightings are caused by the bomber, although he cannot explain why, according to the witnesses, the wing makes no sound as it flies overhead. Ruppelt says that in addition to Project Grudge investigators, another group of people who, “because of their association with the government, had complete access to our files” (scientists convinced of the ETH) were also looking into the Lubbock cases. In March 1955, Ducker sends Ruppelt a telegram indicating that he has figured out that the lights are a “natural phenomenon” and requests no further publicity in his book.

However, Texas Tech mathematics professor [Ralph Sylvester Underwood](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/183461956/ralph-sylvester-underwood&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728915309&usg=AOvVaw2osiXoWnhbdN7_7vN86CZg) has also observed three flights and estimates the objects are at 2,000 feet altitude and flying at 700 mph—much too fast for birds. (NICAP, “[The](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://nsarchive2.gwu.edu/NSAEBB/NSAEBB54/st02.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728916427&usg=AOvVaw0hj7OdQZz_yWbWxmT3tuY0) [Lubbock Lights / Carl Hart Photos](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://nsarchive2.gwu.edu/NSAEBB/NSAEBB54/st02.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728916788&usg=AOvVaw0Pik1ZvvbRy5D4nVS1EUsI)”; “‘Flying Whatsits’ Stir Dispute in Area,” Lubbock (Tex.) Morning Avalanche, September 6, 1951; Clark III 690–693; Ruppelt, [pp. 96–110](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/96/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728917312&usg=AOvVaw3w5gEK7gXSQmsy7b-tamh4); Kevin D. Randle, “Carl Hart and the Lubbock Lights,” IUR 18, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1993): 17–19; Michael D. Swords, “Classic Cases from the APRO Files,” IUR 24, no. 2 (Summer 1999): 22; “[Lubbock 1951,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://roswellbooks.com/museum/?page_id%3D152&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728917911&usg=AOvVaw1OaBujqkSYr_O5Dx1PSiB3)” Texas UFO Museum and Research Library, November 15, 1999; Donald R. Burleson, “New Findings on the Lubbock Lights,” IUR 26, no. 2 (Summer 2001): 3–5; “[Lubbock Lights and Roswell,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://roswellbooks.com/museum/?page_id%3D329&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728918384&usg=AOvVaw3SQ82k7xg2rMVNicRQBGbx)” Texas UFO Museum and Research Library, December 7, 2005; Michael D. Swords, “[Can We Learn Anything from UFO Photos? Part Five,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://thebiggeststudy.blogspot.com/2012/07/can-we-learn-anything-from-ufo-photos_15.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728918750&usg=AOvVaw23xd0N03OPQ0-DU10eZ34g)” The Big Study, July 15, 2012; Swords 131– 132)

* * *

August 31 — 12:45 p.m. Mrs. Tom Tilson and one or two other women are driving north on Hwy 70 near Matador, Texas, when they see to the west a pear-shaped object the length of a B-29 fuselage (100 feet). It is aluminum or silver-yellow with a port or some type of aperture on the side, and it moves with its smaller end forward, drifting slowly at about 150 feet altitude. It then shoots up in a circular fashion and out of sight after a few seconds. (Clark III 692; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728919186&usg=AOvVaw0vE4_DWkP0UUZPIPI6LTBz)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728919395&usg=AOvVaw1Ii9uO_WVj6UcweFz8aQZL) p. 109)

September — 9:00 p.m. Louise McDougall is sitting on the lawn outside her trailer park in Bloomington, California, when she has the feeling someone is watching her. She looks up and sees a flying saucer hovering some 20 feet up. It is lenticular, perhaps 100 feet in diameter, and dull silver metallic in appearance. There are tall, rectangular windows in its lower half, in which can be seen against an amber glow four men, in one-piece “jump suits,” with shoulder- length hair. She turns a spotlight on the saucer, whereupon it shoots off silently at incredible speed. About 15 minutes later it returns, hovering in the same spot, the figures still visible at the windows. After 6 or 7 minutes, it takes off again to the southeast. McDougall’s husband and three other people also see it. (Clark III 267; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1951-09-usa-bloomington.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728919875&usg=AOvVaw33HKqaoWrGCnGrijrgd4f9)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1951-09-usa-bloomington.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728920072&usg=AOvVaw04Z97eTD2ue9NAfzGpJ0Wi) September 15, 2006)

September 6 — The Air Force issues JANAP 146(B), “Communications Instructions for Reporting Vital Intelligence Sightings from Aircraft.” All UFO reports are to go to the Air Defense Command in the Pentagon (which presumably will send them to AMC at Wright-Patterson AFB in Ohio), the Secretary of Defense, and to the nearest US military command. (Swords 123)

September 10 — 11:10 a.m. At the Army Signal Corps radar center at Fort Monmouth \[now closed\], New Jersey, a student operator demonstrating radar functions to a group of visiting officers picks up a target that is moving too fast to be tracked automatically. The object seems to be following the coastline. He follows it off and on for 3 minutes, after which it disappears to the northeast, flying at 700 mph. About 25 minutes later, a T-33 jet trainer piloted by Lt. [Wilbert S. Rogers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/190765231/wilbert-s-rogers&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728920461&usg=AOvVaw17Rnns67dHUrYoVewt79QU)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/190765231/wilbert-s-rogers&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728920640&usg=AOvVaw39ODka8Yi3sU1A5Tv73nz1) with Maj. Edward Ballard as passenger, spots a “silver-colored object about the size of a fighter plane” flying at 900 mph at 5,000–8,000 feet over Sandy Hook. It makes a 90° banking turn and disappears out to sea. At 3:15 p.m., a second radar tracking occurs, but this slower object turns out to be a balloon. (NICAP, “[The Fort Monmouth Radar Incident](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/510910monmouth_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728920857&usg=AOvVaw2WA_BwWLKvX_veO_5WDeLJ)”; NICAP, “[The Sandy Hook / T-33 Incident](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/510910sandyhook_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728921055&usg=AOvVaw2zydx8ADeY3g3M8e2rfNFI)”; James E. McDonald, “[Statement on Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23balloons&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728921300&usg=AOvVaw2nuoWP7C23676gjkTHaEgG)” in Symposium on Unidentified Flying Objects, Hearings, US House Committee on Science and Astronautics, 90th Cong., 2nd Sess., July 29, 1968, p. 66; Clark III 513– 515; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728921587&usg=AOvVaw2DO1w4L2RCF6mC3Z0CugjN)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728921747&usg=AOvVaw3w1pJqIymb82wErYfOs90d) p. 110; Thomas Tulien, ed., [Proceedings of the Sign Historical Group UFO History Workshop](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/Sign-Historical-Group-Workshop-Proceedings.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728921974&usg=AOvVaw1i9vxpUAc0BgkllDFuf-XT), Sign Historical Group, November 2001, pp. 45–46; Swords 124–127; Good Above, [pp. 269](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/268/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728922210&usg=AOvVaw0noLXsByobvD9fTwna2R-o), [487](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/486/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728922440&usg=AOvVaw3Hezn9j2j2Gf3cTGpmxw_M))

September 11 — 10:50 a.m. Two radars at Fort Monmouth, New Jersey, pick up another object moving at 1,000 mph. At 1:30 p.m., another radar target appears, apparently hovering. Overcast conditions prevent a visual sighting. The radar then shows it ascending at a rapid rate then streaking to the south at 700+ mph. (Clark III 514)

September 12 — Fort Monmouth, New Jersey, officials send ATIC and USAF headquarters a three-foot-long teletype describing the sightings. ATIC’s new chief, Col. [Frank Dunn](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Dunn.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728922947&usg=AOvVaw0tXtWLlqLgoNQDcspqpVyK), gets a wire from Gen. [Charles Cabell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_P._Cabell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728923258&usg=AOvVaw3wu8OCuK5aevklAeoO3NTj), who wants somebody from ATIC to find out what’s going on. Dunn sends Lt. [Jerry Cummings](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Cummings_J.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728926649&usg=AOvVaw0uzAgC35pwvpAXzjk9j6Gx) (head of Project Grudge) and Lt. Col. [Nathan R. Rosengarten](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/171879736/nathan-robert-rosengarten&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728927180&usg=AOvVaw1h44oKvWZlsJEcbn-wqB92) (chief of the ATIC Aircraft Performance Section). (Clark III 514–515; Ruppelt, [pp. 93–94](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/92/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728927493&usg=AOvVaw3q5jgz823EF3l5sAohB_pt); Swords 126; Good Need, [pp. 164–165](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/164/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728927733&usg=AOvVaw3WFmWKlEnrMpiO2f2ZMEzR))

September 13 — 9:30 p.m. T/Sgt Warner B. Maupin and Cpl. John W. Green track two objects on radar at Goose Bay AFB \[now CFB Goose Bay\], Labrador, on a collision course. One of them tries to warn the supposed aircraft of an imminent collision and is surprised to watch one avoid danger by moving to the right. A third unidentified target joins the other two. The incident lasts more than 15 minutes. (Chris Rutkowski and Geoff Dittman, The Canadian UFO Report, Dundurn Press, 2006, p. 53; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728928544&usg=AOvVaw0HruaYUgOoJhbipak9ZFNF)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728928818&usg=AOvVaw0hbaDmqyAn8doePXY0_Mcx) p. 110; Chris Rutkowski, Canada’s UFOs: Declassified, August Night, 2022, p. 261)

September 18 — The Day the Earth Stood Still, directed by [Robert Wise](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Wise&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728929552&usg=AOvVaw3hTmqJ8y99S3RVtBBoEBkE) and starring [Michael Rennie](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Rennie&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728929921&usg=AOvVaw2V-2u4-e5zo-bthJDPHRLN) and [Patricia Neal](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patricia_Neal&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728930290&usg=AOvVaw02nEZ52h2hrozRT1lDqSaQ), premieres in New York City. The ultimate flying saucer science-fiction movie, the plot revolves around an alien who lands in a UFO in Washington, D.C., and demands that atomic testing cease. [Lock Martin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lock_Martin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728930643&usg=AOvVaw2b-mMeqmcOIgHV8cqH5lPS)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lock_Martin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728930903&usg=AOvVaw2WySwibgIeWnqZvm0nCqNA) who is more than 7 feet tall, plays the robot Gort. (Internet Movie Database, “[The Day the Earth Stood Still](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0043456/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728931228&usg=AOvVaw3MKCXiSnNdFsFwZDlhQ0tt)”)

September 18 — 10:20 p.m. USAF B-36 radar operator Maj. Paul E. Gerhart and navigator Maj. Charles J. Cheever are flying northwest at 239 mph over the Hudson Strait in northern Canada when they pick up radar interference coming from an unidentified aircraft moving away from them to the east about 32 miles away. The anti-jamming device on their radar is turned on at 11:20 p.m. but does not affect the jamming on the radar scope. At 11:35 p.m., a UFO is seen visually on the right side of the B-36, which is flying at 18,000 feet over southwest Baffin Island, Nunavut. The object has all-white “unconventional running lights” and two white flashing tail lights, travels about 35 mph faster than the B-36, crosses the front from right to left heading toward the north-northwest, and is in view about 20 minutes. While the object is still visible at 11:50 p.m., the B-36 autopilot and APQ-24 radar set

* * *

malfunction, the latter coming back a few minutes later when the object disappears. ECM operators S/Sgt. Donald

E. Jenkins and S/Sgt. Doty T. Larimore on two B-36 flights over Labrador on September 19 detect carrier wave signals at several frequencies and some radar-like pulses at other frequencies, all below 1,000 MHz. (NICAP, “[B-](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/510917atlantic_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728932225&usg=AOvVaw0Rg9lOe-1bRFfdRAiaxVSh) [36 Radar Picks up Object Seen Visually](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/510917atlantic_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728932458&usg=AOvVaw2pQg4F0rcpGt75JQZMk8fH)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728932683&usg=AOvVaw246PG3LGVn5q7HvwiHvVgZ)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728932851&usg=AOvVaw3mmiZ246uvolKIqfCPWgSh) p. 111)

September 23 —At March AFB \[now March Air Reserve Base\] near Long Beach, California, two F-86 jets try to intercept an object in controlled orbit at around 55,000 feet, but they run low on fuel and have to land. Two more F-86s are scrambled, with the same results. Three of the pilots report seeing a “silver airplane with highly swept- back wings,” although one of them says the UFO looks round and silver. (NICAP, “[Swept Wing Aircraft at above](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/510923marchfield_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728933314&usg=AOvVaw1Kp3U49R53SLiWavw-eF0V) [50,000ʹ / Tracked by GCI](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/510923marchfield_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728933549&usg=AOvVaw3JBiUH2OsW4HYs1ANItHnO)”; Ruppelt, [pp. 94–95](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/94/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728933815&usg=AOvVaw0Q-JlT6i6SLPlkqOIR51f-), [111](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/110/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728934038&usg=AOvVaw2F-MFWqDBim3cOpySdivby)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/110/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728934215&usg=AOvVaw1jm62gHbR-8y6_IuQ14IcS) [113–114](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/112/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728934429&usg=AOvVaw0Q0zLsvnrLFO03L2ZFF7Sp); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728934764&usg=AOvVaw3PEj3aZjArgS6Vdj0GSDJo), p. 112)

Fall — Navy pilot Lt. Cmdr. [Marvin C. Davies](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/115130534/marvin-cecil-davies&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728935328&usg=AOvVaw0GHfR79BMwJuF68N-K0ahZ) is flying a plane off a CVE class aircraft carrier near Korea when the crew tracks a radar target 3 miles astern. The object has apparently been circling the fleet at an altitude of 5,000 feet and speeds of “slow” to 1,000 mph. The UFO has been tracked on 14 ship radars for 7 hours. It stops circling and takes up a position behind the plane’s wingman, remaining there 5 minutes, then departing at high speed. (Project 1937, “[UFO Reports, Korea](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/47cats/dekdavies.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728935758&usg=AOvVaw27DO5eKl4y3tYLa6qHxjFG)”; UFOEv, [p. 84](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D96%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728935986&usg=AOvVaw2sTy7WpL26rgDuT-ipu4GN))

October — [Per Sundh](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sv.wikipedia.org/wiki/Per_Sundh&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728936310&usg=AOvVaw1atw8YzaemmXVQSfR5dtqa) is appointed head of a unit at the Swedish Defence Staff responsible for investigating UFO reports. He remains in charge until October 1954. During that time the department handles 6,000 reports, of which 400 are investigated and 40 remain unexplained. Their astronomical consultant is [Bertil Lindblad](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bertil_Lindblad&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728936604&usg=AOvVaw1jhQrjsstW8Pn-KyCOL1zU)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bertil_Lindblad&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728936822&usg=AOvVaw3CwjjGPG2xsWL7jw9FvFp0) an astronomer at Stockholm University, Sweden. Sundh says that his personnel always took even the weirdest observations seriously. (Swords 364–365)

October 1 — 10:00 a.m. At the Pentagon, [Cummings](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Cummings_J.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728937289&usg=AOvVaw0bpGGS7zjCK4gzbEZHergt) and [Rosengarten](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/171879736/nathan-robert-rosengarten&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728937661&usg=AOvVaw3aAsyZ8bQUWhh59Pbf-Anb) brief [Cabell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_P._Cabell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728937929&usg=AOvVaw0tADaN6z-Ag0m8sNutJ_4C), his staff, and a representative from Republic Aircraft Corporation who “supposedly represented a group of top US industrialists and scientists.” The meeting is recorded with a wire recorder. [Edward Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728938245&usg=AOvVaw0Yw1J3hk3m_XNAkQsZwBNf)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728938451&usg=AOvVaw1Knwx2TOrMJQNMUPJNtikx) later head of Project Blue Book, hears the recording before it is ordered destroyed and keeps detailed notes about the meeting. Cabell supposedly learns that Grudge is effectively dead and demands to know “who in hell has been giving me these reports that every decent flying saucer report is being investigated?” Cabell says there is a great deal of doubt in his mind as to what the saucers are and that the Grudge report is the “most poorly written, inconclusive piece of unscientific tripe” he had ever read. He orders Grudge to reactivate itself, and Cummings and Rosengarten go back to Wright-Patterson AFB in Ohio to do just that. (Clark III 514–515; Ruppelt, [pp. 93–94](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/92/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728938741&usg=AOvVaw1YHmmZNoRWK4KbHQM0UXJ2); Swords 127–128, 501–502; Michael Hall, “When UFOs Were Serious Business: Then and Today,” IUR 28, no. 4 (Winter 2003–2004): 4)

October 4 — 2:00 a.m. Two French aviation officers are camped out several miles northwest of the village of Tessalit, Mali. A luminous dark-yellow disc approaches slowly from the east, loses altitude, makes a 90° turn, accelerates, and ascends at high speed. (Patrick Gross, “[Tessalit, Mali, October 4, 1951](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/tessalit1951.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728939232&usg=AOvVaw2weeezf8uXqADStCnDphyu)”)

October 9 — 1:42 p.m. A fast-moving, silvery UFO shaped like a “flattened tennis ball” is sighted by a Civil Aviation Administration Chief Aircraft Communicator Roy Messmore at Hulman Municipal Airport \[now Terre Haute Regional Airport\], five miles east of Terre Haute, Indiana. At 1:45 p.m., private pilot Charles Warren, flying at 5,000 feet east of Paris, Illinois, sees a silvery “flattened orange” object that appears stationary to his left rear. It picks up speed and heads to the northeast. Project Blue Book plots the sighting and concludes that both cases involve the same object. (NICAP, “[October 9, 1951, Hulman CAA / Pilot Case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/511009terre_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728939744&usg=AOvVaw1u53bNcW5wV0RfypzUuyWz)”; NICAP, “[Pilot Radios Terre](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/511009parisIL_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728939981&usg=AOvVaw2E835wGPExJp4CFavtOtMp) [Haute: Observes ‘Flattened Orange’](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/511009parisIL_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728940179&usg=AOvVaw1o70DYgJzljDEdC2UU5pkk)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728940390&usg=AOvVaw1i8KbSMWTWdVyuRie-5rlx), p. 114; Swords 129)

October 10 — 10:10 a.m. Engineer and pilot [Joseph J. Kaliszewski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.heritagesfsd.com/obituary/6140844&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728940703&usg=AOvVaw0_jnKNZhiThJJeSXW5LjTP), flying with copilot Jack Donaghue on a Skyhook balloon tracking mission for General Mills 10 miles east of St. Croix Falls, Wisconsin, notices a strange object crossing the sky from west to east, much higher and behind the balloon, which is at 20,000 feet. The UFO has a peculiar glow. It comes into sight at a slight dive, then levels off and slows down, makes a sharp left turn, climbs at an angle of 50–60° into the southeast with terrific acceleration, and disappears. It is seen for about 2 minutes. (NICAP, “[The Kaliszewski Sightings](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/511011minneapolis_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728941120&usg=AOvVaw39JUgy9XiFtzHplteMMlER)”; UFOEv, [p. 56](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D68%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728941437&usg=AOvVaw2vkvTLmk0xl3deVWaRJd-Y); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728941682&usg=AOvVaw2qmT-LxSNKGypkePg6xhbU)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728941879&usg=AOvVaw1r1fZvBGTcpI9XNRlPKPtc) p. 114)

October 11 — 6:30 a.m. [Joseph J. Kaliszewski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.heritagesfsd.com/obituary/6140844&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728942170&usg=AOvVaw10AwQmL1--4SNj2jz3Uoi_) and Dick Reilly are flying at 10,000 feet north of Minneapolis, Minnesota, observing a balloon when they see a brightly glowing object to the southeast of the University of Minnesota airport moving at high speed from west to east. It has a halo around it with a dark under surface. It crosses rapidly, slows down, and starts to climb slowly in lazy circles. Observers Doug Smith and Dick Dorion at the General Mills tracking station at the University of Minnesota watch the object through a theodolite. They watch another object 2 hours later. (NICAP, “[The Kaliszewski Sightings](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/511011minneapolis_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728942478&usg=AOvVaw07NavFHEnfYmoF_FANdG-2)”; UFOEv, [p. 56](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D68%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728942743&usg=AOvVaw15bjwRAhz-qGfHbgm6zl55); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728942946&usg=AOvVaw0CVF3Taa1rhelO1eau9lVh)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728943102&usg=AOvVaw0npCq_XRPrdeTD-txphSZe) p. 114; James E. McDonald, “[Statement on Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23pilots&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728943348&usg=AOvVaw0Npbq5Lh-TXO3O-No3oECh)” in Symposium on Unidentified Flying Objects, Hearings, US House Committee on Science and Astronautics, 90th Cong., 2nd Sess., July 29, 1968, pp. 44–45)

October 16 — 11:01 a.m. Air Force pilots flying three F-94 fighters out of McChord AFB \[now Joint Base Lewis- McChord\] and naval ground personnel see a round, gray object flying soundlessly at high speed and high altitude

* * *

west of Naval Air Station Whidbey Island in Oak Harbor, Washington. Photos taken from the F-94s show the object. After 50 minutes, the aircraft abandon the chase. The Air Force attributes the sighting to Venus. (NICAP, “[3 F-94’s Encounter Round Grey Object / Photos Taken](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/511016whidbeyisle_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728943888&usg=AOvVaw2KHQjchW8ukR9yPT9t5dJa)”; Clark III 391–392; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728944085&usg=AOvVaw1hMhIpmdPD0lnsdefMa0Mu), p. 115)

October 20 — [Frank B. Jewett Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nytimes.com/1986/07/03/obituaries/frank-b-jewett-jr.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728944393&usg=AOvVaw2mhRk8NE9KMsjdp9f5arK4)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nytimes.com/1986/07/03/obituaries/frank-b-jewett-jr.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728944598&usg=AOvVaw2Csp3dn0UKnln0QKSoUy1A) director of the Aeronautical Research Laboratory at General Mills Corporation, writes to Assistant Secretary of the Air Force [Eugene M. Zuckert](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eugene_M._Zuckert&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728944856&usg=AOvVaw3xi4AxUJv8nIfr4eZCxglZ) about UFOs seen by his personnel. ((Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1951, Supplemental Notes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1951-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728945123&usg=AOvVaw2VMKNxQeBLlf0Z7gok1Q9S)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1951-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728945291&usg=AOvVaw3IVH2dxECi2xSnjncwR26g) The Author, 2000, p. 51)

October 22 — Capt. [Edward J. Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728945659&usg=AOvVaw0SoWpRdWYSfOyq5YvLF760) officially takes over a revitalized Project Grudge, relieving Lt. [Jerry W.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Cummings_J.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728945898&usg=AOvVaw2xq3twDwkR4KROkf0bz-RN) [Cummings](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Cummings_J.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728946093&usg=AOvVaw289NzcGgHrL0Ud8c-cW7VM) and 2d Lt. Henry Metscher. He learns from some scientists and engineers who visit ATIC frequently that “UFOs were being freely and seriously discussed in scientific circles.” (Ruppelt, [p. 114](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/114/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728946376&usg=AOvVaw1l6jlzTZwXr4jXc8aKlld0); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728946594&usg=AOvVaw1lD9Ao6nnavxyTa1y6fF_m), p. 14; Clark III 933)

October 22 — The Directorate of Intelligence provides answers to the problem that Col. [Harold Watson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/105276/brigadier-general-harold-e-watson/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728946887&usg=AOvVaw1fZPm1F-Yg1atLw3Kib0Xu) identified with the CIRVIS reporting system. (Michael Hall and Wendy Connors, “Flying Saucers: Behind the Cold War Veil of Military Intelligence (Part II),” European Journal of UFO and Abduction Studies 3, no. 1 (March 2002): 32)

October 30 — 6:40 a.m. A group of servicemen are preparing to observe the Buster Charlie atomic test at Area 7 of the Nevada Test Site. Just before the blast, they see at an altitude of a few thousand feet a formation of 18 silvery, rotating, disc-shaped objects, each with a dome, arranged in six groups of three stretched out in a horizontal row. They fly low over the test site, hover for 30–60 seconds, and depart at an angle, disappearing in seconds. (Nukes 68–71)

November — Maj. Gen. [Cabell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_P._Cabell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728947370&usg=AOvVaw1Fm70GRq1mcnrBTPAdkNMT) is promoted to staff director for the Joint Chiefs of Staff. He is replaced as director of Air Force Intelligence by Maj. Gen. [John A. Samford](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_A._Samford&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728947607&usg=AOvVaw0nrOe3z8qTnnbIdmolcryf)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_A._Samford&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728947798&usg=AOvVaw3hEmvqQKXCtM10E02aSQNu) (Clark III 936)

November 1 — The Air Force issues a Ground Observer’s Guide for use by members of the Ground Observer Corps, a WWII Civil Defense program reinstated during the Korean War to protect against enemy attack. (US Department of the Air Force, [Ground Observer’s Guide,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Documents/AFM_50-12.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728948134&usg=AOvVaw1Spc-LCo1F5_FK0UnDefxN) AF Manual 50-12, November 1, 1951)

November 2 — 7:15 a.m. The crew of an American Airlines DC-4 is flying east of Abilene, Texas, at 4,500 feet. They see a bright-green, projectile-shaped object, about the same size as their airliner, streak past at about same altitude and same easterly heading. The object leaves a trail then explodes, shooting red balls of fire in all directions. (Keyhoe, [FS Conspiracy](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728948470&usg=AOvVaw1GCsYN8X2DEBsudJ_sISlX)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsc/flying-saucer-conspiracy.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728948655&usg=AOvVaw0u2zPHgyUALTOZ8botH82Y) pp. 92–93; Nukes 74–75; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728948868&usg=AOvVaw2AaU1aXU4xU4SbuCvMLKL9)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728949025&usg=AOvVaw0z20YIV7CEn03s1u-1NHgT) p. 115)

November 3 — 9:00 p.m. A green fireball is sighted in Arizona, New Mexico, Texas, and Oklahoma. Capitol Airways pilot H. R. DeHoney is flying at 11,000 feet about 20 miles south of Flagstaff, Arizona, watches the object speed by as a bright blue-green ball that leaves a streak of brilliant red fire. (Nukes 75–76; “[Mystery Meteor Startles](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93268614/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728949327&usg=AOvVaw2cAVbblx66t5fDFxL0K5-Z) [NM, Arizona,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93268614/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728949522&usg=AOvVaw2iiWYxrzM2GRoW6n6wdI8P)” Santa Fe New Mexican, November 4, 1951, p. 13)

November 6 — [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728949849&usg=AOvVaw0If_8nnknAxvABsLFEDyh3) flies to Reese AFB \[now Reese Technology Center\] in Lubbock, Texas, to begin his investigation of the Lubbock lights, accompanied by OSI agent Howard Bossert. (Clark III 691)

November 7 — Evening. A steamship captain and crew watch an elongated orange object with six glowing “portholes” speed toward Ontario over Lake Superior. (UFOEv, [p. 146](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D158%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728950163&usg=AOvVaw1ruIwj__QekHovYagE59Lh))

November 8 — [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728950416&usg=AOvVaw0EpZKmrDBVEnjearv-if5I) and an officer from Reese AFB visit Brownfield, Texas, to investigate UFO sightings there. (Clark III 691)

November 9 — Since October 30, seven green fireballs of exceptional size have been seen over a seven-state area in the American Southwest. [Lincoln LaPaz](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lincoln_LaPaz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728950776&usg=AOvVaw0rxIKn0RtwkEGw_r6DSHSU)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lincoln_LaPaz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728950950&usg=AOvVaw0egaXPx6x_Vfb-Mv_EleJP) director of the University of New Mexico Institute of Meteoritics, says that frequency is exceptional: “In fact, there has never been a rate of meteorite fall in history that has been one fifth as high as the present fall. If that rate should continue, I would suspect the phenomenon is not natural.” The fireballs travel in straight lines and are completely silent. (“[Southwest’s 7 Fireballs in 11 Days Called ‘Without Parallel in](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1951/11/10/81778313.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728951188&usg=AOvVaw0YvI-XzfuRQD3rnxcW6-0G) [History,’](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1951/11/10/81778313.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728951396&usg=AOvVaw3_QPhApgiQjbLYGL76BEzR)” New York Times, November 10, 1951, pp. 1, 14; Nukes 76–79)

November 11 — 8:45 p.m. Thomas Bartis and his older brother [Francis](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/138128035/francis-j-bartis&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728951799&usg=AOvVaw0o6j6PAyw3VkynQBmiXZkA) are driving through New Haven, Connecticut, when they see a huge yellow fireball with a greenish-blue tail streak through the sky. Probable bolide. (“[Second](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94115843/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728952032&usg=AOvVaw3Deqah_pe5BJAsij7DVJxJ) [Fireball](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94115843/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728952217&usg=AOvVaw2Wzals2PKN_qcvfnDVV24_) [Is Sighted,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94115926/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728952400&usg=AOvVaw1thVEhcc1BZrsxGtrHNacf)” Meriden (Conn.) Record-Journal, November 12, 1951, pp. 1, 10)

November 20 — 6:42 p.m. A vivid green fireball is reported from Dodge City, Kansas, and Lubbock and Big Springs, Texas. Two Air Force pilots landing at Kirtland AFB, Albuquerque, New Mexico, and a Trans World Airlines pilot also see the fireball. (Nukes 78)

November 24 — 3:53 p.m. Air Force Capt. William Fairbrother is flying a P-51 over Mankato, Minnesota, at 25,000 feet when he sees a white object shaped like a flying wing. It hovers at first, then it passes 100 feet above and to the left of his aircraft. He immediately turns to follow but loses sight of it. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728952887&usg=AOvVaw3LcWM1OImeDc17UWFKlRYc), p. 115)

November 24 — 6:24 p.m. A Capital Airlines Flight 94 pilot and several control tower and other ground observers in four different locations in Michigan (Grand Rapids, Coopersville, Battle Creek, and Selfridge AFB near Mount Clemens) see a large round object flying west at 500–1,000 feet at about 1,000 mph. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728953193&usg=AOvVaw2hfzz0DYm3N0WLYBelLrn2), p. 116; Swords 130)

* * *

November 27 — Geophysicist Louis Elterman releases the final report on Project Twinkle. Basically, it admits that the low frequency of occurrence of the fireballs does not justify the $50,000 a year required for a useful monitoring facility. It speculates that “the earth may be passing through a region in space of high meteoric population. Also, the sun-spot maxima in 1948 perhaps in some way may be a contributing factor.” (Louis Elterman, [Project](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/twinkle/ProjectTwinkleFinalReport.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728953624&usg=AOvVaw2Ag6zd1dRQ9w1zr1hTP7NM) [Twinkle Final Report](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/twinkle/ProjectTwinkleFinalReport.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728953835&usg=AOvVaw3XFISu0h16kQsLM8ug0U02)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/twinkle/ProjectTwinkleFinalReport.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728953999&usg=AOvVaw3iTtA-Q8W-eQJDbebX7GHU) Atmospheric Physics Laboratory, November 27, 1951; Clark III 544–545)

November 30 — Project Grudge issues its first Status Report, classified “confidential.” (US Air Force, [Projects Grudge](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.slideshare.net/alexpituba/projects-grudge-and-bluebook-reports-1-12-nicap&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728954313&usg=AOvVaw2-mdPWo75N__DOYa7VM6V8) [and Blue Book Reports 1–12,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.slideshare.net/alexpituba/projects-grudge-and-bluebook-reports-1-12-nicap&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728954551&usg=AOvVaw25aBw_b7nBhE3xVoGorVoT) NICAP, 1968, pp. 1–19)

December — [Ed J. Sullivan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://obscurantist.com/oma/csi-la/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728954864&usg=AOvVaw1-wRyFDPOtujSiYG9hmJyz)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://obscurantist.com/oma/csi-la/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728955025&usg=AOvVaw3fUTdheEQ_aJRPCchBk6gG) a technical writer for North American Aviation, holds a meeting of engineers, scientists, and journalists in Los Angeles, California, who have been following the UFO phenomenon. They form Civilian Saucer Investigation to collect reports and forward them on to ATIC. Its most prominent member is [Walther](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://anniejacobsen.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/02/op-16.jpg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728955240&usg=AOvVaw2qjS4NFvjIivtvmAgO6GJM) [Riedel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://anniejacobsen.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/02/op-16.jpg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728955444&usg=AOvVaw02GoHVyfSZR0ah4UgLfGU6)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://anniejacobsen.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/02/op-16.jpg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728955628&usg=AOvVaw3r91BuBWFR-cmAq_fiO70Q) German rocket scientist retrieved by Project Paperclip. (Michael D. Swords, GrassRoots UFOs: Case Reports from the Timmerman Files, Fund for UFO Research, 2005, pp. 139–140; Clark III 241–242)

December 5 — Early morning. Swedish [Prince Carl Bernadotte](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prince_Carl_Bernadotte&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728956116&usg=AOvVaw1FXF1D4Yp4Yc9DiMGT0Oga) and a friend, [Berl Gutenberg](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sv.wikipedia.org/wiki/Berl_Gutenberg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728956343&usg=AOvVaw24gSBIPgVIMCari62GSmiI), are driving near Stockholm, Sweden, when they see a bright flash of light illuminate the sky. Bernadotte stops the car and opens the door to listen for sounds. They go immediately to the Stockholm Criminal Investigation Department, who reports the incident to the Security Police and the military UFO desk. The report is instantly classified, even though the object is probably a meteor. (Swords 366)

December 11 — Project Twinkle closes down. (Clark III 545)

December 12 — 3:50 p.m. USAF Capt. [Donald “Deke” Slayton](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deke_Slayton&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728956682&usg=AOvVaw0Aitxw1a-1LmCCXfByp1pJ), flying a P-51 fighter at 10,000 feet, sees a whitish or gray object off his left wing about one mile away and 1,000 feet below his flight level about five miles southeast of Hastings, Minnesota. It looks like a kite at first, then like a weather balloon, then two rapidly revolving discs that overlap with centers about 1 foot apart. He attempts an intercept, but the UFO increases speed and disappears. (NICAP, “[‘Deke’ Slayton / P-51 Encounter](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/511212hastings_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728956902&usg=AOvVaw1Edfm2E6f5SfJMAg8RE1KX)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728957099&usg=AOvVaw3pSaW7kaiCC1eQk2uxbgk6)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728957294&usg=AOvVaw2INWXsfG9X6ivBFIeXDVRw) p. 117)

December 19 — [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728957556&usg=AOvVaw2YFhl6y96KWuJQgKr-euMk) travels to the Pentagon with ATIC Chief Col. [Frank Dunn](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Dunn.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728957775&usg=AOvVaw3W8j1OiVE0247J055aLFBq)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Dunn.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728957929&usg=AOvVaw2ZP9Apkl9AxkqtBZ5VbRpS) They visit with Maj. Gen. [John A.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_A._Samford&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728958127&usg=AOvVaw0UZyHrVO_aoHPAsLUnz8_n) [Samford](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_A._Samford&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728958332&usg=AOvVaw2VsmKu_IDvCPDBHwS31201), who has replaced [Cabell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_P._Cabell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728958548&usg=AOvVaw2-74oGj7lY5nPjDscqYYOw) as USAF director of intelligence and who seems “familiar with the general aspects of the problem.” Samford’s aide, Gen. [William M.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49186828/william-madison-garland&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728958791&usg=AOvVaw0BBN4yOCjCwY2IxrateLxd) [Garland](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/107003/brigadier-general-william-m-garland/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728959013&usg=AOvVaw15uQJ70DA1M7dG-MuIGsZt), tells them that ATIC has the sole authorization to carry out UFO investigations for the entire US military (not exactly true), and they discuss security problems posed by UFOs at sensitive installations. Ruppelt reveals that his preliminary analysis of UFO sighting patterns has uncovered a disturbing correlation of unexplained sightings around nuclear weapons facilities and highly classified nuclear stockpile sites and some SAC strategic air bases. Gen. Samford orders ATIC to conduct an exhaustive statistical study to verify Ruppelt’s findings, using the newly established ATIC Project WHITE STORK contract with the research think tank Battelle Memorial Institute in Columbus, Ohio (which eventually spends $100,000 on the study, Subproject PPS-100, confirming Ruppelt’s pattern). (Ruppelt, [pp. 115–116](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/114/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728959359&usg=AOvVaw3E4TC4cze3kcFIyQQEzHQV))

December 26–27 — [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728959640&usg=AOvVaw0WuQy4pLrnatDDTEqkQMac) and Col. [Sanford H. Kirkland Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/48770905/sanford-h-kirkland&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728959882&usg=AOvVaw0AnnpAZ2Bv2whQH-DFU9Em) of ATIC meet with members of the Battelle Memorial Institute in Columbus, Ohio, and ask them to help out with the USAF evaluation of UFO reports: first, a study of witness perception and recall, then a statistical study of UFO reports. (“[Seven Status Reports for Project Stork,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cufon.org/cufon/stork1-7.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728960115&usg=AOvVaw1ItWcb5L_NyzIBc1Gqf1uN)” CUFON; Clark III 929)

December 28 — Project Grudge issues Status Report #2 and a Special Report three days later. (US Air Force, [Projects](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.slideshare.net/alexpituba/projects-grudge-and-bluebook-reports-1-12-nicap&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728960460&usg=AOvVaw3jCAVuTbE2iPFPp4ql2PtY) [Grudge and Blue Book Reports 1–12,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.slideshare.net/alexpituba/projects-grudge-and-bluebook-reports-1-12-nicap&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728960695&usg=AOvVaw18Nrtx02QVf8Y3oV5cFwSC) NICAP, 1968, pp. 21–53)

1952

1952 — The Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory is established in Livermore, California, as an offshoot of the UC Radiation Laboratory at Berkeley. It is intended to spur innovation and provide competition to the nuclear weapon design laboratory at Los Alamos, New Mexico. [Edward Teller](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Teller&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728961287&usg=AOvVaw0VKUrexmu-RUjzgSqanqAy) and [Ernest Lawrence](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ernest_Lawrence&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728961558&usg=AOvVaw0sl4IzFKih6EBhq2-v-63D)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ernest_Lawrence&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728961719&usg=AOvVaw05fZ9X6-zOiDF7tR5xF7-Z) director of the Radiation Laboratory at Berkeley, are regarded as its cofounders. Los Alamos and Livermore soon establish a rivalry, fighting for weapons contracts and feasibility-study awards. (Wikipedia, “[Lawrence Livermore National](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lawrence_Livermore_National_Laboratory&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728961937&usg=AOvVaw3ebnn1K8bN-dtdGgjdE61B) [Laboratory](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lawrence_Livermore_National_Laboratory&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728962154&usg=AOvVaw3Bt4_6WM92nhorj9zc2yiI)”)

1952 — [José Manuel Rodríguez Delgado](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jos%25C3%25A9_Manuel_Rodr%25C3%25ADguez_Delgado&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728962461&usg=AOvVaw15NZyx7rGgbdPGt3-COg2g)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jos%25C3%25A9_Manuel_Rodr%25C3%25ADguez_Delgado&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728962664&usg=AOvVaw3dTnLKGGPDPLuv4S6qqJ09) a Spanish physiologist at Yale University, coauthors what he claims is the first peer-reviewed paper describing deep-brain stimulation of humans. Over the next two decades, he implants electrodes in some 25 subjects. Most are schizophrenics and epileptics at the now-defunct State Hospital for Mental Diseases in Howard, Rhode Island, where Delgado’s occasional collaborator [Hannibal Hamlin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nytimes.com/1982/06/29/obituaries/dr-hannibal-hamlin-former-neurosurgeon.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728962918&usg=AOvVaw0pdltCzUffZCAU7W0i2O6I) is a staff psychiatrist. Delgado is reticent discussing his experiments on humans. He is more enthusiastic recalling research

* * *

on monkeys, chimpanzees, and gibbons, which he kept both at Yale and in open-air compounds in the Bahamas and New Mexico. He explores the effects of stimulation not only on individuals but also on groups. In one demonstration, he implants a stimoceiver (a tiny electrode able to receive and transmit signals over FM radio waves) in a macaque who terrorizes his cage-mates. Delgado installs a lever in the cage that, when pressed, activates the stimoceiver in the bully and pacify him. A female in the cage soon figures out the lever’s significance and yanks it often and with gusto.
