(John Horgan, “[Tribute to Jose Delgado, Legendary and Slightly](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://blogs.scientificamerican.com/cross-check/tribute-to-jose-delgado-legendary-and-slightly-scary-pioneer-of-mind-control/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728963395&usg=AOvVaw3JuDEAH2T16I-Yf88KpuJb) [Scary Pioneer of Mind Control,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://blogs.scientificamerican.com/cross-check/tribute-to-jose-delgado-legendary-and-slightly-scary-pioneer-of-mind-control/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728963668&usg=AOvVaw0IKHvrFD5Aut571xUCOz2y)” Cross-Check, Scientific American blog, September 25, 2017)

1952 — World War II air intelligence records are transferred from the Pentagon to Maxwell AFB in Montgomery, Alabama. This shift is probably why Blue Book’s Capt. [Edward J. Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728963996&usg=AOvVaw3cw8u08H3URWub54BQlXZR) later cannot find anything about foo- fighters during his trips to USAF intelligence to locate reports not forwarded to ATIC. (Jan Aldrich)

1952 — The Argentine Navy establishes a temporary inquiry commission dedicated to the UFO phenomenon at its Puerto Belgrano Naval Base in Punta Alta, Argentina. (Milton Hourcade, “[Argentina: UFO Declassification,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.uapsg.com/2020/07/argentina-ufo-declassification.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728964354&usg=AOvVaw1DoM1IUqB3pjrmP7xTImpr)” U.A.P.S.G.–G.E.F.A.I., July 29, 2020)

1952? — An anonymous occupation soldier in Austria meets a diving suit–clad being who paralyzes him, pulls him inside a UFO, and flies him to an otherworldly place he takes to be Mars. He sees other humans who do not acknowledge him. Then he is returned to his base. (Prince George (B.C.) Citizen, December 11, 1957; Clark 2)

1952 — 6:30 a.m. A carpool of people on their way to work at United Airlines in San Mateo, California, observe five smaller objects merging with a much larger, diamond-shaped object. The big one is about 150–200 feet long, charcoal or gunmetal in color, and is hovering 50–75 feet above some salt flats. The UFOs are directly in front of them to the east, about 1,500–1,800 feet away. One of the witnesses, airplane mechanic [Leonard L. Musel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/106575158/leonard-l-musel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728964818&usg=AOvVaw3PttM_JKKioeKJLZ4NjsSL), said the smaller objects entered the large object through a “transparent tail or sleeve.” After they were aboard, the bigger UFO turned edgewise and zoomed off at a fantastic speed. (Herbert S. Taylor, “Satellite Objects: A Further Look,” IUR 29, no. 2 (Summer 2004): 7)

1952 — Night. USAF Pvt. Sinclair Taylor is on guard duty at Camp Okubo in Uji, on the southern outskirts of Kyoto, Japan, when he hears flapping sounds and sees what seems to be an enormous bird. As it gets closer to him, Taylor sees that it is a winged man well over 7 feet tall with a wingspread of 7 feet. Taylor fires at it repeatedly with his rifle and thinks he hit it, but he can’t find the body. (Clark III 778)

January — [Jim and Coral Lorenzen](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://robert-barrow.blogspot.com/2007/05/remembering-coral-lorenzen.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728965339&usg=AOvVaw2U2gON6kZcgk1Xm776whIT) found the Aerial Phenomena Research Organization in Sturgeon Bay, Wisconsin.

Soon, a man claiming to have an intelligence background becomes an active supporter and tries to lead the Lorenzens into “metaphysical areas of research.” Coral Lorenzen rebuffs these attempts. She discovers what seem to be the impressions of an intelligence report about her on one of his letters. In the summer, two suspicious men posing as building contractors seem to be lurking around her home as well as the homes of the APRO treasurer and secretary the same day. (Lorenzen, Encounters with UFO Occupants, Berkley Medallion, 1976, pp. 1–2, 248– 251; Clark III 49)

January — Some 74% of the CIA’s money goes toward covert operations. It has already infiltrated many US labor, business, church, university, student, and cultural groups, usually channeling the money through foundations. This year it begins HTLINGUAL, a secret project to intercept mail destined for the USSR and China. It also targets domestic peace and civil rights activists. It lasts until 1973, photographing 2 million envelopes and opening 215,000 letters. (Frank J. Donner, [The Age of Surveillance: The Aims and Methods of America’s Political](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/nkj00fran&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728965867&usg=AOvVaw0qrGmMr_Wxe37il43pwFg-) [Intelligence System](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/nkj00fran&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728966056&usg=AOvVaw1C00xZo-c2UOoUfqdJsXVK)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/nkj00fran&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728966235&usg=AOvVaw3YrkPR05NTJYqhQ7jEcHJP) Knopf, 1980; Jim Keith, Mind Control, World Control: The Encyclopedia of Mond Control, Adventures Unlimited, 1997; David Wise, [The American Police State: The Government Against the People](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/americanpolicest000234&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728966541&usg=AOvVaw1Rg8wApqcfIyGnAJOBbner), Random House, 1976)

January 1 —10:54 p.m. Warrant Officer W. J. Yeo (a master telecomm specialist) and Sgt. [D. V. Crandell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/133858511/d_-v_-crandell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728966838&usg=AOvVaw0CieQMNqZyhX3vyvGRd-7q) watch a silent, reddish-orange object circle and maneuver for nearly 9 minutes at RCAF Station North Bay, Ontario. It appears to be very large and travels at supersonic speed. (“[‘Saucers’ Seen Here:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93280805/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728967077&usg=AOvVaw1UOeguJl4bqanvHP1Hwq4P) [2 Sighted at RCAF Station,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93280911/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728967278&usg=AOvVaw1EeEBf2NeLYaDyzJjN_U_-)” North Bay (Ont.) Nugget, April 15, 1952, pp. 1–2; Yurko Bondarchuk, UFO Sightings, Landings, and Abductions, Methuen, 1979, p. 92)

January 3 — Brig. Gen. [William M. Garland](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/107003/brigadier-general-william-m-garland/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728967712&usg=AOvVaw1GVCFghDZiQt4SlCrL4MgE), Assistant for the Production of Intelligence, writes a secret memorandum for General [John A. Samford](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_A._Samford&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728967922&usg=AOvVaw2858RXJf5r3OYno3yXNgXx) that lays down the investigative shortcomings of Project Grudge and suggests policies and agendas for the immediate future. Garland mentions that the aircraft inventions and models by the [Horten brothers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Horten_brothers&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728968161&usg=AOvVaw2ZJzotl31_VDJt8xJdYZCJ) had fallen into the hands of the Soviets at the end of World War II. (Brig. Gen. William M. Garland, [“(Secret) Contemplated Action to Determine the Nature and Origin of the Phenomena Connected with](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/waves/garland.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728968387&usg=AOvVaw2zIsc-1gLB3DOuXqRxXKqL) [the Reports of Unusual Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/waves/garland.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728968575&usg=AOvVaw1WOMdjvoLURqV9fAjNAE5K)” January 3, 1952; Swords 141–143; Kremlin 34)

January 6 — Contactee [George Van Tassel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Van_Tassel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728968854&usg=AOvVaw1ldQa9_UAaoQevflWdtqds), living at Giant Rock in the Mojave Desert near Landers, California, receives the first of many psychic messages from extraterrestrial starship commanders. This one is from “Lutbunn, senior

* * *

in command of first wave, planet patrol, realms of Schare. We have your contact aboard 80,000 feet above this place.” Other messages soon come from Elcar, Clota, Totalmon, Latamarx, Noma, Leektow, Luu, Oblow, Kerrull, Locktopar, Molca, Clatu, Hulda, Lata, Singba, and others. One of his contacts, Ashtar, will become a metaphysical superstar, and in the years ahead many contactees will channel communications from him. These aliens seek to raise humanity’s “vibrationary attunement” so that earthlings will not threaten the wise and peace- loving space people. Van Tassel reprints many of these messages in a misleadingly titled book, I Rode a Flying Saucer! (George W. Van Tassel, [I Rode a Flying Saucer! The Mysteries of the Flying Saucers Revealed](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/documents.pub_i-rode-a-flying-saucer-george-van-tassel/page/n1/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728969328&usg=AOvVaw0QdiVcfrO-rpcl116LqNj8), New Age, 1952; Clark III 1218–1219)

January 8 — Battelle Memorial Institute in Columbus, Ohio, agrees to help out the Air Force with analyzing UFO reports. (Clark III 929)

January 20 — 7:20 p.m. Two master sergeants, both intelligence specialists, are walking down a street at Fairchild AFB near Spokane, Washington, when they notice a large, bluish-white, spherical object approaching from the east. It passes north of their position, traveling horizontally and silently, and disappears in the west. They notice it has a long blue tail. It travels underneath low cloud cover at 4,700 feet at 1,400 mph. (NICAP, “[Large Sphere with Blue](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520120spokane_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728969714&usg=AOvVaw0Jkkk33WhVWgJltRWjKLnJ) [Tail at 500ʹ,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520120spokane_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728969950&usg=AOvVaw1iZnzQjK9OGeCVBwNEw_2o)”; Ruppelt, [p. 12](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/12/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728970166&usg=AOvVaw2im77ZKup2Lq1tV95149Df); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728970364&usg=AOvVaw3EgESyx8KFS-wlFm37ZxNh), p. 118)

January 21 — 9:50 a.m. A Navy pilot lieutenant commander in a TBM Avenger chases a white, dome-shaped object over Mitchel AFB \[now closed\] on Long Island, New York. It accelerates rapidly, makes a 180° turn, and heads out to sea. He estimates it is traveling at least at 300 mph. It looks like a parachute canopy and has a dark undersurface. Although there is a balloon in the area, but its flight path is completely different. (NICAP, “[TBM Chases Climbing](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520121mitchel_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728970670&usg=AOvVaw0d0S4aMGKdfx1Dm8Vpo_nA) [and Accelerating Object](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520121mitchel_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728970889&usg=AOvVaw28Nh-bXzDBYii5wSBzwLw-)”; Ruppelt, [pp. 121–123](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/120/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728971093&usg=AOvVaw0HtokxWk0irKv4VDWurVXR); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728971290&usg=AOvVaw20WDBITLGL8wX_4WzPccMn)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728971440&usg=AOvVaw3DVDcdOMRHzLqDaL8gj-tz) p. 118)

January 22 — 12:20 a.m. At a northern Alaska outpost, Murphy Dome Air Force Station, radar captures a UFO traveling 1,500 mph at 23,000 feet. When an F-94 is sent to intercept, the target stops, slows down, reverses course, and heads directly for the radar station. It comes within 30 miles, then disappears from the screen. The F-94 heads back to refuel, and a second fighter is scrambled. This pilot gets a strong radar return. At first, the object is almost stationary, but then it dives suddenly, at which point ground radar picks it up again. A third F-94 is sent up, also tracks the object on radar, and closes to within 900 feet. At this point, the pilot pulls away to avoid a collision, as the UFO is nearly immobile. Since none of the pilots obtained a visual sighting, the Air Force concludes that the radar returns are weather-related, although the pilots strongly dispute this. (NICAP, “[Alaskan Radar Case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520122nenana_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728971839&usg=AOvVaw1UMXf81ns8G5uA30HJEQPx)”; Ruppelt, [pp. 123–127](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/122/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728972051&usg=AOvVaw2tCWxaM8wJF74iydh0aDS3); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728972243&usg=AOvVaw2fFTQKg1IEc0tmIr2IUY1s)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728972421&usg=AOvVaw2iWnoy4xlFv1gLXvgtuaPR) pp. 119–120)

January 29 — On his trip to the Pentagon to brief Gen. [William M. Garland](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/107003/brigadier-general-william-m-garland/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728972725&usg=AOvVaw2vNAx-9cDq6Y58FjRbLUqj), [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728972930&usg=AOvVaw1IDow7986vxsQGeU45oXp2) visits the AFOIN offices and discovers they have more complete files than ATIC in Dayton, Ohio, does. He arranges to have copies made of the missing files for him at Project Grudge (though multiple visits are required to obtain the copies and Ruppelt probably does not succeed in getting everything). The offices with UFO files include the Technical Capabilities Branch (TCB) of the Evaluation Division and the Collection Control Branch of the Collection Division. (NICAP, “[The 1952 Sighting Wave](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/chronos/1952FIXED.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728973177&usg=AOvVaw31kQbizUJlDAUjicYapml5)”)

January 29 — Brig. Gen. [William M. Garland](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/107003/brigadier-general-william-m-garland/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728973460&usg=AOvVaw2cwT4OtKCMQ3qh_8KuwTVQ), USAF Assistant for Production of Intelligence, and his staff are briefed at the Pentagon on the status of Project Grudge by [Edward Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728973693&usg=AOvVaw1etocBCGgoVGjfQNGi0cc0)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728973851&usg=AOvVaw17vHpK6x7VQh-XAzEMcaxb) who with his colleagues at ATIC has prepared sighting maps that show a concentration of cases at White Sands and Los Alamos, New Mexico; Killeen Base, Texas; Oak Ridge, Tennessee; and Dayton, Ohio (where Wright-Patterson AFB is situated). At this meeting, Garland introduces a new intelligence policy that emphasizes the use of instrumentation for intelligence collection, including the detection and tracking of UFOs (the basis for terminating Project Blue Book as an intelligence function). As an interim last-chance measure to prove whether anecdotal sightings have any value, Garland approves Ruppelt’s publicity plan to draw in UFO reports from the public so that triangulations might be obtained. This leads to Garland secretly backing the Life magazine article. Apparently on the same day, Garland gives the welcoming address to the secret MIT Lincoln Laboratory (Ruppelt calls it the Beacon Hill group) in Cambridge, Massachusetts, where he tells the assembled scientists to study ways USAF intelligence methodology can be revolutionized through the use of technology. (Later Garland sends Ruppelt, Col. [Sanford H. Kirkland Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/48770905/sanford-h-kirkland&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728974187&usg=AOvVaw2Q3RFiE8WnAjkq1_JA7hha) of ATIC, and Lt. Col. William A. Adams of AFOIN, to brief the Lincoln Lab scientists on UFOs on March 26 and in April 1952, respectively) (“[Status of Project Blue Book,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/NARA-PBB85-612-615.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728974544&usg=AOvVaw0EydzVj0L4bLLyiaTJjiFS)” T52-6888, \[1952\]; NICAP, “[The 1952 Sighting](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/chronos/1952FIXED.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728974750&usg=AOvVaw3Emy1m9TjnjcaKe2ANwKTH) [Wave](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/chronos/1952FIXED.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728974943&usg=AOvVaw3ynPhElutOWJ8aKYQEPXpA)”; Swords 144; Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1952, January–May](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Jan-May.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728975153&usg=AOvVaw0SEt_d-g3LfTQ32aPupL-O), The Author, 1993, p. 12)

January 29 — Evening. Violet M. Winstead and her husband are at an open-air movie theater on Guam when they and others at the theater see an orange light passing silently overhead. (Violet M. Winstead, Letter, IUR 9, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1984): 3)

January 29 — Night. A bright orange, disc-shaped object, also described as a “huge ball of fire,” paces two B-29s on the same night, 80 miles from each other over the towns of Wonsan and Sunchon, North Korea. (NICAP, “[Rotating](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520129wonsan_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728975730&usg=AOvVaw2rzRAOXR-yYkDxVjXa6ckW)

* * *

[Light Seen by B-29 Crew](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520129wonsan_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728976035&usg=AOvVaw3muvucn-uVALmWB_rSqBFa)”; NICAP, “[B-29 Crew Followed by UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520129sunchon_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728976320&usg=AOvVaw1qoGWVuf_piYxTwGDXE97F)”; Haines, Korea, [pp. 33–37](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/aadkw/aadkw_ch3.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728976710&usg=AOvVaw34yMqo6XkZeIFkaC4Jnt0a); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728977006&usg=AOvVaw3v5YuSXu1iBj2e1ECvY_SV), p. 121; Patrick Gross, “[UFO US Military Reports, Korea, 1952](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/korea29jan52.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728977221&usg=AOvVaw0l8UeERm0kmn83kc0VBTrK)”)

January 31 — [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728977640&usg=AOvVaw0Ws7QQBGPMfqH_50F1T88Q) releases Project Grudge Status Report #3, in which he reviews the geographic distribution of UFO reports, states the project’s obstacle, and includes a list of 15 cases reported to ATIC in January. (Swords 144; US Air Force, [Projects Grudge and Blue Book Reports 1–12,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.slideshare.net/alexpituba/projects-grudge-and-bluebook-reports-1-12-nicap&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728978237&usg=AOvVaw17wQB4VJnZpqAgcbsSHiTR) NICAP, 1968, pp. 55–64)

February 2 — 7:35 p.m. Radar operators aboard the aircraft carrier [USS Philippine Sea](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Philippine_Sea_(CV-47)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728978893&usg=AOvVaw1QLrHHEImpAi_dO1981BBm) pick up an unidentified target off the east coast of Korea. It is first detected at a distance of 25 miles; when it closes to 20 miles, it makes a wide turn to the east directly away from the carrier, accelerating from 600 to 1,800 mph at 52,000 feet altitude. It splits into two targets 5–12 miles apart on a slightly zigzag course to the north. They disappear about 110 miles away. Observers on the carrier see three exhaust flames. (NICAP, “[USS](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520202skorea_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728979347&usg=AOvVaw13nwTUmmsVugSEajq4kJfF) [Philippine Sea](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520202skorea_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728979618&usg=AOvVaw2WdeqbS8KvDLJ_J2JD7YEC) [Tracks Approaching Target](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520202skorea_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728979891&usg=AOvVaw3J5sf0YYACTUZnpMSl4IvA)”; Hynek UFO Report, [pp. 126–127](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/126/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728980264&usg=AOvVaw1UU3pNwLYsNVXe2H21Myv0); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728980484&usg=AOvVaw0jPWDQPonl4fc1j7W4nHEn)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728980654&usg=AOvVaw1RcOOP3y03sLFujLzhlO2Q) p. 121)

February 8 — [Dewey Fournet](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8653239/dewey-j_-fournet&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728980938&usg=AOvVaw32-wJEwN8QyQdV0sYup5S4)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8653239/dewey-j_-fournet&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728981110&usg=AOvVaw3ngkopRgqqRUVHw-A60nzi) on the Pentagon’s UFO desk, writes to [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728981326&usg=AOvVaw2HyYtEwZcGl1pWXHAkDa6b) at ATIC for help in interpreting the Korean sightings. Ruppelt has brought in an expert from Wright-Patterson AFB’s Engineering Division, [Peter A. Stranges](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.baltimoresun.com/news/bs-xpm-2002-12-28-0212280043-story.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728981614&usg=AOvVaw0KqiSk8JpuVqlSzlnh2DG3) of the Propulsion Branch Power Plant Group, to help with the analysis, which he passes on to Fournet and [Garland](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/107003/brigadier-general-william-m-garland/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728981923&usg=AOvVaw2t2m2EEHA9vkTWbPg6LS9t)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/107003/brigadier-general-william-m-garland/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728982123&usg=AOvVaw3JOjjivim58U5XodVwImir) Stranges compares the Wonsan sighting to the foo fighters of World War II. (Swords 144–145).

February 20 — 3:00 p.m. Rev. [Albert Baller](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/NICAP-Bios/Baller.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728982471&usg=AOvVaw04NWFLUe7urYZkC9gXh1lB) is sitting in a train at the station in Greenfield, Massachusetts, when he sees a “sharp flash of light about 35° or more above the horizon.” Looking upward, he sees three perfectly circular, silver objects approaching in a V-formation. They are moving at about the “speed of a second hand on a watch.” They stop and hover for 10 seconds. The lead object reverses and pulls into a line with the other two between them. Then they depart in a direction at right angles to their approach. (UFOEv, [p. 69](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D81%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728982797&usg=AOvVaw31l7Uq4KgM8TnXJGJ1_qj9))

February 21 — Sen. [Richard Russell Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Russell_Jr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728983636&usg=AOvVaw0KATXrVxQwoojDEaeCSnj4) (D-Ga.), chairman of the Senate Armed Services Committee, requests further information on the January 29 Korean UFO incidents in a letter to Secretary of the Air Force [Thomas K. Finletter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_K._Finletter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728983869&usg=AOvVaw2NKUK4TjXT_RfqpF8agva5)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_K._Finletter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728984031&usg=AOvVaw2ANYSWWXXEjfVyKVRvhcfq) (Project 1947, “[UFO Documents, 1952, Korea](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/korea52a.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728984223&usg=AOvVaw0tT_OUXQ8eVqc_92NRnOGh)”)

February 21 — Far East Air Forces Commander Lieut. Gen. [Otto P. Weyland](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Otto_P._Weyland&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728984476&usg=AOvVaw25IZivu_Tcli-0iLkicBda) tells reporters that “no conclusive evaluation had been made at the present time” on the Wonsan/Sunchon, Korea, sightings of January 29–30. February 22 — The now-completed Site Able is renamed Manzano Base, New Mexico, and turned over to the operational control of the Air Force. What appear to be secure bunkers are visible to people (mostly military personnel) who go to a recreational camping area nearby known as Coyote Canyon. The military, however, never officially confirms the nature of the activities at Manzano Base \[now part of Kirtland Air Force Base\]. At one point, a military spokesman says that Manzano Base has nothing to do with Sandia Base. Manzano has since been identified as the first of six original National Stockpile Sites for nuclear weapons. The other original NSS installations similar to Manzano are: Site Baker at Killeen Base, adjacent to Gray AFB \[now Robert Gray Army Airfield\] at Fort Hood, Texas; Site Charlie at Campbell AFB \[now Campbell Army Airfield\] near Hopkinsville, Kentucky, and adjacent to Fort Campbell; Site Dog at Bossier Base, adjacent to Barksdale AFB near Bossier City, Louisiana; Lake Mead Base, adjacent to Nellis AFB, Nevada; and Medina Base, adjacent to Lackland AFB \[now Joint Base San Antonio\], Texas. (Wikipedia, “[Sandia Base](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sandia_Base%23Manzano_Base&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728985531&usg=AOvVaw3EWC3MgMa6FgUmsJP3wZm3)”)

Brig. Gen. [William M. Garland](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/107003/brigadier-general-william-m-garland/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728987180&usg=AOvVaw0JluqjMWpnx5ub6X02YGhy) tells him that he has considered firing a guided missile at a UFO to bring it down and requests that Ginna delay publishing an article until the Air Force has come to a more definite conclusion.

Ginna also talks to Lt. Col. [Doyle Rees](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/43562489/doyle-rees&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728987746&usg=AOvVaw34oAkJjluJWobuRiXXlVMP) of OSI. (Jan L. Aldrich, “[Have We Visitors from Space?](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/lifememo52a.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728988135&usg=AOvVaw1KCakj5QoTCKeFcIlCw_tB)” Project 1947) February 29 — Project Grudge issues a secret Status Report #4, classified “secret.” (US Air Force, [Projects Grudge and](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.slideshare.net/alexpituba/projects-grudge-and-bluebook-reports-1-12-nicap&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728988604&usg=AOvVaw1MWvun5RP2gv8OHllX-ofU)

[Blue Book Reports 1–12,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.slideshare.net/alexpituba/projects-grudge-and-bluebook-reports-1-12-nicap&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728988952&usg=AOvVaw2sYjBPf7J0ZylB04NgCvWd) NICAP, 1968, pp. 65–78)

March or April — 5:00 a.m. Two women cryptographers in the US Naval Reserve stationed at the US Naval Training Center at Port Deposit, Maryland, are out taking a walk outside the base on a dirt road. They notice a red light off to one side above the trees. It starts moving toward them and stops about 100 feet above the road in front of them, about 300 feet away. The object is a 250-foot black disc with two large red lights at each side, an illuminated

* * *

dome, and smaller lights along the rim. A hole opens in the bottom and phosphorescent white sparks drop toward the ground and disintegrate when they hit the road. The two reservists sprint the quarter-mile back to the base. (NICAP case file)

March 1 — The 4602nd Air Intelligence Service Squadron is activated under ADC to collect air combat intelligence. (CUFON, “[4602d AISS Unit History Sampler](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/4602smpl1.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728989826&usg=AOvVaw216kXlY0QNtxaTRpMaEcRu)”)

March 3 — [Robert Emmett Ginna Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.encyclopedia.com/arts/educational-magazines/ginna-robert-emmett-jr-1927&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728990159&usg=AOvVaw33PSLJ2Nc4KfFLSZWik5KI) of Life visits ATIC at Wright-Patterson AFB in Dayton, Ohio, to obtain material for his UFO article. [Walther Riedel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://anniejacobsen.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/02/op-16.jpg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728990508&usg=AOvVaw07FzqLQxztON3rHChg6LiY), former German rocket scientist at Peenemünde, Germany, tells Ginna he has kept notes on UFO sightings from all over the world: “I am completely convinced that they have an out-of-world basis.” He also meets with visits Air Force UFO spokesman [Albert M. Ginna becomes suspicious. Aldrich, “[Have We Visitors from Space?](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/lifememo52a.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728991947&usg=AOvVaw3yUErfC3HI_SvHBM-_PFCv)” Project 1947; Michael D. [Nathan Twining](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nathan_Farragut_Twining&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728992501&usg=AOvVaw36wB0J3l6GANxRI82zKh01), to Secretary [Finletter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_K._Finletter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728992758&usg=AOvVaw08LEK_s6ExDz-UeNOrgXtH) in response to Sen. March 7 — Physicist [Joseph Kaplan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Kaplan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728993472&usg=AOvVaw2s6KUwFGspuDKcAV8PzAGa) visits ATIC to discuss methods of obtaining more information on green fireballs using a special diffraction grid to be placed on patrol cameras that can be used as a field spectrometer. March 10 — 6:45 a.m. [Clarence K. Greenwood](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/3581517/clarence-kirk-greenwood&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728994521&usg=AOvVaw2h0RzSXErvBtn_lJitgryt)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/3581517/clarence-kirk-greenwood&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728994816&usg=AOvVaw3pjZ-s6BbYZYMX8ONq85dX) inspector of engineering metals, sees two dark objects come from behind him at an altitude of 5,000–7,500 feet while he is waiting for a bus in Oakland, California. March 14 — Evening. US Secretary of the Navy [Dan A. Kimball](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dan_A._Kimball&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728995746&usg=AOvVaw27Xlu99RaZZtTEpKfdv2-b) is flying to Hawaii when he sees two discs moving at 1,500 mph. Kimball threatens to initiate Naval reports on UFOs through ONR to be kept separate from Blue Book. [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728996620&usg=AOvVaw0EqbyGgM1fbL2eUErehv_a) hears about this from both Kimball and Chief of ONR Adm. Kimball Planes Buzzed](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520314hawaii_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728997614&usg=AOvVaw1YVeieGJuZXlIvbA9xRDtV)”; NICAP, “[Navy Secy Dan Kimball’s Pilot’s Sighting, March 14,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/reports/kimball_swords.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728997855&usg=AOvVaw1BQiLUuWKAY5qZpUjz0DZJ) [1952](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/reports/kimball_swords.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728998052&usg=AOvVaw3j7uQoRMR-1S8IIYkwAepA)”; Swords 165)

March 19 — [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728998309&usg=AOvVaw16QK2EN9zPo4R_5-wSWxw3) and other representatives of ATIC meet with the commander of the Air Defense Command, Gen.

[Benjamin W. Chidlaw](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benjamin_W._Chidlaw&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728998581&usg=AOvVaw0SSd264YI4gu7EyOyZBrXf)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benjamin_W._Chidlaw&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728998744&usg=AOvVaw0ABsbaQ8WbH6DcpVkAC_Uf) and Gen. [Grandison Gardner](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grandison_Gardner&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728999029&usg=AOvVaw3SsqrwkmE-o0Ye6ZkDVVhx) and his staff in Colorado Springs, Colorado, on getting radar scope camera films as UFOs are being tracked. “They agreed with it in principle and suggested that I work out the details with the Director of Intelligence for the ADC, Brigadier Gen. [Woodbury M. Burgess](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49223590/woodbury-m-burgess&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728999458&usg=AOvVaw2LMS64JvHSDQrnw5bbvMJ5).” Chidlaw promises to issue a directive to all units explaining procedures in UFO situations, including the scrambling of interceptors. This is issued, apparently in April. Burgess assigns Maj. [Vernon L. Sadowski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.tributearchive.com/obituaries/2140264/Vernon-L-Sadowski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889728999835&usg=AOvVaw2hC41PwxvHA7kzKRIgJT8A) of his staff to be liaison to Project Grudge., and the Ground Observer Corps is brought into the UFO reporting net. March 25 — Project Grudge becomes a separate organization under the title Aerial Phenomena Group and is renamed Project Blue Book, apparently by Lt. Col. Gross, [UFOs, a History:](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Jan-May.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729000809&usg=AOvVaw38T_r0Uq08tfNUlPQ9Eaun) [1952, January–May](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Jan-May.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729001033&usg=AOvVaw090Wkb-1e-p6kdyHxvIYDQ)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Jan-May.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729001202&usg=AOvVaw0znDHu6RgzLVa-7lmAixQZ) The Author, 1993, pp. 20–21; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729001418&usg=AOvVaw3etz2sHVmFgFhgZO1yNfl8), p. 12; Ruppelt, [p. 131](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/130/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729001640&usg=AOvVaw2Q2jr-tjizarKFtJXchu25); Clark III 916)

March 26 — Day. Henry C. Davis is looking out at the ocean through his second-floor window in Long Beach, California, and listening to the radio. He spots two yellow discs in the sky about one mile high and 2 miles away. He thinks they are 1,000 feet apart and moving southeast to northwest at 100 mph. As they pass, his radio goes to static twice. ([Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729001950&usg=AOvVaw3cF56D80Lxc-IN85hiq92K)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729002153&usg=AOvVaw0n6TNvSVcMs7wb7CUsdZbo) p. 78)

March 26 — [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729002412&usg=AOvVaw1MulApJNciTCzYpaoI7x-r) meets with the MIT scientists he calls the Beacon Hill Group, which recommends that Blue Book use “sound detection apparatus” in areas of UFO activity. (Clark III 916)

March 26 — Five trials are conducted through April 21 by the US Army Chemical Corps under Operation Dew. The tests release zinc cadmium sulfide along a 100-to-150-nautical-mile line approximately 5–10 nautical miles off the coast of Georgia, North Carolina, and South Carolina. Two of the trials disperse clouds of zinc cadmium sulfide over large areas of all three states. The tests affect over 60,000 square miles of populated coastal region. The Dew I releases are from a Navy minesweeper, the [USS](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Tercel_(AM-386)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729003004&usg=AOvVaw0oLXZLfb-1apheoiAxAif9) [Tercel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Tercel_(AM-386)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729003173&usg=AOvVaw1lImfGwoTFzBLd8iB_yBaR)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Tercel_(AM-386)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729003333&usg=AOvVaw3KjPsA54tCFLEXl6VmcdKR) The conclusion is that long-range aerosol clouds can obtain hundreds of miles of travel and large-area coverage when disseminated from ground level under certain meteorological conditions. (Wikipedia, “[Operation Dew](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Dew&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729003540&usg=AOvVaw3IZiQf9JOfryCSqoeBN5LE)”)

Late March? — [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729003797&usg=AOvVaw3tTNdIzJvnxxnuzR2lQMvp) meets with two RCAF officers and briefs them on the new procedures. (Ruppelt, [p. 130](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/130/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729004035&usg=AOvVaw1fRqkbWofYkvx-GUQnrwuc))

March 29 — 11:20 a.m. Near Misawa, Japan, USAF Lt. [David Conant Brigham](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49468988/david-conant-brigham&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729004383&usg=AOvVaw3PvZ-h5aTUz0fd3eAo0ryx) is flying a T-6 target plane on a practice intercept mission for two F-84s. The first F-84 overtakes him at 6,000 feet when the T-6 pilot notices a small disc gaining on the interceptor. The UFO curves toward the F-84, decelerates rapidly, then flips on edge in a 90° bank. It flies between the two aircraft, pulls away, flips again, passes the F-84, crosses in front, and accelerates out of sight in a near vertical climb. Both pilots notice the object, which comes within 30–50 feet of the T-6. The pilot estimates it is only 8 inches in diameter. There is a ripple around the edge. (NICAP, “[Brigham/T6 Case: UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520329misawa_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729004670&usg=AOvVaw0BS7OTqzLD5qKfe41rYZwl) [Makes Pass at F-84](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520329misawa_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729004980&usg=AOvVaw0FYAmOFdXtUgOOi9Rd_R2q)”; UFOEv, [p. 5](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D18%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729005342&usg=AOvVaw2HyDsjV11rGp-Phxn1RxOc); Keyhoe, FS from OS, [p. 192](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsos/chXI.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729005820&usg=AOvVaw3yewOg96qErqr6RTERmMnw); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729006123&usg=AOvVaw34-FVDQ9Bofcj7ISc2sFi4)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729006291&usg=AOvVaw26r44xCx4F8mdIEZWkFYka) p. 123)

March 29 — Two fiery discs are sighted over the uranium mines in the southern part of the Belgian Congo near Elisabethville \[modern Lubumbashi, Democratic Republic of the Congo\]. With a diameter of approximately 36– 45 feet, they travel in a precise and light manner, both vertically and horizontally. They emit hissing and buzzing sounds. Changes in elevation from 2,400 to 3,000 feet are accomplished in a few seconds. The discs often move down to within 60 feet of the treetops. A Commander Pierre of the Belgian Air Force sets out in pursuit in a fighter plane from the city airport. On his first approach he comes to within about 260 feet of one of the discs.

Suddenly they hover in one spot then takes off in a unique zigzag flight to the northeast at an estimated speed of 930 mph. Pierre gives up his pursuit after about 15 minutes. (NICAP, “[Two Discs over Uranium Mines / Jet in](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520329elizabethville_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729006688&usg=AOvVaw3nSO0gWUCPi96yg1n8bR3a) [Pursuit](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520329elizabethville_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729006884&usg=AOvVaw0i9ogPbIsVUiN2Bba4OwlO)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729007070&usg=AOvVaw2UByv3Eb3DCqM86xuGSKEn)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729007299&usg=AOvVaw1NMdKcIBFskOKrURm8u3E0) p. 123; Good Above, [p. 512](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/512/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729007646&usg=AOvVaw1RgdlR-9_0T-30q6-xYxBG))

March 29 — 6:40 p.m. [Carl J. Henry](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/79853419/carl-jefferson-henry&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729007951&usg=AOvVaw0xVehYOiH3Veqd7N4YdX9g)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/79853419/carl-jefferson-henry&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729008131&usg=AOvVaw3bsHbnmjrMuYl5xzDi7MKw) chairman of the Industrial Commission of Missouri, along with several others, watches a cylinder-shaped, silver UFO for 2 minutes almost directly overhead in Butler, Missouri. It is moving silently in a northwesterly direction leaving no trail or exhaust. He estimates its length at 100 feet. (UFOEv, [p. 68](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D80%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729008377&usg=AOvVaw0po-xg9KTK7nZnqCbIujV2))

March 29 — 10:45 p.m. Donald F. Stewart and George Tyler III are driving northbound on the Governor Ritchie Highway in Glen Burnie, Maryland. A 50-foot silvery domed disc with two portholes and an apparent hatch appears from the northeast and hovers above their car, causing the engine to fail, magnetizing the wiring, and cracking the paint. Stewart takes a sub-machine gun from the back of the car and debates whether to fire it at the object, which remains in view for 3 minutes before turning n its edge and speeding away to the southwest. Tyler changes his story later, denying he was involved. Possible hoax. (NICAP, “[E-M Effects on Car from Domed](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520329glenburnie_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729008783&usg=AOvVaw2CawSLgls0qitoMCBqpv6c) [Disc](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520329glenburnie_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729009114&usg=AOvVaw0HI3Whqvf5cEewQgiUbrHC)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729009446&usg=AOvVaw1ICOUu9wgeoe7RIuwUxOrA)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729009708&usg=AOvVaw1A7A1p49LKKpXSOLwkna0N) p. 124; Hynek UFO Report, [pp. 196–198](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/196/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729010134&usg=AOvVaw3eUgMonriP3S2ye9tUTotA); Randle, Levelland, 2021, pp. 61–64, 229)

March 31 — Battelle begins its UFO study (referred to as P-47S and nicknamed Little Stork) under the supervision of William T. Reid, folding it into Project Stork, an initiative to examine the Soviet Union’s technological warfare capabilities. Almost all of the UFO analysis involves compiling IBM punch cards based on data forwarded by Project Blue Book files. (Clark III 929; Jennie Zeidman, “I Remember Blue Book,” IUR 16, no. 2 (Mar./Apr.

1991): 7–8; Jennie Zeidman and Mark Rodeghier, “The Pentacle Letter and the Battelle UFO Project,” IUR 18, no. 3 (May/June 1993): 4–12, 19–21; Michael Hall, “Was There a Second Estimate of the Situation?” IUR 27, no. 1 (Spring 2002): 12)

March 31 — ATIC Chief [Frank Dunn](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Dunn.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729011314&usg=AOvVaw07OHdBf2g0ynrCuTH6BklC) writes to Gen. [Garland](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/107003/brigadier-general-william-m-garland/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729011795&usg=AOvVaw1KlyvYhZXwqadAME-03kyj) requesting that Project Blue Book be entirely declassified in order to make it easier to encourage civilian pilots to send in reports. That is a bit too much openness for Garland, who compromises by reclassifying certain case investigations as “Restricted,” a relatively low level. (Swords 146)

March 31 — Project Blue Book issues its Status Report #5. (US Air Force, [Projects Grudge and Blue Book Reports 1–12,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.slideshare.net/alexpituba/projects-grudge-and-bluebook-reports-1-12-nicap&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729012495&usg=AOvVaw2YH-Blzj-pipBhx3Z7bYaA)

NICAP, 1968, pp. 81–94)

Spring — Occultist [George Hunt Williamson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Hunt_Williamson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729013189&usg=AOvVaw3d5w14ZMrlhRNZ-AdNlTK7) and his wife Betty move to Prescott, Arizona, and immerse themselves in UFO literature. (Michael D. Swords, “Strange Days,” IUR 30, no. 4 (Aug. 2006): 21)

April? — Amateur astronomer [W. Gordon Graham](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://adsabs.harvard.edu/full/1951JRASC..45..124N&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729013834&usg=AOvVaw1K6wtlboWkbWyy6w7HpqiS) sees a UFO “like a smoke ring, elliptical in shape, and having two bright pinpoints of light along its main axis” at London, Ontario. It sails overhead from west to east. (London (Ont.) Free Press, May 1, 1952; UFOEv, [p. 49](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D62%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729014420&usg=AOvVaw0r4n6nxzJGn9lI7ZLE7ZTe))

April — Secretary of the Navy [Dan Kimball](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dan_A._Kimball&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729014914&usg=AOvVaw1PBuZtMtErqLJoeERSuAHs)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dan_A._Kimball&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729015188&usg=AOvVaw1GI2Rl_vMtgTE_ES1soyfc) upset with the way the Air Force has treated his UFO sighting, sets up an independent Navy probe of UFOs under Lt. Commander Fred Lowell Thomas of the Office of Naval Research. The project lasts through 1952, but probably not much longer. (NICAP, “[Navy Secy Dan Kimball’s Pilot’s](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/reports/kimball_swords.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729015587&usg=AOvVaw3CAN_wpbvtyAy_RzN3pzdJ) [Sighting, March 14, 1952](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/reports/kimball_swords.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729015929&usg=AOvVaw0eR2V0A1zrRSrTeusTSyTy)”)

April — [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729016375&usg=AOvVaw1yFfsK1NJ7DbhniDFyWjMB) again meets with MIT Lincoln Laboratory scientists (the Beacon Hill group) in Cambridge, Massachusetts, to brief them on Blue Book’s progress. Afterward, he asks them about the flashes seen on Mars in 1951, and a general discussion of life on other planets ensues. [Michael D. Swords](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_D._Swords&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729016834&usg=AOvVaw2BEUYN8_2PFcFnSo5qdmEO) suspects that some of those present are physicist [George Valley Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://news.mit.edu/1999/valley-1020&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729017221&usg=AOvVaw3CogBtl1jKwupcZ3GwHVfl)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://news.mit.edu/1999/valley-1020&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729017477&usg=AOvVaw3YZMmFOg5--n4HHwcSls7T) engineer [Julius Adams Stratton](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Julius_Adams_Stratton&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729017830&usg=AOvVaw2P_gN9uX5Vqr4Wws5bMfW-)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Julius_Adams_Stratton&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729018110&usg=AOvVaw1GZyLP1llcGBRjuhuhqTwV) physicist [Albert G. Hill](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albert_G._Hill&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729018452&usg=AOvVaw39u2DhjnZWs7QK6Ut4KNtX), and chemical engineer [Walter G. Whitman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nae.edu/30667/Walter-G-Whitman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729018746&usg=AOvVaw1E-Ux_uAvEgWBhWl-Gfr7k)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nae.edu/30667/Walter-G-Whitman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729018911&usg=AOvVaw14msXuEiGHINNWvm_fv-yv) (Edward J. Ruppelt, “Are There Men on Mars? Or Other Worlds?” IUR 23, no. 1 (Spring 1998): 10–12, 31)

April — [Albert K. Bender](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albert_K._Bender&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729019237&usg=AOvVaw0cuF-k_MzD2JixJRBsjscq)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albert_K._Bender&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729019410&usg=AOvVaw0z2j4fN0KPPJmAWlOsTkZ5) a factory worker in Bridgeport, Connecticut, announces the formation of the International Flying Saucer Bureau. (Clark III 189, 623)

* * *

April 2 — On the eve of the release of the bombshell Life magazine article, [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729019796&usg=AOvVaw3MppLbdWOaXw-Nr_8t0tJ3) and his boss, ATIC Technical Analysis Division Chief Col. [Sanford H. Kirkland Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/48770905/sanford-h-kirkland&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729020054&usg=AOvVaw1XA-VjpD5IY0LzgLG29TnA)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/48770905/sanford-h-kirkland&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729020230&usg=AOvVaw1GYZRwL0JrMqR9ukxE5CcF) give an extraordinary briefing, technically unclassified but in fact quasi-classified, to a group of aerospace engineers and saucer buffs organized as Civilian Saucer Investigation of Los Angeles. These include aeronautical consultant [Felix W. A. Knoll](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.pknoll.net/knoll_aircraft/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729020432&usg=AOvVaw0Ng3qRGJBnMnpVXdITwRE7), technical writer [Ed J.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://obscurantist.com/oma/csi-la/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729020622&usg=AOvVaw1v1tiNKiOmyPkmPE7CmeKL) [Sullivan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://obscurantist.com/oma/csi-la/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729020800&usg=AOvVaw3gva-qTxGCWdSg7o7X3nXI), and North American Aviation project engineer [Walther A. Riedel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://anniejacobsen.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/02/op-16.jpg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729020999&usg=AOvVaw2e9yt0ucTEoc-NJHEK-7gB). The briefing takes place at the Mayfair Hotel in Los Angeles, California, along with national media reporters and the Life magazine reporters who give them advance copies of the Darrach/Ginna article in exchange. (“[Minutes of Meeting of Civilian Saucer](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/520402csi_minutes.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729021405&usg=AOvVaw2J-KOnATDC8GgDqJVIHm6A) [Investigations Held Wednesday, April 2, 1952, 8:00 PM in the Mayfair Hotel, Los Angeles, California,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/520402csi_minutes.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729021645&usg=AOvVaw0xu2WSxVQ7xreJUGfN5WXj)” April 2, 1952, transcribed by Sign Historical Group; Willard D. Nelson, “When Blue Book Met the Ufologists,” IUR 12, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1987): 21–24; Ruppelt, [p. 175](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/174/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729022005&usg=AOvVaw1p9Mk5374WCftEC3cm8zzx))

April 2 — 9:00 a.m. While on a fishing trip to Lake Mead, Nevada, with his wife and M/Sgt Lester Gossett, M/Sgt Sheldon Smith observes a large silver UFO at a high altitude. It looks like a B-36 without wings. Smith observes it right after a flight of F-86s overfly the area at about 15,000 feet. After watching the hovering object for about an hour at a much higher altitude than the vapor trails from the F-86s, it suddenly disappears. (NICAP, “[B-36](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520402lakemeade_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729022504&usg=AOvVaw3CnvnoALKydbgum0lYRpUc) [without Wings](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520402lakemeade_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729022826&usg=AOvVaw3ny6CqNB3KZ2E92ciztfk-)”)

April 3 — The Air Force publicly announces that it has not stopped investigating and evaluating UFO reports. ()

April 7 — [Henry B. Darrach Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brad_Darrach&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729023331&usg=AOvVaw2wYp3CqRMrU5BQqnfMIrij) and [Robert Ginna](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.encyclopedia.com/arts/educational-magazines/ginna-robert-emmett-jr-1927&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729023766&usg=AOvVaw2yF2mPo08_dWmlWU-F42cC)’s article, “Have We Visitors from Space?” appears in Life and reports on the revitalized USAF project. It comes close to advocating the ETH, and its primary sources are high-ranking Air Force officers. (H. B. Darrach Jr. and Robert Ginna, “[Have We Visitors from Space?](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/0%2520-%2520Articles/United%2520States/Life/1952%252004%252007_Life_Have%2520We%2520Visitors.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729024236&usg=AOvVaw3SFSg54lTS-iex8bfJaNIq)” Life, April 7, 1952, pp. 80–96; NICAP, “[Scholarly Commentary on LIFE Article of April 7, 1952](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/life52.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729024729&usg=AOvVaw20XUBGoO2iY_7VlfZzLMPL)”; Michael D. Swords, “1952: Ruppelt’s Big Year,” IUR 28, no. 4 (Winter 2003–2004): 8–9)

April 7 — During war games taking place in the vicinity of Lampasas, Texas, nicknamed Operation Longhorn, the Air Force announces that a new “aerial light” attached to a B-26 aircraft is in use that makes an “attacking bomber look like a ball of fire in the sky.” It is essentially a bright magnesium searchlight (dubbed a “Hell Roarer” flare) that can illuminate a battlefield for nighttime photography. USAF Public Information Officer Capt. Irving Rappaport implies it could be mistaken for a flying saucer. (“[Light Makes Bomber Resemble Ball of Fire,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94116656/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729025359&usg=AOvVaw1U3gkmIYklcEa4i7diFvNZ)” Chambersburg (Pa.) Public Opinion, April 7, 1952, p. 3; “[It’s No Saucer! Strange Objects in the Sky Are Nothing](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94117530/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729025811&usg=AOvVaw0mWYR1GJRgRaonMHAR7F1A) [New in Dayton,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/94117530/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729026138&usg=AOvVaw0grd1Do3mbIL3Ts8Slh3By)” Dayton (Ohio) Daily News, November 9, 1952, magazine supplement, p. 7; Curt Collins, “[UFOs: Confusing the Public,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2022/01/ufos-confusing-public.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729026652&usg=AOvVaw0DXeLa2Fu97scGMuS3pKby)” The Saucers That Time Forgot, January 27, 2022)

April 12 — 8:30 p.m. W/O E. H. Rossell and Flight Sgt. Reginald McRae are driving on RCAF Station North Bay, Ontario, when they see a bright amber disc arrive from the southwest, move across the airfield, stop, and then take off in the opposite direction at an angle of 30° at terrific speed. (NICAP, “[Amber Disc Stops, Reverses](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520412northbay_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729027157&usg=AOvVaw2oGXSICmxGaLiZRYfxcVjZ) [Direction](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520412northbay_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729027391&usg=AOvVaw28g_BVGJQftEIsXEEwNg0J)”; Yurko Bondarchuk, UFO Sightings, Landings, and Abductions, Methuen, 1979, pp. 92–94)

April 16 — ADC becomes frantic about a possible Soviet attack. Air Force Intelligence warns Brig. Gen. [Woodbury](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49223590/woodbury-m-burgess&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729027798&usg=AOvVaw3i88YQTha1rQEpnZhlx-uM) [Burgess](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49223590/woodbury-m-burgess&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729028075&usg=AOvVaw3bJ_pwVrSiTxfWeBVk9oXJ)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49223590/woodbury-m-burgess&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729028288&usg=AOvVaw0uREq8FaOZN05L-zmX_CmL) at ADC Headquarters, Ent AFB \[now the US Olympic Training Center\] in Colorado Springs, Colorado, that a classified source (possibly an electronic intercept) has provided an “indication” of ominous Soviet military activity. With the simultaneous appearance of two waves of unidentified targets, there is no alternative. At 3:10 a.m., ADC Commander Gen. [Frederic H. Smith Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frederic_H._Smith_Jr&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729028628&usg=AOvVaw2xngAjsqi7H9Lq-nxdzHyA) orders America’s first nationwide Air Defense Readiness alert. (NICAP, “[UFOs and Alert Scare, April 1952](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/ncp/nn-020628.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729028983&usg=AOvVaw1FwaYdWs_4wNIjVW4l2t6k)”; “[Radar Scare,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93333332/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729029313&usg=AOvVaw03RuhPc8NezqCz2S8hXize)” Miami (Fla.) Herald, April 19, 1952, p. 23; “[3](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93333141/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729029793&usg=AOvVaw3Jkf389pJOLyAa6qOgqMOr) [Plane Vapors Cause Alert at Alaska Stations,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93333141/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729030123&usg=AOvVaw0C3T-XMTn_XjTrYgCFurLk)” Long Beach (Calif.) Independent, April 18, 1952, p. 18)

April 17 — 12:58 a.m. Four high-altitude contrails heading east-southeast toward Alaska are seen by NORAD defense observers at Nunivak Island, Alaska. (NICAP, “[Another Radar-Inspired National Alert](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520417atlantic_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729030588&usg=AOvVaw3YKVOx3bB2y04IIcLzz9zq)”)

April 17 — 5:10 a.m. Radar at Caswell Air Force Station \[now closed\] in Limestone, Maine, tracks five unknown targets headed southwest into the US. Three are later identified as off-course civilian airliners, while two remain unidentified. A nationwide Air Defense Readiness Alert is declared at 5:11 a.m. SAC is notified to prepare launch of nuclear missiles. The alert is canceled at 7:40 a.m. (NICAP, “[Another Radar-Inspired National Alert](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520417atlantic_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729030948&usg=AOvVaw33OCxrZThuvSr1KZGBEMWg)”)

April 17 — 12:05 p.m. Air Force T/S Orville Lawson, [Rudy Toncer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/198096963/rudy-f_-toncer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729031290&usg=AOvVaw38fR0AlSGA3HNrAhsKr2TE) (sheet metal shop foreman), and sheet metal shop workers R. K. Van Houtin, Edward Gregory, and [Charles Ruliffson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/62143699/charles-f-ruliffson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729031689&usg=AOvVaw3T8JZwm1yMa-yV7KbE8xK5) at Nellis Air Force Base, near Las Vegas, see 18 circular objects flying an easterly course that carry them over or very close to the Nevada Test Site. They watch the objects for about 30 seconds. (“[Work Crew Spots Flying Saucers over A-Test Site,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93332628/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729031952&usg=AOvVaw00XTeBhKeuz3CBqbYpR73P)” Salt Lake Tribune, April 18, 1952, p. 1; NICAP, “[April 17, 1952: Nellis AFB, Nevada Large Group of Circular UFOs](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/nellis520417dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729032209&usg=AOvVaw29C3M8CJtd-AGrOQUznN9r)”; Nukes 83)

April 17 — [Dewey Fournet Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://robert-barrow.blogspot.com/2009/01/major-dewey-j-fournet-historical.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729032535&usg=AOvVaw1s7bbkl3BlqN8RaEAxyVRv) responds to a reporter from the Baltimore Sun who has asked about details of the Blue Book investigation with a two-and-a-half-page memo, vagued up a bit, but essentially saying that “nothing detrimental to our national security has materialized from these incidents.” (Swords 147)

* * *

April 18 — 12:07 p.m. Detachment 21 of the 618th Aircraft and Warning Squadron, Japan Air Self-Defense Force, picks up a radar target over the Korea Strait north of Kyushu Island, Japan, moving at 2,700 mph. (NICAP, “[Object](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520418kyushu_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729033275&usg=AOvVaw1gyvijkS5R4TyXBMMTM1J_) [Tracked at 2,700 MPH](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520418kyushu_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729033530&usg=AOvVaw3u58-mlZn93nFikFfXZyu-)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729033809&usg=AOvVaw3yCd17pISYAjD046h4acdP)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729034065&usg=AOvVaw2x-4ZDFTTIOSGqYK7C-dQz) p. 127)

April 19 — 9:20 p.m. USAF Brig. Gen. [Edwin M. Day](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/107267/brigadier-general-edwin-m-day/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729034573&usg=AOvVaw1Zr4zum2SafTJAPuMJFeqc) is reclining on a patio in Dhahran, Saudi Arabia, when he sees an object traveling parallel to the ground at a constant altitude (between 10,000 and 20,000 feet) and moving in his direction. Its speed is greater than a jet’s. It breaks into two parts at one point but maintains its constant course. He follows it visually for 5–6 seconds until it disappears to the north-northeast. (“When UFOs Were Serious Business: Then and Today,” IUR 28, no. 4 (Winter 2003–2004): 5–6)

April 20 — 9:15 p.m. Naval aviation student Edmund Kogut and his wife Shirley are at a drive-in movie theater in Flint, Michigan, when they see several groups of UFOs fly over. There are 2–9 objects in a group and about 20 groups, all flying in a straight line except for some changes in direction accomplished unlike any known aircraft. They are shaped like conventional aircraft but have an odd reddish glow surrounding them. (NICAP, \[[Flint, Michigan, case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/docs/520420flint_docs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729035348&usg=AOvVaw3q5HmGyr6M8PKhIpeIMkt8) [documents](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/docs/520420flint_docs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729035586&usg=AOvVaw1nhjzOKlNWLJGDb7PyNiBk)\]; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729035881&usg=AOvVaw2mOWNF3b0pdQvhTKL51xYX), p. 128)

April 22 — The Canadian Defence Research Board establishes a UFO study group that meets for the first time today. Project Second Storey, formed by [Omond M. Solandt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Omond_Solandt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729036178&usg=AOvVaw37joib-15IWER-hKyPjnd2)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Omond_Solandt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729036345&usg=AOvVaw3yxUfK0B6sgPIyOx-N5Omd) DRB chairman, meets at least five times. It is chaired by astrophysicist [Peter M. Millman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peter_Millman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729036547&usg=AOvVaw3NjMrQNqVq3Bz3RSqnrgcf) and includes [Wilbert B. Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Wilbert_B_Smith.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729036769&usg=AOvVaw2j2psjTbrGBxU7TJynpQjz) and representatives from Naval Intelligence, Military Operations and Planning, and the Defence Research Board. At its April 24 meeting, it decides to meet with the US government on UFO matters. (“[Project Second Storey Minutes, 1952.04.24](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://luforu.org/ottawa-ontario-canada-north-america/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729037004&usg=AOvVaw0XyoUIoAinQjOK8dymLmpC)”; Clark III 1078; Good Above, [p. 186](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/186/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729037203&usg=AOvVaw3FUOgiZ8N6WMd7ul9MLc3m); Chris Rutkowski and Geoff Dittman, The Canadian UFO Report, Dundurn Press, 2006, p. 225– 226)

April 23 — 9:30 a.m. R. C. Munroe, engineering standards section head for Raytheon Manufacturing Company, notices an object near an AT-6 Texan trainer aircraft above Lexington, Massachusetts. He estimates its altitude at 40,000 feet. It decelerates abruptly and goes into a flat turn. He writes, “It is inconceivable to me that any human being could have withstood the deceleration or acceleration displayed by this aircraft.” (UFOEv, [p. 57](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D69%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729037581&usg=AOvVaw1uq64RKXlskQ7gRo43_f2K))

April 23 — 10:45 a.m. Engineers [Carl Hawk](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/34712578/carl-newton-hawk&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729037855&usg=AOvVaw1cb3fNjH3LVrTQuEETUT7T) and [Marvin Harvey](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/77517774/marvin-l-harvey&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729038081&usg=AOvVaw22ecShFoae-Ix9H9D_1vGX) are at Sandia Base, Albuquerque, New Mexico, when they look up to watch a jet fighter as it shoots to the north above the Sandia Mountains. They also notice a soundless, flat, rectangular, wing-like object streaking through the sky from east to west above Tijeras Canyon. The object is completely black except for a distinct, bright yellow “V” on its bottom. Two slight points extend from its rear corners. Hawk estimates that it is passing overhead at 2,000 feet altitude at 200–400 mph and is roughly 60 feet wide by 20 feet long. They watch it for 10 seconds until it disappears in a cloud above downtown Albuquerque. (“[What Soared Against Duke City Sky That Day in April, 1952?](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93334249/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729038413&usg=AOvVaw3P9O2iOvFsZLpDZcIMk51x)”Albuquerque (N.Mex.) Tribune, November 21, 1957, p. 8)

April 24 — An Air Force Intelligence memorandum to Col. [Frank Dunn](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Dunn.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729038866&usg=AOvVaw3juyw0k8RpUNUD_cNB65Os), chief of ATIC, transmits nine reports (not released) of unidentified submarine objects reported to the Office of Naval Intelligence. (Good Need, [pp. 141](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/140/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729039084&usg=AOvVaw1EDSu6z8PFTaSEJL-oWP8Z), [145](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/144/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729039282&usg=AOvVaw3vYCODo5ZaRELNq8qpfx_u))

April 25 — 11:00 a.m. A biochemist and a bacteriologist are driving to their office in San Jose, California, when they see a metallic-looking disc rotating around a vertical axis and wobbling. It is moving slowly over the office and is about 4–5 feet in diameter. It flies in a slow arc. Then they see a black object hovering at a high altitude under an overcast. This one is about 100 feet in diameter. Two identical objects come into view out of the clouds. The three objects “jittered about like boats in a stream.” Then the small disc stops spinning, hovers, then shoots upwards, followed by one of the black objects. The remaining two objects linger another minute or so, then take off separately. The episode lasts 15 minutes. The biochemist calls Moffett Field in Santa Clara County, but hangs up before reporting the sighting, which they describe as a “most disturbing experience.” The object “utilized some propulsion method not in the physics books.” (NICAP, “[Scientist Sighting / Extraordinary Propulsion Implied](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520425sanjose_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729039627&usg=AOvVaw1wkfOmY09bQshXVgNlB2T9)”; Richard H. Hall, Uninvited Guests, Aurora, 1988, pp. 241–242)

April 25 — Battelle releases its first status report on Project Stork, noting that it has selected a panel of consultants, initiated a news clipping service, and devised a coding scheme for UFO reports. (“[Seven Status Reports for](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cufon.org/cufon/stork1-7.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729040045&usg=AOvVaw0Nudyc50ZBIl9M5HBJ4LsW) [Project Stork,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cufon.org/cufon/stork1-7.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729040237&usg=AOvVaw15aa4vsPtti-cqJXLPieWQ)” CUFON)

April 29 — Secretary of the Air Force [Thomas K. Finletter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_K._Finletter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729040547&usg=AOvVaw0DPI6POGlkFLV_gEn4nQIi) issues Air Force Letter 200-5, which directs intelligence officers at every base to report UFOs immediately to ATIC and all major USAF commands. It enables Project Blue Book staff to communicate directly with any Air Force base without going through the normal chain of command, and provides for wire transmission of reports to ATIC, followed with details via air mail. AFL 200-5 is modified by AFR 200-2 in 1953. (Department of the Air Force, “[Unidentified Flying Objects Reporting,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Documents/AFL_200-5.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729040830&usg=AOvVaw0ccUCQc0-FsVNxapOgNPsl)” Air Force Letter 200-5, April 29, 1952; Ruppelt, [pp. 132–133](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/132/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729041050&usg=AOvVaw26zCTmFXa7xGjTjskUad2d))

April 29 — An Air Force memorandum written to justify a trip by Lt. Col. E. Sterling and [Stefan Possony](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stefan_Thomas_Possony&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729041346&usg=AOvVaw2mcEGpx2sErqlJyl_5lSab) to Europe mentions that their work for USAF Intelligence’s “Special Study Group” is to evaluate Soviet advanced aerial

* * *

delivery systems, as well as to shed “some much needed light” on the “vexing ‘flying saucer’ problem.” It adds that the “Air Force cannot assume that flying saucers are of non-terrestrial origin, and hence, they could be Soviet.” (Michael D. Swords, “1952: Ruppelt’s Big Year,” IUR 28, no. 4 (Winter 2003–2004): 10; Swords 151)

April 30 — Project Blue Book issues its Status Report #6. (US Air Force, [Projects Grudge and Blue Book Reports 1–12,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.slideshare.net/alexpituba/projects-grudge-and-bluebook-reports-1-12-nicap&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729041915&usg=AOvVaw0Y5FPfozTrheDzCWpaULuh)

NICAP, 1968, pp. 95–112)

April 30 — 6:00 p.m. Six members of the 3rd Platoon, Heavy Mortar Company, 180th Infantry Regiment at the front lines around Panmunjeom, Korea, see two silvery wingless objects, one behind the other, flying in a valley in a southeasterly direction. Pfc H. B. Webb thinks they are flying at 900–1,000 mph. Some slower northbound F-86 Sabre jets pass above them. They make a rumbling sound. (Haines, Korea, [p. 63](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/aadkw/aadkw_ch4.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729042303&usg=AOvVaw0cQsPchm_aCdppTdnX7Ys7))

May — Army radar specialist Jay Nogle is stationed near Washington, D.C., when he picks up an unknown target on his M33 scope at an altitude of 18,000 feet about 130 miles from the capital (which would put it over eastern Pennsylvania). Two other Army units also detect the object, which remains stationary for 30 minutes before moving. By the time the object reaches the edge of the radar scope, it is traveling at 1,000 mph. The report goes all the way to the Pentagon, where orders are given to fire on it if it returns. Nogle says that radar targets are frequently seen in May or June, and units have their antiaircraft guns loaded after the first incident. When fighters are scrambled from McGuire AFB \[now part of Joint Base McGuire-Dix-Lakehurst\] in Burlington County, New Jersey, the targets move speedily out of range. (Swords 153)

Early May — 10:00 p.m. A senior CIA official is having a lawn party at his home near Alexandria, Virginia, for some VIPs. He and two others notice a light approaching silently from the west. It stops then climbs almost vertically, stops again, then levels out. Then it goes into a nearly vertical dive, levels out, and streaks off to the east. (Ruppelt, [pp. 135–136](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/134/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729042747&usg=AOvVaw32mQuwUEI20V2NhN_iVTgv); Swords 148)

Early May — A meeting is held in the Pentagon office of [Stefan Possony](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stefan_Thomas_Possony&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729043009&usg=AOvVaw2m-56nMQ9DN2azARAduZXO), acting chief of the Directorate of Intelligence Study Group under Maj. Gen. [John A. Samford](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_A._Samford&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729043220&usg=AOvVaw3YYJdFqYKn6w6_q4dWMnPO) to hear Harvard University astronomer [Donald Menzel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Howard_Menzel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729043444&usg=AOvVaw2oD0Fch4imCq0EbEEXY0mP) express his views. Present are Possony, Capt. [Edward J. Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729043682&usg=AOvVaw3FohQ55LYbvdH2Qjxf5ERh), ATIC chief Col. [Frank Dunn](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Dunn.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729043889&usg=AOvVaw2td_XDjn-HD-bvQNAAYkaM)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Dunn.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729044045&usg=AOvVaw096zlfeIAjKxQAqlOd3HjO) Brig. Gen. [William M.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/107003/brigadier-general-william-m-garland/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729044278&usg=AOvVaw3kcxMzzr5bQyoK_pig5hOq) [Garland](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/107003/brigadier-general-william-m-garland/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729044501&usg=AOvVaw0k47s6vlycnkh_nOoF5MEe)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/107003/brigadier-general-william-m-garland/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729044699&usg=AOvVaw04iU8X-iaoQ1XaE4X5GF1O) Possony’s assistant [Leslie Rosenzweig](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Rosenzweig_L.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729044906&usg=AOvVaw2ffvTywx5E82sFPtwbAhWJ)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Rosenzweig_L.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729045067&usg=AOvVaw14WxDdWsaA4HLCDw2z-ILp) and one other officer. Menzel announces that he has solved all UFO reports and claims to have helped out in the development of the cameras in Project Twinkle. His attitude irks everyone in the meeting. When he asks the Air Force to support his views in upcoming publications in Time and Look, Gen. Garland gets angry. Col. Dunn says that Blue Book would have put some money into more formal versions of his experiments, but he can only offer a statement that Menzel has told them of his theory. Now Menzel gets agitated, saying it is no theory. He refuses to leave them a copy of his book to pass on to [Joseph](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Kaplan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729045396&usg=AOvVaw3njJNEcQFWRiphBiN-Ud1L) [Kaplan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Kaplan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729045596&usg=AOvVaw2P3NhG1G-CeBSFT6ACGTfa) and [J. Allen Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729045809&usg=AOvVaw1b8Drr5okrm-q3M-Z8RAbx)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729045971&usg=AOvVaw1wBSPdlE5JQgEy5DIrNN7s) In the evening, Possony speaks with astronomer Francis J. Heyden at Georgetown University, who tells him that Menzel’s work is based on no more than a “couple of meaningless high school physics experiments.” (Clark III 743; Michael D. Swords, “Strange Days, Part 2,” IUR 32, no. 2 (December 2008): 9; Swords 152)

May 1 — 9:10 a.m. Air intelligence officer Maj. [Rudolph Pestalozzi](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/31478705/rudolph_pestalozzi_obituary/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729046323&usg=AOvVaw21Ijy3zpS0g6mB69Biy_SG) and an airman standing outside the Davis-Monthan AFB base hospital, Tucson, Arizona, watch two shiny, round objects overtake a B-36 flying above. The objects slow down to match the plane’s speed and remain in formation with them for 20 seconds. Then they make a sharp, no-radius turn away from the B-36, moving away a bit. Then one of the objects stops and hovers. Both are silent, and the crew estimates they have a diameter of 20–25 feet and a thickness of 10–12 feet.
