(NICAP, “[The](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520501davismonthan_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729046600&usg=AOvVaw3SRf9_rDb7JRdeovfM-Bmu) [Case of the Missing Report](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520501davismonthan_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729046792&usg=AOvVaw0hy4wsysycbkriQxJRP-FE)”; Hynek UFO Report, [pp. 109–112](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/108/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729047019&usg=AOvVaw00QWXxJ1nTXoIN5bFPeJ5O)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/108/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729047186&usg=AOvVaw2wGIrorRHFV8w3xzmQNJrU) [292–294](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/292/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729047381&usg=AOvVaw2fKXxUlnJpH67atQNHCne-); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729047579&usg=AOvVaw22Dyp9NLxNH7PIQ9D7GqUO)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729047731&usg=AOvVaw3Zr2AkFMiD4nFVios4n9h4) p. 131; Good Need, [pp. 166–](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/166/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729047925&usg=AOvVaw3W0iCucQGyw2Om8dh_v9C1) [167](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/166/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729048132&usg=AOvVaw3kuv9RVFvqEgj3sYu-PVmT))

May 1 — 10:50 a.m. At George AFB \[now Southern California Logistics Airport\] near Victorville, California, five independent witnesses in the base control tower see a group of five white discs moving in formation for about 30 seconds. The objects appear very maneuverable, seem to almost collide, then break away in a right-angle turn.

They are traveling an estimated 900–1,200 mph and are 1,000–1,200 feet in diameter. Four miles away at Apple Valley, California, the base’s wing director of personnel, playing on a golf course, sees one of the UFOs at the same time. (NICAP, “[George AFB / Apple Valley, CA Radar Case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520501george_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729048482&usg=AOvVaw09q817BvksMJsPw4ui7HKV)”; Hynek UFO Report, [pp. 107–109](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/106/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729048719&usg=AOvVaw24VKbWZ0pr5doldDc14-Yj); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729048948&usg=AOvVaw1UY-PawuAGpCjhYinuPiA9)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729049106&usg=AOvVaw2iA8xwGhlefZ1bcP5lxzBl) p. 131; Swords 147–148; Good Need, [p. 166](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/166/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729049307&usg=AOvVaw2bsGuWER0eYQ_vHqZzuuQB); Michael D. Swords, “Intelligent Motions,” IUR 33, no. 1 (March 2010): 10, 15)

May 1 — 1:45 p.m. Albuquerque Journal composing room employee Eugene Cline sees four silvery objects seemingly playing tag with a formation of 12 Air Force bombers—either B-29s or B-50s—flying west over Albuquerque, New Mexico. The round objects are keeping up with the planes at the same altitude, moving in a “tumbling or pitching manner.” One object shoots straight up and takes off in a southerly direction. About the same time, workmen (one of them Howard Burgess) erecting an antenna at nearby Sandia Base watch three UFOs pass directly overhead. One comes from the west and moves south; another comes from the north and moves south;

* * *

and a third, tan-colored rather than silver like the others, passes low overhead and looks like a “cylinder tumbling end over end.” Burgess and the others are debriefed and sworn to secrecy about what they have witnessed. (“[Flying Saucers Play Tag with Bombers over City,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/5965299/albuquerque-journal/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729049862&usg=AOvVaw1iSezVX96m4HVeb6moSAg1)” Albuquerque (N.Mex.) Journal, May 2, 1952, p. 2; Nukes 56–58)

May 7 — 12:22 a.m. Mrs. Hanley Marks sees a light-green, ball-shaped object fall from the sky into the Sandia Mountains, New Mexico, from her home in the Bel-Air neighborhood of Albuquerque. (“[Fireball Falls near](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93334929/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729050181&usg=AOvVaw31MIC1K89qxhAdjj5W0cpe) [Sandias Early Today,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93334929/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729050377&usg=AOvVaw0ZOxOMJYiiQ21N9KBkYMgw)” Albuquerque Journal, May 7, 1952, p. 1; “[Green Fireball Falls in Southwest, Three Here](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93334874/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729050637&usg=AOvVaw2v9wbfqkczur5WFEOPgAuq) [Report,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93334874/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729050825&usg=AOvVaw1Mk5tNvETaEaeFwj-ywXYs)” Albuquerque Journal, May 7, 1952, p. 9)

May 7 — 12:15 p.m. A Captain Morris and three enlisted men at Keesler AFB, Biloxi, Mississippi, see one or two aluminum or silver cylindrical objects darting in and out of the clouds 10 times. (\[[Blue Book case report](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/520507keesler_doc2.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729051162&usg=AOvVaw3-IK7oH6UG6fv5mfmsCkd8)\]”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729051351&usg=AOvVaw2d7LFo2XJfuelmPhnWisVu)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729051502&usg=AOvVaw3_CiVDt4RB1R84l-4M7j2o) p. 131)

May 7 — 4:30 p.m. Magazine writer Ed Keffel, in the company of João Martins, takes five photographs of a UFO over Barra da Tijuca, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. In the first, the UFO resembles an airplane coming directly toward them over a large group of trees. The second shows the object as disc-shaped. The third photo is taken as the object tilts slightly, showing both the top with a slight dome and the now obvious disc shape. More trees, including a very tall palm, can be seen in the photograph. The fourth picture, taken as the object tilts the other way, shows a raised ring on the bottom. The final picture is taken as the object is nearly vertical, seen over part of the ocean and some distant hills. The UFO disappears shortly afterward. NICAP does not see any negatives and is skeptical. The Colorado project finds a “glaring internal inconsistency” in the illumination and dismisses the photos as hoaxes. Today, the best evidence seems to suggest the case is a hoax, perpetrated by two magazine writers who wanted an interesting story. (NICAP, “[Barra da Tijuca Photos](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520507barra_da_tijuca_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729051854&usg=AOvVaw1Ddjtp32NwZmNvUHh7UKK7)”; Olavo T. Fontes, “[The Barra da Tijuca Disc,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201961%252010%252000%2520-%2520October_Special_report_on_Barra_da_Tijuca.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729052125&usg=AOvVaw0LQlRTmSiCgxlwad0Ym5Tw)” APRO Special Report no. 1 (October 1961): 1–6; Condon, [pp. 83,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/82/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729052408&usg=AOvVaw21nYhkph0dswHQf05r0PIF) [415–418](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/414/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729052629&usg=AOvVaw0df3_sKnzr3ZXNZJHDcZFY); Swords 460–461; Cláudio Tsuyoshi Suenaga, “Os 90 Anos do O Cruzeiro, a Revista que Inaugurou a Era Moderna dos Discos Voadores no Brasil,” October 11, 2018)

May 8 — 2:27 a.m. Pan American Airways pilot Clayton C. Gallagher and his copilot, flying a Lockheed Constellation aircraft at 8,000 feet en route from San Juan, Puerto Rico, to New York, see a light, 10 times the size of an airplane landing light, approach them over the Atlantic Ocean east of South Carolina. It streaks past their left wing about a quarter mile away, followed by two smaller orange balls of fire. Probable meteor. (NICAP, “[Three](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520508atlantic_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729053113&usg=AOvVaw1ce7aFq6_8pBdrQkazGGt2) [UAO Sighted by Constellation Crew](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520508atlantic_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729053314&usg=AOvVaw316ZXhg1QK0njm_wUo16W6)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729053497&usg=AOvVaw0FZqBEHzKd1sA9a-s95VF4)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729053656&usg=AOvVaw0vyl404mNlRvGNLXqRCDmm) p. 131)

May 8 — Air Force Secretary [Thomas Finletter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_K._Finletter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729053916&usg=AOvVaw2hBDECZUkOiKZ4LKpMcIN-) and his staff (including his special assistant, covert CIA agent [Joseph](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.encyclopediavirginia.org/Bryan_Joseph_III_1904-1993&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729054160&usg=AOvVaw0Erd-vP955o1m4x8kmBKkK) [Bryan III](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.encyclopediavirginia.org/Bryan_Joseph_III_1904-1993&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729054374&usg=AOvVaw1cL0R5jKkV-aWp_3RDoizS)) receive a secret one-hour briefing on UFOs from [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729054574&usg=AOvVaw0UO-Yc-0MF0irPDTdssBU5) and Lt. Col. R. J. Taylor that covers USAF investigations over the previous five years. Finletter asks questions about some specific sightings. (Ruppelt, [p.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/138/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729054812&usg=AOvVaw17YETQU9d7E5-D6k-L_ZAZ) [138](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/138/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729055023&usg=AOvVaw3AfUkWRZBdDIvJKXrdv9nZ))

May 10 — 3:00 p.m. USAF Lt. Col. Maurice G. Bechtel and his wife are in the yard of their home in Albuquerque, New Mexico, when they see two silvery disc-shaped objects flying straight and level, one after the other, moving southwest to northeast at above 20,000 feet. The first object seems to waver on its axis, the second object follows a similar path but at a higher altitude. The first object is the size of a B-36 at high altitude. Bechtel alerts the radar station but it is unable to track the objects. (NICAP, “[Two Discs Observed by Lt. Colonel and Wife](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520510albuq_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729055305&usg=AOvVaw0ynQgAF2JVCteUF72wvmrC)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729055491&usg=AOvVaw1UcLYYnbgraUluBb0P8trS), p. 132)

May 10 — 8:30 p.m. A British scientist and others at Paphos, Cyprus, see a luminous circular object rise from the sea and waver back and forth before fading from sight directly overhead. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729055771&usg=AOvVaw3PPayq6zuUwGBdrSKxdUsY), p. 132; Good Above, [p. 540](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/540/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729055968&usg=AOvVaw0sQbTYw50bQrLA4Re4vbED))

May 10 — 10:45 p.m. Four employees of DuPont Corporation at the AEC’s Savannah River Laboratory near Jackson, South Carolina, see four disc-shaped objects approach, then two other discs pass high overhead from different directions. They are a luminous yellow-gold color and move at a high rate of speed. One of the discs approaches at such a low altitude that it must ascend to pass over some tall tanks at the facility. One witness says that the objects are weaving from left to right while continuing on a steady course. The case is investigated by the FBI and passed on to the Pentagon and the Atomic Energy Commission. (NICAP, “[Objects Sighted near Vital](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520510savannah_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729056295&usg=AOvVaw0EYPbOIeYov32BmTm7VZP6) [Installation](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520510savannah_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729056487&usg=AOvVaw2_J7MdVThtF_0J3qhlGHqU)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729056678&usg=AOvVaw1Jk9eJ0qCNn_8Aer1yn8i6)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729056844&usg=AOvVaw1J37-3gAaB_YQJ0jnmv56D) p. 132; Nukes 84)

May 12 — 8:45 p.m. A UFO is seen by Walker AFB T/Sgt. Raymond Bare in a car in downtown Roswell, New Mexico. The object is blue-green in color, and its estimated altitude above the terrain is 20,000–30,000 feet. It appears to be about 40–50 miles distant over some low mountains east of Ruidosa. The object travels three times over approximately the same south-to-north / east-to-west, swaying, triangular course. Rate of speed cannot be precisely estimated but is faster than that of jet aircraft. Intensity of color brightness varies with the object’s altitude. The Air Force explains it as the planet Venus, but Venus is on the other side of the earth at the time. (NICAP, “[High-Speed Object Maneuvers over Mountains](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520512roswell_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729057143&usg=AOvVaw3euRJarikuiIw7M1EOnvq4)”; Clark III 390–391; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729057344&usg=AOvVaw2go-casPjBa4hZX0gP80m-)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729057496&usg=AOvVaw3Tyi27tShYMinogEeYsOqu) p. 132)

* * *

May 13 — 8:55 p.m. Aeronautical engineer Donald R. Carr sees a meteor-like object descend over National City, California, flying a curving path to the northwest. At 9:25 p.m., Carr watches a similar object, seemingly returning from the north. (UFOEv, [p. 4](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D16%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729057862&usg=AOvVaw1_NW-c_Rd5kPlZDCRvOiS6))

May 13 — 10:33 p.m. James Richardson and three other amateur astronomers (among them [Cyril Thomas Wyche](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/142432399/cyril-thomas-wyche&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729058143&usg=AOvVaw3aUgvin52hsgPNxuhCXkDw) and [Harry B. Mooney](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/23310388/harry-balch-mooney&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729058391&usg=AOvVaw0BXrOYFI0l_Oa5Q48s8Gek)), set up telescopes at Furman University in Greenville, South Carolina, when they see a diamond formation of 4 oval, reddish-yellow or reddish-brown luminous objects nearly overhead. They disappear after 3 seconds moving through a 12° arc. The apparent size is a half dollar at arms length. They wobble in flight. (NICAP, “[Diamond Formation of 4 Objects Observed by Astronomers](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520513greenville_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729058618&usg=AOvVaw1L81ahggdeHVA7N-u3lupd)”; Willy Smith, “Blue Book Pearls: Greenville, S.C.,” IUR 20, no. 3 (May/June 1995): 8–9, 24; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729058865&usg=AOvVaw0tpTUTvo6XfP07ebq8adQ7)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729059027&usg=AOvVaw01mmsTKaoZarILy4nVjwgT) p. 133; Michael D. Swords, “Intelligent

Motions,” IUR 33, no. 1 (March 2010): 10, 15)

May 15 — USAF Intelligence Special Study Group Chief Lieut. Col. E. Sterling and [Stefan Possony](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stefan_Thomas_Possony&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729059442&usg=AOvVaw3Y7NtmWEklLsiCM0cvJRZM) begin a five-week temporary duty trip to Europe to study Soviet missiles and aircraft. As a side project they study “flying saucers” that might be of Soviet origin. No documents have yet been found on this trip’s results. (Swords 151)

May 15 — 6:35 p.m. The pilot of an F-51 assigned to the 18th Fighter Bomber Group flying at 9,000 feet over North Korea encounters a silver object estimated to be 50 feet in diameter. It appears ahead of him to the right and begins climbing at 1,000 mph to the east, pauses, then descends into some haze. (Haines, Korea, [pp. 39–40](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/aadkw/aadkw_ch3.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729059814&usg=AOvVaw3XSpW_gHlqlX1DGAxOQpiT))

May 15 — 8:00 p.m. Two F-86E pilots of the 61st Fighter-Interceptor Wing are on a mission in North Korea when they see a silvery disc larger than a MiG aircraft 20 miles away and below them at 8,000–10,000 feet. Seen for only 3– 5 seconds, the object is traveling at 1,200–1,500 mph in a rolling maneuver. (Haines, Korea, [p. 39](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/aadkw/aadkw_ch3.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729060152&usg=AOvVaw2FObdIAGJ9Ac1ZHE6RG4FZ))

Late May — 1:00–3:00 a.m. Royal Canadian Navy Commander George R. McFarlane is officer of the watch on the Canadian warship [HMCS](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMCS_Iroquois_(G89)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729060419&usg=AOvVaw2PNjZyk6ezxkXddhqG0MoQ) [Iroquois](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMCS_Iroquois_(G89)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729060587&usg=AOvVaw1m0csDPTn_doWYqShyv_Zv) in the Pacific Ocean between Hawaii and Guam en route to Korea. He sees many different lights, some single, others in formations of 3, 5, or 6, appearing and disappearing instantly.

Suddenly one of the objects appears off the port bow at close range and low elevation. McFarlane and the signalman on watch see that the light is attached to a disc-shaped object with two dozen black windows running along its side. It hovers nearby for at least 15 minutes. (Good Need, [pp. 142–143](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/142/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729060901&usg=AOvVaw1Djg_HrcxygEVLGn10Bhjy))

May 23 — After 11:00 p.m. Lockheed worker [Orfeo Angelucci](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orfeo_Angelucci&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729061153&usg=AOvVaw1GWE3o4VTnbnlJi4xdzvHw) is driving home on Victory Boulevard from his job in Burbank, California, when he senses a force and sees a red, glowing UFO. After a while he begins to follow it, and after he crosses the Los Angeles River and turns onto Forest Lawn Drive, he gets to within 30 feet of it when it hovers. Just before it streaks away, two smaller green globes, 3 feet in diameter, shoot out of it and approach him. He hears a voice saying, “Don’t be afraid, Orfeo, we are friends.” This begins his contact with benevolent beings from other planets. (Orfeo Angelucci, The Secret of the Saucers, Amherst Press, 1955, [pp. 1–15](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/secretofsaucers00ange/page/n25/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729061524&usg=AOvVaw3nSqAsRnDTTK3awhPkyZ0f); Bryant and Helen Reeve, Flying Saucer Pilgrimage, Amherst Press, 1957, [pp. 222–232](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-156/page/n223/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729061793&usg=AOvVaw1cqSfY2q1H4M_70VrDMDlP); Clark III 127–129)

May 25 — 9:27 a.m. An Air Force captain in charge of the navigation section of Combat Crew Training School at Randolph AFB near San Antonio, Texas, his wife, and another pilot see a group of about 12 orange-white, tear- drop shaped lights in 3 groups of 4 moving from west to east at 2,000 mph and 10,000 feet altitude. They hear deep, soft intermittent noise. (Ruppelt, [p. 140](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/140/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729062129&usg=AOvVaw1586pjZlfqLWyMAJOJILBy); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729062329&usg=AOvVaw3YGYxGRr3uYziAp3BXwzWP), p. 134)

May 26 — 3:20 a.m. Ground radar alerts the crew of an F-94 Starfire interceptor jet over North Korea that an unidentified target is on its tail. The jet turns, locks onto the object with onboard radar at 21,000 feet and begins to close. Both the pilot and radar operator see a brilliant white light straight ahead. The UFO performs a steady climbing turn and accelerates away at a tremendous speed. The jet loses the object at a distance of 7,800 feet after 15 seconds of contact. (Haines, Korea, [pp. 40–44](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/aadkw/aadkw_ch3.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729062702&usg=AOvVaw3yNj7i8sMGb9iJevO-ZnKU))

May 28 — 1:45 p.m. Albuquerque, New Mexico, fire department employees Martin Romero and Don Atteberry see two circular objects, one shiny silver and the other orange or light brown, performing fast maneuvers on three different occasions over the course of an hour above the northeast part of the city. (NICAP, \[[Blue Book case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/MAXW-PBB10-931-933.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729062975&usg=AOvVaw0MbMewom7hizl42lF6JPYx) [documents](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/MAXW-PBB10-931-933.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729063167&usg=AOvVaw0Mve7rhBuX8Caly8D3npkM)\]; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729063348&usg=AOvVaw1g-pBDUf12Keai7RDIzfxZ), p. 135)

May 28 — 8:30–8:40 p.m. A green fireball about one-third the size of the full moon is seen in Albuquerque, New Mexico, from eight ground points and five aircraft. [Lincoln LaPaz](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lincoln_LaPaz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729063611&usg=AOvVaw390jcdCG5BxgqqPQ7HGTxo) pinpoints the fall near Santa Fe. Around the same time, the crew of a Flying Tiger Line C-46 near Otto, New Mexico, sees a green fireball rise up and drop steeply down. (“[2 Green Fireballs Seen by Many, LaPaz Reports,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93336128/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729063862&usg=AOvVaw03gExQjxCprz7Addp-Fr8U)” Albuquerque Journal, May 29, 1952, p. 2)

May 28–29 — During a night refueling mission at 8:10 p.m., the crews of five USAF B-29 bombers see green spherical objects. The primary sighting takes place near Albuquerque, New Mexico, and involves three B-29s flying at 15,000 feet. Another sighting takes place around 11:30 p.m. about 10 miles southwest of Tulsa, Oklahoma. That crew is flying at 25,000 feet. Three hours later the final sighting takes place near Enid, Oklahoma, also with a B- 29 at 25,000 feet. The aircrews making these reports do not think the objects are meteorites. (NICAP, “[Five B-29](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520528albuq_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729064207&usg=AOvVaw1MF0hERow-Sw0GdK8FtfpN) [Bomber Crews Observe Green Objects](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520528albuq_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729064393&usg=AOvVaw05bl-YbTrJN6BGjERnP6Iz)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729064591&usg=AOvVaw1oO86XIZI7sKe0en2tvOwU), p. 135)

* * *

May 30 — USAF Maj. [William D. Leet](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/139829263/william-dean-leet&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729064910&usg=AOvVaw0bCQRR0puKPWsnRi9sKVKA)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/139829263/william-dean-leet&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729065081&usg=AOvVaw3u_YFMdnn7RWbTwqqx0M2z) copilot on a C-54 transport mission at 8,500 feet near Oshima, Japan, sees a dark object hovering in clouds for 7 minutes. It disappears, speeding away in seconds. (NICAP, “[C-54 Crew](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520530nearjapan_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729065281&usg=AOvVaw0oZuX4zMzkbECnk39ePcOO) [Encounters Round Black Object](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520530nearjapan_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729065466&usg=AOvVaw2_RD8jSsaWGHmtE47zRU7s)”; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1952](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Jan-May-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729065692&usg=AOvVaw1oyTDf3abCtUxcxsYhRHHt) [January–May, Supplemental Notes,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Jan-May-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729065897&usg=AOvVaw1owWmVXwS0BhJCJKmAedRf) The Author, 2000, pp. 82–83; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729066141&usg=AOvVaw01SH9KzzkEetln1vQi2jVQ)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729066293&usg=AOvVaw2wYQwh7Gn89qdCH32X9oOB) p. 136)

May 31 — About 4:00 a.m. Over Cheorwon, South Korea, several US soldiers see a bright UFO that looks like a falling star, except that it stops falling and begins to climb again. It then moves northeast at 150 mph, reverses course twice, then climbs at a 45° angle and fades from sight. One guard hears a pulsating sound. An F-94 attempts to intercept the brilliant white object, which takes clearly evasive maneuvers and pulls away at 30,000 feet. (NICAP, “[Jerky Object Observed and Tracked on Radar](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520531chorwon_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729066576&usg=AOvVaw3TSSa0NJybCIRTusRZFys0)”; Hynek UFO Report, [pp. 87–90](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/86/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729066810&usg=AOvVaw0NFaFtvRdFMr7nGbLVP5EN) ; Haines, Korea, [pp. 63–64](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/aadkw/aadkw_ch4.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729067052&usg=AOvVaw34YA2lKrP3xLIf3GgfbkK9); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729067232&usg=AOvVaw3CO1hfF_obLzWd1JYyeS77)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729067392&usg=AOvVaw0DJ_7Ndo8rK-U_rXBUnfs2) p. 136; Patrick Gross, “[UFO US Military Reports, Korea, 1952](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/korea31may52.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729067594&usg=AOvVaw1snKCR9e363f0n9GCgbB9H)”)

May 31 — Project Blue Book issues its Status Report #7. (US Air Force, [Projects Grudge and Blue Book Reports 1–12,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.slideshare.net/alexpituba/projects-grudge-and-bluebook-reports-1-12-nicap&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729067918&usg=AOvVaw3Cp33HgCXqPvhYHLl46zqV)

NICAP, 1968, pp. 113–130)

May 31 — 9:30 p.m. Mr. R. Baits is on the beach at Derna, Libya, with three companions when he notices a soft orange- yellow light traveling soundlessly toward them from inland at great speed and in a straight line. Suddenly, as it reaches a point overhead, it swerves to the east over the town, gaining height. After a few seconds it moves to the south and begins zigzagging until it fades away into the background of stars. (Newcastle (UK) Evening Standard, June 13, 1952; Jan Aldrich)

June — [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729068475&usg=AOvVaw0QWTAn6DhkKG4qgFERfhms) has four officers, two airmen, and two civilians on his permanent Blue Book staff (including Lt. [Anderson G. Flues](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Flues.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729068707&usg=AOvVaw3CAXA2UNd2o5sWmjaj7y-N)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/bios/WHO-WAS/Flues.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729068863&usg=AOvVaw0eXnIuT3OQmCSlc1Li41f0) Robert M. Olsson, and Kerry Rothstien), as well as a number of scientific consultants, including [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729069062&usg=AOvVaw1hqWv3h9ZNKJ6AbeaFJy96). In the Pentagon, Maj. [Dewey](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8653239/dewey-j_-fournet&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729069266&usg=AOvVaw1v0YJ8FspMZLnR6X1tJKG9) [Fournet Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://robert-barrow.blogspot.com/2009/01/major-dewey-j-fournet-historical.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729069479&usg=AOvVaw3xPxdAwuqIYk_gp8SqR_cZ) is a full-time Blue Book liaison. (Ruppelt, [p. 140](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/140/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729069738&usg=AOvVaw1T8nEaBXTS441ivyxFNnzF))

June — In the wake of mass public and governmental interest in UFOs kindled by the provocative Life magazine article, CIA intelligence experts [Sidney N. Graybeal](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/local/1998/03/22/arms-control-negotiator-sidney-graybeal-dies-at-73/8f3e8cdf-fef7-41b4-b2a8-e6f11f481dc2/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729070146&usg=AOvVaw0BwYa621-yyzzaUjX8HXSI) (Chief, Guided Missiles Branch, Weapons and Equipment Division, Office of Scientific Intelligence) and [Irl D’Arcy Brent](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/62821794/irl-d_arcy-brent&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729070394&usg=AOvVaw3lQYBRIDSKk6_7ln8VSnyC) (Chief, Ground Branch, W&E Division, OSI) prepare a summary of the UFO subject for the CIA/OSI hierarchy based on the past several years of OSI intelligence (and OSI predecessor documents going back to ghost rockets of 1946) and mentioning sightings going back to the Bible. The possibility of swamp gas in Michigan as an explanation for UFOs is suggested by Brent (foreshadowing the [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729070647&usg=AOvVaw0zsiN77JJeMi3Hh77OdY9h) swamp-gas fiasco in Michigan in 1966). This report has never been acknowledged or released by the CIA despite FOIA litigation. Its existence and contents are revealed in [Brad Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Brad_Sparks.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729070871&usg=AOvVaw1myyGZYBkBzuwEACYTIs-_)’s interviews with Brent and Graybeal and other OSI officials in 1975–1976. (NICAP, “[The 1952 Sighting Wave](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/chronos/1952FIXED.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729071064&usg=AOvVaw2P1T7In4lHGjgOCy6ZvIvZ)”)

June — Jet pilots allegedly discover the wreck of a flying disc on Spitsbergen in the Svalbard archipelago, Norway. It is taken to Narvik, where it is identified as either a Russian or extraterrestrial device. Other variants of the legend claim it is a Nazi device or that it is actually discovered on Heligoland, Germany, in the North Sea. [Nick Redfern](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nick_Redfern&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729071339&usg=AOvVaw2DrqOAaeTxkASf-tsnBQg8) suspects the story is planted by either Soviet or US intelligence. (“Auf Spitzbergen landete Fliegende Untertasse,” Saarbrücker Zeitung, June 28, 1952; Hessische Nachrichten, July 26, 1954; E. W. Grenfell, “[First Report on the](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/0%2520-%2520Articles/United%2520States/Sir/1954%252009%252000_Sir_Gershtein%2520scan.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729071740&usg=AOvVaw1BbJ6r_2diwUj7vsUf1jwx) [Captured Flying Saucer,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/0%2520-%2520Articles/United%2520States/Sir/1954%252009%252000_Sir_Gershtein%2520scan.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729072137&usg=AOvVaw3EeoqpD0Ls1CHcftIZd9yw)” Sir! September 1954, pp. 16–17, 56–57; Le Lorrain, October 15, 1954; Verdens Gang, December 19, 1954; Condon, [pp. 90–91](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/90/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729072739&usg=AOvVaw0ljmN1S8Jl_iVIuSE0s_2T); William Steinman and Wendelle C. Stevens, UFO Crash at Aztec, UFO Photo Archives, 1987, pp. 353–366; Ole Jonny Brænne, “Legend of the Spitsbergen Saucer,” IUR 17, no. 6 (Nov./Dec. 1992): 14–20; Kremlin 45–46)

June — Sunset. In Tombstone, Arizona, Navy Lieut. Cmdr. John C. Williams, his wife Josephine, and a guest see a “huge circular object” flying toward them from the direction of Tucson. Suddenly it stops in mid-flight, hovers, then reverses direction and retraces its course. A few seconds later it returns, stops gain, and appears to oscillate and tilt from one side to the other. Again it reverses its course, repeating everything 2–3 more times. (UFOEv, [p. 31](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D43%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729073493&usg=AOvVaw3b6kv-0NQoAq4qcJAJMSn2))

Early June — 9:00 or 10:00 p.m. Violet M. Winstead and her husband are driving in a narrow valley somewhere between Charleston and White Sulphur Springs, West Virginia, when they see a number of lights on a bridge crossing the valley. They begin blinking off, one by one. When they get to the bridge, they see no street lights. (Violet M. Winstead, Letter, IUR 9, no.1 (Jan./Feb. 1984): 3)

June 1 — 2:40 a.m. A cargo ship anchored at the wharf in Port-Gentil, Gabon, observes a mysterious object fly from behind the city, make a double loop, pass over the roadstead, and then dive toward the sea. (ClearIntent, [p. 119](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/clearintentgover00fawc/page/118/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729074238&usg=AOvVaw1nsvF4v_Zi6ohZU44Zpl4m))

June 1 — Morning. The chief of a radar test section for Hughes Aircraft Company tracks an unidentified target coming across the San Gabriel Mountains north of Los Angeles, California. It is moving at 180 mph toward Santa Monica at an altitude of 11,000 feet. The object suddenly triples its speed to 550 mph, turns, and climbs over Los Angeles at 35,000 feet per minute. The target then levels out for a few seconds, goes into a high-speed dive, and levels out again at 55,000 feet. They lose the blip somewhere near Riverside. (NICAP, “[Radar Tracks Object Which](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520601losangeles_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729074767&usg=AOvVaw2ylJPgcw8TTHV35i5IPuZg) [Suddenly Climbs to 55,000 Feet](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520601losangeles_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729075173&usg=AOvVaw1RXj6tKnuEqgSfncpUz1rZ)”; Ruppelt, [pp. 141–143](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/140/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729075524&usg=AOvVaw2giVjMYiMmSOeyYr8dvkEs))

* * *

June 4 — Air Force Secretary [Finletter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_K._Finletter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729076080&usg=AOvVaw2P3i_Ef2EkYgG-xeffPAhA) issues a press release about his May UFO briefing, saying, “No concrete evidence has yet reached us either to prove or disprove the existence of the so-called flying saucers. There remain, however, a number of sightings that the Air Force investigators have been unable to explain. As long as this is true, the Air Force will continue to study flying saucer reports.” (Keyhoe, FS from OS, [p. 51](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsos/chIII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729076576&usg=AOvVaw3CF1kX_HIjKiFQPHjis8Na))

June 6 — 8:42 a.m. Flight Sgt. [Kenneth Dudley Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://vwma.org.au/explore/people/500799&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729077006&usg=AOvVaw1QTlLL4hgdxjlXPlfQjqTd) from the 77th RAAF Squadron at Kimpo Air Base \[now Gimpo International Airport\] in Seoul, Korea, observes a dull silver object in the shape of a coin performing spinning and tumbling maneuvers for 4 minutes at 345 mph. Flight Sgt. Kenneth Fawner also sees the UFO for 30 seconds. (\[[Blue Book case documents](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/1952_06_05_KOR_KR-11_Kimpo-AFB_BB_Smith.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729077438&usg=AOvVaw3n609WPkZmcfBAmp_4h-3V)\]; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729077767&usg=AOvVaw2kO_ivAiGLPNbgOF5RDkgu)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729078037&usg=AOvVaw2zByQgEg9gLh8J08WPM3Jm) p. 137)

June 6 — Battelle issues its second status report on Project Stork to ATIC. It describes a “tentative” data sheet for observers to fill out, a more detailed coding scheme, an example of an IBM punch card that will be used, and plans for statistical studies. (“[Seven Status Reports for Project Stork,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cufon.org/cufon/stork1-7.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729078597&usg=AOvVaw3YXljAQ8IFqml4CVVz7jlo)” CUFON; “[Seven Status Reports for Project](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cufon.org/cufon/stork1-7a.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729079003&usg=AOvVaw2ryQ0hJLXBrbmfcKTfwesr) [Stork, Part 2,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.cufon.org/cufon/stork1-7a.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729079337&usg=AOvVaw0rmdIqoGfS4glepFyHUREZ)” CUFON; Clark III 929)

June 8 — 10:50 a.m. Four flat, round, shiny objects in a diamond formation are seen in Albuquerque, New Mexico, from the ground by Mr. and Mrs. J. D. Markland. The objects are approximately 15,000 feet in altitude and traveling 300 mph. There is no audible sound. They are first seen at about 60° above the horizon to the north and are traveling to the southwest at approximately 240°. (NICAP, “[Diamond Formation of Flat Objects Observed](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520608albuquerque_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729079868&usg=AOvVaw1w3yxQAgW0Q5rcjXih9oiY)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729080184&usg=AOvVaw3yqGLuhCbJxk8pKO4um1mw)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729080432&usg=AOvVaw0nRxGHDewDToEZ8RarQzp7) p. 138; Michael D. Swords, “Intelligent Motions,” IUR 33, no. 1 (March 2010): 10, 15)

June 8 — During a launch of a pibal balloon at Calgary, Alberta, a silvery ellipse with a sharp outline reflecting sunlight and an aspect ratio of 8:1 crosses the field of vision of the observer’s theodolite. (Jan Aldrich; Project Magnet Case V)

June 9 — Astronomer [Donald H. Menzel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Howard_Menzel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729081188&usg=AOvVaw3rm7qc_suCa5-TUTNE8hro) writes in Time magazine that most UFOs are light reflections caused by ice crystals, refractions, or temperature inversions. (“[An Astronomer’s Explanation: Those Flying Saucers,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://content.time.com/time/subscriber/article/0%252C33009%252C806457%252C00.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729081737&usg=AOvVaw1l9YL98jqtONrqIRJxNOKA)” Time, June 9, 1952; Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1952, June–July 20th](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Jun-July-20.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729082266&usg=AOvVaw3DDOAJveeLmEGKm_sqMem8), The Author, 1986, p. 9)

June 11 — 6:44 p.m. Two round objects, dark blue with gray centers, are seen moving southwest to northwest for 40 seconds at 500 mph and 6,000 feet altitude several miles east of O’Hare Airport in Chicago, Illinois. One passes the other before disappearing. (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1952, June–July 20th](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Jun-July-20.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729082803&usg=AOvVaw3IPTF7BpnzQVXlhi7g8I7A), The Author, 1986, pp. 10–11)

June 13 — 1:00 a.m. M. Veillot and M. Damiens, air traffic control operators at Paris–Le Bourget Airport, France, watch a prominent orange-red light hover in the sky for about one hour. Eventually it begins moving and crosses the sky southwest of the airport, accelerating rapidly. The light is also seen by M. Navarri, the pilot of an approaching Air France plane. (Michel, Truth About FS, 165–166)

June 15 — 8:32 a.m. A meteorological assistant on reserve army maneuvers sees a large silver disc in the sky southeast of Halifax, Nova Scotia. It moves southwest for 30 seconds at an altitude of 5,000–8,000 feet and then rises and merges in 2–5 seconds with altocumulus clouds at 11,000–12,000 feet. Its diameter is about 100 feet and speed at least 800 mph. (Good Above, [p. 184](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/184/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729083570&usg=AOvVaw0YY_7EnuLbdc8OAq7Ox_2s))

June 15 — 4:20 p.m. A round shiny object is seen over Gordonsville, Virginia. At 4:25 p.m., the crew of a commercial airliner reports a silver sphere over Richmond, Virginia. At 4:33 p.m., a Marine fighter jet is scrambled from Marine Corps Base Quantico in Prince William County, Virginia, and attempts to intercept a target south of Gordonsville but fails and returns to base. At 5:43 p.m., an Air Force fighter attempts to intercept the same shiny sphere but after reaching 35,000 feet turns back. At 7:35 p.m., a UFO emitting a golden glow is seen over Blackstone, Virginia. Fighter jets from Langley AFB in Hampton, Virginia, are scrambled, but the object is gone by the time they get there at 8:05 p.m. (Ruppelt, [pp. 194–195](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/194/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729084100&usg=AOvVaw1V_ept6suoZJXV25g86L0X))

June 15 — 11:50 p.m. Edward Duke, a former Navy radar technician, sees an unidentified cigar-shaped object in the vicinity of Standiford Field \[now Louisville International Airport\], Louisville, Kentucky. It has a light on either side of the fuselage and a reddish hue on the trailing end. The object appears to be moving at about 400–500 mph and maneuvers around in several directions for 15 minutes, then descends and flies away to the northeast. (\[[Blue](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/MAXW-PBB10-1258.jpg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729084631&usg=AOvVaw1s_vsvwZGJSlcyFl0cLGES) [Book document](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/MAXW-PBB10-1258.jpg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729084948&usg=AOvVaw22WDG5S2VeFtKwKFZVZazR)\]; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729085269&usg=AOvVaw1R6YddxeXTC_agNJPgkgCp)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729085541&usg=AOvVaw2TgHSIfWMth57Ql4B4glD4) p. 138)

June 17 — 1:28 a.m. A USAF F-94 pilot sees a light like a bright star cross the nose of his jet at blinding speed over Cape Cod, Massachusetts, for 15 seconds. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729086055&usg=AOvVaw1FsncTHY3ic65sgQNFqZGt)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729086307&usg=AOvVaw36PzxgRf1rOu7tMUl-YfeI) p. 138)

June 17 — Astronomer [Donald Menzel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Howard_Menzel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729086743&usg=AOvVaw0xkINkKGmi9bO0_iQtQamN) writes in an article in Look magazine about how he creates temperature-inversion UFOs in his laboratory. (Donald H. Menzel, “[The Truth about Flying Saucers,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/0%2520-%2520Articles/United%2520States/Look/1952%252006%252017_Look_Donald%2520Menzel_Flying%2520Saucers_Lagrange%2520scan.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729087356&usg=AOvVaw3730OZlgvrOtkQX7vaYslf)” Look 16, no. 13 (June 17, 1952): 35–39; NICAP, “[The Truth about Flying Saucers,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/look61752.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729087818&usg=AOvVaw38uBnRrW3fRWNY3B867df3) [Look](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/look61752.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729088081&usg=AOvVaw2Pdpo522H8713G6KpboO4S) [Magazine](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/look61752.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729088335&usg=AOvVaw3XyhYIl71IZoAdDWYrAGqp)”)

June 17 — 7:30–10:20 p.m. Many witnesses at McChord AFB \[now Joint Base Lewis-McChord\] south of Tacoma, Washington, see 5–6 yellowish discs, tracked by radar and theodolite. Several F-94s are scrambled. (NICAP, “[1–](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520617mcchord_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729088808&usg=AOvVaw0kgHAd9d4Vg5y2OkuLmRRu) [5 Silver Yellow Objects Stop and Start](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520617mcchord_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729089119&usg=AOvVaw3_xIUkPG8LahK4-qY1ephw)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729089417&usg=AOvVaw1vq1AQpl3JTE5prrkKn84-), p. 138)

* * *

June 17 — 8:45 p.m.. Orville Foster, a US Weather Bureau observer at the Pueblo (Colorado) Memorial Airport, watches a UFO through the bureau’s theodolite. It circles leisurely for 10 minutes, then disappears toward the northeast. (“‘Flying Saucer’ Sighted at Pueblo,” Leadville (Colo.) Herald-Democrat, June 18, 1952; Project 1947, “[UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1952a.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729090116&usg=AOvVaw3H2wkqlPz49QyuNvNrPMbv) [Reports, 1952](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/1952a.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729090429&usg=AOvVaw22prqJC6Po9Vb22wunRcZ8)”)

Mid-June — [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729090846&usg=AOvVaw3XmeWtGHzCi7Ov3W90Cja7) briefs Maj. Gen. [John A. Samford](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_A._Samford&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729091214&usg=AOvVaw0I38eaSCNvqTOP5KklAR2W) and his staff, two Navy captains from ONI, and “some people I can’t name.” The meeting is contentious. One USAF colonel argues that Blue Book’s investigation is biased against the ETH, which launches an emotional debate. Ruppelt is directed to “take further steps to obtain positive identification” of UFO reports. (Ruppelt, [pp. 147–149](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/146/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729091661&usg=AOvVaw07lhNn3KAYX5otwwx2OAEx))

June 18 — 5:00 p.m. USAF Capt. Erie P. Ashton and 2nd Lt. Clifton Ashley, while flying a B-25 about 100 miles east of March AFB \[now March Air Reserve Base\] in southern California, sight a silver object at approximately 11,000 feet in altitude off their left wing. The object is longer than it is wide and is in sight for about 39 minutes. (NICAP, “[UFO Paces B-25](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520618march_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729092126&usg=AOvVaw10H1qrVjUU7pj7NVYtsk23)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729092465&usg=AOvVaw3yHyw-GWrc_79CmmQ77I7H), p. 138)

June 18 — According to Sgt. [Richard Doty](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.exopaedia.org/Doty%252C%252BRichard&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729092889&usg=AOvVaw2Xl7yhXywNq8hXA0QhxvXT)’s 1980s disinformation, the living alien retrieved in 1949 (EBE-1) and kept at Los Alamos, New Mexico, dies of unknown causes. (Clark III 364)

June 19 —2:37 a.m. At Goose Bay AFB \[now CFB Goose Bay\], Labrador, radar men pick up a UFO track. 2nd Lt. A’Gostino and others outside see a strange, red-lighted object come in over the field. The radar blip suddenly enlarges, as if the device has banked, exposing a larger surface to the radar beam. The watching airmen see the red light wobble or flutter. After a moment the light turns white and quickly disappears. Apparently, the unknown craft has gone into a steep climb. [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729093381&usg=AOvVaw36BKOdHgr2fJkvrcwge48Z) assumes the radar and visual sightings are simultaneous, but Blue Book records indicate they are separate. (NICAP, “[Target Suddenly Enlarges](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/detection/radar/520619goose_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729093782&usg=AOvVaw3m5nuWiXWpAjI8I1jgGxVs)”; Keyhoe, FS from OS, [p. 52](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsos/chIII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729094216&usg=AOvVaw0FCHEvy88HRBG-EvI2og19); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729094523&usg=AOvVaw0cTyoQWbiQM-404JBk93JF), p. 139; Chris Rutkowski and Geoff Dittman, The Canadian UFO Report, Dundurn Press, 2006, pp. 55–56)

June 19 — 1:30 p.m. Four silvery UFOs are seen by many witnesses in Tacoma, Washington, flying silently at a high altitude. Unofficial sources report that the objects are tracked on radar at McChord AFB \[now Joint Base Lewis- McChord\] in Tacoma and jets are scrambled. (Tacoma (Wash.) Reporter, June 20, 1952; Shoot 9; Michael D. Swords, “Intelligent Motions,” IUR 33, no. 1 (March 2010): 11, 15)

June 19 — 6:00 p.m. Army Capt. Harold Hermann and his wife see a round, silver UFO speeding across the sky at Jersey Shore, Pennsylvania. [(“‘Flying Saucers’ Sighted,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1952/06/24/84327623.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729095447&usg=AOvVaw0PYyHFStrD0P2nV7m0SLGF)” New York Times, June 24, 1952, p. 26)

June 19 — 9:50 p.m. A former Army Air Force ground crew member sees a UFO flying in a swirling motion over the backyard of his home in Trenton, New Jersey. (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1952, June–July 20th](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Jun-July-20.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729096048&usg=AOvVaw1wWfndz6tf8Q9iAWLUojBB), The Author, 1986, p. 17)

June 20 — 3:03 p.m. A flight of four US Marine Corps captains and pilots ([Bobbie Foster](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/118916528/bobbie-gene-foster&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729096586&usg=AOvVaw2RiTNrIbNumcvOtVxqF9al)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/118916528/bobbie-gene-foster&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729096883&usg=AOvVaw3hTuKwve0pBgtEpCH8r1XC) Richard Francisco, [Teddy L.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/3841406/teddy-l-pittman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729097229&usg=AOvVaw3s92jRX7D2so5ikGe5QTVT) [Pittman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/3841406/teddy-l-pittman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729097584&usg=AOvVaw1uampVN8Mc_maEnlcfeikK)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/3841406/teddy-l-pittman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729097861&usg=AOvVaw3Jhmu_srGtJZhCyvsjSn4b) and [Ronnie A. McDonald](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/150828155/ronnie-angus-mcdonald&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729098213&usg=AOvVaw1IW5mp1NCFFWhhKx7CkJJa)) of F4U-4B Corsair fighters with the 7302nd Squadron over central Korea see a silvery-white object passing below them, banking into a left turn. As the object circles around, Foster dives toward the object, which appears to be 10–20 feet in diameter. It flies away at an estimated speed of 1,000 mph and disappears toward friendly lines. (NICAP, “[F4U-4B Corsairs Encounter Circling UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520620korea_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729098654&usg=AOvVaw1vNM4F7geli7uO1e-ZDHvn)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729098980&usg=AOvVaw0wYjV9EdhWjQsNanVd9tNl), p. 139)

June 21 — 12:30 p.m. T/Sgt. Howard Davis, flight engineer of a B-29 bomber flying at 8,000 feet altitude near Kelly AFB \[now Kelly Field\] in San Antonio, Texas, sees a small, flat object with a sharply pointed front and rounded rear. It is white with a dark blue center and red rim and trails sparks as it dives past the B-29 at a distance of 500 feet in one second. (NICAP, “[B-29 Encounters Flat Object with Pointed Front](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520621kellyafb_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729099325&usg=AOvVaw0dmFEd8FCD13LQkczaDPNo)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729099547&usg=AOvVaw1Y0C49BJZAVxOD59Pa-fVN), p. 140)

June 21 — 10:58 p.m. A Ground Observer Corps spotter at Oak Ridge, Tennessee, sees a small (6–8 inches in diameter), slow-moving UFO near the AEC plant. GCI radar obtains the target, but it fades from the scope. An F-97 on combat air patrol engages in a “dogfight” with the object, which makes “ramming attacks” at the aircraft. It blinks until it speeds away. (NICAP, “[Radar Visual near AEC Plant”](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520621oakridge_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729099947&usg=AOvVaw0NVJLU2igoxyMy13bYr5mG); Ruppelt, [p. 43](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/42/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729100306&usg=AOvVaw0fBXIwklyechtjpdz_OH6_); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729100630&usg=AOvVaw2uMidi_SQGrK1Rnq28IDAl)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729100891&usg=AOvVaw0TPMe2WGNq7f1dZcsg_mOi) p. 139)

June 22 — 10:45 p.m. Two US Marine sergeants see a 4-foot diameter orange object dive at a runway from the north, dropping from 800 to 100 feet altitude over the west end of the runway at Pyeongtaek military base, South Korea, shooting 2–5-foot red flames. It then heads west at about 300–450 mph for 2–3 seconds, hovers briefly over a hill, turns 180° in 45–60 seconds, flashes, heads east a half mile, flashes again, and blinks out. No sound. (Hynek UFO Report, [pp. 82–83](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/82/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729101459&usg=AOvVaw0LvGWZLVFZro_yhaud2Bi8); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729101774&usg=AOvVaw2LoCWm1c1qfOZC1oIaj3kj)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729102041&usg=AOvVaw1QJ7EnLBKDEaHCijdV1r1D) p. 140)

June 23 — 1:30 a.m. USAF ADC radar operators Lt. A. N. Robinson Jr. and Airman Ray H. Foote, plus 5 other controllers, officers, and maintenance technicians at Kirksville Air Force Station in Missouri, track a hard target with a clear sharp return about the size of a B-29. It suddenly appears 85 miles north-northwest of the station, moving at a constant speed of about 3,600+ mph on a straight path for about 125 miles for 2 minutes. Then it vanishes. A second target appears at 1:35 a.m. (NICAP, “[Seven ADC Men Track 3,600 MPH Target](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520623kirksville_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729102620&usg=AOvVaw3VLmlF7rWJPD1HQ_YVxKi_)”; Michael D. Swords, “Case Missing,” IUR 19, no. 6 (Nov./Dec. 1994): 20; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729103074&usg=AOvVaw1JLw0qErP-494RpEFq3c0E), p. 141)

June 23 — 3:30 a.m. Secretary Martha Milligan sees a bullet-shaped object emitting a burnt-orange exhaust fly straight and level over Oak Ridge, Tennessee. (NICAP, “[June 23, 1952: Oak Ridge, Tenn.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/oak520623dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729103534&usg=AOvVaw2DmwsKC1PT_d-N8_W73nXL)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729103869&usg=AOvVaw03ZJtgpt_n91iGLKJTyw9K), p. 141)

* * *

June 23 — 10:00 a.m. National Guard Lt. Col. [Oren Laramore Depp](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/145485153/oren-laramore-depp&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729104465&usg=AOvVaw15CV8SXeX5VVQ62WPxKcmh) \[[Johnny Depp](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Johnny_Depp&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729104744&usg=AOvVaw3zOPU6ngYD6lkP_fwkP1d4)’s grandfather\] sees two objects looking like giant soap bubbles reflecting yellow and lavender colors flying in line over Owensboro, Kentucky. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729104949&usg=AOvVaw0LdBhN6qO9R1pR-y6ZrdNX)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729105113&usg=AOvVaw2YaJJaXmqLgFKGhfh4sF4f) p. 141)

June 23 — 4:05 pm. Airport weather observer Rex Thompson sees a round disc with a metallic shine flash and flutter like a flipped coin for 5–7 minutes over Geiger Field \[now Spokane International Airport\], Spokane, Washington. (NICAP, “[June 23, 1952: Spokane, Wash.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/spokane520623dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729105394&usg=AOvVaw3tExWONklvrs0C5_ar1VjG)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729105602&usg=AOvVaw3e1Bz086w4zJCnFsiaSi1k)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729105758&usg=AOvVaw1afcOKMMLikqvxoU_CT1pu) p. 140)

June 23 — 9:00 p.m. 2d Lt. K. Thompson sees a very large light flying straight and level for 10 minutes at McChord AFB \[now Joint Base Lews-McChord\] near Tacoma, Washington. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729106023&usg=AOvVaw0aKjX8B2jkw6CuFhPaP-tq), p. 140; Michael D. Swords, “Intelligent Motions,” IUR 33, no. 1 (March 2010): 11, 15)

June 24 — The first issue of Ouranos is published by the Commission Internationale d’Enquêtes sur les Soucoupes Volantes, in Paris. ([Ouranos](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/France/Ouranos/Ouranos%2520-%2520No%252001%2520-%25201952%252006.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729106442&usg=AOvVaw1aS9ZBW7QF6N7l89JmIlAb)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/France/Ouranos/Ouranos%2520-%2520No%252001%2520-%25201952%252006.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729106657&usg=AOvVaw1rP1-w1i-KiyJPEzXcW8H3) no. 1)

June 25 — [Wilbert B. Smith](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Wilbert_B_Smith.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729106951&usg=AOvVaw2jzdlpyF4EDMjZ-_gBoknA) writes an “Interim Report on Project Magnet,” in which he states: “If, as appears evident, the flying saucers are emissaries from some other civilization, and actually do operate no magnetic principles, we have before us the fact that we have missed something in magnetic theory but have a good indication of the direction in which to look for the missing quantities.” (Good Above, [p. 185](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/184/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729107215&usg=AOvVaw2BnRaodokxOFB3z4X-E_-J))

June 25 — 8:30 p.m. Mrs. Daniel Norbury and Lawrence Matheis see a bright yellow-white, egg-shaped object, sometimes with a red tail, make seven circles over Chicago, Illinois. (NICAP, “[June 25, 1952: Chicago, Illinois](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/chicago520625dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729107479&usg=AOvVaw1PFi67esn2ckcjHGAM4JJD)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729107805&usg=AOvVaw0wvOIiPqTfkST_s-sG5Ujn)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729108056&usg=AOvVaw1rsHfVOkzsscZoIrxSIg90) p. 141)

June 27–30 — [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729108553&usg=AOvVaw3BarQu_NloVqjfn8mAeE30) visits McChord AFB in Tacoma, Washington, to look into recent sightings there. Capt. Harnnagy of the 4704 Air Defense Wing Intelligence tells him that the objects are always seen in the northern sky around 8:00 p.m. (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1952, June–July 20th](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Jun-July-20.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729108844&usg=AOvVaw1CGtNgtzaOvLR_doxl_SID), The Author, 1986, pp. 23–24)

June 28 — 1:20 p.m. Two observers at the Cargo Air Service hangar at Kirtland AFB in Albuquerque, New Mexico, see two silvery discs high in the sky and moving to the south. They noiselessly climb nearly vertically at high speed, one going south-southeast, the other heading almost due east. The observation lasts 30 seconds. (J. Allen Hynek, THE UFO Experience, Ballantine ed., 1974, [pp. 68–69](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/68/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729109532&usg=AOvVaw0typBTl89FDxJhg4W_HowT); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729109879&usg=AOvVaw23qLpdpSit5nvjQdd48Cjv)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729110145&usg=AOvVaw2MX_Vcz8F73aMhEH0Lr6p7) p. 142)

June 29 — 5:45 p.m. Three Air Force police officers of the 83rd Air Base Squadron at O’Hare Airport in Chicago spot a flat, oval object as it hovers between two radio towers about 7 miles away. It is bright silver in color, encircled by white haze, and appears about 30 feet in diameter. During the next 45 minutes the object moves to the southwest and then back north. It accelerates instantaneously to a speed faster than a jet fighter. (\[[Blue Book documents](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/520629ohara_docs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729110628&usg=AOvVaw3wF0Ma4qnskNutR-6zOHoq)\]; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729110898&usg=AOvVaw0b3pGV_UKD3xQI3ElUeRev)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729111161&usg=AOvVaw0gb2wve8gzd0ThJPvbBynu) p. 143)

June 30 — [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729111610&usg=AOvVaw0hoOA0vSX1HrXCWkTYNTgA) says that by this time there is a split in opinion in the military about what to do about UFOs. One group assumes that UFOs are interplanetary, and information must be withheld at a top-secret level. “The enthusiasm of this group took a firm hold in the Pentagon, at Air Defense Command headquarters, on the Research and Development Board, and many other agencies.” (Ruppelt, [pp. 152–153](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/152/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729112086&usg=AOvVaw1LS8seiZLUgG7PUP2cwZAp))

Summer — Denis Plunkett forms a British branch of [Albert K. Bender](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albert_K._Bender&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729112621&usg=AOvVaw1qfrUcRidl9VhWPZv5W6Kt)’s International Flying Saucer Bureau in Bristol, England. When Bender closes down IFSB in late September 1953, the branch becomes the British Flying Saucer Bureau, with his son E. L. Plunkett as president. It publishes Flying Saucer News from Spring 1953 to Spring 1956 and Flying Saucer News Bulletin from February 1955 through 1957. ([Flying Saucer News](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520Kingdom/Flying%2520Saucer%2520News%2520(BFSB)/Flying%2520Saucer%2520News%2520-%2520No%252001%2520-%25201953%2520Spring.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729113309&usg=AOvVaw0xdXjnY304ZsLqN9qM5Yth), no. 1 (Spring 1953); [Flying Saucer News Bulletin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520Kingdom/Flying%2520Saucer%2520News%2520Bulletin%2520(BFSB)/Flying%2520Saucer%2520News%2520Bulletin%2520-%2520No%252001%2520-%25201955%252002.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729113758&usg=AOvVaw0gXDQgyENZ2nbg5yorm-4A), no. 1 (February 1955))

Summer — Night. Radar at MacDill AFB in Tampa, Florida, picks up a target at 40,000 feet flying at 460 mph. A nearby B-29 volunteers to investigate, searching until midnight. The pilot, a USAF colonel, finally reports a visual sighting of the UFO, flying at 40,000 feet and 250 mph and appearing as a glowing white light shaped like a football. The object changes course and disappears at high speed. (UFOEv, [p. 25](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D37%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729114146&usg=AOvVaw2rI73hpRujaFbBMEPleM5f))

July — [Edgar Jarrold](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://theozfiles1.rssing.com/chan-25625913/all_p4.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729114419&usg=AOvVaw1awIK5sPjoW7bjfShtawEH) begins the Australian Flying Saucer Bureau in Sydney, New South Wales, Australia’s first civilian UFO organization, following his personal observation of two fast-moving yellow lights in the sky over Fairfield, New South Wales. (“[Saucers on His Mind,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://trove.nla.gov.au/newspaper/article/18407496&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729114674&usg=AOvVaw33YRR30MfgnV4ySR_BKWka)” Sydney (N.S.W.) Morning Gazette, February 2, 1954, p. 7; Clark III 632)

July — Afternoon. A man driving a car near Schenectady, New York, sees an oblong object hovering nearby. A gondola lowers from the object and a bunch of “Navy officers in white hats” rush to the windows. All are wearing huge dark glasses. The gondola goes back up, and three smaller UFOs appear and go inside the bigger one. (Center for UFO Studies, [HUMCAT Index 1952–1953,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/HUMCAT/HUMCAT_Index_1952-1953.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729115039&usg=AOvVaw11feqodpBzZvEmuJflNDzW) p. 10; Clark III 267)

July — The administration and faculty of Ohio Northern University, in Ada, Ohio, announce the formation of Project A: Investigation of Phenomena, saying that members of the engineering, pharmacy, law, and liberal arts colleges will examine the evidence for UFOs under the direction of Dean [Warren L. Hickman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/158923731/warren-l_-hickman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729115395&usg=AOvVaw0b2KYnabVd1uh7NgCC80ov). Project A personnel seek reports from the public and collect newspaper clippings. The project receives a disappointing 54 completed

* * *

questionnaires, far lower than the 200 they would like for a scientific sampling. However, they do estimate that about 20% involve “unnatural phenomena.” After unsuccessful attempts to obtain reports from Civilian Saucer Investigation in Los Angeles and other groups, the university closes the project down in mid-1954. (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1952, August](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Aug.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729115772&usg=AOvVaw2sswutZwRgQyzaSQ8lWF7W), The Author, 1986, p. 3; Clark III 916; Curt Collins, “[Project A: The Short](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2018/09/project-the-short-life-of-ufo-study.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729116059&usg=AOvVaw0eMvDxahDLc3d_H5nSCx2X) [Life of a UFO Study,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2018/09/project-the-short-life-of-ufo-study.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729116316&usg=AOvVaw1y6dxqm1mf0C-aFWvc-clk)” September 21, 2018)

July 1 — [J. Robert Moskin](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.jrobertmoskin.com/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729116608&usg=AOvVaw22U7rP8Z1qxsDp8sk0WRgC)‘s article appears in Look magazine. It features Gen. [Hoyt Vandenberg](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hoyt_Vandenberg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729116861&usg=AOvVaw1pAUPgJ4rDtyoWN5q5pEY-)’s declaration that “we cannot afford to be complacent” about UFOs. [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729117074&usg=AOvVaw0fL0dR1vIB0DLztNpUttUg) says that the article has upset the “silence group” in the Pentagon. (J. Robert Moskin, “[Hunt for the Flying Saucer,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/fig/look7152.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729117301&usg=AOvVaw0lnw2QEQR3p7Fht3FBCrnJ)” Look. July 1, 1952, pp. 37–41; Keyhoe, FS from OS, [pp. 52–53](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsos/chIII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729117583&usg=AOvVaw08LeQ7cAHukuwt3THCXhbb))

July 1 — 7:25 a.m. A Ground Observer Corps spotter sees a UFO headed southwest across Boston, Massachusetts. Two F-94s are scrambled. Erwin W. Nelson and his wife at Lynn, Massachusetts, notice two vapor trails from the climbing jets, look around, and see in the west a bright silver “cigar shaped object about six times as long as it was wide” heading over Boston at a very high altitude. An identical UFO is following the first some distance back. No vapor trails are visible. The witnesses watch the F-94s search back and forth far below the UFOs. At 7:30, USAF Capt. [Robert E. Metcalf](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49260481/robert-eugene-metcalf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729117900&usg=AOvVaw1cKN3XS0FURcB69754tzc6), petroleum officer for the 6520th Test Support Wing, and USAF air policemen M/Sgt [James Stiner](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/50612319/james-stiner&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729118129&usg=AOvVaw361Lk41ctRl83fzGIBsRF2) and M/Sgt Joseph R. Bosh, 6520th Air Police Squadron, at Hanscom Field,

Bedford, Massachusetts, see the two jets, look for what they are intercepting, and see to the east a 100-foot-long silvery ellipse “fatter than a cigar” traveling southwest. At two points, the object seems to hover, then continues at about 40,000 feet. The object’s path intersects contrails of the two jets heading southeast. Metcalf loses sight of the object on his way to the tower after a few minutes, then sees it again at about 7:40 a.m., noting it has increased distance “considerably,” but finally loses sight of it at the tower. (\[[Blue Book document](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/MAXW-PBB11-326-328.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729118453&usg=AOvVaw00Mp9WL_pn7bR6V_CGqyF9)\]; UFOEv, [p. 160](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D172%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729118713&usg=AOvVaw00vdoIKva7NfW-YP30AVm7); Ruppelt, [pp. 150–151](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/150/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729118975&usg=AOvVaw08ev_iH24aPqB8v3_RKAgm); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729119181&usg=AOvVaw1pAgF_-k-8V1u4CBnvX-aL)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729119333&usg=AOvVaw2aVyBcPQsWdKs6KKBNe54a) p. 144)

July 1 — 8:40–9:15 a.m. Two silvery objects move south along the East Coast and hover near Fort Monmouth, New Jersey, for about 5 minutes at 50,000 feet. As radar at Fort Monmouth detects the objects, they put on a burst of speed and head southwest toward Washington, D.C., confirmed visually. At about 12:00 noon, a physics professor at George Washington University in D.C. sees a grayish UFO hovering and arcing back and forth across the sky for about 8 minutes. He guesses about 500 people are watching the object. (NICAP, “[Objects Tracked at 50,000ʹ,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520701fortmonmouth_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729119633&usg=AOvVaw0ZrAwpn318mmE5QcA4HJ3h) [G/V](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520701fortmonmouth_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729119823&usg=AOvVaw3vYOE-U3mxPf14DzYWaQHD)”; Ruppelt, [pp. 151–152](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/150/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729120027&usg=AOvVaw3_t_fY8HQEsbQ2iH5DtIb5); Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1952, June–July 20th](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Jun-July-20.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729120239&usg=AOvVaw3azNPvN8SEt9BUI2Qphrsp), The Author, 1986, pp. 36– 37; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729120462&usg=AOvVaw0mvSi0TPwEyANqgKovtMah), p. 144)

July 2 — 11:10 a.m. As he is driving on a highway seven miles north of Tremonton, Utah, US Navy Chief Petty Officer Delbert C. Newhouse and his wife see a strange object in the sky. Newhouse pulls the car to the side of the road, gets out, and watches 12–14 UFOs at about 10,000 feet. Looking like “two pie pans, one inverted on top of the other,” they are clustered in a loose formation, “milling around.” He takes about 75 seconds worth of film through the telephoto lens of his 16mm movie camera, though the objects have receded a bit to shiny points of light. At one point a single object leaves the pack, heading east, and Newhouse holds the camera still so the UFO crosses the field of view. He repeats the procedure 3-4 times. Blue Book obtains the film and sends it to the USAF Photo- Reconnaissance Laboratory and the Navy’s Photo Interpretation Laboratory. Both analyses eliminate the possibility of aircraft or birds. (NICAP, “[The Tremonton, Utah / Newhouse Color Film](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520702tremonton_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729120785&usg=AOvVaw0G8vdMZPka7UoAZ-z-LyaR)”; “[Delbert Newhouse](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v%3DvbLvzgJMsIQ&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729120975&usg=AOvVaw0XzvhKRqWAe5Qxp1M7qdor) [UFO Footage, 1952, Tremonton, Utah,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v%3DvbLvzgJMsIQ&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729121180&usg=AOvVaw2lwNSbF_udsO6RGOYjN-NX)” parkerdonaldmusic YouTube channel, September 29, 2012; Ruppelt, [pp.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/220/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729121396&usg=AOvVaw03lMxypf4Mz2E1CfTlne05) [220–222](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/220/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729121608&usg=AOvVaw32yeMJo4-0Q0kEsx_bp-OU); UFOEv, [pp. 88](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D100%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729121823&usg=AOvVaw2e-2pmYRwXfjixUfOcc293)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D100%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729122005&usg=AOvVaw0PB-zwMxPCdRAxHNhVO4cW) [112](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D124%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729122220&usg=AOvVaw0sjgKnNeJXiJQAQwwD2VuX); Hynek UFO Report, [pp. 235–239](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/234/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729122453&usg=AOvVaw37VBEyuMqHa37rl-8SCFNN); Condon, [pp. 418–426](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/418/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729122669&usg=AOvVaw3y2CFMvhL7UvTo7RbWKmtG); “Turner on Tremonton,”

IUR 3, no. 5 (May 1978): 6; Swords 149; Clark III 1203–1204; Kevin D. Randle, “[Newhouse’s Tremonton, Utah](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2013/12/newhouses-tremonton-utah-movie-revisited.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729122991&usg=AOvVaw3ahSMixNjgfO0u7rIhDlpN) [Movie Revisited,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2013/12/newhouses-tremonton-utah-movie-revisited.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729123220&usg=AOvVaw3DK1E8mgzYqFZSsS6-GUGf)” A Different Perspective, December 12, 2013; Patrick Gross, “[Tremonton, Utah, UFO Color](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/tremonton.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729123419&usg=AOvVaw0wBoFq1zbr7KQ2z1NIBLYJ) [Film of July 2, 1952](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/tremonton.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729123633&usg=AOvVaw37MpEJGJYgkWXBwAixIFkQ)”)

July 3 — 4:15 a.m. A witness on the Manitou Beach Highway near Rome Center, Michigan, watches two circular lights about 20 feet in diameter flying horizontally at tremendous speed at only a few hundred feet altitude. (NICAP, “[July 3, 1952: Selfridge AFB, Mich.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/selfridge520723dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729123901&usg=AOvVaw2MChV8wYv6QiVrWjoxch2k)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729124092&usg=AOvVaw0glrLMTrO_F7SepJJbAT6a)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729124251&usg=AOvVaw0_gWo2B_R_Q04FjDnkVM9y) p. 145)

July 3 — 11:50 p.m. Mrs. J. D. Arbuckle sees two bright pastel-green discs fly straight and level very fast for 6 seconds over Chicago, Illinois. The next day the Air Force public information office at O’Hare Airport says it has received 16 reports of UFOs over Chicago in the past week. An Air Force spokesman says that jet patrols are on alert 24 hours a day.
