([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729124525&usg=AOvVaw0Pp1a50aDARmMipDj56LNO)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729124700&usg=AOvVaw2hIQ7ehdPx7CnBoLNBX2p4) p. 145; “[Deny Reports of ‘Saucers’ Alerts,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93380946/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729124890&usg=AOvVaw3h9IzxoStYwIJS7QQgvUoH)” Waterloo (Iowa) Courier, July 4, 1952, p. 1)

July 5 — 6:00 a.m. Four commercial pilots flying at 9,000 feet above the Hanford atomic site in Washington State observe a disc just below a deck of wispy clouds directly above their C-46. The witnesses are Capt. John Baldwin, Capt. George Robertson, H. D. Shenkel, and Steven Summers. Baldwin says that the disc stands still at first and then seems to back away and change shape, becoming flat, gaining speed, and then disappearing. Robertson says “we couldn’t pick it up on our radar. We reversed our course and went back, but we couldn’t spot it again.” (NICAP, “[C-46 Crew Observe Disc over AEC Plant](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520705hanford_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729125254&usg=AOvVaw1y2H5H_-23d4mRYj6_YzUM)”; Hynek UFO Report, [p. 53](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/52/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729125543&usg=AOvVaw3x9UffIArmomgoOLhDa5G-); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729125739&usg=AOvVaw03hZyvc4zJEZcyMbqvY6M6)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729125891&usg=AOvVaw3M3FofzNp-fOd2y3X3B8Gs) p. 145; Swords 149)

July 5 — 7:58 p.m. Oklahoma State Patrolman Arthur Myers Hamilton is flying five miles south-southeast of Norman, Oklahoma, in a State Patrol airplane when he sees three dark discs 4–8 miles away at 6,000 feet hover for 15 seconds then fly away, silhouetted against a dark cloud. (NICAP, “[Three Dark Discs Sighted from State Patrol](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520705norman_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729126236&usg=AOvVaw03ZTDcHGHiAjeXw_loFP_Z) [Airplane](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520705norman_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729126437&usg=AOvVaw2OJZ9qldfBF2NUOaYdVsf1)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729126642&usg=AOvVaw2-qVL7S_hbnE9e9EUBH5Vq)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729126804&usg=AOvVaw1Ol4FflIp3VsASkY1Lt-Pf) p. 145)

July 8 — A commissionaire on duty at an army depot in Ottawa, Ontario, sees a bright orange light about a quarter size of the full moon travel from south to north, turn, and travel south again. (Jan Aldrich; Project Magnet Case X)

July 9 — 12:45 p.m. USAF Maj. [Claude K. Griffin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49193646/claude-k-griffin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729127683&usg=AOvVaw2wIvmpYSU5-W9dTOGPWXEI) is driving one mile north of Colorado Springs, Colorado, when he sees a luminous white object shaped like an airfoil moving slowly and erratically like a corkscrew. He estimates its size at 100 feet, distance at 15–20 miles, and altitude at 30,000 feet, heading northwest. Griffin stops the car to watch for 12 minutes. USAF Maj. E. R. Hayden and his wife come out of their house and look at the object in a 4x rifle scope. He describes it as rectangular, silver on one side, and black on the other. It flutters as it moves slowly north-northwest above 20,000 feet 20 miles away. It gains altitude and gradually diminishes to a black dot, then accelerates to a high speed and disappears. Shea and a civilian, Jane Morrison, watch three lights, one main red light with smaller white lights on each side, traveling 500 mph at 40,000–50,000 feet over Montrose Beach, Chicago, Illinois, from the west-northwest. July 12 — 9:04 p.m. Two USAF F-86 Sabre jets with the 62nd Flight Squadron are flying at 22,000 feet on a routine training mission (or on a scramble mission) over Arlington Heights, Illinois. Capt. Robert W. Casey Jr., after coming out of a right turn, sees an oblong yellowish lighted object with an exhaust moving in a straight course about 15 miles away south of Elgin, Illinois, at 22,000 feet traveling at 800 mph. The F-86 pursues at maximum speed, but the object pulls away. Both pilots hear a strange radio transmission on their restricted communications channel during the pursuit saying the name of the pursuit pilot, Casey, in an ethereal “ghost-like” monotone.

Apparently, this is a prank by Casey’s fighter pilot buddies at the 62nd who are monitoring his channel, though this is later officially denied by the 62nd. (NICAP, “[F-86 on Scramble Mission / Strange Radio Transmission](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520712arlington_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729132055&usg=AOvVaw0OSjo4Io_u27fmaLQXyHPU)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729132359&usg=AOvVaw1HkM0na3PfpmZcvK-hgELN)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729132616&usg=AOvVaw0CBVfS0uknXmAoznO0BA9I) p. 147)

July 14 — 9:12 p.m. Some 8,000 feet above the Chesapeake Bay in Maryland/Virginia, Capt. [William B.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://clipperpioneers.com/william-b-nash/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729135394&usg=AOvVaw3rQlkKr0Z-f5hs9h-KzR9X) [Nash](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.fortmyersmemorial.com/obituaries/William-Nash-21291/%2523!/Obituary&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729135708&usg=AOvVaw2aVpse7HtdKbXvWgAzp0ro) and copilot First Officer [William H. Fortenberry](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pan_Am_Flight_7&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729135955&usg=AOvVaw0ygcn3XYPncj0r77SoN7xy)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pan_Am_Flight_7&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729136127&usg=AOvVaw1eAKGrcFJmZDHVrW1PGJxG) flying a Pan American Airways DC-4, see six crimson dots at 30°. The dots are streaking in their direction like tracer bullets. As they get closer, they resolve into reddish-orange circles, about 100 feet in diameter and 15 feet thick, with sharply defined edges. Nash says they are holding a “narrow echelon formation.” When they are nearly underneath the aircraft, “they flipped on edge, the sides to the left of us going up and the glowing surfaces facing right. While all were in the edgewise position, the last five slid over and past the leader so that the echelon was now tail foremost.” Then they all flip over again into a flat attitude. Two new, brighter UFOs join the formation, and the lights of all eight objects blink out then come on again. They all speed westward (Nash estimates 6,000–12,000 mph) and climb in a graceful 45° arc. The entire sighting lasts only 15 seconds. Possible corroboration comes from a sighting in Camden, New Jersey, although the date is uncertain. July 16 — 9:35 a.m. US Coast Guard photographer Seaman [Shell R. Alpert](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/9302407/shell-r_-alpert&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729142011&usg=AOvVaw2rsBuQLUDNF40KG58dG8VF) sees several bright lights through a window screen (no glass) from his position inside the photo lab at Coast Guard Air Station Salem \[now Winter Island Marine Park\], Massachusetts, while cleaning a camera. He watches them for 5–6 seconds, calls out to Hospitalman 1st Class [Thomas E. Flaherty](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/652942/thomas-e-flaherty&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729142322&usg=AOvVaw1wsupLLdnD__FT5yLj26gg) from sick bay to see them. The objects dim then brighten suddenly. Alpert grabs a camera and films 4 roughly elliptical irregular blobs of light in formation through the screen, on Super XX cut film 4-by-5-inch format. The lights disappear suddenly in a flash. The photo is explained as showing reflections of light sources from inside the building, but this ignores the fact that the window is open, and the camera is not pointed through glass. (UFOEv, [p. 88](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D100%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729142709&usg=AOvVaw0Ni1s5K_5P4fx4vE2UMhra); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729142941&usg=AOvVaw2ZaRh6kW57feSAAT0FU0MF), p. 151; Joe Nyman and Barry Greenwood, “The July 1952 Coast Guard Photo Revisited,” IUR 26, no. 4 (Winter 2001–2002): 3–5, 25–30; Michael D. Lampen, “Mystery Alpert Objects,” IUR 27, no. 2 (Summer 2002): 27; “[The Photographer’s Tale,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.saturdaynightuforia.com/html/articles/articlehtml/thephotographerstale.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729143348&usg=AOvVaw3kWSNqYKe5S_MRP7b9JEf5)” Saturday Night Uforia, December 3, 2012)

July 16 — 9:00 p.m. [Paul R. Hill](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_R._Hill&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729143618&usg=AOvVaw3baoiyhZpLNuOq8VU_bQOP), an aeronautical research engineer, is watching the sky with his future wife, Frances Hoback, on Chesapeake Avenue (near LaSalle Avenue) in Hampton, Virginia, when he notices two amber- colored lights coming in over Hampton Roads from the south at 500 mph. They slow down and make a U turn, moving side by side until they revolve around each other at a high rate of speed in a tight circle 200–300 feet in diameter. A third UFO comes racing up from the direction of Virginia Beach and falls in several hundred feet below the other two, making a V formation. A fourth UFO comes in from up the James River and joins the group, which heads south at 500 mph. “Their ability to make tight circling turns was amazing.” Around 9:03 p.m., the four UFOs have moved out of sight to the south. (NICAP, “[Two Pairs of Objects Maneuver Overhead](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520716hampton_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729143896&usg=AOvVaw23W1AMMCXHILTntxLUpN1H)”; \[[Blue](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/520716hampton_docs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729144094&usg=AOvVaw3wC9LN5Dn4HAQqV2_wqwxd) [Book documents](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/520716hampton_docs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729144296&usg=AOvVaw1vb5NUxHsthxOQRmTXaOM7)\]; UFOEv, [p. 57](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Dmdp.39015006091691%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D70%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729144507&usg=AOvVaw2_5ANF6EJbk3NgVuLQWNGR); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729144704&usg=AOvVaw0awYDcZ73NtTB8kWPNMmwo)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729144860&usg=AOvVaw26v0sUD18iwahbvsixllaE) p. 150)

July 17 — 6:30 p.m. A woman leaving Yarmouth Harbour, Nova Scotia, on the SS Yarmouth watches seven silvery objects in an inverted triangular formation for 2 minutes. They hover momentarily, descend slowly, and disappear. (Chris Rutkowski, Canada’s UFOs: Declassified, August Night, 2022, pp. 268–269)

July 17 or 18 — 10:10 p.m. T/Sgt. Thurman C. Mahone and A/3c [Gene A. Jennings](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/835391/gene-arthur-jennings&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729145319&usg=AOvVaw0Goqs4NxHcGtTXleAVqf2A) at Lockbourne AFB \[now Rickenbacker Air National Guard Base\] in Lockbourne, Ohio, see an amber-colored, elliptical-shaped object with

* * *

a small flame at the rear, periodically increasing in brightness. It moves swiftly, giving off a resonant beating sound. (NICAP, “[July 18, 1952: Lockbourne, Ohio](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/lockbourne520718dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729145690&usg=AOvVaw38gIm7fzPyVIm_NI0_y0KZ)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729145890&usg=AOvVaw2otM-wBn4-HIS96h0zm_n6)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729146057&usg=AOvVaw3uWBafjJfEPvF11W9FVirS) p. 151)

July 18 — Early morning. American Airlines pilot Capt. Paul L. Carpenter, First Officer George Fell, and Flight Engineer Quilici watch several dull-red objects with a “yellowish tinge” speeding around in the air at an altitude of 25,000– 30,000 feet near Denver, Colorado, during a non-stop flight from Los Angeles to Chicago. A maximum of three objects are seen at one time over a 2-minute period. Carpenter says they seem to be about 100 miles away. The first object is moving south by southeast. One minute after it disappears, two more come into view going westward and another one eastward. “The two traveling westward disappeared about two seconds then reappeared traveling eastward.” (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1952, June–July 20th](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Jun-July-20.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729146375&usg=AOvVaw1xTx5d8qtBRSHWy0lmHQ1N)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Jun-July-20.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729146554&usg=AOvVaw28as8f4mzt3JwD5d9U7Wvx) The Author, 1986, p. 60)

July 18 — Capt. [Edward Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729146846&usg=AOvVaw0-d8hbZxwAtmmM8eKD9dWK) tells the press in Dayton, Ohio, that ground radar has tracked UFOs at speeds of 1,500– 2,000 mph, that jet fighters scrambled to intercept them have failed, and that “persons making these reports actually see something in the sky,” but the Air Force does not know what they are. [(“‘Saucer’ Sightings Spur](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93389332/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729147086&usg=AOvVaw3RAijXjOQ_rbUlMRgiqk46) [AF’s Drive](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93389332/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729147274&usg=AOvVaw3DRtde_NhDQ_PZgxzaK99V) [to End Mystery](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93389470/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729147458&usg=AOvVaw1ntSGN0jMpBev8WCQwuQQp),” Dayton (Ohio) Journal Herald, July 18, 1952, pp. 1, 10; Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Jun-July-20.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729147739&usg=AOvVaw3C5S2bGth4qkoMLYoW5Xle) [History: 1952, June–July 20th](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Jun-July-20.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729147949&usg=AOvVaw3f0HhSwkqRzH5kg002FXax)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Jun-July-20.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729148124&usg=AOvVaw3TV06TC2qyBTbORCUddmlh) The Author, 1986, p. 66)

July 18 — 6:10 p.m. André Frégnale is hiking near Lac Chauvet, Puy-de-Dôme, France, when he sees a disc flying west to east in a straight line at constant speed. He immediately takes two photos when the object is at its largest apparent size, then two others when it is moving away to his left. It is in view for 50 seconds. (“[Une soucoupe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/press/lemeridional25jul1952.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729148454&usg=AOvVaw1TvWSCOtGrxQdv9G_lAFjz) [volante,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/press/lemeridional25jul1952.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729148662&usg=AOvVaw3ciQ2j8gaxvSNGojC9YB_Z)” Le Méridional, July 25, 1952, pp. 1, 8; Pierre Guérin, “[A Scientific Analysis of Four Photographs of a](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.scientificexploration.org/docs/8/jse_08_4_guerin.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729148973&usg=AOvVaw1wmjjUJqWaghRcDGI4Gv4B) [Flying Disk near Lac Chauvet (France),](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.scientificexploration.org/docs/8/jse_08_4_guerin.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729149192&usg=AOvVaw1WwzCpCXzBk7mR3qjSWQAv)” Journal of Scientific Exploration 8, no. 4 (1994): 447–469; Alain Delmon, “[Les Cas Solides: Lac Chauvet, France, 1952,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://adelmon.free.fr/Lac_Chauvet.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729149453&usg=AOvVaw2aaeOtFmES3yhBkwbN33cq)” Les OVNIs: Intelligences non-humaines ou mythe moderne?, December 26, 2003)

July 18 — 9:45 p.m. Three Air Force officers and four enlisted men at Patrick AFB, near Cocoa Beach, Florida, see a series of hovering and maneuvering red-orange lights moving in a variety of directions. (NICAP, “[Hovering and](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520718patrickAFB_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729149732&usg=AOvVaw2am9vj8IScQRSu_WoTAAsA) [Maneuvering Lights](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520718patrickAFB_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729149938&usg=AOvVaw0CEIcWlKj6niFlGJqtsAGw)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729150125&usg=AOvVaw1W7FoCIjot61iGF5F9AP_I)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729150279&usg=AOvVaw3BHlJ6RL3qRWHhJHZ-sXcf) p. 151)

July 19 — 2:55 a.m. An experienced civilian pilot watches an elliptical-shaped object with a light fringe over Williston, North Dakota, for 5 minutes. It descends fast and makes a 360° then a 180° turn. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729150649&usg=AOvVaw1vYiKxG-9ARF6yAasXx1s2), p. 151)

July 19 — [Lincoln LaPaz](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lincoln_LaPaz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729150931&usg=AOvVaw1Q8yntP66_Wr1iEdRDtwyh) tells newspapermen in Albuquerque, New Mexico, that UFOs “can reverse directions and cruise back and forth; they travel at high speeds in wide sweeping circles…. They travel at high altitudes and can be followed as long as 3½ minutes.” (“[Luminous Objects Flooding Southwest Skies Not Shooting Stars or](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/7924767/albuquerque-journal/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729151188&usg=AOvVaw210cKpLA7IQPtz1jFxeEnh) [Meteorites, Says LaPaz,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/7924767/albuquerque-journal/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729151390&usg=AOvVaw1mlfV95tQspTF9ot8ELxMw)” July 20, 1952, p. 1; Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1952, June–July 20th](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Jun-July-20.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729151614&usg=AOvVaw1CrSoi4jrnCxWFP61ZXlJW), The Author, 1986, p. 67)

July 19 — 10:00 a.m. Engineer John A. Anderson and other technicians at the Savannah River Atomic Site near Aiken, South Carolina, watch a greenish glowing object dart back and forth silently and erratically at high speed above the plant. It is in view for 2 minutes, moving constantly and changing direction at sharp angles. The object disappears over the horizon at “tremendous velocity.” (NICAP, “[Multiple Witnesses Observe Strange](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520719savannah_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729151934&usg=AOvVaw1Yo6xCsuhw1khX61vmleus) [Maneuvering Object](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520719savannah_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729152175&usg=AOvVaw2gX-695qxTCSkaDkVHaeIQ)”; James E. McDonald, “[Statement on Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23multiwit&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729152388&usg=AOvVaw2CXrfW5Zy0ySaTa2Mz-BEV)” in Symposium on Unidentified Flying Objects, Hearings, US House Committee on Science and Astronautics, 90th Cong., 2nd Sess., July 29, 1968, p. 51; Nukes 47–48)

July 19 — 4:30 p.m. Agricultural engineer Pedro Bardi and others on a farm in the Madre de Dios region of Peru see a UFO flying at 325 feet shortly after their short-wave radio goes dead. Bardi says it is a bit smaller than a DC-3 and is making a buzzing sound. It shows up 4 minutes later at Puerto Maldonado, 75 miles away, and Customs Administrator Domingo Troncosco photographs it. The photo shows an elongated object trailing smoke, passing over the top of a tree and in front of a cumulus cloud. (Curt Collins, “[The Case of the Smoking Saucer,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.jimmoseley.com/2014/11/the-case-of-the-smoking-saucer/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729152770&usg=AOvVaw2ZSRcgsSxCFDaCWnvkPIy-)” In Honor of Jim Moseley, November 3, 2014; Curt Collins, “[Jim Moseley: The Case of the Smoking Saucer,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2018/08/jim-moseley-case-of-smoking-saucer.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729153007&usg=AOvVaw3xI92KzAmy1svgDrM2MOJh)” The Saucers That Time Forgot, August 18, 2018)

July 19 — 10:00 p.m. Six luminous round objects are seen by a Chicago, Illinois, woman moving horizontally and vertically as they cavort around in the sky. The same night, a UFO is seen by three witnesses at the Ground Observer Corps post at the city hall in Elgin, Illinois. (Loren E. Gross, [UFOs, a History: 1952, June–July 20th](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-Jun-July-20.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729153315&usg=AOvVaw1ZDoEWD8eqMkky_S8-TzhD), The Author, 1986, p. 68)

July 19 — 11:35 p.m. USAF pilot Capt. [Charles John Powley](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/33034027/charles-john-powley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729153619&usg=AOvVaw2XeGQoco2BYWf3-4phrQ3z) and his wife [Janet](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/145064742/janet-powley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729153876&usg=AOvVaw0GCHCEN1We0Xn1tWJ0t0o-) see two star-like lights maneuver, hover, and speed up for 5–7 minutes over Elkins Park, Pennsylvania. (NICAP, “[Three Groups of Witnesses See Strange](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520719lavalette_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729154107&usg=AOvVaw2eT7xfQZkqN0ih0z_CyFMb) [Lights](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520719lavalette_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729154292&usg=AOvVaw1X7twOop3Umbzcy8m8XimJ)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729154480&usg=AOvVaw02dTbzMEcLEAJmg3XYJK4V)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729154658&usg=AOvVaw0JLF24HjmvGVLfLUoc2rva) p. 151; Michael D. Swords, “Intelligent Motions,” IUR 33, no. 1 (March 2010): 12, 15)

July 19–20 — 11:40 p.m. Air traffic controller Edward Nugent at Washington National \[now Ronald Reagan National\] Airport’s Air Route Traffic Control (ARTC) in D.C. picks up a formation of seven objects on his long-range radar. They are southeast of Andrews AFB \[now Joint Base Andrews\] in Prince George’s County, Maryland, moving along at 100–130 mph. Two of the targets suddenly accelerate and vanish off the scope within seconds.

* * *

One apparently reaches a speed of 7,000 mph. A second, shorter-range radar in the airport control tower (operated by [Howard Cocklin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/68160004/howard-arthur-cocklin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729155140&usg=AOvVaw1Wnn0rjC1WF5_unnnjIbIB) and [Joseph Zacko Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/158964070/joseph-charles-zacko&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729155414&usg=AOvVaw17Qf5NJDLbzH95ME0HSRR-)) and another at Andrews AFB has also tracked the objects. For 6 hours, between 8 and 10 UFOs are tracked on radar. Senior Air Traffic Controller Harry G. Barnes says that “They followed no set course, were not in any formation, and we only seemed to be able to track them for about three miles at a time…. I can safely deduce that they performed gyrations which no known aircraft could perform.” Several Capitol Airlines pilots (one of them Capt. S. C. “Casey” Pierman) see the objects visually as white or orange lights in restricted air space over the White House and Capitol. Ground observers at Andrews (Capt.

Harold C. May, Staff/Sgt Charles Davenport) watch red or orange lights. Radar and visual sightings are also taking place at Bolling AFB \[now Joint Base Anaconda-Bolling\] in Washington, D.C. By 3:00 a.m., the UFOs are all gone, just as two F-94 interceptors arrive belatedly from New Castle AFB \[now New Castle Air National Guard Base\] in Delaware. The jets depart, and the UFOs return, observed by Capt. Howard Dermott, a Capitol Airlines pilot, and Sgt. Davenport at Andrews. Radar trackings continue, the last at 5:30 a.m. Civilian radio engineer E. W. Chambers sees five huge discs circling in a loose formation; they tilt upward and leave in a steep ascent. Blips appear on radar for at least another day, until the evening of July 20. (Wikipedia, “[1952 Washington,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1952_Washington%252C_D.C._UFO_incident&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729155785&usg=AOvVaw14P-r6xweVyu6r3kskEZGO)

[D.C. UFO incident](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1952_Washington%252C_D.C._UFO_incident&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729156029&usg=AOvVaw2kgh2MXxG4NZCRYwLoo_u2)”; NICAP, “[The Washington National Sightings](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520719wns_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729156223&usg=AOvVaw3AS3wTUCrktwZ3Eg5BI5Js)”; NICAP, “[Andrews Tower Radar Confirms](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520720andrewsafb_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729156413&usg=AOvVaw37OudHQXeD2WB8pwM5FK4C) [Washington Target](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520720andrewsafb_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729156609&usg=AOvVaw23rTpeQtECRtxDHqfGCsJG)”; “Washington’s Blips: ‘Somethings’ over the Capital Are Traced on Radar,” Life, August 4, 1952, pp. 39–40; Ruppelt, [pp. 158–161](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/158/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729156881&usg=AOvVaw1-RHIgoMIMKkgnRFWXUzA0); James E. McDonald, “[Statement on Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23radar&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729157100&usg=AOvVaw0ExMNuxuzfUx737Kb8Skth)” in Symposium on Unidentified Flying Objects, Hearings, US House Committee on Science and Astronautics, 90th Cong., 2nd Sess., July 29, 1968, pp. 71–72; Clark III 1250–1252; Swords 154–155; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729157356&usg=AOvVaw1lcV3paZgIKaCFJYR_0hwe), p. 151; Condon, [pp.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/152/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729157561&usg=AOvVaw0Eec9Gh91pCZ2a3WPfG8Co) [153–157](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/152/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729157777&usg=AOvVaw0gFy9t4e_72z9N9I5Vb5dz)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/152/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729157953&usg=AOvVaw2FKC0pQsJeHvCLn8Ub7h84) [862–867](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/862/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729158170&usg=AOvVaw3L-jdFle5J7GO0FonN5Sj_); Kevin D. Randle, Invasion Washington: UFOs over the Capitol, HarperTorch, 2001, pp. 32– 58; Michael D. Swords, GrassRoots UFOs: Case Reports from the Timmerman Files, Fund for UFO Research, 2005, p. 139; Shoot 28–34)

July 19 — 12:00 midnight. A part-time farmer named Constantine and a hired hand named Davis are curing tobacco when they see two cigar-shaped objects—one hovering, the other moving to the east—for 3–4 minutes near Centerville, Virginia. Both objects are translucent, lit from within, and emit an exhaust from one end. They both ascend until they disappear. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729158663&usg=AOvVaw0mtxhO3-KEMYEx93JCE2SF)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729158832&usg=AOvVaw2WlRn6_kosQa1PXmSxe-DD) p. 151)

July 21 — 10:00 a.m. [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729159088&usg=AOvVaw0V0c-XnVz8lUFoJdeowOUT) first hears about the National Airport sightings in D.C. when he buys a newspaper in the Washington National Airport terminal. He has been to Andrews AFB in Maryland the day before with his boss Col. [Donald L. Bower](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49126583/donald-langlitz-bower&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729159337&usg=AOvVaw1EFFJYJQu0N9AAsg_O80gL)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49126583/donald-langlitz-bower&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729159509&usg=AOvVaw3eb0NIoNZkB8oWqdS97dI4) and no one had said anything. At 1:00 p.m., Maj. [Dewey Fournet](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/ufochop2.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729159705&usg=AOvVaw1MSvd23q-lq0i7M7KFJHFq) calls Ruppelt to come to a briefing with Capt. Berkow, a USAF intelligence officer from Bolling AFB in D.C. Ruppelt hears that President [Truman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_S._Truman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729159951&usg=AOvVaw07Eeeze4DRkD7yKtCK2NG1) is personally interested and wants a full investigation, but Bower orders Ruppelt to return to Wright- Patterson AFB in Ohio. (Ruppelt, [pp. 158–159](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/158/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729160192&usg=AOvVaw2XZFErX7s7n1K_8LkHx6oT); Thomas Tulien, ed., [Proceedings of the Sign Historical Group](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/Sign-Historical-Group-Workshop-Proceedings.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729160402&usg=AOvVaw28pRRWm-HawjltMdD9OQLi) [UFO History Workshop](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/Sign-Historical-Group-Workshop-Proceedings.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729160596&usg=AOvVaw0C2oaLjT_xdYvY0m9elTrU)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/Sign-Historical-Group-Workshop-Proceedings.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729160765&usg=AOvVaw2bPXOBBXanPqtfr0z8jWNM) Sign Historical Group, November 2001, pp. 46–47)

July 21 — 10:30 a.m. Radar used to measure wind velocity in the upper atmosphere at Dobbins Air Force Base, Marietta, Georgia, detects an unusual object flying at 50,000 feet. Observing the blip are four radar technicians who state that “it could have been an electromagnetic phenomenon but they did not believe it was.” A second blip appears on the radar moving toward the wind-finding weather balloon and passing through it three separate times. USAF officials report “in private conversations” that the object moves at 1,200 mph, slows considerably for 3–5 minutes, then disappears. The Civilian Defense director in Atlanta, [George M. “Pup” Phillips](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/170666077/george-marshall-phillips&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729161141&usg=AOvVaw1v9o6bP4XJsMMqBIG3xBb8), receives a report of the object but has “no details.” Col. [Murray C. Woodbury](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/60053447/murray-clarke-woodbury&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729161353&usg=AOvVaw20uEOsi3IVJIA7C4wy_7Df)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/60053447/murray-clarke-woodbury&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729161561&usg=AOvVaw2HyCoyXkQcWx4Lbu9CuvwD) commander of the 35th Air Division at Dobbins, checks with “defense officials in Washington” before telling the press that such reports are sent to the Air Technical Intelligence Center (Project Blue Book) in Dayton, Ohio, for evaluation. Surprisingly, he admits, “We try to intercept such objects and identify them, but so far we have been unsuccessful.” (NICAP, “[Blip Makes](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520721dobbinsAFBdir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729161806&usg=AOvVaw0id8E5EEtFlcJnfgbLUE74) [Passes on Wind-Finding Target](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520721dobbinsAFBdir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729161997&usg=AOvVaw0zozvVnYyV2h_sxaKhWDZV)”; Loren E. Gross, [The Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1952](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-July-21-31-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729162236&usg=AOvVaw0OjI14IdOCylmOLp6tF6Ny) [July 21st–31st, Supplemental Notes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-July-21-31-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729162446&usg=AOvVaw06F--SCRVxIFz6F7olh1gl), The Author, 2001, p. 3; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729162692&usg=AOvVaw1ycRJ5cNJ62reJzqPuoFJl), p. 152)

July 21 — 6:30 p.m. USAF pilot Capt. [Edward E. Dougher](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8769632/edward-ervin-dougher&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729162965&usg=AOvVaw2bTGt4jyqRJfnNWaSboiFm) and WAF Lt. [Josephine J. Stong](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://images.library.wisc.edu/History/EFacs/GerRecon/omg1951April/reference/history.omg1951april.i0024.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729163234&usg=AOvVaw3t225SAg9EPHqPKWFogsku), separated by one mile on the ground in Wiesbaden, Germany, see 4 bright yellowish lights. Dougher watches them separate, with two climbing and two flying away level in the opposite direction. His wife [Barbara](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/131544832/barbara-dougher&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729163456&usg=AOvVaw0rFYUb-_kui4N3w77WtO6i) joins him as they fly away. Stong sees two reddish lights fly in opposite directions for 10–15 minutes. (NICAP, “[Separated Witnesses Observe Maneuvering](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520721wiesbaden_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729163746&usg=AOvVaw2tUQ6KwqZNlADU5dZ5tJT0) [Lights](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520721wiesbaden_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729163940&usg=AOvVaw0RJ8vBLsr8qP550HsKEg_0)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729164130&usg=AOvVaw3n4NpJQtew7zKLAG-pFIaH)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729164300&usg=AOvVaw17VuLzfgLkhHjqtoOoszug) p. 152; Michael D. Swords, “Intelligent Motions,” IUR 33, no. 1 (March 2010): 12, 15)

July 22 — At Wright-Patterson AFB, [Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729164663&usg=AOvVaw0T5E9pBBDdCUnNm4MCTunt) meets with ATIC electronics specialist Capt. [Roy L. James](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/feaf/feafintros.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729164907&usg=AOvVaw30LvUK50TOyNjLa7GWK-pz) (who harbors a “personal dislike for UFOs”). He tells Ruppelt that weather conditions caused the Washington radar returns. ()

July 22 — Pikes Peak Broadcasting Company President Joseph H. Rohrer gives a lecture (one of a series) on flying saucers at a chamber of commerce meeting in Pueblo, Colorado. He mixes a few genuine cases with some crashed saucer fiction, claiming that 7 discs have been retrieved by the US government, three of them forced down in Montana. One occupant has survived, he says, a little man 3 feet tall who is later kept alive in a secret site in

* * *

California. Rohrer claims he has been inside a 100-foot-diameter disc in 1942, but he has made up these stories for entertainment purposes. (“Flying Saucer Talk Startles Chamber Membership Meeting,” Pueblo (Colo.) Chieftain, July 23, 1952, p. 3; Keyhoe, FS from OS, [pp. 111–113](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsos/chVII.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729165501&usg=AOvVaw3Ei2Es832XOw08cl4Rhfwl); James W. Moseley and Karl T. Pflock, Shockingly Close to the Truth! Confessions of a Grave-Robbing Ufologist, Prometheus, 2002, pp. 90–92; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1942-00-00-usa-california.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729165810&usg=AOvVaw2LQsPMC0PgEiruMSXCJXMe)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1942-00-00-usa-california.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729165990&usg=AOvVaw3dKkAw-5lwRAex6b5uPeCP) August 6, 2018)

July 22 — 10:00 p.m. Eubert T. White and his wife see three silvery objects whizzing across the sky above Worcester, Massachusetts, “like planes in attack formation.” One of the objects has a bluish glow in the front and a reddish tint behind it. (“Strange Objects in Worcester Sky,” Lawrence (Mass.) Eagle, July 23, 1952; Loren E. Gross, [The](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-July-21-31-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729166426&usg=AOvVaw1IISrXJiiAk26e5rhJdafx) [Fifth Horseman of the Apocalypse: UFOs, a History: 1952 July 21st–31st, Supplemental Notes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/collections/ufos-a-history/pdf/GROSS-1952-July-21-31-SN.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729166770&usg=AOvVaw2V88uXYuzy1x9-OoA9Uhlj), The Author, 2001, p. 14; Shoot 36)

July 22 — 10:20 p.m. A bluish-green UFO is seen over Boston, Massachusetts, and a few minutes later it is picked up by GCI radar. When Ground Control vectors an F-94 toward the UFO, the pilot sees the UFO near Braintree and locks on to it with his own radar. But the object easily leaves the jet behind. (NICAP, “[F-94B Chases Object /](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520722braintree_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729167323&usg=AOvVaw0BAKWyQX7BENYQnGN09DgE) [With Airborne Radar Tracking](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520722braintree_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729167603&usg=AOvVaw2xRTZjA2NydGTKBiuAL7yG)”; Keyhoe, FS from OS, [p. 67](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/books/fsos/chIV.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729167927&usg=AOvVaw1MPoqpBNOU9D094TTlgcSf); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729168206&usg=AOvVaw36ldlzksrBrg869jp9dd8X), pp. 154–155)

July 22–23 — 10:30 p.m. An air traffic control tower operator at MacDill AFB in Tampa, Florida, watches for 30 minutes a red-greenish-blue object to the west-southwest at about 45° elevation with 2 other objects to the north of it, smaller and lower in elevation. He sights another object to the south-southeast about 30° elevation at 11:30 p.m. MacDill radar tracks an object at 12:03 a.m. 37 miles away at 41,200 feet altitude heading almost directly toward the base at 532 mph. It also tracks an object to the south-southeast at an altitude of 41,000 feet (reportedly Navy and CAA radars also track the object). At 12:08 a.m., the pilot and copilot of a B-29 bomber on landing approach are vectored by MacDill tower operator to investigate the UFO. They see a high-speed object at 40,000 feet heading towards MacDill and traveling faster than the B-29. The B-29 fire control radar locks onto the object and prepares to fire just as the UFO changes course and disappears at 4,600 mph. Four airmen at the MacDill radar site see an object as it passes nearly overhead. MacDill radar loses the object at about 12:15 a.m. Civilians in Tampa also see two yellowish-orange discs maneuvering around the air base. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729168701&usg=AOvVaw1coP7Mffi1xbsTMFHxGcTN)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729168916&usg=AOvVaw0Hqp8Ybx34y-dQr4TiLIfh) p. 156; Tampa (Fla.) Daily Times, July 23, 1952, p. 1)

July 22–23 — 10:50 p.m. Crews of several USAF F-94 jet interceptors from Dover AFB, Delaware, make 13 visual sightings and one radar tracking of blue-white lights around Trenton, New Jersey, continuing until 12:45 a.m. White, green, and blue lights are seen by ground observers and F-94 pilots moving in arcs and blinking out suddenly. One F-94 crew gets a radar lock-on from 30,000 feet away of an object the size of an F-94. At 9,000 feet distance, the object makes a sharp right turn, suddenly drops in height, and disappears. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729169300&usg=AOvVaw3bn3o14UYVAv5HhGPSPZF0)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729169460&usg=AOvVaw3KdlNH6e8AlJXClnIBtv0t) p. 156)

July 23 — 2:15 a.m. Seaman [Henry J. Arnpriester](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/72766295/henry-j-arnpriester&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729169733&usg=AOvVaw0nRzqITkmmzR2Clv4WJI2d) is on watch at Nahant (Massachusetts) Coast Guard Station \[now closed\] when he sees two bluish lights approximately 5 feet in diameter. They appear as flat, disc-shaped objects having no aerodynamic features and move without sound or exhaust trail at a speed faster than a four-engine airliner at an altitude of 1,100 to 2,000 feet. When they are approximately 1.5 miles from the point of observation, they execute an extremely sharp turn similar to the path of a ball bouncing off a wall. (Lt. Col. Robert S. Jones, “[Spot Intelligence Report,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/NARA-PBB89-1103-1105.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729170012&usg=AOvVaw1OOcnoz81CO0_G_f72ldcW)” July 29, 1952; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729170203&usg=AOvVaw3oct9Sy9GVsb41EiOZ9a2O)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729170371&usg=AOvVaw2yNBL0Ysu0gK4LC3fEsInT) p. 156)

July 23 — 7:36 a.m. US Navy radar at Jamestown, Rhode Island, tracks a high-speed target heading north at 42,000 feet.

It is confirmed by ADC radar at Camp Hero \[now closed\] at Montauk Point, New York. F-94s and F-86s are scrambled unsuccessfully from Westover AFB \[now Westover Air National Guard Base\] in Chicopee, Massachusetts. (NICAP, “[Jets Scrambled / High Speed Object at 45,000ʹ Feet](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520723jamestown_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729170699&usg=AOvVaw2kBSvFnlKnJz4FjZB6JfwW)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729170889&usg=AOvVaw0AcZitpytndrmhsNEGF4yO)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729171042&usg=AOvVaw0UYxOv2EQMWfLNvH4Q8Kui) p. 156)

July 23 — 8:40 a.m. The crews of three USAF F-94 jet interceptors see a large silver object, shaped like a long pear with 2–3 squares beneath it, flying at 170–210 mph over Pottstown, Pennsylvania. A smaller object, delta-shaped or swept-back, flies around it at 1,150-1,720 mph. (\[[Blue Book document](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/MAXW-PBB12-1174.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729171306&usg=AOvVaw2_CxrJDB-W-tLn5duKAiQu)\]; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729171497&usg=AOvVaw3tAR-3HrRXXIRpYXsDqtrx)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729171649&usg=AOvVaw0ifUh4Wt1kbDK53foizAEw) p. 157)

July 23 — 12:50 p.m. Crews of two USAF F-94 jet interceptors flying at 35,000–46,000 feet altitude near Altoona, Pennsylvania, see three cylindrical objects in a vertical-stack formation fly at an altitude of 50,000–80,000 feet for 20 minutes. (NICAP, “[July 23, 1952: Altoona, Penna.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://nicap.org/altoona520723dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729171914&usg=AOvVaw2Xyk9wPkoCazSDC32Sr_En)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729172098&usg=AOvVaw2QNkoxKV0kdavQ_dmHr2i_), p. 157)

July 23 — 7:00–8:00 p.m. Owner Edwin C. Johnston and more than 20 employees of Aircraft Hydroforming at Culver City, California, see a bright silvery elliptical object that moves northwest over the Northrup aircraft plant in nearby Hawthorne, then stops and hovers. Two small discs emerge and circle around the area before rejoining the mother ship. The object then climbs straight up out of sight at tremendous speed. (“[Aircraft Co. Owner Sees](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93397593/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729172372&usg=AOvVaw0Fq6Sl8nUUyBS-oXCFM0nH) [‘Discs’ Four Nights in Row,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/93397593/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729172562&usg=AOvVaw36MzGdt5PeJPGtAojC9L94)” Redlands (Calif.) Daily Facts, July 24, 1952, p. 9)

July 23 — 7:15 p.m. Many witnesses at Lockbourne AFB \[now Rickenbacker Air National Guard Base\] in Lockbourne, Ohio, including visiting Capt. Eugene E. McManus from Turner AFB \[now Naval Air Station Albany\] in Albany, Georgia, observe four round, fluorescent white objects hovering near the base at 75,000 feet. An Air force pilot named Capt. Swartz in Flight Service at Wright-Patterson AFB, Dayton, Ohio, radios in the report that the objects

* * *

are balloons. Two F-84 jets are scrambled at 8:15 p.m. and identify them as a balloon cluster. The objects, seen over many other areas of central Ohio (Capt. [Edward J. Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729173038&usg=AOvVaw3iWu2vhTJS77V8DVCrujM0) says he was called out to see it over Wright- Patterson), are probably USAF reconnaissance balloons sent up from Clinton County Airport in Wilmington, Ohio. (NICAP, “[July 23, 1952, Lockbourne, Ohio, UFO Report](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/lockbourne520723dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729173274&usg=AOvVaw3PmdwXMgbmvr8W_Yz0bsZr)”; Clark III 395–398)

July 23 — Night. Contactee [Orfeo Angelucci](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orfeo_Angelucci&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729173535&usg=AOvVaw15sIewg-1DPFd4Q19Nk7uz) feels compelled to walk over the Glendale-Hyperion Bridge in Glendale, California. He feels an odd sensation and suddenly sees in front of him a soap-bubble-like object that turns into a metallic craft. He gets aboard and is taken on his first trip into outer space. (Orfeo Angelucci, The Secret of the Saucers, Amherst Press, 1955, [pp. 18–36](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/secretofsaucers00ange/page/18/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729173934&usg=AOvVaw1Wvwu0tMKNm_ae7U9xDHFK))

July 24 — 3:40 p.m. Two USAF pilots, Lt. Col. John L. McGinn and Lt. Col. [John R. Barton](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/63852700/john-r_-barton&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729174419&usg=AOvVaw0FrJBWR2upU-nMfMq8SVTf), are flying a B-25 out of Hamilton AFB \[now closed\] in Novato, California, for Colorado Springs. They are over Carson Sink, Nevada, at 11,000 feet when they see three unknown objects make a left bank and fly to within 400–600 yards of the plane. They are three bright silver, delta-wing craft with no tails and no canopies. The pilots see a clean upper triangular wing with a definite ridge that runs from the nose to the tail. They estimate the speed as at least three times that of any conventional jet. (Wikipedia, “[Carson Sink UFO incident](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carson_Sink_UFO_incident&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729174865&usg=AOvVaw1yLtwv8xVn1pmYwt7aQhE1)”; NICAP, “B-26 Crew Encounters 3 Triangular UFOs”; NICAP, “[The Carson Sink Case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/july24.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729175377&usg=AOvVaw2IQcRf736AJhMVBP3tgbXC)”; Sparks, p. 157; Ruppelt, [pp. 10–12](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/10/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729176343&usg=AOvVaw3qOVzEMbLiISSUQwi6c9I5); Michael Hall, “When UFOs Were Serious Business: Then and Today,” IUR 28, no. 4 (Winter 2003–2004): 5; Michael D. Swords, “Intelligent Motions,” IUR 33, no. 1 (March 2010): 12, 15)

July 25 (or April 25) — 3:00 a.m. Carlo Rossi is on his way to a fishing spot on the Serchio river near San Pietro a Vico, Lucca, Italy. He notices an odd light above the river and finds that it belongs to an enormous disc-shaped object with a transparent dome. It is about 82 feet in diameter and apparently taking up water through a long tube. The object is standing in the river on three legs and has a ladder reaching down next to the tube. Rossi thinks it is hovering by means of propellors. Suddenly a porthole opens, and a human figure looks out and notices him. Rossi begins to leave, but a green ray passes above his head and he feels an electric shock. The object takes off and disappears to the west. (“[Le Nostre Analisi: Precisazioni sul Caso di S. Pietro e Vico (1952),](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Italy/Notiziario%2520UFO%2520(CUN)/Notiziario%2520UFO%2520-%25201975%252007-09%2520No%252067.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729177271&usg=AOvVaw0l_AmDEI61QX_YYf8K1xd4)” Notiziario UFO, no. 67 (July/Sept. 1975): 4–9; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1952-07-25-italy-sanpietro.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729177808&usg=AOvVaw2MGE09t3fgMPolqfrnmucF)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1952-07-25-italy-sanpietro.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729178130&usg=AOvVaw0LqX4IEpGqsK-zUgLnJOa9) September 12, 2006; 1Pinotti 42–46)

July 25 — Capt. J. W. Titus of the 140th Wing Medical Group sees two oval-shaped objects flying in formation at 400– 600 mph in Portales, New Mexico. They are silent and leave no vapor trail. At one point, they make an abrupt 80° turn and fly off to the north. (Nukes 85–86)

July 26–27 — 8:15 p.m. Flying saucers return to the nation’s capital, only one week after a massive number of radar- visual UFO sightings above restricted air space in Washington, D.C. At 8:15 p.m., pilot Capt. Berkow and a stewardess of a National Airlines flight near Washington National Airport \[now Ronald Reagan National\] see several objects resembling the glow of a cigarette high above them. The lights move at around 100 mph. Soon, the airport and Andrews AFB in Maryland are tracking a dozen UFOs throughout much of the sky, all traveling 90– 100 mph. By midnight, two F-94s are scrambled from New Castle AFB in Delaware to intercept them. National Airport staff hustle newspaper reporters away from the air traffic control tower, saying that interceptions are classified (but Project Blue Book chief Capt. [Edward J. Ruppelt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_J._Ruppelt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729178842&usg=AOvVaw3e9ZSc0rgrdkq6MaKsk8O9) suspects that the Air Force does not want the press around when they finally get a good look at a saucer). The UFOs are seen on radar for 2 hours, but when the jets approach, the blips disappear. When the pilots return to base, they show up again. Reports are reaching Langley AFB about rotating objects that give off alternating colors over Newport News, Virginia. Another F-94 is scrambled, the pilot gets a radar lock, and the target speeds away. At National Airport, the objects reappear shortly before dawn, and two more F-94s are scrambled. The pilots obtain radar locks; again, the objects speed away. USAF press spokesman [Albert M. Chop](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sohp.us/interviews/bios/chop-albert.php&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729179311&usg=AOvVaw34h8DLi85l3uyfQcPGkvO0) is in the airport radar tower and notes that everyone there believes the targets are “very probably caused by solid metallic objects.” One F-94 pilot, Lieut. William Patterson, says, “I saw several bright lights. I was at my maximum speed, but even then I had no closing speed.” A USAF air intelligence report later states that the radar crew is emphatic that the returns are solid and not temperature inversions. In 1969, however, Colorado project physicist [Gordon David Thayer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://rr0.org/people/t/ThayerGordonD/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729179779&usg=AOvVaw3h2W1pBVa75vSN2WyuWkSJ) concludes that the radar events involved temperature inversions. He believes the visual sightings were caused by meteors and scintillating stars. University of Arizona atmospheric physicist [James McDonald](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_E._McDonald&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729180221&usg=AOvVaw3tecfjqhWhXrCZLPx1Tvxj) disagreed, arguing that Thayer’s own data did not support his conclusion. Colorado project psychologist [Michael Wertheimer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://dgozli.com/interview-with-michael-wertheimer/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729180610&usg=AOvVaw2j2d7DhGIktujB8w241V41) interviews many of the radar operators; nearly all disagree with the inversion explanation and maintain that all experienced radar operators have no trouble identifying such phenomena. (NICAP, “[The Washington National Sightings](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/520726wnsdir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729181005&usg=AOvVaw2LceFlpUwNtg27BJ8K7f4Z)”; Richard Hall, “[The](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/waves/washinvas.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729181347&usg=AOvVaw1XCkEdd7B_dLB-UX5u56K-) [Washington Invasion, July 26/27, 1952](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/waves/washinvas.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729181705&usg=AOvVaw2OzQgbygJ79hyQA3clhU3f)”; Clark III 1252–1255; Ruppelt, [pp. 163–167](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/reportonunidenti00rupp/page/162/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729182065&usg=AOvVaw0QTWvZrJaM8JLBIl2lTetP); Condon, [pp. 157–158](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/156/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729182481&usg=AOvVaw3rMot_C61CyXh8ZWzIDVcM)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/156/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729182821&usg=AOvVaw2if7t6pBDCVexDx_0LzyW1) [862–](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/862/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729183209&usg=AOvVaw1GMe7GFVru9MxQ_PagPLGG) [867](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/862/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729183579&usg=AOvVaw3vCHJGIzalVZGAo5p8aqum); Swords 156–159; Good Above, [pp. 270–272](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/270/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729183897&usg=AOvVaw2xu7A3bgbW0AsqNF4MxQzO); Patrick Gross, “[The Washington D.C. UFO Flap of 1952](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/usa1952.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729184125&usg=AOvVaw0SDfit0UByBMOVoAngtEDd)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729184397&usg=AOvVaw3cRocq4iX_JJdne7mt0gsv)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674889729184624&usg=AOvVaw1abeHKpeOLPbh2N-cNDWMG) p. 158; Kevin D.
